column2: a : deep , deep copper color almost like a medium colored iced tea . small off white head that quickly fades to a tiny lace . good .
appearance : dark amber in color , nice white fluffy head , ok retention , very nice lacing .
a : pours a clear golden straw . it is an extremely pale yellow , with only about 1/2 finger of pure white head . the foam settles quickly on this brew .
a : this poured a muddy dark mahogany with no head . not the most attractive sight .
a : this beer poured a copper red brew with a 1 inch head that disappeared very quickly . little to no lacing was present .
a : cloudy lemon / straw color with active carbonation up the middle . huge fluffy white head that lingers and lingers , leaving thick lacing down the glass .

a : nice golden orange hue . copper highlights . appears the color of southern sweet tea when the light hits it right . fluffy head dwindles to a thin layer rather quickly . a halo of foam hangs on for the life of the beer . head retention could be better .
a : cola colored . clean with burgundy highlights . poor carbonation , very fizzy ( like cola ) with a rapidly depleting head .
a : pitch-black beer . light brown head that pours about a half finger , but stays about a half a finger nail the whole way down . with a good amount of lacing .
a : surprisingly attractive , light golden , with a billowy long lasting head
a : pours a very pale yellow with a large cap of foam after gushing out of the big mouth bottle into a pint glass . surprisingly good head retention , light spotty lacing .
appearance : cant really see into the can but from what i do remember pouring into a glass , its very , very , and i mean very light , pale yellow .

appearance : pretty bad , even for a happoshu . head is akin to that on a diet sprite : white and so fizzy you hardly have time to notice it before it disappears . body is a weirdly glowing orangey yellow .

appearance : pours hazy light bronze colour , somehow the barman failed to pour this beer properly and the beerhead was overly limited , unlike what one would expect of a good belgian ale ... besides , the serving temp . was a bit too low .

a : pours a half finger head of nice white colour , milky lactic cream , and restrained thickness . colour is a transparent gold . sm : cream , full expressive barley , slight bittering hops , and pleasant golden grain . a very nice aroma . moderate in strength .

a : upon untwisting the cage , i fell into a delirious spell as the cork wooshed by my nose at breakneck yet slow-motion speeds a la the matrix . i 'm lucky to still have my sight . after the gushing subsides , this pours a mostly opaque , muddy copper . 4-finger ( yup ) head dies down to 1 , leaving lacing on the glass . as this almost killed me , i must dock it 1 whole extra point .
a : pale , yellow , fizzy , highly carbonated . virtually no head and even csi would not be able to find any trace of lacing . so far , so bad .
a : nice looking beer . it is dark , but not jet , black topped with a beautiful tan head . very picturesque .

appearance : white head that dissipates almost immediately . a lot of tiny bubbles rushing to the top of the pint glass . the color of the beer is a very light gold color that is transparent . i got some decent lacing on the glass .
a : clear golden pour . initially a fluffy white head that dissipates quickly and leaves no lacing .

appearance : poured into one of the glasses from the gift pack a wonderful reddish amber . a foamy half inch head forms and eventually fades to a tight ring around the glass . lacing is patchy and sparse .
a : when poured , this beer produces a gorgeous ruby red body and a fluffy pink head . beautiful .

appearance : pours out thick black and produces a three finger , thick mocha colored head with great retention . head cascades up from the netherworld . jet black body with no carbonation evident . head slowly fades to a good film and clings to the sides of the glass . a swirling wisp and a ring remain until the end leaving lots some dots of lacing down the glass . a beauty of a stout and much like the base beer , though the lacing is not quite as perfect .
a : big tan head on this beer , 3-fingers worth . its frothily and fluffy like a cloud . it sits on top of a somewhat cloudy beautiful orange beer , visible carbonation though the haze .
appearance : dark brown

appearance : this was a hazey , amber-orange beer with lots of chunks of yeast floating throughout . the cream colored head rose up big ( up and out that is ; i should pay better attention ) . it was fluffy and dense , settling down very slowly and leaving a lot of lace . the beer looked good , but it was all downhill from there .

appearance : the beer looked really good . amber color , on the darker side . head was a little off white and carbonation was definitely present . head dissipated pretty quickly , but left behind a faint lace .
a : pours a clear gold yellow color with a big aired white head . medium retention and many beautiful lacings
appearance : pours a cloudy straw color with a modest head that fails to stick and does n't provide much lacing
a : pours an extra clear dark amber color ( almost orange ) with a thin white head that dissipates quickly leaving only a film on top .
a : dark burnt orange/copper-hued beer ; bright clarity , with a nice dense cream cap with good retention . medium-high carbonation and some decent retention .
appearance : looked like an your average beer , with a very small head
a : copper-orange , fluffy head , not much retention , some lace .
a : pours a pretty clear , straw yellow body with a small , white head with no retention and lacing of great significance .
appearance : golden body , small white head , no real lacing .
appearance : the brew poured with very weak white head with barely any retention at all . color was golden/slightly amber .
a : pours a ( not surprisingly ) opaque black color with a nice tan head that quickly fades to a thin ring around the perimeter of the glass . leaving no lacing behind .
a : pours a dark black body with a touch of dark drown along the edges . head is fluffy dark mocha at three fingers . retention is decent and without lacing .

a : hazy , pretty orange/copper body with a fairly persistent two finger yellowed white head . unappealing were the 20 or so small , light colored sheet-like flecks that settled to the bottom of the glass .
a : pours a head as high as the beer . fluffy . takes its time falling . the stout is a jet black .
appearance : piss yellow in color , slight carbonation , heavy although quickly dissipating head
a : like another ba stated , this looks like urine first thing in the morning . zero head and minimal carbonation . not a good start .
appearance : nearly black-brown body with cherry hues and a brown head .
appearance : deep brown with some thin red notes in the core . head is fluffy like a cappuccino head and tan to match .
a : pours a light golden color almost zero head whatsoever ... looks like its been sitting out on the table all afternoon

a : pours a dark amber with a hint of orange , fast retreating tan head left so fast , i almost missed it . no lacing either . ar . sweet , spices , fruit , maybe a twinge of vanilla and of course alcohol are present . the sweetness reminds me of honey .
appearance : pale brown to amber with about one finger of off white head , head sticks around with lots of great lacing ,
appearance : pitch black and thick with literally no head whatsoever ... not sure why
a : small white head . traditional golden color . a little bit hazy .
a : pours a straw yellow with a fizzy white mousse that dies away within seconds . looks as boring and unappealing as it sounds .
appearance : amber in color , hazy . great white head that laces nicely and lasts throughout
appearance : head was a little on the weak side with very active carbonation . tast : smooth taste with citrus hues with kind of a dead end
a : this beer looks okay but i found a little lacking with head retention . sometimes it is easy to tell a beer that was brewed in large batches .
a : slightly hazy , light amber color with over one finger of diminishing white foam head . scant lacing remains on the glass .
a : very dark coal color with a very thin creamy tan head . small amount of lace around the edges
a : poured into a traditional pint glass . appeared a clear , orangy-copper with a heavy amount of white and big bubbled foamy head , which remained well .
a : pours a nice orange hue that is gently hazy with two fingers of ample , pure white head that lingers beautifully and leaves a nice amount of lacing on the glass
appearance : caramel in color , fantastic head , great retention .
a : pours dark and heavy with a thick head .
a : extremely pale , golden yellow color with a one and half finger head of frothy white foam that settles to a bubbly coating , leaving minimal soapy lace . bud light with better head retention ?
appearance : very light amber , translucent . two-finger head of foam that lingers .
a : dark , black coffee , espresso-crema colored head , good lacing on the sides of the glass .
a : pours an opaque dark brown body in the glass with two fingers of fluffy , long-lasting , light mocha head . i 'm inclined to think it 's infected , seeing how ... . robustly carbonated it is .
a : clear dark copper body and a cappuccino colored head with good lacing .
a : orange copper body , extremely clear with an obvious filtered nature to it . no head , no retention , no lacing . talk about a lackluster looking beer , this is just pretty sad .
appearance : lager appearance , not red
a : pale , filtered beer . carbonation produces a good but short lived head .
a : pours a deep hazy murky shade of brown , with a big luscious light brown head on top , thick and full , two fingers worth . picture-perfect .

a : clear pale golden/orange amber color with lots of visible bubbles quickly rising to the top . head formation is a nice fluffy 1+ finger 's worth , off white in color . good retention and tons of sticky white lacing all around - sierra nevada is good at that .
a : cloudy gold body with yeast particles floating around . two fingers of thick froathy white head . head retains for the full drink and leaves lots of lacing . could n't look any better !
appearance : pours deep straw color , with no head to speak of- just a bit of white foam and bubbles floating at the top .
a : black pour with a foamy white head . not much lacing

appearance : pours a very clear golden color with little to no head and very small bubbles . the head dissipate quickly to a ring around the glass , but tons of tiny bubbles rising rapidly to the surface .
appearance : pale moon pours a copper color with about a half-finger of slightly off-white head . retention and lacing are both poor .
a : very pale , neither head nor lacing .
a : wonderful cloudy golden color , with a big pillowy off-whitehead . head stays for awhile , lacing is excellent down the side of the glass . tasty .
a : surprisingly light in color , like a lovely amber . have yet to taste raison d'tre , so maybe that 's why i did n't know what to expect . thought it would look more like port .
a : hazy red/brown color . poured a 1 finger tan head that dissipated quickly . broken , thin and uneven lacing . almost unappealing flat look .
a : nice dark reddish color and crystal clear . nice tan head dissipated fairly quickly .
appearance : dingey tan/gold sparkly white head . not impressed .
appearance : a sickly yellow , with floaties . i waited fifteen minutes and there were still floaties . not much head , not many bubbles coming out of the beer .

appearance : thanks to the huge amount of carbonation , this one was a gusher that i was able to salvage ( for the most part ) - however , it did mean i got a huge , frothy head out of the pour . clean ( re not much sediment ) , golden-orange body . ok , it could be better though - i would like to see how this one pours without the quick , over-carbonated pour .
a : pours hazy pale golden with a rather small white head that sinks quickly into almost no lacings .
a : pours murky amber with a large white creamy head that slowly sinks into great lacings .
a : pours pale golden color with a fine fluffy head with little bubbles sugesting a lot of carbination in this one
a : dark coulored foam , almost like chocolate mousse . the fluid is like dark , almost like coffe . only half a centimeter of head .
a : lake erie monster pours a glowing golden straw color with a nice 2 finger creamy tan head . slightly hazy and some decent window drapes of lace .
a : cloudy , orange color . light , off-white head . the beer actually cleared after it warmed up a bit . surely lagunitas would n't make a beer with chill haze ? ( 2.5 )
a : thick as whole milk , black as night . imaginary carbonation .
a : clear deep ruby-orange brew with a fair amount of carbo floating lazily upward . modest 1/2 '' of tan head settles to a thick single layer that hugs the glass a bit . decent lace .

a : despite letting the beer sit , undisturbed , for days in the fridge and despite a careful pour , it winds up a very murky , dark raspberry red in my glass . there is n't much carbonation aside from a very thin collar at the edge of the glass . no lacing .
appearance : the head dissolves very quickly , leaving a urine colored body and some lacing . lots of carbonation bubbles rise to the surface .
appearance : it is very consistent to the dry stout style . the color is jet black with a creamy tan head . the head is retained through the duration of the beer with good lacing .
a : a rather unappealing pale , semi cloudy , yet clear yellow with a white head that quickly dissipates to a ring with one or two streaks of lacing .
appearance : jet black , brown head with good retention , the way a proper porter should look

a : poured a murky reddish-brown hue with a very modest caramel head . the color of the liquid reminded me of a glass of water from the muddy missouri river during spring run-off season . the closer the glass is held to backlighting a ruddy red emerges as the dominate hue . the head receded quickly leaving a thin cover over the liquid and a ring around the collar .
a : hazy , dark brown , very dark . the pour only produced about a half finger of kahki head that quickly receeded and left no lace .
a : dark brown with an beige head . not much lacing on the glass , and none on the head which subsides very quickly . very clear .
appearance : a slightly cloudy dark amber , with a thick rich head .
a : pale golden color , thick head , good cap , good lacing .
appearance : beer pours a medium-straw color , very plain , light carbonation . head is virtually non-existent , even with a fairly heavy pour .
a : pours a brilliantly clear ruby red with a frothy , slightly pink head that retains well and leaves good lace .

appearance : perfectly clear golden-amber in color . a slow and gentle pour left me with four fingers of frothy head that 's barely contained by the glass . the body reveals a massive torrent of tiny bubbles feeding the head . as the head recedes ( which takes a long time ) it leaves chunky sheets of lace all over the glass . a beautiful beer for sure .
a : pours clear golden , thin white head , heavy lacing , decent retention
a : apple juice-like with little head .

a : wow , i 've never seen a beer with a head like this one . it was easily 4+ fingers tall . it filled 1/2 of my pint glass with a meringue like bright white head . i did not use an aggressive pour because i was trying not to get any trub in my glass . the label says not to be too delicate with the pour so as to `` create a luxurious head . '' i definitely saw that . the meringue like head stayed around for the whole 750 ml bottle . it was easy to refresh the head with each pour . ( 3 times in total . ) the beer color was a cloudy bright yellow . kind of like if you mixed a bmc & a witbier .
a : the beer pours a nice amber color , a little dark amber , no real head to speak of and no lacing ...
appearance : pours an opaque brown with ruby highlights . the head is about 1/2 '' , off-white and shows very little retention . barely any lace is left on the glass .
a : pours an orange color , very littel head , no lacing . looks a little flat to me .

a : pours a murky orange hue , with a thing white head , that dissipates very quick into a nonexistent presence . floating pieces of marshmallow show it 's present in the visual . medium levels of carbonation .
a : pours a fizzy straw color . a very thin foam that does n't last past the pour . beer is brilliantly clear . with a little lasting foam , this would be a stunner .
appearance : transparent golden to yellow color . one finger head vanished quickly and left very little lacing down the mug .
appearance : one for the ages . gorgeous honeyed deep , deep amber with a dense off-white head . great retention .
appearance : pours a hazy ruddy color ( the liquid looks like white zinfandel ) with a lovely head that retains incredibly well and thoroughly laces the glass

a : it poured a dark black that when back lit had a slight ruby hue around the edges . there was a wonderfully dark caramel head that receded quickly leaving a slight collar around the rim of the brew .

appearance : gorgeous pour and nice creamy head . super-dark all the way through , disguising the sediment that must be swimming around in this . flavor : assault of oak . a lot of zin on the back end , along with all the attendant dark fruit flavors you 'd expect in that profile . sourness and acidity are too timid and get lost in an almost goodyear-strength rubber taste . complexity is apparent , but really difficult to unravel . suggests a need for further aging .

a : very clear goldenrod body with a fleeting , off white , sudsy , two finger head . unappealing small 'clumps ' formed in the head , persisting for quite a while , leaving me to believe they were particulate in nature when they were apparently not .

appearance : pours a very deep , golden color . the best way i could describe it is cut , wet hay . plenty of bubbly carbonation working it 's way to the top of the brew . not too much of a head to speak of . i did n't really pour it that aggressively though since i was drinking it from a tulip glass and doubted that a large head would fit without exploding over and flooding my kitchen in sticky suds ... what i did get was about a fingers worth of white , fluffy suds that floated on top like a boat in calm waters . did n't stick around for all that long . gone and lonely in about a minute flat .
appearance : pours a murkey orange/apricot color with a full fluffy white head .
appearance : not as cloudy as it should be . medium sized head that dissipates fast .
a : black as night poured out a huge head with tiny bubbles this thing looks great ! the head was even brown ! great look !
appearance : golden , always beautiful , f ... ing gold

appearance : thin straw colored with a fizzy small head , one guy put it well by saying it looked like ginger ale , though i think it 's lighter smell/taste : imagine you drink a budweiser then you fill the glass with water , that 's exactly what bud select is
appearance : pours a cloudy , deep burgundy . it 's topped by a fluffy , two-finger , pink head that sticks around as a quarter-inch layer .
a : mobile 1 with an effervescent head .
a : pale yellow , crystalline , i could see my face reflected in my pils glass , small foamy head and lots of bubbles ;
appearance : a clear , reddish ale with just a little tint of purple , the head really stood out , it was bright and white like puffed rice .
appearance : pale orange , slight haze ; thick layer of yellowy , spongey foam with good head retention
a : clear and yellow , like most macros . heavy carbonation , thin/dissolving head . 1/5
a : moderate pour yields a .5 finger fine white head with decent retention . beer is a cloudy , unfiltered orangy-yellow . lacing is spotty at best with little cling .
appearance : very cloudy light orange yellow color with a lot of yeast chunks floating around . a very small white head rests on top .

appearance : pours a beautiful red/orange color with a creamy off-white head . in fact the color of this beer is one of its better traits . these are very traditional colors for a west coast imperial ipa , and also very similar in color to the mikkeller ipa ( which is also from denmark ) . it has a solid three fingers of head as well . every time i pour more into the glass i get another two or three fingers of head . there 's also a really impressive amount of lacing . very nice !
a : a nice ivory puff of head over a clear golden color . wonderfully frothy retention and good puffs of lace . all fitting for the style .
appearance : this strong lager starts with a big head with sadly little or no head retention . the color is kind of a limpid , not at all interesting , yellow . very little carbonation .

appearance : the beer looked so nice in an avery pint glass on their website , that i too had to put it in a standard american pint glass . i did n't have an avery pint glass , so i had to use a bell 's brewery pint glass . same thing , different label . the beer looks much nicer in real life than on a website page . the beer was a dark mahogany brown with plenty of cranberry red highlights all through out the beer . if that was n't enough , it had a long lasting beige head of foam that left tons of beige colored sticky lace around the glass . the beer looked just as nice as the label on the bottle did .
appearance : there was literally no head whatsoever , and very little carbonation . it looked like a glass of apple juice .
appearance : pours a slight white fizzy head that quickly retreats to not even a slick cap no lacing what so ever , pissy yellow with alot of bubbles breaking the surface .
a : clear amber body with an amazingly long lasting off-white head .
appearance : pours a quarter-inch foam head that vanishes very quickly . you can hear and see carbonation , but that too seems to be gone once the pour is done . very amber , murky look .
a : clear light amber with two-finger , white , foamy head that lasted more than a few minutes . phenomenal lacing .
a : pours a lightly hazy golden pale color with a huge 3 finger fluffy white pillow of foam . amazing lace , how sweet the sound !
a : the brown ale is a full reddish brown color , dark enough to be opaque . on closer inspection , ruby red highlights emerge . a thin band of head hangs around the edges of the glass .
a : the appearance of this beer is just awesome . it is a deep ruby red color topped with a frothy light tan head . visible carbonation keeps the head bubbling .
a : poured a dark brown color with no head/lacing down the glass
a : poured into a tumbler with a 2 finger creamy head . great clear golden color and lots of carbonation activity .
appearance : dark , leathery brown with a magnificent mocha head . it 's so thick and creamy , and such a pleasant color .

a : pours a golden , light amber . did n't get much head , but a bit definitely formed after the pour . probably needed to age my bottle some more . really impressed with the artwork & description on the bottle ( in all honestly : that 's most of the reason why i bought it ; the other is i wanted a new brew to try out ) .
appearance : clear with a light caramel and orange color . nothing too fancy going on here . head is retained for 5-7 minutes .

a : well . . . its less than epic . pours an incredibly , crystal clear orange hue . held to the light , you get more of an orange tinged yellow color . a pretty good amount of carbonation activity in that clear body . the pour yielded a finger or so of white head , but it quickly fell to a thin white ring . that ring tries what it can with some lace , but really to no avail . i am a bit worried .

a : pours a black with a hint of red , about 2 fingers worth of than tan head that settles to a ring.. very nice lacing from start to finish . i will say it does not pour like guinness.. not as pretty .
appearance : pale lemony yellow colour . high carbonation . reasonable head which disappears quickly . no lacing .
a : slightly cloudy , honey color . very appetizing .
appearance : pours a clear amber color with a magnificent head that sticks and curtains the pint glass

appearance : the kalamzoo is an exceptionally dark stout . while you can occasionally find a light stout that you can see light through amongst american craft brew stouts , bell 's has made an exceptionally dark stout . the head of the brew , while light in volume due to the pour from the bottle , is even dark for a stout , and of comparable brown color to other american crafts or british porters . lacing is light but visible . red hues can only be seen around the base of the glass when held up to light .

a : pours a glowing but dark amber color , browner towards the top . head is bubbly , tannish , fairly thick but quick to recede . plenty of carbonation visible on the sides of the glass , but this disappears quickly .
a : pours a light golden color with almost no head . leaves a small amount of lacing . carbonation is medium .
appearance : looks like soda , with a huge reddish-brown head that fizzes away completely leaving neither foam nor lace above the espresso brown colored liquid

a : those widgets are so annoying . you hardly get the top popped and it shoots it 's load . typical jet black guinness look with big white fine creamy head . not much in the lacing department but i do like that a small head stays throughout and gives you a creamy milk mustache . i love that classic settling that guinness does . you have to admit that it is a good looking drink .

appearance : pours a dark brown with orange highlights . the beer is transparent , with a huge , 5 '' tall , exploding out of the tulip , tan head . it shows great retention . extremely thick lace coats the sides of the glass . bubbles carve out the holes in the lace .

appearance : short lived white head on a pale , very clear , amber with wide yellow edges . head dies quickly leaving only feeble carbonation streams to show any sign of life . flavor : some sweet malt and firm grape/grape jam flavors . overall very mild and clean , a good crowd pleaser but doesnt do much for me .
a : poured a straw color but was not very hazy at all . very clear for hefe with little to no debris . not what you expect when you pick up a hefe .

appearance : pours with 4 full fingers of very dark brown head . difficult to tell where the head stops and the beer begins . this settles slowly , eventually falling to a still substantial 1 finger coating of foam . nice lacing . the beer itself is black and thick , not even a hint of light around the edges . fair amount of sediment in the bottle .
a : pours a thin , half-finger head . obviously , this is a result of its cask serving , so it 's forgivable . hazy yellow colour . sm : strong scent of lemon . souring hops aplenty .
a : pours an unattractive dijon mustard yellow/brown with 4 fingers of white head that recedes into a thin cap with a little lacing .
a : pitch black with a light brown head . lots of yeast in the bottle that forms an oily coating on the sides of the glass .
appearance : pours a bright , see-through golden body wit a thin , off-white head .
a : cloudy apricot . short white head , frothy . not much retention but a bit of lacing .
a : veyr pale straw color with thin white head that does leave a little lace
appearance : not really an amber color ; more of just orangey-yellow .
a : green . mildly impressed that they got it to look so much like ecto cooler . all they need is to have slimer on the bottle .
a : cloudy honey color with a minimal thin white head .
appearance : it pours from the can like chocolate milk , in about 30 seconds an inch and a half creamy head forms . the nitro can makes this a damn beautiful beer .
a : pours a murky brown with two fingers of tan head that recedes into a foamy ring with little lacing .
a : pours an amber/red with 1 finger of foamy head that leaves some good lacing . n : sweet breadiness and lemon .
appearance : poured from the 12 oz bottle into a pint glass . the beer is a crystal clear brownish orange color with a decent sized foamy head that is off-white . very plain looking beer .
appearance : a slight haze stricken dark amber , near brown , beer . pours a decent white foam head that settles to a mere whisp of what it was .
a : pours dark translucent brown . no head . no lacing . at first could n't spot any bubbles at all but managed to see a few breaking the surface every few seconds .

a : this beer poured rather syrupy out of the bottle . there was some yeast/cherry juice or something in the bottom of the bottle . it looked like mud . i made sure to swirl this around and get it into my glass . the beer did not pour with any head or lacing what so ever . it has a nice black color with lots of dark red tones .

a : it 's a beautiful orange hue that is crystal clear with loads of carbonation rushing up from the bottom of the glass . the lacing is good and the head has tightly packed bubbles of froth and about a half inch thick .
appearance : pours a clear golden color with a massive head that sticks well and leaves shards of lace
a : deep amber brown with a foamy coffee head and sticky lacing
appearance : pale golden color , with great head retention and good lacing .
a : perfect . very dark ruby/mahogany color , relatively clear with persistent carbonation . a very bready , yellowish tan head that is very thick and never really goes anywhere and clumps to glass .

a : pours a surprisingly clear amber body with a couple of inches of head in my jar . retains poorly , but it deposits substantial , sticky head on the sides as it goes . the remainder is a swirl of bubbles on the brew with a moderate collar , which leaves more sticky lace as the brew vanishes .

a : dark brown with an orange/red hue . one finger of head that dissipates in a few minutes . still , after 15 minutes a slight head remains . in fact , this head remains through the very last sip . impressive ! sufficient streaking down the glass .
a : opaque black , decent tan head , good lacing .

appearance : pours pitch black , with one finger of some of the darkest brown head i 've ever seen . the head dissipated surprisingly slowly , and left blankets of lacing . about as good as an imperial stout can look .
a : super opaque brown with only scattered head . looks like poop water .
a : dark , like a winter sea on a new moon eve . porcelain colored head that is truly whipped cream in consistency .
appearance : a pale , dull golden color with a thin quickly disappearing head and very little lace .
a : cloudy orange/yellow and amber . lots of lacing with hardly any head with the pour . looks great .

a : pours a slightly hazy orange/amber color with a small fizzy head that rises and falls very quickly to leave behind a fizzy island and a thin ring . no lacing left behind on the edges of the glass .
a : looks pretty impressive . rich , deep brown color , with mahogany highlights . a quarter of slightly tan , white head appears , recedes to a thick rim and leaves some streaky lace .
a : murky light brown with a tangerine tint , some bubbles apparent , but virtually no head .

a : a dark amber , about the color of grade `` a '' maple syrup . a creamy white quarter inch head forms but quickly degrades into a spattering of larger bubbles that tend to stick to the side of the glass .

a : deep dark brown/black body , pours very oily thick and sludgy like motor oil . absolutely no had on this , other than some thick spit bubbles around the edges . no retention or lace , naturally . it 's not that high in alcohol to expect no head , so i 'm hoping this is n't under carbonated .

a : pours a burnt sienna color with a stark white head , not quite an inch or so that recedes to a thin cap of bubbles and a few chunks of lacing . fairly cloudy . a few spots of lacing as the head recedes . not a bad looking beer .

a : gusher . this thing basically converts to foam the moment it leaves the bottle , creating a billowing , 4 '' foam presence in my glass with just the barest hint of liquid beneath it . ridiculous .
a : pours a pallid yellow into a glass , with really no head to speak of , dissipates quickly leaving only a small , thin ring of clear foam around the glass .
a : pours a dark red brown with a full white head , very good head retention and lace .

appearance : wowzer , very sexy looking blonde head ( err ... dirty blonde ) , very thick and creamy like . nose mild sweet smells , roasted coffee and chocolate ( i like it so far , i sure hope it tastes like it smells ) . palate : ok , this is where i got lost completely , it tastes like water , very thin watered down coffee , it 's like ordering up a `` iced venti single latte with only 1/2 caff and 1/2 decaf with 4oz 's of milk and alot of water '' .
a : deep clear brown - almost pecan in color . no head to speak of .

appearance : hazy peach gold glass topped by a fluffy 4 finger head at the pour . head settles down after a bit and leaves clumps of lace . the color has a really nice translucent candle lit glow . pretty . flavor : citric flavors jump right out . where the nose was lime rind , the taste is fresh lime flesh ( i know it is lemon and orange peel , but it tastes lime ) . the other spices blend nicely . the alcohol peeks out and is just a touch hot , but not bad .
a : a dark amber color with a massive and insanely dense head that leaves a ton of lacing behind . beautiful .
a : beautiful , foamy head . lacing that lasts longer than the serving . deep hazy gold to rust spectrum . a marvel .
a : pours a very copper/brown color , hazy , with a thick bubbly off-white head on top . it left nice lacing on my glass as i worked through the bottle . well done .
appearance : pours a black color with a 3 '' fluffy head that lasts a while . nice lacing paints the glass .
a : a decently colored dark , brownish amber . nothing too special but nothing really boring either .
a : guinness always looks great ! the head is very thick and creamy and never fades . i have never had a glass so coated with foam when i am done drinking .
a : pours an oily thick black with a nice 1 finger head . very viscous looking stout . brown head leaves lacing all over the glass . the legs on this one are thick !
a : medium copper with a reddish hue under a pathetic off-white head that looked as substantial as the head from pouring pepsi . no lacing .
a : bright copper body topped with a loose tan two finger head of moderate retention that leaves moderate lacing and a thin bubbly cover .

a : the head on this beer is extremely dense . two toned with dark and light mocha . this beer has been sitting out for 30min in glass and still has a head . i am impressed . some sticky spotty lacing . dark brown , almost black but not quit there .
a : very dark amber but i did n't get much of a head out of this one . lacing is also pretty thin .

appearance : pours a one finger medium looking beige mocha colored head that makes a lot of crackling noises . fades relatively fast to a small ring only . black with little carbonation , though some bubbles decorate the top . a ring remains but leaves no lacing down the sides . somewhat underwhelming .
a : poured a dark transparent amber color . very little head , no lacing observed and a moderate amount of carbonation .
a : pours clear golden with a large creamy white head that takes some time to sink . leaves decent lacings .
appearance : murky , pale , pale gold . no head and an ever so slight amount of carbonation .

a : pours with a real nasty head , creats large bubbles that look almost soapy . but quickly dissipate into a nice enough head . nothing special though . decent lacing and the color is pitch balck . gottafix that soapy head look , not very appetizing ...
appearance : murky , dark amber with shallow , off-white head
a : reddish amber color . huge 3 finger pillowy tan head . 4.5
appearance : a beautiful copper/amber . i love the bleach white lace that surrounds this beer . looks fantastic
a : black body with a perfect inch of creamy brown foam ; awesome , especially for 10 % .
appearance : pours a slightly hazy bronzed straw color in to a pilsner glass . there is only splotches of foam on the surface of the beer and no lacing .
a : great deep amber with active head that dies back down to a luscious and lasting creamy foam with great lacing . very appetizing looking esb .

appearance : because of the widget and the nitro can , there 's obviously a ton of creaminess and thickness to the brew , with a head that stays at about 1 '' and the lacing that 's just as thick that stays down the whole glass the beer 's consumed . the body seems opaque but it 's more of a very very dark amber color when you shine some light on it .
appearance : cloudy brown with a short 1/2 '' head . no lacing develops during the session .
appearance : dark , roasted chestnut brown body with a small , tan beige head with mediocre retention .
a : huge white frothy head over translucent golden . the head takes its time to mellow out , and retention is frothy .
a : a murky brown liquid with serious thickness and reddish highlights . the thin head dissipates quickly leaving a few small trails of tiny bubbles rising through the beer .
appearance : giddily chromatic , which leaves this soft ringed froth for you to muscle out . not to die for , but looks never were for the ones with integrity ; i like those kinds of people .
appearance : poured a deep amber color with a decent , but slightly thin head . should have been a little darker .
a : love the semitransparent amber color and the lacing ; hard not to score this a 5.0 on appearance
a : pours a dark amber-orange . small ring of foam remained throughout drinking .

appearance : a monster three finger head that has really good retention . the color of the head is a light tan color that is foamy creamy , and bubbly . the color of the beer is a deep reddish cherry hue with garnet highlights . the clarity of the beer is near opaque , except there is some visibility . the head left a lot of lacing on the glass .
appearance : the highlight of the beer is the beautiful way it fills the pint glass . soft , creamy head that leaves a bit of lacing behind

appearance : deep chestnut brown pour , off white head . beer foam is quite persistent , leaving spotty sticky lacing down the sides of my tulip glass . this ale is clear when held to the light , and exhibit a extremely dark cherry brown color .
a : nice hazy red/yellow/rust body with fluffy bubbly white head
appearance : pours with a thin head that dissipates rather quickly , & a clear , shallow red color .
a : pours a super dark muddy brown color ; one finger-width head , light lacing . overall an unappealing color
a : dark brown almost black , small tan head dissipates quickly and settles into the smallest of rings . no real lacing , no retention , and very small legs . not off to a good start .
a : pours a slightly hazy gold-orange with two fingers of white head that recedes into a thin ring with a little lacing .
a : light amber color unusual for typically straw colored ale . beer appears flat . no head , rare bottom origin bubbles .

a : first of all let me remark on the color of this beer . it 's a really red mahogany color . it has gorgeous red accents and excellent clarity . 2+ fingers of tan fluffy white head . excellent lacing already present . i feel like i 've been giving a lot of 4.5/5.0s lately for appearance but if you have a gorgeous color , tan fluffy head that sticks around and great lacing ... what more could you ask for ?
appearance : black with a really nice off white/tan head , great lacing , ca n't wait to taste .
a : pours a tangerine copper with some clarity but mostly glowing . nice head on the pour with lots of retention and lacing .
a : looks promising -- hazy apricot with ample foam . but no , it 's all downhill from the looking stage ...

a : a large , 4 finger head erupts on the pour . pristinely white , fluffy and frothy . the body is a light shade of golden yellow . thousands of bubbles can be seen rushing at a fast and constant pace through the clear body . very good lacing in the form of chunky sea foam . an absolute stunner in the glass .
appearance : pours a clear orange color with a 4 '' tall cream colored head . great retention on these foamy bubbles . tons of sticky lace .

appearance : pours very dark and still with surprisingly little anything going on , on top of the beer . there are a few bubbles rising , but they do n't stick at all . this beer seriously looks like a day-old coke with no ice . unfortunately there was a decent pop when i popped the cap , so i guess it is supposed to look like this . quite disappointing as i do n't want any style beer to look this still in the glass . i guess i will give it a bit of credit as it does n't look like mud in my glass .
a : pours a dark brown with three fingers of tan head that vanishes completely with no lacing .
appearance : golden with a huge head .
appearance : pours a cloudy golden yellow with a slightly orange haze . the white head rises about 1/4 '' and fades rather quickly . no lace remains on the glass .

a : pours with a bright white bubbly head that struggles to get up to 1 finger . medium retention leaves a thin , sudsy film . the body is pale golden straw , clear and very light in color . super thin sheets of lace with tattered ends . nothing particularly great about the appearance but , given the style , nothing exciting was expected . s &
a : thick black color . did n't get much foam , which was surprising
a : light brown with a touch of burnt orange . no carbonation and translucent . i do not like the looks of this .
appearance : a deep dark black color . there is a quarter inch finger head that is dark tan . the head has no retention to it . there is no clarity to the beer .
appearance : clear and golden with big bubbles and an off-white head with poor retention . it almost looks like a pilsener .
appearance : a nicely hazy golden-straw body capped by about three fingers of white head that fade slowly and leave great lacing .

a : this one gets a five for presentation as much as anything . poured into the distinctive kwak glass ( google it ) and placed in its wooden holder , it 's an impressive sight . the colour is a translucent reddish brown reminiscent of an amber ale . some lacing on the side .

a : pours a relatively thick , inky black . a gentle pour produced a light tan lace ring around the edge , so i can imagine a vigorous pour might actually produce a full-covering head , which would be surprising for a brew of this abv . it sits in the glass looking dark and menacing , with absolutely no light penetration . i usually judge beers this dark by tilting the glass and looking up through the diagonal edge to see how much light can get through : not even the most tilted , shallow depths would allow the hint of any light . impressive .
appearance : as you can see by the photograph , a light yellow . the head is not impressive , and leaves no lacing .
appearance : pink brown body , opaque , no head at all . actually pretty ugly .

appearance : southern tier said that the proper glassware for this beer is a fluted glass . so i poured this beer into a unibroue fluted glass . this cherry saison poured an almost clear light tangerine orange color . it was very light in color . the head of foam on this beer was lackluster . at the height , the head of foam was less than 1/2 an inch in height and white in color . i did n't get a real good look at it because it quickly fizzled away into a few white rings and one single spot of white lace . as you can tell , i was n't impressed at all by the appearance .

appearance : served out of one of those aluma-bottles . straw colored , transparent body . white soapy head . pours out pretty nice then recedes to a filmy thin layer . not bad retention either and minimal stickiness of the head -- not enough to leave anything clung to the glass at the end of the drink .

a : vigorous pour gave me lots of haze on the yellow-orange body and a marshmallow fluff head . speckles of lacing and never ending carbonation . a thing of beauty- wish i poured into into duvel glass for full enjoyment .
a : a mahogany color with very little head and no lacing to speak of .
appearance : deep rep-copper color with a slight haze and a wisp of off-white head that disappears quickly , leaving minimal lacing .
appearance : 12oz bottle poured into standard pint glass . dark cloudy brown colour , thick fluffy head .
appearance : nice strong gold/brass coloring with an impressive head that lasts for a while . minimal beligian lacing after the head dissapates .
appearance : very light , clear . looks like a pinot grigio , but with carbonation and a delicate , white head .

a : pours a half finger head of slight cream , bad thickness , and okay retention . colour is a clear yellow-blonde . sm : lemon esters , fresh barley , and excellent orange peel . a moderate strength aroma .
appearance : light copper color and its over carbonated . it almost spewed out of the bottle and upon the pour with an inch of beer in bottom the head was almost flowing out of the pint .

a : the ale has the sickly red look of many kriek beers , sitting in my glass like a snifter of snapple strawberry kiwi . the bottle opened without much of a pop and did n't generate much head on pour . no lacing whatsoever .

appearance : the brew poured a clear and transparent - but very dark - amber with hints of brown in there . a vigorous pour produced a rocky ivory-colored head of about 3 fingers . some visible carbonation floats , and as the beer is consumed , strings and rings of lacing drag the glass . very nice looking beer , i 'm really enjoying the color of it .
a : very dark , light carbonated with not much of a head but a small foamy creamy tan head .
appearance : nice amber but the snow-globe of floaties that this brewery is known for . not much of a head and minimal lacing .
a : slightly hazy , medium golden color with abundant white foam head that quickly deflates to sparse patches . almost no lacing remains on the glass .
a : brilliant gold with a small and fizzy white head that does n't stick around . leaves occasional spots of lace .
a : pours a rich honey gold color with a huge head the head is off white
appearance : pours a pitch black color with a weird soapy head with only large bubbles . it is only 1/4 '' high , off-white in color with no retention or lace .
appearance : light golden color with a single finger white foamy head which falls very quickly to a bubbly ring and no lace . looks kind of dead when you get to about a half glass .
appearance : orangey and cloudy . no head . opaque
a : wow , this is one of the best looking beers i have seen . color is mahogany . pours an excellent creamy head that lasts the whole beer .
appearance : this beer pours a hazy straw in color with a snow white 1 finger head . minimal lace after the head has faded .

appearance : 11.2 oz . brown bottle pours an alluring peach color . a solid two fingers of head appears that is extremely sticky , though it loses some volume and reduces moderately during consumption . label looks like something i doodled on my notebook in fifth grade , which adds a playful bit of anticipation to the whole endeavor .
a : dark brown with a slight red hue , about 2inches of head that disappears and leaves minute lacing
a : is this a joke ? no head , slight lace at the top , otherwise , i 'm putting ice cubes in this for the iced tea experience .
appearance : bright , hazy blond with a frothy cap of foam . incredible head retention ; it lasted for the entire hour i was sipping on this beer .
a : hazy gold with active initial carbonation and a lot of floating yeast . the small off-white head came and went quickly . left no lace .
appearance : pours a brown color , transparent , with orange edges and 2.5 '' light tan head . it shows good retention , with it 's pancake-like bubbles . very little lace .

a : the pour is rather thick , almost black with a fantastic head - very big , pale brown color , thick and very creamy ( almost reminiscent of a nitro-induced head ) . very good head retention . the beer looks really great . might be the best looking imperial stout i 've ever had .

appearance : pours out a very light and transparent brown . yields a one finger , medium-thin looking . light tan head with half decent retention , fading down to a full wisp and ring . black body with little carbonation evident . a splotchy wisp and ring remain leaving some dots of lacing down the glass . too light and thin for the style , and the head was underwhelming as well .
a : nice brown color with noticeable carbonation . nice , frothy , lasting head . beautiful looking beer .
a : i 've had some hotdog gushers before , but this beer was totally flat . a very dark color .

appearance : pours a half finger off-white medium looking head with decent retention . tawny or burnt orange in color , perfectly clear with medium carbonation evident . very slim ring remains to the end and only leaves touches of lacing down glass . becomes slightly flat looking by the end of the pint .

appearance : pours a pale urine color with a half inch white head . foamy surface lingers for a bit and then settles to the miniscus . plenty of carbonation activity surfaces from the bottom of the glass .

a : held to light it 's a dark cola-brown , though it looks black enough otherwise . slight reddish tint , a swarm of carbonation ... but a also a fine cloud of suspended yeasty bits ( this is n't more than 4-5 months old ) . fairly strong head , a sandy-tan 1/2 finger at first , falls to a clinging ring and a couple small blots of film . almost no lace .

a : pours a clear straw-gold in the glass , with a light film that is surprisingly thin for a belgian tripel . i 'm attributing this to the barrel-aging , and i 'll give it a pass for now . no lacing .

a : crooked tree pours a murky dull colored pale that really darkens towards the center of the glass . cloudy with sediment . chunks alert ! a nice 2+ finger of khaki foam frothed about and seemed to have glimpses of light peach hues to it with some sporatic lace to my glass .
a : poured a oil black colored with a tan head about 1/4 of an inch thick .
a : the beer pours a nice bright golden color with a large 2 finger white head , and superb lacing ...
a : amber classic tea color , not a representative head not retention and fast dissipation .
a : extremely cloudy with tones of floaties . a yellow/orange color . a small white head forms and leaves light lace .
appearance : 5 |

appearance : pours thick black and very opaque . minimal head collects around the edges of the glass and a slight wisp forms on top . no carbonation evident . the wisp remains the whole way down , but essentially no lacing . pretty average for the style .
a : light golden straw macro brew staple with tons of carbonation that dies out instantly and almost no lacing .
a : pours pasty red , syrupy , cloudy , and with chunks . this is not bottle conditioned as far as i know . not a great start .
a : hazy amber , with a tan head with bright yellow tones . never seen anything like it .
a : a nice porter black , however the head was very disappointing , only about 2-3 mm of head , with a decently rough pour . non-existant lacing was surprising .
a : hazy copper/amber . lasting off-white head and lacing .
appearance : has a pretty , slightly hazy , amber-orange color . medium head with good lacing .
appearance : it pours a very clear , light yellow color . head was foamy white and about a finger deep . head disappeared nearly as rapidly as it formed and left virtually no lacing .
appearance : nice gold look , white head , looks really good
appearance : golden amber , slightly cloudy , very lively . half finger head dissipates quickly and leaves a thin off white film that last till the end ; little lacing .
a : straw - yellow , cloudy . no head , pours flat .
appearance : cloudy , deep gold with red highlights , a bit light for the style , thick head that dissapates quickly but leaves very nice lacing
a : pours a perfectly cloudy lemony-yellow with a full , two-finger off-white head . definition of an unfiltered hefeweizen .
a : copper/red and clear . super head retention and lacing .

a : pours a nice clear golden straw with solid orange tones . wonderful 1 finger white head that had amazing retention . stayed with me all the way down to the last drop , leaving an amazing ring lace . check out my twitter for the picture , it makes me very happy .
a : the pour is a dark brown , almost black , color with a very fluffy tan colored head and some nice sheets of lacing .
a : pours pale golden , almost straw-colored ( a funny thing is that halmstad in swedish means `` town of straw '' ) . the soapy white head is small and sinks quickly into only little lacings .
a : pours a light amber , thin white head quickly disolves leaving only a thin ring around the top of the glass . tightly packed bubbles .
a : fluffy off-white head supported by a dark orange ( amber ) malt base with good lacing .

appearance : the bastard does look dirty ! an intense raisin-puree color with no light , topped by a two-finger caramel-colored head that lasts throughout . very dark and earthy looking , with magnificent lacing to boot .
appearance : holy head , batman . put on your `` kid gloves '' when you pour this . extremely foggy light copper . excellent head retention .
a : pours copper with a small head and clingy carbonation . no lace .
a : very hazy rich brown color . very fluffy head with a brownish tint . great retention and some very fluffy lacing .
appearance : pours a semi-clear , bright gold . small white head fades rather quickly but a thin lace lingers .
appearance : perfectly dark with a wonderful head from the nitro that left great lacing all down the glass .

appearance : poured quickly into the glass followed by ample head that is quickly disappearing . carbonation is present and bubbles are still sticking to the sides of the glass . the beer is orangish red . this is a filtered beer with no existing sediment .

appearance : pale golden yellow with creamy white body as it settled , highly carbonated . once at rest the bleached white head which had a finger thick tight creamy head with good retention throughout .

appearance : this beer was a mix of dark amber and deep crimson . a very intriguing color to say the least . to top it all off , the head was lightly pink and rose up to about a finger before it quickly settled back down into the beer . there were some nice sheets of lace left on the side of the glass .

appearance : pours a pale straw-gold color ; very clear . frothy white head soon becomes a thin film , and leaves minimal lacing . i had to do a double-take at the bottle -- this does n't look like a witbier whatsoever , but more like a generic pilsner .
a : pours a deep orangish yellow with a slight haze to it . provides a thick off white foam head with excellent retention . there is ample amounts of lacing as well .

a : poured into my sa perfect pint , this might be the most impressive pouring ipa i have ever encountered . atop the murky golden yellow brew sits a large pillow like head leaving the stickiest lace i 've seen in a long while .
a : clear reddish/brown color . poured a 2 finger off-white creamy head with decent retention . heavy , coating lacing all the way to the bottom .

appearance : amber , a bit chunky ( really loose sediment that was lifted into solution by the carbonation after i popped the cap ) , thick spongey layer of white foam with great head retention , some lace

appearance : light but fairly rich golden hue with a ton of effervescence . poured three to four fingers of creamy white foam , which has surprisingly good retention . one of the best looking adjunct lagers i 've seen .
a : pours a 1.5 finger head of slight cream , fair thickness , and bad retention . nontransparent cloudy copper colour . sm : cream , bittering hops , and full barley . a mild strength aroma .
appearance : this beer poured a nice 1.5 ' thick creamy looking head atop a dark mahogany beer . the head did not last long though and quickly dissipated to a thin bubbly top .
appearance : okay , this does not look like a true beer . the huge foamy head is fun though , and so is the blueberry color ! lambics look similar . the
a : pours a half finger head devoid of cream , quite thin and boring , and of abysmal retention . clear yellow colour . sm : cream and barley . a light scent . boring .
a : pours a murky reddish purple with a white head
a : dark but not black - can see through it up to the light - pour was unimpressive - really no head to speak of from a bottle - no lace - nothing - looks like coke in a glass
a : pours a dark beet red with a mild head , no real lace .

a : pours an opaque black with ruby tint when held to the light . has a huge , generous cream-colored head that takes several minutes to recede to any drinkable level , leaving tons of sticky lacing down the glass as i wait . the drink continues to leave tons of lacing down the glass . the head never fully vanishes .

a : very interesting . the initial pour yields a creme colored swirl throughout the entire glass . it slowly becomes a clear golden amber , starting at the bottom of the glass and creeping up towards the head . the 3/4 '' head is slightly off-white , and sticks around for a long time . at the end of the glass , there 's still 1/2 '' of it . lots of dotted sticky lacing and a few fat curtains are left behind .
a : murky orange/brown , the color of rust with a very creamy , off-white head .
appearance : pours a beautiful ruby amber with a finger of off white head and some good lacing .
a : pours a clear , honey-gold body with very few beige bubbles ( quickly vanishing ) . the appearance betrays this beer 's abv .
appearance : head was creamy and white , color was clear yellow

appearance : free pour yields a one and a half inch , frothy , light tan head that dissipates slowly and rockily , leaving small , tight arches of lacing . pours black with brown highlights , and speckles the glass with spots and large islands of lacing .
a : a dark black body with ruby highlights and a couple of fingers of tan head . retention is poor and it quickly recedes to a quarter-inch film on top . no lacing .
a : pours a muddled opaque dark fuschia to red . nice colour with a very light head , no lace .
appearance : orange-gold with a mostly clear , with some opaqueness look . good amount of carbonation which helps with the continual lacing that glazes the top of the beer .
a : pours nearly straight black with some small brown hues that creep through when back lit . 2 1/2 fingers of mocha head that hangs out for quite a bit . nice clumps of lacing on the side at first .
a : black colour and great 2 cm head that lasts . 5

a : perfect , in every single way . the body is an incredible , shining burnt-orange ; ive seen stained glass less vibrant than this . adorning the top of this body is an off-white head , super-bubbly with silky cream beneath . lacing runs webs of foam over ever part of my glass . just superb .
a : almost no carbonation no head and no pop when i opened the bottle black as night
a : clear straw/yellow color , a little head which dissipated to a layer of small bubbles on top . not much lacing .
a : pours a nice , cloudy , orange colour , but after the initial head is nice , it quickly dissipates to a no head brew , no lacing at all , a bit disappointing , but not terrible .
a : bright yellow color , urinary type , without head ;
a : light golden color filtered with minimal to no head .
a : black as the night but still raised a beautiful light brown head . amazing for 18 % ! had substantial legs . retention was better than i would have assumed .
a : slightly hazy orange color . pours with a dense two inch off-white head ; holds throughout . laces all the way down . one of , if not the , best looking beer i 've ever seen .
a : this poured a clear gold with white head .
appearance : orange/raw honey amber color , with cloudy finish . big 1 inch head with sticky lacing . low/medium viscosity .

appearance : with 2 oz . reserved , pored a clear copper color with light beige head that dissipated rapidly . minimal lacing . light to minimal carbonation . pouring the remaining 2 oz . resulted in the usual yeasty couldyness with yummy chunklets of liquid bread .
a : pours amber color , small white head , slight lacing down the glass
appearance : dense brown with burgundy hues in lit areas . a dark beige head rests atop and leaves good lacing .
a : pours extremely dark - opaque . there is a gorgeous creamy dark tan head that lasts and leaves some nice lacing .
appearance : dark brown/black with amber highlights and a short , quick-fading light tan head . very little to no lacing remains .

appearance : two fingers of beautiful cloudy white head . there is some seriously wonderful carbonation in this beer . the color is a very see through yellow that just wo n't stop fizzing . this was the most beautiful beer i have ever seen .
a : opaque black body with a small brown head that quickly dissipates leaving no lacing , and only a ring of cover . much darker than typical for the style , and the head is sub-par as well .
a : pours a nice looking dark brown with amber edges . almost no head and no lacing .
a : deep brown , spotting sheet of cream over beer . no visible rays of light .
a : clear orange amber color . two fingers of thick creamy off-white head with good retention and lots of lacing . 3.5
a : pours deep black with an incredible head that leaves a massive lace around the glass . the head is tan and when it grows , it reaches about 4 fingers
a : poured a straw yellow tih a nice white cap
a : pours a dark brown with 3 fingers worth of tan creamy head . the head settles to almost a finger worth for the rest of the beer and left walls of lace all over the glass .

a : the cap pops with quite the hiss , and a very cautious pour results in two inches of aggressive , super-fine tan froth atop a black body with clear brown highlights . great retention , plenty of lace . seems a bit overcarbonated , but it looks terrific .

appearance : pours a transparent red-orange , with a big head that looks like egg whites that have been beaten until they form stiff peaks - how is it so dense ? nice lacing as you get down the glass . a beautiful beer .
a : pours a nearly opaque black-brown with a small tan head of big , thin bubbles . leaves sudsy blotches of lacing and a thin silky cap of foam remains .
a : pours clear amber , very nice two finger off white head , laces very nicely and with every sip . settled to a thin overall layer with a thick halo .
a : gloden pour with a really large airy head . that takes it 's time to dissipate . lot of lacings .
appearance : dark , with moderate amount of chocolate colored head . good amount of lacing .
appearance : hazy golden at first with egg shell white head . head was thin with little retention and no lacing .

appearance : a light tan head that has a little retention . the body of the beer is medium amber color with copper hues . the is a little effervescence with yeast floating in the beer . the clarity of the beer is slightly hazy .

appearance : this beer poured a pale , golden yellow color . the white head rose up to a good three fingers and , surprisingly , lingered for a long time . probably all-malt , eh ? after it finally setted , a few thick patches of foam remained , which were being fed by some heavy streams of bubbles from the bottom of the glass . the head was sticky and a light web of lace was left behind on the side of the glass .
a : nice little head that settled but did n't disappear leaving me to the excitement that would be coming next !

a : amazing . near black with deep mahogoany highlights . the foam builds from the bottom like an upside down snowstorm . there is a thick , soft tan head that just sits on top of this beer the entire time leaving foam in the bottom of the glass at the end . this may be my new benchmark for a `` 5 '' appearance
appearance : pours light , milky brown with head that recedes immediately and completely .

a : mild amber color , or a deep golden-orange , depending on your perspective . lightly hazed , plenty of streaming carbonation . mounding head , a robust 2-fingers of rigid ivory froth . sticking lace top to bottom .
a : great , orange/light brown color - clear
appearance : golden , cloudy , some lacing
a : brilliant burnt orange color with a head that wo n't quit and nice lacing . what more could you ask for ?

a : pours out a crystal clear ( for a hefeweizen ) golden straw . there is initally a gigantic head but it fades into nothing more than a skinny cap , which i am thinking is a result of the abv on this beer . as it stands now this beer does not really look like a hefeweizen .
a : jet black . no light getting in at off . cream colored head with a good amount of lacing .

appearance : i poured the duvel into the duvel glass and had a perfect pour , with the division between the foam and beer at around the middle of the duvel symbol and the foam reaching the very top of the glass . this ment about four fingers of super fluffy white head that left the most incredible lacing . the color of the beer was a pale golden straw .
appearance : poured a honey gold with a finger-thick head , and very nice lacing . ample carbonation , but the head receded rather quickly . fairly clear and clean , but attractive nonetheless .
a : the beer is a light color , with a very thin white head that fades very quickly and leaves very little lace on the glass .
appearance : poured from a bomber into a standard pint glass a hazy , dark brown with a very fluffy , off-white half inch head resting on top .
a : pours a clear yellow-gold with a finger of white head that recedes into a thin ring with little lacing .
a : black color . half a finger of fizzy tan head that falls quickly and leaves no lacing . i know how coffee can wreak havoc on head retention , so i went easy on them . 3.5

a : just a hair redder than gold ( i.e. , not really amber in any real sense ) . it has a rocky three-finger head that fades to a thin layer leaving impressive lacing . the amber term is i believe a marketing rhyme ( yarpivo yantarnoe ) .
appearance : very , very pale straw color with a small , think white head that dissipates quickly and leaves no sign of lace .
appearance : pours a cloudy brown color with a 1.5 '' head that has great retention . craterous head with plenty of lace . it coats the glass .

appearance : as with most sierra bottles , this bomber was gorgeous , with a pretty green wax covering the cap . it was a bit tougher than some waxed caps to open , although i have n't seen sierra do this before , so maybe they 're just learning . once it was open the estate poured an opaque golden orange with a big , thick , two finger head in a large snifter . the lacing was outstanding , covering about 80 % of the glass .
a : very translucent and absolutely filled with bubbles . pours a thick , cloudy white head that subsides slowly and looks beautiful . golden with a hint of amber .
a : pours a crisp reddish-brown with a healthy , foamy head . moderate lacing .
a : a clear golden/straw color . a small white head forms and leaves a touch of patchy lace .
appearance : golden , transparent body , white immediately disappearing head , aggressive head .

a : pours out a stunning neon-crimson orange/golden amber brown that is just so ever pleasing to look at and take in . a marvelously thick and large frothy head forms and winds its way down slowly into a very pleasant downy sheen across the top of the brew . magnifico ! n : light tones of sweet malty syrup , tiramisu ( i 'm not being cute ) , brandy , very slight alcohol . nice and quite different from what you get from a deutsch version . p/m : good and firm carbonation welcomes you in to an immediate wash of chalky malt that gives this the tone of a cousin to einbecker ur-bock . the rolling carbonation obscures some of the initial other flavors , but rising upards and outwards are sweet malt , whipped cream , grand marnier , and even a bit of molassas ( thatseems to be the theme here tonight , folks ) . the mid-palate does this wild sort of horizontal even-out that sort of gives the brew a centred flat line that slices right through the flavors and textures . visually it 's a straight line cutting through a cloud . finish is bocky malty and clean , but leaves a nice remembrance upon your palate and in your mouth . if it were n't for the aggressive carbonation , this would be absolutely breathtaking and not merely fantastic .
a : pours thick and dark with overly thin and bubbly head . unimpressive .
appearance : lovely peachy amber pink , with an ephemerally slim strawberry cream white head .
appearance : pours a beautiful reddish gold with a thin white head that dissipates quickly leaving no traces .
appearance : wow , this is one of the lightest lagers i have had . super pale yellow with a small white head that dissipates very quickly and leaves no lace .
a : not the most impressive looking of beers- dark black yes , however little head and rather flat looking . that was the only downside i could find .
appearance : quite the site to behold , with a cloudy peach nectar color and a full head that sticks and sheets

appearance : yellow color , transparent , white head : initially the head was almost non-existent ( maybe i didnt pour right ? ) but when i re-filled my glass from higher up there was a half-inch thickness .
appearance : pours a brown-amber color with a fingers worth of head . no lacing to speak of .
appearance : a deep brownish orange color coupled with a weak head that didnt stay on the beer very long .
a : medium-dark brown and almost opaque with a nice finger of head . when held up to the light , it turns translucent and glows bright red . impressive .
a : nice burnt orange/amber color with generous sticky lacing . slightly opaque , but not nearly as much as other unfiltered brews .
a : pours a pale straw color with one finger head . shrinks to a thin film with nice lacing .
a : black/dark ruby beer that pours fizzy but leaves absolutely no head whatsoever . ends up the colour of a cola or dark-coloured root beer .
a : pours a bright golden orange color with a nice off white head that 's leaving tons of lacing behind .
a : looks like slightly colored water . no head , slight bubbling .
appearance : pours a hazy pale gold with a huge , fluffy white head that settles slowly and leaves a thick and sticky lacing all the way down . impressive .
a : motor oil black with a huge brown head . leaves massive sheets of lacing .
appearance : very light straw color with a minimal head and tons of visible carbonation bubbles .
appearance : this beer is a transparent brown and orange colored brew with a better than 2 inch head . the head is ivory in color . laceing is spongey and coats the glass . great retention .

appearance : this bottle pours out a deep ruby hue with soapy looking head . retention is poor , granted , but i can tell there is still some carbonation left due to slight lacing . not the best looking beer , but being 7 years old now i guess i 'm not surprised .

appearance : poured from a 12 oz bottle into a pint glass the beer is a very pale amber . almost golden , clear , almost looks like a macro lager . the beer had a thin head that faded to a small dollop on the liquid with a ring around the glass . patchy lacing at best .
appearance : unspectacular appearance , pouring a deep , dark-brown , copper hue with absolutely no head nor lacing at all ...

appearance : one and a half inch , white , pillowy head dissipates slowly leaving a wall of lacing and never getting below a few millimeters in height for the 20 minutes or so it took me to drink the beer . color is a hazy , orange juice yellow . beer leaves big rings of lacing .
appearance : golden color , hardly any head given the style i thought it would be huge , good lacing nice ring with every sip .
appearance : deep black in color with a creamy 2 '' + head that lasts forever . thick lacing paints the glass .
appearance : very heady , even after a gentle pour . head lofts a full quarter inch above the rim of my 16 oz glass . very impressive looking . nice light amber body .
appearance : the beer pours light copper in color . there 's a tight white head to crown the beer and it displays superb lacing and great retention .

appearance : pours a one finger , thinner looking , noisy , mocha colored head that quickly fades to a splotchy wisp and ring . black body and very little carbonation evident . no film remains and leaves zero lacing down the glass . a little flat looking by the end , unfortunately . a little lack lustre .
a : yellow , golden , lemonade + carbonation . minimal head with a nice lace .
a : hazy straw with a few floaties . white head , very little retention , slight lacing .
a : clear , straw yellow with a thin head and very active carbonation .

a : pours a half finger head of no cream , bad thickness , and abysmal retention . colour is a clear yellow-copper . sm : yellow chilies , like the ones in those plastic baggies you get at in n out burger , and pizza peppers . a mild strength aroma .
a : unchanged . 5/5
a : crystal clear light orange body with a nice fluffy white head that lasts and laces beautifully .
appearance : black in color with a 2 '' creamy head . some mild lacing develops during the session .
a : very dark almost black with little to no head
a : poured from a bottle into a pint glass producing minimal head that diminished to practically nothing very quickly . no discernible lacing to note . color was a mostly clear light yellow gold .
a : bubbly head and bubbly carbonation . sediment yeasty filled light orange body . tons of sediment and not the most attractive . hello floaties .
a : this beer really is n't much to look at , a clear light yellow with a bit of a white head . just looking at it , it could be a bud light for all i know .

a : `` fizzy yellow beer '' , that poured with a fairly large fluffy white head initially , but it disappeared without a trace , almost immediately . if i hold my beer up to the tv , i can still watch the game . can almost make out the down-and-distance , too .
a : very pale yellow with a one-finger head . died quickly with no retention .
a : pours a light clear yellow with large fluffy white head which does not last very long . lacing is moderate . carbonation is strong . alot if bubbles .

a : served with a finger 's worth of medium-dark mocha brown head , creamy texture and short retention . a thin ring of tiny bubbles rests around the edge of the glass . no film on the surface and no lacing at all . black as hell , there is no chance for light to penetrate .
a : pours black with a full frothy milkshake like brown head . great retention , lots of lace .
appearance : the beer pours rusty in color with a pitiful white film for a head . there 's some steady carbonation but it is n't doing anything for the beer 's looks .

appearance : deep yellow . the head virtually imploded ( i blinked and it was gone ) ; nothing remained after two minutes ( i am using the proper glassware , of course ) and there was no evidence at all of lacing . very unimpressive .
appearance : a bland yellow that is almost colorless . no head to mention . active bubbles racing to the top of the glass .
a : pours a pale yellow , with a very fizzy , soda-like head which disappears in a few seconds making the beer flat-looking throughout the drink .
a : the beer is nearly black , with very little , if any , light shining through . the head is a nice 2 fingers and tan . the lacing is soo good , and stays all the way down till the end ...

appearance : beautiful deep amber pour , huge dense creamy pale tan head that settles very slowly with super thick and heavy retention and a strong , foamy lace down the entire glass . a great looking beer .

a : poured from a bomber into a standard pint glass . this beer is looks like most other big ( d ) ipas . the body is cloudy amber-red and the head has a a brown tinge and excellent lacing . the head is darker than the shiny `` egg white '' foam that forms on more filtered ipas .

appearance : pours a cloudy , dark honey color with a big , two finger head . head is very fluffy , leaving behind thick , unpatterened lacing as it disappears . hazy clouds of yeast linger at the bottom of the glass , as this is an unfiltered beer .
a : when poured from a 22 oz bottle into a perfect pint glass there was a 2 1/2 finger light brown head that was above the very brown/black beer that lives up to its name .
appearance : pours a dark black color with two fingers of creamy mocha-colored head that slowly settles into a half finger . excellent lacing . 5/5
a : rich , dark copper body . cream-white head -- a fingers width -- that slowly ebbs to a shallow , cappucino pillow . lazy spider-web lacing . pretty .
appearance : all of the carbonation must have been used up when i opened the can as , within just a few minutes , the beer was pouring like apple juice

appearance : very light gold in color with mild haziness not the typical extreme cloudiness of the style . head pours a big bubbly white head not the dense , white , moussy head . head retention not as good as it could be , but does form a fair amount of islands . ( 3.0 )
appearance : red ... looks like a lambic . how did they get the red coloring ? maybe red food dye ? nice head retention .
a : clear dark brown body , completely still . mediocre .
a : very cloudy dark reddish-brown . not much head , but a ring is consistent . i would like a lighter color , like golden . where 's the head ? !
a : opaque , black beer - not much head except for tan colored ring around glass
a : pale , like a cave fish species that has n't seen the sun in 3 million generations
a : dark amber , good 2 finger head , plenty of carbo

a : enthralling look : a sultry , mildly hazed amber-auburn capped with a lofty crown - almost 3-fingers of spongy ivory . a few fine lines of wriggling carbonation . terrific lace , long drapes of seafoam spackling atop a solid 1/2 finger of perma-foam . it 's a fine looking beer , top to bottom .
a : pours a very clear , light golden color with a thin , white head . thin lacing with visible carbonation .

appearance : damn gorgeous ! just like a nitro-tap , it pours creamy , luscious and smooth . take your time admiring the head form up and become a thick two-finger crown that lasts and lasts . i bet if i left and came back after a few hours , that massive head would still be there ! and the lacing , oh my . it 's like the great wall of china . color is an incredibly deep black , if you can get past the outrageous head .

a : this beer pours a deep dark brown with a major ruby red edge to it . with the first pour there was a ridiculous four finger of rocky , light brown head to it . amazing head retention , thick , sticky , chunky lacing left on the glass .

a : served with a finger and a half of light brown creamy head . retention is excellent . the lacing from the head alone is impeccable . lacing continues to impress showing the utmost stickiness throughout the entire beer . the body of the beer is middle-of-your-eye black and opaque as expected .
