appearance : pours very clear slightly orangish gold with a huge cap of white foam that was 3 '' at first and grew after the pour . it took a couple of minutes before it even started to fade a little .
appearance : amazing bubbly head , orangish hue . major league frothy .

a : pours out a brilliantly bright blood red color with a foamy light beige head . moderate lacing on the glass with a very mild head retention and is crystal clear . the bright reddish hue of the beer is really rather stunning .
appearance : pale golden color - poured a white head that disappeared quickly . frankly , it did n't look like much .

a : a careful pour produced a crystal clear honey colored brew with a bit of an orange hue . fantastic frothy white foam head at least a 1/2 '' thick that reduces to a tight lumpy foam that hangs in there for the whole glass . i ca n't imagine a more picture perfect look for a triple !

a : big huge mammoth foam head , going away at a leisurely pace , even with a `` beer pour '' , i 'd say outstanding in my book . it looks like fresh beer with pillowy churn across the top . hazy and dimly orange , more yellow , and no particulate at the bottom .
appearance : as far as clarity goes it is just fine , slight chill haze that dissipates , with a weathered golden hue . sticky thin lace is all a hard pour yields .
a : pours a deep black ale which is nearly opaque , but maduro brown when light penetrates . single finger , peanut head falls to a thick quilt of the same . decent lacing .

appearance : hazy reddish brown . lots of action on the pour , but this one pours like it is very viscous . carbonation activity persists through out the drinking of this one in the form of very small and slow moving bubbles .
a : slight hazy orange-ish hue . medium-small sized head that leaves a few traces of lacing on the glass .
appearance : blackish-brown with a tan head . the head left some lacing up top and then seemed to wholly stick to the side of the glass the rest of the way down .
a : pours a nice light orangish/red color with a nice large tan foam head . there is a decent amount of lacing .
a : pours really really black , totally opaque . half a finger worth of a straight brown head . half creamy looking . retention is ok and lacing is bad .
a : pours a cloudy copper with a rock-hard head ( due to wheat ) . unfiltered or not , wheat or not , the cloudiness is a bit odd , although well advertised on the bottle .
appearance : darker golden , but clear ( not cloudy ... hmmm ) . no head retention . yeeeah , not off to a good start .
appearance : black in color with a fluffy 3 '' + head that lasts forever . nice lace covers the glass .
a : into a pint glass , this pours a clear amber color under a thin but nicely sustained head .
appearance : pours a slightly golden yellow with orange hues . a 2 '' ivory colored head that shows excellent retention . craterous surface and gobs of foamy lace make for a perfect visual .

a : pours a clear grapefruit-colored body with light carbonation , underneath a one-finger head of white foam . the head disappears pretty quickly , and leaves only a light amount of lace . this one definitely suffers by comparison to the beatifully unfiltered alesmith , but it certainly would n't be getting a much higher score on its own . pretty boring .

a : well it hits the glass and i am a bit thrown off . this has the thinness and color of a pretty typical macro . really generic golden yellow that is crystal clear . the head was a good finger of bubbly white foam , but it fell to a decent ring with an amoeba-like cap . it does n't throw up any lace due to lack of stick . carbonation is incredibly active , with a fountain like appearance of constant streams of quick moving bubbles . sadly this is the only thing that stands out about the look . this straight up looks like a lager .

appearance : black , nearly 100 % opaque , with a large fluffy brown head and nice lacings . flavor : first hit with a bit of citrus fruit followed by some spices , maybe a hint of nutmeg , and that earthy dark chocolate bitterness . but in the end it is a predominate metallic aftertaste .

a : poured into a glass : dark brown/black color . not totally opaque against the light . the bottle has been chilled continuously since inception , i imagine : i got it out of the cooler at k & l and left it in my fridge . a young beer like this means the bottle conditioning has n't had time to work . there is a slow dissolution of bubbles when the beer is poured , but it never forms a head , collar , or lace . sorry alan : i understand what 's going on but i ca n't just give you a pass .
a : pours a very hazy amber , exhibiting significant chill haze . a half-inch head forms on the pour , falling to a film over the beer . no lacing at all .
a : fluffy white head that does not quickly dissipate . deep copper color .

a : a clear pale orange until the yeast residual at the bottom of the bottle is swirled and added . small , off-white head the recedes quickly . very little lacing ( much less head and lacing than expected ) .
a : cloudy neon yellow hues with a nice white creamy looking head . this is a very strange color . not what i was expecting .
appearance : looks nice . bright ruby , perfect clarity . nice head , nice lacing .
appearance : pour a clear pale golden color with a rich marshmallow of a head that leaves plenty of lace , but dissipates rather quickly
appearance : cloudy , dull orange that turns fiery in the light . massive foamy head with loads of lacing .
a : poured a clear garnet color with pillowy head that reduces to lacing , nice
a : pours a pink orange with a very mild head , almost flat looking .
appearance : light golden color ( looks like a pilsner not like an oktoberfest ) . nice lacing left on the glass .
a : hazy orange in color . there 's tons of floaties/sediment in this beer . nice 1.5 finger fluffy white head that has excellent retention and lacy .
a : pours thick and black as midnight on a moonless night . beautiful 2 inch extremely dark tan head forms and slowly recedes . wow !
a : great . bronze with a big , lasting golden top .
a : a light amber color that first appeared to have great lacing and head , but unfortunately dissipated within a minute or two .
appearance : poured to give a beautiful golden ( light amber ) beer with a rich , thick white foam head that had good longevity . the beer was slightly hazy ( chill haze ? ) .
a : pours a murky brown/amber color . a tiny white cap of foam forms . some light sticky lace is left behind .

appearance : tonight i am going to be using one of my favorite glasses in the cabinet , my dogfish head goblet which is perfect just about every occasion . i pulled the large champagne bottle out of the fridge and proceeded to unwrap the wire cage and wrangle the cork out . thankfully i did n't need to get my pliers to finish the job and the cork slipped out fairly easily and heard a generous pop while the carbonation gasses floated out . i decided to tilt my glass fairly hard to make sure there was n't a overflow of head and it poured beautifully . when i was done i was left with absolutely no head at all , it looks as still as wine with no carbonation bubbles . as i hold my glass up to the light it appears to be deep red almost ruby with some purple tones thrown in . a fair amount of haziness and there is no light passing through the murky ale . as i give a quick swirl the viscosity appears to be pretty light and only leaving slight legs that go away quickly .
appearance : clear , dark maroon , steady flow of carbonation from the depths . big head at first , fades and leaves a little lace , a little off-white head .
a : pours black with a light fizzy off-white head , some lace .
a : the pour is a dark amber-red color with an off-white/khaki head .
appearance : perfect clarity but that does not make up for the thin ring of lace that seems to leave quicker than the beer .
a : thick , viscous pour with almost midnight black color .
a : super aggressive pour did give a good off white head , but it had totally no retention . it was gone within 20 seconds . color is brownish red and there is no lacing .
a : massive 4-finger rocky white head takes forever to settle . like meringue on a pie . brew is a cloudy golden yellow . huge icebergs of foam cling to the glass .
appearance : deep dark brown , nearly ebony , loaded head and creamy froth . was beautiful
a : almost opaque , except for a couple of garnet highlights around the edges . the head quickly settles into a thin , beige film on top of the brew .
a : pale golden color , with a white head . not good head retention .
a : pours a clear straw like yellow with a white fizzy head that quickly dissipates .
a : deep amber color with very little head , even with a vigorous pour . lacing is minimal . some random floaties mingle amongst the bubbly carbonation .
appearance : copper golden amber forms a thin short-lived off white head no lacing left at all .
a : pours pitch black with about half a finger of head . the bubbles fade slowly and cling to the glass for dear life . however , there is n't much lacing as it drinks .
appearance : brown with red hues , white head with better head retention than the others beers i had that night .
appearance : very pale yellow with not much carbonation or foam for me . it 's hard to say i 'm impressed but it 's not gross .
a : pours a hazy straw yellow into an american shaker pint with a little white head that dissipates rather quickly and leaves some lacing .
appearance : pours a slightly hazy , golden-yellow color . thin white cap but leaves a nice lacing on the glass as you drink .
a : pours amber , with a thick white nitro head , sticky full lacing . certainly looks great .
appearance : pours a maroon brown with abundant off white/vanilla head in a weizen glass . the head retention was very poor and the carbonation was weak .

a : pours a very murky maroon body that glows with a faint reddish tint when held to the light . head is beige in color . retention is moderate ; it leaves a collar on the beer and some scattered foam on top . i must say , if it were n't for the head , it would look like pond water .
appearance : pours golden with a white short lived head , hmmm yellow fizzy not much difference so far woops no lacing .
a : clear golden brew gives 1 '' of frothy white head that settles and leaves thick webby lacing behind .

a : pours an ultra clear gold with a short head that dissipates quickly . my second pour yielded the yeast which in turn made it a cloudy gold . almost no carbonation except for a couple of bubbles to let you know it 's there . n : wheat , belgian yeast and hints of dark fruit and spice .
appearance : mahogany colored with a very minimal tan head that dissipates very fast .

appearance : pours an opaque mahogany with some orange around the edges . a light tan head starts out absolutely huge , filling two-thirds of the glass . it slowly shrinks down to a thick and steady cap and leaves lots of lace on the glass .
a : lightly hazed golden wheat color . less than one finger of frothy white head that fell quickly and left no lacing . 5.0
a : gentle pour yields 2 fingers of just off-white head with great retention . hazy copper orange-gold liquid . beautiful
appearance : 4/5 flavor : 4/10 palate : 2/7
appearance : poured roughly into my official beer for punks chalice ( conflicted about it ) . no head . i mean nothing . like middle school dance no head . slightly hazy golden raisin color .
appearance : a disturbing pinkish color , like vomit pink , the appearance alone said , do not drink !
a : poured into a large wine glass . very bubbly , with thick foamy white head . pale gold , light haze .

appearance : a dark copper color with a reddish hue . i pour a bit aggressive hoping for a head , all i got was a foamy light tan quarter inch head without retention . there is effervescence in the beer . the clarity of the beer is clear and brilliant .
a : reddish- copper with a red glow through the brilliant clarity . poured a thin off-white head that dissipated quickly .

appearance : approaching black , with brilliantly clear deep garnet flashes when held to light . fervent carbonation . mountainous , rocky , beige head recedes slowly into a manageable layer that leaves sparse foam trails .
a : very deep , dark brownish red . looks syrupy , like nyquil . really interesting color . nice tan head , lots of lacing .
appearance : after opening with a loud pop , the beer poured a slightly hazy , brilliant , darker gold , with a rocky and foamy white layer of head that lasted .
appearance : a one dark tan foamy head that has very poor retention . the color of the beer is dark brown to near opaque . the clarity is opaque with a lot of carbonation on the side .
appearance : there was not much for head or lace . it had typical wit color . sort of gold and hazy the top was darker than the bottom .
appearance : dull golden colour with a bright clarity , head retention lacks a bit and it quickly dissipates to a ring of lace .

a : poured a hazy partially amber/copper hue with solid 2 finger head , light tan color , strong ringed lacing , retained well through entire quaff with solid cap on the bottom with small holes from rising carbonation .
appearance : brown with some amber orange and lots of rising bubbles . solid three finger off white head with good retention and a decent amount of lacing .
appearance : cloudy orange haze head : light tan head that has very big bubbles and dissipates quickly

a : pours a deep goldenish orange , leaves a 2 finger eggshell colored head that takes forever to settle into a 1/2 '' cap and leaves lacing everywhere . it refuses to let go of the sides of my glass . one of the absolute best ipa 's i 've seen . flawless .
a : opens with a loud pop , clear pale gold in color with huge white head as a billion tiny bubbles rush to get to the surface . the head recedes leaving lace sticking to the sides of the glass .
a : about as light/gold as a beer can get without being water .
appearance : a very disappointing yellow in comparison to regular yuengling .
appearance : pours a hazy golden yellow color with a huge 3 '' + head that slowly fades . nice lacing develops .
a : a soft pour leads to a perfectly golden body , slightly hazy , with about a finger and a half of tight , white foamy head . leaves really awesome rings of lacing .

a : pours a 1.5 finger head of fair cream , decent thickness , and fair retention . cloudy yellow-orange colour . sm : lemon peel , very unwelcome pale hops , and light orange hops . a strangely bad aroma for the style . moderately strong .
a : pours a faded gold color with a fizzy , small head . fades to wisps of white foam and leaves a few tiny spots of lace .
a : dark amber color with a 1 inch head that lasts for the whole pint . never seen that before .
appearance : clear honey colored liquid topped with a nice healthy and frothy off-white head . a nice layer of foam was retained all throughout consumption . nice splotchy lacing was left as well .
a : black in color and came without a head . 4.5

a : pours a clear amber body with a finger of long-retaining off-white head . thick , fluffy collar with some scattered film on top of the beer . nice sheets of lace during a swig , with some sticking behind as register marks .

appearance : pale golden body with a light milky haze that seems to shimmer in the light thanks to the myriad of fast rising streamers . monster belgian style achouffe head rises quickly and drops down to a rocky crevice infested mass that leaves massive cloud like chunks hanging off the side of my glass and expanded foam icebergs ready to sink passing ships . awesome looks ! ! i toyed with a 4.5 but i loved this one so much i went for a 5.0 - hands down the best part of this brew .
a : hazy golden in color . thin head dissipates to almost none . thin lacing .
appearance : pours amberish orange with a thin white head . it 's a good looking beer , but unfortunately it was all downhill from there .
appearance : golden amber with 1/2 finger of white head . it has nice lacing , but it 's a pretty standard look for an ipa .

appearance : oh boy ... is this the belgian version of b to the e but for women ? i am nervous & somehow i have a feeling it is warranted . from the tall slender can , this beer pours a pinkish/purplish color , like the inside of plum that isnt quite ripe . there is an effervescent one finger pinkish colored head atop . it leaves spotty lacing on the inside of the glass .
a : pours goldenrod with a light white head , some lacing .

a : hazy opaque , and very full orange/yellow honey color . wild head that fizzes like crazy , then immediately dissipates leaving the beer looking flat and lifeless in the glass . ( retains a slight ring around the edge and leaves a limp lace that quickly slides back down into the beer )

appearance : the beer is a nice amber that pours with a decent amount of head . a disturbing trend i 've noticed with rogue beers is that the head disappears almost immediately and leaves zero lacing . this beer continues that disappointing trend .
a : pours a dark and hazy orange/brown color . a large beige head forms with great sticky lacing .
a : pours a half finger head of poor retention so bad it 's impossible to ascertain cream of thickness . colour is a light yellow . sm : a very light aroma of plain barley . boring .
a : cloudy pale gold , rocky white head quickly falls into a decent cap with adequate lacing . too pale for the style in my opinion .
appearance : 5 |

appearance : dull color , slightly brown golden tone . wisps of murky white floating suspended throughout the glass . head is thin and dissipates quickly . specks of thin , delicate foam remain floating on the top . low carbonation .
appearance : pours jet black , with an incredibly thick and frothy brown head . the head subsides slowly . no light is coming through this one at all . tons of lacing . beautiful looking beer .
a : beer is a very cloudy deep copper/orange color . very little off-white head , maybe a finger at most all froth . carbonation is evident .
appearance : pours a golden-orange color with a light airy head that turns to a film very fast . there 's a ton of floaters in the beer ... presumably yeast debris . excessive .
a : golden color , white head . not much deeper than that .
a : dark copper brown , inert ; thin head dissipates quickly ; no lacing ; looks dead
a : opaque orange brown color . came with no head . 4.5
appearance : beautiful total blackness , high viscosity pour , big brown head , coats the glass with lacing as i drink .
a : deep dark red brown . murky , and the small head fizzles away quickly and leaves no lacing . not the prettiest looking beer , i 'll be honest .
a : beautiful hazy amber with a one finger creamy head that had excellent retention and lacing .
appearance : billowy head 2+ fingers , pale golden , random lace
a : slightly copper , massive pillow of a head that just did n't want to go away , active carbonation
a : pours a dark red almost black looking , with a full white head , great retention and good lacing . seen this beer out of the olde wooden cask too , looks phenomenal .

appearance : this beer was a royal pain in the ass to pour , even having seen the previous posts about out-of-control head . i poured about an inch in the glass and ended up with foam to the top . ridiculuously over-carbed . there is a lot of sediment in this beer leading to murkiness .
appearance : it is a hazy straw color , with a heavy , white colored five finger head which was poured into a weiss glass that heaps like a mountain on top of the glass .

a : looks exactly like a good pee . not too dark or light . just a perfect pee colour . i mean you could feed this through a tube and use it to make special effects pee in a movie . very little carbonation that fades instantly .
appearance : rich amber colour with a nice-sized head .
a : the pour is a very muddled brown color with plenty of red highlights and a short lived off-white head on top . not particularly attractive in any sense .
appearance : black glass shows some ruby edges , no head retention at all leaves it looking a bit flat .
a : clear golden yellow with a gorgeous , billowing head good retention . tons of carbonation , with trails of whirling bubbles . very pretty !

appearance : fresh off a new keg . no head formation , which is odd for a wheat beer . on top of that , i could seriously pitch this beer into some wort and it would ferment . there was so much yeast in my beer that it looked like someone shook up a yeast vial and dumped it in .
a : faded yellow/straw-colored haze . two fingers of white head that disappears quickly . lots of bubbles .
appearance : light rusty brown in colour with minimal head retention .

a : opaque black with a rich brown , cappuccino hued head . dense , but not bustling . good retention . not exactly an american brown looking ale , more like a rich stout . good looking brew , but not looking like a brown .
a : pours a bright golden amber with a fairly dense half inch off-white head . head retention and lacing are extremely good . this is what an ipa should look like - exceptional .
appearance : pours clear yellow , with a gorgeous 1 1/2 - 2 finger head . copious lacing throughout.this is what i think of when i think of the the perfect looking beer .
appearance : beautiful bright beer , ultra-dark burnt orange with absolutely no carbonation or head .
appearance : not really impressed so far . pours a murky orange-tinted brown with some cream-colored head that fades quickly and no lacing/spotting .
appearance : i have to say , when i first poured it , meantime looked awesome ! poured a nice thick head . it had a cloudy hefeweizen color . i have to admit , it looked very refreshing .
a : slightly hazy straw yellow body with a dinger of head with light lacing 4.5
appearance : a clear orange-light golden color , minimal head that settled quickly and leaves no lacing to speak of . actually kind of lifeless looking .
appearance : pale golden color , with a moderate , snow-white head , thick patchy lacing , and slight carbonation .
appearance : a hazy , honey-orange body underneath a mountain of creamy , off-white head . the head eventually starts to fade and leaves good lacing on the way down .
a : the beer is a bright ruby red color with a large tan head that fades very slowly and leaves a thick lace on the glass .

a : pours a fizzy champagne-esque head , pink in colour , real thin , with no cream , and bad retention . must be extremely carbonated because the abv is low . the retention is ( at best ) 5 seconds . colour is a nontransparent watermelon . sm : souring hops , bacteria , some funk , crystal malts , raspberries , and cherries . complex , balanced , and incredibly inviting . a moderate strength aroma .

appearance : sparkling dark golden color . slightly off white , almost cream colored , head that rises large at first as the beer is poured , but it soon settles to a thin collar and does not last long . carbonation is high when initially poured from the bottle , but it soon rescinds and just leaves a few slow streamers .
a : yellow watery , water mixed with piss .
a : pours a dark , almost opaque brown color . a large beige head of over two fingers forms with great retention . lots of sticky lace clings all the way down the glass .

appearance : a whitish golden yellow body , the carbonation is present but hard to gauge . the body was also pretty opaque . a fluffy white head without much retention , almost akin to dropping an orange slice into the glass .
a : pours pitch black with medium tan head .
appearance : kind of ugly . just a pale straw yellow with a one-finger head that quickly dissipates . literally no lacing left on the glass as i drank .
appearance : dark orangish yellow , good head that recedes too quickly but has good white lacing .

a : clear and dark tree sap brown with a fizzy head that fades into a thin bubbly ring on the side of the glass . would have like to see a head that could sustain itself but really nothing is going on here .
a : pours a typical light golden yellow hue . the head doesnt stick around but leaves a good lace as you drink .
a : pours a very duvel golden yellow but without as much clarity . just about 2 fingers of tight white head . decent retention , laying down to 1/4 inch for most of the drink . nice lacing .
a : pours a nice cloudy golden yellow color with 1 inch frothy white head . decent retention .

appearance : straw color , reasonably cloudy . despite the 60 % wheat malt content it had low head retention ( even with a dirty glass , it should have held up better ) . the bartender served this with a lemon wedge stuck on the glass ... that 's their practice , i guess ... i removed it as soon as he put the beer down in front of me . flavor : bananas and ... mustard ? ! ? that was my initial sense , really ( and i was n't even eating anything , let alone mustardy ) . bananas and mustard slathered on fresh , peasant bread and sprinkled with some lemon juice . has a tart , dry finish .
a : cloudy caramel and light brown . the frothy head is 3 fingers tall and beige in color . there 's a hearty finger of retention for most of the session and a ton of lacing . i love it .
a : cloudy appearance , golden with a touch of red . almost like an amber unfiltered wheat .
a : this beer is surprisingly sexy . i was expecting pale straw , but received copper . lacing is lively and active , but the head could use a bit of retention . sexy nonetheless .
a : light and transparent , slight gold hue . clear as day .
appearance : brown coloured and very cloudy . creamy head , which disappears after five minutes leaving a thin , lumpy layer . not very impressive

a : pours a one finger head of no cream , pretty thin , and of bad retention . colour is a clear cloudy yellow . appealing . sm : clove , light lemon , and very light yeast . very light in strength but appealing .
appearance : pitch black body with a thinnish , near white head . nie fluffy sticky lacing .
a : looks extremely pale , poured almost looking like water . head faded quickly , with some lacing .
a : pours a dark amber , almost copper color with no head and modestly active carbonation .
appearance : this brew pours with a thick foamy butter color . lacings are plentiful . head retention is looong . brew color is a pleasant amber . excellent first impression .

appearance : looks very much like a pint of snpa -- the familiar deep gold color tinged with orange , perfectly clear , and topped with an off-white head that shrinks down to a ring around the glass . the head forms very attractive lacing when you tilt the glass .
appearance : poured a dark caramel color with almost no head and zero lacing .
a : slightly hazy light amber color . disappointing head .
a : not seeing anything special after the pour ; straw-like color with a quickly dissipating head and lots of bubbles . looks like i poured a high life..
a : dark brown with amber hues . 3 finger light tan cascading head . excellent retention with thick concentric lacing .
a : the beer is a murky light red color , with almost no head or lacing .
a : poured rich dark , with a tan head that sat about 2 fingers thick and had a small amount of retention with fantastic lacing ... perfect look for a stout
appearance : dark red color with 1 finger of tan head that fades to a thin cap with some chunky lacing .
appearance : amber in color and darker than most ipa 's with a large white head .
a : pours a deep black colour with only a little bit of light shining through the edges . 2 fingers of dense ivory head and lots of lacing .
appearance : murky medium-brown . thin beige head that dissipated quickly .

appearance : pours a crystal clear amber with a nice half-finger off-white head . it hangs on for quite a while as a result of the large amount of cascading bubbles rising from the bottom of the glass . lacing is tremendous and comes in sheets .

appearance : pours with a large but very very thin head , head retention is of course poor and turns into the whispiest of lacing , if a lacing at all . pours the clearest of yellows you can use your glass as a magnifying glass with this one , not as bubbly as one would expect considering how carbonated it is . it looks clean , clear and crisp , almost completely sterile , which for some would be attractive knowing their beer was clean , however in a romantic sense this beer is devoid of all beauty and romance that a proper craft beer has . lets be serious though this is 50 cents a can or so in a 30 rack . still much better looking than some of the more expensive macros .
appearance : not cloudy enough . golden color . white head that dissipates fast . to style except the cloudiness
a : standard pour yields no head and no resulting lace . beer is a dark , almost opaque black with an attractive reddish tint which barely saves it from being a `` 1 '' .

a : the look of this beer just screams delicious . the overall cloudy very light gold almost yellow complexion was very indicative of a normal hef also the head was average starting out fairly strong about a finger and a half tall and not real thick .
a : pours a golden haze . very little head that disappears quickly . bubbles like champagne .
a : deep , dark amber with no visible carbonation but a solid 1.5 finger , tan head that does n't stick around for very long . lacing appears normal .

a : poured a nice head that dissipated quickly , but the murkiness of this beer had almost a black quality to it , and the color was not appealing . sort of a pink/brown/black that i ca n't describe but not what i expected to see .

appearance : pours into a sam adams glass a brownish amber with some orange hues to it . the head starts at 1-2 fingers and drops eventually to a massive collar and a hazy and full surface of foam . rings of lacing mark the sizes of my swallows all the way down the glass .
a : pours a hazy golden body that is capped by a finger of light beige head . retention is short , with some nice sudsing down the sides as i drink .
a : golden , hazy , with quite a lot of settings since this beer is unfiltered .
a : pours a clear straw yellow with a nice white head that fades to a layering and leaves a nice amount of lacing on the glass . looks pretty great .
a : color of weak iced tea on the pour . good head with fair retention ( dissipates quickly ) and little to no lacing on my beer stein . a lot flaky/chunky from the final bottle carbonation .

appearance : as served the beer is slightly hazy apricot color with a `` creamy fine bubbled off-white head that leaves foam on the sides as it recedes to about `` and then remains at that thickness for a while , fed by the steady streams of effervescent carbonation . sipping leaves interesting patterns of lacing that are a combination of small patches , speckles and leggy trails . even during the last 1/3 of the beer there is a 1/8 '' head that leaves a sheet of foam and lacing when sipping .
appearance : pours a weak head and a watery copper body .

a : massive erupting head in my tumbler ; a very nice whipped topping . things began to slowly melt away leaving pockets and patches of lace . the head itself even took on some crater formations . the body is a soft hazy golden tow-color
appearance : poured with some white foamy creamy head that dissipated to a thin layer leaving a little lacing . the beer is clear and orange golden/bronze .

a : pours a hazy golden-straw color with a ginormous head ! probably a good 4:1 ratio of head to beer ! and man did the head stay around forever ! left lacing everywhere once it decided to go down a bit .
a : nice hazy golden color . head is pure white and medium in volume .
appearance : is very nice ... orange hazey color with a nice 2 finger white head the lacing is exceptional all the way down through the glass
a : huge bready head . amazing and distinct lacing . beautiful reddish amber color . a joy to look at .
a : clear yellow with some gold undertones . a highly carbonated head initially , but dies very quickly . needs a bit fluffy look to it .
appearance : -massive yellow head that doesnt quit ( after a vigorous pour ) -- little valleys appear in it -crazy thick lacing all the way down
a : pours a straw color with a massive frothy head . the head subsides in its monstrousity fairly quickly , yet sustains with good volume and tons of lacing .

a : pours like overused motor oil . dark as looking at a moonless night with a blindfold on . slim cappuccino colored head , slow building , fast leaving . i was promised a voluminous head , maybe it was just this sample , i 'll be sure to amend in the future if necessary .
a : slightly hazy pale straw body with a finger of frothy white head . average retention and lightly spotty lacing . pretty average .
a : nearly opaque plum brown , apparent only whey held to a light ... fleeting half finger tight tan head ... minimal lacing

a : deep , crisp amber color with bubbles casually making their way to the top . i got a finger and a half of creamy , slightly tan/off-white head . the head stuck around for a few minutes and left generous lacing after dissipation . the deep , crisp amber look of the beer is impressive .
appearance : fairly clear yellowish orange in color sporting a spotty surface foam , even with a vigorous pour .
a : pours a deep clear brown , creamy tan head , heavy lacing , great retention

a : a straight pour fills the tulip half with clear amber liquid and half with a majestic 3-finger head of creamy off-white foam . stellar retention and lacing . i have to admit , this is a truly stunning ipa in appearance .
a : does n't look too bad reddish-brown colour with a decent head .
a : the beer is a pale yellow color with a very thin head that fades almost instantly and leaves no lace on the glass .

appearance : dark brown and relatively transparent pour for the style . produces a one finger , medium looking , off-white or light tan head with poorer retention . lots of noise on this head too . dark brown body and , again , quite transparent , with medium carbonation evident . head quickly fades to a faint wisp and ring . only a ring remains until the end but leaves no lacing down the glass . too light , transparent , and the head is lacking as well .
a : a great looking beer . light gold hue . visibly effervescent . visible yeast . capped with a quarter inch creamy white head with good retention .
a : pours dark/black ale with little to no translucency . small , transient light latte head falls away within seconds . the head falls to , well , broken and spotty surface foam . no lacing .
a : black ; almost no light coming through . poured a 3 finger rocky mocha-colored head with excellent retention to a 1 finger cap . sheets of sticky lace all the way down .

a : pours extremely clear . redish gold in color . poured a 2 finger creamy off white head that lasted about 5 minutes . settled to a nice sized head with mild carbonation is present . incredible lacing that lasts the whole glass . gorgeous .
appearance : dark reddish-brown , good clarity , a medium layer of tannish foam that disperses quite quickly to a thin film
a : pours a dark brown color , whitish brown head , slight lace down the glass .
a : slightly hazy ruby red/mahogany color . light tan head with moderate lacing .
a : carbonation was immense , like sprite . i could not believe the amount of carbonation in this beer . probably because no one pours it into a glass and just chugs it .
appearance : fluffy , white head sits atop a cloudy , dark , straw pilsner . laces on one side and retains its head superbly .
a : pours a murky magenta body in the glass . 1.5 '' of fluffy eggshell white head , great retention , and solid lacing .
appearance : black with a crema like head , kind of like a large espresso .

appearance : pours no beer head at all ; just some bubbles like you blew some bubbles in your juice . the only thing keeping me from thinking it is juice is a slight bit of waspy film on top . it 's relatively clear and a deep mahogany with ruby hints . colour is fine , but it does n't look like beer at all .

appearance : pours a hazy orange caramel color with a huge 4 finger thick and creamy off-white head . a touch of sediment pools right on top of the billowy head . the head was so big it rose a full 2 fingers above the rim of the goblet . perfect head retention . halfway through the glass and it 's still got a 1/2 finger head . excellent lacing .
a : its beer . thats all i can say .
appearance : the beer comes to me in a pint glass with a low tan head . the color of the beer is a very , very cloudy dark brown . looks kinda like muddy swamp water .
a : golden color . excellent head retention . slight head after even after a half hour .
a : medium amber with a rose tint , very clear . the head is a massive fluffy off white monster . looks nice .
appearance : cloudy orange-candy hue w/some yeast in suspension , poured so that this would have a large head , but it was completely gone before i 'd even rinsed the bottle out .

appearance : pours into my victory willibecker a crystal clear , bronze golden color . a massive , frothy , 4-finger high , bone white head forms on top and takes its good old time falling . it does n't even get all the way there , settling out at a rocky , 1-finger cap with curtains of lacing showing how high the head had been . picture perfect .
a : a slightly hazy yellow with a rocky white head .
a : practically perfect . very thick rich head and perfect lacing . clear golden color .
a : a little darker than what i expected from a normal triple .
a : almost black with subtle gleems of ruby ; inch-thick creamy nitrous head . good lacing .

a : a steady pour produced a 2-finger eggshell white head . this reduced to a 1/2 finger foamy cap within just a minute or so . color was yellow to straw colored with haze as expected of a witbier . no lace

appearance : pours out brown and yields a small , medium-thin tan head that 's overly noisy . almost obnoxiously noisy . quiet ! head quickly vanishes to a small ring . a very dark brown body with zero carbonation evident . a slight ring remains but leaves no lacing down the glass . could be darker with a thicker , more persistent head . could also shut up . since we 're short a `` sound '' category , we 'll take that into account here .

a : poured a thich pitch black with a minimal head with turned into a thing collar in no time most likely from the high abv eating it up . this thing was viscous enough to make the glass noticeably heavy .
appearance : hazy dark orange . lighter in color than i expected .
a : purplish pink with a very minimal head . i 've tried other fruit beers but i have n't ever seen one with this vibrate of color . looks a little like grape nehi .
a : amber with a big , sticky white head .
a : pours a cloudy , dark yellow , with a medium , slightly fizzy head , almost looks like a dark witbier , definitely unfiltered .
a : pours a barely ripened banana yellow with perfect visibility . a very small head forms and dies right away . no lacing .
appearance : deep coppery-brown color . a careful pour yielded a generous one finger of dense , creamy , off-white head . excellent head retention . large rings of lacing spaced down the glass .
a : light brown , clear with a pale head that leaves great lacing .

a : very clear amber - i 'd go so far as to call it `` honey amber , '' but that would could be taken as cheesy . i suppose i just did . a pretty lifeless head , it kinda comes and goes without much fanfare .
appearance : dark , rich cola color always a plus .
a : pours a pale goldenrod , mild white head , fair retention , no lace .
a : pours black under a huge brown head with bubbles cascading downward . good retention and nice lace .

a : what a lovely opening - i just had to loosen the cork slightly , and then watch as it ever-so-slowly inched its out , on its way to the ceiling . i had the tulip ready to catch the slight overflow , and proceeded to fill it perfectly to the brim with bright orange beer and fine off-white foam . the voluminous head recedes incrementally , leaving patches of soapy lace all around . beautiful gueuze .
a : unfiltered , ruby brown color . looks a lot like cider actually . pillowy eggnog colored head slowly drops leaving complex lace . very nice
appearance : cloudy orange haze with a great 3 finger head that really lasts a long time
a : black as night with a moderate light tan head .

appearance : 2.5 . a light , pilsner like looking golden color . not a strong first impression in it 's debut for me . transparent , no sediment . however , it appears to have strong lacing characteristics , appearing to be pacing it 's way down the glass like patrick ewing pacing down the court in his elder days . extreme copper appearance , not very proper .

appearance : when poured into a bell 's brewery pint glass , this doppelbock is a murky mahagony brown with ruby red highlights all through out the beer 's body . it had a poor head of foam that consisted of only 5 tan colored bubbles . these 5 tan bubbles quickly dissipated into nothing . no rings , no lace , nothing whatsoever . i tried to get the head of foam to come out by swirling it around , but it was a waste of time . it did nothing to aid the appearance .
a : deep black . a finger of chocolate-brown head with a little retention but held to the of the glass the whole way down .

a : shiny gold beer with a white , towering head . it does settle down , a bit , but a foamy pillow floats on the surface down to the last gulp . wonderful brussels lacing . effervescent and sparkling .
a : deep , translucent amber hue . its pale head shrinks quickly with virtually no retention .
appearance : from the distinctive snub nosed heavyweight bottle , this beer pours a deep opaque mahogany with minimal carbonation that leads to just a thin wisp of white on top .
a : deep orange/copper color . poured a healthy three finger slightly off-white head that settled but persisted . medium lacing .
a : orange and amber color with full clarity and a tense bubbling . very thin bright white head with standard lacing .
a : the beer is a rather murky dark brown/amber color with a small off-white head .
appearance : very clear , pale yellow body with a finger-thick white head . dissipates to nearly no lacing .
a : pours a mostly golden hue with a shortlived and small white head that leaves no lacing . rather unimpressive appearance .

a : hazelnut coffee brown and almost just as dark thick head that dropped to nil . another intimidating looking ris . n : espresso , malts , and hops . chocolate is also there , some dried figs as well- every part of it has a great strong roasted flavor and aroma . among the best smelling brews ive experienced .
a : pours a crystal clear pale yellow with a fast forming fast dying white head that creates a small ring of lacing atop the glass .
appearance : dark , nearly opaque . good cappuccino colored head .

a : poured a clear yellow into a plain pint glass with a very dense 2+ inch head . the head 's lasting power and lacing are pretty and impressive . on looks alone , this thing could go into a magezine advertisement .
appearance : clear orange/copper with a pretty two inch cloud-like head that has great retention and leaves great lacing on the glass .

appearance : i 'm always torn to give a beer a bad rating in appearance . the qualities i usually look for are a nice color ( which i suppose is pretty damn hard to screw up ) , head , and lacing . this beer does n't fit in with the color of a usual ipa/iipa , but i do n't think that 's a reason to mark it down points . they are going for a specific blend of malts and hops here , and i think the experimentation ( i do recognize they are n't the first to do a bipa ) should be encouraged . this beer is black . no doubt about it . a very dark color , with no light making its way through the glass . a nice finger of creamy and bubbly head at the top , with some lacing going from head to toe .
a : crystal clear gold color with no carbonation to be seen . no head , no nothing except liquid to look at . at least it does n't have things floating in it .
appearance : pours a brightly coloured yellow w/ no real head to speak of and no lacing . a little disappointing in the lack of head
a : decent lacing a very cloudy amber/copper color with lots of sediment floating around .
appearance : light brown with amber highlights . it 's got a nice amount of head with good retention .

a : jet black with a good looking two finger tan head . a soft pillow of foam hangs with good retention forming a blanket over the beer . it left behind a bunch of sticky lacing as well for good measure .

a : capped opens with a hiss and the beer immediately starts foaming . standard pour yields a giant frothy , coarse , 4.5 finger white head that sticks around . beer is a clear bright orange . lacing is stick and stringy with great retention . outstanding looking beer .
a : dark smooth appearance with a small amount of head that dissapates quickly in the glass . no lacing to speak of .
a : pours , as you might expect , a pitch black with a small ring of translucence . it 's oily looking , with a small mocha head that vanishes quickly into a bead around the rim .
appearance : clear , light yellow , say 2 srm . has some lite looking carbonation . perhaps its the style but the color is a bit ugly .

a : uncapped , causing a foamy eruption . was i too warm or did jp overcarbonate ? bam pours straw gold , birthing a generous four-finger head . the cap eventually collapses to a rocky bubble bath , which sticks around and leaves belgian lace on the glass . there is a slight haze , and the final pours are cloudy from disturbing the yeast cake . even in the first pour , though , tiny flecks of yeast float in suspension .

a : pours a one finger head of fair cream and thickness , but bad retention ( especially for the merely average abv ) . colour is a semitransparent gold . sm : cream , bittering hops , and barley . this is no ordinary pilsner . a mild strength aroma , but a subtle one .

appearance : lucid rusty dark brown body with a clear uniform white head cap which lays a smooth coating on the glass walls . 360 & # 730 ; belgian style lacing coats the entire circumference of the head as it sinks into the goblet . longevity of the white crown is very good and decent enough overall looks .
a : poured into a very nice wheat beer glass , it has a pale yellow head that quickly fades away . the body is clear and pure gold . lookswise , it 's not very special .

a : the beer is hazy pale yellow in color and has a light to moderate amount of visible carbonation . it poured with a finger high bright white head that died down but consistently left a thin layer of bubbles covering the surface .
appearance : reddish looking beer that looks like a fruit cocktail . short 1/4 '' head falls quickly . no lacing develops .
a : fuzzy gold color with ample carbonation . nice medium puffy head that held on .

a : decanting this into my 22oz goblet yields a black beer with ruddy brown highlights and a thin , dark brown head that recedes to a ring rather quickly . there is n't much visible carbonation either .

a : pitch , motor oil black on the pour , sludgy and thick . really no head whatsoever , even with being quite vigorous , a small ring of brown bubbles tried to cling around the glass . i would have appreciated more of a head on this one , but i guess for 11.5 % it is n't too bad . easily improvable but alas ...

appearance : pours an oily black with a very substantial 1-2 finger head that is milk-chocolate in color . lacing is pervasive and amazing . head retention is very good and minimal agitation conjures up the substantial froth anew .
appearance : poured from a 22oz . waxed bottle into a tulip glass . deep , opaque and gorgeous copper color with a fluffy white , quarter inch head .

a : this beer was served a clear light caramel color with yellowish edges and absolutely no head . the head issue could be due to the fact that this beer was served ( without asking me when i ordered ) with a quarter of an orange hooked onto the edge of my glass . what kind of craft brewery still serves fruit in their wheat beers ? or at the very least , what kind of brewery doesnt ask first ? maybe it was my fault . im not sure if i should rate this a 1.0 on appearance since i had an orchard dipped in my beer , or just ignore it . after all , the color is nice enough .
appearance : light golden red / honey colored ; cloudy with small yeast chunks . now somethings are good with chunks in them ... chunks in my beverages - now that does n't do it for me .
a : pours a dark black color , good sized tan head . good lacing down the glass
a : pours black with two fingers of tan head that recedes into a thin ring with no lacing .
a : pours goldenrod with a mild bubbly white head , fair retention , nothing special to look at .
a : pale yellow , looks almost like a light juice . no head , hmm . might be the most pathetic looking beer i have ever seen .

a : pours a pitch brown body , possibly black , with two fingers of light mocha head filling the remainder of the glass . the receding head is composed of dense , creamy-looking bubbles . the head leaves tons of sticky lace down the sides of the tulip , in all 3 pours .
a : clear copper color with a foamy head that disappears quickly to a slim collar around the glass .
a : black/brownish color , fairly transparent for a stout . did have an awesome 1 finger head and some gorgeous lacing .

a : one finger head is devoid of cream , is quite thin , and retains badly . yeast particles sit at the bottom . colour is a hazy orange-copper . unappealing . sm : heavy yeast and dark fermented orange peel . interesting . a moderate strength aroma .
appearance : gorgeous dark ruby color with orange hues and a light tan head .
appearance : dark tan head . a little lighter in color than some other porters , but still a nice dark brown .
a : wonderful copper color . lighter then a lot of ipas but not much .

appearance : pours a cloudy ( some of the particles seem suspended in time ) copper orange with a finger of sticky cream colored head . the bubbles look almost wispy and the head does n't seem to want to go away . when it finally does start to go away , there is a great ring left around the top of the beer and there is actual lacing and i have n't even had a sip yet . perfect !

appearance : as the cap is pried loose , there is only a very faint sound of gas escaping . it pours a nicely hazy golden-amber body with only a hint of bubbly , off-white head up top that fades instantly , leaving only a bare ring around the edge and sparse lacing .
appearance : pale bright gold with a thin white head that leaves behind a few rings .
a : pours a reddish copper with a half finger of tanish head . no carbanation to be found except in the rapidly decreasing head . no lacing , just a ring around the top of the beer .
a : red , and very hazy . like , much , much too hazy . thinnish head , less than one finger .

appearance : it poured a beautiful three finger head that is somewhere between off-white and khaki colored . it is very sudsy with craters forming at the top of the cap . the beer has a burnt sienna body with orange highlights ; can look clear through the glass .
a : poured with two fingers of bubbly beige head , which left only little dots of lacing here and there . beer is a deep reddish orange in color .
a : a beautiful cloudy ruby pour with a small offwhite head . head fizzes out almost instantly and there appears to be no lacing .
a : one finger tan head of poor retention ; little cream . black colour . looks overcarbonated . sm : coffee , alcohol , vanilla , chocolate . citrus notes are missing from the aroma .
appearance : paradigmatic fizzy yellow beer . adequate white head . big bubbles . poor retention .
a : rich , thick , foamy head of large bubbles . cream-coloured head sits above a dark copper beer . plenty of lacing -- very visually appealing !

a : pours a crystal clear darkish straw yellow with a creamy and rocky half inch head held up by some lazy ropes of carbonation . this beer is only slightly lighter than the busch light i just sampled as a point of comparison .
a : a cloudy brownish gold color with a thick off-white colored head . could see sediment floating in the beer .

a : pours with a light brown foamy cap of 1 1/2 fingers , falling at a moderate pace . the body is crimson tinted amber and sports the classic brilliant clarity so common in bbc 's beers . even with only average lacing , this beer is a looker .

appearance : when poured into a pilsner glass , this anchor beer poured a beautiful deep dark mahagony brown with a few dark ruby red highlights . that was only the beginning . sitting on top of this beer was a fluffy 2 inch head of tan colored foam . not only was it big , but it had excellent retention that left behind a small tan film and streak after streak of tan lace . the appearance was eye candy to me .
a : dark as dark could be . there was n't a speck of light coming through this thing . head was very minimal , just a thin dark haze at the top of the glass . left very fine lacing along the way .

a : a huge , white rocky head dominates the appearance . it does eventually dissipate to a ring over the beer and significant glass lacing , but it takes a while . the carbonation is very active ; watching the bubbles climb to the top of the yellow liquid is quite fun .
a : clear straw yellow with a finger head that instantly dwindles to a half finger . nice lacing throughout .
appearance : poured extremely dark , almost black into a tulip glass with minimal to no head .

appearance : pours with a massive 3 1/2 finger dense , white head . this settles very slowly and very little , still maintaining about 2 fingers several minutes after the pour . very nice lacing . the beer itself is a golden honey with a massive amount of activity ; a torrent rises from the nucleation site .
appearance : dark reddish brown , with a fast fading head .

appearance : this beer pours a transparent copper color with nice orange and red highlights . the head is ivory in color with a nice cakiness to it and a height of 1 inch . a little bit of lacing remains .

appearance : gorgeous deep red body is pummeled on the pour by a highly excited flamingo pink that runs deep down into the body of the brew and quickly rises to form a thick luscious shrimp pink head . lots of clotted lacing that hangs around for the entire drink . looks inviting , but it is no surprise that this is the bets part of the st. louis framboise for me .
a : pours murky light brown with a great large creamy beautiful tan head . dissipation is slow , oh so slow , and leaves great lacings .

appearance : a one finger medium tan head that has some retention . the head is foamy and creamy . the color of the beer is a dark brown color with rusty hues . the clarity of the beer is semi opaque with copper hues . there are some carbonation bubble visible .

appearance : pours pitch black with a lot of carbonation from the bottom of the glass . the carbonation mysteriously disappears half way up . pours a relatively large , two-finger thick tan head , which is very persistent . eventually levels out into a thick lace and it remains the entire time . lots of thick lacing down the sides as you drink , and the head re-establishes itself after every drink . possibly the best looking thing on the planet .
appearance : black with slight translucency around the edges . an aggressive pour yields a fairly small head , which quickly disappears .

a : a medium orange pour with a brilliant clarity yields a quickly diminishing fizzy off white head . an initial strong show of macro-bubbles quickly gives way to a near silent offering . the glass remained clean , free of any lacing as it sat there in my pint glass without much inspiration .
a : poured well with a nice lacing on it throughout the drinking experience . color was a nice deep brown .
a : pours a dark brown body with a tan head . it rises to 2 '' in height and retains for a long time , leaving great register marks as it recedes .
a : medium orange brown with some pretty big floaties , head is off white , and it mostly large bubbles that fade pretty fast .

a : there 's no head whatsoever . this is a disappointment . nontransparent solid amber-copper colour . generally appealing . sm : wine-esque . grape , dark fruit , and caramelized malt . some alcohol . mild strength aroma .
a : pitch black . thin tan fizzy head , that disappeared almost immediatly .
appearance : poured into a pint glass from the bottle . a dark , clear red color with an finger of off white head that dissipated after a minute .
a : pours a beautiful pale blonde with a snow white head . aho would have thought ? a india pale ale that 's actually pale .
a : light yellow color , not much head . no lacing or retention once the lime goes in .
a : a bit of a gusher . body is a murky brownish yellow . dirty white head gets up to one finger but does n't stay around for long .
a : opaque black with a strong caramel head and lacing .
appearance : thin lacing sitting on top of a blond/yellow brew .
a : generous head appears right upon pouring which stays for several minutes . lacing is luscious and inviting .
a : pours a near opaque black color . a small tan head forms that recedes to nothing . not much lace either .
a : pours black with no visible light showing when held up to or directly over light . slim tan head with minimal lacing .
a : pours a clear , chestnut brown with a small , short-lived beige head . it has no collar , no lace , no curtains -- very still .

a : poured hard into my portsmouth snifter , a reverse waterfall yields a milk chocolate brown cap on a text-book potting soil black body . although no real head ever formed , the thin surface layer cap and foam ring promise some carbonation . it seems the reports of the marshal 's demise do n't apply to this particular bottle . swirling the beer inside my glass literally stains the glass a walnut brown showing the viscosity of the brew . 5/5
a : pours pitch black with a finger of very dense , light brown head . retention is remarkable .
a : gorgeous , deep amber , literally glows in the glass . egg white whipped head , big bubbles , super light and creamy . makes me want to scoop it out and just dollop it on a belgian waffle .
a : deep amber . does not have much of a head - thin lacing .

a : pours like molasses , midnight black in hue with a slow-rising , deep chocolate colored head . the head quickly falls and the liquid sits like oil in the glass . slow falling , vinous legs drip down the sides of the glass upon swirling . very attractive beer .

a : dark mahogany , hazy and some sediment in the glass on each pour even though there were a few . the head was puffy like a marshmallow . adequate lacing but the one slap on this whole beer are the floaties . bottle graphics : 8/10 .
appearance : pours a straw golden/yellow color with a fluffy , bubbling white head that disappeared rather quickly .
appearance : pours dark brown , almost black in color with a pretty mocha head that lasts throughout
appearance : ehh , nothing special , yellowish , 2 fingers of foam , did not get me excited about the beer . on the other hand it would not scare a miller drinker away .
a : pale yellow , thin white head .
a : two fingers of beige head top an imposingly dark beer . black in the shadows , direct backlighting reveals a reddish-dark chestnut brown beer . scattered lacing .
a : looks good . pours a dark amber with a quarter-inch off-white head , and minimal lacing .
appearance : beautiful ruby red with a perfect head ( into a trappistes rochefort chalice ) . simply stated - this is one great looking beer .
a : decent head , no lacing . body is off in color and haze factor . as far as i 'm concerned , this is too yellow and clear for a wit .
appearance : pours to a dark , translucent orange with a small off-white head .

appearance : looks very standard/unexciting , although darker than most ipa 's , with a deep clover-honey color , red overtones and some shiny yellow strikes . barely any head and what does show up dies right away , which is mighty surprising for an ipa . some negligible lacing .
a : the beer pours just about black with a tan colored head on top .

appearance : poured from a growler with a very large off white super creamy head , it looks like half melted ice cream or whipped cream . it dissipated to a thin layer leaving amazing lacing all down the side of my glass . the beer is a clear orangeish amber-brown color .
a : a very pale yellow color . has a thumb sized head , small amount of retention and medium amount of lace . also has a noticeable amount of carbonation bubbles rising to the surface
a : pours a cloudy yellow-orange with some sediment on the sides ; the head is large and long lasting ; minimal lacing on the glass
appearance : transparent yellow body , very slight orange tinge . very minimal head that dissipates immediately , leaving only slight traces of soapscum . not an auspicious start .
a : pours clear clear straw yellow . tight white head that slowly dissipates to a skim . lacing is light and inconsistent .
a : completely opaque black . small tan head has decent retention , but i was hoping for more of a plume of foam .
a : very nice super deep copper color with a good amount of haze . poured with a finger of white head that quickly dissipated .
a : black , low viscosity , medium low carbonation and head .
a : pours a murky , dark brown hazel , with a nice white head , but for a weizen-type beer , i expected a little more .
a : light brown color , great rocky head

appearance : clear brown pour makes a small , medium , tan head that quickly vanishes . head fades to a ring and splotchy wisp almost immediately . black body with zero carbonation evident . a slight ring remains but leaves no lacing down the glass .
a : pours a hazy yellow-orangeish body with a tiny head that dessipates very quickly .
appearance : poured a dark copper with a large , frothy head that retained very well and laced all the way down the glass . a gorgeous beer .
a : dark dark brown with a hint of ruby/violet . head dissipated quickly .
a : deep , deep amber . very hazy . frothy head with okay retention and fantastic lacing .
a : poured a beautiful deep dark amber color . pretty much clear but kind of clouded by the rising co2 . poured with a nice thick 2 finger head into a duvel glass and left some pretty meaty lacing .
a : ruddy dark brown and opaque with a big creamy off white head . sort of ruddy and swampish . not a particularly attractive color . good retention and some scattered lacing .
a : opaque black body topped with a tight tan two-finger plus head of fantastic retention that leaves behind thick sticky lace and a rocky cover .
a : pours a pitch black color , small tan head with very slight lacing down the glass

a : this beer should just be drank out of the bottle . the body is n't bad looking , clear and straw colored . the head however , looks disgusting . clumpy and overly foamy , but especially ... clumpy . after a pour into the glass , looks like badly made foam for a cappuccino . it starts to dissipate into slimy , spitty looking patches that made me want to stop drinking this beer . a bit like marshmallows melting in a hot cocoa .

a : nearly clear golden color . this beer should be cloudy and i looked at other reviews to verify that it is not filtered . ( i had a filtered apwa before and it sucked , so now i 'm always weary when an apwa is clear . ) also , there was no head to speak of since the beer was poured right up to the top of the weizen glass . pretty much an awful , uneducated pour . i wish i did n't have to do this , but i have to review it like i see it . hopefully i 'll be able to try it again before leaving chicago so i can give it respectable marks . sorry goose island . 3.5
appearance : wow very active beer with a haze through it . the white lace does stay on top forever it felt like .
appearance : in true great belgian style it jumped out of the bottle , cloudy , chunky , gold , with pillowy white head .
appearance : very dark color with a nice creamy head on it
a : 4/5 . light spicy citrus . some pine/resin . some herbal notes . f : 8/10 . light , bright , sweet . bubblegum . a bit cloying . light citrus-y bitterness . residual spicyness .

appearance : golden orange in color with 1.5 finger sticky white head . edit : poured this into an over-sized wine glass ( 11/23/08 ) . bright copper with thin white head . very sticky - great lacing ! steady , gentle , carbonation allows head to retain throughout session . looks very good .
a : loved the deep orange color , exactly what i expected this type of beer to look like . decent white head .
appearance : a cloudy light brown , bordering on orange when held up to light . the head fizzled out quickly leaving little lacing .
appearance : dark , dark , brown with a nice 1/2 '' light brown head that stays there the whole way through
a : extremely dark red , cloudy , nice tan head of 1.5 fingers , big bubbles , lots of retention and lacing .
a : pours a rich dark amber that has lovely red hues when held up to a light . thick cream-colored head that is slow to dissipate , leaving beautiful lacing . delicious looking beer .
appearance : i nice redish dark amber . maybe bronze . i really like a vibrant red beer .
a : pours a cloudy golden with a 1 finger white head .
a : pours a beautiful dark crimson into a flute glass with a colour that thins out to the bottom into more of mahogany . long lasting off-white head with good lacing .

a : golden body , bordering on a medium copper , fluffy white head that brings a rather impressive amount of sticky lacing around the glass . slow dissipation and excellent retention - a really great looking iipa .
a : poured a dark , vinous nature , inky in color with dark purple highlights when held up to the light . no head , with a flat visible carbonation .
appearance : clear pale yellow with a hint of orange . topped by a short lived white head that leaves no traces of lacing .
appearance : the can has the vintage olympia emblem and artwork , very retro . the beer poured a beery-yellow with an almost non-existent head .

appearance : pours black , black , black with a 2-finger loose-bubbled tan head . it lasts for a considerable amount of time looking picture perfect . lacing is also spectacular . this beer ca n't possibly look any better .
a : clear gold body with a finger of sticky white head . pretty good retention , very nice lace . looks nice for the style .
a : big persistent pale beige head , rocky & lacey . hazy , mahogany colour , with orange-leading-to-yellow tinges near the edges of the glass . a very good look .
a : pours a cloudy orange-amber body . 1 '' bubbly head fades to a thin film . leaves quite a bit of lacing on the glass .
a : pours deep brown with light throught the edges . a good head forms and holds for a minute or two . good lacing .

a : pours a clear , mildly hazy orange/copper color with reddish tints when held to the light . the head is a generous 2 fingers when poured , but it recedes into a light film on the top . it leaves significant lacing down the glass as i drink . for the abv , it 's exceptional .
a : piss yellow with a cheap head .
a : nice golden color . good head retention with small bubbles , brilliant bright filtration .
a : dark reddish amber with a frothy and creamy long lasting cap . head retains for a ridiculous amount of time . thick sheets of lacing remain .

appearance : great reverse cascade , even a touch better than the guinness i had a bit earlier . black opaque with a just off white head that lasted at a good finger level all the way until it was the last thing on the bottom of the glass , leaving behind a nice spider web lace . flavor : eh , not much here . a very mild light roasted malt and the slightest hint of milk .
a : cloudy orange to beige color . with a one finger dense and creamy head
a : pours amber color with a orange hue . great off white head is soapy and sticks to the glass really well . good head retention keeps the appearance up for a good amount of time .
appearance : pours a hazy lemonade color with a meringue of a head ; good lacing
a : westmalle chalice , huge rocky foam head with excellent retention , the beer is a golden amber in color with a constant stream of bubbles to the surface
appearance : clear amber , one finger head .
appearance : ample head that recedes to cap but stays , deep rosewood coloring .

appearance : pours a very hazy copper color with a towering 5 '' yellow/cream colored head . it shows great retention . the head has some swiss cheese bubble holes that can be seen through the glass . lots of foamy lace is left behind .
a : straw , very clear . hardly a head or lace .
a : pours a cloudy burnt orange with a medium fizzy white head . spotty lace .
a : beautiful dark reddish brown brew with huge frothy head that crackles and pops till it settles down staying huge but becoming a soft rocky cap .

a : moderate pour yields a 1 finger semi-fine white head with poor retention , evaporating quickly into a thin white film . beer itself is a semi-clear bright orange . lacing is spotty and sticks closely to the brew it came from .
a : clear , and on the neon side of golden body with little to no head . it looks like a typical light beer only somehow more yellow .
a : pours a deep deep black , much more head than the other jewbelations , brown creamy head , nice amount of lacing that lingers on the glass

a : looks great at first : a vibrant amber with a skew toward ruby-redness . plenty of carbonation and a tall cap ( almost 2-fingers ) of mocha-beige fizz . good clarity , small streams of mini-carbonation , but the head dies far too quickly . gone in less than a minute , not even a hint of film left . no lace either . color and clarity are very nice but head retention is a big disappointment . too big to score above a '3 ' ...
a : looks like muddy water when poured into my glass . zero head .
appearance : light golden in color , very clear . big white head , but little retention and no lacing .
appearance : pours a slightly pale , thin-looking yellow with a bit of head .
appearance : depending a large 3-4 finger fizzy head that dissipates quickly into ring around the glass . appearance is a dark reddish brown that resembles mahogany .
appearance : poured a dark blood-red , but was crystal clear with ample light brown foam . the color was brilliant !
appearance : dirty , hazy yellowish-orange . lives up to its name . very little head , a quarter inch at most , and even that recedes to a small ring almost immediately . low carbonation .
a : not much head , what 's there disippates immediately . almost no lacing . fluid is a not-quite-opaque oily amber .

appearance : a thin , transparent , brown pour yields a three finger , medium looking , fluffy , off-white head with great retention . sienna pr bistre brown in color with higher levels of carbonation . head slowly fades to a good , full cap and leaves sheets of lacing down the sides of the glass . great lacing , but too light and thin a body , and the head needs to be darker for the style .
a : gorgeous presentation . pours a milky , ruby red color with a 1/4 inch light red head . mild lacing .
a : standard pour yields a clear , pale yellow beer is no head and no lacing . nice legs though . a beer this style with no head and no lacing is below average .
a : pours a clear golden yellow . large white fluffy head . plenty of carbonation . not the best retention but the lacing is very good .
appearance : ruby black body with a garnet khaki head . rich and slick looking .
appearance : deep golden color , little to no head , little lace
appearance : beautiful pure red body with huge off-white fluffy head . eternal lacing .

a : all of the times i 've had this on tap or bottled i never remember it looking this good . translucent golden amber , hazed but you can still see some carbonation . massive , dense stiff white head with amazing retention and thick streaky webs of lacing . ok , this was the best part of the beer this time around .

a : mag-freaking-nificent . how do they do this ? the head is slowly forming into one finger 's worth of beige head right in front of me . cascading bubbles are turning the body of the beer brown to black from the bottom up . the body is essentially black with brown edges , and not much else . that 's one of the creamiest looking heads i 've ever seen . there 's a ton of retention , too . and i have to say : there 's not one thing i can say negatively about this beer 's appearance .

appearance : gorgeous out of the nitro-can . apart from the initial explosion upon cracking the beer open , ( which always happens regardless of how long you let it sit still ) the beer pours entirely of head ... a thick , creamy head with the consistency of melted ice cream . starting slowly , the head dissapates in stunning fashion..as the carbonation creates a virtual explosion in the glass itself..and creates quite the visual effect .

a : pours a clear golden amber body . a massive 3 '' head nearly overflowed my tulip , even after a slow steady pour . the head hangs around for a little while , and eventually fades to a big fat blob in the center of the glass . lots of thick lacing coats the glass and stays for a while .

a : popping the cap on this beer caused had no discernible effect , so i may have poured a mite overvigorously . i was met with a monumental head rising up the glass ; verily , my cup overfloweth . this white , creamy head sticks around for aeons . five minutes later , only an inch and a half has dissipated . there is also a constant cloud of bubbles rising from the bottom . clear golden colour . scattered lacing conspires to look like a piece of derivative modern art .
appearance : another great-looking irish stout . opaque blackness , with a creamy light brown head that leaves a ton of lacing on the glass .
appearance : pours a translucent dark golden color with a thin fizzy head that dissipates almost immediately and leaves almost no lacing .
appearance : dark red colour , relatively low carbonation . three finger head dies down to nothing within four minutes .

appearance : master tmavy is served in a maroon-to-dark brown colour with a latte brown-coloured , rich and thick crown that remains for several minutes and leaves plenty of lacing on the master-goblet .
a : bight copper colour , thin head that dissapears very fast , but eaves some lacing .
a : black , light tan head , awesome retention & lacing .

a : pouring this beer is an adventure . make sure you are ready to spend some time . i poured into two large goblets to make the process move faster . regardless . watching the large thick beautiful head recede as it leaves lacing on the glass each time is a real treat . color is a bright golden color , as a bottle conditioned beer there is some yeast particles at the end of the pour . depending on your preference , your beer could end up quite hazey .
appearance : pours into a duvel tulip pitch black with a 2-finger , rocky , mocha colored head on top . it shrinks down to a thick , full cap that is unwavering .
a : deep , deep copper black color , very near opaque
a : pours a nice , clear orange with about a finger of white head . head recedes into a thin film with some decent lacing .

a : the bomber pours a light copper color with a nice fluffy eggshell colored two-fingered head . the beer releases massive carb bubbles , bigger than any carb bubbles i 've ever seen . this beer is almost hyperactive . results in inconsistent patchy foam , which happens to be a big turn-on for me ... indicates a very active , unique and lively beer . insane lacing everywhere ... all over the glass .
a : perfect . super dark with no highlights . thick 1 inch off-white head that slowly fades . awesome .

appearance : an aggressive pour got almost a two finger head of off-white foam . it quickly vanishes to nothing : not even a ring around the edges . hazy like a wheat beer should be but , a bit more floaties than i expect or want .
appearance : the beer is a cloudy amber color . the beer pours with a thick white head that settles to a thin white lace as the beer is drank .
appearance : clear yellow color , like urine
a : dark reddish orange color that looks like sun brewed tea made with too many tea bags . white flaking of bubbles on top of the beer are all that remain of the short lived head . low carbonation .
appearance : pale yellow , not much head , no lacing on the glass .

appearance : pours a very clear amberish red with a finger of loosely packed medium head . lots of bubbles rising quickly to the surface and tons of orangish light pours through this beer . leaves some great bright white lacing down the sides of the glass . awesome initial appearance .
a : beautiful beer . big rocky medium cell head , amazing lacing , and great cover over a deep red brown body of crystal clarity .
a : pours a dark brown , almost black color . a perfect two finger beige head forms and leaves nice sheets of lace . i would n't expect anything less from a beer on nitro .
a : dark black . nice beige/brown head . the head is pretty dense and very sticky . awesome looks !
a : no head ; carbonation quite low ; very clear light reddish orange ; no lacing
a : pours a non transparent milky orange with a very impressive 3-4 inch head . looks pretty damn good
a : the pour is black , flat , and generally about the same as the other versions .

a : one finger head of decent cream and good thickness . retention is good . colour is a hazy orange . textbook hefeweizen appearance - which is a good thing . sm : orange peel citrus ester hops . light cream . maybe some lemon esters . a moderate strength aroma .

appearance : a solid two fingers off head the laces and retains decently but sadly suffers from a fairly clear and yellow body . there is a bit of clouding , but i usually expect a bit more from a wit .
a : pours brown with a two-finger off-white head . head has pretty good retention and becomes rocky after some dissipation . leaves nice lacing .
a : pours a transparent dark brown with a thin off white head . not a good sign already . i was hoping for opaque black .
a : pours a clear yellow no head to speak of ( it 's better left in the green 40 oz bottle )

a : murky , dark brown with some light penetrating the edges but less toward the center of the glass . minimal beige foam head present . no lacing remains . this beer looks less like a beverage but more like something one would find in an old , unmarked bottle stored in the garage .

appearance : beautiful ! mahogany brown , brilliant clarity , and velvety tan head which lasted beyond expectation . score : 3 of 3 flavor : toasty upfront malt with a nice hop bitterness creeping in midway through the taste and riding out to the finish , nice transition , pleasant hoppiness in the aftertaste , well-balanced . score : 16 of 20
appearance : dark golden color ( very classic ) with very good head , but no retention .
appearance : brownish red with a large head .
appearance : straw colored yellow with about a 1/4 of an inch of head that dissipates quickly . surprisingly good lacing on this beer .
a : looked good . faint head that was white over blonde body .
