appearance : this beer is seriously the color of my urine . in other words , it is a transparent , pale straw yellow with a few small bubbles .

a : thankfully , the aroma gets this beer back on the right track with heavily toasted/lightly roasted malts , chocolate , coffee , caramel , smoke , and booze . what 's there is good , but the lack of foam is surely contributing to the lack of power and strength here .
a : pours a hazy grapefruit reddish brown with a finger width of faintly pink head that left good lacing . head is very velvety and creamy .
a : pretty much black with a nice and thick , foamy brown head .

a : poured amber nut brown from a 12oz . can into a guinness-style pint glass . in-between hazy and clear , with a beautiful , thick , two-finger head , and amazing sticky lacing . what an ipa should look like .
a : a light amber color , with a sub-one-finger head .
appearance : poured a slightly cloudy golden straw color . four finger plus white foamy/pillowy head . plenty of visible carbonation . lacing/
a : red , but filtered looking . i want more murkiness here ( like a rochefort 8 ) .
a : pours a clear , rusty-copper color with 2 fingers of light beige head . foam takes its sweet time dissipating , leaving plenty of sticky lacing all over the glass . looks incredible .
a : pours a light tangerine orange . pretty clear with good carbonation heads about half inch and off white . it 's leaving good lacing already . looks very `` west coast ''
appearance : thin , dark black brew with almost no lacing or head ; average looking .
a : beautiful clear red/dark amber color topped by a thick 2 finger off-white head .

appearance : pours a clear slightly orangish golden color with a very short-lived head that was gone by the time i got done smelling the beer . there are hardly any bubbles rising , so the head does n't stand a chance .
a : hazy amber with a small white head around the rim of the glass .
appearance : gorgeous opaque golden orange in color with a foamy eggshell white head .

a : perfect stout look : dark brown turning to black as it pours , a foamy finger or so of tan/brown head- thick and foamy enough that it began suspending drops of beer on top of it , a great sight to see . good head retention and lacing that coats the whole glass .

a : pours light brown into the glass , with a very pretty ruby luminescence when held to light . pale , tight-ish head collapses quickly to a ring . no lacing . moderately aggressive visible carbonation , with fairly large bubbles . the lack of any lasting head is disappointing for the style .
a : this beer pours a murky , milk chocolate brown . a 1/4 inch of khaki colored head sits on top . head disappears immediately and leaves no lacing to speak of .
a : thick , viscous , opaque . this is the thickest beer i have ever poured . big three fingers of brown head appears and leaves nice lace .
a : super black , in glass and on the pour . almost no head what so ever . what was there was dark brown and had good retention and left alright lacing . beautiful beer .
appearance : copper color with off-white head poured from a clear bottle .
a : no head and almost clear for its color .
a : poured into a glass same as i would any other beer , but this beer foamed up a storm . left half of the glass with an annoying head that would not recede .

a : there is so much yeast ! the yeast was crusted on the bottom of the bottle so i had to shake it up and let is settle out more evenly before opening the bottle . the body is an opaque , waxy amber and the head leaves a lot of lacing .
appearance : one-and-a-half-finger head right after pouring , but there 's no retention or lacing . color is indeed golden , and it looks rather thin . not too impressed .
appearance : pours much like soda , lots of fizz sound . pokey looking head fizzles down to nothing after only 30 seconds or so . clear amber color . light carbonation .

a : wow , if there is a picture perfect beer to look at for an iipa , kryptonite epitomizes it . a bit of haze probably from the cold but generally clear . a blending of golden/copper/bronze tones in the body all finished with a ridiculously creamy white head . the retention is spot on , as is the sticky lacing all over the glass . absolutely killer .

a : pure white head with no lacing with little foam retention . the foam that is present is thin and slides right down the sides of the glass . as for color , its a pale yellow identical to that of cheap generic apple juice . eventually , the head actually dissipates and you can see the yellow brew if you look straight down at the glass .

a : nice light , pours lively , bubbly at first with a good head that stays for a few minutes , surprisingly long for a lager . it 's very pale and strawlike in color ; and common on the bottle is sweet ! ! ! stubby !
a : deep brown , clear , without suspended yeast , with short cap of off-white head and little to now lacing .
a : pours a typical pale yellow , with a thin fizzy white head .
a : an attractive clear , burnished wood glow that fades golden near the edges . minimal lacing .

appearance : large foamy head with a tan top and enequal bubbles . with the first sip , the foam laces the glass nicely and then continues throughout . the color almost reminds me of a dark apple cider .
a : wow , awesome looking brew . huge pillowy fluffy head with extremely heavy lacing . rich golden coloring . got ta rate it a 5 .
a : dull , pale yellow . no haziness . weak head .

a : pours a four finger tan head of brilliant cream and thickness . i want this beer to have my babies . sm : whiskey ( shocker ! ) , alcohol , maybe some roast . the alcohol/whiskey scent masks the underlying notes . let 's hope the taste unveils them .
a : pours a dark ruby brown , with a full of-white head with great retention , some lacing .

a : really rustic cider orange that immediately makes me think this bottle might be a bit older than i 'd like , there 's a lot of barley wine character in the visual that furthers my suspicions . a modest off-white yellowish orange sticky bubble formation forms some weak but present lacing along the sides of the glass . a thin half-transparent film hugs the circular ring of the glass .
appearance : poured into a small goblet , brigand poured a hazy , golden hue . head and lacing were minimal to almost non-existant .
a : dark mahogany in color , very clear when held up to the light . nice frothy lasting tan head . some sticky lacing too .
a : wow , flawless . light straw colored cloudy brew topped with a white soapy almost meringue like head . some good carbonation . my first 5 rating ever .
a : bright straw body topped with a huge rocky white head to moderate retention leaving behind a heavy lace and creamy cover .

a : there was so much carbonation or alcohol bubbles visible that it was very hard to tell the color . from what i gathered it was a yellow-orange color that poured a very bubbly head . the head had good retention , but left lacing on the glass . there was also very little film left on the glass .
a : nice , clean light brown color

a : simply put , one of the prettiest dubbels i 've seen : deep ruby/garnet , excellent clarity at first ( when held to light , otherwise a browner drabness ) showcasing a cascade of small carbonation . later , when nearing the bottom of the can , an unfiltered haze takes over . not a tall head , but certainly a long-lived one : this 1/2 '' lid of ivory cream sat unmoving for the better part of ten minutes .
a : poured from a bottle to a tulip glass . had a golden yellow color and a mostly clear consistency . there was a thin amount of foamy head that quickly dissipated . no real lacing to speak of .
appearance : light yellow , with a little small head , however it was highly carbonated so it almost reminded me of the appearance of semi-flat soda .
a : copper with a finger of very dense ecru head that dissipate quickly . it looks very nice with the head . there is ragged lacing .

a : pours an opaque inky black body . a 1/8 '' light brown head fades quickly to a thin ring around the edge of the glass and a blob of bubbles in the middle . thin sticky strings of lacing are left behind . it looks a lot like a decent ris .
appearance : beer colored water . no head at all .

appearance : golden/orange/copper color . atop sits a white head that decides this is n't the place for him and splits . however , he leaves a little of himself behind with a decent lace that lets you know ... yes , this is a beer .
a : perfect ! pitch black with no light shining through . very thick mocha colored head that never completely disappears .
a : tan yellow colored beer , white head
appearance : appallingly weak head with soda-like carbonation ; large , plentiful , fast-moving bubbles in a clear , attractively rust-orange body .
a : poured a good deep black with a 1 finger dense head that was slow to dissappate .
a : appearance is really not impressive to me . pours a light golden color , slight whitish head .
a : medium yellow/gold color . minimal head formation ( this beer was served really cold ) and retention . decent lacing persists .
a : pours a clear dark red color under a billowing light tan head that took its time fading into a rocky film that left great lacing down the glass .
a : this was easily the best part of this beer . it was a dark brown in color with a 1.5 finger light tan head .
a : pours a dirty brown color with a large , tight , off-white head . the head quickly dissipates to a thin layer and leaves good lacing behind .
a : colour is the gold of a macro ( carlton draught ) . the head is decent and the lacing is good . 4

a : if i could score a beer on look alone , magnat would be a winner . the brilliant gold color has nice clarity , and very active carbonation from tiny bubbles . those bubbles hold up a firm pillow-like white cap that stays with the beer all the way down the glass . a very heavy lace is deposited in the beer 's wake .
a : black , slight ruby tinge , no head !
a : deep copper ( much lighter than the uff da ) , very light-tan head , very little retention , initial leg/lace . ( does n't look like a doppelbock . )

a : opaque cherry plum color . first pour gave me a lot of head . second pour gave me a full glass with two and a half fingers of fizzy pink head that falls quickly and leaves no lacing . some small floaties pushed around from the constant and intense stream of bubbles from the bottom of the glass . 3.5

a : about a finger of white frothy head bubbles up and dissipates quickly . the lager is a golden straw hue . there 's a small island of foam floating at the top as well as a ring clinging to the glass .
a : crystal clear golden yellow color , boarding on that neon cheap beer look . hardly any head . not the best looking beer .

a : hmm , did n't expect this . like the regular and coffee varieties , this one is n't very sexy . i dare say it 's worse . pours thick with a rich black color . just a half finger of medium brown fizzy soda pop head that falls at breakneck speed . no surprise to see no lacing . 4.5
appearance : true to style , a hazy golden color . sedimentation on the bottom is obvious . thin , barely there head that vanishes on the instant .

a : big pop ! on opening . pours a deep red gold and amazing clarity , 2.5 fingers of marbled ivory head with tight bubbles appears and never quite leaves , active small bubbled carbonation continually rises . nice lacing throughout .
a : pours dark brown , half finger head that recedes slowly , no lace , huge chunks , not very appealing
appearance : huge-floaty alert ! ! a gi-normous foamy , rocky head , great lacing , but , damn , tons of sediment . very authentic looking .
appearance : pours a cloudy amber color with a finger of off white head . this beer has amazing head retention with a solid layer of head remaining throughout the pour .
a : almost no head , almost coppery gold body , no carbonation visible . n : luscious , juicy melons . sweet watermelon and sour honey dew melon rinds . sweet malts
a : pours a very dark brown , black from a distance , with a thick , very creamy head , which leaves gobs of lacing and has great retention .
appearance : oily black color , no head , no carbonation .
a : clear , with little head
appearance : pure mahogany darkness . nearly black , completely opaque . beautiful beige head with sticky ridges of lacing .

a : poured hard into a pint glass this beer has a short white head that dissipates extremely quickly . the beer looks beautiful when first poured with a coppery reddish color and a bright white head .
appearance : tons of white fluffy head . large bubbles . caramel-orange in color .
appearance : pours a cloudy , orange-yellow body with a discouragingly small-sized , fizzy , white head . no amount of vigorous swirling can seem to resuscitate it .
a : little visible carbonation but a huge soapy head with excellent retention . golden yellow , transparent .
appearance : a murky burnt orange in color , poured smoothly and creamy , creme colored creamy head , stuck to the sides of the glass

appearance : the body has a deep orange amber color with a few random and tiny bubbles of carbonation here and there . its clarity is very good as well . the head is very thick and creamy with about a two and a half finger thick ness . it is light tan in color and very long lasting which makes for nice sticky rings of lacing on the glass .
appearance : poured into a duvel sniffter ; big deep brown with just a little light shining through ; huge dense tan head with excellent retention and lacing .

a : even a pretty aggressive pour ca n't generate much in the way of head on this one . just the thinnest off-white ring remains about half a minute after the pour . the beer itself is a nearly opaque dark brown with hints of burgundy . still appears pretty carbonated . not a pretty beer by any means .
appearance : pours a clear , very dark reddish-brown body with a moderately-sized , off-white head .

appearance : pours with a decent level of carbonation that aids the initial formation of a smooth 1 beige head that soon settles to a covering . the beer is has a lovely russet brown color that is perfectly clear . average levels of conditioning the head is reinstated when the beer is swirled .
appearance : nice gold color , just the slight bit cloudy , one-finger head that is just off white , good carbonation
a : this beer really starts off well , looks good , clear deep amber with a pillowy head that resuces to sticky lace .

appearance : murky brown-black glass with a small light tan head that collared but didnt lace . flavor : wow . a lot of the triple bock flavors , but just not condensed like the triple . very sweet with a syrupy taste , some spiciness that i think is hop induced . it has lots of maple , a good dash of rum ( with alcohol note ) and hints smoke ; complex study in dark .
a : pours pitch black . no real head to speak of but some slight bubbles and whisps of foam . standard barrel aged stout .
a : not good , seemed to be carbonated but there was no head . hazy light straw color
a : poured a bright , coppery , orange-amber color with a one finger head of tightly clustered bubbles which left little lacing and did not retain well .
appearance : deep and slight cloudy honey light gold . big white foam head fades into a thin white layer .
a : pours a hazy straw with a big foamy head .
appearance : a thick dusting of stick lace is all over the glass , good head retention with a nearly pitch black color to the brew .

appearance : the cork burst from the bottle and i thought it might be a gusher but very little foam spilled from the lip ; in the glass , the beer was all head , however , but eventually it settled down , with plenty of foam clinging to the side and very good retention ; needless to say , the liquid was a rusty cherry color capped by a pinkish lavender head
appearance : pours a opaque brownish-black with a little bit of tan head that quickly dissipates . there 's a bit of lacing as well , but overall this beer does n't appear to be super carbonated .
a : very dark brown body almost black with no head and no lacing . nothing too impressive .
appearance : a dark garnet , clear as a gem , with a beautiful frothy tan head that lasted for the duration . very good visual appeal .
appearance : dark for a hefe , cloudy , imho not as pretty as traditional hefe yellow
appearance : coal black with a light layer of lacing on top .
appearance : pours a magnificent obsidian , with a huge head that settles slowly and coats the glass with lace

a : dark amber , light brown . light carbonation continues to rise throughout . pours into a quarter finger , bubbly , white head . head quickly deteriorates entirely . some spotty lacing quickly retreats into the body of the brew .
a : pours the lightest of the light , transparent straw color that produces a tiny head with no lacing along the glass ... ( i ca n't believe i have to wash a pint glass after drinking this ) .
a : pours a nice amber hue with a small cream colored head . no real retention with just a few spots of lace .
a : clear , deep vermillion body with a ridiculously persistent , creamy off-white head . this head seriously will not dissipate at all . i ca n't believe that i 'm looking at an 11 % beer - wow .
appearance : dark copper , with a small head .

a : golden-amber with brown undertones . good carbonation . the only unfortunate finding is a minimal head and very poor retention . if this was an english bitter , served at the pub it would be spot on . with my fest-style beers i like a bit more cabesa .
a : murky , medium rusty brown with one finger of diminishing cinnamon-tinted foam head . no lacing remains on the glass .

a : pours a perfectly clear amber color with dark honey highlights against the light . the head is a fluffy off-white cap of foam that retains very well , leaving substantial sudsing down the glass as it recedes . as i sip , there are thick register marks left behind . outstanding .
a : almost no head , dissipating almost immediately . a somewhat murky ruby color
a : murky , almost purple in color . dark dark brown with faint ruby highlights . murky from the yeast .
a : black thick khaki head that does n't disappear quickly . thin layer of foam remains throughout lots of lacing .
appearance : black , with a big , brown , foamy head .
a : dark brown with a few highlights around the edges . visible carbonation brings up a mocha head .
appearance : amber , brown body with a very weak head , barely a finger .
appearance : pours an oily , slick black with 2 fingers of brown head . held up to a sunny window , no light makes it all the way through the beer . this stuff is black .
appearance : rich coppery brown with suspended flecks ; creamy off-white head that dissipated quickly , leaving no lacing in the glass .
appearance : golden maber color . poor head and no lacing . lager like

appearance : nice golden liquid with a steady , sparce large bubble carbonation . head is patchy , practically dead , less some large bubbles surfacing . it does however turn to a creamy lace as you start drinking it , and even has a slight stick to it .

appearance : muddy , dark brown ( not black ) body with large shades of reddish amber around the edges . a wimpy ( 1/8 inch ) , tight , light brown head sits on top and retains decently . does n't look at all like your typical nitro-head ; much looser and smaller . decent lacing .
appearance : crystal clear yellow beer ? the bottle says amber . this is a blonde/cream ale by the color
appearance : pours out a clear , light copper body with steady effervescence feeding a slender white head .
appearance : mahogany brown hue , with a thick off-white head .
a : the beer pours pretty much black with a dense , creamy khaki head .

appearance : after reading all the reviews talking about how syrupy this beer tasted i was a little surprised to see it look like a somewhat normal ipa . nice transparent copper color with a thin head comprised of tiny bubbles .
a : deep apple cider color . abosolutly no head . this beer is flat . it really just looks like wort in the glass .
appearance : 2.5
a : pours with low/no visible carbonation . no head .

appearance : over-carbonated , thought it was going to gush out . pours thick chunky off-white half a pint glass of head . orangeish amber color . particulates floating in the beer . do n't think i poured the sediment in but could have . flavor : major grapefruit up front , followed by some pine and tangerine . a weird solvently hair spray flavor lingering in aftertaste . decent malt backbone . high bitterness .
a : golden yellow not a thick head
a : golden straw pour , not really any head at all . almost yellow .
a : deep ruby red body that appears jet black for all intents and purposes . with a 1.5cm white head that leaves rings as it goes down , guinness has the appearance of a quintessential irish stout .
appearance : black with brown highlights , totally opaque . the first pour produces a perfect 3 finger head and the retention on this thing was ridiculous , it never came close to receding .

a : not what i expected . this was my first smutty ipa and i did n't read the bottle first . i poured from a bottle into my harpoon glass and immediately was disturbed by the floating sediment . it poured a nice golden orange color like any ipa should with a nice one finger head . not much lacing either . i stared at the sediment and finally decided to try the beer . i was not sure what was going on with it , but i tried it anyway . after my first sip i finally read the bottle and noticed it was unfiltered . that explains it , full steam ahead on this beer now !

a : very clear , light amber color with one finger of off-white foam head that diminishes to a large and persistent pad . heavy lacing remains on the glass and an occasional solitary bubble rises in the column .

a : upon opening , i get a huge carbonation crack . after an average pour , i 'm left with 1 inch of liquid and 5 inches of white head that does n't want to budge . the liquid is on par with miller lite .
a : pours a clear yellow with two fingers of white head that recedes into a thin ring with little lacing .

a : pours pitch black , completely opaque . huge 2+ finger , dark brown foamy head . dissipates in a couple minutes to a thin mocha froth . could n't be any better , this is a picture perfect looking stout .
a : pours near black with a thick , bubbly , dark tan head that slowly faded into a thick fuzzy film .

a : a very dark brown color . you would think it was opaque , but holding it up to the light makes the red highlights in the brew show up . there was almost no head at all even with an aggressive pour . there was not enough bubbles left after what little head was there settled to leave any lacing at all .
appearance : motor oil . a black hole from which no light can escape . body : silky smooth , full body .
a : the liquid is hazy , light golden , almost orange in colour . the head is white , thick and foamy , and fades slowly .

a : served in a goblet , it pours a clear and bright orangey-golden hued nectar , with a 1cm thick white pillowy head with good retention , and the lacing is nice and tight too . initial lively carbonation quickly settles to gentle streams of fizz .
a : one finger head that dissipates pretty quick . very clear golden color .
a : big and black with one-half inch of foamy dark tan almost brown head after an aggressive pour and left a moderate lacing on the glass .
a : pours a orangish brownish red color with a small off white foam head . there is nice amount of lacing . looks really nice .
appearance : clear orange in color with a 1 '' head that slowly falls to some rather large surface bubbles .
appearance : amazing , a nice burnt orange with plenty of head and great lacing .
appearance : coal black with a thin tan head .
appearance : a small amount of head , but this falls away qucikly . beer has a slight chill haze to it . medium brown in color with a lot a orange tint .
appearance : pours a beautiful dark black with a half inch head . curious light white setiment around the middle of the glass .

appearance : a dark jet black color in the body of the beer . there was a one finger head that last all but a second . there is effervescence in the beer but only visible by it bubbling on the top of the beer . the clarity of the beer is a black as the black hole .

appearance : pours a very cloudy , very dark amber with hints of ruby when held to light . looks gold around the edges . head is creamy and khaki-colored , and retains pretty well . looks sticky too - leaves spotty lacing . lots of large , yeast sediment floating around in the body . pete just found a strawberry skin in his . wtf ? p : 4.5 ; j : 4.5 ; n : 4.5
a : opaque brownish orange color . one finger of soapy head with less poor retention and some lacing . 4.5
appearance : pours a lovely copper mahogony color with a nice 2 '' head that lasts quite a while .
a : light to medium gold , with a very short , quickly dissipating head . average slow rising carbonation .
a : clear light copper . head , retention , and lacing are dismal . maybe it lost some juice in the growler is what im hoping .
a : flat , no carb ; golden yellow , very clear
a : a light yellow with a quickly fading heading , very unimpressive .

a : even on a very hard pour , little to no head at all . a mm cap on top , made of tiny little off white bubbles . not impressive . limited lacing as well . color however was good , a deep dried oak leaf brown , with the classic hazy color of an weizen .

a : pours a remarkably hazy pale orange color . carbonation is still visible , despite the yeasty `` fog '' . a thick fluffy white head rises magnificently as the beer pours . good head retention as well . this is a great looking beer .
a : pours a straw , piss yellow with a quick fizzy , shock white head that very quickly settles into into nothing and leaves zero lacing .
appearance : orange and copper colored beer give way to a massive 3 '' head that slowly dissipates . the head is an eggshell color with plenty of lacing on the sides of the glass .
a : pours a hazy translucent copper with a mild white head . average head retention , no lace .

a : hazy straw/gold body topped with a half-inch white foam head - this after a fairly vigorous pour . underwhelming retention and next to no lace . a good swirl of the glass produces a larger head , but it too disappears quickly without a trace .

appearance : amber in color with thin white head that remains for a while in a foamy layer across the top . 5 minutes after pouring you can still see little streams of carbonation running up from the bottom of the glass . half way through the beer , the head has mostly dispersed but leaves beautiful lacing on the glass .
appearance : pours nice and dark . very little head and what there is fades fast .
a : amazing looking beer . crystal clear with a light amber hue and a nice white head that stayed seemingly forever and left huge amounts of lacing down the glass . i am in love .
a : slightly cloudy amber with constant bubbles and a solid one-finger white head with lacing .
a : ugly large bubbles and clumpy looking melted marshmallow head that i do n't want to drink . pale clear gold body .
appearance : nice deep brown color with an offwhite colored head . but i wanted to see more of a deep red .

a : the cork came off with a slight pop , but no haze when looking into the bottle neck . a tall pour results in some wispy lacing and bubbles at the edges . there is n't much activity but upon closer inspection - there are some tiny bubbles cascading up the sides of the glass - very faint .
a : a nice , dark brown color with a thin head and ... massive chunks of yeast . was this beer supposed to be strained ?
appearance : pours a clear , pale yellow body with a fizzling inch of pure white bubbles , though it departs at a rapid pace .

appearance : first of all , it 's not red . it 's more auburn/cloudy dark orange in colour , and that was under substantial lights . an unusual colour anyway . poured into a tripel karmeliet glass with no head whatsoever , even in a scored glass , and it eventually settled to a very thin film . carbonation is also low , although the scattered lacing is attractive .
appearance : half-inch , frothy white head dissipates very slowly . pours hazy orange and leaves waves of lacing everywhere .
a : light yellow , tiny white head , 0.1 finger , a bit of lacing . sickly looking - not appetizing .
a : clear amber under a small white head . no lace or retention .
a : a very dark brown/red ; only barely translucent . when aggressively poured , it formed a creamy , distinctly tan , two-finger head . also leaves behind some great lacing .
a : cloudy reddish brown with a weak white head that is very short-lived .
a : pale staw brew , pours thick white frothy head . very poor retention .

a : medium amber with bright golden undertones ( looks extremely inviting ) . not much of a head to speak of aside from a thin lace . its mostly clear , but i can tell there is a lot going on in there .
appearance : pale gold cloudy , with a thin head .
a : pours a golden amber , almost brown , with a small smattering of bubbles as the head , but for most of the drink , it is headless .

appearance : there 's a reason no one really pours this into a glass . it 's a very very very pale beer , just not appealing looking at all with almost no head or the alternate of half the glass being carbonation .
a : a regular poured lager that has a quickly vanishing light foam head . based purely on looks , there are plenty of other choices that look more appealing .

a : pours a big billowy head , as high as 5 fingers , and settling around three . it 's white with bubbles of all shapes and sizes in there . the head has tons of texture as i keep it filled to the tip top of the glass , sticking at times almost an inch over the top . the beer is an amber/golden with pretty good carbonation . i 'd say this is a pretty attractive beer .
a : gold color with lots of yeast floaters and a distinct chill haze . poured a 1 finger whted head that dissipated to a skim . decanted continually . lacing washed down the sides of the glass .
appearance : pours a straw yellow color . poor head retention as a decent white head evaporates rather quickly and is eventually lost altogether . no lacing .

a : pours an absolutely beautiful vibrant yellow orange with an angelic haziness . a medium pour produces two inches of dense white head . poured into my weihenstephan glass . dear god , a half inch of foamy head is lingering . i can tell just from the look of this beer that it will be very good .
a : clear mahogany color , abundant and long-lasting cream-colored head falls into a thick cap with lovely lacing .
a : hazy orange with thin quickly disspearing white head
a : dark , opaque black-vermillion body with a lovely 3 '' head of frothy , creamy tan foam ; good retention and light lacing . great looking beer .

a : pours a nice ruby red color with lively carbonation and no lace ... but there 's a glob of sediment/protein/whatever it is floating around on top , and that 's just disgusting . had to remove before i could start drinking .

a : pours a deep , beautiful orange-amber with a huge , thick , sticky , off-white head . the whole scene is beautiful except that in lingering , the head wears on my patience for a sip . the beer is clear in color and hue , but dense and translucent . the head eventually subsides , leaving an inviting sticky lacing . this is a very inviting , attractive beer that pretty perfectly matches my idealized vision of an ipa .
a : dark , dim garnet with little head and good clarity .
appearance : deep brown , almost black . no head , and not any lacing .
a : very dark brown and opaque . hardly any head ( may need to bottle condition longer )

appearance : unlike most wheat beers that i 've tasted , this one does n't seem to be as dark or cloudy as others . it 's color is a vibrant yellow that 's a bit murky . moderate head formation with decent retention and minimal visible carbonation .

a : murky brown with some maroon hues intertwined , topped with a moderately fluffy and slightly off-white head . honestly , it 's kind of an ugly beer to look at , really nothing attractive here at all . it looks sort of like darkened pureed strawberries .
a : excessive head on an easy pour , the head dropped quickly , no noticeable lacing though there is the thinnest layer of persistent foam , light to medium amber in color - 3.25 ,

a : spot on . pours a very dark amber burgundy . around a 39 on srm color guide . this bottle gave a good two finger head that diminished after about 5 minutes to very fine layer that remained for the rest of the glass . lacing is moderate , but clings firmly in place , not slowly gliding down the glass .
a : dark black , so dark i can see my reflection in the beer glass . a nice head with some lacing as it is consumed .

appearance : a 1 finger foamy , bubbly head with poor retention . the color of the beer is a medium straw color with yellow hues . the clarity of the beer is hazy . the head is white and left some lacing on the glass .
appearance : pretty light golden color , almost clear with a light white head that does n't last long .
appearance : fine-looking murky copper body with a creamy , off-white head . plenty of lacing throughout .

a : bbl is near black , only showing mahogany highlights when held to the light . lacing is fantastic , with millions of microscopic bubbles frantically racing to the head of the brew . the head is also noteworthy ; its pillowy texture is marked by a cream color and everlasting retention .

appearance : pours a brilliantly clear caramel to amber color with a rich and creamy white head . the beer displays excellent head retention and a nice lacing along the glass . strong and lively carbonation bubbles race to the top of this beer , sustaining the head nicely . flavor : first to hit the tongue is a vinous alcohol character that is quickly followed by a wet paper oxidized flavor . some subtle notes of raisin and caramel , though these only last for a moment through the middle before the alcohol takes over again . the malt fades to the back as the alcohol heats up through the finish , leaving the beer rather hot and dry . if you look for it you can find some light candy sweetness trying to work it 's way into the mix , but the oxidation and alcohol dominate the flavor .
a : bright amber body topped with an enormous rocky head of excellent retention that leaves behind fantastic sticky lace and a thick rocky cover .
a : typical german lager paleness . head starts out vigorous but quickly fades to nothing .
a : opaque black . big fluffy rich brown head . as it dies down the retention and body look like a freshly poured cup of espresso .
appearance : pours a clear clean gold copperesque color . 1/8 inch bubbly head which dissipates rather quickly . appears almost flat .
a : it poured an odd green tinted yellow colored body with a minimal white hed that receded fast to a ring around the collar that supported a nominal almost non-existent lacing .
a : this beer is a reddish copper/amber with a very little head

a : pours a dark copper , with a 2 finger head that settles into a small cap , and leaves sticky lacing all over the glass . every drink leaves more lacing too . this is the best lacing i 've come across to date . off to a good start .

a : holy sediment batman ! honey yellow color with a thick bright white head with big diameter bubbles . nice lacing with some of those chunks mixed in . screw the burger i had with it , got my proteins in this thing .
a : blond color , small head of foam , manny bubbles are n't seen as commonly seen in this style ;

appearance : the bottle misled me slightly . it was such a departure from the typical look of a porter bottle wise . this produced some pretty big head which could have partially been because i poured it into such a large stein . very light brownish tint to the head.it was very dark in color similar to a cola .

appearance : a good amount of sediment is suspended in the orange amber beer . some thin , off-white head dissipates quickly leaving no spotting . much more orange in color and lighter than the 2009 .
appearance : pours a low mocha colored head that has decent retention , at least at first . the beer is a deep , dark brown in color .
a : really , you 're calling this a wheat beer ? heavily filtered , it looks more like a pale lager . brilliant light gold . a reasonable pour yields a 1.25 finger head and thin , mediocre lacing .
a : pours a slightly hazy copper-orange with two fingers of off-white head that recedes into a thin ring with no lacing .
appearance : pours out a clear , cheery-looking yellow body with a fluffy layering of white suds .
a : a classic golden yellow . a medium pour produces 1/2 inch of coarse white head that quickly fades to near nothing . average .
a : deep amber color , transparent , thick foamy head . almost perfect for the style .
a : beautiful deep amber color , almost on the verge of being purple . a nice 1.5 fingers of head that left some nice lacing .
a : cloudy light gold with a decent head that dissipates very quickly .
a : light yellow body with heavily carbonated head ( fast dissipation ) , and spotty lacing .
appearance : beautiful clear amber , with two fingers of white head that never seems to ever subside . good lacing . ca n't really ask for anything more in a pale ale .
a : shallow , fizzy head w no lacing
a : lime juice , with a one finger head off the pour that nosedives abruptly . very , very bubbly . is what it is .
appearance : nice foamy head actually gushed from the bottle as i opened it . the beer is a straw yellow with a foamy white head with staying power .
a : avg thin yellow color
a : ideal slim headed stout . pretty low carbonation but an amazing opaque black color .
a : a ruby , dark golden pour . pretty much no head , which was a bit disappointing . there 's not a whole lot going on here at all .

appearance : a warm , ruby pink brown body with a cappuccino foam head the is medium in size at the start and recedes to a thin cover . great lacing on the glass . has pretty good retention throughout . moderate to low carbonation .
a : pours a dark reddish color small head and slight lace down the glass .
appearance : looks suspiciously like a macro , then i remind myself they 're going for a pils-thing . nearly transparent straw-gold in the glass .
a : black pour with a frothy , bubbly brown head . great retention and lacing .
appearance : 4.5 now : 4.5 ( no change )
a : murky maroon with a small pinkish purple head . i think i got the bottom of the keg .

appearance : very dark brown with red hues lower down the glass . opaque throughout but so dark at the top of the pint glass that it was very difficult to see through . biege , tight creamy head , receding to leave good lacing .
appearance : poured a very pale straw yellow , this may be one of the lightest beers i 've ever seen . a 1 1/2 finger head disappears to a thin cap after the first swig . no lacing .
a : poured a big , cloudy and hefty looking ipa with a na dirty white cap
a : amber-brown with a slight haze ; fluffy , slightly off-white head ; great retention and lace .
appearance : mildly opaque golden orange , a thin head with little retention or lacing .
appearance : the beer pours a slightly hazy copper color . from a rough pour no head is produced to the beer so there is no lacing or retention to speak of .
appearance : hazy orange with some reddish tones . a wispy head and no lacing develops during the session . many carbonation bubbles stick to the glass .
a : looks like a dirty aquarium . golden yeller with solid dark orange yeast spots immersed throughout and some clingy lacing tan ... i mean tan lacing
appearance : lemony yellow ( duh ) i poured vigorously and got a decent head but it quickly faded into a slick on the top . not much lacing but i was n't expecting it to have much .
a : pours black with ruby highlights . two fingers of tan head that dissipates slowly . great lacing . n : bakers chocolate , oak , cookie dough and caramel .

appearance : pours a beautiful blood-orange-amber-blood orange-peach-brown shade of effervescence . head is about a half finger 's worth of froth , root beer-like foam . lacing is caligraphic . awesome .
a : nice orange color , great retention and lacing on this 2-finger head .
a : pours a light orange color , minimal fizzy head with no retention or lace . clear , no visible carbonation .
a : pours a pale amber with clear visibility . 1 finger of white head forms and dies to a thick chunky skim within a minute . some decent lacing .
a : golden amber cloudy body , a very typical pale ale colour , with a slightly golden white 1.5cm head that retains very well ... points there .
appearance : photogenic pour in hopleaf tulip - bright orange body , steady white cream head with full retention
a : poured a clear dark amber with a copper tint to it . nice tan head which all but disappeared after 30 seconds .

a : pours a nice looking clear amber body . 1/4 '' off white head quickly fades completely in a very short time . lots of tiny carbonation bubbles rise at a moderate speed . no lacing on the glass . looks like an amber soda-pop .
a : this was more coppery than amber . it poured with a thin , off-white head .

a : it has a very nice overall appearance . the beer is a clear amber color , with a pink rose-like tint to it . the head is about a finger 's width thick and is very fluffy . the head is white and leaves light lacing on the glass .
appearance : this beer pours a light golden straw color like most german lagers and gives up a thin white head .
a : standard porter appearance . mahogany , clear , ruby tint . not much head or lacing .
a : copper color with a 1/4 '' head that last the entire glass full . lots of lacing a carbonation
a : this porter beer has a dark color

appearance : in its natural pint glass this apa pours with a massive 4 finger head . which dissipates slowly into a rather white lacing that is a head in itself . the remainder clings to the glass with a thick viscosity . you already know this is a hoppy beer . beer pours perfectly clear . the color is dark amber with a hint of reddish hue . it gets a 5 this is just a fantastic thing to behold .
a : very nearly black . a bit of brown highlights and a two finger off-white head .
a : dark brown body with two fingers of light mocha head . retention is great and leaves loads of lacing .
a : pours a dark crisp brown , with a medium bodied head that has decent lacing
a : hazy yellow/gold . little to no head retention or lacing patterns . looks really thin .
a : pours a bright golden yellow with an amazing white foamy head

a : small 1 finger white foamy/fizzy head with medium retention . the everlasting collar of small bubbles is aided by active streamers along the glass . the body has a soft , glowing pale golden yellow hue and is cloudy . minimal sediment . the color of this brew is attractive but all other appearance attributes are merely average or below . no lacing at all .
appearance : the beer pours a clear golden coloration . the head was a thick off white and quickly resolved into a thin film .
a : single finger tan head with excellent retention lots of lacing . very dark . no light getting through .

a : really gorgeous brown amber . the thinner portions of the glass ( allagash glass ) change from brown to a ruby red . perfect tan fluffy head . 2+ fingers . i have n't even taken a sip and there 's already lacing going on ! this beer literally looks like the perfect winter warmer in my opinion .

a : opened with almost no sound and poured the same . absolutely no head , even with a vigorous pour . murky body , brown and ruby colored , no lace and no retention ( obviously ) . bleak , sad looking beer to be honest .
a : orange with a slightly orange white head with good lacing .
a : the pour looks innocent enough ... nearly black with a finger of off-white/khaki colored head .
a : clear dark orange body with one inch white head which had pour retention . leaves very little lacing
appearance : clear amber color with a very large slightly tan head that stays for a very long time and leaves lots of lace . many bubbles rising from the bottom .
appearance : reasonably light , straw yellow body with a head that flattens quickly but remains consistent throughout drinking ...
a : an exceptionally aggressive pour into my dfh snifter resulted in a jet black body with a half inch mocha colored head .
a : pours a very thick/cloudy red-amber with a small white head that fizzles out . some noticeable carbonation and decent lacing .
appearance : beautiful brown head had a little cascading action after it was first poured . the body is , unsurprisingly , jet black . lacing is very nice .

appearance : ah , easily one of the best aspects of this beer , and probably one of the greater things that make it a bit misleading as a whole ... pour is like dark coffee brown and shows some very dark ruby/mahogany highlights when held up to the light ; starts with an awesome thick , full and creamy head -- it freaking looks like someone just painted it in the glass it looks so damn perfect ; head has good retention from the additional gas ; body is nearly entirely opaque ;
a : pours a nice orange-yellow with 2 fingers of head that lingers a while leaving a great skim that hangs the entire session and some lacing on the glass

a : awful . i wish there was a `` 0 '' of negative value . bud light has the worst appearance of any beer . an old service industry trick for when you have a bud light and any other very pale colored beer ( pilsner , light lager , etc ) and lose track of the two is to take the lightest colored one to grab the bud light .

appearance : poured an extremely pale hazy yellow . this is probably the closest to white i 've ever seen in a beer . sitting on top the pale brew was an enormous four finger rocky head . it stuck around until the end and left some large splotchy lines of lacing .

a : pours a cascading tan colour that reveals a clear , light brown colour with tiny , tiny rising carbonation bubbles . it has a very think , creamy head that has excellent retention and leaves a nice sticky lace .
appearance : a hard pour gives a decent 3 finger , pure white head . body is pale yellow and clear . retention is rather good .

appearance : another non careful pour is invoked to stir up a few fingers of head . the beer pours a dark copper and amber color with two fingers of head . a few swirls in the snifter does n't produce very much lace . just a streak or two that trickles its way back into the beer . when held up to the light there is very little effervescence making me think that i 'll enjoy the mouthfeel quite a bit . the beer really is a beautiful color .
appearance : a yellow / amber colored body topped off with a fluffy white head . the retenion was pretty good and the lacing was abundant .
appearance : looked like an ipa , okay cool !
appearance : peach in colour with some slight chill haze and free floating solids .

appearance : poured into a 22 oz weizen glass . the color of this is amazing . an odd rainbow of deep ruby red to pale amber . a huge frothy white head sits atop and holds strong . lacing is excellent . a picture perfect beer .
a : when poured it had a nice thich one finger head that was a white color with little hints of burnt red that clung to the gobblet all the way to the bottom of the glass

appearance : very dark . darker than imaginable . no light seems able to escape its truly a visual experience to try to pick out color and light . the head is decent and well coloured , but fades quickly .
appearance : clear , mahogany color with a big , three-finger tan , fluffy head
a : half finger of poor retention . very thin and devoid of cream . clear yellow colour . sm : buttery and hoppy . treated butterscotch mixed with barley . a very light strength scent .
a : cloudy light orange ; billowy head ; great lacing and abundant carbs ; nice job !
a : very cloudy , dark brown . you can see particles in it as you pour . a good head that fades quickly to a thin collar leaving heavy lacing .
a : clear , light amber color with over one finger of diminishing peachy foam head . heavy lacing remains on the glass .
a : gentle pour yields a 2 finger frothy white head with very good retention . beer is an attractive , slightly cloudy bright lemon . lacing is frothy , thick , and ring-like and has great cling .
a : small , loose head . completely clear , yellow . high carbonation activity .
a : pours a translucent goldenrod , very much witbier like . fizzy soapy head , no lace , good head retention .

appearance : very dark brown in color..nearly black . the off-white head is the best quality of this brew ... even after a somewhat mild pour , the head grows surprisingly large in the glass and absolutely does n't dissapate . it just sits ... waiting for you to drink it . as you drink , the extremely frothy head leaves a tan lacing on the glass that does n't go away..it will eventually dry and harden to the glass if you leave it long enough . very impressive out of a medium-bodied stout like this .
a : bright gold color hints of orange , completely crystal clear , typical for a filtered beer but not really my cup of tea . a perfectly white foam head appears , and than runs for cover quickly .
a : slightly cloudy orange colour and excellent 1 cm head that lasts . 4.5
a : pours with a head that almost immediately dissipates , leaving zero lacing , very disappointing for an ipa , looked like cider .
a : cloudy light straw with three fingers bone-white head . no retention at all and absolutely no lacing . lots of little carbonation bubbles . pale and fizzy looking .
a : pours up dark brown , almost black , with red highlights . the tan head dissipates quickly .

appearance : down right black with about two fingers worth of head nice head retention very frothy and thick leaves lace from start to finish . aromas : dried fruit notes very small malt notes as well .

a : standard pour yields a 3 finger frothy off-white colored head with outstanding retention . beer is an opaque black and lacing is patchy and stringy with excellent cling . this one 's a real beauty .
a : slightly hazy golden yellow color with the stereotypically large saison-head .
appearance : fizzy and thin but surprisingly dark - a fairly deep orange-cinnamon . head retention is not very good .

appearance : pours with maybe half a finger of medium tan head . this settles extremely quickly , leaving absolutely nothing behind . the beer itself is a rich copper hue , very pretty . no sediment in the bottle .
a : light golden , international lager style . white foam , creamy , medium sized bubbles .

appearance : beautiful . simply one of the absolute best looking lagers i 've ever seen . from the insanely attractive dark gold with lively carbonation bubbles dazzling in the light , to the crystal-clear body to the thick , foamy , smooth white head ... this can easily make any other lager i 've seen turn its head , and even many ales . its color is similar to dortmunder gold , but quite a bit darker with a more amber/brown tinge to it ; in my opinion , much more appealing visually . i could go on and on , but really ... it has to be seen to be believed . downright amazing .
appearance : pours a thick , oily black with rich creamy dark tan head that has great retention . looks like it 's been dolloped on there really . just how a stout should look !
appearance : it has a dull golden color with a light head which dissipates almost immediately .
a : pours black with 1.5 fingers of tan head . poor retention , almost zero lace ; nothing special here . swirling the glass summons absolutely nothing . barrier , i am disappoint .
appearance : clear yellowish orange color with a 3 '' fluffy head that lasts . some nice lacing developed during the session .

a : the beer is golden yellow in color and has a light to moderate amount of carbonation . it poured with a finger high white head that quickly dissipated , leaving lacy patterns of bubbles on the surface .
appearance : crystal clear dirty blonde hue with a thin ring of lace that struggles to stay . fizzy looking .
appearance : pours a deep brown/almost purple color with no head ( is that normal ? ) . no lacing .

appearance : pours a jet black with a beautiful , creamy , red tinted 2 finger head that dissipates within a few minutes and leaves some lacing around the edge of my glass . this stout is pure eye candy .
a : a light watery yellow color with slight low carbonation .
appearance : a bright straw yellow with virtually no head and no lacing .

appearance : poured into a duvel sniffter ; beautiful orangey gold with a nice foamy off white head , spotty stickage , good retention and great sipping lacing ... the most impressive thing about this one was the northern lights looking haze in the beer itself ... wild
a : pitch black , it has a bad head with weird bubbles and an extremely thin lace .
a : pours a very clouded straw yellow with two fingers of white head that thins to a half finger and hangs around for the rest of the experience but leaves no lacing .

a : clear pale amber body with a voluminous 3-finger white head that 's dense and creamy enough to rise half an inch above the tulip 's rim without me worrying in the least about overflow . retention is stellar , and there 's plenty of pillowy lace left all around the sides of the glass . maybe a half-shade darker than most pilsners , but i 'm not complaining at all . gorgeous beer .
a : medium amber with two finger white head . very average looking . ok carbonation . nice sticky lacing looks good .
a : pecan brown , with next to no head .
a : pours a rustic yellow with some orange tinting , decent clarity but not perfect . about a 1 finger head forms and holds for a bit before falling to a skim . good lacing .
appearance : pours golden yellow with a thing white head . very `` macro '' looking in the glass .
a : pours amber and pinkish with a decent frothy , lively cap of white head which recedes to a ring . no lacing .
a : golden with a haze . large chunks of yeast . white foamy head with decent retention .

appearance : poured a syrupy , black liquid out of a majestic looking 16.9oz bottle . topped with a pillowy head colored a faint tan . definitely does not skimp on the head , as it presents a full three fingers . lacing is thick and abundant .
appearance : crystal clear . no head . not to style ...
a : a hazy , golden color with fizzy head that dissipates quickly .
a : pours a pale yellow with a tinge of orange to it . less than one finger of foam leaves pretty quickly , leaving just a little lace . this looks almost macro lagerish .
a : slightly murky amber with big-bubbled white 2-finger head even with a slow pour with good foamy retention and a coating of lace down the glass . exquisite .
appearance : big head almost three finger head poping up then hollowing out . looks pale yellow , but opaque .
a : pours a dark amber brown with a thick off white head .
appearance : golden brown with a head that quickly vanished . little to no laceing .

appearance : arrives inappropriately in a shakers pint glass , a hazy , turgid , muddy brown , truth be told a fairly unattractive hue , and the glass does it no justice , but i 'll forgive that as its likely a glassware shortage because of the release . though it arrives sans head , faint wisps of white lie on the surface , and a thin solid collar and faint smatterings of glittery lacing suggest a half finger of head had crowned this one . carbonation is very faint and very slow .

appearance : a completely opaque brownish body with a one-and-a-half finger tan head that 's incredibly dense , has good retention , and leaves a sheet of almost solid , rocky lacing down the side of the glass . the highlight of this beer .
a : amazed by its clarity . it 's beautiful . a few bubbles . rich mahogany and burgundy . especially lovely when held up to the light .
a : cloudy gold orange into a american shaker with very little head that went away quickly and did n't leave any lacing .
a : pours a translucent black body . massive head . hmm .
appearance : pours black with one finger of tan head that quickly fades . minimal lacing .
a : very nice dark orange/red looking beer . fully transparent . head is tan and ridiculously strong and lasting . very creamy looking head .

appearance : flat . free pour yields a small white froth ring around the surface of the glass that disappears immediately . by the way , if you 've read the tomme arthur interview about his flat beers , you may remember he pointed out that the beers his company unprofessionally sent to the market before they were carbonated were `` lightly carbonated '' and that the carbonation only `` expressed '' when served at room temperature . i did not refrigerate this beer , and it 's simply flat . pours a dark brown / black . 1.0 for appearance because i can see that it 's ( unintentionally ) flat , and i do n't want it to be flat . the same principle whereby i 'd give the beer a 1.0 if its color were green , even if it had a nice big head .
a : a gold color fairly clear with a really white head that fades fast
appearance : pours a faintly-hazy bold yellow with heavy carbonation ; moderate foam with light lacing .
a : typical straw yellow pils color , clarity 90 % , minimal carbonation . small white head that quickly dissipates even with an aggressive pour .
appearance : pours gold with just a hint of red , and a thin head that fades relatively quickly , but leaves a bit of lacing .

appearance : weihenstephaner hefeweissbier poured into a weizen glass delivers a wonderfully opaque , unfiltered gamboge colour , a sparse amount of bubbles ascend to the magnificently massive cream-white crown which withstands the fall of time in all its majesty for a long period , leaving its inheritance in the shape of sporadic lacing -- hail to the king !
a : pomegranate-colored appearance ; no head ; no carbonation
a : very lightly hazed light gold body underneath a finger of persistent , delicate white foam . absolutely outstanding retention and good lacing . great looking bspa .
a : urinary yellow color , poor foamy head ;
a : this brew poured a deep orange/amber gold color . small head formed and left very minimal lacing on the glass .
appearance : pale straw color , super clear . lots of carbonation . small soapy head that disappear really quick .
appearance : not promising . disturbingly pale , ginger ale-colour , with an appalling head for a wheat beer . cloudy , lots of small bubbles .
a : mostly clear coppery color with an excellent frothy white head . head retention throughout the experience with white lacing down the glass .

appearance : pale golden body , nice white head on the pour fades quickly to reveal a scum laden surface . looks like a cheap canned light beer . below average conditioning , i wonder if that is because of the plastic bottle , it shouldnt be considering the use of fizzy sodas i guess . bored , tired and flaccid looks .
a : pale golden , clear body under a good sized white head . good lace and retention . a really fine looking beer .
a : bright transluscent gold with a gleaming white head .
appearance : pours a dark brown which ends up as nearly-opaque in the glass . head is medium-dark tan color which recedes leaving interesting bubbly lacing . not a bad start .

a : the second the cap was off , the foam came pouring out of the bottle , and i mean pouring . i grabbed my glass and saved as much as i could ... .then the foam burst over the sides of my glass . grrr ... ok , i 'm back . body is a cloudy tangerine bronze with a bit of sediment . head was a towering mess of sticky froth but since has died down to a gentler wisp with a nice ring around the glass . webbing is covering all wides of the glass where the foam once was .
a : really pale yellow color ( just like budweiser ) . fully translucent with a really strong pure white creamy looking head with really good retention and lacing .

appearance : a one finger light tan head that is creamy with some retention . the color of the beer is dark brown with dark garnet hues . the clarity of the beer is almost opaque . there is some carbonation bubble visible on the bottom of the glass .
appearance : pours a cloudy yellow orange color . dense white head with decent lacing .
a : this pours a clear tea color with two fingers of cream-colored head that laces well .

appearance : a dark , imposing body that only allows a handful of dull ruby light to pass through . a big , sticky , toffee-colored head endures until the bottom of the glass , leaving terrific lacing on the way .

a : few beers look better to be than guinness . if i imagine a dry stout in a glass with a thick head my mouth begins to water . the contrast of the light , faintly tan head pressed against the near-black ruby red body .
a : thoroughly black body topped by a faint hint of brown foam that disappears straightaway and leaves minimal lace . boring .
a : cloudy deep yellow/orange hue , no head , no lacing

a : crystal clear pale yellow gold , about almost 2 inches of head , lots of effervescence . i 'm not sure i 've ever seen a filter saison , not a good first impression . looked more like a pislner ...

a : bitch black body with a nice thick creamy head ; about half an inch , which has excellent retention throughout the consumption of it . looks exactly as a good stout should . b : very nice here , i was pleased . caramel , coriander seed , light hints of honey , and burnt sugar . there was also a underlying sent of crisp winter air .
a : very pale yellow , thin white head .
appearance : the head is quick to form but then it drops down to only a very thin ring of lace . no stickage on the glass . nice clarity in the dark amber brown color .
a : the body is a clear copper colour suggesting a vat conditioned macro filtered brew . head is foamy white and it dwindled down to an unremarkable thin lacing . nothing exciting here .
a : thin head on a hard pour , the color is a dirty coffee brown , minor spots of sticky head - 3.00 ,
a : toasty malt , dark fruits , clove , caramel , and soft alcohol .
appearance : brown with ruby edges . a tan chunky head . looks like a porter in the glass . again , i have no baseline for comparison .
a : it pours hazy brown with a glowing tone . the head is large , white creamy and fluffy , it stays for a really long time , and leaves some lacings .
a : pours a very cloudy apple cider colored body . 3/4 '' off white head slowly fades to a thick film .
appearance : impenetrable black with a porous khaki head and folds of lacing .
appearance : pours out black and thicker looking , but sits perfectly still . no head and no life . flat beer .
a : pours dark brown with minimal khaki brown head . retention is moderate and lacing is minimal .

appearance : clear and golden orange with bubbles popping up . a foamy white head developed up to about 2 1/2 fingers , at which point i had to start pouring . medium retention and some lots of lace .

appearance : served in a sierra snifter ( what did you expect ? ) , pours thin , with a chestnut color as it comes out pretty atypical of an imperial stout . some glug and gurgle , and a classic one-finger head with a ton of big bubbles on top . head dies quickly , though , leaving only a white rim around the glass and some of those impressive bubbles . beyond the chestnut color , this is a very dark , almost black beer .

a : the 12oz bottle is quaint and says to use by october 2006 . the body of the beer is opaque and the head is the lasting , frothy tan you would expect of a good porter . unfortunately , as i immediately found out , the molasses make it look better than it tastes . additives - booo .
appearance : normally , black as night without much head . if you look at it when it 's ( very ) backlit though , it has a bit of a red hue .

a : dark brown/ruby red and clear . beer looks very thick ! no carbonation . shocker , i know . there 's more bubbles in the toilet after i pee . only way you were getting bubbles out of this bottle was to pour it from 3 feet .

a : poured an absolutely enormous head that continued to balloon out well after the pour . hugely carbonated , like champagne . dark straw , light orange in color , perfectly clear . tons of lacing down the glass .
a : pours a clear , golden atutumn color with a hint of red . one finger head .
a : deep opaque ruby color . poures a 2 finger off-white rocky head with good retention . laces in rings .
appearance : pours a slightly cloudy light amber color with two fingers of off white head . the head disappears completely leaving no trace .
appearance : the beer could n't manage to produce more than a centimeter head even with a violent pour . it left behind almost no lacing , and was an ugly translucent light yellow .

a : a really nice deep dark black with a nice thick caramel colored head that did n't stick around long enough . this was a beautiful beer when first poured but the head retention was poor . laced on the glass very nicely though .

appearance : when i opened the bottle foam started pouring out . this occured for at least two minutes until i started pouring . pours a hazy golden color , the clarity improves after the carbonation has diminished leaving a sparkling beautiful brew . the beer is topped with a thick merengue-like head that is persistent , and leaves nice lace .
a : mid-yellowish in tone . looks good while being poured . lots of small bubbles .
a : slightly cloudy yellow , great carbonation , a frickin ' four finger head ! ; astonishing lacing
a : this beer poured like a big black oily nightmare . only flaw was the lack of substantial head .
a : pours a beautiful hazy dark amber/brown color . a two finger head forms and sticks around . sticky lace is left in rings down my pint glass .
a : poor head retention and not really a head . little micro rising carbonation . but a beautiful black cherry color . dark but `` transparent ''
a : reddish amber , tan head quickly falls into a minuscule cap , which then again quickly disappears completely , no lacing .
a : dark , but not super dark on the pour . a 1 inch tan head that fades at a decent pace to a bubbly lace atop the brew . ok.
a : pours a light , cloudy straw color . a little bit of golden-yellow in the right light ... a dull yellow in the wrong light . one finger of frothy white head , with poor retention .

appearance : served a very deep brown body with an inch to two inches of lasting , faintly beige foam . yes , nitro beers can look pretty , but , so do glossy beer adds in magazine and they do n't taste great either .
a : pours a caramel color with a foamy head and a column of bubbles that rises steadily from the bottom throughout the course of the drink.. lots of thick , sticky lacing on the glass .

a : moderate pour yields 1 finger of rocky snow white head with poor retention . crystal clear very pale yellow liquid . very carbonated . better retention and darker yellow color with less fizz would be appreciated .
a : black as cola with barely any head at all . no retention and minimal lacing . it 's not much do look at and overall unimpressive . very little carbonation , even for a stout .
a : pours a clear light orange color with loads of bubbles ascending the glass . head is nice which clings to the sides nicely the entire way down .
a : rich chocolate brown color with a gigantic foamy coffee colored head .
appearance : clear copper color with 1 finger of head that fades slowly to a thin cap with little lacing .
appearance : straight pour into a pint glass . the color is straw yellow . two fingers of white head dissipated quickly to leave a thin lacing and ring of foam around the edge .
a : dark brown beer with medium tan head .
a : light amber color , with a head that dissipates quickly leaving lacing around the edge .
appearance : clear , yellowish-orange color and nice head .
a : pours out with a thin head dissolving into a small amount of lace . amber colored with quite a bit of chill haze .

appearance : it pours out and looks very nice . it 's a deep , slightly hazy ruby red color with almost 3 fingers of pillowy off-white head . it reduces fairly quickly but a nice amount of lacing remains , aided by ample carbonation .
appearance : 5 |

a : one finger head of poor thickness , no cream , and poor retention . colour is a nontransparent copper . not so appealing . sm : caramelized malt , some corn of all things , and some light floral notes . a moderate strength scent .
a : pours a clear red-orange with a finger of off-white head that fades into a thin ring with no lacing .
a : inert ; very thin head ; no lacing ; light yellow

a : the beer is a sort of dull and cloudy orange in the snifter . there is almost no head . there is one tiny piece of foam clinging to the glass , and it does n't look like it will last much longer . the beer looks forlorn .

appearance : initially pours a cloudy deep brown color with a rich rolling to the foam as it settles like it does when you have it poured from the tap . it settles within a minute to leave a thick creamy tan head atop the opaque beer . lots of lacing .

a : dark brown and initial observation is that this is a very thin consistency . not your typical stout viscosity . head is a bit weak , but with an aggressive pour yields some nice almond colored foam , which quickly dwindles . minimal lacing .

appearance : an extremely dark brown that is nearly black capped off with a one finger espresso colored frothy head that stayed around for quite some time . lacing remained for the duration of the beer . a very nice looking beer indeed .
appearance : cloudy , hazy & pale yellow body with lots of bubbles but a very thin ring that quickly dissipates .
a : pours an opaque black with a fizzy short lived tan head . no lace .
a : very deep walnut brown . poured with a good frothy tan head and leaves plenty of lacing .
appearance : extremely dark , opaque body . two-finger head the color of espresso froth , leaving irregular spots of lacing . simply a gorgeous brew .
a : wow . surprisingly good look to this ... could be this be the first decent leinenkugel brew ? thick tow finger head that simmers into a thin lacing . great dark brown color .
a : pale yellow golden beer : it does n't exactly look special .
a : the beer is a deep ruby red with just a slight brown hue . the head is decent with a beige color that does not leave much lace at all . the color though , wow !

appearance : unfortunately for me , i am underwhelmed so far . the beer barely had any off-gas when i popped the top and poured a pretty cloudy slightly brownish yellow color with practically zero head after an aggressive pour . there is no lace whatsoever and the beer looks like brownish lemonade in my glass ... still and just ... . ( blech ! )
appearance : pours a very deep , dark brown..entirely opaque . relatively thin brown head to start which recedes to a thin tan ring , and eventually disappears completely .
a : pours a cloudy straw color , does n't look really enticing , a little muddled . head is bright white and fluffy .
a : pours a light , cherry-soda red ( pink , really ) with a light red ( pink , really ) head .
a : dissipating , bubbly head ... clear , pale golden color ... light carbonation ... kind of doa
a : poured a cherry juice red with a half finger pink head that left pretty good sticky lacing .
a : pours a clear golden orange color . a small white head forms , and recedes in a second . light lace is left behind .
a : pours very dark brown , nearly black , producing a light brown head about 2 '' , which has good retention and leaves some lacing .
appearance : pours very black with a thick , billowy , light chocolate brown head that sticks around for a little bit .
a : hazy green-golden body boasting four fingers of head in a weizen glass . head dissipated very quickly and leaves no lacing .
appearance : really nice dark gold , slightly hazy beer with lots of steady carbonation and a gorgeous whipped cream stark white head with great retention ... very attractive beer
a : pours black with a medium brown head with good retention and concentric full rings of lace .
a : pours a crystal clear light amber color with a slight head that fades quickly .
appearance : golden with a smoggy haze . i 'm diggin ' the head .

a : pours a slightly hazy golden with some orange highlights , capped by two fingers of white head . retention ca n't even really be called poor , as the head almost immediately dissipates and does n't even leave any lacing in its wake .
a : pail yellow ; an inch head that quickly fades .
a : this beer pours straw-colored with a large white sizzeling head . dissipation is fast and leaves only some lacings .

appearance : orangy and light brown with not a lot of head , but an extremely long lasting lace , with remarkable bubbles along the rim . little carbonation . swirling to get aroma brings out a disappating foam .
a : poured a very clear amber brown color with hints of burnt orange and a thin veil of white bubbly foam which left little lacing . an odd looking porter to say the least .
a : pours pitch black with an almost no-exicting pale brown head that sets into no lacings .
appearance : golden hue with a nice sticky lace
a : deep beautiful red . tiny white head that quickly fades . good .
appearance : dark brown , slight haze , a few bubbles but not really any head

a : bazzam ! this beer does not like being kept under 4 degrees in the fridge - it came bursting out of the bottle like it had something to prove before the slightly tan head died down to nothing . body is a cloudy honey orange .

appearance : pours a two finger medium looking fluffy white head that makes a ton of noise . retains decently , but soon fades to a thin wisp with carbonation decorating the top . golden tangerine yellow in color , cloudy , with lots of carbonation evident . head quickly fades completely and leaves zero lacing down the glass . slightly disappointing .
a : poured a very thin white head . had an unfiltered golden color .
a : pours a clear golden color with off-white head and lots of lacing around glass . looks good .

appearance : yet again my trusty duvel goblet fares well and proves to be the right choice . the body has a murky brown tinge at first , but on closer examination and strongly backlit it has a deep ruddy red body that glistens with a deep blackcurrant hue . a purple-pink head fizzes into life during the pour but quickly effervesces into nothing . flat appearance is not helped by the low levels of carbonation . average appearance .

a : poured a 3 finger light brown fine head with great retention . brew itself is near opaque except for the slightest bit of light shining through . lacing is excellent with layers marking where i drank .
a : a huge ridiculous head ! it poured what i would call a cloudy amber .
a : pours with a small , off-white head that is quickly diminishing . the body is very clear and medium-dark amber . spare lacing . not off to a great start here ...
appearance : pours a raven black color with a huge tan head that has a degree of permanence to it ; sheets of lacing line the chalice

appearance : avant peche appears dark brown in the glass , but does n't come too close to pitch black . dark ruby hints around edges . 2.5 fingers of light tan head forms that has great lacing and retention .
appearance : the hazy honey-colored liquid arrives with a modest cap that disappears in a blink without leaving a trace behind
appearance : dark straw gold , light lacing , little carbonation- a little dark for a saison

a : hazy golden yellow color . steady stream of carbonation rising from the bottom of the glass . three fingers of creamy frothy head clumps together as it falls and leaves tons of irregular lacing . great retention . a true work of art . 4.0

a : pours a surprisingly dark burnt orange/brown with about 3 fingers off frothy off-white head . the head recedes quickly into a thin ring with no lacing . not very attractive for a hefeweizen , which ideally should have a solid head throughout .
a : pours clear golden with a really large creamy head , that stays for a long time , leaving great lacings when it sets .

a : apple cider or dark champagne gold and very clear . speaking of champagne , it has an insane amount of carbonation which keeps a half-a-finger nail of white head on top for a while . i must stress , this might be the most racing carbonation i have ever seen in a beer . it does not look like a fall pumpkin brew .
a : looks like carbonated piss . very yellow with a half inch sparkling white head that disapears , not too quick leaving no lacing .
appearance : translucent and clean , absolutely no minuscule particles here . pale golden color with a thin white head which quickly completely disappears , very quickly . no lacing .

a : wow , thick is really thick . too much of a cliche to say it pours like motor oil ... but it does . not jet black but very dark and murky . very low carbonation , no real head to speak of ever . some stray swashes of foam decorate the top of the body and guard the sides of the glass .
a : brilliantly filtered , rich orange moving into shades of brown , off-white head with good retention .

a : it pours exceptionally beautiful . without the aid of light it seems to be a dark brown but when held to a lamp it really glows . a nice cherry , burgundy hue appears with the light shining through it .
a : inky black and dark as night , as always .
a : dark brown/gray , opaque with a thick beige head . some carbonation to the top
appearance : not too pretty . hazy ( pectin haze ? ) . quickly dissipating head . straw colored beer .

appearance : pours into my victory becker black in color with a 3-finger high loose-bubbled light tan head . it drops to a thick surface coating never once showing the surface of the beer . lacing comes in sheets all the way down the glass .
a : nice slightly hazy gold with about 2-3 fingers of white , frothy head .

a : it 's crystal clear with an orange hue and multiple lines of carbonation . the head is sizable , and very creamy . really it looks great ! the head lasts a long time , and there 's a lot of lacing .
a : hazy gold/orange with an obscene white head with really good retention .

a : pours a clean golden/amber with a half inch of head that dissipates quickly . moderate carbonation and spotty lacing . n : very good pumpkin aroma along with caramel and light spices ( mostly nutmeg . )
a : what a pretty beer ! poured into an over sized wine glass , a gorgeous cranberry color .
appearance : very clear yellow with thin white head . belgian abbey styles do n't usually look this clear to me ...

a : pours a funky orange-red-copper color . extremely active carbonation bursting out of the bottle into the glass causes a flash head . disappears with no lacing . left with an ugly colored beer and thats it .

appearance : spot on . color was a perfect dark amber/reddish tan , head was low ( appropriate to style , but also possibly because it was served too cold -- this was the pub 's assumption that american 's want frozen beer ) .
appearance : absolutely amazing in its appearance . almost neon-yellow in color , this is an opaque , cloudy beer . pours with a great head that leaves a thin lacing on the glass .
