a : classic guinness : black body with ruby highlights and a waterfall of roiling nitrogenation . the creamy finger of foam stays around forever , creating an almost artificial-looking image of beauty . there 's just no use denying it : guinness is gorgeous .
a : poured a medium light amber color with a one finger , off white head , nice lacing around the edges
a : the beer is a light gold color with no head at all and no lace .

a : pours a thin ( 1/8 '' ) dark tan/cocoa head of low density with little retention . espresso brown body , low light transmission . light coffee brown at the edges . not really a particularly attractive beer , nor entirely appropriate for the style ( head too dark and too weak ; body too light ) .
a : poured into a wide snifter with decent head . dark and packed with unflocculated yeast .
a : dark brown with 1.5 inch brown head that stays the whole time you drink it .
appearance : 750 ml bottle that is corked and caged . orange golden color with a frothy white head and great retention .

appearance : color is light cherry red with a slight haze , though you can fairly easy see through the beer . with an easy pour the head forms a light foam of off-white with low but good retention . flavor : malt sweetness is most prevalant upfront with some candy sugars mixing in as well . the sweetness last but for a moment before a moderately strong alcohol spice kicks in . the alcohol carries the flavor through the middle but does allow those dark fruit notes to push through . finish is biting and dry with hop bitterness and more alcohol hitting you at the back of the throat .
a : poured amber brown with ruby highlights that had no head on the top and no lacing sticking to the glass .
a : nice blonde colour , head dissappeared almost immediately .
appearance : 5 |
a : looks both relatively and absolutely good . the color is full and light amber . there is even some lacing which is impressive in any light beer .
appearance : a brilliantly clear whiskey-brown , a creamy khaki-colored rocky head , lots of lace , small amount of granular yeast on the last pour
appearance : very light golden color with some thin white foam ; with the yeast the beer became golden and cloudy .
a : looks good , light lacing , nice head .

a : without the benefit of light , this looks like a muddy , cinnamon-tinged cocoa ; held to light , it glows ruby , a bourbon-amber - really lovely ! one has to look closely , but the smallest carbonation flourishes here , rising to a creamy khaki lid that - no joke - lasts for over an hour . fragmented lace in fiery licks up the glass . possibly the prettiest bw i 've seen , and that 's saying something .

a : i am in love with this beer 's appearance . the head is soft , creamy , and robust . it looks like it should be on a guinness . the color is light golden with nice carbonation and screams refreshing .

appearance : awfully clear for a witbier as it 's you can still see fairly concise blurs coming from the other end of the glass . the body boasts good carbonation , that is clearly visible through it 's brassy coloration . it started with a good finger of head , and it left very minor lace and did not retain well .
a : no fuckin head , no matter how hard i tried . medium brown color , but looks watery . 3.5

a : this beer pours a beatiful opaque black color that reminds me of ink , beatiful drinkable ink . so dark i ca n't see through this one . this stout pours a huge coffee colored head with alot of lacing .

a : pours a clear amber with garnet tones in the glass . the beer is well-carbed , with a frothy 2 '' head filling my hair of the dog tulip . it retains surprisingly well , leaving thick , sticky lace down the sides of the glass as it goes .

a : deep dark ruby ( yes irish stouts are actually ruby coloured - they just look black ) , poured a perfect 1.5cm white head that leaves rings to the glass as i drink - a perfect looking dry irish stout .
a : nice true black/brown color that does n't let light through . it pours a robust tan head that maybe reduces to half an inch in size over time .
a : amber/brown beer with a light head with great retention on top . impressive .
appearance : poured with a pretty tan colored , fizzy head that dissipated fairly quickly leaving no lacing . the beer is pitch black and does n't let any light through at all .

appearance : augusta saison pours a very hazy dark caramel color with straw colored highlights . about a finger of eggshell white head reduces down to slight lacing . seems a little dark colored for a saison .

a : first off , love the bottle , it stood out on the shelf and is the reason i grabbed it in the first place . the pour is n't bad either ; light , copper brown in color with a big thick head that lasts for awhile . carbonation seems high , lots of bubbles rising .
a : poured with a huge , frothy , fizzy white head that slowly diminished to 2-finger size . very good lacing left on the glass . body is a light orange color , and hazy . an excellent-looking beer .

appearance : very frothy not a gusher but the carbonation was very active during the pour . the head retention was the best i have seen in a long time . the sediment stayed to the bottom the bottle to yield a semi-clear reddish orange hue .
appearance : poured a coppery orange body , with a beautiful fluffy white head . nice suddy lacing .
a : again , when i held it up to the light , i saw a lot o f yeast ( i think it was yeast ) floating around and it did n't sink . smell and

appearance : i poured this into my samuel smith pint glass and what came out of the bottle was this really beautiful dark amber color with a hint of honey to it . it would have been nicer if the head of foam was just as good as the color . all i got was something like half an inch of white bubbly foam that dissipated away completely only after 30 seconds . of course that left no rings or even lace for that matter around the glass .
a : pours a very light gold color and crystal clear . decent sized white head that dissipates quickly . there was good glass lacing though .
a : pours a clear , rich amber body . the head is a bit disappointing , rising to a finger and then vanishing pretty much entirely . no lacing , no collar ... . weird .

appearance : pours an absolutely crystal clear reddish amber into a mug . the head is slightly off-white and massive . bubbles cascade up from the bottom constantly refreshing it , but eventually it falls to a significant surface coating . lacing exists in sporadic sheets .
appearance : massive white head on a deep red body .
a : dark . dark , three finger , espresso bubble colored head . thicker than most stouts .
a : nice amber , burnt orange color . a little bit hazy . head is off white , but not much retention . weak lacing .
a : pour is dark , almost all black but with some red hues . the tall creamy tan head sinks surprisingly quick and leaves ondly faint lacings .
appearance : this beer looks great it is almost fun to pour , it has a black color with a cream head that you could build a sculpture with .
appearance : pours a very pale golden color with little carbonation and lacing .

a : i 'm getting tired of figuring out how to say `` orange '' in a different way every time i review ales so i 'll just come out and say it has a slightly cloudy orange body . there was a white 1cm head which has dissipated to nothing ... looks like a cider .
a : pours a slightly hazy orange color , not too much head , very little lace down the glass
a : rich , off-white head with good persistence and lacing . amber in hue .
appearance : deep copper with a slight haze . off white pours thick then fades quickly .
a : the only thing that comes to mind when looking at the beers is : someone poured out 1/2 a bottle of corona extra , filled it up with 1/2 water , and slapped a `` light '' label on the bottle .
a : pours like a pale ale with a light red hue . not very much white head , and it disappears leaving no lacing . boo .
appearance : clear gold with a fast fading head .
a : looks amazing , such a deep color that i would call blood orange with outstanding head retention and killer lacing . thats a 5 for look for sure .
appearance : cloudy orange/yellow color . huge white head with some staying power .

appearance : pours with barely even an a centimeter of head , that obviously did not lace or retain . the body however boasts solid carbonation , a nice orange/bronze color and boasts decent carbonation . clearly unfiltered by it 's cloudy appearance but not riddled with sediment .

a : pours dark brown but not quite black , capped by a two finger , rich brown head . retention is good for style/abv and a good deal of lacing is left on the glass . not sure how an imperial stout could really look any better .
a : pours a dark red with a full off-white head with great retention and mild lacing .
a : absolutely clear golden color . minimal white head . looks like an american macro .

appearance : hazy orange with a very active sticky head that laced the glass . took some patience for the head to die down to get the rest of the beer in the glass . flavor : mild taste with a firm hop/lemon aftertaste that seems to evaporate on the tongue . some cider notes in the aftertaste .
a : pours a dark , opaque brown that is almost black . a small , bubbly tan head forms that recedes in a second . light lace .

a : green ! 5 oz pour into a fw tasting snifter , hazy , white bubbly head , rose about a quarter of an inch , then settled to a ring of bubbles . high marks alone for the color , since there is very little to compare that too .
a : dark brown with some light beige hues , a little too light for me for an imperial stout . a bubbly and thin off-white head dissipates rather quickly and does n't leave any impressive lacing .

a : clear , honey colored body with an overall reddish tone to it . absolutely no head , retention or lacing ( obviously ) whatsoever . fairly boring but somewhat acceptable for the style , although i 've had plenty of wild ales with some type of head .
a : uh oh . where 's the yeast ? looks like this beer has been filtered . looks like a lager
a : has a cloudy and golden look with a thin white head .
a : pours an off-white 1 finger coarse head that dissipates quickly . beer is a near opaque but clear , dark cherry color . lacing is spotty to non-existant .
a : hazy orange-yellow with a faint trace of head on top . would n't have enough head to lace if it tried .

a : pours a murky amber that glows a burnt orange against the light . an aggressive pour produces a flaccid pinky finger of off-white head that vanishes quickly , leaving only a streak or two of lace . hmm . i prefer clear beers with gorgeous , sticky lace . it 's fair to say this is below average on ipa appearance .
a : poured from a bottle to a mug . had a light brown color and a completely thin consistency . almost no head or lacing to speak of .
a : clear copper colour , nice head , loads of carbonation
a : like dirty motor oil almost perfectly black with medium head with a nice brown color .

appearance : pours a dark brown that is fairly transparent featuring ruby red highlights and a 1/2 finger foamy off-white head . decent head retention with minimal lacing . not exactly what i expect an imperial stout to look like .
a : dark orange copper body , with an off white head . its a little hazy throughout .
appearance : great looking beer : very dark ( almost black ) body topped with a large tan brown head that lasts very well and leaves superb lace .
appearance : pours a medium brown color . there is virtually no head at all .
appearance : light pale , yellow . clear and fizzy with little head .
appearance : golden and translucent . bubbly and appeared like a pilsner , even miller lite . medium , white head that dissipated slowly .

appearance : as poured the beer is a hazed golden peach color with a 1 head that recedes slowly leaving large patches of foam clinging to the sides of the glass . the head persists well and sipping creates some leggy lacing that clings to the sides of the glass . for most of the beer the surface is covered by a layer of foam and there are leggy patterns of lacing clinging to the sides of the glass .

appearance : into a pint glass , this beer pours a very pale golden color . when held to light , only the faintest hue of yellow can be observed . an active head of white rises to and soon settles to a thin lacing on the surface . carbonation is moderate to high , and remains active throughout . who knows if poland is being funny when they print o.k . beer on the cap . i found it humorous .
appearance : peachy sunset brown with an utterly pathetic head that barely forms and then quickly runs away .
a : auburn red color , with a great creamy head . crazy head retention and lacing , so it looked lovely in the glass .
a : copper in color , good clarity , with a dense , tan head that never really dissipates .
a : pours pitch black . a two finger tan head forms in my tulip glass . rings of sticky lace are left clinging to the glass .
appearance : dark copper color with a large off-white head that leaves behind pretty thick lace .
a : pours a pale yellow with a fizzy two finger width head that fades quickly . no lacing .
appearance : clear crisp golden color with a 1/2 inch thick dissipating white head . no lacing .
a : brownish-red , like a dark brown ale . lots of ruby at the edges . head is virtually nil . foam ring after the fizzing stops .

appearance : 8.4 ounce bottle brewed in ceres , ca ... interesting . i picked this one up bevmo in chino hills today for $ 4 something a bottle . the beer pours very thick . it looks like used motor oil . dark chocolate syrup brown . no head and no carbonation are observed . when looking at it like wine , it has nice legs . swirling brings no head . lots of sediment in chunks the size of sesame seeds .

appearance : holy smokes ! this is by far the most unnatural color for a beer i 've ever seen . like others have said , the color is best described as `` grape soda '' . thin , half-finger head that quickly dissipates with very little lacing .

a : pours a surface non-finger head , very thin and without cream . retention is nonexistent . the colour is a dark amber , certainly non-transparent . the beer is lively and appealing in spite of its poor head . sm : caramel , dark fruit esters . not detecting the roasted malts claimed by the label . it 's a strong scent .
appearance : pours thick , syrupy & black . sturdy cappuccino head , that seems smaller than it should be .
a : ruby red , 1 finger head , no head retention or lacing ... although good carbonation
appearance : urine .
a : pours a clear golden color with a nice white head that fades to a large ring and leaves some lacing on the glass . should be cloudy but it 's clear as day .
a : pours a clear dark brown with light brown head . great retention that leaves some decent lacing around glass .
a : pours a hazy gold with no head whatsoever . displays a brilliant , shimmering golden hue with faint orange highlights when held up to the light . if this had a head , it would look great .
appearance : a slightly hazy orange-gold body capped by a little over two fingers of creamy off-white head that fades slowly and leaves excellent sheets of lacing .
a : pours a clear , deep copper with a tight head . head disappears quickly . so far , this is n't looking too kolsch-like .
appearance : poured dark honey amber color , with visible carbonation . two finger pillowy khaki head with very good retention . very nice lacing .
appearance : hazy yellow with a head that builds up and disappears in seconds . no lacing whatsoever .

appearance : pours a dark , deep brown . a little light comes through around the edges to show the burnt carmel color . the tiniest bit of tan head fades quickly to a few wisps . no carbonation clinging to the glass , no lacing .
appearance : pours a bit syrupy and quite opaque . more solid-like particles poured out at the end . no head or carbonation whatsoever .

a : pours a pitch black with an beautiful inch thick head . the head looks like thick dense melted espresso ice-cream , and the texture is almost that . about a half inch of head float like a raft on top of the brew all the way down to the last sip leaving behind thick sheets of lacing that coat the whole glass .
appearance : it has a nice fully black color to it . it has a nice dark tan head that dies down slowly and leaves nice lacing .
a : poured a dark brown with maroon highlights with a very thin khaki colored head and left very little lacing sticking to the glass .

a : what the fuck ? ! ! ? ! is this beer ? this is lighter than most of the bmc lineup . lightly yellow tinted clear . one finger of frothy white head . the retention is actually pretty good and a good bit of lacing is left behind . 1.5

appearance : reasonably pretty beer , though the massive head with soap sized bubbles detracted from it a bit . way over-carbonated . i could barely pour it without developing a 3 inch head on it that refused to go away .
a : a very dark brown , but not black like some stouts i 've seen . no head or lacing , and frankly does n't look that thick .

a : clear gold body under a gorgeous inch of creamy white foam that rises well above the rim of the glass . tons of ultra-fine bubbles rise through the beer to reinforce the epic ( for a half-pint , at least ) head . terrific .
a : reddish , amber color . small head with no retention or lacing .

appearance : a dark brown pour makes a small , medium looking , beige head that quickly vanishes to a splotchy wisp and ring . black body and no carbonation evident . a slight ring remains with zero lacing at all . lacking for the style in this department .
a : pours a deep red , with a tan head
appearance : pours a really cloudy amber color with an orange hue . there is a finger of fluffy white head that fades but leaves some nice lacing .
a : pours a dark dark brown , with an off-white head ; looks like a porter !
appearance : this light , crystal clear beer poured into a pint glass , and left a decent , one finger head on top .
a : light clear gold , constant bubbles , big white head .
a : copper penny red . what i found interesting was the head that started thin and ended in the same exact thinness . i mean , this thing went nowhere .

appearance : free pour yields a two and a half inch fluffy offwhite head that dissipates very slowly and sticks all over the side of the glass . pours a translucent , orange-ish dark red and leaves streaks and walls of thick lacing . looks great .

a : slightly chill hazed , slight bit of sediment made its way into the beer , but otherwise clear and dark , sort of cola-like with just as much head and just as lasting . sort of dissapointed with the look of this one so far .
a : gentle pour yields 1/2 finger of creamy cream colored head with good retention . slightly hazy amber copper color . good lookin ' .
appearance : an amber colored body with a loose thin head that recedes just before i finish the beer . the retention is n't terrible , it just does n't last long enough .
appearance : light copper color , thick initial head , dissipates in a fair amount of time , nice lacing .
appearance : dark amber in color , lots of head , good retention .
a : no head at all . a clear yellow colour . sm : fresh barley and orange esters . a moderate strength aroma .
a : pours a hazy light orange color with some amber hues . provides a loose off-white foam head with moderate retention . provides ample amounts of lacing .
a : pours a murky brown with no head whatsoever . bubbles bluff like they might stick around but disappear quickly .
a : dark orange/burnt red with a 2 finger white head . lacing is left as the beer is consumed .
appearance : pours a dark , opaque brown color with a 1/2 '' tan head . it is short-lived and leaves barely and lace behind .
a : poured a high clarity amber . quickly receding head , but decent lace ring around the glass .
a : murky , dull orange body that is n't particularly pretty . head is very white and gets up to two fingers , but recedes within the minute , leaving behind scant lacing .
a : hmm , looks like a primary fermenter on day 5 . more particulate action than i wanted . hazy orange hue - 1.5 finger head - lacy
a : the pour was an almost artificial looking reddish-amber . like a cherry or raspberry syrup , almost . head retention is poor , as is lacing .
a : a mountain of spongy and porous froth fills the glass with a fizz . a clear , bright golden hue . it 's gon na take a while before i can drink this . tons of sustain and lacing .
appearance : pours dark and thick , like black syrup . has a great brown two-finger head which lasts for a minute or two and leaves some nice lacing behind .

a : this hefe was off to a bad start . the beer had a yellow lemonish color that was n't as cloudy or heavy looking as most of the good hefes i 've tried in the past . nice looking two finger white head but it dissipated really quick , boo . some lacing was present .
a : light yellow
appearance : pours into a shaker pint glass a clear ruddy gold . a head forms initially but drops instantaneously leaving barely a trace of itself . disappointing .
a : pours a dark red , with a thick , full , frothy white head , great retention , leaving medium lacing .
a : huge 3+ finger creamy head . a murky red/brown color , almost cider like . leaves a thick , lined lacing
a : pours a golden orange with a fizzy average white head .

appearance : served in a tulip glass , which i guess is closest to the thistle glass wee heavy is supposed to be served in . pours a very deep brown that allows barely any light to shine through . head is almost nonexistant even after a relatively hard pour , but can build to a quickly dissipating one finger that is off-white .
appearance : a pale golden color with minimal head ... nothing special

appearance : poured in a pint glass it showed a completely translucent amber with a good half finger of tight froth which lasts and left a solid curtain of lace . looks just great , but the excessive clarity is a bit unnerving . flavor : subtle . a gentle dark malt characteristic which ( i swear to god im not kidding ) reminded me of cask ale from england , but lacking the complexity and mouthfeel entirely . there is also a yeasty quality that surprised me at first , but the taste is lost quickly in the glass . hard to give a good description , theres so little here , but whats here is pretty good ! the maltiness just comes through , but very little actual sweetness , which is the only indication of hops .

a : first of all the head on this beer is simply amazing . the head does not even want to recede ! the beer itself pours a rich brown color and billions of tiny bubbles rise to the top . as expected from a head this powerful , it laces the glass and does n't go away .
appearance : nice purple label with a golden thumbprint . pours with very little head ; dissipates quickly . color of deep golden straw . not too clear .
a : straw yellow , clear and surprisingly nice lacing
a : dark brown/red with some lasting carbonation .
appearance : heavy red-orange brown color , clear with significant carbonation , moderate foaming with clean pour , with only resdiual foam lingering around the rim .
a : dark brown and muddy . zero head or lacing .

a : poured into a tall glass , had a nice golden color and a fluffy , but rapidly vanishing head . the head and slick completely disapears after about 2-3 minutes , leaving just a golden drink that looks like cultured apple juice with a few bubbles in it .
appearance : pours a golden translucent color . the fizzy white head dissipates almost immediately leaving no lacing .
appearance : black , no head , no carbonation
a : lame straw yellow .

appearance : a beautiful looking beer , one that invites a drink . nice cloudy golden color ; liquid sunshine . a really nice thick head with fragile brewer 's lace ringing the inside of my pilsner glass .

appearance : hazy orange copper glass that poured with a very enthusiastic head ( all foam actually ) that stayed and started to dry before fading , leaving clumpy lace . flavor : same worty under-attenuated sweetness with a overly firm hop that gives an acid burn . the underlying taste is fairly nice with some orange blossom and honey notes , but there isnt enough hop flavor to balance all the hop burn .
a : pale straw color . poured a 1 finger stark white head that dissipated quickly to a broken skim . decanted lightly . laced in inconsistent thin rings .

a : pours a rich golden color , somewhat hazy . truly lovely when held to light . two fingers of soapy white head . lacing is a mixture of streaks and spots around the glass . film fully covers the beer . this is how a beer should look .
appearance : pours a cloudy golden orange with a very small ivory colored head . it is short-lived and leaves no lace on the glass . swirling creates some spotty lace .

appearance : lightly hazy , this beer poured a light amber-orange color . it sometimes appeared a muted golden yellow . the white head was coarse and behaved like it belonged to a soda . it was very fizzy and dissipated in the blink of an eye , leaving only the few bubbles that appeared on the surface due to the sustained bead . there was no lacing .
a : murky brown body with a few centimeters of head and no lacing .

a : pours orange brown with a slight offwhite head , about 1 finger , that dissipates fairly quickly . noticeably murky and appears that it may be bottle conditioned , but can not determine this as i did not see a layer of yeast at the bottom ( perhaps i poured it all into the beer ? ) .

a : pours a slightly cloudy dark brown/copper color with an inch and a half of fluffy , foamy head . a fairly large amount of carbonation is evident . gobs of head on this one ! the lacing just goes on and on and on . amazing .

a : large 3 finger head , khaki colored , foamy/fluffy and long lasting . the body is orange-amber and lightly hazy at first . clarity improves after warming . tattered half sheets of lacing from the head with even better coverage from the body .
appearance : black as night , thick head , motor oil , this makes guiness sorta look more porterish than stout-porterish . surprising . thick brown head that goes to a decent foam with good lacage .
a : pours a dark red brown . very light colour for a porter , looks like a dunkel . mild off-white head .
appearance : very dark , black look . when held up to a light , there is a beam of amber shining through the black void of this beer , and you can see some yeast floating around .
a : pours a turbid autumnal ruddy orange with limited ethereal head production . a translucent sheet of taupe foam remains . spotty lace .
a : black with ruby hues , not a lot of head , but a thick cream collar forms .
a : perfectly clear light amber body with an inch of creamy white foam . pretty good retention and lacing . lovely .
a : a bit dark for a barleywine . pours like a nut brown . the head is soda-like and fades quickly , leaving no bubbles . there are legit legs in the glass , however .
a : pours a murky brown with no head , just a smattering of ochre bubbles .
a : light pale yellow with a head that dissipated in seconds
a : the cork came out with barley a pop and the beer pours a flat deep brown with maybe 3 or 4 bubbles of head that left a few dots of lacing down the glass . highly unimpressive .
a : crystal clear golden yellow , no head , pretty fizzy
appearance : the beer has a dark amber coloration . the head is thick creamy off white coloration . there is some nice staying power with the head . there is thick lacing going down the glass .
a : there is nothing quite like a properly served guinness for appearance . it consists of a black body and cream mocha head separated by a cascading mixture of the two .
a : nothing short of beauty . great `` mahogany '' color , carbonation bubbles as much as the eye can count . great 2 finger head , exceptionally pretty . expectations are high .
appearance : pours a clear pale golden hue with a ( surprising ) three-finger head ! it 's soapy white and actually leaves lacing down the glass ! whoa !

appearance : golden with a slight haze and a massive stream of carbonation rising from the bottom and all sides of the glass . the head filled up the entire upper 3 inches of my tulip , leaving behind thick sheets of lace as it slowly settled into an thick and dense half-inch head .
a : largest , most fluffy , sticky head i 've ever seen . absolutely amazing . sticks around for ever . murky brown color . great lacing .
a : rich clear gold . big fluffy white head that sticks around for a while . large carbonation bubbles streak to the surface . a beautiful looking beer , but not your typical shade for an oud bruin .
appearance : pale , clear yellow , just struggling for some color to distinguish it from water .
a : reddish , cloudy , with little head that went away quickly .
a : it had to be poured out extremely slowly so i was already anticipating some over the top carbonation . once it was finally in the glass , it was quite dark with a one finger light tan head .
appearance : slightly hazy brown beer . barely any highlights of other colors shine through . minimal head that is slightly off white in color . big bubbles sit atop the head .
a : a hazy orange/lightbrown color with a light brown head
appearance : the first that struck me was the bright , deep golden color . nice full coarse head that did n't disapate until the last few drinks .
a : very dark body , thick mocha head . very carbonated .
appearance : nice . a clear golden straw-like color . nice foamy head which hangs around for a while and some nice lacing left over . nice , as if i did n't use that word enough .

a : extreme cream coloured head that is easily over 3 '' . leaves a lacing comparable to , if not better than , duvel . the liquid is a cloudy amber colour with white chunks floating throughout . i would dive right in , but i have to wait for the head to settle .

appearance : pouring a stunning deep amber with a massive head of a few inches that is very frothy . the head is like when sugar and water come to a boil remarkable . it has a very thick lacing to it .
appearance : opaque black bodied beer with a khaki/tan head . head is about one and a half fingers high . receeds into heavy lacing on side of glass .

a : pours a nice golden hue with a crazy overdone foamy mess of a white head . it takes forever to pour a pint but does leave mass amounts of lace . brewers need to get these heads under control as they are a pain in the ass negative points for that .
a : ruby red , pink head , nice lace .
a : dark brown color ; almost black with no light coming through . poured a 3 finger fluffy chocolate head with excellent retention . laced in thick sheets . truly exceptional .
a : cloudy brown body topped with a small creamy head that quickly dissipates leaving no lacing and a thin creamy cover .
a : a slightly hazed bright rich golden hue . not much head on this body . starts with a one finger head , down to a rim pretty quick . some lacing .
appearance : pours a golden brown with orange highlights . the head is 1.5 '' tall , white , with good retention . lots of lace that allows no window space .
a : pours a dark brick read color , almost brown . a two finger beige head forms with good retention . the foam gently recedes to leaves some patchy lace that crawls along the glass .

appearance : see above . jet black pour with a huge tan foamy head . flavor : spicy yeast driven esters with some cinnamon and clove background notes . moderate warming alcohol . a bit of background roastiness ( i think ? ) that gets washed over by the yeast driven spiciness . background earthy hop flavors layer under the yeasty character . finish is clean and dry .
a : pours a nice frothy head , lots of bubbles but not much head retention after things settle and minimal lacing on the glass .
a : rich amber color ; produced a foamy head that was at first impressive , but did n't last too long . no lacing to speak of .
a : this was a very pretty , dark , coppery garnett color . it poured with a fizzy , short lived , faintly pink head .
a : very dark and very nice to look at 2 finger light brown head that goes down to a nice sheen and pretty collar . the lacing is almost solid up and down the glass very nice to look at .

appearance : pours with just shy of two fingers of light tan head . this settles slowly , leaving behind great lacing , and eventually falling to a thin coating of foam . the beer itself is a muddy brown , with slight reddish hints . essentially opaque . fair amount of sediment in the bottle .
a : maple syrup brown . totally transparent . no carbonation . great big tan head , solid lacing . n : lightly roasted malts , sweet grains , a touch of caramel .
a : pours a hazy golden color . head fizzes away almost instantly and there is no lacing to speak of .
a : pale in color , almost clear in the stream coming from the bottle . the head is fizzy and dissipates almost instantly . pretty standard so far .

a : lacing didnt quit on this one . amber color with a puffy meringue head- high grades here because this is a picturesque esb . n : fresh bakery aroma and biscuity . mild hops and malt as it warmed some .
a : clear straw body ; one finger of reasonably creamy white foam . pretty good retention and lacing . nice looking euro lager .
a : deep burnt orange , pours a 1/2 inch head with great retention and leaves some lovely lace behind .
appearance : pours a bright gold color , slightly hazy , with a thin sticky lace . it has those dollops that i love to see in the lace .

a : crystal clear golden pale yellow hue . gigantic stark white head rises quickly to the top of my glass . it 's actually thick enough that as i finish pouring it stayed on a 45 degree angle while setting up . after falling it leaves a tiny amount of soapy lace and a thin cap .

a : wow.. it looked a little flat so i poured aggressively and the reddest , black-cheery massive frothy head took over the glass and after 5 minutes of sitting has only died down a tad . what a monster looking beer .

a : much darker than i was expecting from a `` brown ale , '' more like a porter . a little dark mahogany can be seen on the edges when held up to a bright light . even a fairly aggressive pour failed to produce even a full-finger of head , and what i did get dissipated quickly .
appearance : streams of carbonation rise to the top of the beer , a gigantic stark white head , slow fades , with big bubbles .

appearance : a thin white head that has no retention . the color of the beer is a medium gold color , with copper hues . the clarity of the beer is clear to brilliant . there is effervescence in the beer .
a : pours a muddy amber color with hints of yellow . head literally fizzles like soda pop and disappears almost completely ( like soda pop ) .
appearance : surprisingly light and golden for a beer of this strength . would probably score this a 3 were it not for the floaters .

appearance : pellucid dark sunburst copper red body sits quietly underneath an off-white head rises and stays stiff and firm . head soon relaxes though and rests at thick . the tan colored head has a rustic charm .
appearance : neon orange-rose , made all the more striking by how clear it is . thin head that dissipates quickly but leaves some legs .
a : pours a nice looking dark red color with a cream colored head that stays for a pretty long time . also leaves excellent lacing on the glass .
appearance : very hazy and only a small head . rusty orange . not very inspiring .
appearance : pours muddy rusty hazed almost black no head .

appearance : a one finger foamy creamy white head that has very poor retention . the color of the beer is a dark straw color with brown hues . the clarity of the beer is clear with some haziness . there is some carbonation in the beer , i hope that is a good sign .
a : it looks like bud concentrate - basically is looks even more like piss . it also looks like the piss of someone who is dehydrated . the head looks like piss of someone who ate a lot of protein .
a : dark coppery body with three fingers of white fully head . retention is amazing and leaves loads of lacing .

a : a super muddy brown hue . opaque . bubbly head definitely has hints of brown in it . virtually no lacing , but i can definitely see some legs down the sides of my glass . first time in a while for that . besides the legs , not the most inviting looking brew .

appearance : very light straw color , which looks like solid yellow that has been watered down . the pour left a bit of head that succeeded in capping the beer , though promptly disappeared . looking at the beer , i could see numerous bubbles marching towards what used to be the head .
a : really dig the look here . mildly aggresive pour yields a two finger light brown head that is extremely persistent . dark brown/black body that is opaque but for the rim .
appearance : golden yellow with a light almost khaki tone . white short-lived head .
a : pours a golden orange with a white sticky head that leaves behind beautiful lacing . very clear with visible carbonation .
a : bright , shiny blood red , white head , nice lacing , neat small glass

a : the color is black with ruby red highlights one the bottom of the glass . it could be seen , in better light i suppose , as a deep brown . the brown head does not stay very well at all and eventually dissolves to nothing .
a : orangy amber with 2 finger white head and medium carbonation
a : bright yellow with a hint of orange . a small half finger head quickly dissipated to nothing . it seemed a bit under carbonated .

a : pours a clear , golden body capped with 4-5 fingers of off-white head that completely fills the glass off of a small pour . the dense bubbles recede evenly , leaving streaks of lace down the glass as they go .

a : tight , creamy , off-white/tan head . the beer is incredibly dark , and completely opaque . i feel comfortable calling it black ; it 's close enough to not make a difference . head has good retention and leaves behind a tantalising lace .
a : hazy orange-amber body with a solid cap of fine tan foam . nice .

appearance : stone pale ale pours an amber copper color , slightly hazy . by far the most appealing part of the appearance is the tall , pillowy , sexy off-white head . tons of sticky lace and carbonation visibly replenishes the head from the bottom .
appearance : pours a completely opaque deep and dark , black with some brownish hues along the edges of the glass . there is no carbonation to speak of , ergo no head formation at all .

appearance : well it is a lucid gold with a large white head that has good staying power . it looks great and has a very pale lager feel about it sadly its macro looks follow through in the rest of the experience .

appearance : deep brown showing ruby amber with backlight . tan head collapsed pretty quickly into a clumpy cover . thin globs try to cling to the side , but fall back to the beer pretty quickly . flavor : starting cold , it comes across as a dark amber ale . the roasted barley characters take the lead , but as it warms more flavors start to show up . a light white grape aftertaste gives a nice counterpoint to the darker flavor , and a lightly sugared roasted wheat flavor settles in after a few drinks .
a : pours black with an insane amount of tan head . it has been 10 min and i still can not actually drink the beer . 5 fingers of head . no matter how carefully i poured the head would just explode .

appearance : a poor foamy and bubbly white that has very poor retention . the color of the beer is a pale orange color with light orange tan hues . . the clarity of the beer is hazy , cloudy , and yeasty . the head left no lacing on the glass , a very poor showing .

a : pours a one finger head of bad thickness , not much cream , and decent retention . colour is a semitransparent orange-gold . sm : moderately heavy malts , light pleasant hops , clean barley , and maybe a biteen cream . a moderate strength aroma .
a : dark ruby in color . crystal clear with a light tan fluffy head . truly a beautiful looking beer .
a : looks like crap .
a : pours reddish brown . i had a hard time squeezing a lot of head out of it and it dissipated fast with almost no lacing on the glass .
a : pours a reddish brown . little head , leaves lacing and edging . very nice carb levels .

a : classic nitro tap look in a much lighter beer than is normally served in a nitro tap . starts out a cloudy cream-yellow color which settles to a very clear and clean beer with a nice thick head that never goes away .

a : it poued a dark brown with redish tint around the edges body . however , when back lit the body became a deep red with a monster amount of bubbles rising from the bottom to the top . the head was a sticky two finger dense concoction that lingered and lingered .

a : pours an unappealing yellow a shade darker than most adjunct lagers with a really pitiful white head that dissipates entirely in around 20 seconds . for a beer that depends so heavily on marketing , this was nothing short of pathetic .

a : well ... the first thing that i noticed was the absence of any carbonation . i contacted the brewery and they indicted that the beer should have some carbonation , but ultimately i could not get the beer to produce a head . this was very much not what i expected at all . aside from that the body of the beer was a thick dark black .
a : pours a clear orange with barely a finger of beige head that quickly vanishes with no lacing .
a : dark brown with virtually no head and lacing .
appearance : espresso brown with just a tinge of brown highlights on the edge ; a thin layer of foam appears ( a good sign ) and some of it sticks to the glass
a : thin , pale yellow , very fizzy but no head

a : the beer is a pure , if slightly pale , gold color with faint traces of carbonation inside . head was huge for some reason and was surprisingly long lasting . looks like an ideal pale lager should .
appearance : pale yellow with a slim white head , very light in colour for an all malt beer and the head retention lacks .

a : i could n't give this appearance a 1.0 , because there almost is no appearance . there are lots of bubbles , no head , and only the palest *hint* of yellow amidst this clear concotion . i am not exaggerating , when pouring from the bottle , it was crystal clear , gaining its ghostly hue only in the glass .
appearance : boring pale yellow with no foam or carbonation .
a : pours a dark orange amber with a mammoth , four-finger head that fills half the tulip glass and detracts from the presentation . out-of-control froth leaves patches of sticky lacing .
appearance : golden yellow , with slightly orange ambition . not a lot of head on my pour , slight lacing . nothing too noteworthy here .
a : honestly , it does n't look like much . a dull golden colour with a few bubbles drifting to the top . almost two fingers of head which dissipated quickly .
a : pale straw color . poured a thin white head that dissipated to a few random bubbles . decanted lightly . no lacing .
a : no head ; no lacing ; carb action only ok

a : popped the cage and cork after sitting in my fridge for about 30 minutes . pours a clear dark caramel and rests in the glass a super , dark mahogany . massive head in my tulip glass that hangs around for a good while .
a : dark amber in colour with moderate clarity , a thick , off-white foamy head that dissipates slowly and leaves lots of lacing
a : bright yellow color , with a poor foamy head , some bubbles too ;
a : hazy , rich orange-amber color . generous one-finger head that sticks around . a bit thicker head in the wine glass .
a : nice copper/ruby blend of color . the carbonation is not lost on this , foamy white head with a decent lacing filling the snifter .
appearance : pours a clear reddish purple color with a thick and fluffy 3 '' + pinkish white head that lasted a while . this is one interesting looking beer imho .
a : a hazy amber color with a thick off white head . there is lots of sediment suspended in the beer , even though the bottle has been undisturbed for a few days .
appearance : pours a highly carbonated mahogany ; huge , cocoa-brown head ; c-cup 's worth of lace ; excellent head retention .

appearance : pours a transparent gold color with orange hues . the head really rises up to about 1.5 inches and is off white in color . plenty of stringy lace drapes on the sides of the glass . nice .
a : dark brownish red ; modest head dissipates quickly ; no carb streams
a : opaque black color with over two fingers of beige foam head . heavy lacing remains on the glass .

a : light amber in color . appears to have rather low carbonation . thin white head that disappears rather quickly . leaves a think rim on the top of the beer , but not much else . not the best appearance .

a : a little darker than i would think . darker than straw yellow . the head was huge . i filled less than half the glass with the beer and the head was over-flowing . a head lasted the whole time and left distinct rings of lacing around the glass .
a : head retention is extremely short . a bronze to light copper appearance , with a slightly unfiltered look .
a : nice golden colour , poor head retention .
appearance : deep ruby colour . very low light tan head that vanishes as soon as the pouring is finished . very clear .
a : clear amber with a red tinge . 3/4 in tough head . medium amount of lacing .
appearance : pale yellow with a champagne like carbonation .
a : cloudy light yellow in color . head was pretty thin with no real lacing to speak of .

appearance : a nice copper color , i kind of liked it as it was a little darker than what i would have expected . very little cloudiness to it and it also had a very little head , perhaps 1 finger that dwindled quickly . left a very thin lacing here and there on the glass as it went down .

a : pours a one finger head of slight cream , nice thickness , and terrible twenty second retention . semitransparent copper colour . sm : light strength scent of pleasant berry esters , brewer 's sugar , and pleasant amber hops . very fresh and appealing .
a : pours a relatively clear copper , with small head that leaves little lacing .
a : looks like a thin saison . slightly hazy . not much head . looks like a hefe with less bubbles .
a : the beer is a pale gold color with a very thin white head that fades at almost instantly and leaves very little lace on the glass .
a : pours black with a mild tan head . fair retention , no lace .

a : clear pale amber body with a few weird worm-like chunks . one finger of frothy white foam . mediocre retention , no lace . i 'm not going to lie , it 's kind of gross looking - are those sea monkeys ?
a : clear dark russet in colour , coming with a fluffy light-khaki head , on top of low fizziness .
appearance : medium gold beer with stark white cap which soon fades to almost nothing
a : the first thing i noticed is that it has no head to speak of . i get a very small head but it goes away instantly . the beer is a dark orange-brown color and is very hazy . i do see carbonation .
a : slightly orangy gold , almost no head , no rising carbonation .
a : typical of brown ale ; not too much head , but noticeable carbonation . not too dark or light .

appearance : 12 ounce bottle pours a very dark brown to black with slight amber hues . the head is thick like a a milkshake and mocha in color . nice lacing as the head reduces . aromas : stong hints of malts as well of honey . hints of chocolate malts and dark roasted coffee .
appearance : little color , hardly noticeable . zero head .
a : hazy straw color with a tiny ring of bubbles around the top .
a : black , black , black ; surprisingly , not much head ; lacing after the drink was spotty
a : the beer is golden yellow with lots of sediment suspended throughout . it also has lots of head , but it dies off quickly .
appearance : amber , nice head volume and retention .

a : chunks in every pour . this beer pours a hazy , dirty , shit colored brown with tons of floating chunks of what i can only imagine is dirty beaver juice . not much of a head but some soapy lacing was left down the glass .
appearance : no lacing . straw colored . minimal off white head .

appearance : a nice one finger ivory head that is creamy and a little foamy . the head has no retention . the body of the beer is a reddish amber hue with a copper tint . there is some very small bubbles coming from the bottom of the glass . the clarity of the beer is hazy , but light is visible .
a : pours a golden yellow with a frothy white head . it has lots of small pieces of debris floating in it .
appearance : after a gusher of an opening , the beer settled down and pours a jet black color with nary a highlight ; nice frothy mocha head that leaves massive amounts of lace
a : dark -- like winter-night-in-siberia dark . head is full , a finger or so , and the lacing is prominent but short-lived .

a : 2005 - cloudy appearance with little head after a light pour ( tried to keep sediment in bottle ) amber colored 2007 - amber color , cloudy appearance - also after a light pour . a very thin ring of lace .
appearance : poured a lovely amber black ( it makes sense ) with a lucious creamy 2 finger head . ample lacing made it a very lovely looking beer
a : aggressive `` pffft '' when opened . 2 fingers of head from a gentle pour , great retention of off-white foam . hazy reddish amber liquid . good looking !

a : pours a pretty solid black color , with an inch or so of head on it . a little more head than i 'm used to compared to other imperial stouts . head dissipated to about an eighth inch fairly fast .
appearance : a crystal-clear , paler-than-pale straw body with a bubbly white head that burns out rapidly and leaves no lacing .

appearance : it poured a slightly hazy orange first , brown second color . quite pretty . after 30 minutes in the glass as i drank , it cleared up quite a bit . i did n't get much head on the pour , but it was very effervescent , as indicated by the clarity that developed over the course of my consumption .
a : very thick and creamy head with a huge and very long lasting amber brown in color and gloriously unfiltered .
a : hazy gold color , tan head about half an inch or so thick , with excellent lacing , pretty fair head retention . quite cloudy .
a : some cloudy dark orange , almost brown . head is off white , is hard to get and do not last . some lacing .
a : clear reddish-copper color . nice fluffy , light tan head with heavy lacing .
appearance : poured the contents of the can into a small , clear , plastic cup . typical looking lager . head quickly disappeared without leaving much residuals .
a : foamy 2 finger tall head , short lived . clear golden-yellow color
a : pours a clear straw orange with two fingers of white , frothy head . the head recedes into a soapy cap with good lacing .
a : bright reddish-amber body under an inch of creamy tan foam . strong retention and layers of lace . gorgeous barleywine .

a : i find it hard to believe that this is a wheat beer . it pours a clear straw yellow topped by a bubbly white head which quickly dies away to nothing . there is very little carbonation visible . i think that the filtered , headless beer was unappealing , considering that it was a wheat beer . i understand that three floyds does n't even want to fit into the style , but even when i try to disregard the fact that i am drinking a wheat beer , i still think it looks bad .

appearance : a golden blonde yellow color . there was a one finger ivory head . the head dissipated very quickly . there are a lot of effervescence in the beer . the clarity of the beer is slightly hazy .

appearance : pours from the bottle with a dark black body which , when held to the light , has deep claret like ruby hints . tan colored thickish head was moderate at first , but once in the glass it quickly relaxed , faster than a sphincter on laxative , to a rather poor looking thin covering , which eventually finished up as just a brown halo around the edges of the glass . had a decent level of carbonation though , surprising given the lax appearance . still , not that inviting to the eyes to be honest .
appearance : pours a deep , ruby red in color , very interesting , head size was generous and actually a pink color . lacing and retention were good all around .

a : maybe i need to get a new glass to put this beer in because i can never get my beer to look like the ones in the pictures . yes this beer does manage a half inch thick of tightly packed head that fades in about a minute into a cap and leaves sparse lacing for a belgian beer . good color on this , dark clear cola , a cherry wood varnish until the yeast is added .

appearance : pours a dark black color into the pint glass . when held to the light a little bit of dark red can be seen . decent tan head ( about 1/2-inch ) faded to fairly thick covering on the liquid which lasted to the end . good lacing to the finish .
a : pours a rich dark goldn color with a good head and good lacing . a good looking bier .
a : 1 1/2 head - golden beer color .
a : pours a dark caramel amber . small frizzy white head .

a : pours very golden for an ipa , very clear with just a slight tinge of copper , new penny copper . good amount of carbonation , small bubbles , champagne-like in nature . billowy two finger head i just-off white . fairly pronounced lacing throughout .
a : light yellow , crystal clear with a moderate white head . lots of carbonation ripping up . a few splotches of lace here and there .
a : poured a murky brown with burgundy highlights , low carbonation , tannosh head that did not stick around , no lacing
a : into the weizen glass it had a two almost three finger white head . into the pint it was only a two finger head . pour color was orangish yellow and cloudy .
a : pours deep black with a generous two finger mocha head . head looks a bit foamy with very good retention and really good lacing .
a : pours a great looking golden color with a half finger head . looks almost commercial .
a : a slow , steady , high pour results in a thick black body underneath a mere half inch of frothy light-brown head . mediocre retention , spotty lace . not terrible , but pretty darn average .
a : pours a hazy straw yellow body . white fluffy head that quickly recedes to nothing . no lacing .

a : pours thick and black as night with a quarter inch of tan head . the head slowly dissipates into a gentle , lingering , tan froth . nice tan lacing up the glass with each swirl and sip . this is what an imperial stout should look like .
a : nice big white head . very pale straw color . crystal clear .

a : golden orange and bronze colored body with a small , thick and bubbly white head . dissipation is extremely rapid and in the end , does n't leave any lace or retention . unfortunate but it 's just not the most attractive looking beer .
a : woah dude , this looks amazing ! deep amber brown with a ridiculous huge frothy head . tons of lacing and fluffy multi layered goodness on top .

a : poured much darker than then the regular papier ... a mix of brown and black , but again ... no head or lacing . if held up to the light , you get a tint of red piercing the outer edges of the glass .

a : poured a cloudy , well , golden color with a substantial orange tint to it . the bartender poured it to the line in the golden monkey snifter , which looked pathetic because it had only the slightest ring of foam swirls ( leaving the headspace mostly empty ) . retention was mostly in the donut , which did n't leave any lacing . kind of a flaccid look for a tripel .
appearance : pours orange ( like slice ) with high carbonatin and about 1 finger of white head . there is very pour head retention .

appearance : a pale off yellow with a slight off tint probably due to the lime . barely any head and no lacing what so ever . also seems to have a clear problem with excessive carbonation . certainly some leeway is given because it is a light lager , however it 's pretty much an off color bud light , which is expected .

a : pours a nice reddish amber color ; sometimes this beer pours with a okay-looking head of bigger bubbles but sometimes pours a very thin head ( both seem to fizzle out fairly quickly though ) . a little bit of lacing . a fair amount of carbonation bubbles coming from the bottom of the glass .
a : poured from a 12 oz . bottle into a pint glass . abundant white foamy head . color is a mildly hazy , golden yellow . long retention and very good lacing .

appearance : straight pour into a pint glass . the color is black , but light was able to pass through when i held it to my lamp . two fingers of tan head developed and dissipated to leave a spotted lacing , trails long the glass , and a ring around the edge .

appearance : this was a dark brew that revealed itself as being a very deep crimson hue when held up to the light . a dense , tan head rose up easily and settled down slowly , leaving behind some foam on the side of the glass as it did so . as i downed the beer , there was a ton of lacing left , sometimes in the form of those wonderful foam rings that i love to see .
appearance : pours a clear golden colors with a tiny head that turns to lacing and a medium amount of carbonation .

a : looks light . very little carbonation , considering i 've had hitachino nests that bubbled over before it was even poured . airy carbonation that sticks to the side of the glass , but little to no head on top .
a : pours reddish brown with two fingers of foam with large soap bubbles . outstanding head retention .
a : a lightish brown with little head .
a : really clear copper looking ipa . hardly any head at all . bummer , was hoping for more on the appeareance . sticky lacing .
appearance : typical hazy orange with massive white cap . retention is outstanding .
appearance : orange color with medium head and lace combined with very little carbonation .

a : pours a translucent amber with coppery highlights against the light . the head is 3 fingers of fluffy cream colored foam that collapses over several minutes into a dense half-finger cap on the brew , leaving substantial lacing in its wake . each sip coats the glass with sheets of lacing and register marks . even to the end of the drink there is a substantial cap .
a : pours with a clear orange copper color with a fiant white fluffy head
appearance : the beer poured a good looking blackness with a cola colored head . no lacing in evidence . this is the high point of the beer .
a : gorgeous mahogany red-brown , dark but with a good deal of clarity . short , tan head followed by strong lacing .
a : this is one good looking stout , from the deep black body to the deeper khaki fruit infused head . great head retention and very creamy . lacing is left in layers and is very sticky .

a : dull gold and hazy , and light toward the top ; hazy enough that i cant see my fingers on the other side of the glass . pours a thin , rocky head that fades fast , with very little lacing , though the carbonation is certainly there .
a : poured a hazy orange color with lacking carbonation leaving a small white cap

a : pours a vibrant chestnut ruby , with a good 1.5 '' light tan head that promises some retention . the hop cone restricted the flow while pouring it into the glass , which made it take quite a bit longer than usual . very nice touch though . nice lacing as it moves down the glass .
a : clear golden color . no head or retention .
appearance : hazy straw golden as you 'd expect , but a very thin and weak head . lots of little champagne-like bubbles .
a : big khaki head with killer retention , quality lacing , rich amber-red beer

a : a beautiful beer ; pours a crystal clear golden-amber color with a finger of foamy white head . most of the head stays for the full glass , there 's tons of lacing , and carbonation bubbles never stop flowing .
appearance : black in color . head is thick , long lasting and light tan in color .
a : truly abyss like - darkness envelopes my glass ! two fingers of tan head sit atop the blackness and eventually fade away to about one finger .
a : deep dark reddish brown ... somewhat cloudy and mysterious . frothy light beige head leaving fantastic lace as a wake of destruction .
a : poured a purple with rose pinksh highlights with a finger of head and a little lacing .
appearance : nice , bubbly , half-inch head . crystal clear , brilliant copper in color . very , very nice looking beer .
a : pours a golden color with a tad bit of darker orange . 3 fingers of slightly off-white head with excellent retention and lacing .
a : poured a dark brown with brown higlights with a thin bubbly head which left good lacing sticking on the glass .

appearance : pours up with a nice finger and a half of tan foam that resists annihilation from the elements as long as possible . color is a deep amber . things are starting off right . however , it was impossible to get past the beta fish sized floaters that appeared to group together like schools of bait fish , roaming about their new 12oz clear sided world . very unattractive .
a : dull yellowish brown ; not much carbonation ( perhaps expected in a beer normally casked )
a : vigorous pour leads to a tar black body with a creamy off white head that lasts as it warms down some . filmy , chunky lacing behind it , like skeleton hands . awesome looking beer .
appearance : dark amber in colour with a foamy , ringed lace head that dissipates quickly .
appearance : pours out a golden yellow w/ little to no head that quickly dissipates .
a : pours a crystal clear amber color with a fluffy white head . ( while nice , the style should be cloudy with little carbonation . )

a : one of the prettier out there , pure eye candy . first pour into the oversized wine glass resulted in a huge offwhite head that lingers , lingers , lingers ... as this translucent amber brown brew goes down the hatch , there is lots of lacing . wow .
a : pours a slightly translucent black with a substantial yellowish head and excellent lacing .

appearance : copper . hazy . head is bright-white . small head . thin ring at edges for the duration . carbonation looks lo be on point . if this really is a dubbel , it 's definitely missing some of the deeper/darker colors .

appearance : a transparent garnet brown beer is active with carbonation and fervent with head foundation . the head is khaki and shows great retention and 4 '' of size . cakey surface and lots of spotty lace . the head still has n't relented after finishing the entire beer so i will have to wait to get the last gulp .
a : overly carbonated which resulted in an overflow upon opening , head was frothy and excessive , the color is a cloudy pine bark brown , little to no signs of lacing - 2.50 ,
a : medium brown with significant haze . good creamy head fades quickly to a thin layer of foam that lasts fairly well .
a : pours a clear reddish caramel color with no head or lacing .
a : light piss yellow
a : pours a dark ruby brown color . a very light tan head forms with pour retention . a light film of lace .

appearance : i drink this beer quite regularly and one thing that always stands out is the lacing . it is some of the nicest you will witness . in fact the appearance of the beer in general is very nice with a pale orange honey color and the head always pours a 2 finger head . when the head recedes there 's nice pillowy puffs of foam that remain until the end .
appearance : pours out a crystalline , golden-amber body with a modestly-sized , white head .

appearance : moldy-reckoning ; deep mahogany colours , and an ample juxtaposition -- the head was slighted , but came fulfilled thorough and clean . a heavy wait . the head bubbled to the top , presenting much foam , until a good 4-minute calibration and it was no more . from afar , looks a bit like a samuel adams ' utopias ... definitively a massive drink . and definitely worthy of many hand-held praise ... even if for a moment .
appearance : pours a straw colored beverage with a two finger head , which remains for five minutes leaving minor peaks and some lacing along the side of the glass .
a : crisp , clear , amber color . generated about an inch of dence ivory head which left very nice lacing .

appearance : a thick pitch black beer with no carbonation at all . pours a very thin off-white head that disappears immediately , leaving no film either . zero head and zero lacing remains . basically , a flat black beer with nothing interesting or off-putting going on . neutral .

a : into a pint glass , the 12 oz bottle poured a coppery-amber with a 1.5-finger bubbly khaki head . lots of carbonation as tiny bubbles rush to the surface to fortify the head , allowing it to linger nicely . some lacing as i drink it , and some sediment settles to the bottom of the glass .
appearance : haze pale golden , almost murky . little head forms from the pour and disappears to nothing , few large bubbles rise to the top .
a : black as night with a fair amount of tan head .
a : wonderful looking beer ... hazy dull golden color , with big fluffy head , a good 3 fingers worth ... . settles to a thick layer of foam and lacing all the way down the glass .
a : clear golden yellow colour , small head with no density .
appearance : pours a clear , golden body with a full inch of snow white suds . thin layers of lacing on the descent .
appearance : uh no foam , bad sign for a belgian . the carbination just does n't look `` right . '' looks more like an amber than a dark beer .
a : pours black , not fully opaque . aggressive pour does not give a head at all .

appearance : poured with a solid two thumbs of head that retained and laced like crazy . the beer itself is a cloudy dark yellow , just as you would expect to be with great signs of carbonation . nothing to complain about here .
appearance : straw color , fair amount of haze , crisp and inviting , head not as billowous as i 'd like , poor retention ( pretty much disappears altogether )
a : very dark with hints of red and drown . wonderfully tan head , about a finger and a half worth , head settles to a nice ring with great lacing all the way down the glass .
appearance : urine-colored liquid , no head , no lacing

a : released the cage and the cork practically fell out . no pop , no nothing . pours a lifeless dark roast coffee brown . no head , no carbonation , no lace . redeems itself a little from the cool looking `` legs '' running down the inside of the glass . lots of suspended sediment .
a : pours a hazy , orange amber with a small , short-lived beige head .
a : pours beautifully into a pitch black substance with a dark tan head of 2+ fingers . head is fluffy , small bubbles , lots of retention and perfect lacing .
a : looks like apple juice ! absolutely no head . i knew looking at it in the glass it was going to disappoint .
a : pours a clear , honey-colored body . zero head and no visible carbonation .
a : straw , 1 finger white head , receded to nothing but a slight ring clinging to the glass . typical lager carbonation ... lively enough . did look flat halfway through the glass though
appearance : gorgeous beer . a bright , orange-yellow color with a little bit of haze . the head was about an inch thick in my 20 oz . glass and the lacing was pretty solid .
a : pours a dark ruby red , almost brown with a thick yellowish tan head which lasts for the whole glass , unbelievable lacing , thick and rich .
appearance : pours a slightly hazy orange color with a 2 '' head that lasts a while . thick lace paints the glass .
a : this brew looks phenomenal . almost completely black with a large light-brown creamy head that sat on top for a long while .
a : thick , white , creamy head . foam clings . dark brown . the archetypical stout .
appearance : slight watered down bourbon color with off white head with moderate size bubbles that vanishes quickly with litte lacing .
a : brilliant clear golden-orange ; no yeast . plenty of effervescent carbonation supports good head retention and truly exceptional lacing .

a : an amateur pour captured the yeast slug in this beer , producing a cloudy amber body that glows slightly reddish against the light . the head is surprisingly flaccid for a beer that contains brett ; it 's half a finger at best , with short retention , no lacing , and a very thin collar .
a : clear orange amber beer with a thin white head , no lacing .
a : pours dark brown/cola colored with just a tinge of red if held up to the light . no head .
a : pours a slightly hazy copper color , as advertised , under a big white head . nice retention , really nice lace .
appearance : very thin head after some quick rising foam , filtered clarity is ordinary for this type of beer .
a : brass body with foamy 2 finger head on pour that completely disappears .
appearance : mellow brown with a thinning head -- not much to look at at first glance ... .

a : hazy red/brown amber ( or copper/orange ) ; even the color is intriguing . poured a 3 finger light tan head that rested slowly to a 2 finger dollop . decanted in lazy bubbles . laced in sticky , wide sheets .
a : pours black with no light shining through . head is thin , and there are clumpy yeast chunks floating around the glass . head retention is good , but lacing is minimal .
appearance : pours a dark cola color with a tight white head that never dissipates and leaves a lot of creamy lacing on the sides of the glass .
a : past the point of blond , this beer had a golden tinge
a : like bubbly tinted water .
appearance : normal pour resulted in huge white , rocky head . beer is hazy-orange amber . great retention and lacing . gorgeous !
appearance : cream soda in colour with even a soda like head that dissipates quickly .
a : no head . heavy carbonation . pale-depressing yellowish .

a : huge , huge , huge foamy head 50cm ! as if i pee 'd on a bar of soap , how did this happen ? apart from that the beer has a really nice glow to it 's murky not yet ripe orange body . the highlights on the beer are even lighter when looking through this duvel glass . dare i say it 's a really pretty looking beer ?

appearance : clear light brown with a thick rich creamy head of microscopic bubbles that lasted a long time and laced . gave a nice guinness like cascade when poured . flavor : malt base with some smoky flavors and some peat taste , both are mild .
a : pours a pale straw with little clouding . a short head forms and dies immediately . no lacing .
a : pours an orange-amber color with a thin off-white head that settles quickly . upon opening , the top barely popped , and pouring yields little carbonation .

a : out of the nitro can/bottle , the surge . that 's all that you need to say -- it 's a sight to behold and it 's almost the authentic pub experience . when pouring this brew , billions of nitrogen bubbles rush to the bottom of the glass and then settle . once you finish the very important two part pour ( i stress this , as this is the proper way to have a pint of guinness ) a beautiful , creamy off white head settles . this is a superb looking pint .
a : dark ruddy color ; clear ; spot-on carb and head
a : deep , clear amber . beautiful with a thin , persistent foam head .

a : impenetrably dark , dark , dark brown , nearly black . pours with disappointingly little head , just a wisp of creamy bubbles rim the top of the brew and swirl within . minimal lacing . i am nonplussed .
a : heavy pour yields a .5 finger coarse white head that seems to evaporate it disappears so quickly . beer is a semi-clear brownish-amber . lacing is very spotty and has no cling .
a : black , just black . no light gets through at all . the head poured mocha at an inch thick quickly simmering to a quarter of an inch while coating the sides of the glass with webbing in its wake

a : poured into a pint glass . actually a little darker than i was expecting , but it 's definitely a light colored beer . some lively carbonation to it , about a half inch or so of head . well carbonated , i fear overly so .

a : probably the closest to `` motor oil '' as i 've ever seen in a beer . super thick and viscous , black as a moonless night with a thick & creamy one-finger chocolate-milk-colored head . absolutely gorgeous .
appearance : pours a bright orangey-copper color with a profusive , fizzy white head .

a : got ta love the nitro effect on this beer . when you crack the can , out pops a nice gushing sound and a small escape of foam . the beer pours the color of buttermilk at the start , then clears up to a bright amber about halfway through the pour . the head initially envelops about 2/3 of the glass as the nitrogen feels its way in waves up the glass . then , it settles in a 2 finger froth atop the brew and refuses to leave . makes for a great beer mustache .

a : pours a clear golden-amber body . a 1 '' off-white head quickly drops to a thin film , and a little later on drops to nothing at all . little to no lacing is left behind . inside the glass , an occasional small carbonation bubble rises slowly to the surface .
appearance : dark ( `` texas tea '' ) , chunky , quite a bit of sediment that dislodged a little too easily , low head
a : a nice clear dark red glass that holds a solid dirty tan head that laces all the way down with thick tidemarks : easy on the eyes all the way around .
a : impossibly clear yellow . literally looks like piss . very small white head that disapears very quickly .
a : begins foaming from the get-go and a gentle pour quickly turns in to a frothy mess . body is a murky brown with an off white ( and lots of it ! )
appearance : murky brown and not a really pretty beer . some thing off-white head that recedes quickly .
a : pours a crystal clear amber with 2 fingers of bubbly head that dissipates slowly . n : caramel malts , clean citrus , sweet bread and notes of floral .

a : a nice rusty reddish-brown , topped with a sticky wite head , a little over a finger tall . plenty of lacing left behind . this is a rare instance ( not sure if it 's the first in my reviews ) where i feel the appearance is bang-on and perfect to style .
a : poured a jet black with excellent carbonation leaving a beautiful brown cap
a : pours a hazy golden-copper body . a 1 '' slightly creme tinted head fades in a short while to a thick film . quite a bit of sticky strings and saggy curtains of lacing are left behind .
appearance : 5 |
a : clear orange amber color . two fingers of beige , fairly dense creamy head . retention is decent and a good robust ring of lacing is left . 2.5
a : pours a slightly hazy light gold with a finger of white head that quickly recedes into a thin ring with little lacing .
a : pours an extremely dark brown ( almost black ) that no light can penetrate . it is adorned with about a 1.5 finger head that dissipates to about a half a finger that sticks around .
a : appears gold and clear , no head , little lacing .
appearance : pours a dark , almost black , reddish-brown color . no head . no lacing .

a : cloudy golden color with a great , thick , slightly off-white fluffy head with endless retention . s/t : blackberries galore , plenty of yeast , with a good lemony-citrus complement . the wheat is in good style , and it 's even got some subtle hopping and perhaps some sweet caramel/cereal malts .
appearance : awesome deep maroon color , reminds me of a red wine . not much carbonation , with no head or lacing . a slight oily texture , most likely due to the high alcohol content .

appearance : this poured a beautiful hazy dark ruby color with a light creamy and foamy tan head . the beer label is kinda earthy and ugly but the unique underside of the cap rocks , 2 campers and a big foot drinking beer together .
a : dark brown with .62 inches of tan head .
a : clear bright gold body with a 2 '' head of coarse white foam . surprisingly good retention and lacing . this is defintley one of the best-looking light lagers i 've ever seen .
appearance : this brew poured a nice solid black ... with a reddish tint , and minimal tan head .
a : dark . could not see through it . small tan head when first poured , but nothing after a few sips . very little spotty lacing .
appearance : really orange and very pretty . there was very little head , but a nice lacing foam never seemed to leave until i had a second pour . really coats the glass .

appearance : served in a smithwicks pint glass , this beer has a hugely enticing deep ruby red color . the head consists of a white foam which remains until the end of the glass due to a brewing process called lacing . unlike other ales , smithwicks will not develop a watery appearance after a few mouthfulls .
appearance : very promising , crystal clear deep red-brown . pours too freely with no viscous reserve . small head with no creaminess which disappeared quickly .
appearance : very pale yellow indeed . almost no head , no lacing , just a few bubbles rising .
appearance : pours a beautiful clear mahogany with tow fingers of tan head and good retention .
appearance : a deep tentalizing ruddy spread , which leapt onto a fouled demention of wondrous showcase colours -- real and glitsy ; its head is flat-out spectacular .
a : clear dark brown . killer head . two finger of it and frothy as all hell . awesome retention and plenty of lacing . 3.0
a : pours a orange-brown body with semi-opaqueness under a two-finger white head with mild retention . minimal lacing
appearance : nice 2 inch head with a tan color . beer is golden orange with no speakable sediment.excellent head retention , it is taking an eternity to subside .

a : mr. adams summer ale has quite a nice coloured body ( not a euphemism ) . it 's cloudy ( the way i likes my beers ) , and golden/honey bodied with a cappuccino froth white head . mmmm , methinks sir .
a : nice amber , crazy hardcore strength head that lingered to the bottom of the glass .
a : cloudy sienna colored brew with moderate carbonation . bubbly pink tinged head comes and goes in a flash . leaves no lace .

a : one finger head of nice soft cream , good thickness , and favourable retention . nontransparent hazy copper colour . sm : orange peel citrus ester hops , cream , banana , and wheat . a moderate strength aroma .
a : pours a hazy amber ale with a persistent , peanut colored , three finger head . the residue sticks to the glass - tacky . good looker .
a : deep brown with a billowing off white to tan head . lacing is pretty solid but the head fades moderately fast .

appearance : this was a golden and , oddly enough , crystal clear wheat beer . i swirled the last inch or so of beer to get the sediment out , only to discover that there was no sediment . a white head rose up to one finger and dissipated quickly . a thin ring around the beer was the only thing left after a few minutes . there was little to no lacing .

appearance : poured first into my snifter with virtually no head but a harder pour into my wife 's pint glass revealed a 1 finger foam . weird and not what i expected . the color reminds me of cola without the fizz . what little foam i have does cling to the glass .
a : black as the dickens , impenetrable to light , light khaki head . very impressive head retention . nice lacing .
a : cloudy amber with a nice cream head and lacing . looks perfect for a saison .
