a : light yellow with some hazy coloring . ample head and thick , sheetlike lacing . very nice . n : little to nothing . hops come through a bit , perhaps grassy .
a : darkness warshed over the dude - darker'n a black steer 's tookus on a moonless prairie night . thin for such a dark stout ... minimal lacing & head .
a : pours a pitch black with 2 finger meringue like head . great retention and leaves some very nice webbed lace down the sides of the glass .
a : well , clear golden with no visible head - no lace obviously .
appearance : tried it by half-pint and it pours slightly-dark amber colour , with minimal beerhead observed which left fine trace of lace along the way .
a : beautiful carmel brown color with a big , fluffy head that recedes to about two fingers . excellent and surprising clarity , given the style .
a : pours a dark brown out of the tap , with a full white head , which leaves lots of sticky lacing on the pint glass as the beer is drunk .
appearance : what do you think ? it looks like someone took a piss in a glass . if you bother pouring it , which is optional , but it dooes release some decent flavouring ( see later ) .
a : a very pale yellow , even moreso than i might have expected . no head , rather just a trim of lace . kind of disappointing , overall .
a : pours a dark amber with a large , dense , stiff , tan head that left a sheet of lace around the whole glass as it receded into a pillow-y lumpy film .
appearance : pours a translucent , very pale , golden color . has a very thin , fizzy head that dissipates quickly and leaves little lacing .
a : light golden color chill haze that never cleared . medium carbonation . large bubbled thin white head that was short lasting . lacing on the low end .
a : beautiful clear deep copper/amber color with an off-white head that maintains a nice lacing . it looks very enticing to drink .

a : three fingers of a medium brown creamy/frothy head is long lasting . the body is the darkest brown possible if it is n't purely black and no light comes through . only a spare amount of lacing finds it 's way to the glass , which is to the detriment of the rating , especially given the style .
a : deep garnet with nice clarity for a bottle conditioned beer . a fizzy cream cap comes and goes quickly as it retreats to a ring at the edge of the beer . leaves no lace .
a : clear tinted orange-golden body with two fingers of white foamy head . good retention and leaves thick lacing .
a : pours murky light amber-brown with a modest off-white head . honestly , this beer looks like iced tea .
a : golden beer , more bubbles than normal . almost no lasting head .
a : pours a deep reddish color . minimal head with poor retention and almost no lacing .
a : as with all guinnesses , it really is gorgeous . nice creamy head , nice brownish bubble effects .
a : cloudy , pale yellow with a thin layer of head that disappears quickly leaving absolutely no evidence that it was there at all . really not that much to look at .

a : this has a light haze to it , which is odd for a distilled spirit ( is n't it ? ) . i do n't even know how to rate this . it 's mildly leggy , i suppose . i 'll give it a 3.5 , and that 's as high as i 'll go , because it 's brewdog .
a : head leaves little to be desired . nothing lasting , no lacing . surprised frankly . have n't seen a head of foam drop that fast in a while .
a : a nice dark bok colour , but too much crap floating in there . yes , you expect a bit of haze in an unfiltered beer but this is over the top .
a : black coffee . not much else . no head to speak of either .

a : pale with a fake-peachy/apricot colored tinge to it that makes it glow . they call it copper , and it really does look like a bright copper metal -- not the `` copper '' color you usually call beer . incredible clarity -- rich color but at the saem time completely transparent . its apperance matches its smell and flavor so well that i have to say it has a fairly perfect appearance .

a : pours a brown-black blend , impenetrable in my tulip but definitely shows some light through the edges if i hold it close to a lamp . has a strong mocha ( ha ! ) colored head that retains well and leaves splotches of lacing down the sides .
a : pours like motor oil , pitch black , thick , viscous , and absolutely no head ... .
appearance : `` looks like a miller high life '' , claims one wiseman . clear and golden with white , head and pretty good lacing .
appearance : ridiculously rich head and great retention . wow ! ! ! !

appearance : beautiful . dark brown , practically black , with an incredible cascading effect from the nitro-tap . the head and rest of the beer blended together , and took a long time to separate . once they did , the beer was left with three fingers of off-white head , one of which lingered for the entire glass . tons of lacing , too .
a : clear orange yellow ; inert ; head dissipates quickly ; no lacing

a : when poured into the glass it looks , quite simply , static and lifeless as you could tell from the `` action '' ... coming in a very pale amber hue and a fluffy head , with minimum carbonation . i 'm ready to embrace a flat pint ...
a : very good , rosey-brown color
a : pretty much pitch black . does n't allow light to pass through . moderate amount of dark head that , as it dies down , turns a slightly lighter tan color . appears to be thick .

a : slow pour yielded very dark maroon brown liquid beneath a finger and a half solid layer of very dense foam that took forever to slowly fade into a very thick and well retained head that lasted the whole beer through . great streaks of thick lacing were left down the glass .
a : this beer pours the darkest of all `` hefeweizens '' i have ever seen , and it is quite murky in appearance . i was somewhat turned off by the color , but the bubbles were abundant .
a : basically no head . light gold . very light rising carbonation .

appearance : wonderful dark amber smoky body with an off white crown that looks as patient as the tide . flavor : over burnt grains and a very strong vegetal note . i have to believe this was infected or just silly old .

a : pours a four finger head of pathetic thinness , no cream , and awful retention . seemingly overcarbonated judging by the wealth of bubbles . colour is a semitransparent copper . largely unappealing . sm : heavy apricot is all i can detect . a moderately strong aroma . a bit artificial though .
appearance : beautiful red hue ale with a decent bubbly head . really all of goose 's belgium style ales appear beautiful in the glass .
a : pours a murky dark amber with a soft off-white head , fair retention . almost opaque .

appearance : this is the only area were this beer falls short . the appearance is somewhere between white grape juice , wine , and mead with color and characteristics of them all . a light , white , honey mead color with almost a complete lack of head and lacing . light streams of carbonation .
appearance : pitch black body ( or so it appeared in the dim lighting ) with a quarter inch of dense , light brown , cap . great head retention and foamy lacing .
a : slightly hazy and pear in color . the head is white and is a good two fingers .

appearance : pours with 2 fingers of tan head . this settles to a thin layer of foam , leaving behind nearly complete lacing . the beer itself is a very dark brown with the slightest hints of mahogany around the edges . no sediment in the bottle .
appearance : the body color is ruby red and the head is close to an egg-shell . the head has great retention that leads to super lacing .

a : moderate pour yields apple juice ... yep ... plain and simple apple juice . you want more ? ok fine ... .5 finger white head that dissipates quickly , partially clear slightly orangy-yellow beer . near non-existant lacing .
a : half finger head of slight cream , fair thickness , and poor retention . hazy murky gold colour . sm : cream . malt . barley . what else is new ? mild esters . i like the cream .
a : amber with golden hues . it poured with a medium cream head that died to a film .

a : pours an amber/caramel/golden brown . cloudy and appropriate for the style . big , frothy head that gradually recedes to about a finger and sticks around . thick , benchmark lacing . it has the kind of vigorous carbonation i associate with bottle conditioning ( whether rightly or wrongly ) . nice yeasty dregs .
appearance : pours a very cola-like colour and consistency into a sweetwater pint glass ... thin tan head with decent lacing ... watery looking brew , not much to porter standards
appearance : poured a clear amber color . the head was small and faded quickly . mildly disappointing , to be honest .
appearance : free pour yields a 1.5 inch fizzy pink head that dissipates steadily and loudly . pours a semi-translucent red and leaves sweeping arches of lacing .
a : clear orange/amber color . poured a 3 finger off-white head with fair retention to a lumpy 1 finger cap . decanted lightly . laced in broken rings .

a : pours a very dark brown with a reddish tint to it . very soapy and bubbly head dissipates very fast -- no retention on the head . bubbles on the sides of the glass make me believe it 's carbonated , but i 'm not sure as the cork slide out of the bottle and did n't pop . looking at the cork now , i see it did n't expand outward as most corks in beer bottles do once they 're popped . this almost looks like an aggressively poured red wine .
a : dark brown hue with good head and great lacing . the one thing i can not get past are the floaties . yeast is everywhere , and this beer is still young .

a : the color is n't anything special , really , but it 's pours quite clear with a nice head and good retention . a good level of carbonation is exhibited with a steady stream of bubbles rising from the nucleation points in the glass .

a : pours a very chilled and hazy dark straw that bubbles to a very light brown at the body of the glass . a fluffy , pure white head forms on the pour , about one finger in height , that stick with me down the entire glass . splotches of lace follow me down the glass . looks perfect .
a : maplesyrup colored . very little head , less than one fingerwidth .
a : foam that settles into yellow pee .
a : pours black with a frothy two finger creamy tan head . lots of lace . very good head retention on this one . a great looking pint of stout .
a : clear , dark brown with a thick head and nice lacing .

appearance : probably the best looking belgian stout i 've seen . i could n't stop looking at it . pours a big 3 finger light tan head that 's a little thin but very persistent . head dissipates slowly , bubbly and unevenly into a thick film cap that stays the whole way down . lots of chunky lacing coats the glass all the way to the bottom . is dark brown , almost black , in colour and shows quite a bit of carbonation .
a : pours a very nice golden orange , slightly hazy , and very nice 1 finger head that settles to a small cap and leaves sticky lacing all over the glass . very impressive . off to a great start .
appearance : dark dark brown , basically black , with a nice rocky tan head with a little retention . little bit of lace . does n't look too bad .

a : a devilish start its black as night . i even brought it outside in the afternoon sun to see its color more clearly . the result : still black . not a single hint of sunlight shone through . damn , thats thick . the head is just as dense ; tan like wet beach sand and unrelentingly creamy . its assertive , too , coming to a full two-and-a-half fingers before my pour was even finished . sexy lacing stays around for quite a while , as well . i really like how this beer looks .
a : this pours a hazy copper hue and is topped with generous head . the head on this stuff is the whitest ive ever seen and holds up insanely well . it looks like it 's made of styrofoam .
appearance : pours a clear copper body with a small wisp of offwhite hued head that soon falls to film and collar . sparse patches of lace are left on the glass .
appearance : lemonade colored with just about no head , it turned a bit more orangey and opaque when i got a refill .

a : if it were n't for the little hue of yellow , it would be as clear as mineral water . head seems like it could have some retention , forming a good finger and a half ... but then bam ... it 's gone . absolutely no lacing , nothing . just this incredibly pale yellow liquid in the glass .
a : copper-amber with a light tan head , very little retention or lace .
a : poured clear light amber . a single finger of gleaming white head . head retention and lacing lasted just a few seconds after the pour .
appearance : pours a nice copper color , but with no head whatsoever . none .
a : pours a chill-hazed amber with a small head . light lacing .
a : served right after a small '08 darkness pour and the first thing i thought was damn , that 's an impressive head . great ebony color with some naughty lacing .
a : it pours a very dark red color with a two and a half finger , off-white head that holds and laces incredibly well .
a : pours black with about a finger of chocolate-colored head that quickly recedes into a thin ring with a little lacing .
appearance : light copper with absolutely no head and very slight carbonation
a : copper-amber , fairly opaque , no head .
appearance : a really unimpressive pour , with absolutely no carbonation ; the liquid was a murky , apricot nectar color
a : this beer looks just about perfect . clear , but extremely rich amber with a cramy white head . great lacing .
a : clear deep amber mahogany color . one finger of beige , creamy head with average retention and a nice ring of lacing . 2.5
a : very dark brown with red hues , it poured with a dense tan head that died to a collar .
a : murky , light brown look . minimal head .

appearance : -- this baltic babe is one burnt beauty ; really , it was as if some bloke were to spit up his chewing tobacco in a pint glass , and further its wonderment by adjoining a great lace , and a rocking carbon dioxide wake , as well as a few card tricks . yes . for the

appearance : gorgeous , in all respects . the bottling and packaging is unique , the bottle itself is enviable , and it only gets better once poured . the color is a rich , though light copper , the head is clean ivory with fine bubbles , though no lacing as one would expect on a bottle-conditioned ale . the beer is slightly hazy despite careful pouring ( at refrigerator temps ) though this chill haze dissipates with warming .
appearance : black with brown highlights . one fingerbreadth light brown head of mostly tight bubbles . hard to discern clarity in this vessel .

appearance : hazy , orange , gold in color with a foamy half-inch head when poured from a 22oz . bomber into a large rocks glass . several big bubbles were distributed throughout the foam to give it an interesting and pleasant heterogeneous capping .
appearance : pours into my new weyerbacher tulip a deep brown with the tiniest tan head on top . it falls to nothing but a thin collar immediately .
appearance : a crisp , golden-looking sparkler with a thin bit of white film as its head .
appearance : pours a cloudy brown with cloudy red highlights . a tiny yellow/white head is short-lived , there is no lace left behind . lots of bubbles stream to the surface .
a : dark as all get-out . something to behold ... made the glass look like it had been painted black on the inside . 2 fingers of tan head , persistent lacing .
a : deep clear ruby brown in color . minimal white head quickly dissipates into a thin white layer of bubbles and healthy white perimeter ring . very little ( if any ) lacing .
a : reddish brown , dark copper color . carbonated , head does n't retain well .

appearance : deep copper bronze color with red highlights . head is slight beige , creamy and recedes slowly leaving relatively sticky lacing . carbonation dances off the bottom in a very refreshing looking beer .
appearance : piss yellow with zero head or lacing .
a : black body with 3 '' of finely constructed light brown foam . great retention and solid sheets of lacing . gorgeous stout .
a : cloudy red with a thin , not so pretty head that dissapates quickly .
appearance : pours black . not quite opaque , but almost . no head to speak of . no lacing .
appearance : cloudy , golden-orange in color . big , fluffy , white head on top . thick spotty lacing .
a : pours a reddish amber body with a fluffy off-white head . retention was a minute or two , with some streaks of lacing down the glass .
a : nice pour , managed to get some head from it , but takes an aggressive tilt . golden , translucent , creamy colored froth . airy bubbles .
a : a really awesome hazy golden yellow . no head but the glass kind of glows !
a : murky brown in color with a hint of red and a thin off-white layer of head . no lacing to speak of , and hardly any head retention at all .

a : pours a deep mahogany into my glass . active manila bubbles form its guardian head on the surface . beady lace . this is more similar to an old ale than any belgian style i 'm familiar with , and i 've never seen an old ale look this good .
appearance : this is a beautiful looking beer . unique bottle . it pours a copper / amber color . tall thick head . nice lacing . this is what beer should look like .
a : clear , nut brown color . thick and creamy head with lace . small/medium carbonation . great look to it . 5/5
a : pours a dark mahogany with a finger of khaki head that recedes into a thin ring with no lacing .
a : poured a nice caramel hue into my tulip with a half finger of head which had some good sticky lacing .
a : the pour is a nice looking hazy golden orange color with a white foam on top .
a : poured into a weizen glass a dusty , straw gold with a small , white fizzy head that dissipated almost immediately , leaving no lace .
appearance : this beer pours a translucent brown color with a minimal ivory head the leaves a little bit of lace upon swirling .
appearance : a somewhat hazy golden , almost orange colour . the head is white and small , nearly non-existing at the start , but it grows , to soon fade away .
appearance : pours a dark brown almost black color with a thick 3 '' milk chocolate colored head . moderate lace paints the glass .
a : nice adrk brown with really thick head . head actually continues to grow as beer sits , eventually settling and leaving a nice lacing .

appearance : its body has a deep orange amber color with a very slight haze to it . it is also full of visible carbonation racing up to the head . the head is just off white in color and very thick and creamy . it has excellent retention and it maintains a good cap of foam until the end .
a : deep reddish brown and crystal clear . lots of nice head that laces beautifully . a surprising amount of carbonation is apparent .
appearance : poured 12 oz bottle into sam `` perfect pint '' glass . all looks well , with appropriate head and carbonation .
a : pours a very dark brown almost black with a creamy two finger off white head . settles to a one finger head that lasts the entire time and leaves great thick creamy lacing .
a : pours a hazy , orange-amber body with off-white head .

a : this is a beautiful looking beer . dark ruby brown hue . opaque due to the dark color . pours with a two inch buff head that dissipates down to around 1/4 inch . sticky lacing devlops as beer is quaffed .
a : white bubbly head dissipates slowly leaving a moderate amount of lacing . light to medium carbonation present . color is light gold .
a : pours a lightly hazy yet luminescent deep gold . head rises and falls , leaving splotchy lacing .
a : a very attractive pour ... moderate , off-white head that had good lasting appeal . quite thick and creamy , with good lacing . body is a deep-ruby color , and completely clear .
a : beautiful golden , great puffy head , decent lace .
a : pours a dark ruby color with a massive head that took forever to settle down . spotty lacing was left behind .
appearance : amber-brown body with admirable clarity and a one-third inch , ivory-hued head .
a : pours a golden yellow , with what seems to be good carbonation and almost no head .
a : flat as can be ( intentionally ) , deep yellow ( or in the case of dehydration it 's `` piss '' yellow ) .
appearance : had on tap at the continental lounge in san juan , pr . clear and straw gold with an almost instantly dissappearing white head . no retention nor lacing . just a little bubble action .
a : poured a cloudy dark copper color with almost no head . the cloudy colored brew is appealing but the lack of head was dissapointing .
a : creamy dark chocolate , caramel , a little belgian yeast , and alcohol . not nearly as pronounced i would have liked .
appearance : excellent pure black color , however absolutely no head , foam , or lacing to speak of . this would have been fantastic with some good lacing .
a : red ale with a pretty beige foam .
appearance : light brown/tan in appearance and murky . it pours a nice head that is frothy that seems to disappear quickly .
a : pour resulted in a one quarter inch white head . beer is amber in color .
a : pours a reddish orange body with a big off-white head with great retention that eventually becomes very rocky . leaves lacing all the way down the glass .

appearance : pours a light , golden straw color . very effervescent -- tiny streams of clear bubbles run up to the top long after the beer is poured . a very pretty beer , but less than average head retention and very little lacing .
appearance : slightly pale / golden color with a light and quickly vanishing head .
a : moderate pour yields one finger of tan , thick and frothy head with good retention . nearly opaque black with a hint of dark brown at the bottom edge .
a : pale straw in color , clear . white head that dissipates quickly . no lacing .
a : one finger head of no cream , unappealing thinness , and average retention . colour is a lemon-yellow . transparent . sm : lemon citrus ester hops and cream . pleasant if mild .
appearance : pours pitch black , which is kinda cool . head is tight brown and thick , reduces to nearly nothing . no lacing .

a : a nice , clear tawny brown into a standard pint glass . an aggressive pour brought out only 1 finger of head which settled to a ring around the glass with a couple of bubble islands in the middle of the mug . very fine lacing , but not much .
appearance : really nice golden/orange/yellow color with a 1/2 inch head . sporadic lace follows down the glass , while a thin fizzy white head remains the entire time .

a : pours a clear , deep amber color with a finger of off-white head in the snifter . retention is quite amazing , especially for 10 % . the final result is a collar on the brew , with no lacing down the sides .
a : pours a slightly hazy orange with two fingers of off-white head that recedes into a very thin ring with no lacing .
appearance : the body is a very dark ruby red color . the head is a finger tall , light tan head , great retention and beautiful thin lacing .
appearance : color : red caramel , beautiful carbonation : great head and its retention : excellent and a brown tint is it clear or cloudy ? clear caramel red
a : pours a very deep brown with a huge pillow of a tan head . excellent retention . little to no lacing , what 's there is sparse and patchy .
a : black with a tan head , very little retention ( especially considering it 's a stout ) , but it initially leaves a light lacing .
a : barely poured a white head . the foam that did come out quickly dissipated . unfiltered , golden color .

appearance : holy foam , batman . the beer pours entirely as foam and is creating beer as i type . kind of a role reversal , huh ? transparent , garnet/orange hue with a towering ivory head . plenty of coating lace swallows up the crystal from the inside of the vessel . interesting experience . it might take 30 minutes just to drink the contents of the bottle .
a : murky swamp brown with no head .
a : poured from bomber a dark black color with good lacing and one finger tan head
a : very clear amber , does n't look particularly exciting except for the lovely foamy head .
a : kind of a dirty murky brown with no head at all . hmm ...
a : pours a lightly hazy yellow with a medium to full white head , good lace .

a : pours a hazy tawny-amber with copper translucence against the light . an aggressive pour yields a finger of light tan-colored head that retains moderately , resulting in a light film on top of the brew ( which in turn retains indefinitely ) and a thin collar around the edges . for a 15 % beer , to have any carbonation at all is impressive , and for it to stick around is mindblowing .
a : definitely looks the part , the beer is black , with maroon highlights possibly from the port used , with a thick , creamy tan head which lasts forever .
a : it 's a nice yellowish gold color , a bit hazy , very big bubbles but not very big itself with bad retention . not much lacing though .

a : kind of a weird funky head . one finger of off white frothy head that faded to a chunky lacing that floated all over the top of the body . lacing stuck to the side of the glass in chunks . body is totally cloudy and off yellow dirty piss colored .

a : extended pour yields a single layer of off-white colored coarse bubbles that dissipates quickly , forming a single ring along the side of the glass . beer is a cloudy brownish mud/clay . lacing is stringy and with no stick .
a : pours a dark honey-amber with a couple fingers of off-white head that held a good retention and left sheets of sticky lacing .

a : pours a hazy opaque orange shade with an awesome thick white head with great `` pancake batter '' bubbles in the middle . a picture of perfection . it leaves great lacing on my glass as i work my way through the bottle .

a : standard pour yields a 1 finger foamy , thick , off-white head that never seems to collapse or dissipate . beer is a clear , orangy-clay . lacing is patchy and thick with awesome legs and great cling .
a : crystal clear pale , bright gold body under 2 inches of pillowy white head . strong retention and plenty of lace . practically perfect for the style ; no complaints at all .
appearance : clear , red food dye body with a thin , thinning , pink head .
appearance : it 's an 18 % stout , how should it look ? thick , black , light defeating . the head is surprisingly large and rentetive , a nice dark mroon/tan color .
a : absolutely perfect . hazy dark golden body with a 2 finger off white head that has great retention . good lacing down the glass as well .
appearance : nice rich dark brown/black color with a thin coffee colored head that disappears quickly .
appearance : light yellow , amber
a : pours warm golden with a large , a bit uneven white head - rather thick for being a dortmunder . slow dissipation leaves pretty nice lacings .
a : hazy brownish red a little white head that dissipates instantly no lacing . ar : big nose of spice and caramel you can smell the caramel across the room . some bread/biscuit aromas .

appearance : poured out much lighter than expected , in terms of color/opacity , that is . a loose , tan head surged upward , peaking at about 3/4 of an inch in height . it then descended and settled as a modest cap . body is brownish-black with reddish shades . head retention is impressive , but body color and opacity are not .
a : very good for a light larger . golden , clear , puffy creamy head that slowly fades into the still waters . not as amber as most octoberfest beers is one slight .

appearance : this beer pours a crystal clear shinny light gold color with faint pure white bubbles . the beer appears quite effervescent like champagne as bubbles continue to cascade to the top of the glass after a strong pour .
a : pours a cloudy dark brown/orange . has a creamy white head and the lacing stays until the end .
a : sheer black with a thick , robust beige head comprised of various sized bubbles . the head displays great retention and absolutely coats the glass in lacing .

appearance : poured from a growler that was picked up by hophead101 for his epic tasting ! thanks again ! upon popping the swing top growler there was absolutely no pop or hiss coming from the growler that was filled that day from a counter pressure machine . this kind of scared me right off the start , but as we continued on it poured the ever so famous bight sunny golden yellow like the regular golden monkey . there is absolutely no head or bubbles here pours very still like wine . the viscosity seems to be medium and not overly heavy or thin .
a : the beer pours a headless murky muddy brown color , its quite unappealing i must say ...
a : slightly hazed pale orange-amber body topped by a stunningly solid , creamy finger of ecru foam . this head looks like meringue , but is so heavy it only leaves light lace . beautiful .

a : pours a two finger head of very slight cream , decent thickness , and good retention . colour is a solid cloudy orange . generally appealing . sm : orange peel , biscuity yeast , and fermented sugars . a mild strength aroma .
appearance : pours a burnt orange color , exceptionally clear , with a lasting white head .
a : pours a dark black with brown highlights , 1 finger of frothy brown head , nice lacing .
appearance : it has a nice pale/golden slightly cloudy colour to it . it has a nice white head that dies down moderatly and has some lacing .
a : dark amber with ruby highlights . little head with little lacing .

appearance : this was a hazy , glowing copper beer . i poured it very carefully down the side of the glass and still got a think , dense head over two fingers tall . it settled down very slowly , becoming even more dense and rocky . it left tons of thick foam on the side of the glass as it dissipated . after drinking , the glass was covering in lace , solid sheets in most places .
appearance : opaque brown body with a tan small head .
appearance : nothing particularly beery about this . basically lemonade with some bubbles . very syrupy .
a : dark brown , great lacing , 1/2 finger head .

appearance : great big white head , initially the texture of meringue . it 's fairly volatile so it breaks down quickly , but still retails excellently . body is a peachy red-orange and slightly hazy .
a : orange brown , a bit hazy , no head , solid particulate chunks floating around .
a : looks nice ! it 's dark brown in color with a creamy-looking off-white head , and it forms some pretty lacing on the way down .
a : pours a nearly opaque black with subtle amber highlights and a creamy , tan mousse . my initial impression is that this looks like a solid stout .
a : beautiful appearance . thick and hazy . nice copper color with huge head . legs cling to the glass .
a : body pours a hazy straw yellow , with a light white head that dissipates quickly . the level of carbonation is standrd , and no lacing is left behind .
appearance : hazy golden yellow with a goodly sized head ( about 1/3 '' tall at max ) . not much in the way of retention or lacing for a hefe .
a : looks really good . pours a reddish tint of gold , good sized head that stays for a long time .
a : pours a dark brown with a light head that does n't last too long . not murky .
appearance : beer had nice clear , deep , amber color . held the head nicely . decent lacing in the glass .

appearance : there was a very small off-gas when popping the cap , which was surprising ... but the beer is very cold . after a relatively aggressive pour the head was pretty small ( ~1/4 '' ) , but some pretty nice vortex action started and there were numerous bubbles rising to maintain the head at about 1/16 '' all the way across the top of the beer . there is already some lacing on the glass as the head recedes . after drinking , there are some heavy sheets of lace left on the glass .
a : completely opaque - does n't even let light through ! nice fluffy head , 1.5 fingers , white , good retention , decent lacing .
a : pitch plack with a nice mocha colored head that is moderately thick and retains very well . it leaves almost wine like legs when swirled , exactly what i am looking for in a stout
a : pale yellow with thin white head that quickly disappears . very urine-like .

a : aggressive pour yields a 1 finger coarse white head that dissipates quickly into a collection of big bubbles . beer is a clear lemon . lacing is very spotty with web-like patterns that cling very close to a barely-there head .

appearance : beautiful pale gold color , the foaming head envelopes the whole glass before equalizing out to a nice white foam on top , which does not dissipate . light amount of lacing on the glass .
appearance : pours a bright red with thick pink head that fades quickly . average lacing .

appearance : looks absolutely amazing . almost like a nitro-stout how the head suddenly rose from nothing , before settling to some sturdy light tan foam . dark brown body looks about black in the glass .
a : nice thick head , golden colour , nice pillars of bubbles rising up : perfect
a : honey colored , clear . medium white head with fantastic lacing .
appearance : wow , this is a beaut . stunning clear ruby red with mahogany undertones . a thick , pocked berg of espresso foam with excellent retention tops it . great lacing .
appearance : poured with a tan fizzy head that dissipated quickly leaving no lacing . the beer is a reddish brown color and completely clear , resembling cranberry-apple juice .
appearance : dark with very subtle reddish hues , with only a few hints of froathy bubbles . again , i 'm sure it 's historically accurate , but i do n't have to like it ...
a : black on the pour , non-translucent , with a very thin layer of bubbles capping the surface . bubbles reduced to a thin line around the glass . lacing was present but light .

a : pours a beautiful 3 finger fluffy white head with great retention . beer itself is a semi-cloudy peach color . lacing is patchy and full with great cling . perfection ... i ca n't imagine a beer looking more `` commercial-like '' than this one .
a : black , tan head , very little retention or lace .
appearance : pours a hazy amber color with a towering head that grows craggy and leaves curtains of lace around the pint glass
appearance : pours a light copper color with a firm head that dissipates quickly leaving some lacing .
a : appears an attractive dark purplish pink with a big frothy dark pink head . nice retention . great color in the body and the head , and great clarity .
a : great deep color . good head and lacing .
a : a very typical , clear and solid brown . head was more than i thought it would be , around an inch
a : a dark amber/brown color . this has a huge creamy , foamy beige head . spotty patches of thick lace . this does not look like any american ipa i have ever seen .
a : thick , three finger , creamy , tan head . great retention , leaving plenty of lacing . almost clear , reddish brown body . impressive looking .
a : this beer looks really good . crystal clear gold with very active carbonation from small bubbles . pillow like white head has incredible retention and leaves substantial lace .

a : garnered a dark caramel color but unfortunately no head at all nor lacing . i think i might have gotten a flat one considering there was little pop when uncorking . there is also a lot of big pieces of yeast floating throughout even after a very careful and soft pour .
a : the beer pours a clear brown color with no head at all , just a thin ring ...
a : deep and black , with just the tiniest collar of bubbly head that sticks around for a few moments and recedes to nothing . with each sip , there are some hints of brown through the edges .
a : i was also excited when i saw it in the glass . huge head that sticks like rib sauce to the glass and a nice ruby orangy beer . 4.5
a : pours a beautiful head that lasts forever - 3 fingers and leaves a great skim across the top during the entire session . cloudy orange in appearance
a : buoyant head ; solid black ( what else ? ) ; great carbonation
a : no sustained head

a : pours a one finger head of very slight cream , fair thickness , and poor retention . colour is a semitransparent yellow . sm : cream , stale barley , and caramelized malt . a mild strength aroma .
a : beautiful head & lacing , dark dark brown , probably one step above black . head retention was excellent .
a : no release of carbonation when corked : - ( clear , slightly claret hued brown liquid . very little head leaves very little trace of a ring in very little time . more head please .
a : pours a cloudy honey-gold with three fingers of white head that eventually recedes into a thin ring with no lacing . lots of floaties in this beer .
a : ridiculously large off-white head w/ great retention & lacing . hazy brown body .

a : the beer pours a slightly cloudy , but can still see through orange . a billow white head rose over two inches , but faded ridiculously fast , and left no lace . i could have sworn i had just poured a glass of soda , or orange shasta , strange .
a : pours a nice golden hue with a 1/2 finger head . great retention and spotty lace . nice to look at in the glass .
appearance : pours dark-straw or amber colour , with a sparse head and very limited carbonation . nothing special for a bitter , really .

a : poured a clear , pale copper-orange with a beautiful 2 finger frothy white head that had amazing retention while leaving a nice sheet lacing on the way down . visible carbonation was almost non-detect .
appearance : this was served without a lemon , thankfully . this beer had the typical cloudy witbier look . the thin head left quickly with nothing left behind .
a : urine yellow , kinda like the wahoo . almost no head . poor lacing .
a : copper orange body . rome was n't built in a day , but this head built up rapidly and fell faster than you can say brutus .
a : deep blood red color , a bit cloudy , great retention and lacing on the 2-finger head . could n't be better .
a : pale yellow-orange body boasting three fingers of fluffy white head . retention is great and leaves loads of lacing .

a : there was something seriously wrong with the yeast in this beer . a careful pour resulted in huge chunks of what i guess is yeast coming out of the bottle and into the glass . the resulting mess looked like a murky brown snow globe . it was absolutely full of white chunks . i do n't know if it was supposed to be like this but i doubt it .
a : pours a hazy mahogany body with a mild head . this came out of a pitcher , so i ca n't fault the appearance much as far as head goes .
a : quite a deep amber - quite a bit darker than many others of the same style . head fizzled up quickly and dramatically , but drops just as swiftly .
a : a healthy white head leaves think rings of lace down the glass . slightly hazy gold color .
a : poured a golden , macro yellow . not much head to speak of with little to no retention . no lacing to write mom about .
a : impressive look for a porter . brown , almost black with a thick lasting head and tan lacing .
a : pours a light yellow with two fingers of bone-white head that quickly fade . minimal lacing .
a : pale yellow gold , no head , wisp ring . appearance of a lot of upright beers are a little watery and the weakest part of the score . this one is no exception . 3/5
a : dark brown almost black in color with about 1/2 finger of head that disappeared fairly quickly . nice lacing though .

appearance : pours a cola brown with a one finger off-white head . not much retention , the head looks pretty thin and flimsy . not as appetizing as others once poured . even with an aggressive pour , it was pretty pathetic .
a : can is poorly designed , but big with the abv listed proudly and large .
a : dingy yellow-orange body , completely transparent , with precisely no head .
a : deep copper color with red shades
a : shining copper with a fizzy , quick-to-vanish head and moderate carbonation .

appearance : this one only get a 3.0 because i really like the color of it . i poured pretty hard ( i 'm not a fan of carbonation ) and i still got only a one finger head that disappeared before i could blink and no lacing to speak of .
a : nice golden color , a little dark for a pils , no head to speak of ( common from this brewery in my experience )
a : poured a beautiful copper color , head stayed through out , with good lacing , and substantial carbonation as well .

appearance : beautiful , clear , light amber beer with bubbles rising through the mug to the thin one finger hear . head is moderate in duration with light lacing . head will not keep volatile aromatic molecules in beer .

appearance : pours a dense , 2-finger head that recedes gradually and leaves beautiful lace on the glass . color is desribed on the bottle as being `` tawny , '' and i could n't agree more . bright and clear , no sign of haziness . gorgeous presentation .

a : pours a nice dark blackish hue with strong tones of brown showing through . the head was 2 full fingers in height with nice rich mocha coloring . the retention was good with a nice solid ring hanging around for the duration . spotty lace noted as well .
a : clear , golden yellow appearance . medium sized head that dissipates rather fast .
a : pale yellow color , slightly hazy , small head with little retention
a : deep copper with a solid white head that dropped a touch too quickly , though it was still leaving lacing from its small ring later in the session .

appearance : though it was served in a can , when pouring some out on the sidewalk for my dead homies , i noticed a pale yellow color . the color is much akin to standard cass and all korean macros for that matter . it is not in any way red ... the redness denotes the color of the can . that 's a standard korean misjudgment , and i find it oddly charming .
appearance : the beer poured a promising dark brown with ruby opaqueness . the beer has a tan head and looks creamy good . dam appearances arent everything .

appearance : poured from the glass flask into a brandy snifter . flat . about 6 bubbles form , then pop . flat looking liqour like beverage , which i have come to expect after reading some reviews . there is also some cloudy brown sediment in different shades . all in all , not very appealing looking for a beer . still , i was not deterred from embibing .
a : pours a golden honey color . finger size head that quickly retreats .
a : poured a murky cherry color with good carbonation leaving a dirty white cap
appearance : pours a nearly opaque brown body with a cascading 3 finger toffee colored head than recedes to nothing in less than a minute .
a : smoky colored
appearance : dark amber/ light brown -- too dark for an ipa , with off-white head that fades fairly quickly . ( score as a scottish ale : 3-3.5 )
a : standard pour reveals how viscous and heavy this one is . no head or lacing . beer is a cloudy reddish-silt color .
a : pours a hazy dark golden color with a soap-like crisp white head made mostly of big bubbles . you can see some carbonation rising from the glass to the foam cap .
a : light orange-golden , hazy color , with a large enough white head with good lacing .
a : a pretty gorgeous golden amber with a dense , white head . retention is pretty good , and there 's a little lace .
a : clear dark cherry ruby color . creamy tan head .
a : absolutely no light gets through , but retains a great foam ring around the glass .

a : the can opens with a fizz as the nitro widget releases its gas . the agitation almost caused white head to peter out over the mouth of the can . a three step pour into a guinness glass resulted in the magnificent visual bubbling effect . the stout 's body was a dark red-black color , more reddish at the narrower points of the glass . atop the black body was a white , slightly tan , head that stayed in place throughout the pint . visually stunning , regardless of how it may taste .
a : very light golden straw , little to no head
a : perfectly clear pale yellow . pours 1 finger head that falls almost immediately . some lace .
a : pours a hazy orange/red with a one finger head that dissipates quickly down to a very small layer of foam on top . nice sheets of lacing .
a : 1/2 finger of fine , lacy head . clear , dark brown , inviting .
a : great dark copper color with 2 finger head . good lacing .

a : disappointing , quite honestly . deep sienna color with nice clarity and minimal carbonation . even a vigorous pour would n't net much of a head . all i could get was a seltzer fizz that disappeared after only a few seconds in the glass . left no lace .
a : to me , this is just a gorgeous beer . amber gold glow , nice off-white head with minimal lacing as consumed .
a : an opaque brown body that exhibited absolutely no head or lace-like qualities . i contribute this to the high alcohol by volume , but still , not quite what i had anticipated for this beer .
a : no head , dark brown in color with a slightly reddish tint . the beer is nearly opaque when held up to a light , but not quite .
appearance : transparent brown w/ not much of a head and no lacing . maybe i 'm at part to blame as i poured it over-carefully as to not get a glass full of yeast like my first one .
a : an exceptional balance between pale yellow and orange , like orange blossom honey .
appearance : with an average pour not much head is produced , and lacing is basically nil . color is a dark amber/gold .
a : yellow tinted water with a one finger foamy white head that was gone in under 2 minutes .
a : deep amber color has good clarity and minimal carbonation . small fizzy head dissipates quickly and leaves no lace .

appearance : poured a nice golden color . clean and clear in appearance . this brew had a big creamy head to it that did not quickly dissipate . i had to let it sit for a couple of minutes before i could pour the rest .
a : murky brown with a thin tan head that quickly disappears . very boring looking , even a little off-putting .
a : cloudy deep orange . little head that audibly pops down to nothing pretty quick .

a : this time i choose to drink it `` kristalklaar '' ... in a 300ml weissbier glass it pours a slightly dark-golden colour , with an effervescent white beer head building up non-stoppingly , so tight and frothy the head simply refuses to go away ; exceptional for a british bottle-conditioned beer ( or my choice of glassware this time might greatly help with the head retention ? ? ) . carbonation is fierce at first but gradually softens and remains consistently lively , when combined with the colour the whole thing looks more like a bottled lager ! ! next to perfect , for a bottle-conditioned ale .
a : pours a tangerine colour with a frothy white head . very active while pouring , continues to bubble merrily afterwards .
appearance : awesome golden , crystal clear , body with a sticky , film-like head that stuck to the side of the glass like a glue stick . yeast sediment was heavy at bottom .

appearance : pours a very dark brown color -- almost black . even with a careful pour , a good 3 '' of head forms , which hindered me the entire rest of the beer . would not go away . pretty impressive retention and lacing . when held up to light i see some dark ruby highlights . great looking brew .

a : hazy , chock-full-o sediment . honestly , it 's a bit revolting to me . but i know that the overall color ( amber ) and texture ( lots of fine carbonation ) appear to be fine , so i 'll just slightly rate it below average .
a : a deep golden color with a tinge of copper , soft cottony head , some lacing down the sides of the glass - 4.50 ,

appearance : hazy golden body peppered with lots of small and large particles in solution . up top , over two fingers of fluffy white head that leaves great lacing . as you approach the bottom of the bottle , it becomes almost milkshake thick with terrific sediment .
a : this is a very dark ruby red , not quite black . it pour with a big foamy off-white that leaves lots of lace in its wake .
appearance : yellow , short white head that dissipates as fasts as it forms . leaves no lacing . worse head retention than soda .
a : pinkish/purple cloudy brown with a cream collar and creeping lace .
appearance : poured a beautiful orange and yellow with a nice , light haze . the selling point was seeing that abundant crisp , white head rise up in front of my eyes .

appearance : a nice light gold in color , very cloudy , tons of sediment here . a small wispy head gave way to very little lacing or retention . kind of dissapointing since the color of this is the only thing holding it up in the looks column .
appearance : straw yellow , huge pillowing head , and some lacing .
a : deep brown sugar colored with a super huge off-white head that fades slowly . very good .
a : poured into conical pint glass . cloudy dark amber white small white head that quickly dissipated . good lacing .
appearance : the body of the beer is black . the head has a dark brown coloration with a raspberry hue . the head quickly resolves to a thin film .
a : comes in a clear dark amber hue , with incredibly thick frothy beer head sustaining forever , it seems . one of the most beautifully presented pint i 've ever had the pleasure to taste .
a : opaque pale yellowish , typical wheat beer color .

a : pours a one finger head - quite thin , without cream , and of okay retention considering the abv . colour is a hazy murky light dirty copper . sm : light cream , pleasant yeast , and some nice toasted malt . aroma is moderate in strength .

appearance : pours into my victory becker a crystal clear , golden copper-orange . the head is a dark beige and holds pretty steady until finally dropping to a hearty collar with patchy bubbles all over the surface .

appearance : a nice two finger head that is off white in color and has pour retention . the color of the beer is an amber color with orange hues . the clarity is slightly hazy . there is some effervescence in the beer .
a : 5 - opaque black with loads of tan head and massive amounts of lacing . a beautiful beer .

a : blonde , amber with a one finger head . poured from a 25 oz bottle into two glasses . the yeast starts a flowin about 2/3 through and unless you wan na drink all the yeasties , you lose about a fifth of the bottle . i chose to drink the plethora of yeasty particulates , but it definitely loses some points for appearance .

a : poured slowly into a duvel tulip glass . same beautiful head that its little brother `` professor gesser '' has . 2/3 of the glass is filled with cream-colored fluff and the bottom 1/3 is glowing orange . carbonation speeds to the top and the head slowly ( very slowly ) recedes . lacing holds on forever .
a : clear and golden . head is light and bubbly , disappearing quickly and leaving splotchy and uneven lace .
a : clear golden honey , very sturdy off-white head . i may be hallucinating but i thought i detected a greenish tone in the shadows of the fluffy stuff . very nice appearance .

a : pours a very nice , cloudy , light caramel color with a massive 3.5 finger widths of white head . the head is very dense and last forever , taking literally well over 10 min to dissipate to a level that allows drinking . about a finger widths head remains and lasts the entire drink , leaving some of the heaviest lacing i have ever seen . cant imagine a better looking beer .

appearance : this beer pours a 1 finger head that recedes quickly , but leaves a lot of lacing on the glass regardless of temperature . very pretty brown/red almost rusty orange color that is completely opaque and darker than i expected . the second beer i poured of course was completely saturated with yeasty floaters throughout . i do n't mind this and actually like the taste of the yeast in my beer .
appearance : poured a crystal clear light yellow color . half finger bubbly white head with minimal retention . visible carbonation . no lacing .
a : clear brown , very little head .
a : pretty much black . one finger of creamy/frothy light brown head that falls quickly and does n't stick much . there 's also some nonuniformly sized crap floating throughout . not a looker . 4.0
appearance : deep dark brown nearly black , no head rentetion at all and poured very rough

a : poured a hazy lemonade color with light orange hues and an outright explosive carbonation factor that literally looked like a torrential tropical storm inside the glass . large bran flake like yeast matter race up and down inside the glass in the strong circulating current . the wild yeast was evident upon the pour yielding a quickly evolving snow white rocky head that rose with authority into a towering structure . all the time i was marveling at the beers coloring and head in my glass , unbeknownst to me the bottle was spewing foam like an erupting volcanoe at a steady and fast rate forcing me to run for backup glasses to catch the runoff and do some containment and reclamation effort . the lacing provided an incredible coverage on the glass of large patches of foam after the slow retreat of the head . after more then 5 minutes the effervesce eventually settles down a bit revealing a thick haziness and coloring that was similar to orange juice . an absolute picture perfect example in the glass worthy of any beer mag cover . perfect regards from me here .
appearance : rapture stout comes out very dark with dark brown and ruby hints around the edges . head is a light tan color , and has okay lacing , but reduces down to nothing .
a : pours dark black with a bubbly brown head .
appearance : slightly cloudy dark yellow/orange . off white foamy head 1 1/2 fingers . looks good to go .
a : pours a very dark brown with a giant , foamy , everlasting head . perpetual sustain and heavy lacing .
appearance : slightly murky coca cola brown with a light beige head of fine bubbles . slightly sloppy pour resulted in a 2+ finger head . some yeast chunks visible .
appearance : 12oz bottle poured into sam adams `` perfect pint '' . cloudy golden-wheat colour . thin bubbly head . visible moderate carbonation .
a : pours a dark amber/polished copper like color with about half an inch of off white head . clarity is perfect and lacing is quite nice as well
a : poured a deep copper color with less than a fingers worth of head that settled to nothing with no lacing .
a : the beer pours a semi-hazy yellow color with a very fizzy white head ...

appearance : pours a light golden colour which is a little brown . the head formation was pretty poor and the head subsided quite quickly leaving little to no head or lacing . the carbonization was also visibly non-existent .

a : not much of a lager drinker , but the beer was invaded by bubbles . i mean hundreds of them ! the color was crystal clear and a light golden honey color . pouer with a decent head that did seem to dissapate rather quickly leaving little lacing . not that impressed ...

appearance : a one finger dark brown head that is creamy and bubbly . the color of the beer is dark brown/black . the clarity of the beer is opaque . there is some carbonation bubbles on the side of the glass .
a : really clear and chicken broth-like .
a : yellow urine color with a thin head that remained on the sides of the glass
a : light gold in color with a thin white head that dissipates quickly and leaves no lacing .
a : seriously impressive . viscous , black pour with a thick , creamy , dark brown head with excellent retention . truly evil looking .

a : pours a dark amber color with a pretty thick white head . the beer itself looks cool , but the label ... well , do n't get me started . i used to think the old label art was pretty cool looking . it reminded me of what halloween used to be . this new one though , looks like it was made in photoshop in about an hour . i typically dont care about art on the beer , but this new one sucks compared to what they had . got ta take a point off for that .
a : dark brown , with a thin head that does not linger much
a : slightly cloudy , golden amber . minimal fizzy head with very little lacing and a flimsy film .
appearance : pours a hazy copper color with a gargantuan head that becomes problematic but does leave good lacing

appearance : good looking beer . big two finger mocha color medium thick looking head with lots of fizzy head initially . black and opaque . no carbonation evident . decent film remains until the end and leaves some lacing down the sides .
appearance : the worst part of the beer . hardly any head at all , and looks to be a thin amber/honey color . no lacing , and you can almost see very fine carbonation .
appearance : the beer poure a very pleasing clear brown with a nice off white head . leaves behind seemingly nice rings of lacing .
a : poured from a bottle to a pilsner glass . had a yellow color and a clear consistency . there was a small amount of foamy head . very little lacing .
a : cloudy yellow color , 1 finger width white head , good lace
a : the beer is a very pale straw yellow color with an extremely thin white head that fades instantly and leaves no lace on the glass .
a : wonderful red/amber color with two fingers of white head . lacing from the top of the glass down .

a : pours a clear yellow color ... literally almost clear when light is put up to it . yields a fingers worth of white head that fizzles to nothing , but not too quickly . certainly lasts for longer than other craft brews i 've had , abv aside

a : beer is a pale straw yellow with very active carbonation and an unbelievably pillowy white head that sits about three fingers high and hangs around for ages leaving gobs of sticky lacing on the side of the glass as it gradually recedes . a thick cap is left behind for good measure
a : pours brown with a large tan thick head . lots of lacings .
a : hazy , cloudy , dirty straw ; very little head , retention or lacing .
appearance : pale gold color , slightly greenish . white head that dissipates to a thin layer , no lacing .
a : pours a perfectly clear straw-yellow with a cap of white foamy head .
a : i was n't expecting much from the look of this . it 's a muddy ice tea color .

a : great orangish appearance . reminds me of a perfectly ripe peach . lacing is clumpy and lingers . n : spice , specifically peppercorn , is foremost but is rounded out nicely with summer fruits ( peach and apples predominantly ) . hints of banana esters really hit home that this is a saison . while i do enjoy the components , i do n't feel they work very well together in this beer .
appearance : not even all that hazy , kinda looks like a pilsner , and no head and no lacing really . disappointing .
appearance : pours a translucent piss yellow with what starts out at a 2 finger length that dissipates in about 10 seconds to leave no tracing lace behind .

a : let me say this now . there is nothing more impressive than the head on a belgian ipa . it looks like drifting artic landscape . this beer poured with around 5 fingers of head into a big ass duvel tulip . the lacing melts the glass . very hazy blonder color . looks like a darker version of a heff .
a : pours a deep dark brown almost black color with a thick tight brown foam head . there is tons of lacing down the sides .
appearance : very pale yellow color . the head is gone in a matter of seconds .
a : pours deep amber with a rather large tan head that dissipates slowly leaving rich lacings .
appearance : despite an increasingly hard pour , no head arose over the espresso brown liquid
appearance : dark brown color , with an obvious cherry tint and an actual cherry glow , although there is no head whatsoever .
appearance : very watery and flat looking . looks pale yellow , almost like murky water .

a : i do n't know if its from the style or not , but it pours a cloudy light amber . unless its an unfiltered beer i do n't really approve of cloudy ( could be part of the style ) . head is a light yet thick 2 finger minimum head . head leaves a good lacing all the way down the glass . not a lot of film from the beer . a lot of carbonation can be seen too .
a : very dark , red-tinged brown , and quite hazy . plenty of head on this one , and plenty of lacing .
appearance : nice pillowy head and lacing . very dark brownish red body turning brilliantly translucent in the light .

appearance : pours with an amazingly dense 4 fingered head of nearly white foam . this settles very slowly and hardly at all , still retaining most of its original height . where it has dropped , the lacing is thick and sticky . amazing . the beer itself is cloudy and orange .
a : pours a light amber with a slight haze and 1 inch of off white head that drops to a thin film .
a : this is a beautiful lager . golden , clear , big slow moving bubbles crowned by a foamy white head that stands the test of time .
a : nice gold color , great frothy head , wonderful lacing .
a : hazy , dark reddish-brown color with a peripheral ring of golden brown bubbles . light lacing remains on the glass and fine sediment is plentiful .

appearance : pours thick 3 finger off chunky off-white head . slow to dissipate . heavy lacing . orangish amber color . very clear . flavor : astringent , soapy flavor . light caramel . a lot of earthy/minerally flavors . high bitterness .
a : pours a hazy yellow-orange with three fingers of white head that fades into a dense white cap with a solid sheet of lacing .

appearance : hazy , pale yellow with some of the sediment poured in . tons of bubble action surfacing in the middle , with bubbles on the side of the glass slowly coming up . almost look 3-d in a way , and it 's very nice . head 's still sticking around , with the lacing pretty thick , too .

a : clear dark brown copper colored with decent 1.5 finger head that slowly fades ( similar to autumnfest but a little darker ) n : eh , lots of nutmeg , cinnamon , spice , a little pumpkin , and sugar , that 's about it
a : pours a medium amber with a light off-white head , fair retention , light lace .
a : black to dark brown beer , with a very thick light brown head which sticks while drinking the whole beer and leaves a large amount of lacing .
appearance : orange w/ some red dashed in , but still pretty clear . some slight head at the beginning but it fades quickly
a : clear orange-gold color , pours a thick cream-colored head that slowly falls into a thick cap with excellent lacing .
a : deep amber mahogany color that looks purple plum when awary from the light . only about a half finger of frothy off-white head that falls quickly , but does leave some sparse lacing . 4.5
a : opaque brown color that pours a very thick light tan head that stays around til the very end .
a : beer poured a clear , pale gold color with a sparse white head that fizzled right out .

appearance : pours with a beautiful cascading effect which initially produces a creamy , pale yellow turbulance within the glass , which after a mimute or two settles to a clean , clear , golden color . the head is decent and lasting .

appearance : pours a transparent dark brown with garnet highlights . a 3 '' tall , light tan , foamy head builds and sticks around for some time . lots of coating lace , with tiny holes everywhere shedding light through .

appearance : black albert is a phenomenal looking beer . it pours almost pitch black with a couple fingers of mocha colored head , even with a careful pour . retention is very nice and lacing is great . one of the best looking imperial stouts out there .
a : very striking appearance on this beer . a real bright orange/straw color , explosive bright white head . great lacing throughout .

a : poured into a smaller snifter this virtually black bodied beer has a reverse cascading burnt caramel head that flexes with all its might . lacing is great . head retention is n't amazing , but great too . dark and mean , what a ris should look like .

a : clear ruby-black body with a moderate amount of carbonation rising from the etched `` d '' ; 3+ finger head fills half the tulip with frothy tan foam that seems unwilling to go away , and leaves nice chunky lace when it finally does . awesome looking barleywine .

a : beautiful dark brown pour with a gigantic head and lots of effervescent bubble action drifting towards the bottom ; finally settles to about 1 finger of light tan head , no lace , and a pitch black body .
a : amber with excellent clarity for a bottle conditioned beer . very active carbonation . soapy off-white head has amazing retention and leaves a very heavy lace . an really nice looking beer .
appearance : very dark amber with reddish hints . the head is minimal and does n't last long ... a rather disappointing appearance in all .
a : thin off white head . very dark brown . a little sporadic lacing . somewhat disappointing .
a : standard pour yields near no head . beer is an opaque black . lacing is spotty and stringy with no cling but nice legs . a bit below average . thick and viscous looking though .

a : pours an extremely dark clear brown with a super carbonated spritzy head that foamed up in the glass . head disappeared rather quickly though and receded into a thin collar that left a pretty decent sheet of lacing down the glass .
a : black with huge brown head . nothing i can think of to add or change as far as appearance .
appearance : semi-hazed gold beer with amber hues . head pours moderate and settles in a mere whisp of a lace .
a : dark , a little ruby around the edges when held up to the light . not much head , fades quickly . almost no lacing .
appearance : crystal clear golden body , nice crisp white head that stuck around . lots of bubbles up to the top . good lacing too .

appearance : pours a very clear amber color with about 1/2 '' of tan bubbles on top after an aggressive pour . there are some bubbles rising , but the head is on its way somewhere within the first 30 seconds . the beer leaves some solid lacing on the glass after drinking , so it is a very well presented dipa .
appearance : light golden hue , good clarity , poor head development from this sample
appearance : sunflower golden yellow body with enormous bubbles and a fizzy white head that just ca n't hold itself together for more than a few seconds . pathetic .

a : clear chestnut color with ruby highlights when held to the light . generous bubbles up the glass . pours with a 2 '' dense head that continues to grow in the center of the glass , resulting in an ice-cream-cone like appearance . takes close to 10 minutes to die down into a half-inch of foam on top of the brew . leaves nice rings of lacing down the glass as i sip .
a : pours a very deep brown color but not quite black , pours with an inch of foamy tan head . leaves a nice amount of lacing around the glass
a : clear orange-amber body under a finger of fine off-white head . mediocre retention and spotty lace . ok , but nothing special .
appearance : pale yellow similar to most light lagers with little head and lacing
appearance : no lacing and about 1/4 inch of white foam that did n't last . light yellow color ( color of urine )

a : pours golden orange with a massive 3 finger head , white and extremely tight with great retention . i could have flown to paris and back and the head would still be standing tall . leaves a ton of lacing .
a : nearly black , with a touch of maroon showing dimly through the glass . head is cream in color and texture .

appearance : pours a two finger medium-thick white head with great retention . perfectly clear amber orange in color with lower amounts of carbonation . head fades to a thin wisp and a foamy ring , leaving some lacing . a film remains and leaves lots of nice lacing down the glass . good looking for sure , and surprisingly clear for the style .
a : pours a very nice deep golden color that is quite hazy , pours with a nice amount of head and leaves a bit of lacing
appearance : still the same lovely look , a bit nicer of a head that lingers more and provides more lacing . maybe because it 's not in a chilled glass ? the difference is amazing ... looks perfect

a : crystal clear and yellow , the beer begins teeming with effervescence and opens with a thick white head . the bubbles diminuendo to stillness , while the head exhibits staying power and coats the glass in white lacing . a very impressive appearance .
appearance : black with a fluffy 2 '' head that falls to a thick surface foam . thick lacing paints the glass .
appearance : hazy , no head . minimal lacing .
a : pours a very dark amber with a lively & enormous brown-orange head that displays magnificent retention . looks as if someone dropped a mini throw-pillow on top of it . gorgeous .

a : the body presents an atypical lager hue of gold and yellow . the white head began at around 2cm and ended at 0.2cm with minimal lacing - no i did n't actually physically measure it , these figures are approximates .
a : pours a dark red color . no head and no lace forms .

appearance : murky sun tea color , rusty orange brown . very cloudy with noticeable sediment . enormous ivory head that clings to the glass and laces their entire way down . this head has load bearing capacity , that is how significant it is . i think that it has the most impressive head ive ever seen on a beer . deserves a 5 on the appearance for the head alone .

appearance : cherry red with almost no carbonation . small bubbles formed low in the glass , but nothing like a head appeared . flavor : a tart cherry taste with some horse blanket aspects to it . nice dry finish .
a : medium golden yellow , transparent . 1 '' head disappeared quickly after pouring ( although not into a suitable glass )
a : pour from bottle resulted in a good frothy head that dissipated into a well laced top and sides . coppery brown color and very clear .
appearance : pours a motor oil black with a 2 finger creamy chocolate brown head . excellent lacing . looks pretty much perfect for a stout .
a : opaque black . 1 finger tan head with excellent retention and lacing .
a : light amber ; moderate head
a : reddish dark amber ; light head ; not much carbonation
a : pours an opaque black into a tulip with a half finger of light brown head that dissipates quickly and leaves some spotty lacing on the glass for the first third of the beer then nothing .
a : cloudy golden orange hue . solid two fingers of cream colored head . thick lace rings remain .
a : rusty orange amber . tiny wisp of beige head . no lace no cap .

appearance : glugged into the glass , the whole bottle would n't fit so i waited until the head dissipated . 2 '' head right off the bat clung to the top of the glass . brown/gold color with moderate carbonation surfacing . some head still lingers at the miniscus of the beer .

a : pours a hazy deep ruby-brown body . massive 2 '' slightly off-white head seems to take forever to fade to a thin film . lots of big , thick strings of lacing are left on the glass , mostly from the initial head . a narrow column of tiny carbonation bubbles rises very quickly from the center of the glass .
a : a nice deep brown , almost mahogany . good amount of head , but it goes away almost instantly .
a : pour is hazy orange with a rather small white soapy head . slow dissipation leaves some lacings .
a : the beer pours a bright , clear amber finishing with 1 '' of fluffy white head . the head has fairly long retention and diminishes with a bit of sticky lace on the side of the glass .

a : this beer wins with is it 's appearance . a very inviting reddish hue , it pours and settles to leave the drinker with absolutely no lace . looks more like a carbonated wine than a beer in my pint glass .

a : dark copper with a slightly off-white head that lingers leaving a beautiful lacing on the glass . there is some haze , but that 's probably cause the beer was bottle-conditioned and i accidentally just dumped all the sediment in ( long day at work and i was rushing to pour my evening beer ) .
appearance : an orange , yellow and brown beer is transparent with plenty of active carbonation . the head is a huge 4 '' + , off-white , great retention and plenty of lace .
appearance : fairly watery overall . not much carbonation . good initial foam , almost no lacing . golden color , practically straw yellow . lots of condensation on the glass .

a : pours a very deep brown , but not black color , and actually pours quite thin looking . a fairly attractive light khaki colored 1 finger head . some decent lacing after a few vigorous swirls , and some memorable legs . n : very green and fresh smelling chocolate , dominated by heavily roasted malt . some coffee on the nose as well .

a : it pours out dark brown , with a very small tan head . it 's probably only about a third of my thumb width . the head goes away very fast , leaving nothing but a tan ring . there is some lacing on the glass .

appearance : pours a pretty pale golden which is very translucent . no real definite head , though there is some rather small lace going on . i 'd say the aesthetic appearance of the beer is it 's only downfall , as well as the lack of head & head retention .
appearance : pours literally like lemonade ( minus the head ) . totally hazy with a 2-3 finger head . really dig the look .
a : clear golden with a large white head that has great retention and lacing .
appearance : orange amber in color with a thick 2 '' head . lacing was thick as a coat of paint on the side of the glass .
appearance : this is wonderful looking beer . it pours like motor oil . nice and rich black with a 2 finger dark brown head

appearance : a golden color with a copper hue . there was an ivory one finger head that diminished to a quarter inch ring around the glass . there is a lot of effervescence in the beer . the clarity of the beer is clear and brilliant .
a : a very deep brown , clear when held to light . 2 finger offwhite head that does n't seem to ever go away . i actually got excited when this beer came out . rare occurance for me .
a : truly appealing in every way . barely hazy yellow-orange with meringue 1-2 finger foamy white head with exceptional pile of lace down one side of the glass .
appearance : pale yellow color with some white bubbles on top .
a : fairly light copper colored and pretty clear . a barely off-white sea foam head tops it off . excellent head retention and lots of lacing . this stuff looks sticky as hell .
a : very pale yellow color with very light head and no retention . no lacing .
appearance : an ominous dusky , light-less cloudy brown with dark cherry highlights , hinting at an overt aggressiveness in flavor . the small head stays throughout .
a : pale yellow body , with an almost greenish tint . carbonation is intense and bubbles in the head are large .

a : pours a hazy golden color with a wonderful lively frothy white head on top . some `` pancake batter '' bubbles in the middle . i like that . this brew is leaving great lacing on my glass as i work through it .
appearance : this beer poured a light yellow hue with a foamy bright white head that stacked up roughly an inch and a half . there are many columns of bead floating to the top .
appearance : semi-hazy orange/copper with a thin finely carbonated off-white lace that dissipates quickly .
appearance : a tan head that was two or so fingers high , great retention , thick and abundant lacing and a dark brown ( not quite black ) body .
a : copper colored , decent head
a : standard pour yields a coarse 1 finger white head that dissipates quickly . beer is a clear peach-apricot . no lacing . a rather shabby looking beer overall .

appearance : pretty clear burnt orange color with an initially assertive head . the head fell to end up as a 1/8 layer of foam on top of the beer , and this maintained for quite some time . there was some lacing left on the glass after drinking .
a : i have to admit the appearance was actually good for a really light colored beer . the head stayed there for the entire drink and the lacing was amazing .
a : pours a golden yellow colour with a lot of fizz that dissipates rather too quickly for my liking .
a : pours black with a perfect two finger tan head . thick lace , great head retention . my first 5 in a while , but just an exemplary looking stout .
a : really cloudy orange , quite bubbly , nice 2-finger white head . retention great , lacing great . a nice looking beer .
a : pours a hazy brown with amber hues , with tons of sediment even on a fairly cautious pour . capped by a one finger white head that recedes fairly quickly .
appearance : poured for the 22 oz bomber black into a pint glass ( two pours ) . brown head about 1/4 inch sits on the black viscous liquid that light does not penetrate .
a : nice , big off white head that does n't stick around too long . decent amount of lacing . poured cloudy and the color of apple cider . really nice looking in the glass .
a : pours a nice golden orange color . there is a snall tan foam head with sufficient lacing .
a : poured a good thick head peaking right at the top of the glass and forming a decent amount of lacing down the glass as the head slowly recessed . pink/rose in color .
appearance : pours amber in color . nice off-white 1 inch thick head . minute lacing .
a : beautiful slightly hazy golden peach color with fluffy white head that leaves some lacing around glass . got ta say i have never seen this color in any beer before .
appearance : cloudy pale orange , medium head retention , mild lacing .

appearance : pour is darkest brown/near black ; starts with a 1/2 finger tan head that fades quickly to a thin wisp and uneven ring around the surface ; body is opaque , but you can still seel some relatively strong looking carbonation holding to and bubbling near the sides ; faint webs and loose oily spots of lacing are left hanging around .

appearance : pours thick medium brown head . very slow to dissipate . tons of foam clinging to side of glass more like whip cream than beer head . pours thick like motor oil . black hole black in glass . some ruby highlights when pouring and at edge of glass . flavor : creamy chocolate up front followed by acrid notes and coffee flavor . thick caramel sweetness lies on tongue in aftertaste .
appearance : dark , dark , and a bit dark , dark head . getting spooky in here .
a : clear , bight red-amber body with a thin quarter-inch head of fine off-white foam ; what little head there is quickly dissipates into an island of miniscule bubbles . no lace .
a : crystal clear medium amber body beneath a very nice three-finger head of soft , frothy white foam . great rocky retention , and plenty of lace . gorgeous beer .
appearance : bright yellow . head fizzes into nothingness . looks like soda pop .
a : impressive , atypical blood/ruby red , the head retains quite well .
a : pours a light gold with orange/amber highlights . nice thick one finger head dissipates slowly to some foam on top . very nice lacing left on the glass .

a : poured a slightly bronzed , golden amber color with tons of lively carbonation and thick , pillowy head of sterling white carbonation which held to one-finger throughout the brew and left some nice soapy lace . very nice !
a : copper red colour , looks really promising . good layer of foam , disappeared pretty quick , but the colour is enchanting .
a : a murky , dark piss yellow , as if you 've been drinking this beer for a few days or weeks ... nothing special .
a : pours a deep black under a very small slightly off white head . no lace , a small ring of retention .
