a : 12 oz . nr poured into an imperial pint glass . beer is very pale for a mrzen/oktoberfest ... a bright golden color with an ever so slight chill haze to it . a 1-finger head of fizzy foam dissipates quickly to a very thin cap . barely any retention and only the slightest bit of fine lace .
a : pours a hazy golden-straw color with a couple fingers of incredibly dense bright white head that took forever to fade into a dense , thick film that left thick stripes of lacing down the glass .
appearance : hard pour yields a reasonable head of white foam that manages to linger a respectable amount of time . golden , slightly hazy brew , minimal carbonation .
a : pours a cloudy reddish-amber , with almost no head ; just a bit of off-white foamy residue on the center surface/edges of the beer .
appearance : poured into a clear glass mug , red oval formed a fluffy two-inch head that melted away to nothing . still looked good , though .

appearance : pours a thinner looking one finger tan/brown head that makes tones of crackling noises . poor retention , head dissipates very quickly and disappears totally . dark brown and some carbonation in the form of little bubbles . resembles flat cola .
appearance : a hard pour produced only a one finger white head . clear golden yellow . despite the head dropping to nothing i still had a little bit of lacing .
a : frothy off-white head falls quickly to nothing . looks more like diarrhea out of a growler for some reason . 4.5

a : pours like a stout : a dark chocolate ( brown ) color that is nearly opaque , with only the slightest bits of light peeking through the edges . unlike a stout , this has a generous off-white head that speaks to ample carbonation , and it leaves some lacing down the glass .
a : poured a dark purple with a pinkish head and some good lacing on the glass . there was also berry like sediments floating in the beer .
a : pours a yellow color with a one finger white head which almost immediately disappears . carbonation is moderate . lacing is almost none existent .
appearance : pours a slightly hazy golden yellow with thick , fluffy , stiff white head that wo n't quit . great retention and leaves lots of lacing .
a : semi-hazy amber with a lasting eggshell-colored head that leaves sticky lace around the rim of the glass .
a : pours a pale golden with a fluffy white head that has nice retention and lacing .
a : bottled , very clear , no head , dull gold .
a : blood red color . clear with a pinkish-red head that dies quickly .
appearance : 4
appearance : black like the back ground on this page
appearance : deep dark but crystal clear mahogony color . just barely off white head that dwindles down and leaves nice lacing .
a : pours slightly hazy gold with white , billowy head . retention and lacing are disappointingly lackluster . minimal effervescence .
appearance : 750ml bottle poured into duvel tulip . pours a very dark brown with a reddish hue . two-finger head is thick and rich . very nice head retention .

a : dark brown , not quite black in the body with a pretty pathetic looking `` head '' if you 'd like to even call it that . no retention other than some tiny bubbles around the walls of the glass . no lacing , either ( no pun intended ) .
appearance : deep gold color ; rich , creamy , white head . foam stays for few minutes , leaving nice lacing . medium carbonation .
appearance : light brown , ok clarity , meager layer of off-white foam that quickly dissipates
appearance : very very dark maroon color which lets very little light through . head quickly dissipates , and no lacing . visually , it 's a very stunning beer .
a : one finger head of fair cream and thickness . a hazy copper colour . appealing , if not for the poor retention of the head . sm : barley , lots of hops . maybe an apple ester ?

appearance : totally black body , thick , with a really dark brown head ( about 3 fingers ) . looks awesome ! once the foam has died down , the color of the remainder is a cross between strong espresso and caramelized sugar .
appearance : hazy/translucent golden yellow beer . foam disappeared quickly and never reappeared again . no lacing either .
appearance : pours like light-coloured gingerale : the palest beer i 've ever seen , a fairly decent head except for the bubble-popping noise , and frighteningly large-bubble carbonation .

appearance : poured into a ravenhead dimple . i was expecting ipa so i was a bit disappointed with the appearance . copper-colored . loose two-finger head , composed of big bubbles . ended up with some pretty big chunks from the krausen in my glass . yeasty aroma i do n't detect any hoppy notes . flavor : complex notes of oak , sake , pineapple , brown sugar , yeast . no real notable hop character aroma .
appearance : beautiful , a deep cherry color and a pink head , nice retention , lacing on the side of the glass as i drink it .
a : pours a copperish amber color with a small white foam head that quickly dissipates to a film . no lacing .
a : black with a tan head . great retention & lacing .
appearance : zero foam or lacing . bright gold with good transparency . extremely disappointing . ginger ale ! on my third try with this one i got some ok foam . it still disappeared right away .

a : a slightly hazy medium amber body with half and inch of tight white foam is the result of a fairly harsh pour . kind of flat , and kind of disappointing . still , not an ugly beer ( although definitely dark for a saison ) .

appearance : pours into my duvel tulip a crystal clear amber with a distinct reddish hue . the head is slightly off-white and one full finger high , and it seems to last thanks to the etching in the bottom of the glass . giant spider webs of lace track the entire way down the glass .
a : pours a light orange color , nice 2 finger width frothy white head with lots of lacing down the glass . much lighter in color than i expected a winter beer to be .
appearance : striking kool-aid red body , huge off-white head which leads a lot of lace as it fades . streams of carbonation make their way to the surface .
a : orange-yellow cloudy , very little head
appearance : pours a hazy golden body with a frothy egg white head that shows good retention and leaves plenty of lacing
a : poured a dark , dark brown , almost black , that came gushing out of the bottle after a hard pour ... well ... flat as a pancake .
a : light yellow.. very pale straw.. clear body.. head settles very quickly..

appearance : just as i remember , guinness is one of the best looking beers i 've ever seen . the upward cascade of nitrogen bubbles is a sight to behold . once the process is complete you 're left looking at a beer that looks like it 's straight out of promotional material . it 's picture perfect , the edge between the head and the beer itself looks like it was drawn on with a ruler . speaking of the head there was about two fingers worth and it stuck around for the duration leaving some quality lacing . the beer itself is black at first glace , but mahogany tones come through when any light hits .

appearance : pours with 1 1/2 fingers of nearly pure white head . this settles slowly to a thin yet complete cap of foam , leaving behind nice lacing . the beer itself is a bright , medium yellow and perfectly clear . shows a fair amount of activity .
a : pours like an under carbonated old ale , absolutely no head . nothing , no pop of the bottle , no head at all .
appearance : dark reddish-brown , kind of like coca-cola actually . no real head to speak of , but there is some thin lace .
a : solid pee yellow . not much of a head .
appearance : soft but structurally unsound head . let the label be your guide as to the color
appearance : clear orange-amber , almost no head .
appearance : wonderful red/orange color . light suds and high viscosity . low/medium visibility . looks ominous in the glass .
a : pours a deep amber color with a really big fluffy head with adequate lacing .
a : extra pale yellow color , the foamy head is thin but never disappear ;
a : really nice looking almost clear color . it was kind of weird . under some light it would look a little yellow but then it would almost look like super watered down milk .
appearance : cloudy golden color with a thick rocky head that just does n't quit even after 10 minutes . a ton of sticky lace . this is what a beer is supposed to look like .
appearance : very light golden body with a large white head that disappears pretty quickly and leaves a little lace .

a : first pour gave me a ton of head , so an additional pour was necessary . hazed straw color . three fingers of creamy white head . retention is very good and the lacing covers the entire glass . 3.5
appearance : burn copper in color slight haze . very tight tan head that clings to the glass .
a : pours a glowing tangerine flesh , hazy . good sized head with pretty good retention and decent lacing .
a : a yellow hazy/pale body with a small carbonated head ( fast dissipation ) minimal lacing .

a : pours a half finger head of slight cream , fair thickness , and poor retention . caramel-amber in colour . nontransparent . sm : dark fruit : maybe cherry or plum , caramelized malt ( tame , not overdone ) , maybe hints of wine , and general esters . no alcohol . moderate in strength .
a : pours a hazy pale yellow/straw under a fizzy small white head that dissipates quickly , with no lace .
a : black with a tan 4-finger foamy head . this beer held up !
a : dark in color as you would expect , not to much carbonation or head to speak of , just a half of a finger for no more than a minute .
appearance : pours a clear amber color with a magnificent head that leaves a streaky pattern of lace
a : pours a pale yellow color with a big white fluffy head . small retention and only few lacings left
a : orange marmalade with a slight haze . small off white dissipated almost immediately to a thin ring and was gone by a third of the glass .
a : poured it into my urthel glass and it looked viscous . a deep dark brown color near to black . did n't observe any head at all .
appearance : crystal clear . huge white head . many tiny bubbles . awesome lacing
a : poured a sluggish near pitch black with a brown head
a : looks perfect , as it should for a macro beer . perhaps a bit too dark for an american ale being on the darker side of amber and pretty reddish . nice off-white head on the top .
a : 't is a lovely crimson tide that cascades into the glass . the carbonation appears ample though the lacing is minimal .
a : no head , no lacing , no cover . cloudy stray body . looks a bit like unfiltered ice tea . not impressive .
a : i cant give this good marks when they color the beer with caramel coloring give me a break what shit
a : looks a little light and adjuncty from first impressions ; goldish yellow with a pure , white fizzy head . nice lacing for the duration of consumption though .
a : pours a very dark brown , completely opaque . maybe a finger worth of loose , yet creamy tinted head . dies to a thick creamy skim within a minute or two . decent lacing throughout .
appearance : a crystal-clear golden-straw body capped by over two fingers of bubbly white head that fades slowly and leaves good lacing .

a : i only give 5 's to perfection and a pint of guinness is sheer perfection . had it off the tap and it was a beautiful black with that gorgeous tan cascading foam head . it just does n't get better than a guinness .

a : literally looks like apple juice or urine ... but in a good way ... and i know that sounds weird . lol . after a heavy pour , isabelle did n't seem to exhibit any apparent head or significant lacing .
a : clearish golden color with a fluffy white head with great retention and plenty of lace . a looker . 5/5
a : pours a very very dark brown , almost black , with raisin highlights . a very thin head surfaced then receded into a lasting collar that left spotty lace down the glass .

a : uplands lambics usually are n't that visually appealing , but this one is easily the worst . opaque plum color . this was a category one gusher , so little was lost ( and fortunately little was gained with regard to my clothes ) . anyway , the initial three fingers of frothy head quickly fell to half a finger . blackberry particules were abundant on the glass and in this last half finger of head . to be more descriptive , it looks like blackberry puree is hovering over the beer itself . 4.0
appearance : very hazy golden brown with lots of big floaties all over the place . not doing much for me here
a : a dark amber in color with a nice thick white head . nice lacing all the way through as well .

appearance : not much to this one , poured with a crystal clear yellow that is reminiscent of a light beer . a lot of carbonation initially stuck to the sides of the glass on the pour , and it made a good thumb of head . however , within mere minutes the carbonation had completely died out . needless to say , no lacing either .
a : this is an amazing looking beer . dark brown in color with a 1.5 finger mocha colored head with excellent retention and lacing .
appearance : nice looking beer . golden , bright , head dissipates into an attractive lace on the glass . yum !

a : the cloudiest professional-made beer i have ever encountered . russet-colored , with virtually no head . frankly , this beer looks like muddy , red oklahoma lake water ; although , as eric and lauren salazar explained , the lychee extract was milky and opaque , so i suppose it is justifiable .

appearance : pours a golden , cloudy straw color with a a white fluffy , big , and foamy head . basically my glass had 10 % beer in it and 90 % head . and the head stiff and sticky so it did n't go down that quickly . i 'm all for lively beers , but this was ridiculous . it did n't even look nice since most of the glass was foam . that 's not appealing to me .
a : deep golden color that leads to a creamy small bubbled head

appearance : not sure if it 's because the waitress left the pint on the bar for 15 minutes before delivery , but there was no head on the pour . or at least , it dissipated quickly and did n't linger . jet black though , it looked thick and smoky .
a : beautiful deep color of tangerine and orange with a hazy clarity . the head was minimal and disappeared quickly . lacing is wet and slides down into the liquid pretty quick .
a : this had a black body and poured with a medium sized , tan colored head .
appearance : light yellow blond ; quickly dissipating limited foam head and carbonation .
a : poured jet black woth good carbonation topped off with a nice khaki head , lots of , lacing with this too
a : hazy gold , plenty of lacing , and a head that lasts forever .
a : aggressive pour yields 1 finger of good-looking head with good retention . reddish-brown and luminescent liquid . beautiful !
appearance : straw yellow with 1 finger of head that fades to a thin cap .
a : pours a lovely amber that is actually quite clear . shifts between ruby red and golden straw depending on the light . big fluffy eggshell head . above average retention . leaves some lace .
a : virtually opaque blackness with a two-finger mixed bubble tan head that holds on well . decent lacing .
appearance : horrible head retention ; looks just like soda . clear golden color .
a : drank from the can but have seen one poured . very light , light color with no head . lots of carbonation .

appearance : this certainly is a most impressive academical pour : thick , juice-like coating , with fizzled deposits lifting atop , and sliding to and fro from the rimming of the snifter . was a tulip recommended ? maybe , maybe , maybe ... also , there were floating minerals pedaled to the bottom , a very dreary yeast sediment that 's hard not to appreciatively glance at continuously all throughout the session . when i peered up at the stemware 's bulbous cylindrical midsection , it looked very much like ice particles awash in the way of a gigantic docking-ship en from england to greenland . a greenway , as it were . damned vikings ...

appearance : pours a beautiful opaque almost black color with a thick thick creamy beige/brown head . this magnificent head fades from 3 fingers to 1cm creamy cap and lasts for the duration of the beer . the lacing is simply pasted the side of the glass . nitro may be gimmicky , but it sure does look nice .
a : pours a dark brown with hints of red in the tan head .

a : clear hold colour . thin head without cream . sm : clean light scent of barley , typical of cask ales but not indicative of quality . i 'm of the opinion that beeradvocate vastly overrates smell , especially in the case of cask ales .
appearance : pours a clear yellow with subtle head . reminds me of something plain , but we 'll see .
appearance : it pours a very pale shade of yellow with a thin white head that quickly fades out .
appearance : clearish amber in color , no head or lacing .
appearance : pours a clear golden yellow color with a one finger head . no lacing develops . several carbonation bubbles slowly rise from the glass bottom .

a : the cask version is better in all ways except here . the nectar i am used to shines in a way that no other beer does . the casked version had a haze to it that would not have bothered me with any other beer . it was darker than other versions , almost a light brown color . it was served to me with a perfect white frothy head .
a : nice rich amber color with a decent head .
a : the appearance is phenomenal : a semi-hazy orange hue topped with a fluffy , steamed-milk quality head that laces the shit out of the glass .
appearance : pours a gorgeous reddish amber with just a layer of off white head and great retention .

a : its been said before , duvel has maybe the best pour in the beer world . gigantic fluffy head that sticks around forever , but somehow does n't get in the way of your drinking , when you tip the glass .
a : pours a dark mahogany with about a finger of beige head that fades into a very thin ring with little lacing .
a : yellow-gold , slightly cloudy , no head .
a : pumpkin colored with not much head to it . typical for the beer type and flavor .
a : pours hazy golden copper , 2 finger frothy white head that slowly dissipates . good lacing

a : orangish brown . definitely darker than most hefes . highly carbonated as it should be . nice cloudiness . the head is soft , large and fluffy , but it unfortunately dies fast . overall , this does n't look like a typical hefe . darker in color and the head dies too fast .

appearance : pours a light coppery colour , more orange than red in my opinion : akin to your favourite pumpkin ales . off-white head that takes on a bit of the orange colour itself ; poured a thicker head than expected , but dissipated quickly , leaving only thin cover to shield what was beneath . impressive staying power for the beer lace .

a : really dark brown and rather opaque . i could n't get a good head ( about one finger ) , and not good retention of that either . head is light brown in color . decent amount of lacing . there is a bunch of variable sized crap throughout all layers of the brew . 4.5

a : cloudy orange , just like any typically good hefe . pours a rather small two finger head that is sort of creamy , though not as creamy as some of the german-made hefes . the head quickly reduces to a single finger . lacing and head retention are poor for a hefeweizen . the head soon dissipates to a pitiful cap .
a : 1 finger of dense light brown head with good retention . nearly opaque dark brown liquid .
a : thin tan foam that quickly fell into the beer . beer is black as night without a moon .
a : pours a very good looking deep red/light brown color . like red rust . lots of head , too much for the style in my opinion . leaves nice lacing . very clear .
a : looked very much like a mix between a flanders red and a lambic . minimal slightly off white head .
appearance : very pale straw color . lots of white creamy head and high carbonation ( bubbles ) .
appearance : it 's a looker , with a huge head sitting atop the clear amber liquid ; great retention and lacing
appearance : brown , color of the bottle from which it was poured , tan head which lingered for approximately thirty seconds . decent lacing . not very carbonated .

a : light fizzy almost non-existant head over a hazy pale yellow dark murky dirty water colored beer . n : nose is light , some light malts , little sour mash aroma , tangy light fruits , some lemon peel .
a : murky red-brown ale with mountainous foamy head with numerous clumps floating .
appearance : crystal clear golden lager . off white quickly dissipating head .
a : super pitch black with a humongous mocha colored head 2 inches thick that fades slowly . perfect !
a : poured a somewhat flat brown with a ring of carbonation around the side of the glass and no `` islands '' . clean and clear .

a : nice looking bottle ... but that is about all that seems to be left of this . pours almost black with some golden , yellowish highlights around the edges . absolutely no head whatsoever . the inside of the bottle held onto a dark sludge ... it covered the sides and bottom . when rinsing the bottle , the first pour of water came out black .

a : three finger head of off-pink vomit colour ( really , it 's fucking uncanny ) , terrible retention , and no cream . colour is a nontransparent hazy red . horrible appearance all around . sm : vomit and tomato puree , with perchance some light grapefruit . this is one of the worst aromas i 've ever encountered . and it 's moderately strong to boot .
appearance : orange/bronze , very clear , tight yellowish/tan head that has no staying power .
appearance : poured a clean light straw yellow . two fingers of white head developed and slowly dissipated to leave a nice foamy cap ... which then dissipated to a ring around the edge .
appearance : average , clear , pale golden lager la the look of budweiser or pilsner urquell .

a : very dark , hazy ruby brown ( almost looks like apple butter ) color with a massive , fluffy rocking tan head that has nice retention , slowly dissipating to a thick film . thick , clumpy lacing coats the inside of the glass .
appearance : a gusher upon carefully opening , we 're left with a clouded , darkened amber body with , despite the initial active , mess-making carbonation , only a very thin , whitish head .
a : piss in a glass . thick white head . i ca n't say anything better and maintain integrity .
a : nice foamy head , glowing amber color , great lacing , carbonation floating up adds to the effect . perfect !

a : nice amber orange colour with lacy white head . unfortunately the beer is full of floating crap - it looks at lot like they hopped this one with pellets and did n't even try to get the junk out afterwards . not really appropriate to a commercial beer .

appearance : pours a big fluffy 2+ finger medium-thick white head with great retention . color is rust reddish brown or mahogany with lots of carbonation in the form of small bubbles . a solid film cap stays 'til the end and leaves some great lacing down the sides . good looking beer .

a : pours a deepy ruby/brown color that is clear ( no haziness at all . ) mild ( if any ) foaminess to the `` head '' as it creeps slightly upwards and almost immediately retreats to a film . carbonation is present but lacking . head is completely gone now , not even a film .

a : standard pour yields a 1.5 finger off-white fine cream head with awesome retention . beer is a clear dark purple-red . lacing is thick and web-like with very good stick . an all-around beautiful beer .
a : pretty unremarkable when poured into my snifter . no head whatsoever . pours a dark black . opaque .

appearance : alhough it did n't look very dark coming from the bottle , this beer settles in an opaque black with a generous 1.5 '' head for the snifter it was poured in . retention is nice and the lacing clings on with its tiny bubbles .
a : light amber color ; cloudy , thin head that dissipates quickly

appearance : very dark nut brown colored . nice thick delicious looking three finger head that looks amazing . lacing clings all the way down the glass . i do n't know how you get this style of beer to look any better than this .
a : the aroma is of a nice bourbon presence , dark-roasted chocolate malts , and some ripened dark fruit .
a : cloudy orange colour and a 5 cm head that last . 5
appearance : looks dark black in color with a spotty surface head . no lacing develops .

a : once the gross foam dissipated , leaving the brownish-orange yeast and cork chunks all over the sides of the glass , this started looking pretty good . the color is a bright hazy orange with more foam than you could ever ask for .
a : a great amber copper color , 2 finger head , good carbonation .

appearance : mostly clear goldenrod color with an amazing , thick white head . the head looks so much like a great big dollop of whipped cream on top of the beer ! lots of little bubbles floating to the top - looks a bit like champagne .
appearance : color is a burnt , cloudy amber-orange that poured a big two-finger head that lowers to a very nice bit of lacing on top . good looking .
a : pours a dark brown with a dense khaki colored head .
appearance : hazy copper , light orange hue with hite head that lingers for several minutes disipating to thin coating that leaves a nice lace along sides of pint glass .

a : about the worst looking beer i have ever seen in my life . what very , very little head it had actually came out lopsided . never thought that was possible . looks like water with a drop of yellow food coloring in it .
a : a dark brown color with a nice pinky of head and great lacing ! a great start .
a : poured opaque black with a half finger reddish caramel course head that dissipated rather quickly . spotty lacing at best .
a : great 2 finger head , nice frothyness , can watch it recede from the rim on top of a nice deep amber beer . excellent lacing .
appearance : pitch black , topped by a dense brown head with very nice retention . leaves sheets of lace on the side of the glass .
appearance : no head . slightly cloudy . tan colored . not too appetizing looking
a : clear , dark reddish-amber color with no head . no lacing remains on the glass .
appearance : slightly cloudy golden , white head that fades quite quickly .

a : turbodog pours a deep , deep reddish brown , with a three-finger , lush , creamy , beige cap . when held up to the sunlight , the crystal clarity becomes apparent , and the beer is a gorgeous blood red . the head persists until the end as it fades to patchy lumps of foam .
a : very pale , clean , slightly hazy straw-yellow color with a thin , bubbly head of white carbonation that fades quickly and leaves very weak lacing .
a : excellent head retention . sheets of lacing left on every sip . hazy , copper tint . perfect .
a : hazy orange . an assertive pour results in a modest head that collapses very quickly . there is very little lacing .
appearance : clear brown with moderate carbonation . two finger , off-white head that diminished in less than a minute or two . the lacing was virtually non-existent .
a : hazy gold color ; cleared as it warmed , sol likely a chill haze . poured a 1 finger white head that dissipated . light rings of lace .
a : light , straw , wheat , fluffy lacing
a : pours black , with a full light tan head , great retention and lacing in my tulip .
appearance : golden and a good neck of foam . maybe too dark for a pale ale .
a : dark amber with particles and three-finger , off-white , creamy head that lasted a while and left great lacing .
appearance : pale gold with a medium , white , foamy , almost completely diminishing head and very little lacing .
a : murky orange-brown , off-white head , no retention or lace ( gravity poured cask ) .
appearance : a hazy straw color with an enormous frothy head that lasts and lasts . i ca n't really imagine a better-looking saison .
a : pours a dull yellow with a large whhite head that quickly turns thin . a small amount of watery lacing is left .
appearance : pours a pale golden color with a frothy white head . actually decent lacing compared to most magic hat offerings . thumbs up .
a : pours a very light copper color , with a little head that disappears quickly after pouring
a : pours a rather thin brown that settles into what looks like a glass of barqs root beer . head dissipates quickly . not ugly , but not overly inviting either .
appearance : this wheat ale is a nice dark brown to black color that lets little light through . there is little , if any , head .
a : lots of carbonation , little head with immediate dispersal , no lacing . golden -yellow .
a : dark mahogany brown . minimal head with decent lace .

appearance : pours out like water , producing a very wimpy-looking white head . body is crystal clear and orange-gold in color . a small halo retains for the entire session and does n't drag any mentionable lacing .
a : the beer is a medium brown color , with a very thin off-white head that fades nearly instantly and leaves almost no lace on the glass .
appearance : murky brown-orange , thin fading head .
a : a pleasant reddish- orange .

a : brown twist-off bottle with a bottling date of 3/10/08 . poured into a tulip glass with a thin white head that dissipated quickly with no lacing . the beer is a ruddy brown and clear , but full of yeast particles . there 's no sedimentation whatsoever , so no possibility of leaving the yeast in the bottle .
a : pours super smooth . very dark , nearly black/brown . two-finger caramel head rides the top all the way through the first half of the glass , then some nice lacing for the second half .
a : very light honey color with a thick white head that reduces quickly .
a : cloudy , nearly opaque light copper color . the head was ephemeral and not too thick .
a : dark brown , small head with small amount of lacing . the white head does make a pretty contrast to the dark brown beer .
a : opaque dark brown , almost black . minimal tan head with a nice , retaining thin lacing that is tan colored .
a : dark ! almost black hardly any ligh comes through , with a heavy brown head with great retention
a : pours a head of slight cream , decent thickness , and bad retention . colour is a solid black . sm : very light caramel is all i detect .
a : pours a coarse , 2.5 finger white head that dissipates quickly . beer is cloudy orange-grapefruit . lacing is non-existant . spots creep up but they drop down quickly .
a : pours a very light amber with a massive head . it is a little cloudy , looks great .
appearance : a pale golden pour with a disappointing head.i think triple and i think belgian style with an enormous frothy head ... .not here though . almost no head at all .
appearance : dark black color with a thick and fluffy 3 '' + head . only a few spots of lace develops despite the fluffy head .

appearance : this was a deep ruby , practically black beer . the head ( what there was of it ) was fizzy , tan , and almost gone before i could make note of it . there was nothing left of it by the time i finished that last sentence .

a : pours a lightly hazy orange hue with a fat white head that gives way to nice lacing from start to finish , with a good deal of chunky sediment that is a bit too much for my liking . i 'm down for unfiltered but this is just too much .
a : pours an almost moonless night black . thin brown head with very little lacing .
a : beautiful , clear , brown/amber with hints of orange in the color . very thin/no head but a bit of lacing .
a : pours a slightly hazy straw yellow with two fingers of white head that completely vanishes with no lacing .
a : golden haze .
a : i was expecting something more blond ! hazy chestnut with a light tan head , very little retention but some nice leg/lace .
a : pours a hazy , golden color with two fingers of serious , off-white head . outstanding retention and lace . the last drops from the bottle were foam that fell out in dramatic clumps .

a : cantaloupe with great clarity . a finger of bone white head recedes to nothing , but one of the liveliest beers i 've seen yet quickly builds up a thick glass ring that maintains through the drink . 5/5
appearance : deep brown , nearly black , opaque , with a dense but limited medium to dark brown head . leaves a little lacing . a very nice looking beer .
a : brownish orange color ; moderate head dissipates quickly ; slightly cloudy
a : black , black , black body . about 1.5 '' of thick , creamy head that recedes extremely slowly , leaving plenty to enjoy as i drink . leaves generous lacing throughout .
appearance : a murky amber body with a finger-high , fluffy , off-white head that leaves fantastic lacing . reminds me of a good hefeweizen in the glass .
a : poured a clear pale yellow with a strong carbonation and a great white head of foam .
appearance : at the first look i thought this would beer a good beer . the beer poured almost perfect darkness with slight ruby opaqueness to light . the head was a thick off white .
a : poured jet black ( maintained when held up to a light ) with an inch of caramel-colored head ( minute settle ) . some sticky , globby lacing but that settled quickly .

appearance : pour nets about an 1/8 inch of brown foam that quickly dissipates to off-white crown . it remains that way for the rest of the session . body is black , and damn near opaque . spotty lacing .
a : pours a dark brown when held up to the light with mahogany highlights , long-lasting off-white head , light lacing .

appearance : black coal and tar blended with espresso , with a little red-eye gravy thrown in for good measure . amazingly fine bubbles in the head , clinging to the side to shade the dark side of ebony .
a : the appearance is your ordinary light beer . minimal head and lacing . what would you expect ?
appearance : dark brown in color . very low head .
appearance : pours a clear amber color with a massive head that leaves great lacing
a : shit , complete and utter shit . it has extreme carbonation , a ginger ale body and wispy piss foam for a head .

appearance : the beer has almost a pink almost ruby coloration . the head was minimal frothy whiteness that quickly resolved into a thin cream colored scum . no carbonation is to be seen in the beer .

appearance : ugly as hell . muddy , sceptic tank brown , with zero head , and plenty of weird sediment . reminded me of the mixtures i used to make with apple juice , 5 different food colourings and half of my mother 's spice rack back when i was a kid .
appearance : dark brown with a small amount of transparency . quarter inch white head that dissipated fairly quickly . lot 's of effervescence .
a : it pours a clouded neon-yellow color with an unimpressive half-finger head of short-lasting , large-bubbled white head that almost completely disappears after thirty seconds .

a : a very nice medium brown color with reddish notes . crystal clear but little head . a light ring around the glass and some sticky , spotty lacing in different locations on the glass . no hard lace lines .

a : the first pour produces a clear straw-colored body with gold highlights . has generous effervescence that results in 3 '' of head with nearly 10 minutes of retention , receding into a half-inch foam top that leaves substantial sticky lacing down the glass . absolutely gorgeous . unfortunately , the second pour captured all the sediment , resulting in the same appearance , but cloudy .

a : pours a dark brown in the snifter , with an inch of tan head . retention is moderate ; the foam collapses over a minute into a thin film on the brew and a nice collar around the edge . no lacing that sticks , but it leaves nice sheets during each swig . as the beer recedes in the glass , it becomes evident that the beer is actually a clear brown with ruby highlights ; when there 's about 1.5 '' left , i can see right through it . pretty lame for an imperial stout .
a : a very dark brown.. nice creamy head on top , and a lot of sediment.. lots ...
a : pours a lemon flesh yellow with a bit of clouding . a 2 finger loose head forms and holds for a couple minutes . a few wisps of lacing .
appearance : typical gold appearance for a honey beer , but not the dark cloudy look i like in wheat beers .
appearance : poured with a fizzy off white head that dissipated very quickly leaving no head . the beer is slightly hazy with a yellow golden color .
a : pours a nice clear pomegranate-amber color with a fairly large amount of head that leaves quickly .
appearance : a hazy brownish amber color with a beautiful cream colored head . that slowly fades to a nice layer over the brew .
appearance : hazy gold-amber color with finger-sized head that dissipates into lacing .
a : poured a very dark brown with reddish hues into a pint . looks like coke . no head at all despite a semi-aggressive pour .

appearance : very pale yellow liquid with zero head retention and lacing , and a few coarse bubbles all coming off the bottom of the glass at once . i am serving this beer cold , rather than cool , and it 's a chilly autumn night here in canberra . the only thing kind of like a head is this whitish scum on the top of the water . ok , it 's fine bubbles , not something gross , but still i 'm not giving this a good mark for appearance . the bottle is kind of attractive , what with the blue and red . still not too good though .
a : murky brown with an insane amount of off white head . after the initial head settled a nice quarter inch layer of head remained , leaving some some lacing behind .
a : orange-golden with no head at all ; not even any bubbles .
a : pours a superbly clear straw color . nice white head w/good foam stability & decent carbonation . head lingers for quite awhile .
appearance : this is an absolutely gorgeous saison . it pours a luminescent golden orange color with a huge white head and all the lacing you could want in mt snifter glass .
a : pours a crystal clear , bright gold with almost no head and lots of carbonation bubbles . leaves no lace .

a : vigorous pour results in a great big beautiful foamy head that slowly shrinks down , leaving lots of pretty spiderweb lacing down the sides of the glass . color is pale straw yellow . visually , genesee struck a chord with me . it 's like the platonic ideal of what a beer should look like . hey there , handsome . n : nose starts metallic and finishes with a smattering of cereal grains . wet cardboard scent becomes noticeable as it warms .
appearance : pours into it 's own branded flared pilsner-style glass a somewhat clear amber brown . a small white head forms and quickly drops to a small collar and nearly full cap .
appearance : this beer is caramel colored , with big fluffy off-white head .
a : pale yellow , no head whatsoever . very few traces of carbonation .
appearance : reddish purple in color with no head .
appearance : a half finger white creamy frothy head with little retention . the color is a dark amber with reddish orange hues . the clarity is clear .

a : pours a transparent dull gold into a snifter . there is no head at all , but weird , slanted carbonation bubbles streaked up the glass and took awhile to lift . said bubbles move quickly to the top of the beer . there is no lacing at all and the beer looks more like a sparkling wine than a beer .
a : pours a nice ruby color with quite a bit of head that leaves a ton of lacing .
a : copper-bronze , off-white head , no retention or lace .

appearance : pale golden color with a modest amount of fizzy fast-rising carbonation . the snow-white head utterly vanishes in less than thirty seconds . aside from the color , this beer could be mistaken for mineral water .
a : hazy gold , with mild carbonation . a fizzy and soapy eggshell head comes and goes fairly quickly . leaves the faintest bit of lace .
a : interesting . very cloudy and orange-ish in color . almost looks like watered down oj when mom would add too much water to the concentrate . anyway , small dissipating head , no lace . 4/5

appearance : pours a body as black as motor oil with a surprisingly dark brown ( like an aero chocolate bar ) bordering almost on a light black head . huge and thick that lasts a long time . very impressive .

appearance : bright clear yellow that goes hazy as my glass widens at the hop . very active carbonation fails to hold a head ( at times a very thin collar ) . a careful pour leaves behind dark sediment . flavor : soft wheat , mild sweetness , a bit of the bubblegum which gives this a nice character . there is also a light grassy hop deep in the taste but no real bitter to speak of . the tastes are well blended and complete .

a : pours a very , very pale orange . completely transparent . 1 finger pearl white rocky head that remains a thick skim on the brew . 1 ring of fluffy lacing at the top and a pebble here and there on the way down .
appearance : pitch black , with a slight twinge of deep mahogany around the edges . though for a saison , it seems remarkably clear with very little sediment .
a : caramel light brown in color , good head retention and medium lacing . off white head of foam .

a : one finger white head dissipates quickly , leaving almost no trace at all either on the glass or in the beer . it 's always disappointing to see a thick three-fingers of head in pictures on the brewer 's website , and then experiencing the exact opposite . color is orange with a hazy , unfiltered presence . there is a slight , almost invisible tint of purple and a few floating particles here and there , probably from the raspberry puree .
a : nice amber/red body under a good sized white head , creamy head . great lace and retention . good looking beer .
appearance : faint yellow color similar to straw , urine , or a glass of water with a drop of yellow food coloring added .
appearance : clear coppery body . good head retention and lacing .
a : 1 inch solid white head . pale color , not amber .
appearance : honey-amber color , with a three-finger head . active carbonation and thick , even , slightly cloudy consistency . thick lacing and long retention .
appearance : bright clarity with a light golden color . the head is white , moderately low with a poor retention .
appearance : ruby/copper , with orange highlights . great color . light lacing following a virtually non-existent head . medium clarity and medium viscosity .
a : pours a grapey plumy purple color . pretty dark and cloudy with a beautiful light purply pink head . i do n't think i 've ever seen a cooler looking beer . the stuff just looked very impressive .

appearance : poured into a standard pint glass . black , when held to the light , still pretty darn dark , maybe with better lighting this may be reddish , but held to a 60 watt light bulb , still dark . big tan head , at least 2 inches . had to stop the pour , then finish . head lingered well into the first few sips , lacing down the glass to the finish .
a : black . i put it up to light to see that it 's got a bit of carbonation . no head and little lace .

appearance : beautiful hazy tangerine iced tea with honey corners . a billowy 3 finger foam head that is rocky , retains well , and leaves snowflake type lacing all around the glass ! absolutely beautiful imperial ipa .

appearance : a very dense , dark , chocolate brown head rises to about the width of a finger . it really takes it 's time to fade , but once it does there are only a few blotches left . the beer itself is pitch black , and only a sliver of dark brown is detectable when held up to the light . a ring of foam clings to the inside of the glass .
appearance : pours close to black with ruby hints around the edges . about 2 '' of light tan head forms which has extremely good retention and lacing .
a : looks like liquid waste . very pale yellow-white
appearance : tea . thick foamy head after a moderate pour into a glass mug . it quickly reduced to a thin head . minimal lacing .
appearance : nothing much to say here . it 's appearance is very bland . it pours an o.k yellowish straw color with a bit of a head , nothing too impressive , but overall alright .
a : crisp and clear golden amber ... the glass was poured quite high , so the head spilled over the rim of the glass , and did n't leave much behind . a thin little collar remains behind .
a : poured from bottle a golden color with 2+finger width head that stuck around forever , good carbonation up the glass , good lacing
a : hazy blonde , thick foamy head

appearance : golden apple-juicy amber with a smooth , fluffy , white head and fair retention . thin flecks of hops are visible in slowly swirling suspension . you can tell this one 's gon na be hoppy .
a : pours a dark black once the nitrogen bubbles settle . watching this beer settle is beautiful in itself . the brown cloud sweeping up ward towards an always hearty head .
a : no head , gold orange color with slight haze
a : crystal clear , a beautiful orange amber in color , the head on this rises up from the body and creates a thick , light tan foam .

a : pours a two finger head of light cream , okay thickness , and average retention - though the abv is low . colour is a clear gold . sm : light sourness and yeast , bacteria , with some funk overshadowed by peach . very pleasant and inviting . maybe slight apple .
appearance : pours with 1 1/2 inches of creamy , tan head that settles slowly to a thin layer of foam with a ton of lacing . the beer itslef is a beautiful ruby color .

appearance : pour with a medium sized head that dissipates before your eyes . lacing is non existent except for thin wisps here and there . oonly way to get a lacing out of this is to use an etched glass , but thats cheating if the beer does n't start with a good head is n't it ? 100 % clear and no sediment , unusual for a belgian ale as they are usually bottle fermented . color is golden .
a : this was a light coppery amber color . it pours with a big craggy , lacey , slightly dirty white head .
a : clear amber/copper color with thick off-white head and heavy lacing .
appearance : foamy head , but with little retention . pretty golden color similar to many bires blondes .
appearance : very light and bubbly . nice head . good amount of lacing .
a : two fingers of head that recede over a minute and leave nice cobwebby lacing . a ring follows down the glass as i drink . the brew itself is a cloudy orange/persimmon color .
a : beer is a deep golden amber color with a slight haze and a nice , frothy one-finger head that hangs around for a bit and leaves a generous amount of lacing . active carbonation is noticeable
a : bright white creamy/craggy head . brilliant yellow . carbonation is visible . light and pleasant ; cloudy but translucent . traces of lace .
a : black coffee colored , one finger head gives way to wispy dark tan head , nice lacing
a : pours champagne like in color and carbonation . huge amount of head on this one due to the yeast . really clear and clean looking .
a : poured a honey color with a small white head
a : clear reddish-amber body with a thing , transient off-white head . pretty good .
appearance : very carbonated with a fizzy tan head and a rich brown caramel body .

appearance : poured from the can into my shorts pint glass , the beer is is clear , vibrant light gold color with a massive , foamy 2 inches worth of head . the retention is pretty good , and i can see thick chunks of lacing clinging to the sides of the glass . lookin good .

a : very nice orange-yellow color , very cloudy , with a great two-finger lasting , thick head , which left good lacing . s/t : light and lemony-fresh with a good spiciness provided by the yeast , almost to a rye-like degree , along with some possible cloves . a surprisingly solid caramel-like malt backbone . gets a bit astringent in time , though .
appearance : caramel amber with a big frothy off white orange cream head leaves minimal specks of lacing not bad .
a : pours a clear orange with two fingers of white head that fades into a thin ring with no lacing

a : not a good start . poured a bright , golden yellow that has some orange tints to it when the light hits it . ca n't get head of this bitch to save my life . i pour vigoursly and i get maybe half a finger , but zero retention . this fades faster than a 24 hour whore who is out of coke . lame , very lame . there is zero haze to this beer and jst a bit of carbonation bubbles flowing in the glass . moving on .

appearance : ah yes , here it is : the king of beers . well , it does n't look like the king of beers . there was something like a foam that formed when i poured this beer , but then it dissipated into nothingness . there is n't even lacing around the top to make this beer look like beer . basically , i 've got yellow soda water .
a : clear pale amber body under a thin off-white head that settles into a ring . mediocre retention , no lace . meh .

appearance : pour is a dark brown , but not deep dark brown near black like coffee , and this one shows plenty of ruby highlights when held up to the light ; starts with a 2 finger light tan head with decent retention ; the body shows strong carbonation through the highlights ; head eventually fades to a full , but very uneven cap with thick lumps on the side ; fair lacing is left on the sides of the glass .
a : pours a honey color , slightly on the orange side . carbonation streaming from the bottom of the glass to support the fluffy light tan head .
a : very pale yellow ; small head that faded fast . looks like your average run of the mill adjunct light beer , and this is the king of them .

appearance : deep yellow golden orange . very opaque and next to no carbonation evident . pours a large fluffy white head that is pretty persistent . eventually levels out to nothing and leaves no lacing . looks great at the beginning , but relatively flat by the end , unfortunately .
appearance : cloudy orange and gold body with off-white head which recedes to leave sticky lacing . looks more of a hefeweizen than an ipa . residual hops has got something to do this .
a : light golden ale with a single finger of fine white foam falls to a blank , reflecting surface . no lacing . hazy as expected .
appearance : it is a vibrant red with a thick head
a : i have to give guinness credit that this is one of the most striking pours i have ever seen . dark brown clouds billow downwards between a creamy head and a jet black body .

appearance : this beer pours a dark caramel/ hazelnut hue with a pillowy off-white head that rose up very vigorously on an easy pour . many columns of beading floating rapidly to the top of my tall weizen glass . minimal amount of laceing .
a : pours into the glass with copperish color and 1/4 inch head that dose n't stick around and no lacing .

a : pours a hazy , light orange , not gold as i expected , with a thick great white head , which is legitimate in height with great retention all through the drink , great lacing as well , the higher alcohol brew just coats the glass when drunk , certainly a great looking beer .
appearance : pours a very light yellow color with a 1/4 '' head that breaks apart immediately . plenty of carbonation bubbles rise to the surface .

appearance : cloudy golden color with bits floating around . had to double check the label to see if this was a non-filtered beer . it does n't specify so i 'm a little confused . head is white and foamy . not the best head retention . decent lacing .
a : pours golden with an enormous white creamy head that sinks into fantastic lacings .

appearance : pours a charred wood color coming off deep brown at the top and edges but black through the middle . looking through the sides the beer appears to pour with good clarity . next to no head forms with even a moderate pour . some bubbles form along the rim of the glass , but after a few minutes these have all faded to nothing . no lacing . flavor : a smack of vanilla coats the tongue at first before a very strong bourbon and brandy flavor kicks in . if i knew more about these liquors i could describe it better , but there 's something more going on here than just bourbon oak . high alcoholic spice becomes present in the middle and toward the finish where you 'll also find some dark fruit playing into the mix . finishes with stickiness on the tongue and lingering vanilla .
a : copper , slightly hazy , nice small-bubbled head with decent retention and good lacing .

appearance : this is easily the largest most rapidly expanding head i have seen , ever . explosive even . other than that , pours a dense , cloudy orangey bronze with lots of sediment and bubbles constantly streaming up .
appearance : lovely to behold , with a massive head atop the liquid and plenty of lacing
appearance : free pour yields a quarter inch fizzy white head that dissipates immediately . pours a semi-translucent dark red orange and leaves occasional short lived spots of lacing .
appearance : pours a very clear , deep golden pumpkin orange . a few streams of fine bubbles are present . very large head and decent retention . soapy , glittery lacing .
appearance : urine-colored beer with 1-finger head , white in color .
a : pours a golden body with a small , white head with pretty poor retention but with some lacing along the side of the glass .
a : very hazy , ruddy caramel color . thin head that dissipated quickly ( the bottle poured very smoothly , so perhaps it was n't agitated enough ) .
a : there was a little foam over after uncapping this beer , a solid centimeter of frothy head on a medium pour , deep gold - 3.00 ,
a : pours a beautiful , crystal-clear orange ( pumpkin , i suppose ) body with two fingers of soft , long-lasting off-white foam . plenty of lace . gorgeous beer ; perfect for the style .
a : dark mahogany . retains a thin white head . little to no lacing .

appearance : poured a cloudy , slightly pale honey color ; microsuspension is visible . two finger white , bubbly head that diminishes to a thin layer before sticking around some more . no lacing at all .
a : clear , light honeyed amber color with over one finger of persistent white foam head . thick sheeting lace remains on the glass . numerous rays of bubbles rise energetically in the column .

appearance : tenaciously-driven : illustriously tenebrous , and holds its weight solidly ; looks like third-world oil ... its head is reassuring and does n't have too much of an outward flow . impressive . mighty-fine lace ; takes a good while for the caramel-coloured froth-head to finally settle back in place , but when it does its vainglory still sits well out of reach in the glass .

appearance : the body has good clarity and a nice golden color . it builds up a tall white head full of big loosely packed bubbles that quickly fade out . this only makes for a very little spotty lacing .

appearance : pours a very small tan head that quickly disappears into a thin wispy film . colour is an opaque dark brown , bistre perhaps , with very little carbonation . a bit of a film stays to the end and leaves some lacing down the glass . unfortunately the head is a little too average .
appearance : odd yellow color reminds me of weak urine . foam is mediocre and non durable . forgettable appearance , and this is probably the best part of this beer .

appearance : a non existent head after trying a hard pour . there is some foamy ivory rings around the glass trying to be a head . the color of the beer is dark mahogany color to almost opaque . the clarity of the beer is opaque .
a : golden straw color with a light head .
a : carbonated gross yellowish clear liquid with not much head . faint color . the head looks like the froth that floats on polluted water .
a : slightly hazy , dark brown color with no foam head . no lacing remains on the glass . a significant amount of sediment is left at the bottom of the glass .
a : beautiful golden color . the head pours huge ( 3 fingers ) and fluffy . quickly falls to a ring around the edges . leaves lacing along the glass .
a : white one finger head with pink hues . exceptional dark ruby red in color . sporadic sticky lacing .
a : three-finger head ; amber color ; clear ; great lacing

appearance : carbonation streams frazzle through a clear marmalade body to feed a steady crochet of white lace . well above average in terms of looks . retention is flawless . lace is sticky and clings to the glass in attractive patterns .
a : poured from a 750 ml bottle into a stein . gold with about 2 fingers of fluffy head .

appearance : pours almost perfectly clear with a white head of medium sized bubbles . the head was maintained pretty well by quite a few bubbles rising . there was some light lacing on the glass after drinking .
appearance : pale yellow , nearly straw in color . the beer pours with a very wimpy head which subsides to nothing in literally a matter of seconds .
appearance : black , big brown head .
a : pours a light straw color ; no head , no lacing
a : hazy golden ocher . head is fast to form , but is not very rich and recedes quite quickly . kind of lackluster , in the end .
a : beautiful . murky brown with a creamy white head and lots of lacing . i 'm a sucker for the goblets . s +

appearance : pouring this beer for the first time was amazing . the whole glass turned into a thick head . and i when say thick i mean like cool whip thick . it looked wonderful and gave me an immediate appetite . the head was long lasting , slow to fade , and laced the glass perfectly . the lace was about 1/8 '' over the beer through out my entire sample . it did not fade , break up or go away . i covered my beer and the edges of the glass was something to admire . the beer had a rich gold color with the color deepening as it neared the center . my notes say , `` translucent beauty . '' a light carbonation bubbled through the entire beer and just made it look like what i imagine a beer is suppose to look like . for that reason i gave it a 5 . even in the wrong glass it was picture perfect .
a : pours very clear . it is a light mahogany to dark honey color and boasts a frothy cap of off-white foamy head . this beer looks just amazing !
a : poured jet black with great carbonation leaving a big brown cap and lots of bubbles
a : ugliest bottle i 've ever seen , and a very unatractive beer which pours an average piss color .

appearance : flat , thin brown . no head , minimal carbonation that faded to just plain flat quickly . flavor : maybe . to be fair , what you can taste is enjoyable . toasted malt , hops in fair balance , with a finish that is , well , it tastes like budweiser . they must use some of the same ingredients , possibly the yeast and hops .
appearance : jet black and opaque . pours a thin head that quickly disappears . leaves no lacing on the side .
a : a slow pour yielded a huge mocha head body is black as night .
a : pours dark brown with no real head formation and only a ring of tan foam with a mirrored center . no lace .
a : a hazy yellow-beige , rock and roll head with lots of lacing , almost creamy head left on sides of glass . the haze is a little deep , but the head is something to behold .

appearance : glass was slid in front of me by the bartender , causing the cascading head to rock back and forth until it had completely settled . the body is a hazy amber , and shows suspended sediment within . the head might be the nicest i 've ever seen on a cask ale ( keep in mind that this is only my forth cask ale ) . it 's super tight and creamy , stands 1.5 fingers tall , and drags a blanket of lace down the entire cylinder . oh yeah , and the retention is fantastic : it holds it 's 1.5 finger height for the entire session . excellent !
a : pours a straw light color with little to no visible carbonation .
a : infinium 's cork pops much the same as a champagne does . it displays exceptionally fine bubbles that race from the foot to head . the body is crystal clear , and displays a gentle copper color .

a : hazy golden-orange . bubbly two-finger white head . decent retention , delicate lacing forms rings on the glass . retention could be better considering all the adjuncts used in this beer ( wheat , oats , rye ) .
appearance : pale yellow , small head , very slight haze .
a : slightly cloudy , light orange/peach color . thick , fluffy head with great retention .

a : pours super dark nearly opaque with a beautiful ruby color when held in the light . a really nice two finger creamy tan head . the lacing was fairly sparse in the end with most of it toward the top of the glass .

a : this beer pours jet black with slight , and i mean slight dark brown hues on the edges in the light . the pour came with about 2-3 fingers worth of dark mocha brown head . left some lacing on the side of the glass . a great looking beer .
appearance : dark gold color , thin white head quickly dissolves , no lacing on glass .
a : light sparkling yellow with a look that did not come across as bottle conditioned . creamy , rocky , milkshake head on the golden dustiness . it lasted long and the lacing was like soap suds .
appearance : clear deep mahogany brown in color , with a large tan head , excellent lacing , and moderate carbonation .

a : a huge , tight head impressively crests the beer , gently churning , but never quite collapsing . a dark tan , it tops a much darker brown beer , completely opaque . good lacing . with this creamy monster of a head , occasional bubbles , and a richly-coloured impenetrable beer , appearances do n't get much better than this .

a : bottle nearly exploded taking the top off ! 1st pour yielded half a pint of foam , understandably . subsequent pours yielded 1 '' yellow tinted white head . leaves thick , intact , sparkling lacing virtually all the way down . appearance score takes a hit for dowsing me .
a : pale straw color , fizzy white head .
appearance : obsidian color , absolutely no head ( i actually thought it was completely flat at first ) , good clarity

appearance : mostly clear ( you can almost see your fingerprints through the glass but not quite ) golden body . the thin white head that forms as you pour it vanishes almost instantly . obviously , there 's no lacing left behind when there 's no head to leave it . as this is probably consumed from the can 99.9 % of the time i doubt it matters .
a : a cloudy yellow color . well carbonated . 1 finger of head , which lasts a while .

a : pour an incredible creamy peach . it reminds me of a melted orange-creamsicle . it has a beautiful could haze to it and there is a thin white head . the lacing is great.this beer hangs onto the glass for dear life .
a : a dark crimson beauty with a milk coffee colored head that leaves nice lacing while receding ever so slowly .

a : dark brown with solid finger of tan colored foam , settles into a thick ring with strong lacing that forms a full ring around the glass and holds its ground throughout . a good looking brew , off to a good start .

a : poured with a large , extremely frothy white head ... this baby stuck around for minutes on end before it finally started to fade away , leaving thick lacing on the glass . body is a dark copper color and clear .
a : the liquid is straw-coloured and has an airy white head with not much lacing going on .
appearance : hazy brownish red with a 1 '' head . the head is off white and lasts a short bit , with some lacing on the sides of the glass .
a : hazy pale orange . inch of head . great lace , great retention .
a : pours a light amber with an average white head , a little lighter than i expected .

appearance : absolutely beautiful to watch , and makes you anticipate what you are about to drink . a very thick 3 finger head , and the very unique waves that cascade down the glass like waves in the ocean . the bubbles flowing downward are very unique also , and a treat for the eyes .

a : poured motor-oil thick and black into my bruery tulip glass . what was disappointing was the lack of head and lacing , but i can contribute some of that to the growler . a few quick swirls develop a head , but the retention was mild at best .

a : poured into a snifter , this appears dark brown but can be seen through when held to direct light . a deep violet is apparent when this is done . a half glass of dust brown head builds with a violent pour . good lacing considering what this is . good legs cement a perfect score here . 5/5
a : poured a fruit punch red with pink highlights with a thin head and little lacing on the glass .
appearance : gold with a red tint and a nice white foamy head .

appearance : poured from a can into a hoegaarden pint glass in low altitude galway , ireland , on october 25th , 2010 . pours a clear bright yellow with a pathetic two finger head that appears thin and without cream . at least it does n't look overcarbonated .
a : hazy unfiltered orange brown color . could not get a good head on this not matter how hard i tried . that said , not much retention or lacing . 4.5
a : pours a clear ruby body in the glass . it 's flat , no carbonation .
a : ultra light straw color in body , hazy , bubbles everywhere . three finger white head . attractive..
a : light pale copper . fizzy head that comes down to almost nothing soon after a normal pour .
a : yellow , like urine .
appearance : 3 |
a : an absolutely huge foamy , densely packed head . nearly perfect orange-gold . cloudy .
a : brownish opaque color . no head ... boo . i would say the color is not inviting : p
a : deep black and opaque , nice tan foamy 2-finger head . great head retention and great lacing . beautiful .
a : dark orange amber , nearly opaque , hazy , clearly unfiltered , tan head
appearance : crystal clear , light gold in colour with very little head -- just a very thin white foam lace .

appearance : pours a beautiful ruby red liquid with a soft pink head . nice constant carbonation in the middle of the glass keeps the head going till the end . the really nice part is that if you swirl the liquid around in the glass the head takes on different shades of red . a beautiful color overall .
a : dark as night with a decent tan head .

a : the first thing i noticed about the beer is how loud the head was . that tan head very loudly crackles away to nothing , leaving not a trace on top of the dark brown body . however , when that beer is held up against a strong light , we can see that the body 's color is more accurately described as a deep , deep red with slight orange hues throughout .
a : very inviting appearance , beautiful mocha head , jet black , lace sticks to glass very nicely .
appearance : pours a cloudy lemon juice color with what turns out to be a modest head ( although it foamed out of the bottle initially ) ; a few dots of lace
a : pours a clear mahogany with a finger of off-white head that recedes into a thin ring with no lacing .
a : mahogany color with small foamy head that dissipates quickly .
a : super high head -- amazing ; pours cloudy dark orange

a : pours a crytal clear new penny copper , maybe even a bit lighter than that , one of the lighter ipas i 've seen in a while . a three quarter inch head settles nicely on top of the beer and is supported by a few thin ropes of carbonation bubbling up from the laser etchings below . head fades to a thickish ring and leaves minimal lacing .
a : fantastic . a hard pour yielded a nice tan head , sitting atop a viscous , black concoction . decent lacing .

a : pours a clear golden-amber body with a steady column of carbonation leading up to a perfectly lofty head of frothy bright-white foam . it presents the perfect image in the duvel tulip , with the initial beer/head line falling right in the middle of the logo . awesome .
a : dark brown color but more the color of mahogany , with some red hues . the head is very small and is eggshell white .
a : very little head that dissipated immediatley . not a lot of carbonation either , typical lager hue .
a : pours a dark opaque brown with a thick , dense tan head . the head retains very well and leaves quite a bit of lacing .
appearance : pours a golden colour , with very slight reds . think head which dissolves to a thin lacing rather quickly .

appearance : a one finger ivory head that is foamy and creamy with some retention . the head is leaving some lacing on the glass . the color of the beer is medium amber color with orange highlights . the clarity of the beer is hazy . there is some yeast floating in the beer .
a : pours a clear , apple cider colored body . a 1/2 '' fizzy bubbly head drops to nothing in just a few seconds . no lacing is left behind .
appearance : pours a dark brown with nearly no head even with a vigorous pour . leaves virtually no lacing whatsoever . i 'm not impressed .
a : pours a light copper color with a massive head that comes to rest as a thick blanket of foam .
a : amber , decent head

appearance : drank straight from the 12 oz . can . the label assures me that `` this is the original pbr beer . '' i do n't think i had any doubts to begin with hahaha ... the label also declares that pbr was `` selected as america 's best in 1893 . '' 114 years later , i doubt that 's still the case , but here goes ...
a : pale yellow color with little to no head and minimal lacing .
appearance : a half finger head that is white and has some foamy head . the head is a light straw color . the beer has some effervescence . the body of the beer is clear .
a : pours a dark brown body with a suprisingly effervescent tan head , rising to 2 '' in height and sticking around a while .

appearance : great looking beer . nice , topographical head appearance that is dense , uniform , and leaves a good bit of lacing on my clean glass ( hear that ? ! ? ! clean glass ... ) anyway , beer itself is hazy orange . interesting phenomenon : when i drank about half of the beer a very dense formation of creamy head formed in the center of the beer forming an almost perfect circle .
a : a lovely ruby tinted copper , plenty of bubbles rising from the glass , full just off white head . looks great .
a : one finger of beige head over a beautiful mahogany and amber body . sticky lace adorns the glass and a head retains magnificently throughout the session .
a : clear copper/amber color . poured a 2 finger light tan head with good retention settling to a 1 finger cap . light , inconsistent lacing . lightly decanted .
appearance : copper brownish , and relatively translucent . a very appealing stream of frothy bubbles dancing on top .

appearance : unfortunately not too much head on it , and the lacing does n't seem to be sticking very well . and i suppose the color is n't the most intriguing either , actually . not awful , but i expected a bit more .
a : pours with a very short lasting head , no lacing just a quick showing then gone . body is brown a touch cloudy , with a light red hue when held to the light .

a : in my brief experience with them , tommyknocker beers either have a great head , or none at all . this one had the later . after a quick blip of seltzer fizz , i had nothing more than a thin ring around the edge of the beer . beep gold color has good clarity and very active bubbles , however .

appearance : pours a brilliant copper ; pristine clarity ; huge , foamy , three-fingered head ; excellent retention -- at least one of those fingers made it down to the bottom of my 20oz . pint glass ; heavy , heavy sheet lacing .
a : pale yellow as far as i can tell . deduction for bragging about being made with rice on the can 's label .
a : pours out a murky brown , with bits of yeast . there is also a film of yeast left on top of the beer when the head settles . small , light brown head that faded quickly .
a : golden-yeasty colour , no head so no head retention .
a : poured a reddish/amber color , with a very thin head , and little lacing .
a : pours a slightly hazed radiant yellow brown . two fingers of fizzy white head die off quickly like a can of coke . 4.0

a : this pours out a syrupy liquid . the colors are brown , red and orange . it varies depending on how much light is hitting it . the body is slightly hazy with minimal carbonation movement flowing . the body is lighter than i expected , you can see throw and light gets through the hazy body . the pour does n't seem like there will be a head at all to form , but it slowly builds a very thin , white , bubbled ring . very small and minimal .

a : dark brown brew , ca n't see through it at all . has a healthy head at the initial pour of foamy off white that reduces to something a bit thinner but sticks around for the entire time . lacing is more like a thin layer of foam that sticks to the side of the glass . very nice .
appearance : pale straw-yellow , crystal-clear body with a fizzy bright-white head that recedes quickly and leaves no lacing .

appearance : very impressive . gorgeous dark brown with a subtle red hue if held to light . contrasted nicely by the off white head that tops the brew . if poured fairly vigorously , a terrific head will develop . the surface tension of the head allows it to cling to the glass and lace out perfectly atop the beer . the carbonation is just enough to promote lacing without disturbing the beautiful islands of foam . too bad the rest of the beer is not as divine .
a : black beer with a reddish-brown hue = . half a finger worth of a light brown head . retention is low and lacing is low .
a : very small head . light golden color . bit hazy .
appearance : deep black in color with a thick 2 '' milk chocolate colored head . the head lasts quite a while . thick lacing paints the glass .
a : it comes in a clear bottle and is a dark amber colour ; it pours the same with a one finger white head with webby lacing . this is the best looking beer ever .
appearance : slightly cloudy with a greenish tint in an otherwise pale , yellow beer . no head at all , which translated to almost no lacing .
a : poured a caramelly mahogany body with a finger of off-white head . retention is pretty short , and the head is mostly gone by the time the bartender gets it to me .
a : this beer poured a cloudy brown/orange with a quickly falling head .
a : deep amber color with a solid tan head
a : fantastic rich golden color with a very robust foamy head that clings to the glass very well .
a : nice dark brown opque color . big lasting creamy white head , and really nice lacing .
a : cloudy dark amber body with a frothy tan head . leaves a good , thick lacing on the glass .
a : snifter . pours a impenetrable dark brown that looks black . light brown head , quick dissipation , practically no lacing .
a : pours dark , dark brown in color with a finger mocha colored head that has excellent retention and decent lacingso far no signs of infection
a : quite a looker . typical stout , super black color . two fingers of the creamiest head i 've ever seen , which is tan/cream in color and had great retention and tons of lacing . 4.5
appearance : poured a cloudy brown color , without much visible carbonation . half finger head the disappears immediately . no lacing and a bit lifeless .
a : pours a thick dark brown almost black color with a thick two plus finger foam head . lots of lacing all down the sides .
a : love the color here , clear golden orange , almost glowing , and topped with a short , bone white head .

a : as soon as the waiter brought this beer to the table i looked at it and thought i was going to regret this one ... opaque straw in color , 2 finger white head that leaves little retention ... i thought this beer was going to be very watery

appearance : brilliantly clear honey colored body . thanks to the widget , the head is amazingly dense , creamy , and measures a full two fingers . great fun to pour and watch with interesting little bubbles that cling to the glass . i could watch this all day , not quite as cool as the guinness cascade , but certainly worth the cost of admission . even after the head settles , this is an exceptionally pretty beer . the head rides all the way down to the bottom of the glass , leaving sudsy lacing behind .

a : pours a two finger head which lacks cream , is of bad thickness , and average retention ( ~2 minutes ) . colour is a clear dark yellow . sm : slight caramelized malt and nutty hops . a light aroma .
appearance : poured into the 350ml kmetsko glass . slightly cloudy , gold color . 2 finger pure white head with poor retention .
a : average . super clear golden , not much head . pretty much what you 'd expect from a lager .
appearance : the pour is somewhere between black and brown with red highlights . the head forms as a small light brown ring around the glass .
a : pumpkin orange with hazy yeast , finger thick head that dissipates quickly into a thin lacing .
a : nice woody dark amber color with dense , clumpy 1-2 finger off-white head with sheets of lace down the glass
a : pours a deep , deep , deep brown . very thick caramel head , large bubbles . beautiful lacing left on the glass .
appearance : no head , no lace , dark dark brown in color

appearance : a nice , deep amber color , but looks much lighter than most bocks . has a pretty nice head- not too thick , but by no means thin- that dissipates just right- not too fast , not too slow .
appearance : dark brown , almost opaque , brew with dark tan wispy head . little carbonation in the body .
appearance : very nice and head retention . head stays round for a while .
a : pours a black body with tan head . no retention or lace .

a : the color of maple syrup , though wholly transluscent and relatively light at 23 srm . one inch head vanishes within a minute to nothing . beyond the appealing color , little other visual fulfillment to be had .
a : pours a really nice light golden color , almost straw like . provides nice white foam head with decent retention . provides ample lacing down the sides . this is what a pils should look like .
appearance : medium amber with orange hues . sticky off white head . good retention and a slight amount of lacing .

a : cloudy copper , about half an inch worth of cream colored head , sticky gobs of lacing , nice looking beer minus the big chunks of sediment in the bottom , quite noticeable and very out of place for the style , but still a good looking beer .
a : very pale straw color , cloudy with off-white edges . no head retention at all .
appearance : it was dark brown-black with minimal head
a : pours a light gold color , thin , quickly thinning head . lacing throughout the pint .
a : incredible look to this one . pours a thick black with a duvel-esque dark tan head which lasts for ages and settles down to a permanent half-finger at the top of the glass .
appearance : amber in color , nice white head , great retention .

a : pours a hazy golen color with a huge white ( 2+ fingers worth ) head with lots of lively carbonation . huge , thick lines of lacing cling to glass long after the liquid goodness has disappeared below .
a : pours red with no head , not even a smattering of bubbles . nice colour .
a : opaque black with a slight reddish brown on the edges of the glass every now and then while drinking . half a finger of head with some nice lacing .

a : pours into the glass looking like flat , generic `` cola '' . a few bubbles and a tiny tan head pop up before becoming absolutely still again . no lace . looks like the cuyahoga river around the time that it caught fire .
a : poured a muddy/cloudy brown red color , little to no head , no lacing .
a : aggressive pour yields 2/3 finger eggshell colored head with good retention . cloudy dark reddish-brown .
appearance : a nice straw color that has a two finger foamy white head . the head has some retention to it . the body of the beer is clear .
