a : underwhelming appearance ; a murky garnet-orange . no head . no lace . an oily sheen . a little unfair to judge appearance on such an odd beer , but i feel a '3 ' is justified , perhaps even generous .
a : very pale and light straw in color , not much head and it dissipated quickly .

a : i should preface this by saying that hefeweizens in a weizen glass is the greatest looking beer in the world to me . that being said , this one falls short . the pour is a hazy golden color with a billowing two finger head that dissipates quickly and does not lace very well .
a : deep copper color with rosy hues , lots of sediment in bottle ( about 3/4 of an inch )
a : deep opaque coffee brown with a beautiful frothy tan head of 2-fingers that settles into a 1/2-finger lace . glorious .

a : cloudy and orange-amber in color with a beautiful 2-finger head of pillowy tan foam . oily hop resins are very apparent in suspension . head shows great retention and leaves sticky lacing trails all the way down the glass .

appearance : poured like a chocolate milkshake from the nitro can . as the famous cascade of bubbles rose the beer settled to deep black that was not completely opaque . a thick , creamy head sat on top throughout the pint .

a : standard pour yields a half finger fine , light coffee colored head with poor retention . beer is a clear , opaque black . lacing is non-existant though there 's some decent legs . below average .
a : pours a nice straw yellow with a 3 finger puffy head . great look to a hefeweizen .

appearance : pours a thick golden color , like a mixture of apple and orange juice . has a solid one-finger head which is nicely thick . it 's bubbly and foamy , lasts awhile , and leaves some awesome lacing . a+ .
a : typical pale yellow with pitiful head that dies quickly .
appearance : dark yellow color with almost no head that fades quickly to absolutely no head . slight effervescence .
appearance : a monster 3 finger dark tan head that is foamy and creamy . the body of the beer is jet black . there is effervescence on the side of the beer . there is no clarity in the beer .
appearance : pours a cloudy apricot with a big belgian head that retains and laces with the best
a : dark copper body that separates quickly from a thick creamy off-white head .
a : really nice cloudy orangish gold . looks like a really great heff . minimal amount of white head . some lacing .
a : pours a cloudy burnt orange , with a small white head which is frankly dissapointing for a wheat beer , fair head retention , no lacing .
a : pours a cloudy orangish color , small white head , no lacing observed .
a : the only thing that might be lighter and fizzier is urinating after the 3rd or 4th one ( sorry to be so crude , but i thought it to be true ) . that said :
appearance : pitch black with thin caramel brown head .
a : brilliant bright white head with excellent lacing . meringue head sits atop honey golden body .

a : yep , yellow water is a good description . then , as i usually do i take a sniff of the beer . b : wow , smells sweet , and chock full of corn . ok , everyone else is on their 3rd cup , time to try it
appearance : an incredible white head with superior lacing , perfect clarity as well .
a : pours amber color . thick head slowly dissipates . can hear it fizzle down ! little retention . little carbonation . redish-brown-amber in color .
a : this beer pours dark as hell . you also get a major creamy head , with nice spidery lacing .
appearance : a good four fingers of nice resilient foamy head . surprisingly clear for a hef . slight hazy yellow .
a : deep copper/amber color . really wonderful when held up to the light . creamy white head with less than 1/2 fingers .

appearance : one finger of light tan lacing falls quickly . dark brown body , with some clear visibility around the edges . flavor : wow ... something went horribly wrong with this one . tastes like some kind of cleaning solution ( mop & glo ? , though i 've admittedly never imbibed it ) up front and then blood . once the malt starts showing up , the flavor is as if someone cut the beer with some water , and squeezed-in few drops of lemon juice .

appearance : a nicely hazy , golden-amber body with a big white head that features decent retention and lacing . lo an behold , there 's even some sediment at the bottom of the bottle . not much wrong with the way it looks .
appearance : a deep black syrup that seems to stick to the glass ( with a gentle swirl or after a sip ) .
a : crystal clear orange with a white head that has large formed bubbles .
appearance : small head that disappeared quickly , mildly cloudy , with not too much action going on inside my glass .
a : it 's black . black as hell to be exact . the head is frothy and fairly thick . a good inch of cream colored love on top .

a : very light golden orangish color , you could definitely see through it . not much head , but a nice thin lacing throughout the glass . tons and tons of carbonation bubbles flow nicely to the top .
appearance : redder than rubies , with barely any bubbles , they were quite soapy and frail , but quite normal for this style , methinks .

a : translucent orange/red in color . big head upon pour that falls quickly . lots of lacing left over . presence of sediment and `` floaties '' really take away from what would otherwise be a very sexy beer . floaties are rather large . 4.5
a : pours a cloudy golden color with a slight orange hue . provides a big frothy white foam head that is long lasting . provides decent lacing .

a : poured into a nonic pint glass . semi-vigorous pour reveals a deep brown ( nearly black ) opaque brew with a beautifully reverse-cascading two-finger head of frothy espresso-colored foam . the head seems to want to linger forever , making the presentation extremely appealing and inviting . a fine lace clings to the glass as the head slowly recedes to a thick cap . flawless .

a : big billowy fluffy ivory-colored head , 3 '' in height . in a couple minutes it settles from within to a 1/4 '' cake , then eventually to a thin whispy layer . minimal lace at first , then becoming more generous as it warms .
a : a light golden body , with decent carbonation holds a white head with nice lacing and good head retention .
a : nice clear golden color . lace on the glass ran away relatively fast . great looking head at first that dissipated faster than expected .
a : black color . two fingers of creamy light brown head . retention is good and plenty of lacing is left . i 'm impressed so far . 2.5
a : purs a clear copper color with clingy carbonation and a bubbly head . no lacing .
appearance : dark red , like a sherry with a crown of lace .

appearance : this beer comes in bottles . after pouring this beer into a clear glass , i noticed that it had an orange/amber colour with a nice amount of carbonation and a short head . later on there was a very small amount of noticable lacing on the glass . not the best i have seen .

a : pours an absolutely massive cream colored orange-tinged head beneath a hazy orange-copper body . literally , the head was sticking 4 1/2 inches out of the glass like a snow cone . when it finally receded it left tons of thick , sticky lacing on the glass and a solid 1/2 to 3/4 inch of foam retained atop the beer . looks great , i must say .
appearance : thin foamy head that quickly dissipated into a fizz .
appearance : dark brown in color , with not much head , probably due to snifter glass .
a : the pour is just about black with a tan head on it .
a : oh yeah . pours a thick , dunkel brown/black . very slightly lighter on the edges . nice , creamy brown head that sticks around and to the sides . 5/5

appearance : hazy brick red pour with a sticky off-white cap . flavor : saltine crackers , biscuity , earthy hops , and some spicy floral flavors . a brush of alcohol but this flavor is really lacking . just a little malt and hops and really nothing else .

appearance : pours a one finger medium off-white head with good retention . a nice partially clear gamboge orange color with next to zero carbonation evident . head fades to a wisp and a thick ring around the edges . a bit of a wisp and ring remain to the end leaving a bit of lacing down the sides . average for the style .
a : pours a clear yet dull honey color . virtually no head , a few stray splotches of foam float on top . bottle label fits its style well- very 'classic ' and 'canadian ' feel to it .
appearance : poured from a bottle a straw yellow with a thin white head .

a : pours a dark golden color with a fairly substantial bubbly white head that took its time reducing into a thin film that left a surprising amount of lacing down the glass . this beer was darker than i was expecting and actually looks good .
a : golden straw color . slight chill haze . thin snow white head that disappears as quickly . minimal , if any lacing .
a : caramel in colour , with tons of fluffy , slightly off-white head ! lots of retention and incredible lacing ! ( enough to make some stouts jealous ) ! exceptional . perfect .
a : typical adjunct lager urine-yellow . a nice head bubbles up but disappears almost instantly leaving no lacing .

a : creepy gurgle sound from the bottle when i popped the cap . clank-clank from the nitro capsule . the body is n't nearly as black as i remember , more light a dark brown , with amber tones by the edge of the glass . 1/2 '' creme colored head holds on for a long time , some muddy brown colored curtains from the head falling back into the body . the lacing is very impressive , it coats everywhere with a thick creme curtain .

a : not quite sure if it lives up to the `` triple hoppy '' tag on the bottle , but it is damn hoppy for sure . great aromatics that smell like a big ol ' bowl of fruit jambalaya . i get pineapples , peaches , oranges , grapefruit , and a squeeze of lemon . malt is there if you concentrate on it , but they take a backseat to the fireworks show put on by the hops .
a : murky amberish orange with a thin white head . no lacing as you drink , but a good retention on the head .
a : copper color , really small head , fully translucent , not a lot of lacing .
appearance : a brilliant chestnut color , completely clear . head is nonexistent , save for a thin ring of bubbles .

a : hazy golden body with an over load of white fluffy head . there was way to much carbonation in this beer , i poured a bit , then it exploded into foam . lost half the beer and needed a major clean up . not impressed . retention and lacing is good though .
a : pours a clear copper-amber body with ( when served ) not much head on it . a moderate collar with some scattered lace are all that remain of the foam . no lace during sips .

appearance : after pouring into a glass i was struck at how pale the color was and how effervescent it became . besides the clarity , the thin head also indicated a light bodied beer . it was quick to foam but also quick to settle leaving almost no webbing on the glass wall at all . as i was drinking , webbing never quite appeared on the glass .
a : a nice pink/white head on top of a ruby red liquid . decent head retention with some good lacing .

a : deep opaque black with light ruby edges . a large , rocky , and mocha-colored head composed of large , erratic bubbles settles slowly to a thin foamy covering , leaving some nice rings of lace in its wake . nice appearance .
a : red to brown hue . poor head retention and a low brown finger of head .
appearance : it comes in dark-amber to reddish colour , with very fine carbonation and milky-white , extre ... mely dense and thick beerhead which lasts throughout the drink . simply remarkable !
a : reddish , coppery gold , clear . nice 3-finger off-white head , and yes , lots of lacing on my bells glass . good amount of carbonation too .
a : nice color for certain . very clingy foamy head ; about 1 inch after a typical pour . nice amber/pale melded color typical of style .
appearance : deep brown but still transparent .
a : clear gold color with champagne-esqe bubbles with a decent sized head that does not stick to the glass .

a : the first time i saw this beer opened it was a room-temp gusher , so i popped this one right out of the fridge . an initially gentle pour soon shows that overcarbonation wo n't be an issue , and the final picture is a perfectly adequate finger of coarse tan foam atop a dark reddish-brown body . the head demonstrates reasonable retention but only spotty lace . not bad , but not especially great , either .
a : like a pale orange . a thin and pale yellow-orange with a little head that goes away in the blink of an eye and leaves no laceing .

appearance : big chunky , pillowy head . color is pale yellow . very cloudy . lacing looks more like a popcorn ceiling and stays around for about as long . flavor : dominate flavor is funk.. lemony fruit notes and light malt . tasted like someone dropped a sweet tart in the bottle . bitterness is medium-high .
a : the appearance is really fabulous . the beer is transparent and pale yellow , with pockets of carbonation bubbles throughout . the head is a gorgeous , white froth that lingers indefinitely .
a : mahogony color with dark brown showing around the edges , thick brown head that retains for a good while , very nice lacing . a very good-looking beer .
a : lots of frothy head leaving tons of lacing , sits atop a clear amber-brown beer .
a : pours an attractive dark amber with 1 inch head . the head has decent retention and leaves a surprising amount of lacing .
appearance : bright topaz with a light yeasty haze . similar in color to a butterscotch candy . head is just barely off-white and does not retain well .
a : cloudy amber color , no head of foam , i guess if the logo is the volcano popocateplet ;

appearance : served in an eight-ounce glass , comes with a great frothy white head , excellent retention ( at least for a barleywine ) and lacing . color is dark caramel , very opaque . looks are the winning part of this brew .
a : nice red/ amber color , roasty brown head , and very cloudy .
a : clear slightly ruddy golden color with a two-finger fluffy white head . good retention and lacing . marred slightly by some small black floaters .
a : pours a hazy canteloupe orange with an inch of off-white head . nice carbonation up the center of the glass . the head recedes into a collar around the drink and leaves lacing down the glass .
a : pours black body with a two finger off white head on top . has good retention and lacing . when back lite , has a deep ruby red color .

appearance : barely a hiss when the cork pops . pours thick and black as hell . almost no head . at all . a rim of dark brown foam and some smaller floating bubbles is all there is . just a couple spots of lacing .
a : blah . thin body and thin head probably means thin flavor
a : vivacious golden rod color with thousands of scurrying bubbles vortexing too and fro . head is quite spectacular , full and creamy made up of tight off white bubbles . so far so good .
appearance : opaque , purple hue . no head , no lacing .

a : pours a two finger head of light cream , okay thickness , and good retention . cloudy murky dirty orange colour . nontransparent . sm : a floral aroma , with yeast , bacteria , lilac , and orange peel . smells soft - if that 's possible . pleasant , inviting , and fecking brilliant . incredibly inviting . heavenly . a pretty strong aroma .
a : completely opaque black body . this pours with a large , sticky , and rocky light tan colored head .
a : semi-hazy amber color with a very small white head that dissipates quickly and leaves no lacing .
a : pours black with a full tan head , very good retention and lace .
appearance : the beer has a ruby opaque body to light . the head is a small tan quickly resolving affair . no lacing is noted on my glass .

a : * @ & % ! ! ! this thing is a gusher . why did i do it so close to the computer why oh why oh why oh why did i backup recently f*** me it 's on the keys now people are going to look at me funny when i 'm typing in a meeting and my keys are sticky crapcrapcrapcrap it looks like i 'm talking about fapping pours a glowing , murky reddish-amber body capped with tons of fluffy tan head . it just keeps coming and coming and- ... uh , anyway . i like head on a beer , but this is at the point where it 's absurdly overdone .
a : stubble yellow , with a thin , fluffy white head that vanishes rapidly .

appearance : pours an orange/ruby red that is very dark , but crystal clear . fine carbonation leads to a fluffy quarter inch of tight tan head , that has some decent staying power and leaves behind a nice lace .

a : little to no head and i 'll be terribly surprised if any lacing develops . dainty yellow orange color body . there is hardly any visible carbonation . where 's my frothy never ending cap ? where 's the relentless effervescence ? while this brew is mildly attractive in it 's own right , the asylum is way off the mark in terms of tripel-like appearance .
a : pours a hazy orange color with 2-fingers of white head with holding power ! this beer in my glass was also lacing really well . very impressed so far .
a : super cloudy golden yellow . enormous off white white head with some lacing .
a : pours a 3.5 finger head of fair cream and decent thickness . clear yellow colour . a nice upward bubble show . sm : wheat , crystal hops . standard fare for the style .
a : pours a cloudy deep brown with no head or lacing .
a : the cork slid out quickly and silently . an angry pour netted not one bubble or hint of foam . absolutely still . clear , rosey-red with no hint of sediment .
a : clear yellow color and no head ... probably thanx to the glass .
a : black color . just about one finger of light brown head that fell quickly and left no lacing . 5.0

appearance : pours into my new belgium globe glass a crystal clear copper gold with 2 fingers worth of fluffy white head on top . it drops slowly to a full cap with constant help of the nucleation sites in the glass . lacing comes in sheets creating a picture perfect ale .
a : orangish/amberish/murky-light brownish color that is pretty hazy . tons of carbonation ripping up that creates a huge , rocky and very thick , light khaki head . nice sticky lacing .

a : crystal clear light amber color . head was initially about 1 1/2 inches and fluffy white , but dissipated quickly , leaving a scant layer of suds and no lacing . i hand washed this glass and rinsed it at least five times with hot water , so i 'm pretty sure the glass is clean enough to hold the head .
a : darkish copper with quickly dissipating head and no lacing .
a : pours a cloudy straw yellow/ amber into a erdinger wiezen glass with about three fingers of great frothy white head that leaves awesome lacing .
a : hazy , luminous , pale golden color with over one finger of white foam head that is initially lofty and goes on to show some staying power . heavy lacing remains on the glass .
appearance : cloudy , weak lacing
a : thin dull gold , with little carbonation rising . small white head .
appearance : tawny amber color with a weak head that dissipates very quickly .
appearance : pours a stunningly beautiful golden orange with thick , pale white , one-thumb ( it 's a tapered glass and i have big fingers ) head with surprisingly ample lacing .
appearance : looks like a pissy yellow beer , the decent head quickly disappears with no lacing . carbonation is apparent in the tasting but not the glass
appearance : crystal-clear , bright bubbly gold with two fingers of solid white foam sitting on top . good head retention ; lively carbonation .
a : pours toasted honey with little/no head production , some wisps of white here and there . no lace . hazy . like ramen beef broth .
a : pours a bright golden color with lots of carbonation . provides a two finger white foam head with really nice retetion . there is some moderate lacing .
a : pours a bright and effervescent amber-gold . a small head forms and quickly dissipates in under a minute .
a : pours a cloudy yellow body , 2 '' of well-retaining off-white head . lacing is restrained , but a few dribs and drabs are noticed .
appearance : pours a orange-golden color with a huge three finger head ,
a : poured deep blackish-brown with a lot of head , more than two fingers with good lacing and retention .

a : pours a clear , well-carbonated medium amber body with two fingers of lusciously creamy off-white head . excellent , rocky retention and plenty of lace . i ca n't imagine a better looking apa . seriously .

a : certainly very amber in appearance . reminded me of bigfoot , but not quite as thick in appearance . has some beautiful ruby red hues when held up to light . but generally light brown/copperish . mild , tan head retention that leaves a soapy lacing on the glass .
a : light orange-brown . unappetizing rusty color . lots of bubbles on the side of the glass . thick head at first , but it melts down quickly into a thin membrane . hardly any lacing .

a : in this glass the color is awesome . it 's light honey at the bottom and gradually grows into a dark amber underneath a 1 finger head . the carbonation is very good . the head thins out in a few minutes and the beer leaves great lacing .
appearance : medium/dark brown , not much of a head that recedes quickly
a : pours a half finger head of no cream , bad thickness , and terrible retention . colour is a clear yellow-gold . sm : malt , straw , and stale cream . a mild strength aroma .
a : pours a somewhat pallid , translucent , red-orange , with a small white head , fair retention , minimal bubble lacing .
appearance : golden color with a quickly dissipating head . yeast is visible throughout the glass .
a : absolutely perfect pale lemon-yellow , cloudy but still visible carbonation , nice thin head , good lacing .
a : deep golden , copper with pretty much no head . no retention and no lace , obviously . just about the only complaint for me on this one .
a : dark opaque beer with small frothy tan head that last for a short period of time out of a tapered 16oz glass .
a : deeply hazed orangish brown color . two fingers of foamy head . retention is just short of average and little lacing is left . overall , an ugly looking brew . 3.5
a : clear , coppery medium amber with two fingers of off-white foam ; great retention and lacing . a beautiful ipa in every way .
a : not the prettiest looking beer . murky straw in color with a finger or so of white head .
a : clear amber color . no head or lacing .

appearance : deep , dark black-brown body . light brown , whipped-creamy head with lots of staying power and lace all over the place . small cloud islands in a sea of darkness ... does n't get any more inviting .
a : pours a gritty , earthy , dirt brown with a tiny tan head that fizzles to a slight rim that causes some light lacing . overly , not the most appealing looking beer , somewhat dull .
a : pours a perfectly clear polished mahogany hue with a medium corona of froth that fades to an eggshell white ring .

a : pours a clear , very pale gold , under the tiniest of white heads that does n't cover the entire beer . no lace , no retention . slightest bit of yeast sediment is left in this one , but seems to be filtered for the most part .
appearance : heavy amber with a thick haze head : nice frosty dark tan head
a : pours a thick black with some dark brown hues along the edges and finishes with a 1.5 finger brown head that slowly dissipates leaving a wonderful lace behind .
a : the best feature of this beer . dark brown with a stunning white foamy head that lasts and has amazing retention as it settles down .
appearance : pours a clear mocha color but sits opaque in the glass . a finger of light tan head forms and sticks around for a shockingly long duration for an indian wells beer .
a : meh . little head , no lacing , no tracing . a mild-dark brown with strange particulate matter ( yeast ? ) floating all around .
appearance : very little head , maybe 1/2 inch . settles quickly into nothing . beer is slightly hazy , medium yellow .
a : pours dark brown with a small bubbly head . very little retention or lacing .

appearance : great label . sometimes less is more . gorgeous mahogany reddish brown but very dark . nice creamy yellowish latte head that looks like it will go the distance . clean and filtered with lots of tiny bubbles racing to the surface . the brussels lace is textbook , bravo .
a : pours a slightly murky orange with a two inch very sticky head and nice lacing

a : after a brief struggle with the cork , a pleasant hiss erupts and the beer rushes towards the top . pour yields a massive 3 finger fluffy white head with great retention . beer is a clear , golden orange that reveals copious amounts of carbonation . lacing is thick and frothy with great stick . an amazing looking beer all-around .
appearance : 4.5 |
a : dark amber with redish highlights . one and a half finger rocky , tan head . awesome retention and sticky lacing .

appearance : pours a dull , turgid , muddy sepia , opaque a short distance in from the edge of the glass though partially transparent near the rim , and even the most vigorous of pours from the ( adorable , as always ) bottle yields only about half a finger of lightly beiged head that disappears completely inside five seconds . the only remnants it ever even existed are a few streaks ( and ultimately , a few glittery dots ) of side lacing and a thin , wispy dusting of surface lace sitting near the center of the glass . yep - this one 's dead , and , to be fair , it did n't have a lot of margin for error , given the general unattractiveness of the hue to begin with .
appearance : clear mahagony brown in color with a big 3 '' head that lingers a while . some mild lacing develops .

appearance : pours with an immense , pillowy head , nearly half the glass at first . this lite tan foam settles very slowly , leaving behind the best lacing i have seen . the lacing on the glass is thicker than the head on some beers . the beer itself is a crystal clear amber with lots of activity .
a : ink black color with a small head . there is little to no retention and zero lacing .
a : poured with a small head and spotty lacing . great golden color with a slight red hue to it .
a : golden yellow with a large white head .
a : lightly hazy copper color with orange in there . it actually does look like the sunset .
appearance : pours a golden orange color with an aggressive 3 '' , slightly yellow head . great retention and tons of lacing . perfect so far !

a : pours a crystal clear light straw colored body . a 1/4 '' head formed after a very aggressive pour , and faded very quickly to just a thin ring at the edge of the glass . a few fat carbonation bubbles rise quickly here and there . only a few strings of light lacing are left on the glass just after sipping , but fade very quickly .
a : hazy yellow colored , very weak off-white head ( literally almost nothing ) . carbonation bubbles covering the glass .
a : pours a pale clear straw yellow , your usual run of the mill adjunct beer here . not much of a head , and what was left of it fades quick .
a : hmm , hazy medium light yellow . not exactly beautiful . medium head and carbonation . not impressed ...

a : 11.2 oz bottle . this beer poured an uncontrolable amount of head , almost thinking i got a bad bottle . another interesting tid-bit on the bottle was it had a made date of 05/08/2009 , best before 05/08/2014 . that seams like a long time to collect dust on the bottle and for a beer to settle .
a : pours a motor oil black , with a small thin tan head , which surprisingly stays around for a long time , though it looks kind of flat on the first pour .
appearance : very nice amber color , closer to orange . nice two finger head , and great lacing . very active carbonation .
a : pours beautifully . a nice thick head which leaves a delecate lace . the color is amber with golden sides . i think this is the ideal ipa color . plus it is crystal clear . very nicely done .
a : pours a dark sepia brown , with a full , off-white/tan head , that stays robust throughout the whole glass , leaving excellent , thick lacing . a sight to behold .
appearance : pours a plain black body with a frothed , though quickly diminishing , off-white head .
a : pours a big bold black hue with very little head . there are tons of bubbles , but all it can build is a rather wimpy lilly pad esque head . retention is nil , with no lace noted .

a : light copper . medium carbonation pours into a half finger , bubbly , white head . dissipates quickly leaving not much to shield your beer from the dangerous and scary outside forces . carbonation continues to rise throughout . leaves some beer ring lacing as you drink .
a : pours a 2 finger foamy white head that collapses quickly . beer is a cloudy lemon with a slight red tint ... a golden raisin if you will . no lacing .
appearance : cloudy yellow , with creamy white head . the best part of the beer , i think .
appearance : super clear yellow , with only a collar of head , but decent lacing flavor : smells like a candle , tastes like one too . swear i got a waxy taste out of it .

appearance : poured out of an 11.2 oz . bottle into a nonic glass . the plastic label tells me to `` serve extra cold '' and to `` drink straight from the bottle '' , but i do n't take orders from bottles . this beer pours an opaque dark brown color , but when held up to a light the beer appears a dark , ruby red color that supports the old saying that `` there 's a ruby in every glass '' . the nitro-bottle gives the head the usual cascade effect and produces a swirling storm inside the glass that eventually rises to a soft , pillowy , and very creamy looking beige colored head about one-and-a-half fingers in height . the head sticks around for an absolute eternity , and never really dissipates , just stays a thin layer of foam on top of the beer .
appearance : orange-copper color , medium head . very good lacing at drinking points on the glass , and in-between with a white dotty film .

a : pours a clear pale straw body topped by an inch of pure white , highly active foam ; surprisingly decent retention and lace . as much as i want to attack this beer , i ca n't really say anything bad about its appearance relative to style - the color is even lighter than i might like , but the carbonation is spot on : solid without being ridiculous .
a : pours straw yellow with a very translucent stream and fizzy head , just like the lighter sibling .
appearance : perfect , poofy , marshmallowy cream-white head lasts and lasts atop a barely hazy , sunset orange-cinnamon body .
a : looks like the stone irs - black , with a thick brown head , nice lacing and legs .
a : pours a wheaty-straw color ... really has a nice even character when held up to light . pretty good head with slight lacing .
a : very pale golden , half inch head dissapears fast leaving little lacing

a : poured a burnt orange with a frothy 2 finger cream colored head that was moderatly lasting leveling to a skim coating that persisted for the remainder of the drink . the lacing was spongey and near full coating the glass on the way down . perhaps the most intriguing aspect visually was the insanely turbid nature , my glass was a snow globe of eye candy ( im trade-marking this so do n't even think about using it in your review ) of yeasty flakes that danced and swirled around the glass much like in a snow globe . the feverishly strong carbonation produced a topsy-turvy and rising and sinking notion of large visible bran colored yeast matter creating a blizzard in my glass . needless to say this was one of the most interesting visuals ive seen .
a : pours a hazy dark yellow , very fizzy head .
appearance : quite good . pours a pale gold with outstanding carbonation and a large bubbly white head that quickly dissipates to a thin lace . very champagne like .
appearance : amber , slightly reddish . lacing is very white with smallish bubble , dissipates pretty quickly .

a : pours out like champagne . big , fizzy white head . it faded quickly , but left a thin layer on top . it looks almost like lemonade . it is a clear pale yellow , with carbonation running up the glass . it is almost clear . never seen a beer this clear .

a : poured a beautiful honey/copper hue with a 1-inch cream colored head . head retention died off after awhile , but the beer still seemed to hold a quarter inch head throughout the entire drinking session . the only true knock on the appearance was the lack of lacing .
a : gentle pour yields a .5 finger fine , milk chocolate colored head that dissipates quickly into thin wisps atop an opaque black brew . lacing is very spotty and sparse with little cling .
a : this was a clear , dark , golden orange color . it poured with a large , airy looking , big bubbled head that faded to moderate lace .

appearance : a monster three finger ivory head that is creamy and foamy . the body of the beer is is a medium gold color with some orange hues . there is a lot of effervescence in the beer . the clarity of the beer is mostly clear with some haziness .
a : this beer pours a hazy orange color with a frothy white head that leaves decent lacing . as with other brews from mad river , this one also throws some serious sediment .
appearance : light yellow , to basically clear , even more clear than others

appearance : big , white , belgian head , mountainous and snowy with thick , cloudy lace . body is a bright orange-amber with tiny bits of sediment in evenly-distributed suspension . bold and classy .
a : amber colored , with a white head which quickly dissipates .
a : poured a one fingered rusty auburn , which is a nice rarity . this is beyond cloudy and the color that it makes is just beautiful especially with its nicely rising carbonation .

appearance : with an aggressive pour into my snifter there was barely a head . the 1/8 of an inch of bubbly white fizz faded to nothing . the color is a hazy straw yellow . the appearance is very disappointing and is easily overshadowed by many macro brews i have had . no lacing what so ever .
a : pale cloudy yellow , next to no head .

appearance : the pale of this yellow is extreme ; one of the lightest colored beers i have ever seen . some soapy foaming upon pouring , but no head retention . after a minute , all you see of carbonation is a few itinerant bubbles . lacing , what 's that ?
appearance : a brilliantly hazy , orange-tinged golden body with brilliant tendrils of yeast stretching from top to bottom . up top , a big , fluffy off-white head that leaves patchy lacing .
a : black . pours with a huge , off-white , almost tan head . there 's only a little retention , but it leaves a little lace .
appearance : pours a 1/2 finger pure white head which quickly falls leaving minor lacing on the sides of my snifter . the body is straw gold in color .

a : hazy light gold color . just a little lazy carbonation rising to a thin , short-lived white head . has a 'watery ' look , like the golden-ness of the beer has actually been separated out and is suspended . worst of all there are ( uh oh ) flecks of brown at the bottom the glass , either spent barley husks or cardboard ; either way , they should n't be there .
a : hard pour produces a beautiful deep burnt orange & blood red sunset color , with 3-finger rocky , dirty white head . lots of lacing left behind .
a : reddish brown hue with a mild head - offwhite , and did n't really last long . not bad , but nothing mind-blowing .
a : light porter-brown colored with ruby red tinting and white 1 '' head with seemingly both cherry pink and cappuccino tainting that stays afloat like a raft . interesting for a stout .

appearance : pours a remarkably clear light gold with large carbonation bubbles fueling the big 4 finger whit head in my flute . the whit head has a decent retention but not quite impressive . what impressed me was the carbonation bubbles that looked like a lava lamp in the golden body . mmm looks good .
a : copper in color with a short , fizzy head .

a : pours into a goblet , the exact color of apple juice . the beer itself is crystal clear , but there are chunks of a bizarre fleshy bits in the beer . i suppose that means this bottle is either the first or last of the tank , since a quick scan of other reviews indicates that this is n't the norm . i 've also seen this in dogfish head 's red and white . kinda makes me question the brewery 's qc , but moving on ... white head that quickly vanishes .
a : a golden straw color . big bubbly head . varied fat carbonation bubbles lazily make their way to the surface .
a : poured normally into a pint glass revealed a 1 finger head and a nice ambery-dark colour that i like to see in ipa 's . might be some malt behind that hop bite .
appearance : pours a cloudy muddy orange head : light tan head that dissipates quickly
a : pours very dark brown , nearly black , looks `` burnt '' and features a big pillowy beige head .
a : crystal clear orange with a one-finger , nonpersistent head that fizzes down to a mackerel sky and then a lace ring around the goblet edges .
a : black with zero head or carbonation coming from the bottle . it could be that i got a bad bottle but in any event this was pretty terrible in terms of presentation
a : copper-amber with a exceptional head , continual lacing even after it subsides .
a : pours a deep brownish amber color with a half inch of creamy brown hued head
a : poured a nice dark brown with tan head .

a : this pint comes in an almost opaque , extre ... mely dark brownish to pitch-black hue , with an inch-thick , incredibly tight and frothy , light-ovaltine-coloured beer head which lasts throughout the drink ... decent looking .
a : a golden , straw-like colour . looks like a standard lager . less carbonation than i expected , however .
a : the beer pours a pitch black color , with a large fluffy mocha color head which is sticking all over the glass , may be one of the best looking beers i have seen ...

appearance : pours out a golden-orange body , quite clear , and with a bubbly white head that was gone in the time it took to yell at meemo the cat for clawing up the poor , defenseless carpet . that idiot .
a : pours a deep copper gold with a persistent tan head that fades to very nice lace . after last night 's pale yellow `` amber '' beer , this one is actually amber .
a : golden-yellow , white head , very little retention or lace .
a : deep garnet clear body with a beautiful creamy 1 finger tan head .
a : very impressive , clear red colour , with a firm white head that lasts forever , with some nice lace .
a : not a very thick head upon pouring . head is very , very white and a bit thin . color although not bad is very pale . looks like a pilsner . straw yellow .
a : straw yellow with a massive white head that slowly recedes to a thick disk , leaving tons of lace and foam in my stein
a : pours a cloudy , dark golden w/ 1.5-inch off-white , foamy head . lots and lots of lacing .
a : super aggressive pour gives a minimal creme white head . it quickly dissipates to a ring . the beer itself is burnt orange in color and cloudy , ca n't see through at all . almost no lacing .
a : pours a deep ruby that 's nearly completely opaque . good strong head forms and holds nicely if not a bit rocky . nice sticky lacing throughout .
appearance : this beer looks really good . dark golden orange color with nice fluffy white head . good sticky lacing . this looks like a very nice saison .
a : deep orange , totally cloudy with a crazy pinky of thick foamy head that leaves nice lacing . i guess that 'd be a 5 for malt liquor to me !
appearance : dark dark brown , held up to the light dark amber . white head dissipates completely and leaves zero lacing .
a : red and slightly hazy . one finger red/pink head that dissipated quickly .
a : served a super dark brown with red highlights under a half inch of dense nitro head that lasted forever and left great lacing .
appearance : oooh pale yellow . surprise . minimal head and scant carbonation . the head collapses to a film after 1.5 seconds . no lacing .
a : pours a deep red clear body with two fingers of thin white bubbly head . retention is good and lacing is pleasing .

a : lightly copper-hued . you expect copper hues , but you do n't expect them to be so light . another thing you do n't expect is the absolute clarity of this brew , a clarity which , the longer you study it , seems more and more suggestive of thinness rather than simple purity . other reviewers have noted their suprise at this brew 's paleness and clarity , and i got ta say : i 'm suspicious of claims to greatness in an ipa when you do n't see at least a dusting of yeast in the amber when you hold your glass to the light .
a : super clear burnt orange color . the pour dropped a nice 2 finger cream head that receeded and left great lace . this is one seriouly good looking beer .
appearance : looks like mango juice with a small but very creamy nitro-like head that was very persistent .

a : the cork rips in half when trying to remove . using a corkscrew results in the rest of the cork falling into the beer itself . poured through the strainer , it pours blacker than the inside of satan 's sphincter . the strainer catches the pieces of cork along with what looks like phlegm a smoker of 80 years would cough up . no carbonation .

a : poured a half finger of extremely light , fizzy head that disappeared in the blink of an eye . zero retention up top and zero lace on the glass . color is orangeish amber , which is n't bad , but the lack of head is unacceptable for a wheat -- light or not .

appearance : one of the most beautiful pumpkin beers i 've witnessed . beautiful amber in color , nice size head slowly rises and reduces as it settles in , perfect lacing and retention here , truly fantastic !
appearance : clear amber with a head that fades out to nothing very quickly .

a : clear medium-gold body with just half an inch of coarse white foam ( even after a fairly hard pour ) . moderate retention and only spotty lacing . not nearly as bubbly as i 'd expect from the style , but not too bad .
a : pee-coloured , bubbly on the glass . little bright white head .
a : pours black with an inch of foam that is a really nice shade of dark brown . retention is good . looks great .

a : vigorous pour leads to a 4.5 finger quickly collapsing head that retains nicely at 3 fingers . head is white , semi-coarse , powdery , fluffy , and very foamy . also incredibly dense . brew is a crystal clear orange that reveals a ton of carbonation . lacing is second to none . frothy , thick , and ruler-like , measuring my every sip .
appearance : looks like i just peed in the glass . and i was quite dehydrated . very yellow and a small amount of frothy carbonation .
a : pours a dark brown , almost black . a small beige head forms and leaves some light lace behind .

appearance : pours a very dark brown , with only the faintest glimmer of color at the edges . three-finger ( large ) tan head that dissipates slowly . lacing is underwhelming however . the size of the carbonation and consistency of the head are indicative of bottle conditioning . very attractive .
a : looks pretty good , nice warm dark brown with a soft tan head , with tiny flecks of lace left behind .

appearance : i notice right away that the beer level is 2 '' from the cap of the bottle . a little suspicious ... here goes . golden orange color , orange highlights , ample carbonation , 2 '' light gold head . great retention and caked on , spongy lace all over the glass
a : jet black , large mocha colored head , reduced quickly . average lacing . this is the darkest porter i have seen .
appearance : slight head . pitch black . looks great .
a : pours a reddish color , small head that went away quickly .
appearance : murky reddish/brown with a huge billowy tan head . amazing retention , this is one of nicest looking heads on a dipa i 've ever seen . thick lacing clings to the glass .

a : deep copper/red color and slightly hazy . a finger and a half of creamy head stuck around for a few minutes and left nice lacing . average carbonation on appearance . it looks very impressive : especially the deepness of color .
appearance : deep brown to black color , nearly opaque . poured with about an inch of creamy tan head , which had a retention of a couple of minutes , leaving generous lacing . so far , so good .
appearance : dark tan , no head , no carbonation
a : dark black , opaque , dark brown head , good legs
appearance : clear amber brew topped by a thick head of dense white foam . light carbonation , good lacing effects .

a : if theres one thing that sun king has down , its look . this one has a gorgeous , shining gold body , with a creamy white head . the foam looks a bit oily at times , as it does tend to dissipate quickly ; lacing is there , but minimal . could have been the pour , too these pints are poured more for amount of liquid than head plumage . still , theres a pretty good showing . love that color , though !
a : there 's nothing pale about the color . this is dark , dark orange and is hazy . there is a 2 finger off white head that has excellent retention and lacing .

appearance : not much of a head when poured was my first significant note here . in fact it soon settles with a scummy looking thin broken covering that has a small sad looking beige ring halo head around the edges . the body of the beer has a golden glow , with a few streamers . looks flat , old , tired and lonely .

a : i poured this both ways , vigorously , and easy . vigorously , a one finger head was produced ; a smoother pour produced virtually no head . this review is based on the rougher pour . as a result , the one finger head disappeared within the minute . the brew is a hazy light golden color , with a slight orange hue . there were quite a few particles floating around , and i 'm not sure what exactly what they were either , maybe yeast , maybe dried fruit . i was n't impressed .

a : wow ... .this is a massive beer . a moderate pour resulted in a head that exploded in the glass and exceeded its capacity at over four fingers . after i recovered and resorted to a gentile pour i saw a dark murky chocolate body that when back lit had deep ruby colors . the head was massive and sticky and receded slowly to a nice rich cover over the liquid it also supported a long-legged curtain of lacing that also hung in there long into the drink ( surprisingly considering the high abv of this brew ) .

a : gorgeous look to this one . dark amber body , with a two-finger cloud white head with great retention and enough lacing to make you wan na take a spoon to the sides of the glass to get your money 's worth . hazy , as the yeast is still hanging around .

appearance : clear , gold , slight amber with small bubbles . not exactly like how it appeared on their website , more yellowish than i expected but not too pale . fluffy , off-white head which dissipates quickly . very light lacing .
a : pours a beautiful yellow-orange with slight cloud and hint of yeast sediment . 2+ inch thick bubbly white head . like admiring a wondrous sunrise .

a : about a finger of white bubbly head dissipates rapidly into a body that is swampy and murky . it 's a very pale orangish-yellow that to me is not that appealing , though it may be appropriate for the style .

a : pitch black , guinness-like color with a mocha-tan , cascading , stout-like head -- around two fingers ' worth . fine , sticky bubbles leaving a nice lacing as the head slowly settles down to a finger 's worth . head thinning out dramatically as i drink , but still good lacing .
a : pours a beautiful pink with a peach hue . pretty pink foam cap disappears quickly to a clean surface . really a pretty beer with murky clarity which lends well to the colors .

appearance : looks a lot darker than i expected , almost an amber/honey color . about a finger of creamy , off-white head which dissipates smoothly leaving almost no lacing on the glass . little to no carbonation . perfectly average .
a : 3 finger thick mail chocolate head . black with redhues and light getting through . tons of lace .
a : golden copper in color , with great clarity . one finger off white head , that is super creamy , with good retention and awesome lacing .
a : clear and fairly dark brown . edges give wisps or brownish red . where is the head though ? barely there and fizzy . no lacing .
a : pours dark straw yellow , no lasting head .
appearance : amber with a nice 1 '' head off the tap
a : very clear beer , obviously lagered to its full length leaving this one practically see through . bone white head .

a : appears similar to amber wildflower honey colored in the glass . huge voluminous snow white head forces me to pour by parts into my glass as the head recedes . insane amounts of lace sheets cover my glass . surprisingly it 's very leggy and viscous as well . it does n't get any better looking than this . 5/5
a : copper color , huge creamy head and which lasts forever . marvelous !
a : pours a ruby brown color . no head and no lace .

a : with 2 oz reserved , poured a light-golden , clear color with minimal head and rapid dissipation . pouring the remaining 2 oz resulted in a hazy appearance ( typical ) . this style should have a thick , mousse-like , persistent head ( -1.5 ) .
a : pours red-orange with a light soapy/frothy white head , spotty lace .
a : no head at all ( likely as a result of the high abv ) . colour is a cloudy orange . sm : orange citrus ester fruit hops . a simple , generic , mild strength aroma .

appearance : this beer , when poured from a bottle into a pint glass , produced a 1/2 '' slightly off-white head with fair head lacing that dissipated quickly . body was a cloudy gold with soft carbonation
a : pours a translucent yellow amber with a small amount of white head . not much retains , leaving nearly no lacing .

a : pours a deep mahoghany brown , almost maroon . little wisps of film on top ; no head . very still , color resembles brewed tea . quite a few suspended white particles ( yeast ? ) make it look murky and less attractive . bottle said nothing about pouring carefully ... did i do something wrong ?

appearance : a monster two finger head that has really good retention . the head is frothy and bubbly with a nice off white head . the color of the beer is a medium amber color with a nice orange highlight . the clarity of the beer is hazy , with carbonation bubbles . the haziness is from the yeast .
a : a clever red/cranberry hue with a pinkish cranberry head that vanishes relatively quickly .
a : nice head , brown , black color .
appearance : pours a completely opaque deep dark brown color , almost black . the head formed 1-2 fingers thick , very creamy , and retained nicely .
a : amber-brown , fluffy off-white head , great retention and lace . amazing for its weight .

appearance : pours extremely thick , almost chunky . in my glass , it 's a very very dark brown and completely opaque . no light getting through this bad boy . the dark tan head disapates somewhat quickly but leaves a nice collar and a lot of patchy lacing .
appearance : like most beers , coors looks good . damn good .
appearance : dark black beer with almost no head at all . not much to look at .

a : a clean dark gold color with a crazy amount of sediment . almost liked suspended red pepper all over the beer , but not anything making it cloudy . good carbonation , low head , low head retention , low lacing .
appearance : bright copper with a fantastically foamy , cream-colored head . good retention , excellent lacing spattered against the side of the glass .
appearance : pours a standard near black shade of dark brown with just a hint of an espresso brown head that disappears very quickly .
a : a thick off-white head quickly died down to nothing in the glass , not even a thin ring . virtually no lacing . beautiful mahogany color beer .

a : poured a very hazy , orange color , with a nice two finger white head that looked very reminiscent of ground up penicillin . bubbles shot up through the glass from the bottom throughout the session .
a : pours a reddish mahogany with a khaki head that fades to a thick ring and leaves no lacing on the glass .
appearance : clear , yellow color with 1 finger of head that fades quickly to a ring with little lacing .
appearance : okay it 's a 4.75 ... the head could be darker . otherwise it 's perfect . the lacing is again epic . three finger head and the retention is going on five minutes .
a : the beer is a dark reddish brown color , with a large light brown head that fades slowly and leaves a thick lace on the glass .
a : pours a cloudy gold color , with absolutely no head , carbonation , or lacing . another victim of lost abbey 's quality control issues .
appearance : pee yellow .

appearance : very eye catching . sky blue fizzy head foams up before settling to a small patch of light blue on top of the beer . the body of the beer is mostly deep blue with some slight greenish hues .
a : hazy clear yellow pour with a huge white head . tons of lacing down the glass and great retention . i really did not expect this to be so light .

a : poured from guinness ' unique nitro bottle . watched the legendary nitro cascade effect slowly settle . dark brown to black body , big , thick creamy khaki-colored head . unmatched retention , the definition of lacing .

appearance : pours a murky brown color with cherry red hues at the edges . a vigorous , but short-lived brown , red-tinted head builds and falls down just like soda would . a minimal lace ring stays behind .
appearance : murky brown with ruby highlights ; there 's little foam and it falls quickly .

appearance : this beer looked terrible in the glass . the beer poured a murky off colored brown . there was large chunks of yeast floating in the glass . the head was about an inch and a half high and quickly resolved to a foam . tight bubbles of carbonation broke the surface of the beer . dam near a drain pour just on appearance .

a : pours a dark , but clear , brown body . has a nice two fingers of off-white head in the glass ; it retains very well , and leaves thick sheets of lacing down the glass . it 's beautiful to watch as the foam collapses evenly .
a : pours with a huge thick creamy light brown head , similar in look to a guinness but more porous . good lacing . deep but clear black in color .
appearance : a thin one finger head tops the tan translucent beer with a medium amount of bubbles marching towards the head , which disappeared in less than a minute .

appearance : clear red/amber glass with an off white short lived head that collared but didnt lace . flavor : has a u shaped profile with a touch of sweetness starting the show , an empty watery middle and a rush of hop bitter at the end . the overall impression was a bit watery and the hops gave a slight metallic note as well . given that harsh critique ; the hop and malt flavors really made up for the odd middle .
appearance : beer is a dirty blonde/murky golden color with very heavy carbonation visible through the glass . head is a soft-white color with decent retention . no lacing on the sides of the glass .
a : pours a clear golden blonde color , thin head fades completely in a short time . minimal lacing on the glass .
a : amber-brown that is clear but with little effervescence or head . some evidence of legs .
a : light american lager
a : pours two solid fingers of bubbly , just slightly off-white head with low retention . head recedes to film very quickly . body is clear , true copper color . entirely style-appropriate .
a : golden yellow , very cloudy , with a nice , thick , white head .

appearance : poured with a solid thumb of frothy head , that retains quite well but does n't seem to lace . the body is a deep gold with copper highlights . carbonation looks fairly good and has good clarity .
a : pours a clear golden under a foamy white head . excellent lace and excellent retention .
a : poured into a pint was a beautiful translucent golden color with frothy white foam to form a nice 1 head . this was the most appealing aspect of this lager .
a : extremely pale coming out of the can . sloppy pour into a glass produced frothy bubbles but faded to nothing fast . i 've seen coca-cola with longer lasting head .
appearance : clear brown , low head that fades out quickly .
a : reflects the tasty wine-beer chimaera that it is . slight rosy tint suggests at fruit within .
a : black , and slightly brown on the edges . the head is made of big bubbles . it disappear rapidly . lacing is medium ...
appearance : a transparent brown body with a white head on top . the lacing was n't great and neither was the retenion .

a : huge 4 finger mousse-like head is off white and very long lasting . as it recedes sizable pockets form along the glass 's edge creating a rocky and uneven head . the body is a dark mix between ruby and amber . the opaque body becomes murky when held in front of light . lacing is between fair and good . s &
a : inert , no carbonation ; clear , slightly dark blond ; no head ; no lacing
a : beautiful rich golden coloring . nice pillowy head that stuck around . lacing apparent as well . awesome looking brew .
a : pure orange in color with a foamy , thick head made of a mix of big and medium size bubbles as well as visible carbonation streaking to the top . lacing is crazy good !
appearance : pours a cloudy orange w/ no head but some visible carbonation . no lacing
appearance : pours dark , dark brown , almost black , with three fingers of tan-brown head that subsides slowly . tons of lacing . great looking beer .

appearance : pours a very cloudy orange color with a small , 1/4 '' white head that shows decent retention . the bubbles pop slowly and the beer looks lifeless otherwise ( not a bad thing ) . swirling creates some spotty lace .
appearance : the beer is fizzy yellow in coloration . the beer has a thin white head . the beer has ok head retention .
appearance : what a head on this sucka ! unbelievable . leaves some massive clinging rings around the glass .

appearance : the ale went into a brooklyn brewery ( not that the actual branding on the glass really matters , but people seem to think it 's necessary to add to their reviews ... ) snifter . i poured it from the 12oz . bottle . humming ale pours full of effervescence with a thick , puffy white head . the color is a brilliant and crystal clear amber . scent : i smell just faint and snappy hopness . it 's very clean and pure and simple . the hop aroma is dominant ( but not too aggressive ) to the lightly toasted grain on the nose . texture : light bodied . nice prickly carbonation . flavor : as with the aroma of the humming , the flavor is dominated by hop . anchor focused the hop profile of this beer on the new zealand nelson sauvin hop . the bitterness that this hop brings forward is very snappy and aggressive on the tongue . the flavor it imparts is pretty grapefruity . the malt of the beer levels out the bitterness nicely .
a : poured into a pint glass ; straw yellow color , very small head that disappears immediately .
a : i 'll give credit where credit is due . this beer looks pretty good . very pale straw color with active carbonation . head is foamy and firm , with good retention . leaves quite a bit of lace .
a : dark brown under a good sized light brown head . great lace and retention .
a : ruddy dark amber/brown colour with a quickly disappearing off-white head that leaves bits of lacing .

a : upon opening , this bottle explodes all over my desk and computer , and continues to gush profusely . * @ & # % ! ! ! i wish i had read the reviews before opening this thing . its body , a glowing ruby color , is capped by 2 inches of light pink head off a very gentle pour . overcarbed ? overcarbed ! i 'm completely annoyed at having to clean everything up , so points off .
appearance : deep orange almost copper colour . slightly hazy . the very small head is white with poor retention and no lacing . really not impresive .
appearance : beautiful golden color with a nice head and somewhat translucent .
appearance : 4.5 |
a : huge frothy soapy white head is taking its darn sweet time coming back to earth . body is a lively , muted orange copper color with some chill haze in it .
a : dark clear orange color with a lightly tan head , exactly what you would imaging a pumpkin ale to look like .
appearance : brown with dark red and purple tints . the light tan/orange head showed fantastic concave action and the retention was amazing .
appearance : nice amber color .
a : the beer pours just about black with a finger of tan colored head .
appearance : looks really nice . pours a brownish-amber color with a thick foamy head that dissipates really slowly . the head leaves impressive lacing all the way down the glass .
a : pale-golden hued , with a fast-dissolving white cap and a low-carbonated body . looking so so ...
appearance : medium brown in color with a slight reddish hue . very minimal off white head

appearance : standard pour yielded a small , loose , white head that completely fizzled away in seconds . body is clear and pale gold with no visible carbonation . a quick swirl reinvigorates the head , but only temporarily . this beer has zero head retention . no lacing to speak of either , but that 's not too surprising for a blonde ale .

a : four fingers of eggshell white on the pour , this fantastic looking cap has a creamy/foamy texture and is very long lasting . the head deflates more quickly along the edges of the glass , causing a lumpy mountain of foam to remain in the middle . the body has light straw colored hues . a second pour produces contiguous lacing about the glass which is quite an improvement from the scrappy segments left from the first pour .
a : pours a slightly hazy golden with a massive foamy head . good retention with lots of lacing .
a : next to no head on a hard pour , very dark brown in color , minimal activity visible in the beer - 3.00 ,

appearance : vigorous pour yields a respectable bubbly , white head that stands 2 inches tall . hazy golden orange beer is somewhat cloudy with some floating yeast . 5 minutes pass before the head receeds to a drinkable state . the lace wo n't let go of its grip on the side of my glass . no apparent carbonation from the bottom of the glass .
a : opaque black color with two fingers of persistent beige foam head . heavy lacing remains on the glass .

appearance : thin yellow glass with a white collar . this was the only beer i tried here that didnt lace . flavor : again , this beer is a platform for yeast , which is really nice . the malt and hops balance well leaving a light lemon note .

appearance : looks almost like a pilsner ; crystal clear and golden . pours with a nice bit of foam with good bead once the head falls with lacing on down the sides ( no doubt due to the carapils and red wheat mentioned on the label ) .
a : pours a dirty cloudy light brown with very little head .
a : pours a dark mahogany with barely any trace of khaki head that recedes into a thin ring with no lacing .
appearance : copper with a sticky white head .

a : poured a tight head of only around one centimeter , although the head stayed with the beer all the way to the end . good lacing . the beer is a murky light mahogany , and at cooler temperatures carbonation clings to the side of the glass .
a : black , nothing but darkness with a light tan head .
a : highly carbonated ... poured like soda , but almost no head dissipating to nothing but a slight ring . red-brown in color
a : pours a dull orange under a rather limp and minimal white head . not a particularly distinguished looking hefeweizen .

a : two fingers of medium dark , mocha colored head on the pour . creamy and very compact with good retention , eventually fading into a collar of bubbles . the body is as black as black gets . lacing is good .
appearance : golden amber hues , lager like
appearance : very pale yellow . quick fading head . no lacing .
a : thin yellow , barely a head and carbonated like a semi weak soda .

a : pours a half finger head of no cream , bad thickness , and terrible retention . the colour is a bit more appealing : semitransparent vibrant copper with some floating yeast particles . it looks alright , but i would n't call it inviting . sm : bright fruit esters , biscuity yeast , well handled malt , and fresh barley . quite a nice aroma . moderate in strength .
a : pours a medium shade of brown with a sweet tea look around the edges of the glass . the head is very large , well over a thumbs width and egg shell white .
appearance : yellow and clear with incredible , foamy , white head that sticks throughout .
appearance : ruby black with creamy tan head that coats the glass all the way down .

a : pours a clear golden color with lots of small carbonation bubbles released to the top . a 1.5 finger white head formed on top , but quickly reduced to a thin layer of foam on top . splotchy lacing down the sides .
appearance : a little darker than ommegang 's witte ... hazy , saturated golden hue ... practically no head .
a : does n't look like much . pale straw color , zero head , zero lacing , no sign of bubbles throughout the beer . honestly , it looks like urine .
a : pours an opaque black in the center with a light ruby translucence at the edges . mocha head dies quickly into a small ring of bubbles that leave no lace or curtains .
a : pours clear pale gold with big , meringue-like head that shows great retention and leaves wonderful brussels lacing . effervescence competes with champaign .
a : bronze-blonde , yeast floaties , off-white head , very little retention , slight lace .
a : pours a reddish/copper with a finger+ of head
a : pitch black with a rich coffee hued head . head retention is not great . neither is the lacing .
a : a very pale yellow with a thin head that disappears quickly , with no lacing at all .

appearance : poured a crystal clear , golden-orange that seemed very bright in the glass . dense off-white head rose up huge and took a long time to settle down , becoming fluffy as it did so . the density and staying power of the foam was amazing . tons of sticky lace was left on the glass . flawless appearance .
a : orangish body that is hazy with a few floaties . thin white head that dissipates quickly and leaves no ring nor lacing .

a : pitch black center , cocoa around the edges of the glass . no head until the trailing end of a motor oil-ish pour ... a half finger coffee bean head appears and quickly disappears into barely a cap .
appearance : pours a cloudy pale golden color with a rather slim head for a hefe ; leaves the occasional dot of lace
appearance : poured a slightly cloudy ( but mostly clear ) brown amber . visible carbonation . two finger foamy light khaki head with good retention . mild lacing .
appearance : pours a nice amber with little off white head .
a : black . opaque blackness that is devoid of light . with a thick tan head . beautiful .

a : pours a one finger head of slight cream , fair thickness , and abysmal retention . colour is a solid hazy orange/pale gold . sm : a delightfully yeasty and biscuity aroma . a bit cidery as well . lots of bretts for sure . i would n't call it funky . a strong aroma .

appearance : this brew pours with a marvelous eggshell colored head . lacings are plentiful and head retention is long . color is a medium amber . i would be proud to brew this myself . excellent first impression .
appearance : pleasant murky brown-yellow , thin head that dissipates quickly
a : pale and fizzy . indistinguishable from ginger ale .
a : pours a hazy orange color . a small white head forms that fades away quickly , and leaves light lace .
a : pours an almost black body with an unfortunate small and short-lived brown head leaving no lacing .
a : dark-amber . little head .

appearance : pours a smooth extremely dark amber brew that is not quite opaque , typically i like the look of a brew that is completely black with no light showing , but this one looks good . a inch dark almond head built but quickly faded to a thin ring around the glass , the carbonation streams feed the foam ring throughout the drink . as most stouts are to me this one has a definite appeal and fits the category well . there is however no lacing on the glass at all as it slides off with the smooth thin syrup brew .
a : poured from a bottle into a pint glass . honey/yellow in color with a very slight haze , a wicked 2-finger head , and seriously sticky , cloudy lacing . looks great !
a : deep auburn brown with red and rich orange tones . pours a thick , heavy , bready head and leaves very nice lace down the entire glass .
a : this was a clear , dark , coppery amber color with golden edges . pours with a huge , long lasting , sticky , light tan head .
a : yellow water with foamy head

appearance : looks like a porter or a stout , stark black with a generous and foamy white head . as it slowly faded away , the head did change color a little bit and take on a more off-white hue . the head retention was a thing of beauty and there is some lacing forming on the top of the glass already where the head dropped from . update : as the beer goes down , the lacing does not . it is really clinging to the glass all the way around and from top to bottom . this is an exceptional looking beer .
a : standard pour yields a billowy 1.5 finger light pink head with very good retention . beer is a clear , dark red that reveals ample carbonation . lacing is patchy with good stick .

appearance : extremely clear , practically white with a drop of yellow in it . this is the clearest and whitest beer ive ever seen . had a creamy small bubbled head that dropped to the thinnest of collars quickly . flavor : tastes like soda and a malternative mixed together . fruity , sweet , and not at all like beer . more like a diet soda

a : very dark body , with slight reddish hue . exceptional carbonation , more force behind the cork than champagne , leads to a vary lively pour . head cascades upward into a tan , creamy , dense froth - reminds me of bread dough just after the rise .

a : a light copper amber color and hazy . this beer does n't seem to be filtered as it is hazy , but there is no sediment and looks very clean . the head is about two fingers high after being poured fairly aggressive and it is white and creamy . lots of creamy lacing .
a : the beer pours a clear golden orange color with a large , fluffy , white head and lots of sticky lacing .
appearance : brownish-black color . thick lacing that hangs around for a good while .

appearance : thick , blackish coffee brown with an impossibly pathetic toasted marshmallow tan head . impressively sloshy and sticky in the glass , but the head ( or lack thereof ) unfortunately keeps me from rating this above average .
a : clear , dark amber color with over one finger of cinnamon-tinted foam head that collapses to a large island . heavy lacing -- nearly continuous sheeting -- remains on the glass .

appearance : pour not as thick as expected . produces a 1+ finger , medium looking mocha colored head with pretty good retention . noisy head too . black body with higher levels of carbonation for the style . head slowly fades to a wisp with lots of carbonation decorating the top of the brew . lots ! a swirling wisp and a ring remain , leaving some dots of lacing down the glass . too much carbonation for the style .
a : pours a very pale yellow with a huge amount of beaten eggwhite head . about 4 fingers worth and pure white .
a : pitch black with a tan head , dissapates quickly ...
a : bad . a person with poor vision would mistake this for water .
a : black with a slight ruby hue . only a hint of tan head , which quickly dissipates . no lace what-so-ever . it 's a shame the appearance brings this down ... maybe it was getting old ?
appearance : straw like yellow w/ a white head the fades oh so quickly
a : pours a very dark chocolate color . almost no light came through . i poured to the suggested 25 cl mark and had a large creamy three fingers of head . there was a generous amount of lacing .

a : the appearance is the best thing about this beer . it appears opaque , but upon holding it up to a light one can make out a faint , light , ruby-colored hue on the edges . the center is still dark , however .
appearance : i knew there was a problem when the cork released without a sound ... pours out without producing any carbonation ; rich caramel color

appearance : slightly hazy golden straw color . small white head forms with moderate-low retention . small stream of bubbles from the glass is indicating a higher level of carbonation . overall a very good looking beer . although there is haze , it may be more of a sign of mishandling by the distributor and/or liquor store .
a : dark with a huge head that geisers over the top on a hard pour into my glass . leaves a nice tan head behind .

a : pours a crystal clear dark gold showing very vigorous carbonation . head is not particularly large , but it forms an egg-white like cap that clings to the glass . lacing is beautiful . one of the prettiest tripels i 've seen .
appearance : pours out a clear , light mahogany color with a light beige head . no doubt , its one of the prettiest hues of the beer rainbow .
a : poured a thick , orange-tea like color , with a very small head and minimal carbonation . the brown tea color is n't very attractive , really .

a : very dark brown . appears black but when held up to the light you can see through the outer edges . decent size beige head which dissipated slowly to a surface film . nothing to change here for the style .
a : poured from a bottle to a pint glass . had a golden yellow color and a completely clear texture . there was a small amount of foamy head that quickly dissipated . no lacing at all .
appearance : a beautifully clear , effervescent pale yellow with a thick , pillowy white head . excellent head retention and lacing . a beauty .

a : poured fairly gently , has a small brown head that settles to some film covering right away , looked like really melted chocolate syrup pouring out of can , dense looking , just really rich appearance , deep brown with some lighter brown hues
a : this beer pours an opaque brown with a one finger of khaki head . head recedes quickly , leaving wisps of sticky lacing .
appearance : pours a cool looking orange red color with a good-sized sturdy beige head . it takes forever to dissipate and leaves thick curtains of lace all the way down the glass . picture perfect .
appearance : beautiful dark evil looking amber , with a brownish head and great lacing .
a : a very dark color with a red hue when held to the light . a foamy thick and tan head , with great lacing
a : pours a jet black color with some brown hues around the edges . very viscous looking . provides a thick light brown foam head with sufficient lacing .
a : pale gold in color and an aggressive pour results in an inch of head with decent lacing .
a : pale yellow , clear , some had but quickly dissipated
appearance : a yellow lager that is very bright from a very thero filtering.not much head at all only a small white head that lasts only seconds .
a : love the bottle art ! . poured a clear golden color . two finger frothy white head formed with nice retention and chunky lacing .
a : clear amber/chestnut with a creamy head and very nice lacing . nice looking beer here ! 4/5
a : dull orange/copper with no head and no lacing . is this apple juice ? because it sure as hell looks like it .
a : this beer pours a deep dark opaque brown , almost black . no head to speak of and the littlest of spotty lacing on the glass .
appearance : syrupy consistency and a rich amber in colour .
a : golden yellow , light oak amber hue , clear . generous 3 inch head ! took a while to settle too , leaving tons of lace .
a : the beer is a pale and almost clear yellow color , with a short white head that fades very quickly and leaves a very spotty lace on the glass .
a : pours mostly black with a hint of brown . appears to be lighter in color than some other imperial stouts . a nice tan head forms and sticks around
appearance : pale gold , great clarity , very bubbly but no head formation
appearance : opaque black , surprisingly dark and chewy looking for a lower abv stout . the initial pour produces 3 fingers of thick foam that slowly settles to a film .
appearance : pours into an imperial pint glass - big bold mahogany body with a huge ( but well maintained ) head and terrific retention ... extremely nice looking beer to say the least
a : super deep red color with minimal tannish head .
a : nice golden color with a huge pure white head , which was quite surprising for a cask beer with full on lacing . super good looking .
a : comes in a pint glass with no head , so i 'm looking at alfrantzell 's glass instead . it has a finger of off-white foam with seemingly decent retention . no lace .

a : the bottle is cracked open without making any bit of hissing sounda leaked bottle perhaps ? ? very dark brown in colour , with russet glows , coming w/o any signs of a beer head and a rather static body .
a : nothing special it looks like beer that has water in it . just so light in color and consistency
appearance : golden with no head .
a : orange , white lacey head , slightly cloudy from yeast
appearance : awesome . this is one of the darkest beers i 've ever seen , almost like imperial stout . there 's a pretty decent off-white head . modest lacing .
a : clear golden body with three fingers of foamy white head . great head retention and stellar lacing . fantastic .
appearance : hazy gold with absolutely no head .
a : cork comes out with the slightest pop . vigorous pour yields a single layer of coarse bubbles atop a nearly opaque , dark brown brew , that dissipates very quickly . lacing is non-existant .
a : the beer pours a light yellow piss color with a fizzy white foam of a head and no lacing ...

appearance : deep , red-auburn body with nice clarity . surprisingly , no visible carbonation within the body . a creamy , sticky , khaki-colored cap sat on top for the entire session and left tons of lacing on the walls of the glass .

a : i had to suck that head as if my life depended on it . pour went fine til halfway in when i pour straight down and the head was coming with a vengance ! frothy , fluffy cocoa head . black as night .
a : pours a dark mahogany with almost no head that vanishes with no lacing .
a : murky dark amber body with cream colored head that left no lace trace .
a : pours clear golden yellow . ( very bmc ) some head that quicky fads to away leaving just a few bubbles behind .
appearance : wonderfully translucent brew , with a color within the copper/reddish range , a nice contrast to the pearly white compact head .

a : pours a deep red/mahogany color , almost brown , 2 finger tan head settles after 5 minutes into a full cap , sticky small bubble lacing everywhere , and it refuses to let go of the glass . very , very impressive so far .
a : deep brown color clear wen held up to the light . billowy off-white head that dissipated rapidly and and lace only in spots ; that was the only thing that disappointed me about this beer ,
appearance : clear orange , white foamy head . good head retetion and really nice lacing .
a : deep red color with good two-finger head . appreciable lacing .
