a : great presentation in the wrapped bottle , corked and caged . brown but pure deep clear red on the edges when held to light . head was 2 fingers with ok retention .

appearance : mine lacked the satisfying blackness of most stouts . it 's a dark and translucent reddish-brown , almost like an irish red ale . other reviewers seem to have generally found theirs darker than mine , so i 'm willing to give the brewers the benefit of the doubt . there 's a centimeter-thick tan head that retains throughout . it leaves bits of lacing .

a : pours a deep , murky , dirty gold . not much different than a blended arnold palmer . head is small and after a very short time it has completely disappeared . this one is not off to a good start .
appearance : below par overall , but it is your typical lager .
a : not to be cliche but piss color . no lacing and a microscopic amount of head .

appearance : everything one would expect in an english pale ale . clear dark amber that is a nice and bright orange-copper when held up to the light . very persistent light tan 1/4 '' dense head the whole way down until the very bottom of the glass . strands of lacing that slowly slid back down into the main foam . great looking beer .
a : deep gold with a slight chill haze and semi-active carbonation . fizzy orange tinged head clears the area quickly , leaving me with fizzy gold water . left zero lace .
a : hazy orange amber that looked a little dirty . poured a 2 finger off-white head that dissipated to random bubbles . minimal lacing . decanted continually .

appearance : pours extremely black , blacker than night . very little head , maybe an 8th of an inch or so during a heavy handed pour . what little lacing produced was almost sheet like with cohesion . nice !
a : thick and black . big ol & # 8217 ; dark mocha head . killer lacing .

appearance : does n't pour much like a ris - the color is right but the head formation does n't create the bubbles deep into the liquid that settle down into a frothy cap ; this one just creates a tan head atop the liquid that quickly fades to a ringlet
a : vigorous pour resulting in virtually no head and little lacing . for imperial stout just did n't impress me .
appearance : pours a dark , almost black , liquid w/ a slight head . minimal lacing

a : latte colored head with medium sized bubbles which have shrunk smaller over time . head seems to be maintaining quite well , extremely well actually ... .very impressed . body is a clean very dark brown .
appearance : transparent brown and nice looking ruby red
a : pours a slightly hazy orange with a finger of beige head that recedes into a thin ring with no lacing .

a : pours a dark brown in color with hints of cherry and a golden sheen towards the edges of the glass . an ample , half inch of creamy off-white head sits atop that dissipates to a thin layer of cream . carbonation looks ample with sparkling water qualities .
a : sudsy head , whatever 's left of which by the time you get back to your table is thoroughly unrewarding .
appearance : it 's a bit of a gusher though that makes for a great looking pour , with a massive head that sticks atop the orange/amber liquid ; foams clumps to the side of the pint glass
a : light , fairly clear amber/orange body with a somewhat persistent one finger off-white head . not much lacing .
a : pours black , with a thick , creamy off-white head , with great retention , leaves medium lacing as the beer is drunk .

a : just like the bell 's expedition stout i had earlier tonight there is no carbonation at all in this one . i know the style can have low carbonation , but there was n't even a ring around the rim . otherwise , it looks good . a nice pitch black oily looking beer .
a : pours a deep hazy amber with a thick foamy head which quickly fades with almost no lace . seems more carbonated than usual for a woodstock brew .
a : this pours more like a soda . the head is none existent , it fizzes at the top . it is super clear with a tint of yellow . it almost looks neon .

appearance : this is a bottle conditioned brew that has a heavy layer of sediment . keep this in mind when serving . head is minimal to non-existent . carbonation threads are not observed . color is a nice deep honey . clarity is high ( if sediment is left in bottle ) . not overly impressive .
a : commercialy blond lager , no head ,
appearance : very dark brown / borderline black - oily looking without much of a head at all - might actually be oil , not beer ...
a : beer pours a murky brown body , with a two finger off white head that sinks slowly . the carbonation levels are slow . lacing is left in large swaths .
appearance : well , i thought maybe the date was a mistake , but it pours with the gross chill haziness of an aged beer . looks like pondwater .
appearance : amber in color with a 1/4 '' head that breaks apart immediately . no lacing develops .
appearance : very dark black with a pissy sudsy head . the head ran away quickly , but left a small suds layer throughout the glass .
a : the beer pours a darker golden , very clear , large white head an no lacing ...
a : pours a clear maroon body with very small tan head , no retention . at best there is a very light collar on the beer .
a : pours a beautiful mahogany hue with brillant tones of red showing thru . there was almost head head upon the pour and the beer just lays there giving off a somewhat flat appearence .
appearance : pours a light , nutty brown color . disappointingly , this beer has almost no head or lacing to speak of . something seems wrong here ; an oktoberfest with no head ?
appearance : pours a dark brown , near black body with a small , fine tan head .

a : i 'm completely smitten with the look of this one : burnished copper/auburn with a multitude of carbonation ribbons . mostly clear , but something mildly hazed belies the latent strength . terrific head : a healthy 2-fingers of dense foam , gold-tinged tan cream that holds a couple minutes before a gradual fall to a patchy film and sticky lace .
a : the beer pours a dark amber color with some brownish notes and a thin layer of off-white head .

a : presents as a clear golden body ( with some champagne fizz going wild within ) . the pure white 0.5cm head sits proudly atop ; which is nice , but i ca n't help but wonder why this brew is filtered and not bottle conditioned like every other abbey beer ? scale of economics perhaps ?

a : gentle pour yields a .5 finger foamy white head with little retention that dissipates into a thin film atop a cloudy , lemon yellow beer . lacing is stringy and spotty with little stick . average and the cloudiness is forgiven due to the style .
a : pitch black in color with a nice 1 1/2 '' brown head on it . small bubbles of carbonation can be seen rising up through the glass if you look closely . just a thing of buety to look at
a : lots of carbonation bubbles sticking to the glass and good levels of carbonation . body has a very clear yellow character . white head sinks very quickly .
a : a somewhat hazy copper-orange color with a moderate white head with decent retention and ok lacing .
a : pours a one finger head of fair cream and thickness , and okay retention . nontransparent dark copper colour . sm : bacteria , souring hops , and some funk . a moderate strength aroma .
a : dark golden brown . poured with a good two fingers of foam , which dissipated quickly .

a : delivered in a snifter with a finger of light beige head , with the creaminess characteristic of nitro taps . retention is quite strong , and it leaves some nice lacing down the glass as i sip . the body is actually a dark , semiclear brown with reddish tint , the clarity becoming more apparent as the beer vanishes in the glass .
a : pith black with a tan , brown head that dissapears quickly . poor lacing and little visible co2
a : pours a beautiful dark amber mahogany color with a 3 finger white head . lots of carbonation bubbles sticking to the side of the glass . great head retention and lacing .
a : pours a copper , almost rusty amber color into a nonic pint with the pretty cascade of bubbles and nice hockey puck of creamy , khaki colored head . this is a pruddy beer .
a : slightly hazy , medium amber color with less than one finger of diminishing eggshell foam head . no lacing remains on the glass .
a : pours a two finger , thin head of poor retention . hazy dark yellow colour . sm : light . clean . barley . nothing extraordinary . a bit disappointing .
appearance : reddish chestnut colour , small white head that disappears completely after a few seconds . little to no carbonation .

a : very thin . very light golden orange , kind of resembles apples juice . small one finger head is pretty thick but fades quickly , decent lacing . the thinness/clarity is a little bit off-putting somehow .
a : cloudy , cola brown color . thick , fluffy light tan head . moderate lacing .
appearance : pours a red , brown color with a small off white fizzy head that fades fast and leaves little lacing .
a : still maroon liquid . no carbonation at all . pretty boring , but i was expecting it .
appearance : bright golden-yellow in color , one inch head , cloudy , high carbonation

a : the top of this beer makes a huge pop as i flip it . this is a relief , the last th beer i cracked open gave me nary a whimper . in my glass , this beer sits handsomely , almost black , with a finger-thick dark brown head that slowly recedes to a disk . solid
appearance : pours a very cloudy orange/amber beer with a thin creamy white lace . there 's a hell of a lot of sediment in the bottle -- way too much in my opinion .
a : pours deep brown with rues of red . a very small tan and airy `` nothing-head '' . no lace .
a : pours a clear , coppery-orange with a finger of off-white head that recedes into a thin ring with no lacing .
a : hazy golden orange colored ... good 1 fingers worth of creamy white head after a nice pour ... settles to a nice layer , with fantastic lacing.. wonderful looking beer .
a : pours a hazy dark-iced-tea-golden color with a thick oily head that slowly faded into a bubbly film that left great rings of lacing down the glass .
appearance : pours a clear golden body with lots of bubbling activity ; huge , fluffy head that created an alpine panorama as it settled down ; tons of lacing left behind
appearance : poured without even a hint of head or lacing which is disappointed , the beer itself is a weak coffee like brown that does boast carbonation in the body .
appearance : pours a dingy yellow color which has a head that dissipates almost instantly . considering its a wheat it threw me off guard on how weak it appeared , no cloud at all .
a : pale gold with a 1-finger head which quickly disappears , leaving just the faintest ring . no lace whatsoever .

a : pours a magnificent chestnut brown with moderate light penetration . despite a vigorous pour , the only bubbles churned up are from agitation ; retention is nonexistent , no donut , no lacing . meh .
a : cloudy hazy burnt orange color . very little head receded quickly
a : huge bready head whcih only falls a little bit overall . perfectly clear amber rouge .
a : white head , gold yellow body .

appearance : pours a very clear , pale yellow , urine color with a 2.5 '' tall white head . carbonation flows to the surface steadily . it shows great retention , and lots of foamy , gobby lace . perfect .
a : certainly looks the part with a cloudy ( bottle-conditioned ) tea coloured body and a dense packed off-white head that diminishes to a light foam covering .

appearance : it came in a neat-looking bottle with a blue label . there 's a picture on the label . at first i thought it was benjamin franklin in the picture , but then i figured out that it 's a picture of ... sam adams . duh . i poured the beer into a clear glass and saw that it pours an interesting goldenrod color .
appearance : pours a dark yellow with a large white head that recedes too quickly . decent lacing though .

appearance : pours a two finger medium fluffy white head . colour is a dark burnt orange or tawny with higher levels of carbonation . head has good retention and settles very unevenly to a thick cap . that thick cap remains the whole way and leaves lots of nice looking lacing down the glass . beautiful look and colour . this is as good as it gets here .

a : hazy deep copper . perfect marsmellow head . this is probably the best head i have ever seen on a beer thus far . also , it stays thick and creamy the whole time i 'm drinking it . tons of bubbles racing around inside .

a : poured this into a pint glass from a 12 oz . bottle . it poured beautifully a nice off white thick head that lasted for several minutes before settling to a white film that just sat there . the color was a deep tan almost light brown and very cloudy . at the beginning this beer looked fabulously but once the head settled it became rather run of the mill .
a : pours a deep choclatey almost ashen with a full , frothy head . not much lacing . the beer seems viscous , frothy and chewy .

appearance : it was poured into none other than my bell 's brewery american pint glass . this bell 's poured a disappointing clear and bubbly straw colored beer with a 1/2 inch head of white foam . after about a few seconds , the head of foam dissipated into a small whie film , a few white foamy rings , and streaks of white lace . it just had your run of the mill typical lager appearance .
a : opaque black color with over one finger of fine , persistent mocha-tinted foam head . light lacing remains on the glass .
appearance : deep gold , great clarity , thinnish layer of foam that disappears within the first minute
a : pours a very pale yellow colour , with a nice fizzy , white head a first , but quickly dissipates to nothing . looks like an other boring macro lager beer .
a : dark brown in color . a small head recedes to nothing very quickly and it looks kind of flat .
appearance : poured with a small white fizzy head that dissipated leaving no lacing on my glass . the beer is a very light yellow and totally clear .
appearance : a nice cloudy orange amber pour with a white head . the head fades into a nice wispy white coating over the top of the beer .
a : pours a very light color for an imperial stout . black , but i can definitely see through it . a small amount of head quickly recedes .
a : poured into a lucifer snifter , with almost no head , and no lacing .
a : murky ruby . dirty head and heavy sediment .
a : 1/2 finger light tan head with not good retention . clear dark brown liquid with ruby highlights .
a : light amber color , legs when the glass is swirled . it almost looks like a dessert wine .
a : the pour is amber in color with a whit head .

a : pours a nearly headless clear amber body . the initial head is just a thick film , and fades very quickly to nothing . a few medium sized carbonation bubbles rise slowly . no lacing is left on the glass .
a : this beer pours light copper color with a one finger of white head . head recedes rapidly without much lacing .
a : beautiful bronze color out of the bottle with a rich tan head that does n't go away completely , and leaves extensive lacing .
appearance : pale , light yellow-hued body with goody clarity and a scant head film , though it leaves a surprising amount of lace on the way down .
a : deep reddish brown hue . excellent clarity .

a : golden-orange body ... slightly hazy but with a lot of shimmering highlights ; huge rocky whipped head - 3 fingers thick on the initial pour . sticky lacing leaves littles patterns like clouds along the insides of the glass

a : darker than used engine oil . completely opaque . i put a flashlight up to it and still barely saw any light through it . awesome . poured with a very slight head on it , but not a lot of carbonation visible .
appearance : surprisingly huge and ever lasting white head upon a clear gold body . lots of bubbles .
a : deep amber with 2 fingers gorgeous , gorgeous head .
appearance : poured pale yellow with lots of bubbles , but minimal head and no lace . completely failed to impress me - vernors has more of a head on it .
a : pours a semi-opaque light red body with a small off-white almost pink head with low retention and no lacing .
a : dark with red highlights shining through . little off-white head that quickly fades . eh ...
a : grapefruit/ pear color . white head , but thin .
appearance : pours a redish/amber color , with an inch of creamy white head that fades fairly slowly , lots of lacing .
a : pours a deep black with a slight reddish tinge , pours with a nice head of tan frothy foam that lingers for a while , nice amount of lacing
a : opened the botlle and one fourth of its content gushed out on the table . not amused . a nice yellow/lightbrown color but no head . probably that 's still on the table .

appearance : pours an attractive , dark brownish-red . has a clean color to it , with a few bubbles rising up inside . has a one finger , light khaki head which sinks pretty fast and does n't leave much lacing behind .
a : the beer pours near black in color with a 1.5 finger medium brown head that has excellent retention and lacing .
a : snifter . pours a nice clear tawny color , with bright orange hues . nice two finger head that is off-white in color . great retention rate and decent lacing .
a : poured a dark reddish brown oak color in the glass with some cloudiness . poured a rocky head , about a half inch , with lingered on the glass for some time .
a : poured a dark ruby color with an inch of fluffy caramel-colored head . it had long-lasting retention and left huge gobs of foam down the sides of the glass .
a : slightly hazy , very light amber color . absolutely no head formation or retention . how is this even possible for a wheat beer ?

a : pours a clear , dark yellow/ light golden color . it initially had a small white head , but it disappeared quickly and left no lacing throughout drinking . it appears to be considerably carbonated .
appearance : hazy blond with a finger and a half of foam that sticks to the sides of the glass nicely . retention is solid . all-around a spot-on looking wit .

appearance : very very surprizingly dark for a hefeweizen ... especially `` the original '' german hefe-weizen ale ... not very consistant with the style . head dissapated very very quick . no lacing , no head after 15 seconds at all .
a : slight haze in color looking through bottle .
a : pours a dark brown with some ruby highlights around the edges . a tan head rises to over two fingers . rings of sticky spiderweb looking lace is left all the way down the glass .
a : one finger of light brown head crowns an intensely dark red/almost black brew . the head sticks around for a minute or so , but leaves no lacing .
a : pours a perfectly clear copper body with a two-finger off-white head with amazing retention staying around the entire drink . leaves a perfect sheet of lacing all the way down the glass .
a : pours a deep black stout with single finger head which retires leaving half as much in a latte color . the beer retains the head throughout the life . thick , resounding lacing .
a : deep black in color , thin tan head

appearance : pours a cocoa charcoal , a nice hue really , dark but not oppressively dark , though it does look considerably thinned out by age and the coffee addition . this belief is confirmed by the permanency of the head , or rather the lack it - one finger of fizzy , frothy , foamy sienna head gurgles itself in to oblivion after about ten seconds of fervent activity ... definitely an oily coffee addition here . the side and surface lacing are similarly ethereal , or perhaps nonexistent is more appropriate a word . a few stray streams of bubbles rise relatively quickly to the otherwise devoid and empty surface , again suggesting a thinned body .

a : poured dark and thick ... typical ... and appeared to be forming some head until i stopped pouring . on the other hand , the lacing was amazing ... sticking and looking all comfortable , just like how victor looks and feels in my snuggie currently .

a : pours a nice semi-heavy golden color and , even though it 's sort of thin for a lager , it sticks to the side of the glass quite nicely . little to no head , though , which knocks down the score . the head was n't a fraction of an inch tall and disappears almost instantly .

appearance : pours from the bottle with a deep orange color and a light tan head . the head is just a few mm thick . despite the thin head , the brew porduces nice lacing . in addition , there is a steady stream of carbonation .

a : pours a one finger head of soft cream , decent thickness , and poor retention . solid brown-black colour . nontransparent . sm : esters of fruit , caramel , caramelized malt , cream , chocolate , raspberry , and toffee . no alcohol comes through . a mild strength aroma .
a : slightly hazy copper in color with a good two fingers of off-white head , leaving an appreciable amount of lacing .
a : black with thick head that dissipates quickly
a : pours a dark brown with excellent clarity . two fingers of latte fall to a very thick quilt of the same . stubborn lacing . good looker .
a : dark brown at first , but no light passes through as more hits the glass . thin head dissipates quickly , leaving a very small lacing .

appearance : sounded like a gun shot upon opening and started to gush a little . never a good sign for a big stout . poured out a murky dirty-looking dark brown and produced a massive four finger thinner-looking bubbly popping mocha colored head that was pot-holed like swiss cheese . dark murky brown or black in the glass with a little bit of carbonation evident in the form of tiny bubbles . head slowly fades leaving some chunky lacing on the sides . a thick foamy cap stays until the end and leaves some bubbly chunky lacing down the glass . looks like an abomination of an imperial stout .
a : a 2 finger , light brown colored cap quickly fades away leaving large sudsy bubbles on the surface . the body is medium amber brown in color and hazy .
a : amazingly clear , light yellow ; very good carbonation ; three-finger head ; decent lacing

appearance : an aggressive pour yields an equally aggressive , foamy , 2.5 '' head that fills my entire 30oz snifter to the brim . the head is eggshell , the beer is a hazy , unfiltered , golden orange color . i can barely make out any carbonation , but it is in a flurry . great retention and as the head recedes it creates pillowy peaks and valleys . a faomy coat of lace remains .
appearance : moderate effervescent carbonation , consistent with moderate foam from clean pour . opacity lightly cloudy with solid amber-orange color .

a : pours a black body with a surprisingly high mocha-colored head ( for such a small pour ) . retention is pretty good , and the head does not vanish while i 'm sipping . leaves clumps of foam on the sides of the glass .
a : srm is golden yellow with a slightly red tinge . lots of sediment floating around . translucent . heavy carbonation . light lacing .
a : straw colored with moderate lacing and good retention . the thing that kills me is that the beer is cloudy , never a good thing in the world of pilsners .
appearance : cola brown with a bit of red thrown in for good measure , it sported a nice frothy ring .
a : absolutely beautiful opaque golden-orange body with a nice looking off-white head with good retention and lacing .
appearance : i think i might have gotten a bum bottle here . i poured this very aggressively , but it yielded almost no head and lacing .
a : a beautiful clear ruby red with a long lasting head which leaves an attractive lacing on the glass .
appearance : nice can . red , white , and blue -- hey , these colors do n't run ! the beer , poured into a 16-oz . glass mug , is neither red , white , nor blue . it 's yellow .
a : the colour was a rich golden brown , with head that dissipated suspiciously quickly , leaving no lace at all . i last drank leffe blonde a few years ago and i recall it being fizzy and lacy .
a : dark , but very clear red . white fluffy head , small bubbles , great retention and lacing .
a : clear copper with a small cream head with lacing .
appearance : i had this beer at the source , on tap at the pub in eugene . looked red , cloudy , unfiltered , ring of foam .
a : pitch black with a creamy mocha 1-finger head . solid retention and fantastic lacing .

a : pours like motor oil ; thick and black . creamy , brown head is short ( less than 1/2 a finger ) but resilient . beautiful reddish tinge around the edge of the glass where light can actually pass through .

a : three finger head of nice cream and decent thickness . very hazy caramel-brown colour . sm : wheat , cream , hops . moderate strength scent . kind of disturbs the nose , almost to point of sneezing .
appearance : translucent and yellow . thin , foamy head that dissipates quickly .
appearance : pours a hazy lemony yellow color with a bubbly white head that leaves some strands of lacing behind

a : after a tip from a friend who tried this beer , i poured as slowly as possible into my duvel tulip . after this careful procedure , i ended up with 2/3 creamy , tan head and 1/3 glowing orange body . head hangs around forever and finally starts to recede but leaves a trail of rocky lace .
appearance : yellow with white head that dissipated quickly . lots of bubbles indicate the presence of a lot of carbonation .
appearance : clear slightly tanned color . looks like a budweiser . no head

a : pours a pretty nice and solid brown color . when the light hits it , it really bursts with some nice ruby highlights just pouring forth . the head was minimal and white . sadly , no real head retention at all . i mean nothing . this puppy is just beer now . very lazy carbonation moving around in there . pretty average when it comes to brown ales .
a : pours a half finger head of fair cream , decent thickness , and okay retention . colour is a transparent textbook copper . sm : lightly toasted malt . a mild strength aroma .
appearance : an aggressive pour provided a quarter-inch of head that quickly settled down to about an eighth of an inch on top of a clean , transparent and deep copper colored ipa .
appearance : very hazy orangish color with a small head that dissipated quickly .
a : deep black copper
appearance : perfect crystal clear copper hue , with an off white head . the head has some staying power , but eventually falls to a ring that laces all the way down .
appearance : a murky , bright , burnt orange with a small but frothy head . the head clings to the glass nicely all the way down the glass . overall , a traet for the eyes

a : a monstrous marshmellow head quickly evolves upon the pour standing a proud and firm 3 fingers high in my standard pint glass . sturdy , it slowly lapses , first around the edges invoking a `` devils tower '' structure standing in the middle . the coloring was a orange-cream with a medium sense of haze , while an initial vibrant carbonation of feverish macro-bubbles race upwards in a fairly dense state . soon thereafter things quite down carbonation wise to a slow putter of random bubbles with no where to go in a hurry , much like an old women on a sunday drive . the lacing was spongey , of broken concentric circles running down the glass providing good coverage . substantial pours produced a dense head that looked like whipped cream . overall i really enjoyed the appearance , that of an honest grain base minus specialty influences , the haze , and the long lasting dense creamy head that gave me plenty of time to both write/review and still appreciate the visual aspect long after i was done .
appearance : nice light brown with a fluffy head and nice lacing .
a : pours a golden color , slight head , not much lacing . nothing too awesome about the apperance .
a : poured vigorously from 50cl can into goblet . piddly little head dissipates quickly , with a touch of lacing . very clear apple-juice color , which the can describes as golden ( dore ) .
appearance : transparent , pleasant orange-copper in color . head retention and lacing are excellent .
appearance : pours a rich black with billowing , cascading rich tan head that leaves lots of lacing as it subsides slowly . like a big ol ' stout .
appearance : bright copper orange with excellent carbonation streaming . head is a thick khaki surf foam with outstanding , chunky lacing . a flawless looking beer . just gorgeous .
a : clear golden color with a thin head that fades really quickly .
a : pours a deep brown with substantial foamy head that lingers for a very long time , leaves a thick layer of lacing
a : pours a golden orange , a shade darker than the similar midas touch , with a small cap of white foam which dissipates rather quickly , actually looks a lot like a mead when it comes down to it .
a : pours a medium amber with a small white head , average retention , no lacing .
a : poured a dark as night black with a thin tan head that with a little bit of lacing sticking to the glass .
appearance : sticky lacing , thin head retention . too much head and too light in colour ( pale amber ) for an english bitter . inappropriate , even if it were to be considered a macro lager .
a : had this on tap at mackenzie river pizza in billings . poured into standard pint an amber red color , not too much head , very little lace .
a : huge , huge pillowy head with an unbelievable level of carbonation . beautiful looking brew that definitely whetted the appetite .
a : a pitch black liquid with a massive light brown head , which leaves some lacing as it slowly recedes . i guess this is pretty close to perfection .
a : pours a deep copper-brown under a fingers worth of white head . good lace , good retention .
a : deep dark brown with a miniscule head that fizzes up to at most half a centimeter and disappears quickly . makes me question the freshness of this beer .

a : typical cloudy straw yellow of a heffeweiss . more bottom sediment than i would have thought gave way to some chunky floaters . not usual , i would think . head was ok , but not like the wipped cream topping i usually see from my usual weiss beers .
a : looks awesome , thick and black with a think dark tan head .
appearance : thin golden body , light effervescence , with a thin iced tea head that shifts in unison with its body -- odd ...
a : pours a deep solid looking black with a thick head of medium brown frothyness , leaves a nice amount of lacing
a : the beer is a very pale yellow color even for the style , with a short white head that fades very quickly and leaves almost no lace on the glass .
a : straw-like golden color . very carbonated ( almost too much ) which resulted in a massive but artifical head .
appearance : pours out a beautiful amber/gold color . a small amount of head at first that disappears quickly . looks like a thing of beauty in my troeg 's mad elf glass .
a : the beer is a light gold color with a very thin white head that fades very quickly and leaves a thin lace on the glass .

a : a 12 oz bottle poured straight down the middle of a pilsner glass yields a full four fingers of fluffy head that barely fits in the glass . the head slowly dissipates leaving sticky lacing on the side of the glass . the color is a bright yellow and completely clear .
a : not pretty . deep copper-ruby colour . head was not high , but was very dense .

appearance : this beer arrived topless ... a victim of an untrained barkeep and a pouring temperature which locked the co in solution . the body was light copper with very nice clarity but absolutely no foam or lacing .
a : amber in the finest since of the word with a perfect 1 finger head and some of the best lacing i 've seen all the way down the pint glass . this beer was crystal clear and looked perfect !
appearance : beautiful near black body with a nice tan head ; nice lacing

appearance : absolutely gorgeous dusty rose beer with orange highlights . the first half of this bottle went into my new belgium globe and pours remarkably clear for a bottle-conditioned belgian-style ale . creamy ivory cap with good staying power and some nice lace .

a : standard pour yields a .5 finger foamy white head that dissipates quickly into a thin white ring hugging the side of the glass . beer is a slightly cloudy flourescent peach-orange . lacing is stringy and spotty with little stick . not heady enough for the style and deducted points for lacing .
a : pours a dark brown color that does not let in any light . provides a thick foam head with nice retention and some nice lacing .
a : pours a rich mahogany color in the glass that seems black on first glance . ruby highlights against the light . moderate head that recedes into a collar and leaves no lacing down the sides .
appearance : golden bronze
a : pours yellow with a limited head , low retention .

a : pours a murky , opaque reddish/copper with a thin layer of head that dissipates slowly . thin layer of fine lacing . n : pretty much smells of tootsie roll and toffee with some faint leafy hops still lingering . also seems to be some brown sugar and molasses .
a : pours like black oil with a decent brown head that is mostly lasting and leaving good lace on the glass .
a : pours a clear copper with a finger of beige head that recedes into a thin layer with no lacing .

a : first off , when i popped the cap , a huge amount of carbonation smoke came out the top and it started foaming up over the top . pours a clear medium brown color with a huge 4 finger head that fades over 10 minutes and leaves thick fluffy lacing .
appearance : almost , but not quite , jet black . very active and thick beige head . great retention and lacing .
appearance : the fluid itself is nothing to look at , but i love the cowgirl on the moon .
appearance : rich garnet color , quite clear . big , very nice off-white head , with good retention and lots of attractive lacing .
a : a beautiful golden color , however the head definitely left something to be desired . almost no retention and no lacing to speak of .
a : pours a very murky apricot color , looking more like a hefeweizen than anything else . no head , just a few bubbles . barely any lacing . does n't look very appealing in any aspect .
a : hazy amber colour , nice creamy head
a : pours a slightly hazy orange with four fingers of white head that recedes into a dense cap with a solid sheet of lacing . lovely .
appearance : golden , straw-colored , clear , pours a decent thick head that discipates to thin and lacey whisp that lasts down to the last drop ; looks like a decent american macro should
a : the beer is a light gold color with a short white head that fades very quickly and leaves a very little lace on the glass .
appearance : brown amber , clear , moderate white head with some lacing . not bad so far .

a : pours a dark , translucent mahogany body ( like caramel swirled into chocolate ) . actually quite a beautiful color , though not particularly unique . i enjoyed looking at it . the carbonation was light and fine , leaving milky swirls on top of the brew in a matter of seconds . no lace .

a : probably the coolest pour i 've ever seen . the bubbles just forged up from the bottom , settling into a nice , thick tan head . a perfect compliment to a very black looking color . lacing looked like an intricate lattice pattern of dots .
a : this beer is cloudy , color is magenta and looks really thick . has a smoothie appearance it to it .
a : cloudy yellow . pour out 2/3 and then swirl the rest for a decent head , otherwise you wo n't have any . either way , it dissipates quickly .
appearance : pours golden in color with a very small white head that is gone quickly and leaves no trace .

a : gold with incredible clarity and minimal carbonation . huge fizzy white head ( must be the can ) sticks around for a minute or two . after that , we have gold colored water with a few bubbles in it . left no lace .
a : pours a dark brown , nearly black color . a two finger tan head forms with good retention . nice lace is left behind as well .
a : hazy reddish-amber body with a thin cap of off-whtie foam . mediocre retention , very light lace . meh .
a : pours a deep brown with nice deep mahogany notes . pours with thick head that lingers and nice lacing
a : typical american lager yellow .

appearance : pours to a very thick , expanding foam . be careful . the foam mass holds well , and when it finally diminishes , it leaves an intricate , robust lace on the glass . bon jambes ! body a somewhat hazy , golden honey hue . aromas : bright citrus notes interjected from beneath with a field of wildflowers late in the bloom . body : sturdy and the enough weight for this style . strongly carbonated which adds to the t
a : hazy light brown color , limited head and almost no lacing .
a : this was dark brown with ruby edges . it poured with probably the prettiest head i 've ever seen . an extraordinarily long lasting , frothy , creamy , light mocha colored head .
appearance : cororna looks as bad as a beer can possibly look . it looks like piss .
a : black , thick body with some head that recedes over a few minutes . no substantial lacing .
a : looks nice , not great head but does possess lacing . beer is crystal clear with lots of bubbles . comes out to a light golden honey color
appearance : huge bubbles during the pour that dissapeared rather quickly leaving lace and a decent ring .

appearance : pours a one finger , medium-thin , white head with decent retention . orange peel or amber orange when held to the light , but more tangerine orange otherwise . perfectly clear with only a touch of carbonation . head quickly fades to a wisp and a bubbly , soapy ring . a ring and splotchy wisp remain leaving some legs of lacing down the glass .
a : pours a beautiful hazy honey-colored gradient with a creamy two-finger off-white head and excellent lacing . it could n't look any more appealing than this .
a : transparent

a : the porter is a dark black color that looks cola-like at the absolute edges of the glass . each pour generated a sizeable coffee-and-cream head , over 2 fingers worth , that threatened to spill over my glass .

a : poured into a duvel tulip and is an excellent orange-red with a slight haze and a beautiful 1 '' head that retains its shape seemingly forever . a little bit of flocculated yeast made it into the bottom of the glass , alas . the sticky lacing is fantastic .

a : standard pour yields a 1.5 finger fine , light tan head that recedes as quickly as i can measure it into a thin wisp floating atop the brew . beer is a unique near opaque dark purple-brown . lacing sits where the head used to be with a waterfall effect to the level of the beer . pretty beer .
a : small , quickly dissipating head , gold/dull gold in color with small amounts of rising carbonation .
a : awesome huge light brown foamy head of at least a finger throughout the drink . black color , great lacing .
appearance : burnt orange in colour with a thin creamy head .
a : looks black and viscous ... perfect for an imperial stout . on the other hand , the lacing and head profile was not just lacking ... but basically missing .
a : deep amber , light tan head , good retention , great lacing .
a : dark rusty amber color . two inch head .
a : hazy deep orange-amber body topped by a reluctant finger of very coarse tan foam . mediocre retention , very spotty lace . disappointing for a dipa .
a : very standard looking , light to middle amber . very little head that dissipated quickly . quite carbonated .
a : slightly hazy , ruby colored in the glass . nice white head .
a : hazy gold body with just a few stray bubbles . boring .

a : pours a nice golden color with a frothy two-finger white head supported by a constant stream of bubbles . the head becomes rather rocky as it dissipates . the head stay around for the entire drink and leaves lots of lacing . does n't get get better than this .
a : looks like a barely carbonated european lager . a somewhat orangey urine color .
a : cloudy orange , with little to no head .
a : pours a super hazy yellow with highlights of brown with a big frothy white head . cool little bottle from a brewery i 've never heard of before . head dissipates quickly with almost not lacing .
a : nice burnt orange color , hazy and not much head after pouring , maybe 1 finger . head dies away quickly , but overall nice first impression .
a : two finger head of very slight cream , fair thickness , and bad retention . hazy murky gold colour . sm : yeasty malt scent with bland hops .

appearance : wondering if i poured too soft ... . the head was almost non-existent , and from past pours i know this should n't be ... does anyone have any ideas ? i 'm wondering if i stored it at too low a temp and then let it warm up while in the bottle before pouring it ?
a : murky brown and orange , reminds me a lot of iced tea . there 's not much head to speak of but there 's a light tan ring around the top . this does n't look very appealing .
appearance : poured into a duvel tulip glass . very cloudy with sediment . dark orange brown color . thick head , that stayed with the beer and laced the side of the glass to the end .
appearance : very good clarity with a golden blonde color . the head is white and extremely low . no retention as there is no head to begin with .
a : burnt orange ale with little head development . thin , translucent film of yellowed white foam . no evidence of carbonation . spotty lacing .

a : pours a four finger head of nice cream and moderate thickness . hazy yellow colour . appealing . admittedly , i 'm a newcomer to the style . sm : fresh and lovely . wheat with treated barley . estery almost citrusy hops .
a : the beer is a dark hazy amber/orange color with strangely little to no head . what was there was offwhite .
a : one finger creamy light brown head . jet black . nice thick lacing .

appearance : pours with 1 1/2 fingers of dark brown head . this settles very slowly , dropping to a thin coating of foam and leaving behind nearly complete lacing coverage . the beer itself is as black as ink ; opaque even at the edges . some sediment remains in the bottle .
a : pours a light honey body with moderate carbonation and a dense , dense , rocky 2+ finger head .
appearance : impressive , vibrant red with a slick of froth that contrasts with it 's pearly white color . it really does look like those alcopop nightmares ...
a : clear yellow , similar to apple juice . pours with a small , white head that quickly dissipates .
appearance : copper/brownish , 2 fingers of foam falls fast . off-white head , good beading but no lacing worth mentioning . thin white covering of foam stays above the beer until near the end .
a : clear , pale yellow with an enormous , white head that took a while to settle .
appearance : pours more like a sprite than a beer . very pale pale yellow , extremely clear . huge foamy head , not much retention .
a : clean , clear light copper with a fluffy white head . head is not as persistent as i hoped fro the style . medium sized carbonation bubbles move briskly to the surface .
a : looks amber like , and a huge head that sticks around throughout the beer . lacing is evident .
a : pours a pale yellow color with about a quarter inch of head that dissapears fast leaving no lacing
a : pour is burbundy with a very small off-white head . dissipation is instant and lacings are faint .
appearance : golden amber with towering , thick , white foam ! good lace . almost no sediment .
a : pours a dirty blond with a very small head . carbonation bubbles seem larger than normal . no lacing really .

appearance : sadly , no carbonation meant no head . beer looks strange when you pour it in a glass and no head forms . it looks naked . my named doggie claws displayed a deep amber color , almost brown with decent clarity . no lacing .
a : pours with a slight head that eventually dissipated , deep copper , clear color
appearance : beer porn to look at - pours a hazy golden color with a prodigious head that lasts and lasts and leaves thick gobs of lace along the side of the glass
a : viscous pour yields a very slowly forming layer of bubbles around the brew that seems to emerge gradually from the depth . beer is a dark , cloudy mahogany . no lacing .

appearance : pours with a bubbly three-finger head , with excellent retention . left delicate lacing all the way down the glass . the beer itself is gorgeous . the outer edges appear golden and almost silvery , but it quickly accrues a red hue as your eye moves towards the center of the glass , resolving into a pale amber color . the best looking beer i 've seen yet .
a : beautiful cloudy orange color with a small off white head that quickly dissipates . visible and high carbonation . no lacing .
a : absolutely spot on for the style . deep , tawny reddish body , tan head , pretty good lacing on the glass as well . looks almost identical to a paulaner salvator .
a : totally black body , head is light brown creamy with good retention . lacing is great .
a : pours a cloudy light orange with a minimal white head , spots of lace , i like the colour , but it looks gloopy .

appearance : i 'm a little nervous to try this one ... no head whatsoever suggesting a lack of carbonation . thick dark brown ( read : murky ) color dotted with what looks like chips of white paint . maybe it 's just the batch , or maybe it 's just the sediment left over from brewing , but this beer is by far the worst-looking beer i 've had this year . ( amendment : read some other reviews and realized that it was my mistake to pour the sediment into my glass ... whoops ! lol ... i raised the score from a 1 to a 2.5 )
a : pours pitch black , opaque . 1 finger worth of tight dark khaki head forms and holds nicely . good lacing .

appearance : a monster two finger head that has really good retention . the head is light tan in color that is foamy and bubbly . the head left some lacing on the glass . the color of the beer is a copper red color with orange hues . the clarity of the beer is clear with carbonation bubbles . there is some yeast floaties in the beer , overall it looks great .
a : pours pitch black with a big , foamy head . good sustain with thick lacing .
appearance : pours black as night with a brown head and awesome retention . great looking beer .
a : pours a very pale yellow , with a soapy frothy sudsy head with very good head retention for the style , very limited lace .
a : served with no head . beer is a cloudy lemon that reveals ample carbonation . little to no lacing with very little stick .
appearance : delivered to the table a clear , golden-amber body with just under an inch of white head .
a : deep brown , barely visible light . thick , whipped tan head . strong lacing . great .

appearance : two finger , foamy , tan-peach head forms on the initial pour . body is dark brown , if not black , in the center and shows shades of reddish amber around the sides . head retention is awesome - freakishly long-lasting . great notch-like lacing all the way down . what else can i say ? perfecto !
a : dark husky brown , with a thin tan head that dissipated quickly but had good lacing .
a : the usual piss-yellow that i 've come to despise .
a : pours beautifully , great 1+ '' head and lacing during the drink . color is clear and great .
a : pours a bud light esque yellow with a small white head that disappears in about 3 seconds . not particularly attractive .

a : pours a nicely hazy , almost opaque , pale hay color . the pour produces a 4-5 finger head that fizzles down to a one finger head by the time you finish the beer . the head is extremely rich and creamy . this is the best looking beer of the style that i have had and may be one of the best looking beers i 've ever seen . there is some lacing , but not too much , i feel this does not distract from the fact this has a virtually perfect appearance for the style .
appearance : poured from the 750ml bottle into a tulip glass . the beer is a hazy peachy-orange color . head is pure white , grew to three fingers thick and stuck around for a while .
appearance : beautiful golden brown color , nice white head , peaceful stream of carbonation . if looks were taste this beer would be off the charts !
a : pale yellow and not very cloudy at all . nice lacing though .
a : the beer is a light yellow color with a very thin white head that fades almost instantly and leaves very little lace on the glass .
a : this is what a good , drinkable stout should look like . it poured nicely , forming a slightly brown cap of foam that stuck around for a few minutes before fading into some very lovely lacing .
a : dark brown body with a velvety finger of light brown head . fantastic retention and lacing . perfectly beautiful .
appearance : cloudy , reddish brown , nice stable half-inch nitrogen head
a : dark , but slightly translucent , brown with a beautiful `` tight bubble '' head that starts as a monster but then dwindles down .
a : pale yellow , almost no head of foam ;

appearance : yep ... it 's black . it originally poured with at least a 2-finger head of tan bubbless that took at least 3 minuted to completely fall . there is a whole lot of thick lacing left on the glass where the beer was .
a : pours a deep mahogany brown color with one finger of frothy off white head . leaves a small amount of lacing

appearance : clear mahognay . thick , healthy crop of rocky light beige head is erected on top . the retention and lace abilities are very good . vigorous carbonation is noted in the body of the beer .
appearance : cloudy burnt orange in color with no head .

appearance : this beer looks rich , completely dark with tremendous amounts of sediment . there is paper-like and fine particle sediment in the bottom and sides of the container 's inside , some of which transferred into my glass ( even with a slow pour ) . the beer has an oily halo that is of incredible richness . this fine layer left on the inside of my glass produces a rusty-yellow glow when held to the light . i have never seen anything like this beer .
a : pitch black with brown head . heavy lacing .
a : flat-appearing copper with scant chemical head with no retention and no lacing .
appearance : light straw , crystal clear . one finger head that diminished quickly leaving little to no lace .
a : cork flies out of this one . huge fluffy white head over a straw body with lots of trains of bubbles
a : i rated this average b/c i drank this from the bottle while camping and really could n't see it that well . i did notice a good , creamy lasting head .

a : popped the cap on this one and it bubbled up and over the top of the bottle almost immediately . when poured into the glass it has the appearance of cloudy cola with a quarter inch of tan and sandy brown loosely bubbly head that fades into a cap rather quickly . maybe it was a result of the initial bubble over but i was hoping for more than this in the looks department .
a : pours a light amber with a pallid white head , poor to fair retention , no lace .
a : pale yellow.. minimal head.. not inviting for a dipa
a : it poured a deep black body with a monster head that was a deep mass of sticky dark brown . the head receded to a cover over the liquid and supported a nice rich lacing .
appearance : this is one fine looking beer . its black with a very big very creamy light light brown head . good lacing , good retention . i even got somewhat of a cascading effect . lovely .

a : this one pours a very deep brown ; its almost black . the head is superb , bubbling up like a thick , beige whipped cream . excellent retention and some really spectacular lacing give this one of the most sophisticated looks ive seen from a stout . its one of those examples of timeless beer beauty .
appearance : crystal clear pale yellowish straw colour , thin lace that has trouble staying right after the foam subsides .

a : this stuff reminds me of ginger ale or n/a sparkling wine . pale golden color . huge and copious carbonation bubbles . head fizzes up and disappears almost immediately . no lace . the color hue is the only reason this stuff does n't get a 1 on appearance .
a : pours dark , nearly opaque and appears to be thick with a medium brown head with great retention and a good amount of lacing .
a : burnt amber with a nice two finger frothy tan head disspiating into a substantial lace .

appearance : a vigorous poor gives the beer a nice , 2 finger thick khaki colored head which settles to a quarter inch film . nice lacing so far . clean and clear and deep red ! this looks good , the red is very rich and when held up to a light , amber glares peak through .
appearance : pours a transparent golden color with plenty of active carbonation rising to the surface . off white head rises to 1.5 '' and is cakey . the lace is very sticky and clings to the glass .
a : pours a clear golden straw color . a white head forms and leaves some light sticky lace .
a : it pours a very dark and murky brown color with no head and very low carbonation . it does not look appetizing .
a : mild amber color with medium head .

a : hazy bottled-conditioned medium orange color . two fingers of incredibly creamy and dense off-white head with sickeningly wonderful retention and tons of sticky lacing . i ca n't find a reason not to give this a 5 . 3.5
appearance : clear and gold in color . very little visible carbonation . lots of very white head , with just ok retention .
a : pours a very light straw yellow . it has a fizzy head with large bubbles , nothing spectacular .

appearance : body is thick and viscous , just about as opaque as they come , the blackest shade of burgundy . even though i poured as vigorously as i could , there is virtually no head , just a thin layer of creamy tan froth that disappears quickly .

appearance : a one finger froth creamy white heads that has very little retention . the color of the beer is a pale straw color . the clarity of the beer is clear to brilliant . there is a lot of carbonation .

a : the appearance is a very cloudy pinkish orange with no head , this looks more like juice than beer . i understand that the addition of mangoes makes for a cloudy appearance , but this just does n't look like a fantastic beer . i have a feeling that the taste will make up for the appearance .

a : poured into a pint glass a lemon yellow colour with a 1/2 '' bright white head after a vigourous pour . lively cabonation bubbles from the bottom as the head disintegrates . looks very crisp , not off-putting .
a : pours a pink grapefruit hazy body . creepy . 1 '' soapy white head fades fast to nothing . lots of tiny stuff floating around in it , i do n't think it 's yeast .
a : this class of beer does n't belong in a glass . great looking can .
a : slightly hazy , faint lemon color with a decent fluffy white head that fades quickly to a thin film of bubbles .
a : jet balck and topped with a half inch , mocha colored head that faded into nothing for some reason . i cleaned the glass too .

a : bright , clear light golden color , with a few bubbles seen streaming from the glass bottom . the head starts out huge at about 5 fingers , and features a good amount of lacing and fair retention .

a : i love a robust ipa in color : this one is a deep auburn-brown , about the color of the crust on a loaf of baked wheat bread . cloudy and unfiltered , the haze glows a ruby-orange when held to light ; tiny bubbles rise periodically . terrific head , a fluffy tuft of khaki building to well over a finger high . creamy lace sticks in wide webs from top to bottom .

appearance : an insanely huge , billowing white head of foam , like ice cram , with big bubbles sucking to the glass . body is a hazy golden yellow , with tons of tiny bubbles swirling and surging toward the top of the glass . even with subsequent pours it leaves such insanity , and the lacing 's left in clumps and nice lines .
a : pours a light golden ale with some haziness . a three finger , large bubble , whipped meringue-like head hangs out nearly indefinitely . nearly total sheets of lacing . almost perfect look .
appearance : translucent and pale yellow like a macro lager . the thin fizzy head dissipates almost immediately leaving barely any lacing .
appearance : very little head retention at first pouring , soda like . clarity is fine but no head .
a : light yellow color , quite strong foam , ok retention and lacing .
appearance : very dark and cloudy brown with a huge thick head and above average lacing .
a : pours a hazy golden with a massive white frothy head . long sustain and tons of lace .
appearance : disappointedly clear for the hefe as the body is not very cloudy , however it boasts ample carbonation . it produced a finger 's worth of head that sadly did n't lace or retain .
appearance : pour is a cloudy orange-yellow , erupts out of the bottle into the sink . fills the glass entirely with foam .

a : this thing looks fantastic , plain and simple . not only is the nitro effect completely stunning , but the body has an imposing dark body ( not pitch-black , though ) , along with a fabulously creamy 2-finger head with some of the best retention and lacing i 've seen .
appearance : good white head , gradually collapsing but never quite disappearing . beer itself looked a little cloudy/turbid . this particular cask did not seem to have dropped bright .
a : 1 1/2 finger off white head . pours light copper . decent retention . very little lacing .

appearance : nothing exceptional about the appearance of this beer . it was a light copper color with a white , coarse head . i got a finger of foam out of it with some coaxing , but it was gone in a flash . the small amount of bubbles that remained left no lace on the glass . it did have a pretty heavy bead , which i was surprised to see .
a : slightly hazy , golden yellow with a nice white head that leaves minimal lacing .
a : pours black with ruby highlights . has about a finger worth of tan head . settles to a nice cap and leaves quite a bit of lacing .
appearance : cola color , with very tiny foam and low carbonation .
a : pours a slightly cloudy , rust yellow with a nice creamy off-white head that disappears quickly .
a : pours a murky , maroon body with half a finger of instantly-vanishing beige head . there is light filming across the top , a collar around the drink , and lacing down the glass .
appearance : pours a hazy light amber with about one finger of off-white head . the head retention is quite poor and there 's little carbonation .

a : pale straw yellow , big sudsy head , impressive carbonation effect , could be the glass helping but still impressive . big patches lace sticking to the glass . honestly good looking for a light beer .
a : pours a pitch black color with a two-plus head which is tan in color . great retention . very impressed with the carbonation level after 2 years of cellaring .
a : poured a deep orage with good carbonation and a nice white cap
a : light yellow . very fizzy . bit of head . standard for the style .
a : poured with a very large , off-white , creamy , frothy head that seemed to last forever . thick , clumpy lacing left on the glass . body is a deep , ruby-red color , and extremely clear .
appearance : a watered down translucent amber body with a tan head that leaving a bit of thin lacing and not very good retention .

a : deep amber to brown with loads of brown speckled sediment . i 'm seriously wondering if it 's not some rehydrated bits of crispy bacon . a finger or so of dusty head recedes to a wisp ring and leaves no lacing . not very appetizing appearance . 1.5/5

appearance : pours a nice black-amber . head is about a half-finger with some white foam haze resting on the top of the liquid . lacing is splattery and fine . pretty nice looking , fits the bottle color scheme and the devil motif pretty well .

appearance : fizzy and light brown beer with absolutely no beery yellow touches . a color i can honestly say i 've never seen in a beer . carbonation is high and generates alot of billowing , empty foam .
a : seriously looks so good . pours like a yoohoo with mixed brown colorings during the pour but all mix to a super dark brew with a 2 inch rushing waterfall head . looks awesome
appearance : clear yellow . slight orange hue to it . the small white head drops to nothing . it has only the slightest bit of haze to it .
appearance : gold-ish yellow , light in color . small head that faded quickly . light lacing .
a : beautiful hazy tangerine pour with a good finger of slightly tinted head . head holds very well at a 1/4 the entire way down . some wisps of lacing .
a : the beer is a pale gold color , with a thin white head that fades quickly and leaves a thin lace on the glass .
a : pale orange but it looks pretty decent overall .
a : it has a common pour from this style of beer .
a : nice tight head churns slightly before fading . the beer is a clear , if dark , beautiful brown that turns brilliant ruby in direct lighting . some slight bubbles . good lacing .
a : really goo-looking ruby-brown with creamy off-white head with good retention .
a : nearly black with ruby edges with cola-like 1-2 finger head that disappears pretty quickly and leaves no lacing .

appearance : pours a fizzy , thin , loose off-white head with horrible retention . very loose and fizzy head . pathetic . fizzes down to a bubbly ring and half wisp . slightly hazy tenne orange with no carbonation evident . a bubbly ring remains but leaves no real lacing down the glass . color is nice , but the head is embarrassing .
a : i remove the cork without so much as a hiss of carbonation . beer is completely flat as totally expected . no head and no lacing . beer is an opaque , motor oil black .
appearance : porter/3 pistoles like dark , the ring of lace was sort of off-grey .
a : the beer looks great ! its a light orange color , visible carbonation , perfectly clear , and a fluffy cloud-like head but with no visible lacing .
appearance : mild haze within the deep reddish amber colored brew , patchy big bubble lace is thin and soda like .
a : pours absolute amber orange with three fingers of dimply head . i do n't see any rising carbonation . settles to a quarter inch , bone colored . 4

a : pretty decent creamy head , very brown in color , about 1.5 fingers thick . it lasted for the entire beer ; i love when that happens . high expectations for lacing were met , covering the walls of my pint glass in sheets . the body was dark black ( as if that makes any sense ) and completely opaque .
a : pours brownish black with under a finger of off-white foam which falls quickly to a central cap and rim . dark . no lace .
a : pours amber with a thick white head , good retention , great lace .
a : pours a hazy orange copper . soapy white head that leaves gobs of lace throughout down the sides of the glass .
a : opaque black color showing light transmission at the edges , with off-white residue of foam that tries to climb the walls of the glass . no lacing remains on the glass .
a : pours a deep mahogany with red highlights . appears black on a superficial look . mild off-white head , fizzy , hardly any lace - spotty .
a : a cloudy brown . has a slightly offensive color to it ... looks a tad like diarrhea to be honest . very fluffy head with little retention and lacing .
a : pours a beautiful golden hue . some fizz leads to a light head . okay retention and no lace .
a : i 'm sure this is described as `` golden '' quite often but it looked like more of a urine yellow to me ... decent head that was quick to fade , minimal lacing .
a : basically no carbonation , slightly cloudy thin yellow .
a : a light straw color with a nice white head . crystal clear .
appearance : opaque due to the black colour . the head is deep brown and low . poor head retention and no lancing whatsoever .

a : super carbonated bubbles forcing their way to the surface consistently . veyr light golden color with a thick 2 inch white head that does n't fades very quickly at all . holds steady for a while . very good .

appearance : pours a one finger medium looking off-white head with good retention . no carbonation evident . pours clear and a nice venetian red in color . head fades to s wisp and a thick ring . splotchy lacing remains until the end leaving some splotchy lacing down the glass .

a : waaaayyy too much head . from what i did pour out of the bottle with the most gentle of angled pours , it frothed up immediately into a huge 6 '' frosty white head in the mug . retention is astounding as i let it sit in the mug for a solid five minutes with no reduction . clings and laces like a mf'er . if you 're looking for beer foam as a cooking ingredient , this is your beer . do n't even attempt to shake one of these suckers up as a joke . you 'll kill somebody . when it did settle down , it was a medium bodied amber color .

appearance : this is a pretty darn fizzy-looking beer , light yellow - almost in champagne territory - with a rather sad head that does n't last long enough for me to even accurately describe it . but i 'm pretty sure it was white .
appearance : pours a dark chocolate brown color with ruby highlights but , as others have commented , no head
appearance : looked pretty good . nice tan head on a very dark body . faded fairly quickly , but was easily resuscitated with a quick swirl .
a : murky orange-green body with three fingers of white fluffy head . retention is good and leaves great lacing .
appearance : impeccably clear , with a color similar to that of apple cider . no head at all . it does n't even look like a beer , really .
appearance : light amber colored , slightly hazy , finger and half of cream colored head . lots of carbonation off the bottom
a : a light greyish yellow , with a very short lived head that fades into a white ring arround the glass .

a : pours the most pathetic head i 've ever seen ; a quarter finger of bubbles sits atop the beer , and dissipates within a couple minutes . not even a true head as the bubbles do n't cover the top entirely ; there 's a patch devoid of bubbles . jet black colour . it seems something is wrong with the beer even though i poured it from a just-opened bottle . sm : coffee , roast , chocolate , caramel . light . i 'm hoping this beer tastes better than the appearance and smell are indicating ...
appearance : honey color , not quite clear , small head with no lace

a : poured into a pilsner glass , this is a spectacular looking beer . crowned with a moussy , gleaming white head that slowly drops down to a quarter inch or so . light gold hue . cloudy . visible effervescence .
a : cloudy and gold in color . it has a substantial amount of head and noticeable amount of sediment .

a : pours into a goblet an almost jet black hue , with a little reddish hint against light . the head is very restrained , without the help of force-pour , forming just a thin layer of sparse big bubbles . quite static it looks .

a : pours a slightly brownish shade of ruby rude with a mixture of loose clear bubbles resting on top of the tightly packed one inch head , the head fades away into a cap in a minute or so and leaves little lacing along the way to the bottom of the glass .

a : pours a lightly hazy lemon-yellow with a thin , short lived , fizzy white head that quickly bubbled away into a faint collar . carbonation and head characteristics remind me of soda , not of a heff . no lace .
appearance : extraordinarily pale yellow . a decent amount of foam for about 2 seconds then it goes flat .
appearance : the color of ... it 's a medium gold color . ( i 'll let some other reviewer make that joke . ) a 1/4 inch head with minimal to moderate lacing .
appearance : pours a translucent , muddy orange color with a very short ivory head . retention is short as well . some spotty lace remains on the sides of the glass .

a : pours dark mahogany brown . little mocha head falls quickly leaving a simple , oily surface . excellent clarity , actually surprisingly thin appearing with light passing through a full pour , a bit disappointing . no lacing . surprised there was no head given the description on the bottle bragging about the head quality/quantity .
a : beautiful rich yellow/orange color like a popsicle , little carbonation , and little head retention .
a : i 'm not sure how a porter could look any different . the head is full , dark and does dissipate . the body is nearly and opaque black .
appearance : pours a cloudy golden yellow color with a finger of thick fluffy white head . the head goes away quickly , but leaves a lot of very nice lacing .
appearance : nothing too impressive here , looks like your average macro . straw yellow .
a : pours a deep , dark brown with an off-white head . looks like a porter should .
a : as usual , this beer has amazing clarity . great lagering effect . medium lacing with an offwhite head . wouldnt call it amber in color , more orange to red .
a : pours a pale , straw color with virtually no visible head . highly effervescent .
a : flawless . beautiful dark red-brown color that is still a little transparent . lots of carbonation can be seen feeding a tan-redish head . no lacing or film left on the glass .
a : head fades almost immediately . dark with lots of brown and amber tones . pours and looks like a glass of diet dr. pepper

appearance : golden in colour with a small head but with reasonable retention which is quite solid . some totaly sexy lacing which is very respectable . there isnt much that is wrong with this beers appearance .
a : poured from one of those giant cans into a pint glass . looks pretty bad and the head is downright awful .
appearance : nice looking mahogany color with brown head that quickly went away
appearance : this beer pours a mahogany brown with very little head and some spotty lacing .
a : clear dark brown body , almost no head . underwhelming .
appearance : nice deep burgundy color , with a decent white head which dissipates to a good rim lacing .
appearance : deep and dark with glints of toffee around the edge . two fingers of off white head slip down to a touch of sticky lacing .

appearance : wow , thats some head . billowy , fluffy , starting to condense on itself forming a rocky landscape , clinging to the sides like its drowning . body is a deep gold with a solid column of carbonation at the center of my fischer tulip glass . left clumps of foam on the side of my glass that look like ill need a wire brush to remove them . flavor : a mild malt taste , gentle fruit and pepper tastes , with a slightly funky finish , almost a cardboard but not unpleasant . some alcohol tastes come through as well . overall , a very subtle flavor , and somewhat like a wit minus coriander . i was expecting a more tart or sour flavor , but im not getting that .
appearance : yellow . yep , typical ugly mexican ( corona ) beer pale straw yellow .
appearance : yellow to dark yellow .

appearance : poured easily at a 45 degree angle . nothing mind-blowing , but the color was nice ( as george carlin would never say ) . looked like an average pilsner ; light , highly carbonated and lacking a heavy , foamy head . absolutely no lacing whatsoever .
a : pours a clear , forgettable amber . less than 1 finger of white head with little retention . not much lacing .
a : black with next to no head . not anything special .
a : cloudy dark yellow in color . large head at pour that settled into a lingering foam throughout drinking .
a : strawberry-blonde , with an off-white head . there 's a little bit of retention and it leaves some nice lace too .

appearance : a dark brown , almost black pour yields a one finger , thin looking , loose , fizzy tan head with terrible retention . cola head fizzes down quickly to a ring and slight wisp . black body and lots of carbonation evident for the style . a ring and slight wisp remain with unrelenting carbonation all over the place . horrible head and almost all wrong . at least its dark .
appearance : absolutely brilliant ; sparkling , clear ; red-toned amber hue ; fine , cream-colored head ; light to moderate lacing ; decent retention .
appearance : poured from the 0.5l plastic bottle with a twist top . the beer is a light orange color with a lot of carbonation , but little head that dissipates quickly

appearance : pours a big billowing two finger super thick looking tan/brown head with great retention . poured out looking like thick black sludge . jet black with next to zero carbonation evident . head slowly fades to a decent film cap that remains the whole way and leaves sheets of nice lacing down the sides of the glass . gorgeous looking .
appearance : black with rich brown marbling in the light . it 's khaki head has ruby tones to it .
appearance : pours a clear , dark amber-hued body . it 's still , but check out those legs .
a : very , very light . would be like apple juice if it was mixed with water . honestly , if i hold the glass to the screen , i can read through it .

a : pours a very light lemongrass color . no head at all , this looks like dead hottenroth . there is some bubbles sitting around in the glass but overall this could have used some time to possibly develop some carbonation .
a : ca n't say much as i drank it from the can , but i am sure i can take a wild guess and say it looked like piss with no head .

a : orangey color , opaque , like the traditional unfiltered yeast was also mixed with some tropicana pure premium , or something . definitely caught me off guard . not sure i was a fan of the appearance .
a : pours a ruddy amber-brown , somewhat cloudy . small 1/2 '' head dies down to a mere covering after 30 seconds .

appearance : amber-orange with tons of tiny suspended particles in the glass . a good finger of head at the pour faded to a half cover then disappeared about halfway through without lacing . flavor : a good winter ale . rich malt with some molasses notes , but not sweet . spices are at a nice level , mostly allspice and spruce , both fairly mild . not nearly as heavily spiced as anchors seasonal or as rich , but kissing cousins from an extended family .

a : pours a very prodigious head of tan atop a deep brown/black body . two fingers of head that really stick it out leaving residual up the side of the glass at least a half inch and in the glass until near the end .
appearance : gold , nice carbonation , big head , good lacing . very nice looking beer !

appearance : hazy , very dark golden-brown . a spiraling , massive white head , and i tried to pour it lightly . it eventually receded to a few millimeters with patchy lacing high up the glass . the lacing is amazing to look at .

a : deep brown with tons of yeast and protein sediment suspended in the brew . a two-finger head of creamy , beige foam holds pretty sturdy and leaves a bit of nice lacing . a bit off-putting appearance though .
a : clear pours a golden coat with lots of carbonation . forms a medium foamy head that fades rather quickly .
a : pours brown with a medium-large tan head that sinks into some decent lacings .
a : medium brown with ruby red . one finger off white head that fades supper fast into nothingness . no lacing .
appearance : pale amber colour , with a slight sediment haze , a small head made from massive bubbles , and very little carbonation
appearance : this pours a dark brown color with a hint of ruby at the edges . no carbonation apparent from no head - uh oh .
a : poured from a 12oz into a pint glass . a surprisingly light , gold amber with little head .
a : a nice murky copper pour , clearly unfiltered . big pillow of head that laced nicely through out the drink .
a : this beer pours an extremely pale , clear , yellow liquid , and gives a weak , white head that quickly looses all its integrity .
appearance : surprisingly good retention on this eggy-looking brew , with a sticky white head and a yolky golden-yellow body .
a : poured a light golden orange with pale yellow highlights that had a thin ring of head with very little lacing sticking to the glass .
a : caramel-amber color , kinda orange-red and hazy , with tinges of brown . frothy white head with sticky rings . looks very nice .

a : pours a clear orange tinted lemon-yellow with that signature duvel billowing whipped egg white head that we 've all come to love . a huge oily dense pillar of foam appeared as the frothy white mound slowly receded into fuzzy lace .

a : the beer is transparent and light yellow in color . the head is light , white , fluffy and stands in at about a half inch tall . as it fades , it manages to leave some faint traces of lacing on the pint glass .
a : clear medium-amber body with a big 3 '' head of rocky white foam . good retention and tons of fine spiderwebs of lace . lovely .
appearance : poured with a small foamy brown head that dissipated leaving almost no lacing on my glass . the beer is black and lets no light through .
a : pitch black with a thin brown head , this is how a ris should look .
a : a clear amber color with no apparent head .
a : clear brown body under a big slightly off white head . excellent retention and lace .
appearance : pours a dark brown color with a creamy and thick tan head . eventually becomes a heavy film that laces the glass a bit .
appearance : golden straw yellow with a dense feild of globby floaters despite a careful pour . tall , audible white head with good retention and a texture of whipped egg whites .
a : pours an opaque black brown into a new belgium globe with a fingerr of light khaki head .
a : pours a dark brownish amber with a large fluffy tan head that slowly collapsed on itself into a thick oily film that left great streaks of sticky lace down the glass .
a : pale amber that 's perfectly clear . very complex , thick head of off-white foam head .
a : clear yellow with a tootpaste white head that quickly dissipates
a : bottles are only like 10oz ! wtf ? bottle appearance is of a underfed , pasty corona . very , very thinly yellow colored `` beer '' . medium carbonation .

a : the appearance is a thing of beauty . the head was bone white , 3 fingers easy , and so rocky it was falling over itself . and i poured the double simcoe as gently as possible . the head retention was in another time zone . picture-worthy lacing . the body was richly brown , medium saturation of color , and showcased orange and tawny tints . so hazy and , with the yeast sediment still getting situated , i 'd say it was heavily cloudy or even murky .

appearance : poured with an exceptional 3 finger head of some of the thickest and richest foam my eyes have ever seen . the beer itself is a murky burnt orange ... which shows streams of carbonation rising to the top .

appearance : opaque black with a thin ruby edge . dark tan tight head has already left thick sheets of lace that look like frost on a window . flavor : seems like a stout base , and a fairly thin one , almost a brown ale . spices are nice , present but not overwhelming . very mild malt , no real hop note .
a : pours a murky brown color , with not much head . and what was there did not retain well .

appearance : a classic ... guinness draught..that you can find just about anywhere . how i forgot how damn cool it looks in the glass . it looks as good as any beer . pours a nearly pitch black color , while the nitro-tap gives this beer a gorgeous , creamy tan head that is so dense that you ca n't distinguish a bubble at all..head retention is outstanding . i could go do my laundry , make a sandwich , and catch a few episodes of seinfeld and i still do n't think it would look any different than the second it was poured . leaves rings of lacing on the glass with every swig .
