a : half finger head with appealing slight cream lacing , decent thickness , and abysmal retention ( less than fifteen seconds ) . colour is a light amber , semitransparent . sm : amber hops , heavy raspberry and strawberry fruit ester hops , butterscotch , and cream . quite pleasant and unexpected for the style . moderate strength aroma .
a : a nice dark copper to amber body . very fizzy head builds to about a finger and then , well , fizzes away . minimal lacing .
a : two fingers of dark beige head that laces the glass nicely . dark amber in color , good amount of carbonation off the bottom .
a : amber color with a small whitish head that fades rapidly ; poor head retention ( better head retention is standard for this style ) but good lacing . clear which suggests no dry hopping .
a : pale yellow body . tiny white head that fell to almost nothing .
appearance : light golden ale with fluffy/rocky ivory head with decent retention and nice cascading carbonation .

a : deep , dark , clear body shows amber against the light ; atop floats an inch and a half of light tan foam that very gradually recedes , leaving ample lace . good carbonation rising from the bottom of the glass . great looking beer .
a : pours a half finger head of slight cream , fair thickness , and terrible retention . colour is a transparent yellow . sm : cream , full barley , and well handled malt . mild in strength .
a : pours a deep red with a minimal bubbly head , some lace .
appearance : the body is a clear dark golden color , topped with nothing but air .
appearance : uh weak point . head fizzle 's very quickly , leaving a flitered looking hefe
appearance : a crystal clear , bright pale yellow liquid with not much of a head at all . in fact , it 's nearly still .

appearance : on-tap at the new claim jumper in clackamas , or . the beer was served with a lemon ( i should 've asked for it without ) floated on top of an overfilled pint glass . very hazy wheaty yellow , absolutely no head or lacing , lackluster to say the least .

appearance : when poured into my samuel smith imperial pint glass , the beer was a light mahogany brown color with ruby highlights . the head of foam was a big disappointment . all i got was a small skim of white foam and after only 1 minute , there was nothing there . no rings , no white sticky lace , nothing ! by the appearance it looks like it 's from january 17 .
a : good . orange and red hues . inviting
appearance : boris pours a very dark black with brown highlights around the edges , and it is capped off with a very thin head that dissipated quite quickly and left minimal lacing .
a : no carbonation , head or lace . color is sallow .
a : brown with no head but some carbonation apparent .
a : medium cola brown , fading head , no lace .

a : pours a murky orange body with a pinky finger of off-white head . for a pale ale i expected something fluffier and longer-lasting . the cap quickly vanishes into a thin collar and leaves only the slightest dribbles of lace at the beginning , then nothing more .
a : beautiful ruby orange body . with light behind it this one shines like a gemstone . just a fantastic looking beer .
a : standard pour yields a 1 finger foamy pink head with great retention . beer is a striking clear red . lacing is thick and layered , with great cling .
a : poured a dense dark cream head that stayed with the beer . showed moderate to heavy lacing . color is dark garnet , very clear , with lots of tiny bubbles .
appearance : bright clarity with a golden blonde color . well-formed , medium , white head . fair head retention ( not much lacing though ) .

a : pours a solid amber color with golden edges and some bright orange notes circulating in the body as well . a one inch bone colored head forms on the pour and leaves cascades of thick down the glass . great looking beer top to bottom .
a : beer pours a slightly hazy very light orange with a beautiful dense foam that reminds me of the way most sierra nevada foam looks . the meringue floats atop the beer for the entire glass .

appearance : black , that showed a deep amber red when backlit . clear , with a creamy light tan head that lasted a while flavor : clean taste with malt and hints of smoke . great balance with the malt being dominant , but not heavy handed . i let the beer sit for a while and the carbonation died off , but still left a bubbly and dry aftertaste .

a : pours with little no head , and just a small coding of carbonation bubbles . it 's a pretty medium brown with a hint of amber red . i 'd really prefer a little head to this for accent . partially tranluscent .
appearance : dark and murky copper/amber color . good amount of off-white head that slowly dissipates and leaves a collar . some lacing .
a : dark black under a big dark brown head . good lace and retention , great looking stout .
appearance : a beautiful dark red amber with an off white head , lacing is present on the glass .
a : tons of head atop a clearish pale orange body . gorgeous lacing .
a : clear , dark amber color with a peripheral ring of off-white bubbles . no lacing remains on the glass .
a : cloudy beer of dark yellow-orange color . head is only about 1 finger high and seems small for a wheat beer poured in a weizen glass . lacing is very low .

a : a dark mahogany color with a huge head . i can barely pour the beer . every drop is turning to foam . just wo n't seem to go away throughout the beer . this does n't look so good . leaves alot of lacing . more than some pale ales and maybe too much for this style .
a : pours a very pale crystal clear yellow . the only head is from co2 , and it dissipates immediately after the pour stops . leaves no lacing .
appearance : pitch black , ca n't see through it . i like that . brown head with holes in it . nice lacing .
appearance : pours pitch black with about 1.5 '' of khaki head , which has awesome retention and lacing . very nice tight bubbles on the head . great looking stout .
appearance : pours an opaque black with a very thin mocha brown head that dissipates quickly leaving a ring around the glass and not a lot of lacing .
appearance : pours a murky dark brown , not a very attractive color . there is a finger of off white head that fades to just a ring around the glass .

a : pours as i thought it would , not black , but more of a deep brown . there is almost no foam , absolutely no lacing , and you ca n't tell that you even drank any beer cause the glass stays clean the whole way through .
appearance : holy jeez , batman ... it looks like beer !

a : dark rasin black , very alluring , could kind of see into it if it were just a shade lighter . thin to no head , no lacing . a vigorous swirl provides a half finger tannish head , but again doesnt stick around for very long .
a : pours a orange/brown/tan colour with a massive head . the weizenbock always has amazing head retention . the side of the glass you do n't drink from will be white when you are done .

appearance : well , i have to agree with joe os this one . it is indeed a deep mahogany color , but i was not impressed with either the head or that lack of carbonation or the lack of lacings . this beer , after about two minutes , looks like a flat pepsi that has been left out for a couple hours . not very impressive .
a : very minimal head , nearly zero rising carbonation , transparent thin dull gold .
appearance : the usual - dark black opaque body , brown creamy head that quickly dissipated . some lacing , but not an exceptional amount .
a : pours black with two fingers of creamy beige head . head retention is good with some decent lacing .

appearance : not quite black . more like a very dark brown with an amber hue and a reddish glow around the edges . i could still faintly see my fingers wiggling through the glass . very little head even when poured straight down the middle . lacing was n't substantial .
a : clear reddish amber , constant bubbles and a steady white head . looks good .
a : murky reddish-brown body with a film of tan bubbles . nice legs . standard barleywine appearance , although earlier pours might have fared better .
a : pours a deep golden color with a thick , oily , bone white head that slowly faded into a thick oily head that left great streaks of sticky lacing down the glass .
appearance : no head . hazy brown body . certainly does n't look impressive .
a : color is beautiful . rich , deep , dark red . head was tannish-red , poured with about a finger 's worth . it disappeared quickly . light lacing , no sticky trails on glass .
a : pours pitch black with three fingers of tan , fluffy head . various sized bubbles ranging from tiny to large soap-bubbles . awesome lacing . this beer looks just the way a stout should .
appearance : pours a deep orange-copper with huge , frothy , khaki-colored head . head dissipates slowly , dragging a blanket of lace behind it .
a : pours a dark , but ultimately clear , dark brown body capped with a very small light beige head . retention is quite short , leaving absolutely no trace of bubbles after about a minute .
a : light yellow tinted , like a faded stained glass window .
a : light amber sort of orange color . incredibly fluffy and long lasting off white two finger head . sierra nevada 's ipa 's always look so good .
appearance : pours a clear amber body with a dense , lush off-white head .
a : pours a clear golden yellow color . a very minimal white head forms , and recedes in a second . light lace is left behind .
a : thin crimson brown look with a small tannish head that dies to a small ring . ok.
appearance : poured into great dane imperial pint glass ... looks innocent enough ... dark licorice mahogany , khaki head with decent lacing
a : pours a dark mahogany with traces of red shining through when held up to the light . about a finger of off-white head at first that completely vanishes and leaves no lacing . very flat looking .
a : one finger solid white head does n't want to go anywhere ; it retains as neat webs on the glass . rich copper and amber colors darkened with a slight haze .
a : pours a clear , deep golden with a big frothy head . rings of lacing are stuck like glue all around the glass . very nice
a : hazy gold orange color , no head what so ever
a : this had a black body and it poured with a medium sized tan head .

a : pours a macroy looking golden straw color though admittidly darker than its american counterparts . head as typical macro foamy white that bubbles away into nothing in a matter of seconds . less than impressive .

appearance : moderate pour yields a 1/3 inch white head that disappears immediately leaving no lacing . pours a rather dark , semi-translucent copper . leaves one or two streaks of short-lasting lacing .
a : light straw yellow , light carbonation . very thin head that dissolves quickly . 1/5

appearance : i would not call this dark , really . its orange . its lighter than most dubbels . its got a nice puffy white head . looks really good , but does n't look like a dark beer of any kind . that 's not really unibroue 's fault though .
appearance : pours a clear orange brown with a sickly thin head . disappears almost instantly , leaving no peaks .
appearance : poured with 1cm off white bubbly head that dissipated leaving no lacing . the beer is a clear orangish-reddish brown .

a : opaque black color with two fingers of super-fine and persistent light beige foam head . within the lofty head , cascading veins cut a dark network through the more pale substrate . thick , localized lacing forms low on the glass .

a : poured into a pint glass slowly and a champange like head formed and quickly left as i filled the glass to the top . copper colored with load of carbonation rushes up from the bottome of the glass .
a : golden like straw in the glass , with yeast floating throughout .
appearance : pours a gorgeous hazy red with an off white head .
appearance : pours a hazy honey color with a hollywood head - picture perfect and does n't drop a whit

appearance : this brew pours with a thick foamy head . color is a medium amber . clarity is fairly high with a very slight cloudiness . chill haze ? lacings are very plentiful . head has an amazing sustain . this is certainly an exceptional appearance .
a : pours a very dark ruby with a massive persistent head . even after waiting several minutes , i still have 2/3 of a pilsner glass full of foam .
appearance : clear yellow / orange in color with a spotty surface head . decent amount of carbonation bubbles streak to the surface .
appearance : pours the color of a typical bmc , except somewhat even more diluted .
a : dark brown , almost black with a light brown head that crackles away
a : pours a slightly murky hazelnut color with not much head . a thin spiderweb of film sits on the top . no lacing either .

appearance : i have to say , the bud light does look refreshing . the light color with a tiny , but very bright , white head makes it look pretty appetizing . that said , what little head there is vanishes almost instantly and there is no lacing at all .
appearance : served up an opaque , mahogany-hued body with an expansive , meringue-like , off-white head .
a : pours a copper color , slightly amber , with lots of fizzy carbonation . there 's not a prolonged head . in fact , after a minute or two all that 's left is a few bubbles skimming the surface .
a : amber brown body with slight head with fine bubbles . looks inviting .
a : pours a deep , dark brown with a finger and a half of creamy , mocha colored foam that fades slowly . ruby highlights around the edges .
a : very clear orange with a nice head .
appearance : clear amber / orange in color with a 2 finger off-white head . super thick lace paints the glass until the pint glass was empty .
a : hazy copper with no head ; very little carbonation . plenty of sediment left stuck to the bottle .

appearance : well , usually this section is dedicated to describing the head and overall color of the brew . well , the only thing that i 'm going to add is that there heavy sedimentation . bottle conditing is not unknown to very small breweries . however , this brew , despite the front of the label , is actually bottled by pyramid breweries . this is a contract brewing . sedemintation is not expected from a brewery with that kind of capacity .

a : wow , is this one light colored dipa . held to the light , would have thought it was some sort of belgian , strawlike . the head is sturdy sea foam and flat out great lacing . we have some floaties at the bottom of the glass . from a bottle , this is one of the most distinctive and nicest looking pours i 've seen .
a : the pour is black and completely opaque with a finger and a half of tan head that holds very well and leaves good lacing .
appearance : looks just like a draft the way the bubbles settle down into a nice black body and a creamy tan head with lacing all over the place

appearance : very slightly reddish yellow . pours with a heavy thick head , which i should add now to watch out when opening the can , head subsides to a nice covering and continues to cling to the glass all the way down .
appearance : yellow , slightly richer in color than bud or miller . no head but it was probably a faulty pour , as is common in chain restaurant bars . clear with slight lacing .
a : a clear golden color body with a very sticky white , pillowy head .
a : poured an light apple cider color . definite light quad .
a : a nice copper mohagany color . starts with a decent off white head and instantly dissipates into nothing . nice and clear

a : vibrant golden rod with massive amounts of bubble activity . head is slightly spritzy but overall creamy , just a touch off white . the bubble activity nevers stops actually , i 'm quite impressed . head remains as a solid pillow the entire time . edit to add that after reading other reviews , this picture perfect carbonation is not common . either i got really lucky or they made some positive changes at the brewery .

a : gorgeous hazy pear with particles that hardly settle , a thin sheen of a white head that almost seems like an afterthought of the haze ( the gradient of color from the top to bottom is perfect ) , and some brown yeast floaters inside .
a : the color is like a beautiful honey , great carbonation .
a : the beer is a deep black color with a short dense light brown head that fades slowly and leaves a thick lace on the glass .

a : this is an ugly looking brew . opaque orangish brown . one of the worst colors i 've ever seen . this had too much carbonation , so it took three pours to get the glass full . eventually , three fingers of foamy off-white head . retention is good , but lacking is sparse and completely randomly placed . 3.5
a : dark black , with a slight ruby tinge . some off-white , almost tan head , but no retention or lace . a stout needs a standup head !
appearance : pours an unsurprising wheat-like color , hazy and unfiltered with a small amount of sediment .
appearance : cloudy orange haze head : fluffy cream head that dissipates quickly
appearance : pours a copper color with orange highlights . about 1.5 '' white head forms which has very nice retention and lacing .
appearance : looks like a nice lager - deep golden amber , medium viscosity with heavy lacing .

a : i had read a few reviews of this one that talked about how flat it was , so i was n't surprised when there was absolutely no pop when i took out the cork . what i was n't ready for was the way this beer looked . this is an ugly mother . the color is a muddy , murky brown that kind of looks like sewage .
appearance : very saison-esque golden/peachy with a pearly white head that did n't last too long , but i 'll blame that on the fact that it 's a little aged .
a : pours a dark black with tan , almost brown one-inch head . nice lacing on the edge of the glass . head gradually dies down to a thin layer left along the edge of the glass .

a : the appearance is n't that great at all . the foam hardly even lasts for a minute i think . it has pretty luch no lacing . i like the color though . and i always think it looks nice when it 's in that green bottle . ( no i 'm not being sarcastic ) . i honestly think that they would n't be able to make a crisp smooth heineken and have a creamy long lasting foam at the same time . you ca n't have everything i suppose .
a : dark brown , almost black body , with a thin , creamy tan head ; mostly lasting , but no lacing .
a : dark brown body with a fizzy , small , tan head that vanishes quickly .

appearance : the body has a bright clear orange amber color with lots of cool visible carbonation . the head is very long lasting and maintains a small cap of foam all the way to the last sip . lacing is very good as well .
a : pours a dark brown/black with clear crimson tones around the edges in the right light ; a ring of foamy head , which dissipates quickly , without much lacing .

appearance : this bottle of beer wonderfulness pours a an extremely dark garnet with brown hues . on top of that is light foamy tan head about two fingers worth . this is one beer that i could gaze at for a while . aromas : a very light hop nose with the coffee and chocolate malts roaming all around . the vanilla beans it 's brewed with top off all those scents like a cherry on an ice cream sundae .
appearance : poured a dark amber , slightly cloudy . 1 finger slightly off white head , with decent retention ; it soon levels off to a few mm thick coating . very nice lacing all the way down .
a : pours a half finger head with okay cream , bad thickness , and bad retention . colour is a cloudy yellow . sm : light champagne , unfermented sugar , and lemon . a mild strength aroma .
a : pours an unimpressive bud light color , small white head , no lace down the glass

appearance : a dark , nearly black , reddish brown body with laser-beam red highlights . up top , two fingers of creamy -cream-colored head that endure almost to the end of the glass , leaving excellent sheets of lacing on the way down .
a : the beer pours a very nice , blueish purpleish color , very cloudy and an almost pink colored head , and great lacing ...
a : pours a murky straw color with a huge rocky head that faded to absolutely nothing and left no lace .
a : gold with small head , but reasonable rising carbonation .
a : poured a neaf black color , with a dark tan , frothy head .
a : dark brown , just short of black with a huge rocky cap and great retention . impressive .
appearance : i would n't be able to clearly identify this as beer by sight alone . as described before . it has lots of rising bubbles but no head retention , like soda .
a : i may have gotten a bad bottle , this one had zero head on it . very nice amber color .
a : black body with frothy milk chocolate river head .
a : pours a dark brown with some caramel notes and an off-white head .
appearance : pours a slightly hazy copper color with some visible carbonation . head is foamy and a bit rocky , off-white . great retention and lacing .
a : pours a yellowish orange color with a thick white foam head that dissipates to a small film . there is some moderate lacing .

a : pours a nice caramel color with sudsy light tan head , but is marred by an unappetizing suspension of particulate distributed uniformly throughout the glass . with each sip , i think of that particulate , and the fact that i am ingesting it . off putting .

a : the beer is very dark brown ( close to near black ) in color and poured with a finger high creamy brownish gray head that has excellent retention properties and consistently left a quarter finger high head covering the surface .

a : rather bleak looking , served with absolutely no head whatsoever , looking thin and watery in the glass . dark brown to black body without any retention or lacing . yikes . i 'm not sure whether or not to fault the brewers or the tap system at the bar for this dismal looking beer ...
a : pours a dark ruby/brown color . a large beige head rises to over two fingers . the rocky foam recedes to a ring , and leaves some spotty lace behind .
a : hazy , unfiltered dirty blonde color . lots of big streaming bubbles to a thin head that dissipates too quickly in my pilsener glass .
a : pours a quite cloudy , dark orange copper hue , with a rimmed beer head which looks really just normal

a : poured very hazy amber . minimal carbonation . at first i thought this beer was flat , like something had gone wrong with it . but with a very aggressive pour i managed to get a thin head that turned into a thin ring around the glass . this is probably the only bland feature of the beer . it just looks kind of flat .
a : copper in color with minimal head and virtually zero lacing .
a : brass in color with a quickly vanishing head .

a : a fairly rough , careless pour produces a perfect two-finger head of tight tan foam above a clear dark amber body . average retention and some spotty lacing . maybe not as lace-heavy as i 'd like , but a great looking beer nonetheless .

appearance : pours into an osa tumbler a dark bronze with slight red highlights . the head is creamy and blonde in color and starts out at over 2 fingers in height . it shrinks down a bit but continues to hold firm the entire way down the glass .
a : hazy golden liquid , huge white head which dissolved quickly .
appearance : deep reddish amber . nice tan head with decent retention and lacing .
appearance : pours a cloudy reddish amber with hardly any head at all .

appearance : well , the dang thing blew up on me as i opened the bottle . not sure why because it 's been siting in my basement for a while but it is n't the presentation kind of killed it for me . pours a hazy yellow/orange with way too much chunky white head .
a : cloudy yellowish-orange color , the white head is minimal , the cap is persistent , and the lacing is adequate .
appearance : opaque black with chocolate brown head .
a : pours a light brown color that is close to a dark orange . there is no head or carbonation to be found . it looks very still and dull .
a : pour is clear golden with a very large , kind of sparkeling thick head . dissipates slowly into quite nice ladings .
a : dark brown in the glass with a 1 finger tan head that leaves some great lacing behind after a short while .

a : hazy orange-brown ale , a vigorous pour into a tulip kicked up a very brief and bubbly head which was gone within a minutes . looks more syrupy than it tastes . b : scents you 'd expect from a pumkpin ale , but with a sharp spice note that sets it apart - clove , i suppose
a : nearly opaque ... a deep rusty brown where it does come through . almost white head which does n't last long or impress much

a : well , not called big head because of the foam pillow . thin head on top of apple juice color and the head dribbles out to naught . lacing holds on for dear life . n : my god , is the nose on this beatiful . if i could bottle this or use as an air freshener i would . ive heard description before of mowed grass , this one has it combined with pure pink grapefruit . the malt and alcohol are there too but wow with the fruity hops .
a : small but long lasting creamy head , dark red cedar brown in color . pitch black body . lacing is spare . s &
a : golden-bronze with a fluffy , white head . great retention & lace . exceptional .

appearance : looks like cola when light passes through the beer as it 's poured . much lighter in color than i 'd anticipated . bold coffee-colored once in the glass with tinges of ruby . not opaque . one finger of head quickly falls to a thin layer of splotchy foam , and then to a circle of foam around the inside of the glass . on a related note , many of the labels of the other bottles on the store shelf were torn for some unknown reason . i now see that there appears to be dried beer on the outside of the bottle , presumably from the ( hand ? ) bottling process . the notion that this was hand bottled is appealing , but the appearance of the outside of the bottle is amateurish and reminds me of my early bottles of home brew . flavor : not nearly as complex as the aroma , unfortunately . light molasses sweetness up front . boozy alcohol then creeps in , and is followed by a very slight but noticeable metallic twang . the finish is bittersweet and hot . the flavor of this brew is reminiscent of dfh world wide stout ( `` did someone dump a shot of vodka in my stout ? `` ) , but is slightly better imo .
a : looks great , just like a dark belgian ale should . dark brown with a bit of a misty look
appearance : the beer pours clear with an ample white head . the retention is completely ridiculous and the lacing is superb as well .
a : light orange color , slightly hazy , one finger off-white head with killer retention time , excellent lacing .
a : pours a clear gold with a fizzy minimal white head that does n't make it past 2 seconds .
a : ruddy , vaguely hazy complexion reminds me of apple cider.. low carbo and hardly any head or lacing

appearance : wow , i 'm not sure what happened to this beer -- it was stored right along side the other four -- but as soon as i popped the cap , foam came pouring out like a science-project volcano . as i write this review , the beer has been sitting in its glass for at least fifteen minutes and there 's still a big , frothy head on it . colorwise , it 's similar to the rest , a dark gold , but is noticeably cloudier than its brethren .
a : pours a reddish honey color , somewhat cloudy with under a finger of white head . no lacing , next to no film .
a : muddy light brown body with no head whatsoever . kinda ugly , but what do you expect for a beer this old and strong ?
a : jet black with a decent tan head , good lacing .
appearance : cola-ish dark brown with slight hints of crimson , soapy bubbles with little to no head retention .
appearance : pours a crystal-clear , golden-amber , with two fingers of off white head that subsides fairly quickly . tons of bubbles . tons of lacing . very , very nice looking .

appearance : a crystal clear , golden amber beer . the widget produced a super dense and creamy head . the beautiful cascading action settled down into a two-finger head that just sat there . it showed no signs of dissipating at all before i took a drink . even as i polished off the last drop of liquid , a good finger of head was still present . it left solid sheets of foam stuck to the sides of the glass in its wake .
appearance : clear brown with moderate carbonation . two finger , off-white head that diminished very quickly . the lacing was virtually nonexistent .
a : pours with almost no foam whatsoever , but is a nice rich amber color .
appearance : extremely low carbonation , very little head at all i pretty much had to force one with a hard pour . the colour id expect from a stout

a : superb . this beer poured nice and black with some dark walnut showing through the sides . a nice creamy , thick tan head that remained throughout the drink . chunky lacing that started out as big areas of sheeting .
a : pours a lovely dark black . no hues . a pretty thick dark tan head with big bubbles . dissipates at a medium pace .

appearance : medium golden color , very clear , with a moderate head of coarse bubbles , which collapsed to scattered patches of foam almost immediately . profuse streams of fine , fast-rising carbonation were also noted .
a : burnt amber-orange with a thin cap of off-white head with some retention but no lacing .
appearance : cloudy orange with lots of weird particulate floating around . ugly .

a : pretty color , a cheerful golden/honey . pillow-y white head which retains pretty well - a couple minutes - before falling to a thin star-shaped film and clingy ring . good rising carbonation and slipping lace . big negative marks for lots of suspended yeasty bits and a sprinkling of dark dust that settles on the bottom . since i 'm confused by this whole 'best after ' thing ( which is almost 6 months ago to the day ) , maybe this is 'old ' ?
a : dull golden in color . hardly carbonated .
a : awesome , what can i say ? the bottle is awesome , i really love the presentation of this beer . this beer has a nice golden hue to it with a lovely foamy heady .

appearance : how the hell do i rate this one ? i poured about an ounce into a 12oz glass , and the glass overflowed . the head explosion was a joke ! it took me about 5-10 minutes to fit the entire thing into the glass . eventually , i got an extremely sticky , rocky , white head with lacing soapy lacing , and a clear goldish-orange liquid underneath . while one wiseman says the head was a bad joke ( rates it a 1 ) , i thought it was quite funny and give it a 3.5 . after it settled , it looked like soapy urine . we averaged out the score to give it a 2 .

a : pours a vibrant orange marmalade color with a full finger and a half of fluffy foam that dissipates quickly . plenty of lacing left around the glass as well , with a nice quarter finger of foam sitting on top .
a : pours a very dark brown -- nearly black -- with very nice 2 inch frothy dark mocha head . excellent retention and beautiful sticky sheets of lacing . best porter i 've seen ... hands down .
a : the pour is cloudy pale orange with a white sparkling head , kind of fluffy . rather fast dissipation , and the some lacings .
a : a pale straw yellow with a fizzy white mousse that does n't make a point of sticking around that long .
a : served a burnt dark amber with a thick long lasting film that left great lacing .
appearance : pours a crystal clear amber color , very dark for a `` light beer . '' the head formed 2 fingers thick and faded into a thin layer and some lacing , both remained .
a : pours a clear golden with a moderate , bubbly head . good sustain with plenty of lacing .
appearance : an amber brew with slight chill haze . an amazing cascading effect produces a 1 finger thick perfect nitro-induced creamy white fluffy head that sticks to the glass and never goes away .
appearance : pours a hazy amber color with no head - zip , nothing , nada

appearance : near black , opaque , with basically no head . whatever head was there quickly levels out into a thin film . minimal carbonation evident and some lacing as well . looks flat after a couple minutes . seems to be standard for the style .
appearance : streams of carbonation bubble through the hazy gold body to sustain a white foamy head .
appearance : a hard pour produced 3 fingers of tan foam that displays great retention . hazy body the color of dark honey . good lacing .
a : very enamoring . deep dark black leather with a brown tide churning in a mercurial pattern . couple stacks of paper thick head .
a : cloudy gold with a steady stream of fine carbonation . a frothy eggshell head has decent retention , but does n't leave any lace .

appearance : ( 5 ) orange and cloudy , almost opaque . big fluffy white head that slowly deflated to a cap of frothiness . very good lacing all the way down the glass . regardless of everything else , ill go ahead and say that this is a very pretty beer .

a : here 's that 'perfect pour ' . say what you will about guinness ; it 's a damn sexy looking stout . however , bartenders , do n't fuck it up with that shamrock crap . that plastic paddy shit is annoying as hell .
a : pours a clear golden orange with fluffy off-white head that leaves some lacing around glass .
appearance : deep amber in color , with some floaty bits .
a : pale straw color ; slightly clouded . poured an ample three finger head that dissipated to healthy skim . even light lacing .
appearance : dark copper with brown hues , slightly murky . no head .
a : yellow to golden liquid , with a white , airy , cheesy , off-putting foam .
appearance : pours a clear amber color with a finger of fluffy off white head that leaves some lacing on the glass . very nice .

a : a beautiful amber/copper with contant little carbonation gently rising to the top . a huge frothy 1.5 finger white head , which the server apologized for , but that i was more than willing to accept . one of nicest looking lacing patterns i 've seen in a while .

appearance : more carbonated than i would have expected ; pours a 1.5 finger head of solid density with little encouragement . head is a slightly tawny-hued off-white color , longer-than-average retention . body is reddish brown , very hazed with what i presume to be yeast .
a : beauty . copper/red and clear with a creamy , frothy head ( like on my dad 's lattes ! ) . head has excellent retention and plenty of lace as i drink it . 5/5
appearance : pours black with brown edges with a 2-finger light brown fizzy head . not much head retention . almost zero lacing . looks rather tepid .

a : pours a dark ruby brown and topped by a rocky one inch head that quickly bubbles away into nothing and leaves no cap or lacing . will give a more detailed glass washing next time and re-rate but as it sands , meh .
a : dark chestnut body letting slight only escape near the bottom of the glass . no head , no lacing . shame ...
a : nice , clear , light orange . an aggressive pour produces a little more than one finger of eggshell white head that retains well and leaves tons of thick lacing .
a : pours a clear mahogany with two fingers of off-white head that recedes into a thin ring with no lacing .
a : cloudy straw color with creamy white head . the head quickly disapeared with very minimal lacing
appearance : more dark brown than red and could pass for a porter . no lacing to speak of as i drain the glass .
appearance : this one pours an embarassingly light straw with a wispy white head .
a : pours dark dark dark brown . aggressive `` glug glug '' pour leads to a small pinky-finger sized head that disappears in under a minute to a thin ring of light tan head . no lacing . boo .
appearance : clear with a very pale golden color . the head is white , medium-sized , frothy and not very persistent .
a : black with a great looking dark khaki head . there was n't any lacing , but it still looked really nice in the glass .
appearance : pours matte dark brown with slight honey red folds and a 1 finger mocha crown that shows lots of retention and lace .

a : head is a touch fizzy but ok. light tan colored and made up of medium sized bubbles . i do n't expect it to last long or give me much lace but it should bless the beer with a ring . the body is an unfiltered pumpkin/ruby color ... very attractive .

a : this beer pours black in color with a finger cappuccino colored head . actually there 's barley any head at all , rather , this has a swirl of bubbles that collect around the edge of the glass . only a tiny bit of lacing on this beer . the bubbles that did exist lasted for the duration of the drink .
appearance : clear brown in color with a thick 2 '' + head that last a long time . thick lacing paints the glass .

appearance : pours with a huge light tan head . takes several minutes to fill my glass as the head settles very slowly . when i finally get the contents of the bottle into the glass , i still have an inch of head that rises above the rim of the glass . the head is thick and viscous , there are waves and undulations from the multiple pours . they call this beer ruby , but it sure as hell looks black to me , maybe a litle ruby/brown along the edges , but in general it is a beautiful black .
appearance : this beer is hay colored , with a fantastic head .
a : pours a very hazy straw orange color accompanied by a dense off white head with great lacing around the glass .
appearance : pours a hazy caramel orange color with a nice layer of head , although that disappeared quickly . lacing is trickling down from the top of the glass to the middle .
appearance : pours a slighty hazy orange colour w/ no head
appearance : pours , as expected , a light amber . medium head , with little to no lacing . a decent , but pretty average looking glass of beer .
a : 1/3 finger head , very pale ( urine color ) yellow .
a : thin vanilla head fades quickly to almost nothing . dark , dark brown , with a reddish hue evident when held to a bright light . ( note at end explains reason for `` awful '' score . )
appearance : pours an average head that quickly dissolves into thin , almost non-existence . very orange-amber in color , and clear
appearance : pours a brownish yellow with no head
appearance : deep burgundy . head is off-white , rocky , and leaves a thin ring at edges . carbonation looks higher than expected . opaque .
appearance : 5 |
a : fake amber orange-ish color .

a : completely transparent dandelion yellow . it 's actually quite disturbing how transparent it is ... there was a 1 cm head that disappeared very quickly . throughout the drinking of the brew , there was absolutely no lacing .
a : clear , light blond ; very nice carbonation ; four-finger head ; laces nicely
a : pours a hazy light amber with a billowing , frothy head . plenty of lacing .
a : pours a hazy copper , dark orange . tons of bubbles . produced a fluffy two finger head that sticks around . some nice lacing on this as well .
a : amazing motor oil black with a humongous 3 inch duper dark chocolate colored head that fades very slowly . perfect !
a : pours a lightly hazy golden orange with a light white head , fair retention .
appearance : pours into my victory willibecker deep brown to black with a huge , frothy , light brown head . it drops a bit initially but still holds on to its full , firm cap .

a : satisfying pop from the cork . pours straw golden yellow with nice fine and foamy two fingers of white head that is slow to subside , slight lacing as well . somewhat hazy body - i can see the outline of my fingers through the glass , but not much else .

appearance : pellucid dark brown with some mahogany traits when backlit . breaking tan colored head builds quickly but like a soda it soon rescinds to leave only a thin covering , and with further time it breaks down to just a sad looking halo . low on carbonation but a gentle swirl reinstates a coca-cola like appearance , which soon fizzes back to how it was . no lacing whatsoever . a little more head retention would have been nice .
a : pours an amazing hazy amber/copper color with an outstanding massive eggshell color head that retains very well and leaves lots of sappy lacing along the pint glass .

appearance : pours a small , medium-thin , light tan head with lousy retention . really noisy and fizzes down to a slight ring very quickly . color is a clear seal brown with no carbonation evident . slight ring remains but leaves no lacing down the glass . not off putting , but definitely not attractive . forget this though ; the rest is killer .

a : pours a fast , almost completely black . it only lets a touch of light through in the form of a dark , crimson red beam . the head is the most impressive part of this beer . big and fluffy , three fingers of head that builds with careful pour . it has amazing retention that you ca n't get rid of . the foam is sticky on the glass and notches as the beer goes down . pretty damned impressive thus far .
appearance : not really that amazing , it might have been the pour . has a very thin head that dissipates into near invisible lacing .
appearance : dark ruby/ brown , off white two finger head , that left spider-web lacing all the way down .
a : incredibly thick and creamy belgian style head , clear amber colored , little lacing .
appearance : arrives at the bar with a pale golden color and a big head that leaves sheets of lace
appearance : pours a clear , dark amber with an average tan head . slight stickiness on the walls of my pint glass . neato comic book-esque packaging .
a : pours a murky dark mahogany-red color ; fat two finger-width head , fades quickly ; slight retention ; slick head , with barely any lacing .
a : did n't have much head , even with an aggressive pour , but goddamn if this is n't the finest body i 've seen on a beer . brilliant scarlet red . i love me a redhead .
a : opaque deep brown with no head , thus no head retention
a : nice dark syrupy black . almost no head except for a thin film n top of the beer . no lacing to speak of either .
a : pours a light apricot with a huge , dense , and oily off-white head that slowly faded into a bubbly thick film that left a solid sheet of lace down the glass .
appearance : pale yellow color , quite light . one finger of head which was fizzy not creamy , and gone in about a minute . left no lacing .
a : black with a ligh tan head , very little retention or lace ( i expect more from a stout ) .
a : the pour is by far the best thing about this beer . a nice amber/copper color with a minimal off-white head .
appearance : very solid , textbook ; very big fluffy white head retention ; yellow straw color ; very cloudy , like thick fog ;
appearance : the pour into my snifter creates a huge 2 '' khaki head . a nice layer of carbonation remains on the surface . the beer itself is pretty much solid black in color .

a : i thought the review before mine a fluke , but i had a huge head as well despite gentle pour . entire case is like this . over half the glass is foam and it takes quite a while to settle . other than that , color is black .
a : pours a ruby colored amber with a one finger head of fizzy foam . the head retention and lacing are lacking .
a : nice hazy unfiltered coppery gold . about damn time i saw an unfiltered blueberry up here . one finger of head . good retention .
appearance : zlaty bazants golden pheasant pours a light , light yellow colour along with barely no crown at all , small carbonation is visible .
a : cloudy golden yellow with light orange tones . big frothy white head that dissipates slowly .
a : clear , medium golden color with one finger of persistent , snow-white foam head . heavy lacing remains on the glass .
appearance : another pitch black creation with a massive foamy tan head leaving collared lacing nice and thick .

appearance : a beautiful and rare deep amber/caoba color , reminiscent of the most luxurious and expensive woods from faraway lands ( no ikea sawdust here ) . very exuberant big head , highly carbonated and with thick yeast sediments rising to the top . a most unusual pour .

appearance : body is deep brown with caramel tints on the outermost edges . head is brown and creamy with orange hues ; boasts fantastic retention and blanket-like lacing . even in a plastic cup , this looks beautiful !
a : strong cloudy amber body with an elegant three finger foamy white head with good retention . carbonation visible in the body . good lacing surprisingly for a hefeweizen .
appearance : the ale has a nice crimson/ruby color . it is clear with no particles or haze to be seen .

appearance : immense mocha colored foam that looks like a cascading brown waterfall . looks really nice . the head just sits there and barely moved . body looks pitch black but it is more brown as seen by the pour .
a : pours a very very dark brown with a huge mocha colored dense head that took forever and a day to slowly fade into fuzzy film that left thick streaks of lacing down the glass .
appearance : thick gold amber brew with lacing on top .
appearance : pours a very strange , reddish brown color with a big fluffy head that leaves some lacing . not your typical color or an ipa or apa .
a : just a wisp of chocolate foam on the pour . dark brown , but a surprising amount of light comes through on an angle .
a : really nice color . deep brown and red with almost a hint of purple thrown in . minimal amount of off white head .
a : head immediately fizzles out . i could n't even take note of the color . the saison is a golden-orange brew , waiting to be had without a hat ! do n't ask . where 's my head ? !

a : clear , light amber color with two fingers of eggshell-tinted foam head that diminishes to a thick half-dollar sized pad . heavy lacing remains on the glass and scattered solitary bubbles rise infrequently .
a : clear golden amber , minimal head and very little retention . quite flat looking

a : this beer is definitely took `` extra pale '' seriously , it hardly has a color at all ... weak , quickly receding head . the only thing saving it from the lowest rating are the pretty carbonation bubbles .
appearance : great looking beer ! pours a cloudy straw color with a puffy white head that hangs around for quite a while and leaves plenty of lacing along the side of the glass
appearance : pale fuzzy amber-ish color with some distinctly noticeable sediment floating around . eww . thin white head that dissolves to a lid right away .
a : midnight black , with the darkest head i 've ever seen off a stout . this baby means business ... .

appearance : pour is a very deep dark brown and starts with a 1/2 finger , light tan head that is creamy looking , but fades almost immediately to nothing but a thin ring around the surface and a light whisp that is unevenly distributed over the top ; body is nearly opaque with the exception of some deep ruby highlights taht appear when held to the light that offer up a glimpse of what looks like pretty strong carbonation ; lots of spotty lacing is left on the sides of the glass .

appearance : poured like liquid evil , slow and black as tar . a firm drop in the last bit trying to raise a head showed a brief flash of deep tan froth that slipped quickly back into the ooze from whence it came . my mug looks like a black hole . bright light showed about a millimeter of clear black that a few carbonation bubbles could be seen , but not else . stuff looks freakin ' great ! flavor : burnt coffee bitter is quickly soothed by slightly sweet roasted malt base and dark chocolate . the flavor is simple but delicious . the back end has a wet hop light bitter to give the beer a wonderfully round profile .
appearance : thick & frothy white head that rests comfortably at 2 fingers and looks to want to stay . the body is a mostly clear honey color . near perfect looks .
a : pours a hazy dark amber with zero head .
a : pouring it into a small cup it 's a bright clear pale .
a : deep red/amber color - amazing color . very week head , i had to work to get the half inch of head that there was . some lacing but really not worth mentioning .
a : poured a wonder black with a nice thick dark tan head that settled to about half size quickly then slowly worked itself away .
appearance : a billowing mocha head of foam and turbulent ebony body below makes this one hell of a good looking beer .
a : black color , one finger brown head , some lacing

a : there 's barely a head to speak of , and it goes away instantly . there is carbonation that i can see popping through the surface and sticking to the side of the glass . it closely resembles cola . it 's a dark brown color , but appears mostly black . zero lacing .
appearance : pours a clear gold that looks like cheap champagne or urine , depending on your perspective . no head , no real lacing . very thin appearance .
a : rusty brown color , maybe a little bit cloudy . it has yellow hues when held up to the light . giant 3 finger head with excellent lacing and retention .

a : pours a slightly cloudy amber / orange body with a huge , fluffy off-white head that fills most of the 1l glass . it collapses into a thick clump on top of the brew , and leaves substantial sheets of lacing and register marks down the glass .

appearance : brown , relatively transparent pour produces a 2+ finger , medium looking , tan head with half decent retention . head fades to a good foam cap leaving some decent lacing down the glass . dark brown body , relatively transparent , with higher levels of carbonation evident . good wisp remains and leaves some nice lacing don the glass . good head and lace , but way to light and transparent a body .

appearance : dense , pillowy , three-finger white head w/ great retention . thick rings of foam are left behind as i drink this one . body is a deep , clear gold . great looking beer ! flavor : honey sweetness is well-balanced w/ spicy , fruity hops . interestingly , i 'm picking up a cotton candy note as the hop flavor intermingles with the malt . at the end , a nice , strong bitterness rises up and stays through a long finish .
a : pours yellow , with a very light white head , poor retention , though some bubbles do stay around the rim .
a : pours a very deep dark red with a 1 finger head that sticks around for quite a while .
a : very dark with a two finger , cappuccino-colored head that quickly dissipates to a foamy ring around the beer . low retention , no lacing ; longer retention is typical for this style .
a : clear pale amber body with two fingers of creamy white foam . good retention and lacing . attractive .
a : pours a translucent shade of heavy brown and settles opaque with a tan head and tight bubbles ; it looks a lot like a stout .
appearance : clear amber in color with a huge 3 '' head that lasted forever . nice lacing developed .
appearance : jet black . huge white billowy off white head . medium lacing
a : golden color , small white head . slight lacing . nothing special about appearance .
appearance : look like a good standard hefe , a little clearer then i am used to , made a great head like a wheat should . very straw yellow in color
appearance : pours a sparkling gold with a fine , snow-white , two-fingered head ; not much in the way of lacing or head retention .

a : the body is a fairly typical black with clear red-brown highlights when held up to light ; above is a lovely 1 '' head of tight , creamy , light-brown foam that delivers very good retention and leave some spotty lace . good looking stout in a great looking glass .

appearance : pours a pale orange with a big-bubbled single finger of head . i poured in and then opened my computer , and the head is already gone gone gone . very clear as well . in this heat ( 97f as i type ) , this beer looks beautifully refreshing .

appearance : served up a clear , fairly bright mahogany body with a slim , ivory-hued head . looks like an amber ale . taco mac staff has been known to goof now and again , though , a quick double-check was made to confirm that this was , indeed , the watership `` brown '' .

a : poured a dark brown hue and thinner than what i had originally anticipated . after letting the beer settle for a few moments , i noticed the lack of head and lacing ... which was bit disappointing as well .
a : clear amber-orange with a solid eggshell-colored marshmellow head . this is one beautiful friggin beer .
a : big fluffy copper head that fills half the glass . dark , rich golden brown head that basically sticks to the sides of the glass .

appearance : got to say i am digging the beer from the pour . the beer pours a clear dark amber coloration . the carbonation is active and plays with the light in the room . the head is a monster . i am looking at about 3.5 fingers of amber / tan head . the retention is fantastic . the lacing on my glass is like pancake batter . a visual treat for the beer lover in me .

appearance : pours a pretty cloudy burnt copper color with a thick 1 '' head of creamy white foam . as the head fades a little it is leaving a thick wall of lace on the side of the glass . overall , this is a nice looking beer .
a : pours a cloudy yellow color , 2 finger width white head , good lacing down the glass .
a : moderately hazed golden yellow color . aggressive pour yielded only one finger of frothy head . retention was subpar and no lacing was left . 4.0
a : beer very carefully poured into my glass after an old faithful like explosion when i popped the top . huge white head , lots of lacing , beer poured a nice ruby color
a : pours a lovely crystal clear rich red . a great 3 '' tan head forms instantly and the lacing clings tenaciously throughout . really nice , i wish more beers poured this nicely .
a : pours a nice golden amber with a lot of long-lasting head that leaves behind some nice lacing . probably , one of the best looking beers i 've seen . nice , simple bottle , too .
appearance : tons and tons of foam . lacing is average at best . pretty pale golden color .
a : very clear and light yellow . bubbly head dissipates in seconds .
appearance : pourded from the bomber into my schneider hefe glass a full three inch foam starts my mouth awaterin - looks good and i am ready ...
a : cloudy brown color with no real head to speak of .
appearance : deep golden in color . light thin head . trace amount of lacing .

appearance : good old mug with classic cask head , frothy , fluffy and voluptuous . tons of bubbles atop a white head with coffee speckles . good retention , a nice half-finger of that head remains throughout . beautiful thick lacing . the beer appears black and opaque , no see-through , with auburn/ebony tones . kind of a polished-copper color .

appearance : the body has a nice dark chocolaty brown color with a light brown , chocolate milk shake like head on top . the head has very good retention makes tons of thick light brown lacing on the glass .

appearance : crystal clear copper color - well into the red/orange side of that color . bubbles moving up slowly through the beer . off-white 1/4 '' head initially that dies down to a ring around the edge and a thin film in the middle . plenty of persistent lacing ( sheets , strands ) as i drank it down . a very good looking beer .
appearance : pours a dark bown to light black color with thin tan head that falls quickly . some lacing seen .

a : i 'm no that impressed with the look . it 's clear with no visible carbonation . it 's pretty much brown , darker and with a slight reddish tint . about two fingers of brownish/off-white head that dissipates quickly and leaves no lacing .

appearance : slightly opaque and a medium copper color . the head was a nice solid inch thick with almost completely homogenous bubbles of a medium size . as the head slowly dissipated some of the bubbles combined to form larger ones and a few bigger bubbles dotted the top of the foam . the strong head also leads to some very nice lacing . in fact , this is some of the finest lacing i 've ever seen . it is very thick and bubbly and covers about 60 % of the backside of the glass all the way down to the bottom . it is gorgeous .
a : exceptional head and head retention . wonderful paintings by the head on the glass . deep dark black color with very dark soft brown highlights on the edge of the glass .
a : deep red under a big off white head . great lace and retention .
a : murky yellow , think pomme , with no head . n : duvel meets delirium meets hennipen lots of wheat . melons , apple , tangerines , and loads of belgian yeast .
a : pours a clear amber with a finger of long-lived cream-colored head . initially it deposits some nice sticky lace on the glass , though that ceases as i get past the first 25 % or so .

a : pours a dark black in color . the black is nice and glossy , pretty vibrant for . . . black . there is no seeing through this for sure . the head was a bit disappointing . it built incredibly slowly but brought up a fluffy dark brown color . sadly , it does n't last but for a couple minutes . it falls to a thin ring with a very thin mass in the center floating around . lace slides back into the glass , but it is very spotty as it goes up . the reason it slides back in is because this beer is oily slick . leaves a thin and clear film on the glass , keeping any stickiness from happening . it still looks good , just wish the head was a bit more .

a : amber , sometimes more of a reddened macro lager look to it . little head , on the first pour i turned my back and before i had an opportunity to consider it , there was none . when poured strongly for my second glass where it gave a white head with little retention and no lacing .

a : does n't explode out of the bottle like some of the 8 and 10 did . pours a lovely mahogany with red hues . the carbonation is strong , creating a bubbly , champagne-like head initially . the head unfortunately dies after a few seconds into nothing . the bubbles continue to eminate from the bottom of the glass however .
a : appearance is not what i 'd expect . very dark , like a brown ale . very minimal head too - dissipates to nothing within a few seconds but ... .
a : pours a clear medium amber to orange with a thick white head , leaving strong profuse lace . great head retention .
a : deep copper with a one finger creamy head . leaves some solid lacing behind . tiny carbonation bubbles stream up
a : pours a golden color , not much head at all . moderate amount of carbonation .
a : deep grenadine/ruby color , four finger head settles to a think one finger foam . clear with a few carbonation bubbles . fantastice lacing , maybe the thickest i 've ever seen . unbelievable .
a : one finger head of fair cream but poor retention . transparent straw yellow colour . unflattering . sm : very light straw and barley . poor and unappealing .
appearance : do n't know , i did n't bother to pour it .
appearance : a heavy rust-red with a silky head of blond foam that quickly recedes .
a : pours pitch black with a finger of dense tan head . retention is nice .

a : clear bright red body with an inch of bubbly pink foam that quickly disappears completely . ok , but slightly better retention would have been nice - that head was beautiful for the few seconds it lasted !
a : pours a dark hazy goldenrod with a fizzy white head . poor retention for the style no lace .
a : very dark in color with a thin medium brown beautiful head
appearance : dark coffee look . head is brown that dissipates quickly to nothing , little to no lacing .
a : pours a cloudy straw-amber body . nice head , lacing , with a long-lasting cap .

a : pours a beautiful amber with excellent clarity , enormous off white head , a good two inches worth that slowly recedes back into the beer . large clumps of lacing left behind . really a nice looking beer .
a : dark dark brown , pretty much black with a small light brown head . no lacing .
a : nothing great here , pale yellow , decent carbonation .

a : beautiful translucent orange-copper colored body . cream-colored , small-bubbled foam makes up an impressive 1 1/2 finger head that never dissipates . leaves sticky rings of lace all the way down the glass . i find it impossible to believe that a beer of this style could look any better than this .
a : black liquid , gorgeous large creamy light brown head which .
a : clear golden color . fluffy white head when cracked , thins fast .

a : hard to know if this is the 'correct ' look or not ... beautiful auburn-amber hue , crystal clear and cut by a multitude of cascading carbonation stream . all this occurs beneath a gigantic rocky head of ivory seafoam - over 3-fingers - which drops slowly , leaving plenty of sparkling lace . i do n't know if it *should* have such a massive head ( it has been at least 5 months since our trade ) , but i honestly do n't care ; it 's quite pretty all the same .
appearance : pours a clear , light/on-the-verge of pale yellow , settles to very little carbonation with very slight lacing .
a : moussy , full head with excellent lacing and retention ; beautiful amber color and lots of carbonation . one of the best looking beers i 've ever seen .

a : black . an aggressive pour creates about a finger 's worth of dark brown head that lasts for a minute or two . the lacing is quite prominent for the style . this is what an imperial stout should look like .
a : poured chilled into a room temp pint glass with a full tan head that stays throughout the session . carbonation appears medium to high . color is black .
a : thin yellow , lots of bubbles , 1-finger head that dissipates into nothing with no lacing -- not too much different from a fizzy lemonade .
appearance : cloudy dark gold body , fluffy white head , great retention , good sized head , good lacing .
a : pours a dark reddish-brown with a big foamy head . leaves gobs of lacing on my goblet .
a : pours a light straw yellow with a small tight head . light lace and a slightly cloudy appearence .
a : the best thing this has going for it is the look from the pour . thick ample head , murky amber orange , apple cider sort of look
a : pours a rather light brown , with a medium white head , average head retention for style .
appearance : clear reddish tan . minimal head , almost no lacing .
a : it pours a straw yellow with a one finger white head
a : dark brown color , not as black as expected . it has a generous tan head that has very good retention . tons of lacing too .
appearance : the classic guinness pour that forms a massive head from the bottom up ; great retention and leaves sheets of lace
a : the beer is a deep yellow color , with a thin white head that fades quickly and leaves very little lace on the glass .
a : very light . more like an american domestic light than anything . just a little bit of head .
a : a beautiful deep hazy amber with a thin creamy head . nice residual lacing . beautiful dipa .

appearance : pours into my new belgium tulip a crystal clear yellow gold . a giant , rocky , white head forms on top and does n't really shrink at all because of the nucleation site in the glass constantly refreshing it . the lacing down the sides hardly lets any glass show whatsoever through the wall of white foam .
a : pours a dark amber with a very light head , fair retention , no lace .
a : an off-white head with little carbonation that lasts the entire time . very dark black , looks like motor oil !

appearance : the hop wallop is a great looking beer . a big , thick and fluffy head rests on top and hangs around for a long time before finally receding . skimpy lacing , but it is very pretty and arch-like .

a : dark as hell obviously but what surprised me was how aggressive the head was . i poured fairly gently and almost overflowed after 2 inches . it is the brownest head i have ever seen . really does look like milk chocolate . tilt the glass and the head does n't even move ! it is like cement . anyways not too many beer overly impress me here .
appearance : pours a pretty hazy copper color with amber and orange highlights . about 1.5 '' of off-white head forms that has awesome retention and lacing . high carbonation . great looking beer .
a : everything an ipa should be . a wonderful hazy gold color with about half an inch of white head that laces and settles into a ring .
a : this is a beauty , and dead on for how they style should look . amber/orange with a fluffy white head with tons of retention and all sorts of lace , even after the glass is finished . money . 5/5
a : pours a cloudy light orange , really light fizzy head for a hefe , not impressive .
appearance : pours a hazy golden wheat color into a still hazy dulled amber body . the head is a faded white that does n't stick around for long .

appearance : kind of looks like flat guinness extra stout . nearly jet black , but actually dark dark brown . no carbonation or head retention , which creates the flat look . i 'll give this the benefit of the doubt ... maybe it was just a bad pour .

a : a dark brown porter that kept a decent finger and a half rustic head . light penetrates the sides of the beer to give it a very cola look , it comes off as a bit light in the visual for the style . the movement of the beer itself also makes me scratch my head a bit ; just so thin .
a : pours a dark amber with a dense head in a pint glass . as it settles , the lace sticks to the side of the glass .
a : poured a jet black color with good carbonationa nd dirty white head . looked pretty good
appearance : hazy amber body with an exceptional 2 '' mound of head . the clumps of lacing are unreal . it 's bottle conditioned , so expect free-floating yeast .

appearance : not much of the guinness cascade but it 's still very nice looking . brown-black body with a milk chocolate/cola head that is bubbly and holds steady quite a while at 2 fingers . lots of lacing also .
appearance : average looking clean golden hue of most lagers

appearance : the creamy and foamy white head lasted only a few seconds . the color of the beer is medium light straw . there is a lot of effervescence in the beer . the clarity of the beer is clear to brilliant .
a : slightly hazy golden color with a three finger head . great retention . lacing is also excellent . 5
a : pours a very nice reddish shade . rich amber , if you will . smallish off-white head with not much lacing . head subsided fairly quickly .
appearance : a medium amber color with orangish hue . there was a one finger head but it dissipated quickly . there is some effervescence in the glass . the clarity is clear .
a : looks like any standard lager . fizzy and yellow . pretty weak head gone in a flash lacing does n't really stick .
a : murky , brownish apple cider color . a minimal head popped up after the pour and quickly faded to a thin collar .
appearance : clear , bright amber with thick , foamy and sticky head and great lacing .

appearance : jet black , no head whatsoever - looks thick , syrupy and dense in the glass . held up in the light , however , it is speckled with tan sediment - almost looks like tiny pieces of wood chips ? i was n't expecting this
appearance : pours a slight white head that soon becomes a thin ring ... and soon becoming placid . ends up looking like a glass of chardonnay . the beer is a pale golden in color .
a : dark brown head which drops and leaves a lingering layer of spots , pours with some serious viscosity and moves in the glass with a slight sluggishness , obsidian black in color - 5.00 ,
a : this thing pours like motor oil into my glass - nice 1 finger tan head that leaves skim as it leaves the glass
a : murky dark brown , huge brown head leaving lots of lace .
a : this is one awful looking beer . runny mud puddle brown color . the pour produced about a finger of cream colored head that left some nice lace .

appearance : a somewhat cloudy burnt amber . a moderate pour produced a thin , white head that disappeared almost instantly . a small amount of lacing was present throughout . okay , but no prom queen .
a : pours a hazy copper color with a small white head that has faded to thin layer .
a : pours a brilliant dark golden with light ruby hues . nice creamy looking head , that sticks around for a while .
appearance : light brown to copper in color , off-white thin layer of head , reasonable clarity
appearance : extremely dark brown , some may say black . thick , luxurious foamy head that lasts , chocolate brown in color .
appearance : pours a pale straw/gold with a thin film of bubbles on top , but no head to speak of .
a : solid brown and clear , nice creamy brown/white head with copious lacing . 5/5
a : beautiful golden hue with a decent head that fell quickly .
a : very hazy gold body , next to no head . light ring of bubbles . not bad at all , but no better than average .
a : pale yellow with slightly more color than the typical light lager . a large head to start out , but quickly receding . little to no lacing .
a : pale yellow . no suspended wheat or yeast - fairly clear . limited heads immediately dissolves into nothingness . just left with pale yellow beer .

appearance : i decided to pur this british ale into a brooklyn brewery imperial pint glass . out of this can comes a beer that was a dark yellowish amber color . the color of this beer was nice , but it does n't compare to the head of foam . this beer had one of the creamiest heads of foam i 've seen on a beer . that was thanks to the nitro widget inside the can . when it was poured , the glass filled up with nothing but foam . but then the foam slowly started receding and filling up with beer . it was like watching a beer show ! i almost forgot to mention that the head of foam was a light tan color at first , but then turned into a solid white color . if that was n't enough for my eyes , the head of foam was long lasting and left behind a ton of milk like streaks of white lace around the glass . it was truly an exceptional appearance .

appearance : thick flakes of something make the rounds in a dark cloudy orange glass . solid finger of meringue head laces heavily . flakes are dark , they dont look like protein coagulation , a bit disturbing . as the head settles , there are dark particulates suspended in it like dirty snow . flavor : heavy bittering hop , firm tea flavor , mild malt base . theres a heavy orange peel element and some earthy tea flavors that make me think english hops . as it warms up a bit , some of the worty under-attenuated malt flavor comes out .
appearance : nothing special , just golden ameri-beer . but it 's got great cans , so i gave it a 5.0 anyway .

appearance : this beer looks like it will taste delicious . the liquid is a really warm coppery orange , somewhat hazy , with an enormous 3 finger rocky white head . the head fades fairly quickly to a bubbly skim , but leaves behind a ridiculously huge amount of sticky , foamy lace all along the walls of the glass .

a : very dark brown to almost black as night color with thick everlasting creamy and frothy tan head , fine lacing appear sip by sip . medium carbonation , some visible bubbles cling to an inner wall of a glass .
appearance : piss yellow with a weak frothy head . looks like mass produced macro-lager
appearance : gorgeous deep amber red . totally translucent with a steady skim of bubbly white froth .
appearance : a clear reddish amber beer with a thin ring of foam that leaves a bit of lacing around the edges of the glass .

appearance : lovely milky golden body that some pale orange flashes . massive head on the pour , reminded me of whippy italian ice-cream at times . thick luscious lacing clotted cream blobs stick to the glass sides . average carbonation . the clumpy head seems to last forever.distinctive looks in the glass .
a : it pours a murky reddish-brown color with a finger of tan head that dies quickly .

appearance : a picture perfect pint . two finger head rose right to the top of the glass without me even trying . body is an opaque black/brown that turns to ruby red when held up to light . nice webbing of foam down the side of the glass as i drink .
appearance : copper orange with no head or lacing
a : very dark amber , bordering on mahogany . thin head that dissipates quickly .
a : it pours a glowing dark red color with pretty much no head and it does not lace very well . the carbontion seems to be very low which is not a good sign .
a : clear amber with two-finger , off-white , creamy head that lasted . nice lacing .

appearance : good-looking , overall . the body is clear and sparkling with bubbles , and is almost identical in color to grain belt premium . head poured about 1.5 fingers thick and rocky , and receded over about 5 minutes to fine film .
a : hazy brownish orange . thick-bubbled two-finger head .
a : like most people have said , the darkest beer i 've ever seen . looks like it 's filtered , head is extremely minimal with only a minuscule ring of foam staying . no lacing , no retention .
a : a deep copper with reddish/orange highlights . the head is virtually non-existent and has no retention .
a : pale , sickly goldenrod , but clear . pours with a quick burst of head , which subsides into nothing with no trace of lacing . visible carbonation up the side of the glass .

a : wow , this one really lets off a bit of fizz when poured into the glass but the head dissipates in the same violent fashion that it poured ... disappointing . the body is golden bordering on a certain yellow colour that we 've all seen before while going to the loo . the head is straight white .

a : pours a one finger head , fairly thin , of slight tan colour , pretty much no cream , and pretty decent retention . solid black colour . sm : slight cream and very light malt . an extremely light aroma .
appearance : i might have got a bad one because i didnt get much head out of this . cloudy lemon/orange , the head was ok but dissipated with an uneven head with little to no lacing .
appearance : this pours a copper amber color with an unfiltered look . a dollop of white foam rests on top , and it demonstrates brilliant retention and leaves a sheet of lace down the glass .
a : cloudy golden yellow with a thick , foamy head that would be white save for a lemony jaundice . the carbonation comes in thick strands of fair sized bubbles .

appearance : cloudy , pale yellow in color , a medium sized head dissapears quickly . wow , this beer provides alot of overcast , even from looking down into the bottle you can tell the clarity level is at a low .
appearance : hazy . brown . no head . no bubbles . looks very unappetizing
a : lovely golden shimmer . pours with a seizable head .
a : it pours golden with a really large white creamy even & compact head that leaves lot of lacings .
appearance : pours a golden yellow slightly hazy color . big head with great lacing down the glass in webs .
a : medium carbonation ( several small bubble trails going to surface ) ; lacy white head that sticks to glass with ~1/8 '' head that remains on the edges . beer is a copper color and clear .
appearance : adam pours out a dark brown color with dark mahogany highlights . head is soapy , and sticks around for a very limited amount of time . obviously not much carbonation here .
appearance : dark brown with amber hues . creamy off-white lace that settles to a ring .
a : bright straw yellow beer with a huge head that was hard to control even with a slow pour . soapy head takes forever to dissipate with carbonation continually rising to the top . great lacing .
appearance : poured a very pale light yellow , crystal clear . half finger white bubbly head that diminishes to nothing in less than 30 seconds . ample carbonation present .
a : yellow very yellow . not very pronounced .
a : very nice golden orange color with a touch of haze . pours with a big white head , as advertised . one of the cooler looking pours i can remember , so i give this a 5 for appearance .
a : awesome pillow-like head , about 3-fingers . very clear , light golden color . lots of bubbles coming up to the surface . sticky , soap-like lacing .

a : pours a two finger head of fair thickness , no cream , and poor pathetic retention . colour is a clear gold . sm : very nutty , actually . malt and barley are there , alongside a hint of lime . i also get a fermented pineapple note , a bit like tepache . interesting and unexpected .

a : pours positively perfect , a solid finger of foamy light tan head that lingers for a long time . pours perfectly clear with a small amount of carbonation bubbles and comes out a medium brown color that is very enticing . leaves a ton of lacing
a : very little head that quickly fades to pretty much nothing . very clear copper/red coloration . some visible carbonation . absolutely no lacing .
appearance : clear dark brown color , weak carbonation , small head , and weak retention .
a : deep red with a nice off-white head with decent lacing , good retention .
a : medium gold color with an extremely thin head little carbonation and lack of lacing .
a : very pale yellow color with some particles floating around . big white aired head which dissipates very quickly leaving no lacings
a : warm golden , tinted by orange , with a slight cloudy haze ( bottle conditioned ) . about one-finger of creamy white head & decent lace .
a : a little foggy dark copper color . not a lot of carbonation or head . no head retention either . the lacing and film fall back to meet their buddies quickly as well .

a : wow-certainly not what i expected ! fluffy off white and soldly foamy head that stays put and does n't seem to want to get any smaller . deep and rich rusty orange/chestnut-hazelnut brown that shows happening carbonation quite clearly . great color , i must say . n : hefty floral , spring flowers in full bloom we 're talking here , and malty citrus ( florida sweet oranges ) tones dominate . tangerine , orange hard candy . shows some signs of the concord yeast strain , but all the same not bad .
a : pours a nice dark coal black hue with a small tan colored head . very little retention and no lace .
a : clear gold body ( surprise ! ) with a lovely finger of creamy white foam that shows strong retention and leaves comprehensive lace . gorgeous golden ale .
appearance : sad flaccid pathetic looks , the fizzling white head disappears rapidly to a thin halo like edge , the surface reflects the lightly hazed milky golden pong beneath .
a : clear golden orange body with very faint head . no retention and little lacing .
a : it 's a darker shade of brown , but not black . it is transparent and has a very nice thumbs width white head that stays up and leaves good lacing .
appearance : gorgeous , swirling currents of ultrafine bubbles that coalesce into a thick , creamy , egg nog-colored head atop a clear , rusty , bengal orange-colored body .
appearance : pours a medium amber body with a tiny head that quickly disappears and leaves no lacing

a : the beer is a cloudy pale tannish color . almost light brown , sort of orange . odd color here . not the most appealing , but not too far from an average witbier . head was 3 fingers and pure white with ok retention .

appearance : not the most attractive beer . it pours a turgid yellow amber , sort of a dark goldenrod , with the majority of the turgidity likely being the result of the yeast kick in the finish , though likely not all of it . the initial pour - even split among three glasses - yields a nice , initially fluffy head , sort of a dull white , but it ends up fading fairly quickly , fizzing , bubbling down in to nothingness . no lacing and no surface dusting of which to speak renders this one fairly average-looking .
