a : a deep murky dark brown color with no head and no glass lacing .

a : let the cascade effect settle . appear the very dark brown to inscrutable black color with thick creamy tan head naturally for nitro system . the head recede slightly and stand until the last sip and leave fine lacing along its path .
a : pours a dark brown , with a nice , thick off-tan head which looks like its going to fade away fast into nothingness at first , but stays there the whole glass .
appearance : beautiful clear golden orange with a dark off-white head that disipates and leves nice lacing in a chimay goblet .
appearance : a light golden amber . no head at all and no lacing .
a : looks kinda like a darker cranberry or rasberry witbier to be honest . mild head with little lacing .
a : a cloudy brass body with a small cream colored head which falls quickly . a few pillars of carbonation .
a : dark as all hell . decent head .
a : hazy straw pale with a light orange tint . poor head retention . large amounts of carbonation and no lacing .
a : unexpectedly light with a thin white head , fading to a thin and fastly disappearing ring .
a : nice black appearance and when the light reflects through you get a little mahogany hue . nice head at first .

a : for a light beer , this looks really watery . very light yellow , resembles ginger-ale . the head was the only redeemable quality , light and fluffy for a few minutes , with wisps of mild lacing .
a : clear gold with a large , pillowy , ivory head . lots of little carbonation bubbles flowing . good lacing .
a : i really prefer to drink in the can because poured in a glass seems urine ;
appearance : pours about two fingers of creamy , beige head . a deep , dark brown . dark amber when held up to the light . slow moving , subtle carbonation . a tiny bit of lacing .

a : pours a half finger head of slight cream , fair thickness , and poor retention . colour is a semitransparent yellow . sm : light vinegar , earthy notes , pleasant funkiness , bacteria , and heavy yeast . a moderately strong aroma .
appearance : a certain cloudiness shows this beer as unfiltered and the bubbles that struggle to the top show that the beer has some body to it .
a : urine . with some bubbles .
a : a little uneventful ... a decent golden amber pour , head is a bit lackluster , pretty much no stick , and lacing is minimal .
a : dark ruby red brilliance with a small amount of head . this is one damn good looking beer . let 's hope the carpet matches the drapes !
a : pale , golden color . small , white head .
a : very dark , but lacks the type of head i would expect from an oatmeal stout . the head dissipated almost immediately . disappointing .
a : it pours a clear , but dark colored amber , the shade of rosewood . a thumb 's width of fluffy white head , and lots of lacing .
a : pours an opaque black with half an inch of thick head . great cascading effect from the nitro-tap . always a pleasure to see this . thick lacing down the glass .
a : rich golden amber , very little head or lacing . carbonation light as well . solid looking .
appearance : it poured a yellow body with a small white head holding poorly and leaving no lacing .

appearance : this beer lives up to the first part of it 's name - it 's black as night . the beer sports a fingertip deep layer of a frothy chocolate colored head , floating on the surface of the beer like the milky way against a black night sky . a herd of carbonation bubbles scurry up the sides of the snifter to the surface , creating a small ring of bubbles underneath the layer of head . the beer leaves behind a curtain of light brown lacing along the side of the snifter . pretty . 5
a : it pours a great cloudy orange , with big tan head . in some parts it changes color to yellow . it has lots of lacing on the glass . it is truly a sight to behold .
a : very dark brown with lighter edges , no head at all but i 'm going to call that the bartenders fault .
a : standard pour yields a .5 finger cream head with poor retention . beer is a dark , blood-red mahogany . lacing is web-like , patterned , and spotty in parts but with very little stick .
a : black color with little head . it dissipates quickly .
a : this brew pours a dark amber looking color . after the pour the small head turns to nothing , with no lacing .

a : i love the look of a nitro-beer ... cascading is cool . ok. down to business . pale copper color with a dense cream nitro head , about two inches thick . excellent retention . a few clumps of lacing , but nothing really to speak of . tons of tiny bubbles cling to the inside of the glass .
appearance : hazy , unfiltered look . a combination of muddy oranges and lighter amber colors . pours with a light white head . dissipates quickly and leaves little lacing .
a : clear , effervescent orange body with an inch of creamy white head . strong retention and beautiful , thick lacing . gorgeous .
a : light golden , very clear color , head disappears quickly .
a : pours a very dark brown to black , with a great thick , brown head , that lasts forever and leaves brilliant , thick lacing , could n't wait to taste this one .
appearance : pours black with a decent brown/red head that dissapates to a thin layer quickly . it looks pretty good through the whole bomber though .
appearance : pours a dark black color with a 1 '' milk chocolate colored head .

appearance : red/amber color with a monster head . also noted the very active carbonation seemed to keep some very small ( spices ? ) particles suspended in the brew . also have to note , the entire pack i got were all gushers , quite a surprise from such a prestigious brewery . a solid coat of lace , which looked more like spray paint , dominated the glass . flavor : spices are right up front , nutmeg , pepper , allspice ? i & # 8217 ; m taking wild guesses here . spice fades into a malt sweet that takes about 5 seconds to transition to a hint of hops at the end . balance is good and allows the spice and yeast to come through , but i have to say , this wasn & # 8217 ; t the transcendental experience i had hoped for .
a : pours out to a flat and lowly carbonated presentation . medium yellow color with a short lived foam head , and a total lack of lacing .
a : clear , golden straw with 2 finger white dense head with nice lacing retention
a : hazy , light amber color with two fingers of diminishing off-white foam head . pebble-sized yeast solids are seen slowly settling to the bottom of the glass .

a : i must have to say , this beer is gorgeous , crystal clear shimmering copper/amber with golden/orange hues on the edges . creamy off white head ; 1 fingers worth . good head retention all the way down the glass .
a : poured a light golden yellow with a thin head and good lacing sticking to the glass .
appearance : light and clear as a kristall should be .
a : pours an ultra clear yellow . heavy carbonation , with a large white head . no lacing because the head evaporates in seconds .

a : pours with a decent frothy bubbly head about a finger to start but fades quickly to a light head covering . it has a brilliantly clear toasty maple leaf brown color that gives me vertigo as i stare through it . n : it has a sweet malty aroma to start , with a crisp marzen feel . some toasted malt character and syrupy cracker aroma is there . i also get a slight alcohol and a slight porter style roasted malt smell that finishes off the nose . different but still a decent oktoberfest nose .
appearance : pours a pale straw , transparent yellow colour with a bone white head , instantly dropping to a very thin ring .

a : pours a clear yellow color , perhaps slightly darker than most adjuncts , with a pitiful fizzy white head ( you can literally hear it fizzing like a soda ) that fades before i can even take my first sip . needless to say it did n't leave any lacing .
appearance : great head and nice lacing . smells citrusy and watered down.. not very strong , but nice
appearance : clear straw color with a large white head that dissipates pretty quickly and leaves no lace .

a : poured at about 45 degrees into a huge wide mouth belgian glass from iron hill . slow pour down the center of the glass leads to a thin head after two minutes only a thin ring remains . wow this one has really tight bubbles and awesome legs . when held up to light it is a beautiful glowing red . 4.5
appearance : pours a hazy lemon color with a huge head that leaves clumps of lace behind
a : pulpy guava , huge voluminous soapy white head , copious clumps of lacing . 5/5
a : deep auburn in color , clear , with about 1/2 '' of white soapy head . head dissipates quickly to a very scarce ring of bubbles . no lacing to speak of .
a : fairly hazy , slightly orangy yellow . 1 finger head that itself looks like lacing . low to moderate rising carbonation .
a : holy oil batman . this guy pours a very viscous jet black with a ridiculous dark brown head that has ridiculous retention . this is what an inviting stout should always look like .
a : hazy gold/copper color . poured a thin off-white head with fair retention . bubbles lazily rose to the top . b : lightly toasted bread . hop spices ; cinnamon and pepper . a hint of alcohol .
appearance : murky dark gold , low head retention . flavor : caramel flavor with malt in the background . fruity estery flavor also . coriander/spices also lend slight medicinal notes .
a : crystal clear brassy body with a good 3/4 '' head that kicks around for a few minutes before departing in a thin layer of brussells lace .
appearance : pours a mostly clear dark red-amber color . off-white head dissipates to a film rather fast , but leaves nice lacing along the glass .

a : overcarbonated . i gave it a gentle pour and it gave 3/4 glass foam . gold/amber color . thick head enough to hold up a bottle cap . left suds scraps as i drank it . s. not much smell to detect . boozy and malty
a : pours hazy golden yellow . sediment was slightly stirred and there are a few chunkies flating . nice two fingers of foamy white head that is slow to subside .
appearance : yellow to clear . not much to look at . some white head and lacing .

appearance : very clear with amber colored tones . the head was a perfect big fluffy two fingers that slowly receded to a nice foamy covering . the foam produced some of the best lacing i 've seen . i was shocked that a beer that looked this good could come from a can . i have totally changed my opinion of beer from a can .
a : pours jet black with a modest tan head . very little lacing .

a : poured with a large , creamy white head that slowly dissipated down to a full 2-fingers , where it stayed for the duration of drinking . fair lacing on the sides of the glass . body is light yellow and clear , with a slight touch of haziness .
a : i was not at all impressed with the pale straw color , but the head was one of the most substantial and beautiful i 've seen . gorgeous lacing left on the glass .
a : the brew pours a light mahogany color with mauve hues . a soft pour resulted in a bubbly two finger pinkish-white head that recedes quickly leaving very little lacing .
appearance : pours a hazy , pale orange color . has small , fizzy head that dissipates quickly and leaves only spotty lacing .
a : pours super viscous . no head or lacing . beer is a deep , dark , opaque , motor-oil black . leaves nice oily remnants on the side of the glass .
a : very clear , honestly , it truly is just slightly colored water ( piss actually ) . decent initial head , but dissipates quickly , no lace .
a : this poured an opaque pitch black with some thick dark tan head . very dark .
appearance : copper/orange with a billion microbubbles coming together to form a thick , chunky clump of white head . ca n't go wrong with that !
a : pours a very dark brown , with a full tan head , medium retention , looks like a good porter should in a pint glass .
a : pours a very light crystal clear yellow like any other adjunct , with a pithy white head that fades to nothing and leaves no lacing at all .
a : thick foamy head , but not much , deep deep dark brown . i want to climb inside of this beer and drink my way out , from the look ( and the name ) .

appearance : pours a medium to dark brown with almost no head . a small island of foam floats in the middle of my glass with a thin ring around the edge . kind of looks like coca cola that has been left in cup for too long . after a second pour , even the carbonation looks like that of a soda , thin bubbles and extremely short lasting .

appearance : the same pale , straw color as bud light , i can not tell these two beers apart based on their color , but the regular bud had a little more head and it actually retained it for a minute or so . it is a good looking beer .

a : could n't get much of a head no matter how hard i tried in my freshly washed glass . orange amber color . incredibly horrible retention of the head that i did get and minimal lacing . fine particles floating throughout .
appearance : gold to copper . nice and clear , a job well done . nice head befitting of lager , leaves half a finger until the last drop .
a : normal beer yellow , no head at all

a : when i opened the bottle ( 33 cl . ) with first the bottle-opener and the cork-screw it poured golden ( with some orange ) . the head was surprisingly small , white and compact - but small . the beer was also cloudy , with some residual lacings .
a : deep reddish , full color , with a thick , almost picture perfect creamy off-white head , great lacing on the glass . bubbly at first but that settled quickly .
appearance : bright copper , 3-finger cloudy head sticks around , impressive lacing

appearance : wonderfully dark with a slight cream colored head . appears golden ruby around the edges of the glass when held up to the light . ca n't get much better than a properly poured guinness ! perfect lacing down the whole glass .
a : looks like a plain lager , complete with rapidly-fading head . nice bit of lacing , though .
a : black with light tan head . there is carbonation , which is a big deal coming from la .
a : dark clear mahogany with a frothy lively off white head . excellent lacing as head slowly dies .
appearance : pours a transparent golden orange color with a two inch ivory head . lots and lots of spongy lace that sticks to the sides of the glass . head retention is incredible .

appearance : pours with a wonderful golden color and a massive , briliant-white head . the head is very rocky and produces magnificent lace . plus , there is a giant stream of bubbles . all-in-all , a picture perfect beer .
appearance : nice cloudy golden color with a robust head on it . there was almost too much sediment which quickly settled at the bottom .

appearance : dark amber body with a large dirty-white head on the pour , this sadly all too quickly disappeared and finished up as a small blob of froth floating like an island on top of a lifeless brown pond . smattered lacing is few and far between , with some weak looking patches here and there .
a : deep golden , turning to medium brown body . little to no head , though its more carbonation than i expected for the age of this bottle . doesnt look likemuch but i didnt buy it to look at it .

appearance : pale golden yellow with a thin weak white lace , if it was not for the quick champagne like carbonation forcing bubble to the top there would be no head at all . yeast is quite compact and stayed on the bottom while pouring to leave a nearly clear beer .
a : poured a nice straw yellow color with light carbonation and a nice white little cap
a : pours a murky brown with no head , yeasty look .
appearance : a crisp , clear , golden yellow pour . this stuff wont stop foaming ! ! wow .

appearance : pours a midnight ( ha , ha ) brown with a fluffy , two-finger dark tan head that moves around quite a bit and has large bubbles -- and enough movement to seem , well , alive , at least at first . lets of fine , tiny bubbles move to the top of the glass , but calms down into a fluffy , espresso , cherry tinged head . the head retention is amazing -- it 's been sitting here for at least ten minutes and the head still rises to the top of the snifter . in fact , the lowest level the head ever gets to is about half a finger , and there 's quite a bit of fluffy sticky lacing .
appearance : thick frothy head . great retention .
a : nice golden color , but a bit hazy . moderate head and retention .
a : beautiful maize pours with a fluffy white head and sparse lacing . a lot of sediment floating around amongst the bubbles on of the more active and beautiful beers

appearance : poured a orange amber with a 1.5 finger head which dissipated quickly but a nice lace hung around . the beer was quite cloudy due to some yeast coming out during the pour into a piraat tulip glass .
a : black body with a nie silky tan head , sith fair retention , reduces to a lacing ring aroud the glass

appearance : we 're off to a good start . an aggressive pour yielded an impressive 1 1/2 fingers of creamy mocha colored head . the beer itself was jet black with minimal garnet hued edges when held to the light .
a : pours a dull , cloudy yellow with a short white head . the foam does not linger long .
appearance : you 'd think this beer was once a little more reddish than it is , now it 's sort of an off-brown murky color . for a high octane beer , the head was pretty solid .
appearance : its a light gold color and with sediment

a : a relatively aggressive pour resulted in a finger thick tan head that had decent retention before finally becoming just a slight covering of bubbles after quite a few minutes . there was decent lacing . the beer is opaque and only shows the slightest tint of red when held up to the light .

a : it would be a stretch to call it a `` light straw color '' . most likely it was the dirty glass that tinted it to the shade of urine normally reserved for those rare moments when you know you 've had too much to drink 'cause your pissing nearly clear .
a : pours a blood-vomit color , to steal a phrase . murky light rose color with a short-lived off-white head . it looks like a lambic , but knowing what is to come , i ca n't give it a lambic pass .
a : rusty reddish body , minimal head barely covers the surface then dissipates .
a : orange and hazy with a small white head ( bad pour by the bartender ) either way the head had very little retention and no lacing .

a : two finger pathetic , thin abysmal head , devoid of cream and of laughable fourteen second retention . clear dark yellow off-urine colour . this is looking like a cooking beer already . sm : a bit like creamed urine . i try not to laugh in front my german friend , but she joins in when she sees what i 'm drinking .
appearance : pours a cloudy light amber color with a prodigious head that few but fantme can produce ; sheets of lacing all over the place
a : dark brown/black with three-finger , tan , rocky head that lasted several minutes . good lacing .
a : pours a dark reddish brown color . a small white cap of foam forms , and leaves hardly any lace .

a : pours a clear ruddy/pink hued copper body that momentarily develops a finger of off-white head . there is a small collar after collapse , with no lacing . swirling pulls many bubbles out of suspension and produces a pretty decent ( but again , short-lived ) head . quite nice for the style .
a : extremely deep mahogany color with nice lacy head
appearance : hazy deep honey color . 1/2 '' creamy head that did n't last long . lots of tiny rising bubbles and pretty lacing

appearance : pours a transparent copper orange color with tons of carbonation . the head is off white and tops 2.5 '' with lots of great retention . tons and tons of coating , spongy lace cling to the glass . a real beauty of an ipa . a ramp of foam stays on the surface of the beer and then attaches itself to the side of the glass .

a : pours a burnt ruby red with 1 finger of white head that dissipates quickly . excellent clarity and moderate carbonation . there 's a fluffy layer of webbed lacing . n : apple cinnamon , huge clean caramel malts , banana , booze , hints of clove and perhaps some coriander .
a : light to dark brown . a small fizzy head . lightly laced .

a : pours a deep dark shade of brown , *nearly* completely black , with a thick frothy 2+ finger light brown head that sits nicely on top . it leaves great lacing on my glass as i work through the bottle . 5.0 .
appearance : pours a lightly hazed , light yellow body with a large , airy , white head that 's fairly persistent .
a : amber ; minimal head , no retention or lace .
appearance : golden brownish with a two-finger creamy head . no transparency ; totally cloudy . one of the finest-looking beers i 've ever set eyes to .
a : orange/copper with a little haziness . nice looking white head does not stick around long . thin lace does .
a : dark black , no head .
a : i like it . bronzed , translucent amber with a rolling `` tight 'n ' tiny '' bubbles foamy head that dwindles to the likes of algae .
appearance : dark brown brew with a frothy tan head that dissipates quickly .
a : pours a light brown , some light passage , minimal head , no lacing
a : a clear , bright reddish amber with vivacious carbonation . head is vigilant and leaves a nice lacing behind . as good as you are gon na get looks-wise .

appearance : light brown pour with lots of foam coming out of the bottle . makes an impossibly huge , thinner looking , fluffy , off-white head that sticks around forever . could only pour half the bottle into my snifter , as the head was so insane . color is a murky brown with very little carbonation evident . head slowly fades unevenly and bumpy , leaving some thin , chunky lacing down the glass . a thick film lingers and lots of chunky , gobs of foam . this does n't look like a stout . maybe an out of control strong dark ale .
a : pours dark brown , near black , with minimal head that quickly reduces to an uneven ring of bubbles . light lacing .
a : bottle poured into duralex tumbler . slightly cloudy reddish amber . 1/4 '' head dissipates quickly .
appearance : very dull amber brown color . the clarity is poor with a lot of haze . a small white tan head barely forms and fades very quickly .

appearance : poured into a duvel sniffter ; beautiful dark blackish red with just a trace of light sneaking through . the head is a glorious eggshell white so dense it looks like the matting on on a picture . excellent retention with full lacing as its enjoyed .
a : yellow and gold hues , exceptionally clear . almost non-existent lacing and minimal head .
a : pours a one finger head of no cream , decent thickness , and okay retention . colour is a clear textbook gold . sm : caramel , toasted malt , and light hops . a light aroma .
a : so damn pink . thin head , some bubbles . the rich pinkness is enchantingly interesting .
a : light yellow color and good carbonation . beautiful head formation with excellent retention and good lacing .
a : pours a hazy yellow color with huge foamy white head . slight lacing down the glass

appearance : this looked dissapointing . there was a very small head when served and it left almost no lace at all . i 'll give the brewer the benifit of the doubt on the head as it was poured almost to the top of the pint glass so there was n't much room for a head . the color was a darker brownish amber . it was very clear .

a : the most disgusting beer i 've ever set eyes upon ... immediately off the pour , the body was a light , sunny yellow , but as the head stabilized , a thick column of sediment that reminded me of whale sperm in an ocean began to very slowly lurch down toward the bottom of the glass ... and , i was using a weizen glass , so it was truly horrifying to behold . many large chunks settled to the bottom , and some lighter chunks stayed suspended in the body , which eventually settled on a rich tequila sunrise orange . head was of the persistent , off white , three finger variety .
a : hazy pale yellow with a small white head that fades quickly . color is a little dim .
a : pours golden , clear , with a thick fluffy white head that thins out considerably , but leaves a nice ring lace behind . carbonation is visible ; this beer looks great .
appearance : wow . pitch black . thick head that threatens to escape my snifter that holds a 22 with ease . thick light brown rocky head that lasts and lasts .
a : pours a translucent brown color , slight head , and lacing . looks a little wattery/thin for a porter

appearance : extremely cloudy orangish-yellow with tiny bits of stuff floating around . it needs to be poured slowly because of the crazy foaming white head . the head dissipates fairly rapidly , with decent lacing .

a : looked like upchuck with tons of particles floating in the glass . it grosses me out to look at it . i 'd probably have rather taken this right out of the neat bottle in which it came . points given back for a beautiful foam that seemed to want to launch right out of the bottle .
a : hazy pear in color , white head that dissipates very quickly .
a : pours a one finger head of fair cream , good thickness , and decent retention . clear ruby colour . sm : amber hops , yeast , light cherry esters , and a hint of ammonia . moderate in strength .
a : pale gold ... . pretty thick on the bubbles . not very impressed at all

appearance : first off , this beer 's got some pretty cool artwork featuring an old train on the bottle ( not to mention , the name is pretty cool ... ) . a somewhat dark , murky , orange liquid poured into the glass . has a beige-colored head that does n't last too long . however , with the relatively high alcohol percentage , i ca n't really fault the beer too much for having a quickly decaying head . carbonation seems weak ; tiny bubbles , and very few of them at that ; maybe more of it would have improved head retention a bit . this one just looked so ... dead . ca n't say i 'm all that impressed so far .
a : pours a pitch black with a dark brown head . light lacing .
a : latitude 48 pours a deep amber color , very clear with 2-3 fingers of off-white head . leaves lots of thick lacing on the glass and fairly thick film . great looking beer .
a : pours a clear golden amber with a small head made up of big bubbles which turn into a thin silky cap .
a : very pale straw yellow . typical adjunct lager look but it did yield quite a nice head . follows the style just a little too closely to the big boys .
appearance : pale gold ; quick dissipating head .

appearance : pours with just over 2 fingers of off white head . this settles slowly to a still substantial cap pf foam , leaving behind thick , complete lacing coverage . the beer itself is a light copper with a the slightest of haze and moderate activity . absolutely beautiful .
a : pours brown with a small head that fades quickly , no lacing . there are very large chunks floating throughout .

appearance : rich dark gold beer , pours clear at first , but towards the bottom of the bottle there is a lot of sediment in suspension . this is an unfiltered beer so i guess that 's to be expected , but damn . on the upside , this beer produces a creamy , fluffy stark white head with good retention .
appearance : clear orange in color with some golden highlights . one inch head lasts a while and some thick lace paints the glass .
a : pitch black . almost non-existant lace .

a : super hazy ruby-orange . visible carbonation . off-white head starts promising but dips down to more of a rim . a fair amount of sediment dumped into the glass as well . i understand it is a bottle-conditioned beer , but this seems a bit excessive .
appearance : the pour into my snifter creates an off white 1 '' head composed of big bubbles . the beer is a dark burnished copper color .
a : great appearance of a deep amber/red as anticipated and expected of an amber ale .
a : sticky , two-finger , foamy white head . clear , yellow - light amber pour . lace sticks to the glass beautifully .
a : pale yellow -- like lemonade ! cloudy , which i expect from a wheat ale . the head was short-lived , and no lacing .
appearance : hazy golden yellow with a small white head .
appearance : pours a very light yellow color with a short 1/4 '' white head that breaks apart immediately . no lime in the pint glass .
a : pours a tar black with a substantial small-bubbled tan head . head slowly fades leaving a bit of lacing .
a : standard pour yields a .5 finger semi-coarse head with great retention . beer is a clear orange-peach . lacing is stringy with great stick . great on all fronts .

a : pours a cloudy dark brown , nearly black color . a fairly aggressive pour gave a maximum head of about 1/4 a finger , which quickly receded . i 'm sure the abv did n't help with the head formation , but i 've seen other kuhnhenn brews form very nice heads despite super high abvs . 5.0
a : well , it 's certainly a dark beer . very thin amount of head with the pour . pretty average looking for a imperial stout
appearance : i poured some out just so i could see what it looked like . into the plastic cup it went . very , very pale yellow . some carbonation , but virtually no head . about what i expected .
appearance : dark orange hue , almost no head , moderate lacing , carbonation briefly collected on the glass and disappeared shortly after i began to drink .
appearance : for a macro , the head looks pretty okay . still evaporates fast as hell . looks like apple juice .

a : dark mahogany . the color reminds me of a well worn in dark red cigar chair . a 3 finger head that is a mixture of large and small bubbles and is light tan in color . the head settles quickly to a lacing that continues to lace as this beer disappears from my glass .
a : pours a deep black with no visible light . 1 1/2 fingers of mocha colored head , tight , with good retention . good lacing throughout .

a : dark brown and quite red on the edges ( even towards the middle ) ; pretty clear even on the brown sections . smaller off white bubbly head that dissipates quickly . very little lace . not a great porter look . 2/5
appearance : beautiful . golden . very thick lacing in my plastic cup .
a : pours a deep honey color with a small white head that quickly vanished into nothing . after a couple minutes there where zero bubbles to speak of and it looked like a glass of juice . no lace .

a : this is undoubtedly a perfect looking beer . pours a gold/orange color with a little bit of haze . white , thick , tasty head that lasts for most of the beer . great looking lacing . this beer is at the peak of apas appearancewise .
a : pours a hazy mahogany brown color . a two finger beige head forms that leaves rings of patchy lace .
appearance : clear burnt orange . quickly dissipating head leaving a nice 1cm froth .
a : beautiful mahogany color . clear . looks varnished . three fingers on sticky , light tan head with decent retention and a good amount of lacing . a picture perfect beer .
appearance : pale gold ( exactly like champagne ) , frothy white foam that dissipates to a thin layer of spittle , lots of rising bubbles
appearance : this sample has a magnificent candy-apple red color . in addition , it produces an interesting pink head with loads of lacing . this brew has a striking appearance .
appearance : a thick very dark brown with a nicely laced brown head . looks exceptional .
appearance : the pour is black with chestnut highlights . a thin light brown head does n't quite cover the body and soon fades away completely .
appearance : one beautiful beer , with a clear pale golden color and a fluffy white head that lasts forever and leaves lacing all over the place
a : a golden-amber pour , though the head was a little insignificant . about a finger tall , and a bit quick to recede to a thin sheet .

a : pours from a bottle into a pint glass with a deep caramel color , but looking through the glass , this beer settles into a dark , slightly reddish color , almost like a cola . a head is present , but it is a mild tan , unremarkable , and full of larger bubbles as if you poured a budwiser , foamy not frothy .
a : a pretty bad look to its . yes , its black , as it should be , but no head at all , just a few brown bubbles ...
appearance : a clear red-brown body capped by a little less than two fingers of densely-packed cream-colored head that features terrific retention and lacing .
a : bready , fluffy head . great golden color with very vague amber hues . decent lacing .
appearance : looks like a strawberry amber color . it has a medium sized head that dissipates quickly .
a : a nice deep ruby red / dark mahogany . a tan head that disappears quickly .
a : no head whatsoever , and my glass is clean . pours an opaque dark orange/brown color . honestly , not very appetizing .
appearance : by far , the best thing about this beer . large off-white head that lasted until the last drop . pours a nice dark golden amber color .
a : clear medium amber body under a frothy pillowy ecru head that just wo n't go away , leaving thick , comprehensive lace . stunning .

a : no doubt , the lack of any head on top of this brew is hindering the strength of the aroma , but what 's there is respectable . initially , a boatload of caramel sweetness hits me upside the head along with a toasted biscuity malt . as for the hops , the pine-scented variety is the most dominant , followed by citrus in a distant second . i also get some toffee and the slightest hint of chocolate in there , too .
a : pours a hazy straw yellow with huge bubbly white head ; good head retention with spotty lacing .
a : pours dark , almost like a stout . head is disappointing at best . one finger lasted for about 30 seconds , giving way to a next-to-nothing lacing .
appearance : a nice dark orange transparent orange body with a just off white huge head . the head had great retention and large bubbles and had good lacing all over the glass .
a : this one is a clear dark copper color with orange and yellow highlights . it pours with a nice two finger white head that has decent retention .
appearance : jet black and opaque ; nice brown head with tight bubbles
appearance : pours a hazy chestnut color with a nice , rocky head that sheets lacing all over the chalice
a : dark red with a creamy fluffy head that stayed the course . the cloud of foam was like one of those simpsons marshmallow clouds .
a : pours a rather pallid gold with a very light head , looks like a macro lager .
a : a big frothy white head quickly gives way to a thin white layer of bubbles . clear copper color , average retention , no lacing .
a : a somewhat turbent beer with a very rich golden hue . very frothy head with lacing that lasted throughout the whole beer .
appearance : ultra pale yellow with a small head
a : clear amber color , huge foaming head that slowly settles to 2 fingers thickness , lots of lacing
appearance : amber , clear carbonated , medium head
appearance : admittedly did not pour out to be able to determine
a : pours a hazy dark cherry colour with little to no head . lots of bubbles floating to the top .
appearance : the beer has a very clear pale yellow coloration . any less yellow and this would be clear water . the head was about one finger high with no retention .
a : pours a clear golden copper with a finger of white head that fades into a thin ring with a little lacing
a : black color . one finger of frothy brown head with poor retention and not really any lacing . 4.5
a : pours a light amber color with slight pinkish hue . when poured from the bottle produces an ample amount of fluffy head
a : pours a cloudy dark orange , very light head , no lace , poor appearance for a wheat beer .
appearance : pours an opaque black body with a tiny , tiny beige head that , regardless of being so tiny , was rather short-lived .

a : a vigorous pour from on high results in a midnight-black body supporting two and a half inches of dense brown foam . impressive retention and thick sheets of lacing . spot on for the style , there 's really nothing to mark off for here . awesome looking brew .
a : very clear pale straw in color with a white head .
appearance : 5 |

a : this is one black stout ! this is blacker than satan 's armpit . slight carbonation ( i was worried by the previous talk of flatness ) but it was there . not much head to speak of , just a slight brown ring .
a : pours very very light yellow , good finger and a 1/2 of white head that settles to nothing ... no lacing at all ... looks very flat , no carbonation at all .
a : medium golden amber . very nice head formation and retention . looks beautiful in the glass .
appearance : a dark orange with what appear to be floaties suspended in the beer . a nice white one finger head that settles after a good length of time and leaves nice spiderweb sticky lacing .
a : pours a fire-y plum flesh amber , nearly opaque . 1 1/2 fingers of off white creamy heads forms and holds forever . lots of lacing .
appearance : pours caramel in color with a small white head that sticks around for a while and leaves some lace .
appearance : crystal-clear with thin white head that recedes quickly .
a : the pour is clear and very pale yellow with very little head . they serve it with a lemon wedge . i declined to make use of it .
a : thin head , quarter or half a finger at most . very fizzy , raised a head then it dissipated very quickly . color is a deep gold , slightly hazy .

a : pours an amber in color that has a nice amount of copper hues to it . held to the light , more of that copper and some reds come out . the body is pretty clear , for some reason i was expecting a little more haze or darkness to the body . a light carbonation is moving around in the body . the pour yielded about half a finger of off white , cream colored head . it does n't stick around too long and falls to a thin top cap that leaves minute amounts of spotty lacing . meh .

a : this has to be the pretties beer of all time ... .pitch black beer with a fingers worth of off white creamy head . the beautiful cascade as it 's being poured is wonderful to watch ... the head settles to a 1/2 a finger layer and stays there ... lacing , hell the foam sticks to the sides of the glass all the way down .
a : copper , good head
appearance : this beer pours a beautiful translucent amber color with great lacing .
a : muddy-brown , hint of tan head , touch of lace .
a : a pale copper color with a dirty , off-white , one-finger head . lots of lace as the head drops .
appearance : a deep golden amber with little or know head , however , there was some lacing which was a pleasant surprise
appearance : extraordinary appearance with a cloudy tea brown body and a rocky beige head ; great retention and lacing

a : the pour is pretty dark and dense for a porter , in my opinion ( maybe i just have n't had that many primos ) . the single-finger head dies down relatively quickly , leaving a nice , thin vanilla top-coating , which rests upon the chocolate bottom like a somewhat flat guinness . some subtle lacing that sticks well to the glass .
a : straw yellow with a fluffy white head and gobs of lacing . virtual perfection .
appearance : medium amber with neither head nor lacing
appearance : the pour creates a 1 '' white head that never really falls back into the beer . some moderate lacing is left behind . the beer is a rich golden color .

a : 1 1/2 fingers of that creamy , grey beige head forms more quickly than other nitro dry irish stouts i 've had . the body is dark brown with red and orange edges . good retention and lacing . and this beer actually fills up my whole pint glass !
a : golden color with a thick head

a : the beer is a cloudy orange-brown color with a big foamy off-white head that fades slowly and leaves a thick lace on the glass . the pour also creates a nice guiness-like cascade of carbonation , which i havent seen too often in this style .
a : to be expected
appearance : does n't pour pale really but more of a copper color with a generous 3 finger off-white head that sticks around for awhile and leaves some lacing . looks more like an ipa that an apa .
appearance : nothing special . pale yellow color with white , quickly disappearing head . if you drink it straight out of the bottle though , it does n't matter .

a : pours a lovely crystal clear honey gold with three fingers of dense white head . the head retains well all the way down the glass , accompanied by a constant torrent of bubbles and leaving a good lacing . beautiful .
appearance : pours red , with a thick , slowly leaving off-white head that leaves behind lots of lace .

a : tangerine color to it . about an inch head on top . good head retention . this beer looks very lively with tons of bubbles rising to the top of the glass . this beer really has a great appearance .
a : looks just like the picture , pours very nice , lacing is good and is retained throughout the drink . beautiful color , very impressed , like looking at it a lot .

a : the head is ridiculous and a bit obnoxious here . several pours to get it out and got annoying to wait for it . hazy orange with loads of sediment , not the most attractive color either . obviously , there was serious lacing . n : far more sweetness than i was thinking i would get , didnt really catch the abundance of ibus it is listed as having .

a : i struggle to pull the plug on this one . it reminds me of decorking a wine bottle ; i say this because it has so little carbonation evident on the corking , that there ca n't be any carb . so i pour it , and here we are : flat as kansas . dark brown . no lacing . hazy even at the edges .
appearance : pours a cloudy orange color with a spotty head .
a : nice shade of sunset red-orange with a thick fleece of white head .
appearance : pours a dark orange color with a wispy head that disappears in seconds .

a : pours a dark , translucent , brown with lots of rising carbonation bubbles . it has a 1 1/2 finger , off-white head with good retention and leaves a decent lace . if only the rest of the beer could live up to its somewhat promising appearance ...
a : deep amber/mahogany , minimal head . nice lacing and plenty of carbonation bubbles oozing from her .
a : murky orangish color . not really any head going on and thus no lacing . 4.0

a : pours a very dark brown , almost black with a massive 2.5 finger tan/brown colored head . this slowly dissipated to about one finger of foam that lasted for the rest of the time drinking . lacing covers the entire glass . picture perfect .
a : the beer is a deep black color , with a short dense beige head that fades very slowly and leaves a thick lace on the glass .
a : i 'm glad that the bar-tender gave me this caveat : do n't let its appearance fool you . it looked disturbing like a light beer , with a whole lot of hazified yeast action going on .
a : pours black with ruby highlights , no real head to speak of . even with a hard pour .
a : looked exactly like tomato soup ... honestly it looked better after i threw it into the intracoastal ... even then , in brown ocean water mind you , it left a red trail
appearance : very thing looking , clear and bubbly . pale orange in color with very fast dissipating head .
a : very hazy , medium golden color with over one finger of diminishing white foam head . no lacing remains on the glass . specks of rusty brown sediment are visible at the bottom of the glass .
a : pours a surprisingly dark amber/mahogany color with about a finger and a half of white head , which recedes into a thin cap with a little lacing .
appearance : nice easy dark brown pour . started with a finger plus coffee-and-cream head that faded to half that and light tan . looks black in the glass , with dark ruby showing through .
a : hazy gold with massive white bright foamy head . retention superb . carbonation brisk and beautiful . gorgeous beer .

appearance : poured with a wonderfully massive , foamy three-finger head . as a drink it , i 'm notcing some nice cling ... which is pleasant to the eye and almost mandatory for an ipa . the beer is a burnt orange/copper . looking closer , you may notice that this is a damn murkey beer . i 'm gon na say this is bottle conditioned .
a : the usual color of a porter ...
a : nice crystal clear amber/red body . not much head , but old ales do n't typically have that much .
a : hazy as hell , golden with average white head . copious lacing though . surprisingly beautiful .
a : this beer is golden with a very small white head . no lacings .
appearance : pours a brilliant red-brown with a quarter inch of tan head that slowly settles .
appearance : very clear with a straw colour . the head is white , moderately low , frothy and not very persistent .
a : pours a clear copper-orange with a finger of white head that quickly vanishes into a thin ring with no lacing .
appearance : small brown head on top of a black body . kind of disappointed by how small the head was , but i 'll get over it .
a : brown , somewhat lifeless with a short lived head .
a : black with little head production . there was a substantial amount of rust around cap ( probably from the tin wrapper on the top ) . no lace . near mirror surface .
a : hazy beige to orange color with huge , bubbled and persistent white head which does n't desappears . many lacings left ( reminds the duvel 's famous foam )
a : clear brown color , 2 finger light tan head
a : pretty basic golden yellow . no head . no real lacing . meh .

a : zero head , zero implication of a head , no carbonation at all , even when held to light . beer was poured to the lip of the brim . looks like blackberry juice . this is not beer . from appearance alone , something is obviously off about the tap setup , why did they serve this to me ?

a : nice yellowish orange color . super hazy . you can see the yeast swimming around , looks almost like glitter . big fluffy , like a cloud , 3 finger head . perfect white , with a couple light tan spots where the yeast came out of the bottom of the bottle . great lacing and the head might never go away .

a : poured with a little over a finger of head . nice and dense , tan . deep brown with reddish casts . head completely dies after a while . no lacing at all . starts making me think i 'm drinking a hearty tea .

a : possibly the clearest ipa i have seen ! absolutely see-through amber , possibly from the 90 minute boil or just the knockdown times in the fermenter that really give this beer a sexy look . good head , mild lacing .
a : dark , dark brown . not quite black . minimal head , but the beer legs ( lacing ) is nice .

a : pours an entirely clear golden amber ; mountainous , foamy white head tops off the glass , with a constant stream of bubbles flowing up through the beer for the entirety of its time spent with me . very impressive to look at , and one of the most visually appealing beers i 've seen .
a : light golden-yellow color , with a huge , billowy head , with excellent retention and lacing . actively visible carbonation gives it something of a nice animation .

a : pours with a 1 finger high , creamy light-brown head that becomes fizzy and diminishes fairly quickly . the film that is left disappears eventually but the bubbles continue to actively float through the glass . the body is 95 % clear and a cross between amber and orange in color . no lacing . very illuminating , capturing the light from my lamp and becoming , sort of , it 's own new light source .
appearance : very pale yellow with a quickly dissapearing white head . no lacing .
appearance : poured a deep amber , did n't look really brown .
a : poured from a bottle to a pint glass . had a brownish color with ruby tints . mostly clear in consistency . there was a half inch of off white , foamy head . below average lacing .
a : very clear , bright gold color . poured a fast-rising two inch white head that fell quickly . very little lacing . beer continued to decant throughout - it was nice to look at .
appearance : bright golden orange with a medium sized white head that quickly fades away . not much lacing .
a : pours a murky brown , with a really light off-white head , fair retention , not a great look for a belgian .

appearance : it has a dark opaque color with a supper aggressive light brown bubbling action that takes a minute to settle out . ( very cool ! ) after it settles it forms a thick , supper creamy , tan head . its head is stiff , has great retention time and leaves light tan rings of lace on the glass .
appearance : bright yellow , light in color . although the 1 finger head went away quickly , it leaves a decent lining on the side of the glass . average carbonation .
appearance : black , with a thick vanilla-colored head . light does not pass through easily , and there is little apparent carbonation , aside from the head .

a : cloudy yellow-orange , with a thick white creamy head that is n't going anywhere . this baby 's stickin ' around 'til the end of the glass . beautiful thick lacing adds to a gorgeous beer experience .

a : pours a really nice dark brown that has some really beautiful amber hues when held to the light . got a good finger of creamy white head that had some decent retention as it slowly fell to a thin , then thinner , ring . left some nice sheeting in the lacing throughout . looks good . please do n't suck .
a : pours an opaque , dull orange color with lots of suspended sediment . a small head quickly bubbles away .

a : the appearance of this beer is great ... a rich golden amber , topped with a head that carries over some of those golden hues . the head forms into a tulip pretty much picture-perfect , at least from the pour i got from the bottle . it holds on for a while , never completely disappearing , all the while leaving behind some nice sticky lace patterns all over the glass .
appearance : hard to judge this , as i was drinking it from the can . the logo was n't very interesting ?
a : looks beautiful . nice and golden with a sudsy , rich head . the beer would keep on bubbling up the glass for days if left sitting , it 's quite the sight .
appearance : slight hazy orange brown color . great head from the pour - thick and foamy . dissipated quickly .
a : pour a standard yellow lager with an impressive rocky white head , long-lasting , sporadic lace .

appearance : poured into a pint glass from the1 pint 0.9 fl . oz . bottle with a notched best by date of oct. '05 . the beer is black , no other way to say it . i held it to the light , nothing really gets through . there is also a nice thick light brown head , about 1 1/2 inches that fell to , well , a nice 1/4 inch thick light brown head as the beer was consumed . good thick lacing to the end .
a : the pour is not a very pretty one . intensely turbid and cloudy yellow/orange color with a soapy white head .

appearance : straight pour into a pint glass . the color is an opaque black ; no light passed through when i held it to my lamp . three fingers of dense , cappuccino-tan head developed and dissipated to leave a dense lacing ( much like a cappuccino ) and ring around the edge .
a : pours brown with a medium large light tan-colored creamy head . slow dissipation leaves some lacings .
a : deep , clear rubeous copper body that leaves tremendous legs . for an intentionally flat , spirituous beer , i couldnt imagine it being any prettier .

a : pours a very dark mahogany brown with a great 2 finger chocolate milk colored thick frothy head . the carbonation looks great , and the head retention is awesome as its very slow to fade . lacing is great too , forming amazing patterns on the glass and not leaving .

appearance : very dark brown , with ruby highlights when held to light . in ambient light , looks black . very dense , thick , whipped-looking head that forms a solid cap . great lacing after every sip . really nice looking beer .
a : pours gold with a nice full white head , good lace .
a : dark golden amber with lots of rising big bubbles and just a hint of haze . big , rocky , light-ecru head with good retention and super lacing .
appearance : very attractive clear , copper similar to a bass pale ale . very little head with some lacing .
a : hazy , dark gold . fizzy , not much head .
appearance : somewhere btw coer , pink , red , and orange lies the color of the body ! murky body with little to no head or lacing .
a : very clear golden with a good creamy white head and lacing .
a : pale yellow with minimal head that leaves no lacing .

appearance : deep brown colour , almost murky looking . very pleasing to the eye . has reddish tint that gives it a creamy sort of appeal . lots of bubbles moving about and what a head ! big foamy , fluffy head that lasted all the way down and a thick , chunky lacing to boot . what a great looking beer .
a : pours a dark amber color with an off white , cream colored head . looks fantastic . good retention and lacing all over the glass .

appearance : deep rich golden amber colour . reasonable head which dissipates at a reasonable rate as the head thickens . nice moderate carbonisation . good thin lacing.cant kock the appearance of this brew at all .
appearance : bright clear orange , almost reddish . medium dense , medium thicnk light-beige head leaves huge , thick , almost solid lacing . head stands up . very solid appearance .
appearance : very clear yellow , some carbonation bubbles and a very weak head . no lacing .
appearance : no need to pour this bad boy . i know this beer well !
appearance : dark amber color with a good head and substantial lacing .

a : pours a clear straw yellow , with a laughably pathetic thin disgusting head that goes from two fingers to one in ten seconds and completely disappears to nothing in twenty five seconds . at least i do n't have to taste that part of the beer . sm : smells of straw with maybe a bit of horse urine for flavouring ( that extra touch from the brewmaster - eau de cheval , anyone ? )
a : deep gold . a 2 finger off white colored head with a hint of lacing .
a : dark amber color , single width head . the head is off white and leaves a little bit of lacing behind .
a : awesome . very dark with an awesome dark brown head about an inch thick that quickly dissipates to a ring around the top of the glass .
a : dark brown/black with plenty of tan head ; sticky lace .
a : a tea brown , hazy and full . head is quick and rather fizzy . it does n't have much retention , taking a few moments to all but disappear .
a : dark with light barely visible around the edges when backlit . very good head retention with lots of lace .

a : this beer was poured from the 11.2oz bottle into a standard pint glass , in direct violation of the instructions on the label . the body is remarkably opaque but not terribly dark . the structure of the head is unique . it 's super yeast and looks like the foam that forms on the top of baguette batter . this is obviously a gift from the beer gods .
a : black-brown body , fluffy 2-finger khaki head with good retention . looks tasty .
appearance : deep red ... the color of rust and kinda hazy . mine poured very litte foam and what little was there dissipated immediately .
a : clear , straw gold color . poured a coarse one finger head with fair retention . decanted continually . lacing sheeted down the glass .
appearance : very pale golden color with a tight , fizzy head that dissipates quickly and leaves some spotty lacing .

appearance : pours a clear copper with a thick , creamy , off-white head that 's fed by a massive quantity of bubbles . retention is excellent , the head slowly fades to a persistent quarter-inch layer leaving lace that clings to the glass in thick patches . i ca n't think of a single thing wrong with the way this beer looks .
a : well lets just start off as it looks almost like water . add a bit of yellow dye into the `` water '' looking beer and you have now ... busch light .
a : pours a dark , opaque brown with a fluffy , long-lived tan head . no lacing or curtains , but it 's fairly lively for an imperial stout .
appearance : no head , looked very flat . unappealing yellow color that was n't really golden or amber .
appearance : a beautiful clear orange-amber in color with a towering tan head that lasted a long time and left exceptional lacing on glass .

appearance : dark brown body , with little to no head when it settles . finishes looking like a flat lifeless porter . the head is a thin light brown colored halo which struggles to survive . staid rather depressing looks .
appearance : pours very black , though not light-blockingly black like other dark beers . holding it up to the light reveals a lot of shades of very dark red . head is very small with no lacing .
appearance : first saw a very thick head that dissolved quickly before my eyes . a yellowish-golden color was all that was left .
a : pours a bright clear golden straw color . does not provide much a foam head . there is no lacing .
a : pours a dark ruby red color . a small tan forms , but recedes in an instant . no lace .

appearance : dark brown with reddish hues , not as dark as i was expecting , with virtually zero head even with a vigorous pour . the only head produced formed a thin ring around the side of the glass .
a : standard golden beer , very translucent with a very weak head but very effervescent .

a : a small bright head practically fizzes out before it can even sustain itself . a slender white ring of tiny bubbles remains as the collar . the body is a medium dark yet faded plum color and it is 100 % opaque . minimal lacing .
a : this was pretty far short of black , more of a dark , reddish brown color . it poured with a thick , craggy , and super-sticky head .
a : small , toasty brown head with limited staying power . pours ink black .
appearance : deep , clear gold with a pillowy , pure white head . there 's a beautiful stillness without bubbles to this beer when left to rest . there 's good lacing and retention .
a : almost black with a small thick beige head that leaves a lot of lacings . looks good .
appearance : amazing head that i have to wait to subside some before i am even able to pour the rest of the beer , even then the head does not want to diminish . hazy yellow .
a : pours a dark dark black with just a hint of a reddish hint . seriously dark , like ca n't see a flashlight through it dark . scant head with zero lacing .
appearance : light brown , clear . enormous head with medium-high lacing , and good carbonation .
appearance : a brownish murkyness and greying head .
a : pours a beautiful copper color , nice mellow lacing .
a : pours a very thick motor oil pint . produces a light brown lasting frothy head , with bubbles . looks like a thick shake , mmm ca n't wait !

appearance : this is a marzen ? pours a deceptively light straw yellow with a short , foamy white head , looking just like an american lager . completely clear with lots of co2 bubbles and very little lacing on the glass .
a : clear cider brown with a fast fading finger or so of off white head . no lace or cap .
a : hazy yellow-orange with one-finger head that dissipated quickly and did n't leave much lace to speak of
appearance : beautiful golden color

a : when i initially poured this , it was a very light blond beer similar to a belgian whitbier . it frothed up immediately with a big pillowy 2 '' head as thick as mashed potatoes . lacing is tenacious with all day long cling . it looks beautiful .

appearance : dark force pours close to pitch black in the glass with a towering expresso head . retention is awesome , and lacing is fine and pretty abundant . it looks pretty thick on the pour , but not the thickest i have seen . still , it does look great .

appearance : ragnarok takes on a chocolate black color with a nice thick coffee-colored head . the cap is full and creamy , displaying exemplary retention and leaving a ton of lace . three floyds knows how to make their beers look appealing .
a : copper with a pale head and great lacing . not much more to ask for here .
a : pours a dark orange , darker than i expected for sure , perhaps we are looking at a belgian amber . medium white head , no lace .
a : pours black with barely any head that completely vanishes with no lacing .

a : pours black with some reddening at the bottom and sides of the glass . the khaki-colored head was creamy and about a finger thick , but evaporated almost instantly and left not a single speck of lace behind .
a : this beer has a towering white head and excellent retention , and lacing . the beer 's hue is pale straw yellow , as expected . lots of bubbles rising to the top insure the healthy retention .

a : pours a two finger head of bad thickness , no cream , and bad retention . colour is a semitransparent yellow . sm : light cream , full barley , a handful of hops , and a light grainy wheat touch .

a : the first thing i noticed was the thick cream and toffee colored head that was then accompanied by ample amounts of lacing after a few sips . the body on the other hand was pretty much standard , consisting of black/brown hues for the most part .
appearance : no head . looks like orange soda . didnt ' look too appetizing

a : this beer has a slightly hazy straw/amber colored body with a nice white head . i checked the bjcp and it should n't have be cloudy unless it 's dry hopped which i do n't think it is , so that 's a negative .
a : lives up to its name . very dark , almost black until held up to light . backlighting reveals very clear , deep red . very thin tan head dissipates to a ring almost immediately .
appearance : gorgeous reddish-copper ale with creamy eggshell-colored head . head is rocky , has nice retention , and leaves great web-like lacing all the way down .
a : light golden in color , very clear . almost no head that quickly fades leaving next to no head and no film .
a : deep amber color . moderate carbonation . offwhite head starts out strong , but dissolves to small whisps fairly fast . left no lace .
a : pours a clear golden body with three fingers of white fluffy head . head retention is great and leaves full lacing .
appearance : pale gold , not very much head , but good retention .
a : it is black , pitch black . head is a creamy , milk chocolate , brown .
appearance : very nice ligth yellow body that bubbles keep bubbling up and also a nice 3 finger head
appearance : dark brown body with shades of brown and red when held to light . head is tight , thin , tan , and very clean ( no lacing ) . not much head retention either . looks very slick .
a : rich copper color , brilliant clarity , light off-white head , all to style .
appearance : darkest beer i have ever seen . aptly named .
a : hazy brown body topped with a tight tan one finger head that quickly dissipates leaving only slight lacing and a thin creamy cover .
a : murky swamp water orangish brown with no head .
appearance : pours a dark orange color with very little head . whatever head is there , does n't last long .
a : redish-orange/copper , a little murky , hardly any head .
a : bright honey/gold/straw in color . rocky three finger head . effervescence comparable to a champagne . head resides to one finger after a long time leaving evidence of lacing .
a : dark honey ; it poured with a dense head that clung .
a : pours yellow with a mediocre white head , poor head retention , no lace . really pallid , it is clear .
appearance : all appear similar , the organic being a fairly clear , dark gold color , minimal head , and little lacing .
appearance : nice two finger head . laces very well . good brown color .
appearance : good two fingers of head with a great clarity to show off the reddish amber hue .
a : it pours a transluscent dark red color with some orange hues and not even a semblance of a head .
appearance : traditional colour for the best bitter -- amber-dark amber ; it is clean , with very limited carbonation and almost no beerhead ...
appearance : very dark brown almost black . amazing head builds quickly and stays around , a frothy tan beauty . lacing in extraordinary , a beer simply can not look any better .
a : pitch black with a small tan head , great lacing all the way down .
appearance : two fingers of billowing white head that dissipates really quickly . the beer is a slightly golden yellow color . there is a tiny bit of lacing , but it really looked like shit .
a : pours a clear straw body beneath half a finger of coarse , quickly-dissipating foam that leaves an oil-slickish island of tiny bubbles . minimal lace . boring , ugly fizzy yellow beer . ugh .
appearance : golden clear white quickly dissipating head leaves no lacing left on the glass .
a : hazy golden orange-red color which changes at different light angles . pours a vigorous half inch head which settles to an 1/8 '' ring with quite good lacing . this is a truly beautiful beer .
a : pours a pale , fizzy , yellow , the head dissipates quickly , after the second pour , it does n't last much past 2 seconds .

appearance : slowly dying almost cola head of shaded white on a red tinged amber glass . the head was weak and fading , but managed to hang and lace . flavor : flavor is the aroma intensified . more bubblegum , some tropical fruit , spices ( cant be more specific ) , and the light red wine flavors are more pronounced , but i am unable to give more descriptors of the many subtle flavors i encountered .
a : golden yellow , middling head ; good carb streams ; poor lacing
a : clear copper color . nice large fluffy head . lacing is amazing .

a : this beer has a gorgeous appearance . the beer pours a clear golden color with a spectacular reddish hue and white frothy red/tinged head . the appearance is easily the best part about this beer .
a : red tinged medium darkened brew . nice thick pinkish head that slowly fades to fine lacing . made me question my manhood for a moment as i looked at it .

appearance : poured a golden amber color , just very slightly cloudy . two finger white & foamy head . very good retention , with the head reducing very slowly and leaving a nice half-finger layer . lacing all the way down the glass .
a : pours a ruddy red ale with no real head production and a mirror surface . hazy clarity . no lace .

a : cloudy darkish yellow color . i guess i did n't give it enough of a twirl as there is some yeast clumps at the bottom of the glass . two fingers of frothy white head . most of it falls quickly , but the last 1/4 inch is stalwart . leaves behind only a touch of lacing . 5.0

a : a cloudy amber colored beer with a white head , practically no retention , the head disappeared just as fast as it showed up , just a few clumps of bubbles linger . a few spots of lacing as well . some more head retention would be nice .
appearance : dark brown with a slight hue of burgandy . poured to an inch of off-white luscious foamy head , with fabulous lacing that sticks to the side of glass .

appearance : sludge-tastic brown with plenty of chunks . if it did n't have that thick greyish head , it would have passed off as raw sewage . serves me right for procrastinating and ending up with the tail end of the bottle .
a : dark amber , with a thinner head than expected . didnt really look like a triple .
appearance : a really murky , hazy reddish orange brown beer , with a white head of average retention and splotchy , speckly lacing . nothing too impressive .
appearance : there is copper colored body that is nice but there is not much head or lace . a bit flat looking .

appearance : pours a gorgeous opaque midnight black with less than half a finger of mocha colored head that dissipates quickly . the reverse head looked awesome to start , but the thin ring around the glass and minimal lacing leave a bit to be desired .
appearance : very cloudy , brown with a hint of red . decently retained creamy white head . minimal lacing .
appearance : pours an attractive mahogany with ruby ( when backlit ) color with big creamy tan head and lots of lacing lining the walls of my glass .

a : no head . colour is a clear light gold . i 'm unimpressed . sm : pear , citrus ester hops , distinct ammonia ( i shit you not ) , and maybe cream . the aroma is just downright repugnant , but fortunately is only moderate in strength .
a : pours pitch black with a very thin soft dark brown head that disappeared into a thin collar leaving no lace .
a : the devil 's tooth is a slightly cloudy deep ruby red with orange and yellow highlights . it pours with a thin off-white head that does n't last long .
appearance : hazy but clear amber with a fluffy off-white head that retains well , leaving rings of lace as it dissipates .

a : pours a murky orange/copper color with a two-finger off-white rocky head . nice lacing as the head slowly fades . ( there seems to be an unfiltered trend in russia right now , so i do n't know if the murkiness has anything to do with that , or not . )

a : a moderately hard pour yielded one finger of bubbly white head that dissipated to a thin layer of about a centimeter of suds , leaving a bit of lace in its wake . the beer itself was a slightly hazy golden orange color .
a : light reddish gold hue with a very poor head and retention for a dipa
appearance : a light amber transparent body . just off white head . head is a little cakey , but not very sticky . and poor retention

a : pours a beautiful golden , copper in color with a plethora of thick , creamy white head that lasts . tons of lacing . carbonation levels are solid . exactly what you want to see from an ipa . all signs point to plenty of hops with a bit of balance from a malt backbone .
appearance : it looks more like a lager than a witiber ... in fact , it looks more like a light lager . it has a once inch head . moderate lacing . the body is a slightly hazy straw color .

appearance : only poured it out once because let 's face it , this is definitely meant to be consumed by the can . when i did pour it out it was a very pale yellow color . light passes through very easily and reveals a clean , bubbly , hay colored brew . a rocky head dissipated within seconds and fizzes into almost nothing .
a : pours a murky dark amber/red with a nice off-white head , good lacing .
appearance : hazy straw colored with an enormous head that lingers forever .
appearance : characteristically awesome ska brewing head , tall , stiff , and marshmallowy with very good retention . body is a hazed brassy yellow with plenty of carbonation .
a : pours a honey golden with red hue . less than one finger loose foam slowly dissipates , eventually leaving broken surface of the same . little visible bubbles .
a : pours a very hazy copper color with almost no head resulting from a very aggressive pour .
a : it poured light yellow in color and slightly hazy . a light to medium level of carbonation is visible and a thin layer of bubbles consistently covered the surface .
a : poured with some carbonation and head , but eventually died down into a dark and still liquid . one of those beers that exhibits no lacing , but is still able to stain the glass .
appearance : best by date printed as 6/25/13 . pours dark and thick into a snifter ; 1 finger of head forms on top and stays there forever , like vanilla icing on a dark chocolate torte .

a : unbelievable white head with easily the best retention of any beer -- i think it is actually growing bigger after pouring and sitting for a few minutes . the head 's consistency is like frosting made of bubbles . the clear golden hue after careful decanting accentuates the active carbonation .

appearance : pours a piss yellow with small but steady carbonation streams and a inch white head with solid retention and lacing that is above average for the style . i hate the color so it gets a two . ( i 'm being harsh )
appearance : poured vigorously into a duvel tulip , resulting in a clear , deep ruby/orange hue with a rich , meringue-like 3 finger head .
a : dark black colour . brilliant creamy , tan , thick head with amazing retention . this is a proper head . sm : coffee , oats , toffee , chocolate , cocoa , alcohol .
a : natty light is an amazing beverage in that it 's physical appearance is almost identical to water . some bubbles and a slight yellowish tint are the only indications as to its true form .
a : 1 '' foamy white head that fell to a collar with thin lacing everywhere . slightly hazed reddish-copper body .
a : not a very pretty beer to look at . quite turbid , brown in color , with almost no head .
appearance : clear golden yellow . at first a lage white head had formed , but quickly dissappeared . it is very effervescent , tons of little bubbles just streaming through the beer .
a : cloudy golden color , the initial pour produces a fizzy off-white head that quickly dies into ... nothing , non-existent cap and pathetic lacing .
a : really ? we 're calling this a porter ? it looks more like a drab brown ale . a decent pour yields a loose two finger head . with minor , unspectacular lacing .
appearance : pale yellow golden colour with a great clarity , the head lacks a bit and is only a thin ring of white lace .
appearance : pours jet black , darker than coca-cola . with a very dark tan almost brown inch high head , very good looking beer .
a : hazy golden color with a thick long lasting and sticky white head
appearance : the only time i ever saw it out of the can , i remember thinking it looked like a urine sample .
a : poured from the can into a pint glass . body is a golden honey color with a bright , creamy white head . the cascading-nitro thing looks good , and the head lingers for a long time .

appearance : in the bottle and then the glass this looked like a promising brew . tasty-looking clumpy yeast , a good pale ale colour , and a white head which looked slightly too puffy for the style .
a : cloudy straw color with large frothy and dense white head with great lacing and retetion .
a : tawny brown color , like fresh apple cider . chunky precipitate is slow to settle , floats slowly around the glass . thin eggshell head .
a : pours deep burgundy with an off-white small , rather fluffy head .
a : this poured a very pale , watery looking yellow with a thick white head that faded away to a thin sticky layer . larger sized bubbles .
a : pours a dark , murky red/brown into a pint glass , without much of a head , fair retention .
a : the color is what threw me off . deep purple with a lighter head .
appearance : beautiful thick honey-golden color with an ethereal , snow-white lacing . pours a 1/2 finger head from the bottle .
appearance : clear brown / burgandy in color with a 1 '' head that quickly falls to a spotty surface foam . no lacing develops .
a : bright copper body and a big rocky head that lingers leaving amazing lacing and considerable cover .

a : clear golden-yellow hue looked a bit too much like urine . poured from a 12 oz bottle into a pint glass with a tall fluffy head that dissipated quickly . little lacing . carbonation evident , but not to champagne levels .
a : muddy copper red .
appearance : pours a one finger tan head on top of a pitch black body . i love the way this beer looks !
a : nothing can top the beauty of guinness on tap . while my review is for the bottle , the jet black color with beautiful white creamy head is very eye catching .
appearance : crystal clear and bubbly pale golden-amber body . pours a rather large and bubbly white head that quickly melts into a solid finger , leaving good lacing all the way down .
a : nothing special here !
appearance : typically transparent , pale yellow color , short , off-white head .
a : very dark brown , light tan head , about 1/4 inch thick , very dense bubbles and some big sticky clumps of lacing . completely opaque , quite dark . nice .
a : beautiful ruby color with a whipped meringue head that lingers for several minutes , leaving big lacing . awesome appearance !
a : pours almost completely flat , only a thin tan film spreads across the surface of the brew . appearance of the body is thin , with a dark chestnut hue to it .
a : poured a creamy one fingered head . the color is of a mahogany like state , but sadly this appears thin giving me thought of not much flavors . this laces quite randomly , but i love it .
a : rich , dark brown , with a creamy-looking two-finger head that lingers .
a : golden yellow pour , perfectly clear . a fizzle of white head that 's gone in seconds , leaving a sleepy-looking liquid with a random scattering of lonely carbonation bubbles . no lace .
a : pours , um , canola oil yellow ? no real indication of carbonation beyond the initial and transient finger of white foam .
a : hazy , straw yellow with good head retention and thick bonewhite foam .
a : chestnut/deep amber color , really nice creamy off-white head and lacing , served in it 's own branded glassware .
a : watered down urine , with two finger head which almost immediately starts to disappear into nothing with no lacing .
appearance : looks pink coming out of the bottle but amber in the glass . fast fading head knocks off a point .

appearance : the beer has a brown reddish hue . the head is thick about 2.5 inches tall . nice foamy and with an off biege coloration . great head retention . rings of foam line my glass marking its passage .
a : fizzy yellow body under a nearly non-existent white head . no lace , no retention .
appearance : pours a dark amber ( seriously amber if held to the light ) with a tan-ish big fluffy head that leaves a bit of soapy lace around the glass .
a : hazy straw/gold color with some carbonation up the glass . head is half a finger and recedes quickly , leaving no ring and no lacing . pretty unimpressive for a belgian , imo .
a : creamy , buttery light beige with a golden hue . very pure white lacy head .

appearance : using my trusty spiegelau tulip , this brew pours a jet black with about a half finger of mocha colored head that dissipates quickly leaving a light ring around the edge of the glass . the lacing down the sides of the glass is magnificent , and when you consider the way this beer appeared to seep slowly out of the bottle and the total opaqueness in the glass ; well , it just adds to the illusion of this beer .

appearance : a crystal-clear golden-amber body with two fingers of off-white head . the head recedes slowly and leaves decent lacing . there 's just something about the tone of amber that 's very satisfying .
a : pours golden , with a thick white head which leaves a nice rim around the glass , solid lacing .

appearance : i think miller lite may have a better head than this . absolutely falls to nill immediately , along with absolutely no lacing . hardly any bubbles in the dull yellow color of the glass . how is this possible ?

a : golden , almost orange beer , with a touch of red ; almost the color of apple juice ; very clear and clean , as if looking at the world through orange-tinted glasses ; light carbonation , with bubbles floating to the top periodically ; head pours a white , frothy , .5 finger thickness that quickly dissipates ; soapy lacing minimal , but there
appearance : green bottle with a picture of a moose on the label . i poured the beer into a 16 oz . mug , and the moose mysteriously vanished . what a trip !
a : a dark brown/amber color . no lacing and a small white head the quickly disappears .
appearance : pours a murky honey orange body with a prodigious head that leaves tons of lacing
a : pours a bright straw color with a substantial white fluffy head that fades to light lace .
a : a beautiful brown color . no clarity . three finger browning head that lasted most of the glass .
a : slightly hazy , medium amber color with less than one finger of diminishing parchment-tinted foam head . no lacing remains on the glass .
