a : my glass was just a little warm , which turned the entire thing into head . now that it 's calmed down a little , and it looks good - black , nice tan head , great retention , really nice lacing .

a : pours a half finger tan head of nice cream , good thickness , and rather laughably poor 10 second retention . in fairness , this was poured into a snifter , but come on now . non-transparent black colour . sm : extremely light scent ; all me broken nose can make out is malt and caramel . not a great combination in my book .
a : dark , but not black
a : i 'm going to set the tone early and state the appearance is the best thing about this beer . the pour is nearly black with a thin ring of khaki colored foam .

a : pours a deep amber brown body . 1-1/2 '' tan head fades to a very thick film . very few tiny carbonation bubbles rise slowly from the center of the glass . leaves quite a bit of lacing on the glass , lots of long thick strings and big dots .
a : pale golden amber . slightly hazy with some nice off white head which seems to really be hanging around .
appearance : pours a golden copper color with a light in texture foamy head that leaves some nice lacing .
a : pale golden body . 1/2 '' white head that did n't last long & left little lacing .

a : pours three thirty three in the morning darkness . fluffy head was roasted caramel and pecan coloring . the lacing plastered around the glass like chocolate brown curtains in willy wonka 's living room .
appearance : golden , sparkling , thick head with staying power , actually one the prettier beers i 've seen .
a : this brew looks fantastic . it 's golden in color and slightly hazy in appearance . it has a ton of head and retains it well . good lacing .

appearance : pours a rusty copper with reddish hues . not really brown per se but still nice looking . slightly clear with a voluminous head and great retention . lacing drapes the glass as i drink it .
a : pours pitch black with a 1/2 finger tan head .
appearance : pours a slightly ruddy , light-to-medium brown with a fine , 1/8 '' , off-white head ; light-to-moderate ring lacing .

a : golden , with a slight unfiltered haze . topped with a fizzy 1/4 '' or so of white head , which drops rapidly to a half-cover of film , gathered at the edges . a few steady streams or carbonation , otherwise it 's pretty dormant . on closer inspection , there are some sand-like brown bits of , presumably , yeast resting on the bottom . a few bits of sticking lace . those dark flecks are pretty unappealing , which is why this gets a below average mark ...

appearance : darkness is what it says on the bottle , and darkness is what is inside . it pours a midnight blackcolor with just a hint of slightly off-black molasses in the very tip of the glass . darkness indeed . a creamy dark tan coffee head mellows in its creaminess , then recedes , reforming with every swirl and leaving some unexpected lace on the glass .

a : this one took a lot of crap for being flat when it came out . not the case here . it opened with a nice hiss and even gushed slightly , though slowly enough that we caught it in glasses and did n't spill a drop . it 's a clear amber body , with great , long-lasting carbonation ( streams of bubbles up the center of the glass ) . its ample 1 '' head lasts and lasts , leaving great lacing and a substantial cap the entire time .
a : deep orange color with a big white head and lacing all the way down the glass . this looks great .
appearance : honey color with no head or lace . a faint stream of bubbles .
a : pours with a stout-like latte head on top of a dark amber colored liquid . great retention and lacing
appearance : pours a nice clear copper color , with off-white head . leaves a decent amount of lacing on the glass .

a : pour a cloudy glowing tangerine color with a huge , thick , billowing , and oily looking light cream colored head that took forever and a day to fade into a rocky layer of foam while leaving a sticky network of dense lacing down the glass .
a : slightly hazy orange-amber body with only a wisp of superfine carbonation . kinda flat , but i 'm not too surprised .
a : poured a honey-gold color with good carbonation leaving bubbles and a small white cap

a : damn , this looks devilish . the body is a thick black , like a stout ; what a full color . the head is awesome , a dense , foamy three fingers of excellence . its a light tan cream that sticks around for a hell of a long time , with a strong showing of web-like lacing when it finally comes down . it even darkens to an oily dark brown when i swirl the glass . impressive .
appearance : quickly dissipating cream-colored head , dark amber color with no lace
appearance : poured with an amazing billowy white head . this thing just wo n't recede . cloudy , wheat-beer coulour . beer is bottle conditioned , with a lot of cloudy yeast on the pour .
a : caramel colored and very opaque . pour does not have lots of carb . and settles down with a light ring around the edge of the glass . light to moderate lacing . ( 3.0 )
a : super pale watered down looking . maybe a finger head with an aggressive pour that is gone within the minute . no lacing .
a : pours out a murky brown color with an almost-white head . not all that much to look at .

appearance : the cascading action is a beauty to watch . when all is said and done , the beer has a jet black body with hints of red barely penetrating through the body . thick , creamy two-finger vanilla colored head that sticks around the entire time and leave massive walls of lacing all the way down the glass . guinness is , in my opinion , the best-looking beer out there .
a : slightly hazy , medium amber color with a peripheral ring of off-white bubbles . light lacing remains on the glass .

appearance : when poured into a pilsner glass , the beer was a nice golden amber color with plenty of carbonation bubbles racing through out the glass . i got a big 2 finger white head of foam that left some lace and plenty of rings around the glass . the rings will last the entire duration of drinking . excellent !
appearance : pours a clear dark amber / almost brown color with a 1 '' head that falls quickly . no lacing develops .
a : pours a dark black with a chocolate brown head that recedes to nice lacing . a great looking pour .

appearance : this beer has a thick tan head that tends to last for the majority of the beer . the beer is black and can not be seen through . mouthfell : the beer has a very light mouth feel . the beer is almost creamy when drank .
appearance : 1 inch head , black , with a light cocoa looking head
appearance : the best thing about this beer . first of all , it has probably the coolest looking twelve pack box in the store . nice bottle . thick , light tan head . dark copper color .
appearance : this tomatoe juice- like beer is absolutely ugly ; pukish red color .
appearance : nice looks , ruddy amber body with a striking clarity . off white head is creamy , resilient and laces nicely . solid conditioning and
a : amber with a 1 finger head . not much haze here .
a : pours golden with a soft white head , fair retention .
a : pours a dark red amber . a little more than a finger of head with great retention .

appearance : bright gold glass struggles to hold a soapy white cover . head fails to hold and only gives up spots of lace . flavor : nice german yeast , noble hop toasted barley thing going , but theres that metallic edge at the finish that really calls the cops on the party . theres a vegetal note that comes out as it warms with a musty side that really doesnt help much .
appearance : nice dark reddish brown with a excellent fizzy head .
appearance : pour is dark brown ruby red . little-to-no head with zero retention and zero lacing . light carbonation flows throughout .
a : pours a clear , vibrant gold body with two inches of fluffy white foam on top . good retention and some fine , solid lacing . you ca n't really ask much more from this style appearance-wise .

a : eat your heart out budweiser ! ! ! a commercial-quality looking beer . monster 4 finger frothy white head that just spills over the top and never seems to dissipate . beer is crystal clear yellow . lacing is thick with nice legs and great cling .
appearance : it 's very clear and light golden in color . head is foamy white and about a finger deep . virtually no retention or lacing to talk about .
appearance : pale , boring , some ok carbonisation . little lacing
appearance : orangey and hazy ( got the bottom half of the sample this time ) .

a : pours a crystal clear , dark amber/rusted red color . a frothy , eggshell , two-finger head sits beautifully atop the beer . this is a pretty looking brew for sure . over three decades of brewing this recipe has certainly perfected its appearance .

a : as soon as i saw it in its tulip glass in front of me , i knew i was in for something special . dark brown transluscence with a nice pinky-width of head . holding it up to the light shows inviting bubbles . a thing of beauty .

a : viscous , with a body as thick as motor oil . the head is a dark brown , and it grows fast to a solid 3 fingers . i do n't think i 've ever seen a head this aggressive on a super-dark stout like this - but i love it . sticky lacing is everywhere , and , if you pay close enough attention , you can catch a quick glimpse of some yeasty sediment before it disappears back into the darkness . black , bold , and beautiful .
a : pours copper colored with a bit of white head that disappears quickly and leaves just a halo and lacing

a : pours a really nice dark black that lets barely any light in at all . got a good finger of head from a careful pour , so the head is very vigourous . the head is dark mocha in color and has some serious staying power . it only recedes a touch and the head remains for the entire beverage experience . lacing is spotty , leaving just a touch of soapy bubble goodness on the glass . not a bad looking beer .
appearance : 24oz can high gravity another malt liquor during our sampling of varietal malt liquors , appears pale golden white head dwindles quickly leaves specks of lacing not too apetizing .
appearance : clear and yellow , medium carbonation , pours with a head the width of a finger . 2/5
appearance : 5 |
a : pours a deep brown with a healthy , foamy head . good sustain with massive lacing .

appearance : it 's exceptionally dark . i 've heard it compared to used motor oil before and i have to agree somewhat . you ca n't shine a light through it , and if you get it on while clothes , it stains a charred brown color . if you do n't pour it correctly , it can develop a somewhat massive head .
a : this beer pours golden with a large rather thick white head that takes some time to dissipate , into nice lacings .
a : pours a nice black color with hints of redness in the light . a solid tan head dissipates quickly .
a : pours a crystal clear pale yellow with about 1/2 fingers of bright white head that disappears almost immediately .
appearance : pours a hazy , ruby-tinted brown with a thick , fluffy , beige head that fades to a thin film leaving sheets of lace on the side of the glass .
appearance : not sure what to call the color , somewhat orange with a hint of pink and a pronounced pink head .
a : i have to say this is a beautiful beer . clear , deep purple body and a small , fizzy pink head .
a : pours an opaque black color . the light brown head is small and rather short-lived . lacing is minimal . well , ok ...

a : thick , black menacing liquid with virtually no head and barely any lacing . cold carbonated coffee filtered through an offensive linemen 's jock strap ? does n't look too great , but that might not matter too much .
a : cloudy dark mahogony color . big head retention with high amount of lacing .
a : very clear , only slightly yellow in colour . pours with a ton of fluffy white head ; not much retention , but it initially leaves a nice lace .
a : a very deep dark brown with very red/copper tones around the edges

a : pours out the classic hazy glowing orange of the best hefeweizens out there , the difference here being in the size and duration of the head which remains no more than an eighth of an inch or so above the beer for the duration of this particular review .

a : pours a very lively medium-dark-gold , carbonation bubbles climbing to the top of one of the best heads i 've seen in a while . half-inch of bright white head sits on top of this bubbly looking brew , retention is near incredible , staying between 1/4-1/3 of an inch throughout drinking , leaving behind layered white lacing .
a : perfect pitch black with a thick 2 inch mocha colored head that slowly fades . exceptional !
a : gold with moderate micro rising carbonation . mild head retention , fluffy and varied carbonation .

appearance : i am a sucker for the nitro pour - the cascading reminds me of those guinness commercials from ten years ago that convinced me that drinking guinness would make me mysterious . after the cascading stops , the beer itself maintains a dark brown color with clear ruby parts with thick , creamy , nitro-induced beige foam on top .
appearance : fizzy , hazy reddish-pink with no head retention .
appearance : dark brownish red , clear , lasting off white , pillow like head .

appearance : pours a semi-cloudy brown color with orange highlights . the head is monstrous for a glass like this . 2 '' tall with varying bubble sizes . craterous surface with gobbs of stick lace . excellent retention .
a : deep yellow w/ hint of orange ... . pretty clear with a little carbonation visible , about 2 fingers worth of head that settled to a ring , with wonderful lacing ... great looking beer .
appearance : dark ; nice foamy head .
appearance : there is no more beautiful beer to look at then a stout in which the bubbles cascade down like like rows of psychedelic curtains . amen .
appearance : 1.5 fingers of pure white head . well carbonated , golden amber , no cloudiness . very nice looking beer .
a : pours pale yellow with an average white head with no lacing , average head retention , not bad for a macro lager .
a : pale yellow , with a white head , which looks good in the beginning , but dissipates rapidly .

appearance : this was a light golden beer with hints of amber within its depths . a coarse , white head rose up to two fingers and dissipated quickly . being fed from below by a heavy bead , a thin layer of foam remained to cap brew for quite sometime and even left quite a bit of lace on the glass . i was surprised to see this from a lager .
appearance : dark brown , translucent , with a circlet of lace .
a : pours an opaque black . no head to speak of , does n't matter how aggressively i empty the bottle . does not leave any lacing .
appearance : basically looks like urine . not pleasant at all . i usually try to explain the appearance a little more , but there 's no two ways around it ; this stuff just is n't very appetizing .
appearance : yellow with a green tint . no head .
appearance : crystal clear golden color , with bright white bubbly head and wattery lacing .
a : poured a clear amber with a quickly-dissipating head . bubbles rose slow to the top , almost like it was under-carbonated .
a : absolutely no head and lacing , but had a nice orange-golden appearance . pretty typical for a barleywine .
a : that is a truly beautiful beer . a deep brownish red color , like cherry or mahogany . a decent bit of slight tan head .
appearance : bright gold beer with crazy high carbonation ... snow white head forms from a vigorous pour and settles into a 1/2 inch creamy cap which leaves a bit of lace .

a : extended pour yields an unpward cascading 1 finger coarse , off-white head that collapses as quickly as it forms into a thin wisp of foam atop the brew . beer is a cloudy , near opaque , mud-water brown . i can see the clay-like sediment at the bottom . not the most appetizing beer to look at . lacing is non-existant .
appearance : opaque black or very dark brown . light tan head about 1/4 '' thick , slowly disovled . little visible carbonation . nice lacing left on glass .
a : no head ; maybe a goblet was a poor choice of vessel for this beer . amber-copper colour ; semitransparent . sm : alcohol . a delightful complex mix of hoppy

a : pours a three finger tan colour head . lovely cream . beautiful . excellent thickness . the head is perfect , delicate , and soft . the retention is incredible for the high abv ; i 'd estimate about ten minutes . colour is a solid nontransparent black . sm : light aroma of cream , pineapple and other notes me broken nose ca n't distinguish . very light in strength .
a : pours a jet black with about a finger of tan head . it quickly recedes into a thin ring with no real lacing .
a : cloudy orange , no head , no lacing . dull appearance .
a : pitch black body with three fingers of fluffy dark mocha head . rentention is good and laces amazing lacing .
a : it pours beautiful mahogany , with an off-white head that takes some time to dissipate , and the it leaves nice lacings . it looks great ! ! !
appearance : straw yellow with little carbonation .
a : dark brown with three-finger , tan , creamy head that lasted a few minutes . pretty good lacing .
a : very clear golden yellow . the half-inch head became a thin film within two minutes of pouring . sudsy ring around the collar at the half-way mark .
a : pours straw yellow from a clear bottle . non existent head with lots of carbonation .
a : pours a dark amber with an eggshell-hued head that settles quickly . carbonation and lacing are decent , but this beer throws way too much sediment for it 's style .
appearance : the body of the beer is a clear deep copper coloration . the head is white and resolved to a ring of foam rapidly .
a : tiny bit of white head , body is reddish amber in color . bits of lacing .
appearance : big creamy and thick light tan head with a well painted trail of lace all the way down to the bottom of the hazy very deep brownish red brew .
a : amber body topped with a subtle low retention head , some lacing .

appearance : poured a very transparent and clear light red/amber , basically the same as a kentucky ale . however , there was zero head ( only a collar of bubbles ) and zero lacing . occasional carbonation bubbles rise , more so when the glass is swirled for agitation . when i first poured it , i thought i got a bad batch , or maybe i just did n't pour it vigorously enough . beautiful color , though .

appearance : pours a cloudy , burnt orange color . the head is ridiculously big & frothy..almost too much ... even with a gentle pour . it does n't dissapate either . retention is incredible..probably has the longest staying power of any beer i 've sampled to date . leaves a nice lacing on the glass as well.. impressive from a so-called fruit beer .

a : i really wanted to give this beer a high appearance score because it is crystal clear but i simply ca n't . the body is pale straw but the head dissipated immediately . i realize that the color is correct for the style but it simply is n't appealing to me .

appearance : a rich golden beer , bright and clear , with very little carbonation action , and initial thick white foam that teases , but does n't follow through and cowers to a lackluster wispy white foam head .
a : beautiful appearance , almost opaque . lovely dark brown color .
appearance : it pours a fiery dark amber with a bountiful cumulus of foam .
a : 1/2 '' of khaki head on a deep ruby copper body . consistent , even layer of film/lace left on the glass as the head recedes . moderate retention . clear as a bell .

a : a beautiful dark black , that draws you into the nothingness . light can not escape . the legs are an oily , viscous , 10w-30 affair . this is a beautiful beer . if it had any carbonation , it would be a 5.0+
a : poured from a bottle to a pint glass . had a black color and a thick consistency . there was a big , creamy , tan-colored head and excellent lacing . a great looking stout .

a : pours a slightly hazy , golden body with a substantial , fluffy , and long-retaining off-white head . it clings to the sides of the glass as it falls , and it remains a decent cap on the beer for the entire time that i 'm drinking it . outstanding .
a : crystal clear medium-amber body , verging into copper , topped by 2 '' of dense , creamy tan head . great retention and lacing . this is an absolutely spot-on ipa appearance-wise .
a : pours a jet black with a serious cappuccino colored head . i 'm talking four fingers here . and it lingers . there 's no light getting through the beer though . i like seeing that .

appearance : color was very pale light yellow and reminded me of something ... what could it be ? it attempted to sustain a head but there was n't much chance of that . moderate carbonation is present and an oily residue kind of hangs around on the sides of the glass .

a : pours a one finger head , extremely thin , devoid of cream , and of very poor retention . cloudy orange colour with floating yeasty particles . sm : light scent of berry esters : primarily cherry . no citrus . refreshing . a mild strength scent .

appearance : poured from can into ( non-real ) pint glass in low altitude galway , ireland on september 18th , 2010 . pours a clear yellow with an abominable , thin head that quickly reduces to nothing . a pathetic appearance that looks a bit like urine - ca n't wait .

a : standard pour yields a .5 finger frothy , creamy white head with great retention . beer is a clear brown . lacing is thin and stringy with good stick . one of the best looking beers of the style i 've seen to date .
appearance : bottle dated 5/21/10 . poured into a large snifter . colour is a rich brownish-red . big two-finger head fades with mild lacing . a moderate amount of carbonation is visible .
a : black with a couple of fingers of light-brown head that looks like a pancake on the griddle . the head lasts for a few minutes and leaves lots of lacing .
a : pours a deep golden-orange body with an extremely thick , creamy head that leaves its marking all over the walls of my glass .

appearance : served to me in a 20 oz glass . the color is a golden copper , that reflects a honey-yellow tint when held up to the light . the glass came to be with minimal head , which faded away to leave lacing on the edges and a layer of foam on the top .
appearance : thin head , golden amber in color ( rather less orange than i would have expected ) . poor retention and no lacing .
a : attempted to `` cold-crash '' this bottle-conditioned brew in a bucket of ice water . with a careful pour still got large globs of yeast and particles , orange/amber with lots of haze
a : the bottle poured sunshine orange with a slight sign of sediment . no head at all and no lacing .
a : the beer is a cloudy deep yellow color with a very thin white head that fades at almost instantly and leaves a very thin lace on the glass .
a : copper with an inch of fully developed head . left gobs of lacing on the side of the glass .

a : brownish/ orange amber.. little amount of foam on top . lot 's of sediment in the glass . -hmmm ... . ( been drinking this one for a little bit , sediment has settled to the bottom of the glass , dark black cloud.. minus points ... )

appearance : pours a cloudy amber orange color with a nice finger of head at the top . a lot of lacing going from head to toe on my tulip glass . the head retention has been excellent has i keep on sipping .
a : the beer is a light yellow color with a large white head that fades almost instantly and leaves very little lace on the glass .
appearance : gold color with about a half inch head on the pour ; looks decent , very transparent

appearance : this one poured a burnt ornage hue but bright orange when held to the light . the frothy white head stood up to be recognized and maintained its standing power for quite some time , leaveing behind a thick trail of bubbles . also you can find lots of beading floating vigoriously to the top .
a : pours a clear yellow-gold with two fingers of white head that recedes into a thin ring with no real lacing .
a : light yellow color . crystal clear . zero head .
a : pour from a bomber into a standard pint glass . excellent color and head retention .
appearance : poured a darker amber , slightly cloudy . 1.5 finger off-white foamy head , with excellent retention . plenty of visible carbonation . lacing ?
appearance : very pale yellow with very little head and poor lace .

a : pours a clear yellow . perhaps urine . appears undercarbonated . four finger head of no cream and okay thickness . surprisingly decent retention . not appealing , but not awful looking . sm : clean barley . thank yhwh it does n't smell malty ; this has been a huge problem with ibiza beers .
appearance : pours a thin , nonaggressive head with a little lacing and very little carbonation . it 's a pale straw gold color and seems just a little hazy .
appearance : light amber color
appearance : pale gold , slight haze , some floaties , even layer of creamy white foam
a : inert , but strangey nice head ; copper colo ; no beads , no lacing
a : pours a dark and hazy copper color . a small white head forms and recedes in an instant . not much lace .
appearance : subtle orange with fast rising bubbles and a big long lasting white head .
appearance : good foaming action and the clarity is nice as well in its pale yellow colour .
a : pours amber with a big foamy head . great sustain with tons of lacing .

a : the body is black but does allow some light to come through , illuminating it with deep persimmon glints ; above is a thin cap of fine light-brown foam that sticks around admirably and leaves tons of lace . excellent .

appearance : sits hazed and honey-colored in the glass , with a moderately thick layer of white froth on top . as the head descends , it drags a blanket of cobweb-like lace in its wake . head retention is n't too impressive , nor is clarity , nor is the color or even carbonation . other than the lacing , this really does n't have much going for it .
a : looked great ... almost black witha nice tan creamy head that didnt go anywhere and laced beautifully down the sides .
appearance : poured a clear reddish brown amber , with plenty of visible carbonation . two finger thick and foamy off-white head . excellent head retention . very nice lacing .
a : dark red/brown amber color . mild head and lacing .
a : served in a 16oz glass , zeno was a clear orange with very little bits of bubbles on top , not quite a head though . no lacing either .

a : golden body with a pure white head . looks just like it should . two things in particular impressed me : the clarity of the beer and the size of the head given how long it probably took to get to me after the pour . unfortunately , the appearance was the best aspect of the beer .

appearance : free pour fails to yield a head , instead leaving a small foam ring around the surface of the glass that gradually dissipates to almost nothing . pours a clear reddish amber , and leaves no lacing .
appearance : pours a deep , ruby red color with a thick , creamy head that dissipates down to a thick cap and leaves some spotty lacing .

appearance : dark velvety black color . small dark tan head forms and quickly becomes a small collar . not a very heady beer . kind of disappointing , but the black color of the beer is so seductive .
a : orange-yellow body , some effervescence , no head to speak of . dissapointing .
appearance : pours a watery golden color into a clear yellow body . a foamy misleading head quickly dissipates into nothing .
a : pours perfectly golden yellow/orange with 2 fingers of extremely tight white head that is slow to dissipate .
a : poured a murky orangish color with no carbonation , no head or bubbles
appearance : ruby red hue , very nice looking beer . a slight head .

appearance : dark morning piss yellow ( sorry , if it sounds vulgar ... ) . i would probably describe it as brownish/reddish yellow with amber copper reflets . good head of white foam when pour . it did n't lasts for a very long time .
a : clear golden yellow in color with a small white head , very little lacing .

a : pours a half finger head of slight cream , fair thickness , and abysmal retention . colour is a semitransparent dark yellow . sm : fruit esters : passion fruit and lemon . clean barley . a moderate strength aroma .
appearance : brownish-red , huge head .
a : like pale yellow water . no head at all . highly disappointing .

a : pours a fantastic deep gold that tiptoes the edge of being red ... maybe an orange-red ? this beer is exceptional looking . a beautiful 1/4 inch tan head showed no signs of dissipating until the last sip .
a : light brown head of medium density on top of a beautiful dark ruby body . crystal clear as far as i can tell . head stays for awhile ; just nice to look at .
a : pours a very deep near opaque brown , with a thick creamy dark tan head . excellent retention and lacing .
a : auburn color with a thick head and some of the stickiest lacing ive ever seen . nice looking . n : a bit of malt and a layer of caramel . not too strong .
appearance : a cloudy reddish brown that seems to boast quite a few particles on yeast and ginger i would assume . anyways , a pinky of creamy head that retained amirably was produced .
a : smells a bit like an ipa . some toasted malts , citrus hops , caramel , and some spice . not as pronounced as i would have expected .

appearance : the body has a medium brownish/red color with a very clear appearance and visible carbonation . this seems very odd to me for the style . on top is a thin white head that quickly fades out to just a wispy thin ring of bubbles that makes no lacing at all .
appearance : very dark with a nice brown foamy head that disappears leaving a decent soap-like lace .
a : flat , murky mahogany . does n't look good at all .
a : pours a very dark brown with a reddish purple tinge . topped with a seemingly perfect pancake batter bubbling head . excellent lacing and very good retention .

appearance : light copper bordering on brass with such a light hue . pours a billowy white head off the tap , which slowly fades to a thin but persistent coating over the top of the beer . good clarity though it appears to have a slight chill haze . flavor : light bread with hints of kilned melanoiden malt and carmel notes . earthy hop bitterness is very low . a malt focused pale , but the malt profile is light and somewhat mottled .
a : dark purple-brown , a couple fingers of tightly formed espresso head , moderate patchy lacing , looks good . 4/5
a : pours a slightly hazy mahogany with absolutely no head , save a few large bubbles that were a product of a vigorous pour .
a : a nice looking brew . a deep amber color with a decent one-finger head that did n't need much coaxing . dissipated pretty quickly to a ring around the beer . left some spotty lacing .
a : very cloudy , hazy . color is a dirty , ruddy dark gold/bronze . small thin diminishing head . does n't look like an alt , and worse , is not pretty to look at .
a : pours an extremely dark coffee brown with a billowing dense latte-foam colored head that slowly faded into a thick oily film that left rings of fine lacing down the glass .
appearance : poured a hazy amber orange with a little bit of head . absolutely no lacing alongside the glass . head disappeared quite quickly .
appearance : interestingly , the dark amber body reflects a pink light onto surfaces , which is set of by a luscious head of foam .
a : amber , almost no head , and even that small head dissappears almost immediately . really not impressive .

appearance : poured a slightly cloudy , very dark red/brown color . 1.5 finger head , light khaki and & # 8220 ; pillowy & # 8221 ; . retention is very good , with the head sticking around for a while and then keeping a thin layer . very good lacing up and down the glass . very little carbonation .
appearance : pours a very pale gold color , with a small white head that stays for a while and leaves a good lace .
a : pours a crystal clear light yellow with a soapy white head that dissipates rather quickly . a fair amount of carbonation floats up toward the top of the glass .
a : tree-bark in color and super-clear , this brew has an off-white film that leaves rings around the glass . lacing is evident , but not particularly significant .
a : clear amber with a ruby hue and topped with a generous off white pancake batter head . good retention and great lacing .
a : pours a pale straw hue with a 2-finger fluffy head that quickly dissipates and ends in a minimal lacing .
a : excellent creamy white head with good lacing down the glass . toasty yellow color , hazy .
a : did have a great look . dark , dark , dark , with a small tan head .

a : pours a hazy dark caramel ale with two fingers of yellow and creamy head . the head falls to a solid billowy sheet of the same . spotty lacing . orange hues sharpen where light passes through this murky ale .
appearance : it has a very pale straw color that is very clear with lots of visible carbonation . the head is thin , white in color and fades out quickly leaving no lace behind .
a : black with an inch of creamy tan foam and nice retention . lots of lacing is left on the glass .

a : one of the most beautiful beers i have ever poured . a jet black motor oil of a stream cascades into the wine goblet . a large coffee-colored head that recedes ever so slowly . no light gets through this one .

appearance : poured into a weizen glass , brilliant hazy yellow orange `` radiated '' from the glass , a small amount of head that looks like `` yellow cake uranium '' floating atop this magnificent looking beer .

appearance : it forms a thin white head that quickly fades leaving just a few small bubbles on top . the body has a light golden color with very good clarity . ( apparently this is a filtered wheat beer . )

appearance : into it 's proper glass , it pours a clear , pale gold with the characteristically massive head that intially takes up more space than the liquid . the head leaves gobs of sticky lace down the inside of the glass . tons of bubbles race to the top , from the heavy carbonation . a truly classic appearance ; if this does n't rate a 5 , nothing does ...

a : this beer poured a light amber to the eye , but the actual beer is seemingly darker than what was poured . the head was 2 fingers at its maximum , but wasnt too fond of hanging , so he bolted , leaving a lacy layer on the top .
appearance : pours black with some amber-cola color coming through near light . large brownish head dissipates slowly and leaves behind thick lace spots .
a : pours dark black with not head whatsoever . a small ring of bubbles formed around the outer edge .

a : pours with an unimpressive 1 finger head , foamy and fizzy , off-white in color , and it diminishes quickly . the body is almost opaque and earthy orange in color . heavily particulate on the last pour . spare lacing . not a great start .
a : cloudy yellow color , non filtered , the surface is orange , two finger of foamy head without consistency , but good retention ;

appearance : top marks for the catwalk looks , the off-white head is thick and crusty . high conditioning levels keep the head at least throughout whilst leaving some clinging lacing that swirls in clotted patterns . the hazed orange body looks murky but the marmalade frontage is nice enough .
appearance : dark as night with the faintest ruby hue . thick , two-finger brown head .
appearance : pours a cloudy yellow . slightly orange . even with a heavy pour , and a stout swirling of yeast in the bottle , i got very little head . that which i did get , disappeared quickly .

a : crystal clear golden amber with tiny bits of sediment wandering about . the dfh signature glass keeps very steady stream of bubbles flowing to the top that keeps the head from disappearing completely . s/t/m : of all the ingredients , honey dominates the smell . when i try very hard i can sort of make out the peppers , but really i doubt i would have thought that if i did n't know beforehand that they were in there . the taste is less honey-overwhelmed . while certainly prominent , the chocolate and peppers come through effortlessly in the taste . for a dry tasting beer has kind of a slicker mouthfeel than i would have expected .
a : this beer looks great . pours a gorgeous copper color with a thin head that dissapates quickly . slightly opaque . this beer practically glows .
a : pretty ugly , like a mud dark sloudy brown color with a little head . n : somewhat hoppy , spicy , little dark malts , some creamy malts , slight sweetness .
a : looks good a little darker than most pale ales .
a : nice orange color , slightly cloudy with a touch of white head on top and just enough retention for the style .
a : very good , bright orange colour , almost red , with a nice , white head , which has excellent retention and lace .
a : hazy , medium golden color with one finger of persistent off-white foam head . moderate lacing remains on the glass .
a : completely transparent , large-bubbled fizzy head that dissipates immediately . it looks extremely overcarbonated , like an energy drink , even after 3 minutes . no lacing .
appearance : light straw color , delectably hazy , luscious stand of frothy white foam , lacey
appearance : pours a nice , truly golden stream and is a pure amber in strength . head was abundant but dissipated quickly and no lace to speak of .
a : deep , deep brown with some mild highlights . extremely hazy and dense . head is a light beige color , but dissipates quickly .

a : a vigorous pour produces only an average sized head , creamy and white in color . retention is short , but a collar persists . the body is a light yet radiant yellow-orange hue which starts out very clear , but becomes opaque towards the end of the bottle as the yeast sediment is incorporated . other than the color of the body , the appearance is pretty disappointing .
appearance : served in a tall uniform and rather largish wine glass , this looked the part when it arrived . a glowing yet murky looking , marmalade orange color with little to no head whatsoever .
a : very pale pour . decent white head . little lacking in the color . bordering straw , just a little darker .
a : bright clear amber red . bubbly bright head . some tiny bubbles trickle to the surface .
appearance : dark golden with a straw colored head that dissipated quickly .
a : pours a hazy brown color with a thick tan foam head with plenty of lacing .
a : pours a dark mahogany with a fizzy off-white head , fair retention , muddled look . not the best looking stout in the world , but i do n't care with how good it tastes .

a : gentle pour yields a 3 finger fluffy mocha head with great retention . beer is a clear , nearly opaque black cherry color . lacing is patchy and stringy with great stick . every dark beer should look like this .
a : pale yellow-straw color , lots of carbonation , and a large bubbly head that disappointingly shrinks to a small lacing and eventually disappears .
a : nice deep black
a : a brilliant amber red hue . good head and great lacing .
a : pours very dark brown with a finger of dense light brown head . the head seems to stay around forever .
appearance : clear reddish orange in color witha big fluffy 3 '' + head that looks like merangue and lasts forever . nice thick lacing paints the glass .
appearance : tres blueberry stout is a very opaque , dark brown color . this is one of the darkest heads i 've seen on a stout . the color of the foam is almost a charcoal gray mixed with brown .
appearance : hazy pale amber , darker than a lot of tripels i have had and the lace is just ok as it leave only a ring .
appearance : a muddy brown color with no head . some spotty surface bubbles are all that arrive with the pour . no lacing develops .
appearance : pretty dark and cloudy -- muddy .
a : pours a translucent orange with a soft white head , average retention .
a : straw yellow and surprisingly clear , with a fluffy white head that fizzes away too quickly ... light lacing . odd for a wheat beer .

appearance : pours a very clear , transparent light urine color with a 3 '' tall , foamy white head . the retention is excellent and the beer leaves lots of sticky lace on the glass . some bubbles actively move to the surface of the beer .
appearance : mahogany hue , lasting , and i mean lasting creamy tan head , good residual foam and lacing .
a : pours a very light yellow with a long lasting head , very unimpressive .
a : pours a clear gold with half a finger of weak white head that disappears quickly .
appearance : straw yellow consumed straight from the bottle .
a : the beer is a pale yellow color , with a very thin white head that fades very quickly and leaves almost no lace on the glass .
appearance : reddish amber and clear .
a : red-orange-brown blend with a little ring of foamy head . a little too translucent for a barleywine .
appearance : black as black can be with deep ruby accents on the bottom . medium khaki head which recedes fairly quickly to cover the entire top of the beer .
a : the red color and the rose head gives a nice aspect to it . reasonable retention and many lacings left around

appearance : poured into a duvel glass ; even with a light pour , 50 % of the glass was filled with a dense head . color was surprisingly light . i 'm always impressed with the `` fountain effect '' of bubbles making their way from the bottom of the tulip glass to the head .

a : beautiful tan head of nice cream , good thickness , and great retention , especially considering the high abv . wow . dark copper colour . semitransparent . sm : amber hops , caramelized malt , alcohol , a sort of buttery note that mixes with the caramel . pleasant albeit strange .

a : one finger head of slight cream , decent thickness , and poor retention - though in fairness the abv is 9.50 % . colour is a cloudy yellow . sm : very malty , light spice , and full barley . a moderate strength aroma .
appearance : 3-4 fingers worth of foam covers a light copper body . the head lasts quite a while and leaves lasting traces . well done .
appearance : ruby , and brown , with an consistent head .

appearance : hazy yellow with a nearly nonexistent head . it really just does not look appealing , quite frankly it looks like urine in all honesty . ( i apologize if i 'm offending anyone but thats what it honestly looks like .

appearance : yellow-gold in color with a nice distribution of carbonation . the color was much lighter than i thought it would be after trying a few sips from other bottles . the head was decent and seemed to want to stick around which led to some great lacing .
appearance : pours a slightly hazy gold with a huge 3 finger white , rocky head that fades and retains at a 1/2 finger skim . tremendous sticky lacing clings all over the glass .
appearance : typical of an american adjunct - fizzy , pale gold , frothy white head with no stamina .
appearance : pours out a standard-issue black body with an inch of light beige foam , though this eventually dissipates entirely .
a : beautiful deep tawny copper color . looks great and inviting , with a half finger head that lasts . good lacing . great appearance .
appearance : pours a dark amber color that is a bit cloudy . there are three fingers of thick off white head and a decent amount of lacing .

a : pours a slightly translucent reddish-orange color . the orange/tan-tinted head is quite tall , reasonably dense , and foamy , with a somewhat rocky texture as it slowly fades . lacing is superb , layered continually down the sides of the glass .
a : black color pours from the bottle creating a finger and a half worth of thick coffee brown head . sticky lacing all down the glass .
appearance : pours a beautiful amber with a perfect head , excellent lacing , lively carbonation

appearance : dark brown to black color . small head when poured aggressively . no lacing . flavor : more fruit carries over to flavor . medium coffee flavor and roast that carries into aftertaste . medium bitterness , no perceivable hop flavor .
a : wow ! pours very dark with a huge , billowing cream-colored head that lasts for quite some time and leaves behind multiple rings of sticky lacing .
a : brown . i mean it 's pure brown . a big fluffy 3 finger head quickly dissapated to nothing .
appearance : a translucent yellow with a minimal-to-no head .
appearance : black coffee color with a small brown head that dissipates fairly slowly and leaves behind a ring of lace .
appearance : finger sized tan head , deep mahogany color , good lacing
a : pours a slightly hazy orange with two fingers of white head that fades into a dense white cap with good lacing .
appearance : shocking ... a beautiful copper and amber pour with an abundance of white head calls me from the glass .
a : dark brown with carmel legs . nicely carbonated with though it lost its head quickly

a : huge 4 finger light brown rocky head sits atop a dark brown nearly opaque body . only when the beer is held in front of a light source is the clarity noticeable ; ruby highlights appear . the head lasts forever and becomes increasingly lopsided . excellent lacing sticks in chunky sheets that are punctured by bb pellet sized holes .

a : standard pour yields a 1.5 finger , creamy , semi-fine , white head with moderate retention . beer is a clear orange ... and when i say orange , i mean the most orange that orange can get ! lacing is outrageously ample . thick , web-like froth covers the glass in layer upon layer . just giving it a swirl creates new foamy patterns . excellent .
a : pours a clear amber with golden hints with two fingers worth of white creamy head . settles to a thick head and covers the whole glass with foam .
appearance : carbonated water with the faintest hint of yellow
a : mostly black . the pour produced a quarter of off white head that retained well and left some great lace . but , it 's black .
appearance : a clear golden-straw body capped by a finger of whitish head that fades quickly and leaves bare lacing .
a : murky orange-brown body with some sediment . no head , but good legs . underwhelming , but not entirely unexpected .

a : pours nearly opaque black with just a little bit of brown around the edges . a first a small tan head forms , but continues rising to over two fingers . the tightly packed foam gently recedes to a ring that sticks throughout . lots of spiderweb looking lace is left behind .

a : deep orange/amber with a one-finger offwhite head which quickly dissapates into a thin layer across the top of the entire beer . lacing is pretty consistent throughout the session . a very nice looking beer .
appearance : it looks like a lager
a : piss-colored yellow with white head which quickly dissipates .
a : poured a golden color with good carbonation and a small white head
a : no head , no clarity . dark amber in color .

appearance : pours a very dark charcoal cocoa , entirely opaque , and a moderate pour yields a very nice and incredibly creamy finger of moderately tanned head . the retention is excellent for a barrel aged beer clocking in at 11.6 % , though as with all things it ultimately fades to a thin sheen and a thicker ring , replenished consistently by gentle but plentiful carbonation . the lacing on the sides of the tulip is what elevates this beer from a good looking beer to a great looking one , however - huge sticky , creamy swaths of delicate and thin on the one hand but also glittery and runny lacing dominates the glass landscape , proving that just because a beer 's spent nine months in a barrel and weighs in at supra 10 % does n't mean it ca n't also have very attractive and clingy lacing .
a : this one pours a nice orange/brown with 2 fingers head leaving a nice skim coat behind and lacing
a : pours goldenrod with a mild soapy head , spots of lace , pallid .
a : deep caramel color ... especially for the style . full , thick white head that lingers and leaves a good bit of lacing .
a : pours a clear golden yellow . large fluffy white head that does not last and leaves little lacing . carbonation is ample .
a : light piss color w/ ok head and almost no lacing
appearance : deliciously golden orange , great color . lots of fun junk floating around . beautiful froth . looks great !

a : a bright watered down piss colored beverage pours out to my chagrin , i was hoping they accidentally filled the bottle with horse piss as it would probably taste better . it 's clearer than a babies butt on a window and even magnifies my finger prints on the glass making me worried i might have stolen this glass without realizing it . it reveals many little bubbles rising to the top . a nice big head rises up with a nice lacing on the glass surprisingly as it fades back to a light head covering . n : a light pale adjunct like aroma wafts out . it 's better than a typical american macro , but barely . i get some light pilsner malt aromas that are actually pretty nice . very light hints of lemongrass and some wheat . i get some light cereal aromas too .

appearance : a little too pale in my opinion , but has the great carbonation tracings running up the sides of the glass like the real deal . comes with a very insistent and frothy white head that sticks around for a little while ( but not really long enough ) .
a : very deep brown color with a finger of creamy white head . quite a bit of lacing as well . nice looking beer .
a : very dark . almost pitch black , but with a very faint brownish red around the edges .
appearance : nice dark reddish brown color with a minimum amount of head . adequate amount of lacing that adds to appearance
a : pours a medium brown with a slight amber hue that is perfectly clear with a very thin layer of medium tan head that dissipates immediately , leaves minimal lacing
a : very clear and yellow , medium/heavy carbonation . thin head dissolved quickly . 1/5
appearance : a sunburnt orange that poured with a thick head . the head quickly dissipated . no clingage .

a : pours a vigorous 3 finger fluffy fine white head with great retention . this one hung on for dear life till the very end ... brew itself is clear golden . lacing is weblike and ample and really covered the entire side of the glass .
a : light brown/amber in the pour . nice 1 finger white head .

a : aggressive pour yields 1 finger of off-white head . texture of the head is like fried egg whites - large and small bubbles evenly mixed . dark brown liquid with a peachy-red edge when held to a light . good head retention . very attractive beer .
appearance : poured a pale yellow with a long lasting head .
a : black with dark , chestnut highlights , tan head , no retention or lace .
a : very little head retention , golden/orangish in color .

appearance : bright golden with an ever so slight chill haze , medium sized bubbles nonchalantly make their way to the top to keep the thin white lace in form yet to no avail the head vanishes for good .
appearance : pours a very dark brown with some light coming through . there is a finger and a half of thick tan head and great retention .

a : light gold in color and slightly cloudy . the color took me off guard as i expected this beer to be a bit more orange . the head dissipated quickly and left me with a slight lace around the rim of the glass .

a : smells like rotten fruits , with notes of green apples , lemons , and sour cherries being the strongest of the bunch . some toasted malt is there , too , along with some bretty funk , vanilla , brown sugar , and a little bit of cocoa powder . it smells like nothing i have ever come across before , that 's for sure !
a : color is the same yellow as dehydrated urine . head is white , not alot at the beginning and none after a minute .

appearance : pours really , really light and transparent . produces a one finger , medium looking , off-white head with decent retention . black body and no carbonation evident . head fades to a slight wisp and ring . a ring remains until the end but leaves no lacing down the glass . way too transparent and thin , and the head is far too light . does n't look like an imperial stout .
a : possibly the lightest beer claiming to be an ipa that i 've seen . clear and light yellow with a gorgeous 3-finger white head , excellent retention , gorgeous lacing . excellent
a : a dark black , viscous looking beer . pours with an impressive , frothy mocha head that dissipates very slowly . tons of lacing .

appearance : after popping the cap , the slightly tan head overflowed from the opening , good thing i had my glass handy . after the pour , the head in my glass settled into a quarter inch , dense layer . the foam in the bottle keeps slowly rising out . the beer is a dark brown with a little amber in there as well . it seems very lively as i can see minuscule bubbles rising , some sediment in there .

a : soba ale pours a somewhat hazy deep golden color with very orange hues . there is a nice off-white head which leaves a very modest amount of lace on the side of the glass . the head drops down quickly . some carbonation is visible through the haze .

appearance : slightly hazy golden colour with a poor head , just few big bubbles . however , when i had this from cask at one of the otley pubs , it poured with a thick creamy head , and this is the thirs different otley beer i have had from bottle that has show a crappy head . anyway , the carbonation is very light too .
a : pours a clouded brown into a chimay chalice with a finger of tan head that hangs around for the drinking experience . not a whole lot of lacing left on the glass .
a : flat . looks more like cough syrup than beer . but of course the same could be said for all of the bt variations . min lacing and dark as dark gets .
a : liquid black gold , great head , with good retention , amazing after all it was a cask , it looked soild black , and i barely let the light pass through the glass ! !
a : looks good , golden amberish yellow with foamy white head that diminishes faily qulickly
appearance : a super hazy orange/gold beer with medium carbonation and a thin ivory cap .
a : pale hazy yellow , almost no head
a : pours dark brown , not much light getting through . head is cream colored but there is not much of it . no lacing .
a : dark beer , but ruby red and crystal clear when held to the light . i 've never seen such a dark , yet clear beer . tiny bubbles that cling to the side of the glass .
appearance : pours a clear pale yellow color with a wispy head that breaks down immediately .

appearance : a clear ruby-red to brown beer ( you could indeed call it mahogany as the bottle says ) that poured a 1/4 '' light tan dense head . however the head died down to a thin ring around the edge of the glass and a very thin little island in the middle of the beer . very little lacing - every now and then but it slowly slides back down . slow bubbles moving up through the beer . i 'm digging the color , but the lack of head and lacing is a bit of a bummer .

appearance : the flatness of this batch of angel 's share , or any other beer that experiences some carbonation issues , is , in my opinion , not so much a problem for the drinking experience , as it is a problem for the visual aspects of the beer . no carbonation means no head and no lacing . i tend to place a lot of weight on a beer 's lacing , in particular , and to a lesser extent its head , so when there 's just nothing in my glass upon constant swirls , i have to give it a low rating . body color can , of course , make up for where the lacing or head lack , but this one is a sort of off-brown greyish black that is just , well , not appealing at all , especially when held up to a light . that being said , i do , when i hold it up to a light , see some slight carbonation bubbles ! additionally , if you put your ear up to the glass , you can hear some definite popping . my bottle 's been sitting for some time , so it 's possible that this is because the yeast is beginning to do its job . i would n't , for what it 's worth , call this beer completely flat .

appearance : free pour yields a one and a half inch , frothy light tan head that dissipates slowly leaving sweeping peaks of lacing . pours a beautiful , solid dark red brown . leaves occasional islands of lacing .
a : pours gold/yellow , remarkably clear with only a slight hazy , and a creamy white head that dissipates relatively quickly . good lacing .

appearance : dare i say this is the best looking beer i 've ever seen ? it pours a deep amber-red with great clarity and awesome carbonation . nice 1.5-finger white head with great retention that leaves just fantstic lacing .
a : hazy orange with no head basically .

a : the '94 can is fuzzy ... i 'm going to assume that 's from being cellared in my sock drawer and hope it 's nothing else . that aside , both pours look very nice ... clear light amber color with active carbonation .
appearance : not so clear as i expected . a rich mahogany , reddish brown with a thin cream-colored head that fades quickly , leaving a small lace .
appearance : a dark bronze body with a line of cream colored lace with a lot of retention very mild lacing .
a : as transparent as i 've ever seen an imperial stout . i can see light right through the center . the head is foamy and disappears in an instant leaving no discernible lace .
a : appearance was n't anything amazing , pours a light to medium gold color , like a lot of other beers , very carbonated .
a : dark color with blue tint ; lots of carbonation : malt liquor like .
a : murky , brownish-orange , off-white head , excellent retention and lace . could n't be better .
appearance : a deep , deep ruby red that is black in this lighting . a nice , two finger frothy mocha head . a nice lingering lace all the way down .
a : very nice clear amber with a thick white head .
a : amber with good clarity and minimal carbonation . very small cream head does n't stick very well , but does leave spots of lace .

appearance : dark cloudy brown that showed some light at the edges . whipped frothy brown head of a good finger and a half is starting to dry in the center . looks like it will outlive me . flavor : the smell mirrors the taste , with the addition of even more molasses and long roasted malt . spices top the taste , mild pepper and clove . a dry bitter aftertaste last longer than it should .
a : pours out a dark brown , completely opaque , forming a big fluffy head . amazing retention - as it very slowly recedes , the brew leaves a wall of sticky lacing .

appearance : amber with the slightest haze . the head is quite nice -- big foamy bubbles around the outside and a big marshmallowy dollop of finer creamy bubbles in the middle . fades to a thin layer . pretty nice lacing . good looking beer .
a : a beautiful pale yellow , chardonnay perhaps . with a full 2 fingers of fluffy white head . this my friends is an excellent looking beer .
a : black , black , black ... . about 2 fingers of beautiful tan head . a nice ring thought the session ... . best lacing i 've seen for a while .
appearance : head : dark khaki , fluffy , long lasting body : roasted , hoppy , coffee , chocolate
a : poured a deep cocoa brown color with great carbonation leaving a rich brown head . this looked amazing !
appearance : deep brown , hardly any head , good clarity
appearance : it poured a darker than brown color , but not as dark as i would have expected . head was okay .

a : the head is large , 3 fingers high , rocky/frothy , off-white and long lasting . the body is clear with a medium rich color of amber mixed with honey brown . lacing is just a notch above good . s &
appearance : perfect ! ! ! an awesome brown color with a very generous creamy neck of foam . never had so much fun to pour a beer in a glass .

a : pours an opaque , dark red color , solidifying into a mahogany . some light gets through , but very little . the head is thin but with dense bubbles and is a beautiful purplish pink hue , very unexpected and nice .

a : crystal clear straw colored beer with a bone white sea foam head . this is perhaps the most translucent beer i have ever seen , it 's like glass . large bubbles burst and soon the foam lowers by about an inch leaving just a bit of lacing . edit : crystal clear halfway through until about 2/3 of the way through the bottle ... then gets all san francisco .
a : huge bloom of carbonation ; thick head ; pale , cloudy yellow color ; lacing decent for this style

appearance : the most noticeable thing about this beer is , sadly , the unnecessarily vapid head . it barely forms , then evaporates into nothing but an oily film on the surface of the otherwise lovely , thick , coffee-black body .
appearance : huge head , dark black , chocolate colored
a : opaque dark brown body . small loose head that dissipates quickly leaving no lacing and no cover . how is that possible in an oatmeal stout ?
appearance : dark brown in color . good head , light beige in color .
a : light purple color , foamy 1/2 '' head with very little retention

a : not bad looking at all . pours a dark brown in color that builds a seemingly black body . held to the light , you can see the browns and reds coming through but this is dark and opaque . the head builds a little over a finger of mocha colored foam . it falls pretty quickly though , down to a thin top cap that lingers through the drinking experience . no lace to speak of .
a : kind of an ugly beer , it poured a cloudy dark amber with very little head or lacing .
a : well it looks like a stout ... fairly dark but i 've seen darker , little to no head on it though .
a : pours a pale straw body with light haze and off-white head . decent retention .
a : dark brown with only a thick ring of toasted cream foam and spotty lace . opaque .

appearance : man , this is basically like what i envision with i think of `` ale . '' pours with a massive two and a half finger head just slightly off-white with a hint of tan . lacing is thick , consistent , long rainbow arms of stuff . the body is a beautiful kaleidoscope of golden straw , red , and brown . really nice looking .

a : pours a murky soft apricot body with active effervescence up the glass , continuously replenishing a light beige head . throughout the drink there 's an even half-finger of foam capping the brew , with gorgeous , sticky lace down the sides of the glass . unbeatable appearance .

appearance : painfully clear light yellow with a frothy white cap that left a lace mark on recession from pour . nice thick lacing all the way down the mug from a long lasting head . flavor : standard american lager taste , clean , crisp , weak malt water taste with a rather harsh metallic twang at the end . dont know if it is a canning issue or just a bit off or maybe a hop artifact . also just a slight orange experience , but it may just be suggestion from the name .

a : pours a surprisingly rich amber-gold body with tons of carbonation sustaining a two-finger head of dense white foam that sticks around seemingly forever : by far the best head i 've ever seen on a beer of this style , it verges on being `` rocky '' - really impressive . still , it 's fizzy yellow beer , so i ca n't bring myself to award the 5 , even though it looks amazing according to style .
a : a clear , light golden color with a thick , dense off-white colored head . good lacing down the glass .
a : pours a cloudy orange - slightly darker than usual - with a small bubbly head . almost no lacing .
a : pours a very pale yellow with a small white head that quickly disappeared to nothing . leaves no lacing .
a : poured light straw yellow , hazy , light white foamy head , no lacing
appearance : unusual copper color with a fizzy head that quickly disappears without a trace
a : aggressive pour yields 3/4 finger white head with good retention . clear golden colored liquid . decent though fizzy .
a : crystal clear amber orange color with a thick almond colored bubbly head and some really nice lacing .
a : pours a clear gold with a pallid white head , solid retention , spotty lace .

a : thick & viscous ( surprise , surprise ) . color is jet black with absolutely no light passing through anywhere . aggressive pour yielded an active bubbly chocolate colored head which dissipates but not completely , leaving a nice frothy layer on the surface and around the edges . lacing is relatively boring and minimal .
appearance : pale golden color , managed half a finger of soapy-looking foam which died away to a few small arcs of bubbles within 10 seconds . no lacing .

a : pours a light copperish amber with nice foamy white head that sticks around quite a bit . with around 2 to 3 fingers in width , it fades to a simple blanket . poured an entire bottle into a standard pint glass . towards the end of the pour , i noticed some dregs floating around in my glass that muddied the beer . a little surprising as i thought it would have been filtered a little better .
appearance : pours a hazy ruby tinted dark amber color with two fingers of off white head . the head fades quickly and just leaves a ring around the edge . this is a nice looking beer .
a : pours a clear and dark copper and topped with a rather fizzy , none too substatial off white head , that fades into nothing , no lacing either .
a : it pours an opaque chestnut brown ; the color is a bit flat . there was no head and no real lacing . the whole appearance of this beer is just heavy and flat , not very exciting looking .
a : bad appearance , very cloudy and murky , no head whatsoever , bland orange and brown color
a : this is where the horror begins , just a fizzy no headed yellow beer ...
appearance : a great looker , with a massive head that sits atop the chestnut colored liquid ; wonderful retention and lacing
a : pours a gray/yellowish color with an average head that fades within 3 minutes after pouring . not impressed .
appearance : bright amber orange with a big head that is white with tint of tan . great retention and lacing .
a : a hazy golden/straw color with a pretty solid white head .
a : dark amber and very cloudy . looks thick like a light maple syrup . not a lot of head , carbonation or anything on the glass . not much to look at to be honest .
a : pours a cloudy , copper-orange body with a small off-white head that vanishes quickly . during sips , some curtains are left on the sides of the glass .
a : evenly cloudy orange/amber color . poured a 3 finger fizzy off-white head that dissipated to skim along the inside edge of the glass . laced in some intermittent spots .

appearance : when poured into an oversized wine glass , the beer was an extremely nice golden amber color . the label was n't lying when it said it was going to be a golden ale . when it was poured , the beer was nothing but a pearl white head of foam . when it finally settled down , the beer still had that nice head of pearl white foam , as well as white foamy rings and plenty of pearl white lace around the glass . a small skim of that foam still remains after the beer is almost all gone . it does n't seem to want to leave . i ca n't say enough good things about this appearance .
appearance : plain , boring , clear applejuice color , slight carbonation . no head nor lacing .
appearance : amber color with a very white head . head was fairly thin and did not last very long with a minimum amount lacing .
a : chocolately brown beer with a huge 2 finger head dissipating slowly ,
a : pours an extremely pale and dull yellow . this defines straw colored . tight carbonation of tiny bubble leaves a 1 finger white head that recedes to a thin layering .
a : golden colored . definitely filtered . big loose head to it .

a : right off the bat , the appearance is fantastic . it 's a dark beer the color of molasses , allowing beautiful dark brown tones of color to show through when held up to a light . the head stands about the width of my small finger , and sinks to a sliver across the top of the beer . it is a light tan color , and looks milky smooth across the surface . lacing is already starting to build .
a : dark orange/red almost burnt ember hues .
appearance : pours a thick , clear amber with minimal head .

a : dark amber color , with a slight reddish hue . after pouring the head formed up high and fizzed down with vigorous carbonation , but the remnant head is more creamy looking , a light amber color .
a : served a clear honey amber with a dense off-white nitro head that left a stereotypical sheet of nitro lace down the glass .

a : poured from a bottle to a pint glass . had a dark brown , almost black color and a thick , opaque consistency . there was a big , tan-colored , creamy , long-lasting head . great lacing . a fantastic-looking beer .
a : pours a deep , cloudy golden-orange . stark , white 2-finger head has excellent retention , leaving an immense amount of lacing on the glass as it recedes . beautiful .
a : transparent yellowish-orange color with a head that was almost non existent . very unimpressive for a draft beer .
appearance : arrives at the table with an espresso brown color with tan highlights and a mocha head that retains beautifully and sheets the glass with lace

appearance : dark copper color . it resembles caramel a little . the round bottom of my glass makes it look like a caramel covered apple . anyways , there was a small light tan head that minimizes pretty fast . not that much lacing for this pour . it looks good , nothing special though .
appearance : this may be the perfect beer from an appearance standpoint . excellent , deep brown ( but not black ) color and excellent head retention .
appearance : pours a slightly hazy amber color with a nice head that webs lacing around the pint glass

a : this ale poured with very little head , not a bad thing for an ale as far as i 'm concerned . the body is a rich cloudy and earthy brown ( bottle conditioned ) . the head ( which left a tiny ring of lacing around the glass ) is best described as beige ... a good colour in this instance .
a : the beer is a very light yellow color , with a short white head that fades very quickly and leaves very little lace on the glass .
a : copper , huge head from the pour - sticks around forever - very nice appearance .
a : caramel-amber with robust 3-finger rocky off-white head with good retention and copious lacing .
appearance : the look it terrific . it pours a dark garnet brown with absolutely loads of lacing plastering the walls of my glass like a curtain .
appearance : light brown head with major cascading effect and long retention . it 's also creamy and coats the glass all the way down . body is a dense brown color . simply gorgeous .
a : pours a deep brown with large floaty chunks visible on the surface . not much head . having trouble getting past the chunks in this .
a : zesty , crisp , floral hop aromas . stone fruit esters , biscuit malts . a little bit of spice .

a : pours an opaque , burnt-orange with an impossibly creamy and pillowy dark khaki colored head on top . retention is fantastic ! gobs of sticky lace were left clinging for dear life to the inside of the glass .
appearance : red/brown pour with no head , not necessarily attractive .

a : pours a very clean , just of white one finger head on a dark brown body . by clean i mean it just came out as head and there it was . it did n't do the guinness falling bubbles thing , it did n't look small and then foam up huge , it just was . held up to the light the beer has a reddish copper hue with lots of active carbonation and is very clear . head fades and leaves a little lace .
appearance : pours a light coffee colour that ends up looking black w/ a creamy 1 finger head . the head lingers the whole time and plenty of lacing

appearance : pours a slightly darker than gold into a victory shaker pint . it 's only slightly hazy and is topped by a tight-bubbled eggshell-colored head that holds at almost a finger 's height . this is what beer should look like .
appearance : this beer is a clear chestnut brown coloration . the head is a light tan coloration approximately 2 fingers high . the head resolves into a thin foam .
a : pours a ruby red or very reddish amber color with a very tiny head that actually left lace on its way down .
a : pours an amber golden . 1/2 finger , egg white head diverts to 1/4 finger within a couple minutes . sporadic lacing along edges . head easily agitated to original height with a spritely stir .
appearance : dark brown almost black . thin brownish ribbon of head
a : there is nothing wrong with the way this looks in a glass : hazy light golden with a great looking head . lacing is apparent and plentiful .
a : pours a clear , straw color with a giant 3 finger head after a generous pour . recedes to half a finger 's worth of off white head on top .

a : holy god . i did n't pour very vigorous out of the can , and it resulted in a 4 finger eggshell head topping a golden yellow , almost copperish color beer , and the head stayed around and left lacing all over the glass . settled into a nice 1/8 '' cap and leaves sticky lace after every drink . this one is off to a fantastic start .
appearance : morning piss . yellow . yummy !

a : golden honey brown colored body with a bubbly , rocky and creamy looking head . a nice retention ring is left behind , along with sticky lace on the walls . unfiltered floaties are unmistakable in the body , as mentioned there might be should you pour this out . really , they 're just ugly and kill the looks of the beer . i ca n't help but think this is part of the reason they recommend drinking from the can ( other than the hop aroma retention ) .
appearance : pours out a clear , light orange-hued , honeyesque in color body with a rather tall , almost glistening , near white head .
a : perfect . nice deep ruby red with hints of brown and an medium off-white head that quickly resides .
a : big pour yields no head as carbonation struggles to escape from the brew . beer is a dark , near opaque brownish-black . no head , so no lacing . a bit on the flat side even given its style .
appearance : a nice reddish amber color . goes right along with the name . it had a tiny head that left no lacing , points away for this .

appearance : transparent golden blonde , with a significant amount of carbonation that forms a moderate amount of off-white foam . the head settles quickly , but leaves a bit of foam in the center of the glass and along the side of the glass . faint lacing is noticed as the glass is tilted .
appearance : black glass shows some clarity at the edges and holds a tan head that laces in heavy clumps .
appearance : light brown , hazy , with almost no head ( just minimal bubbles forming around the edges ) . no lacing .
appearance : light straw color with a small amount of white head . plenty of carbonation streaming from the bottom . very clear and looks inviting , almost like summertime in a glass

a : uhh , this is a stout ? a great imperial stout ? i could barely pour this one because it was foaming over for minutes . poured out a dark red , nowhere close to dark . were any dark malts used here ?
a : this looks exactly like fred . this was a clear , pale , golden copper color . it poured with a huge , fluffy , craggy white head that was sticky and long lasting .
a : brown colour and a huge 4 cm head that lasts . 5
a : syrupy , black body with a generous 1.5 inch head . the head is creamy with a dark tan hue . leaves a lot of lacing around the glass and has some stay to it .
appearance : pale yellow color . poured with a 1-finger soapy-looking head which died away leaving just a few scant bubbles around the glass . left almost no lacing .

a : pours a half finger head of fair cream and thickness , but terrible retention . colour is a nontransparent copper . sm : lots of fruity tones , a light air of vinegar , and malt . moderate in strength . very pleasant and inviting .
appearance : light black and good clarity despite the dark colour . head : light brown and low head with very poor retention ( no lacing whatsoever ) .
a : pours a hazy orange with a giant white head that slowly fades to a ring and leaves a ton of lacing .
a : deep orange amber with thick 2-finger , light beige head with good retention and thick patches of lace on the upper half of the glass .
appearance : motor oil black , nice carbonation coming up the sides but you really have to look for it with how dark this stuff is , about an inch of brown head on the top .
a : pours a light red-tinged golden color with a couple fingers of light tan head that slowly receded into a thick fuzzy film that left a great network of lace down the glass .
appearance : pours very dark , black in fact . seems darker than most porters . a thin , soapy , tan head that recedes quickly . lacing is very nice too . excellent appearance .

a : the beer is transparent and light yellow in color . the head is light , white , fluffy and stands in at about a half inch tall . as it fades , it manages to leave some faint traces of lacing on the pint glass .
a : cloudy amber body with a white head .
appearance : 1/3 inch head , dark brown in color , clear , moderate carbonation
appearance : pours a clear dark amber color with an impressive head that splashes lacing in every direction
appearance : pours a pitch black with two fingers of head that settles quite nicely .
appearance : pours a clear golden hue with a two-finger head that actually takes a few minutes to dissipate . tiny spots of lacing left along the glass as i drink .
a : fizzy-yellow . a little cloudy . nice , 1 inch head at first but it dies to nothing fast . strong carbonation . does n't look too appealing .

appearance : cloudy , grade a `` dark amber '' maple syrup . poured a huge , off-white , billowy head that extended well beyond the rim of the glass , then receded to something resembling a bubble bath .
appearance : slightly cloudy cooper-brown , no head , no lacing
a : bronze with an off-white head , no retention or lace .
a : a light lager even the budmillcoors would be jealous of . poor head retention and steady carbonation . bone white head leaves no lacing .
a : pours a hazy garnet/reddish color . a very minimal , bubbly , white head forms and recedes in a second . almost no lace . though the color is very appealing and inviting .
a : pours a candy grapefruit pink body with a very short-lived head that vanishes into nothing . it 's totally opaque ; the glow and color are very captivating .
a : pours a amber ale with brilliant clarity . two fingers of peanut head falls over a few moments to a sheet of the same .
appearance : deep red with a foamy , pink head . nice , almost champagne level of carbonation initially , which decreased fairly quickly .
a : black . no light seems to come through this one . poured with a tan head that dissipated quickly .
a : light yellow color . crystal clear . zero head .
appearance : the non-existant head makes this beer look like soda ; sort of looks like sprite .
a : deep auburn reddish color . very beautiful when held up to the light . you could see particles floating in the bear . nice head that was fairly thin but left a good amount of lacing .
