appearance : poured into a soon-to-be-terribly-appropriate weeping radish brewery pint glass . it 's got a great fluffy thick head that lasts . good lacing . good carbonation . not bad at all . except it 's fucking beet red with a pink head . pink . bright pink . pink ! ! ! jee-zus kee-rist , it 's ugly as fuck . ugly . as . fuck . awful . jolly rancher watermelon red . pepto bismol pink . nauseating . psychotropically bad . i wish i could give it a zero but i ca n't . the ba api wo n't let me .
appearance : the appearance is an orange / yellow body with a creamy white head .
a : pours a hazy goldenrod , not what i was expecting for an ipa , looked more like a brewpub hefeweizen to me , fine lacing and retention .
a : very clear and no head retention at all .
a : midnight black in color with a dark brown chocolate colored head . this is about as good as this beer is going to get . read on .

a : one finger tan head of lovely cream and notable retention . black colour . inferior to guinness . far inferior , mind ye . sm : vanilla , caramel , coffee , and either toffee or chocolate . strong and distinctive .

a : this beer pours what i would call a standard head from the bottle . just over 1.5 fingers to me , with medium sized bubbles that do n't look like they 're going to last . and it does n't . beer as very little carbonation , and is a clear coppery orange color . maybe the slightest haze .

appearance : dark chestnut to amber body that has a massive tan colored deep creamy head which laces the glass walls exceptionally well . this looks fantastic in an imperial straight sided handled mug . the head wrestles the beer and a swirl unearths some hidden dissolved carbonation . its a drinking beer is this one and the look is that of a great esb or premium yorkshire bitter .
a : motor oil with a sandy tan head that leaves no lacing . also a little more retention would be welcome .
a : absolutely elegant mahogany to almost black hue , with an supposedly thick and tight frothy beigh head which sustains forever .

a : large 3 1/2 finger frothy/creamy head . pure white and long lasting . the head begins to attach itself to the glass in large chunks as it recedes into a rocky cap . despite the sticky head , the lace that the body produces sticks sparingly . the body is a light yellow , pale gold color and very , very clear . minimal visible carbonation .
a : pours a pale straw yellow , good clarity . very small head forms and dies fast . no lacing .
appearance : deep ruby/purple with loads of head and a slight lacing . so appetizing .
a : slightly hazy medium amber body with a perfectly majestic three-finger head of creamy , chunky ecru foam . terrific retention and tons of great , sticky lace . fantastic .

a : clear golden color , lots of bubbles rising to the surface , meeting a decent head that holds well at the top and clings nicely to the sides . even so , it does n't look especially attractive . i assume this is a simple , one-dimensional american ipa .

appearance : very cool label . it shows the famed beast in its signature stride and reads `` untamed and imposing . '' the head is a magnificent dark brown color that contrasts perfectly with the pitch black yeti .
appearance : pours a very light yellowish color with a 1/4 '' head that is whiter than white . the head falls immediately to a surface bubble or two .
a : pours red with an impressive off-white soapy head . excellent head retention and good lace , an impressive looking pint .

appearance : a brown pour makes a one finger , medium-thinner looking , fizzy , light brown head with decent retention . noisy one . dark brown body , relatively transparent , with no carbonation evident . head quickly fades to a wisp and ring . only a ring remains until the end and leaves dots of lacing down the glass . a little under par here .
a : pours a real thick foamy head atop a pale , brownish red body .
a : clear , ruby red color . the pour produced a nickel size , pink head , that vanished before my eyes . the beer left no lace .
a : clear amber body full of floaties . 1/2 '' head of frothy off-white foam . meh .

a : creamy two finger , yellowed-white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a thin layer of foam on top of the beer . head collapse is marked on sides of glass by some good streaking . color is deep , dark amber/orange/brown with a bit of yellow on top when light shines through it .

a : light brown with orange to copper with small tan head that degrades to nothing quickly . still which is okay but the haze is not . another negative on appearance is the twist top . s/t : a mildly sweet caramel note combined with a dry tart order characteristic of this yeast strain . the nose and after taste have a prominent floral flavor from the styrian goldings . the bitterness is mild overall . the finish is dry , tart and just a bit fruity .

a : the lacing and head were lacking on this stout , which could be due to the duvel glass i 'm using for this tasting ( second beer with basically no head ) . anyways , when swirled vigorously , this beer consists of a caramel color that is still missing the thick lacing i desire . also , just like any good stout ... this beast is the blackest of black .
appearance : : it has a light clear yellow colour to it . it has a white head that dies down fast and has absolutely no lacing .
a : golden yellow , hazy . poured a little dead , tried for a head , got about 1 finger but quickly receded to a thin film . some nice lacing though .
appearance : low off-white head with decent retention . cloudy brown .
a : pitch black with a coffee hued head that i wish was around for longer . some lacing and some legs .
appearance : pours a black color with a 3 '' tan colored head that lasts a long time . some spotty lace develops .
a : very nice looking beer . nice color , very nice creamy light brown head .
appearance : pours a dark black colored beer with a 2 '' light tan head . excellent retention and plenty of lace coats the glass .

a : pours very dark brown with a really nice mocha head . retention and lacing are amazingly good . looks like a really good porter , or maybe even an expertly made cappuccino simply a beauty of a beer .
a : pours a murky burnt orange with a very light head . some light lace .
a : yellow , slightly turbid .
a : fat , white , bubbly head crowning an outstandingly beautiful orange amber body . lace is clustery . looks like champagne .
a : pours a rich semi transparent gold with a huge 4inch fluffy head . looks amazing !
appearance : glear gold color , streams of carbonation rise to the frothy white head . nice looking .
a : pours a cloudy yellow , with a firm nice head , with good retention and really good lacing .
a : after the cage was removed , the cork practically fell out . pours a pitch black . no head , bubbles , or lace .

a : medium brown murky body with absolutely no head on it . even with some vigorous swirls i could n't get any head to form . naturally , no lace or retention either . for being bourbon barrel aged i ca n't fault it too much as the barrel tends to kill some visuals , but it 's still not very attractive .

a : pours a burnt yellow color with some orangish tint . i have a lot of trub or yeast sediment in my glass . way to much for simple bottle conditioning . must have been left in there on purpose . i 'm not a fan ... i 'll try a more careful pour next time to see if it is just bottom sediment . the head is ample and bright white . lace sticks to the glass even as i 'm half way done .
a : poured a very light gold that was easy to see through .
a : pours black with a soft but firm tan head , full lace immediately and all the way down the glass . great looking pint .
appearance : pours a clear brown with what can only be described as violet highlights . topped by a quarter inch of tight white head ( also with a purple hue ) , that is slow to settle .

appearance : cloudly yellow with notes of green in the body that has little in the way of carbonation . no lacing to be found here , despite a finger of head and decent retention . the hazy appearance is making me raise an eyebrow .
a : beautiful head ; clear golden yellow ; lacing rather nice
a : thin , creamy head ; no carbonation ; deep red copper color
appearance : a light-amber/orange color without much head at all . fairly clear . it really is a beautiful looking beer .
a : weak . a couple shades from completely black . opaque . no real head to speak of aside from a thin beige collar that did check up and leave some pleasant lace down the sides
a : slightly hazy orange color with minimal carbonation . white head is rocky and thick . it has great retention and leaves a very heavy and sticky lace .
a : healthy head and a cloudy peach color .
a : murky prune juice body with a finger of jelly belly toasted marshmallow hued head that dissipates quickly to a thick wisp ring . no lacing . 3/5
appearance : fizzy pale yellow with practically no color , perfectly clear , with no head whatsoever . pours like soda .
a : clear pale orange body with two fingers of fine white foam ; solid retention and beautiful lacing . perfectly gorgeous apa .
a : semi hazy brownish orange color . unfiltered brew with off white head with very low volume , correct lacing and very low retention .
a : pours deep golden with hints of green . a really small airy white head . no lacings .

a : the head on this is spectacular ! this beer initially poured a deep dark burgundy with a couple finger of light tan head . the head then slowly collapsed on itself to form a very soft , dense , melted ice-cream film that left a solid sheet of lace around the whole glass . this is what a bsda should look like .
appearance : dark orange body with a nice two finger white fluffy head . great retention . amazing lacing .
a : ruby red to brown , significant layering a creamy foam - 4.50 ,

a : pretty much perfect for an impy stout . this beer is solid black until you thin the liquid to less than ~1/2 inch . a full glass looks like espresso . the head is tan , about a shade lighter than expected , and very creamy , sticking to the sides with ease .

appearance : a one finger foamy with good retention . the head left some lacing on the glass . the color of the beer is a pale straw color with yellow highlights . there is a lot of effervescence in the beer . the clarity of the beer is clear .

a : a small white foamy head provides decent retention . the body has an 80 % opacity that provides a color range from rustic orange through auburn , then dark copper at the core . there is a light smathering of lace in broken sedimentary fashion .

appearance : very clear pale yellow color with a nice white head . i love this color ( even if it is the same color as miller lite ) . the head eventually drops to a medium collar with a bubbly lacy patch in the middle .

a : pours a clear golden orange , with a smooth one finger white head that dissipates quickly and leaves little lacing . i like my big ipas to be hazier with a foamier head , so this did n't do much for me .

appearance : looks just about perfect . pours a fluffy off-white head that fills my pilsner glass as loads of bubbles rush up from the bottom . awesome retention and lacing . the beer is a rich golden color .
a : deep black and opaque , void of color . a half inch of thick , beige head rests atop the beer and leaves ample lacing throughout the glass . a fabulous appearance .
a : clear mahogany body , no carbonation . expected .
a : pours a clear ruby/copper color with a chunky , two finger , offwhite head which sticks around a while . nice chunky lacing down the sides .
a : copper brown , with a creamy beige head that dissipates rather quickly . looks like a standard lager ( yuengling comes to mind )
a : pours a clear , but dark brown with a bubbly off-white head that reduces to a film and leaves some decent lacing on my glass .

appearance : pours a pitch black color with a small , 1/4 '' light brown head . the bubbles vary from large to minuscule . there is n't much retention or even any lacing . a body of large bubbles make a continent .
a : pours a cherry brown ale with absolute clarity . three finger burnt cream head retires down over five minutes to leave broken quilt of the same . coarse spider web lacing . good looker .
a : pours amber with a gorgeous frothy white head which goes well above the rim of the glass . full sticky web like lace is left in its wake .
appearance : reddish copper in color . pours with a decent off-white almost tan head which condensed to large bubbles quickly which then lasted a long time , fair amount of lacing .
a : very very dark brown with a garnet streak . this one is topped with a gorgeous tan head . great retention and very good lacing .
a : pours a medium straw color with a thin head that vanishes quickly
a : transparent , orange yellow . mild scattered rising carbonation but zero head .
appearance : poured bottle into glass and had a one centimeter light brown/tan head . very fizzy/bubbly on the pour . very , very dark . delightful to behold .
appearance : jet black with a root beer float head that really lasts , leaving great lacing behind . possibly the best looking stout i have ever seen .
a : pours a slight , hazy golden body with a small , white head with pretty poor retention and lacing . not overly impressed .
a : pours a dark golden with a small fizzy head that quickly settles and disappears without leaving a wisp or hint of its brief existence .
a : clear golden in color . some sediment seen with what looks like tiny chunks of fruit in the glass . no real head on this one , just a collar .
a : very dark , no light shining through . black
a : pale straw brew , pours with thick head that dissipates quickly . bits of soapy-looking foam sticks to the glass and covers the surface of the beer .

appearance : a body of deep red tinted amber that has a cloudiness i 'd expect from a wheat beer , but still boasts excellent carbonation . the head however , was completely lacks , giving barely a finger that did not lace or sustain .
appearance : amber , great clarity , absolutely no head even on a hard pour ( just some pitiful foam )
appearance : hazy gold with minimal head .

appearance : flat . shit . was afraid that would be the case . i complained to the brewery and received replacement bottles that were supposedly carbonated , but this is flat as a plank . no head , no lacing . i raised the bottle higher and higher as i poured but still nothing . i might as well get out a straw and start blowing at this point .
appearance : clear yellow in color with a creamy white head . took a while to clear up after the pour with the cascading foam . big lace develops during the session .
a : dull bronze in color with a small head , but healthy carbonation .
a : clear straw color , a very thin head that disappears quickly , no lacing
appearance : ruby-mahogany-black , good clarity ( around the edges of the otherwise opaque brew ) , thick creamy layer of fine-beaded tan head , great head retention , lots of lace
appearance : not really muddy , but a dark burnt caramel . i think i 've made dulce de leche look like this when i 've overcooked it a lot . thin , persistent head ( at least the way i poured it ) .
a : the best feature of this beer . the beer pours a golden color with a picture perfect head . the topography of this beer is just tremendous .

a : pours a maroon brown with copper highlights at the edges . a bit cloudy , some small sediment particles even with an extremely careful pour . thin slightly off-white head , only a few millimeters , which goes down a bit a first but then lingers for quite a while .
a : standard pour yields no head . beer is a muddy brown/clay . no lacing and minimal legs . a really sad looking beer .
appearance : crystal clear golden with a small quickly disappearing head
a : more brown than an oktoberfest should be , little head
a : eeeewwww ! what in the world is that smell ? it 's like rotten cheese sitting on top of some roasted malts and chocolate . plugging my nose as it take a sip ...
a : clear copper-amber , zero head or retention .
appearance : the beer is a deep amber with a big and well sustained eggshell white head . there is a slight haze with some yeast or other particulate matter left in suspension .
a : light amber , with little to no head , with bad retention .

a : bottle was a gusher , and foam geysered out even after some beer was poured out of the bottle . pours a hazy light orange with very active apparent carbonation and an enormous rocky head . foamy head follows beer all the way down the glass , and the head coats the side of the chalice . striking appearance .

a : not the most carbonated beer . elevated pour barely yields a thin mocha film atop the brew that dissipates as quickly as it forms . beer is an opaque black . lacing is nearly non-existant with a spot here or there and little cling .
appearance : brilliantly clear ruby red , completely still ; not a trace of carbonation .
a : a deep golden/brown cloudy color looking alive and attractive .
a : grainy , blueberry esters , and some faint hops . very fruity .
a : deep yellow to a gold body color , with a fluffy white head that settles with sticky lacing . good levels of carbonation .
a : poured a deep black with a nice two finger mocha colored head . head had decent retention time resulting is a nice lacing .

a : hazy orange/caramel in color , not much head at all , and lots of sediment . thankfully i noticed this before dumping the entire bottle into my glass . however , this resulted in my having to pour at least an ounce of the beer down the drain because it was chock full 'o chunks .
a : the beer pours a dark golden color with a large white head which is 2 finger , and laces well ...

a : pours a clear , dark maroon body that appears opaque in the center , with edge translucence , in slightly larger quantities . as the beer dwindles in my glass , it reveals its clear nature . it pours fairly still , as i would expect for something of this abv , though it maintains a very thin collar of tan bubbles .
a : heavy pour shows a non-stop flow of carbonation . fat shaving cream head on top of a nice orange body . two seconds later , the head was dead as disco .

appearance : dark brown with a creamy tan head with some retention , a little bit cloudy flavor : highly complex malt flavor with undertones of lightly roasted malt , chocolate , slight hop flavor , slightly dry finish
appearance : pours a deep reddish brown with a full finger of vanilla white head that leaves beautiful lacing .
appearance : poured an apple juice gold with a head that dissipated very quickly to a very weak lacing . the color is nice though .
appearance : hazy orange topped by a healthy and frothy ivory head . recedes to a small layer of foam and leaves some ok lacing , but i 've definitely seen better from ipas .

a : appearance certainly shows that this beer is aptly named . extraordinarily pale and yellow . almost unnatural looking with only a small amount of white head that dissipates quickly , leaving no lacing to speak of . really not much to look at .
appearance : hazy orange , with absolutely zero head .

a : pours a deep , reddish-brown . this stout was a lot thinner than i expected - not quite as viscous as other stouts . nor was this stout as dark as others and when i hold it up to the light the glass shimmers a very dark ruby red , but it is not opaque at all .
appearance : served in a goblet , lovely golden color with a small head about a finger high .
appearance : pours a dark brown 1/2 finger head which dissipates quickly leaving a slight lacing on the side of the glass .
appearance : cloudy pineapple juice yellow , with pale orange hues . the head dissipated so fast i could n't see it 's color , i 'll assume it was white .
a : pitch black with a pillow-like head , this yeti expression looks promising in its tulip glass .
a : pours a cloudy light amber with a big , 3-4 finger thick bubbly white head . excellent retention and lacing .

a : even before i begin to pour the beer out , white foam comes rushing out of the bottle . the head is so massive , that i ca n't really pour this beer into a glass . the color is a nice reddish/orange with gobs of chunky lace . the massive amounts of foam detracts from the appearance of this beer . obviously a beer should have a good amount of foam and lace , but i ca n't even try to pour the beer correctly .
a : pitch black with a creamy off-white head that left excellent lacing .
appearance : honey-golden . looks like a light version of guinness given the amazing falling carbonation . foam goes away a bit quicker than with guinness , otherwise i 'd give this a 5 .

appearance : beautiful garnet color with a pale pink head . the head is pretty minimal , though on the second pour , i poured a lot harder and got about a finger 's worth . the head dissipates quickly my there is some lacing
appearance : really nothing going on here . dark , kind of reddish color , with almost no head . whatever head there is dissipates quickly and leaves no lace .
appearance : a dark ruby red in colour , bright and clear . head is a thin off-white lace .
a : pours a cloudy yellow , with a small white head not expected in a wheat beer .

appearance : pours a copper color with orange and red highlights . a huge 6 '' head grows and is light gold in color . it shows excellent retention and leaves lots of foamy lace on the glass . the beer has no carbonation bubbles flowing to the surface .
a : cloudy hazelnut brown with a beautiful creamy even head . lots of rising carbonation .
appearance : a deep golden body , with a very active inch of head that has poor retention and does n't last . medium carbonation levels , but the overall presentation is n't great .
a : poured abysmally dark , with about a two finger dark brown head that when it withered away , looked like sawdust on top of hardwood . the lacing was ridiculous !
a : if your gon na have a billy d williams colt 45 , out of a brown bagged 40 . actually , it was extremely bubbly , it was really impressive even though there was no head .
a : poured into a bulb glass , copper to a lighter gold towards the edges , with a nice thumb-sized bright white head .

a : bottle poured into a large snifter . the head is/was tan , gone in seconds to just a ring of tight bubbles around the glass . swirling leaves some lacing that falls quickly back into the beer . would n't say pitch black here , some dark brown is noticeable when held up to light . not really impressive looking .

a : the beer looks great- golden/straw color similar to la fin du monde . nice thick head that diminishes fast . already laced my glass after a few sips . cloudy , full of yeast which was visible on the bottom of the bottle . fizzy like a can of soda .

appearance : say what you will about nitro beers : regardless , they pour out exceptionally beautifully . after a minute of settling , there 's a still a luscious , thick white head nearly an inch deep . rest of the beer is a dark , clear gold color .
a : straw to light orange color with a nice thick head and lacing , very nice look .
a : ruby brown with about a fingers worth off-white head , settles pretty quickly with little to no lacing at all .
a : pale yellow color , lots of carbonation coming from it . no head at all . was n't made at all to go into a glass .

a : pours deep dark and black . there is not a trace of light that shows through this beer . the head is like dark brown in color and a full inch thick . it settles down to about 1/2 '' and the retention is great . bold sheet lace left behind .
a : very deep chesnut color , quite appetizing to your eyes .
appearance : pours a coffee brown color that shifts to translucent rust at the edges ; no head , no lace
a : hazy dark orange color . less than one finger of creamy off-white head with below average retention , but some lacing . i know the abv is up there , but they could have done better . 4.5
a : fully hazed , bright orange body filled to the absolute brim - so no head . i like the obvious unfiltered-ness , but i like head more . this pour is disappointing .
a : head was thick initially , possibly due to the keg tap being overpumped . head very quickly disappeared . looks light yellow after head goes away .
appearance : dark yellowish close to golden
a : poured from a nip sized bottle into a snifter . completely opaque with no head .
appearance : pours a hazy amber with some golden hues around the rim . almost no head .
a : pours a murky amber under a small white head . no lace , no retention .

appearance : the body has a very dark brown color with some lighter brown highlights . its head builds up thick and slowly settles down to thin cap that hangs on to the last sip . the head is tan in color and makes nice slippery lace that slowly slides down the glass as i drink .
appearance : poured out a dingy , hazy straw yellow with a ridiculously big head of large white bubbles . leaves absolutely no lacing as the head falls to about a quarter inch thick .

appearance : it 's very rare for me to give a 5.0 appearance to a stout . when i look to review the appearance of a beer , i 'm usually looking for : 1 ) color or hue ; 2 ) clarity ; 3 ) carbonation levels , size , and distribution ; 4 ) head shade , density , and retention ; and 5 ) surface and side lacing and collar . it 's hard to get anything terribly useful in the first two categories out of a well-made stout - even if filtered , it 's likely going to be entirely opaque . so even when trying to rate to style , it 's tough for me to give a perfect 5.0 on appearance for a stout . and this beer is indeed black , absolutely opaque , even when held to most direct light . it may or may not be filtered and clear - it 's too opaque to tell . it gets a 5.0 overall though because it manages to get a 5.5/5.0 in the other three characteristics outlined above . the carbonation levels here are perfect , with thousands of fine , well-distributed , perfectly shaped bubbles rolling upwards and forming a mammoth bubble nest up underneath the head . the head is quintessential , picturesque . one finger or so high and a beautiful shade of mocha , it 's as dense , creamy , and sticky as you could imagine . fifteen minutes in and it has n't dropped more than a few tenths of an inch , slowly caving in in the center but leaving thick , solid , rocky sheets of lace clinging to the sides of the glass . which brings us to the lace , a crystalline lattice memorialized permanently along the sides of the tulip .
a : the beer pours a fairly clear , pale yellow color with a finger or so of white head .
a : pours a pale straw color with fine sediment suspended throughout the brew . a small head at the pour quickly dissipates . very little lacing is left on the glass .
appearance : this beer is a deep amber with great head retention , and good lacing .
a : dark , with brownish / ruby highlights around the brew . tiny white head that fades to nothing but a couple bubble on top of the brew . nothing special .

a : pours from a phalic and bulbous bottle to a glass as a golden ale with brilliant clarity . two fingers of loose peanut head dissipates slowly to a sheet of the same . near-sheet lacing . great looking beer .
appearance : nice champagney pilsener , pale gold colour . very impressive head retention . carbonation also impressive . lacing is good also .

a : jet black in my duvel tulip with a dark brown head that 's rather massive , receding to a solid disk . some patchy lacework , pretty darned impressive . some visible carbonation running up the side of the glass

a : poured from a 12oz can into a standard pint glass . pours honey and amber blonde with a thick and creamy head . the head dissipates fairly quick but leaves a nice cloud-like puff at the top of the glass . lacing is n't anything special but has decent cling . held up to the light , the brew radiates a little more golden with carbonation evident .
a : clear brown with very little carbonation . almost no head , with no retention , latency or film on the glass .
appearance : murky and sludgy brown with an off-grey head . not much to look at , but this is a weizenbock so it 's to be expected .
appearance : cloudy golden honey in colour , pouring with sizable creamy white head , with good retention . no visible carbonation at all .

a : pours a dark brown body that seems nearly black in the glass . but when held to the light , it reveals some ruby edge translucence . the head is light beige in color , rising to two fingers of height in a moderate pour of the first half of the bomber . quite nice . retention is great , and it deposits sticky lace on its way down .

appearance : pours a big fluffy 3+ finger medium-thick bright white head . medium to higher levels of carbonation evident that eventually mellows out . very opaque and the colour is a bright golden poppy or amber yellowish-orange . colour is very nice . head is pretty persistent . a thick cap stays the whole way down and leaves some nice lacing . i 've seen lots of weizen and this is probably the best looking one i 've ever seen . ca n't imagine it getting any better than this .
a : pours a cloudy amber with a fluffy 2-finger white head which was slow to receed . lots of sticky lacing throughout .
appearance : 5 |

appearance : looks like it came from a nitro-tap . seriously , unbelievable ! a gorgeous , white , cascading head sits on top of a bright apricot body . i 've never seen a head so dense before . body is very cloudy , but shows golden highlights around the edges . damn good retention and decent lacing . a work of art .
a : poured very dark with a good 1-2 finger mocha colored head . *this is the only positive thing to note for this beer*

appearance : a lot of carbonation here . i do n't know anything about how fresh this is , but it tastes good so i 'll keep going . there is a whole fist of tan head . the beer is a slightly cloudy reddish amber . the head left some lacing on the glass once it decided to go down . nice color , too much carbonation in this bottle .
appearance : dark brown with red to almost purple hints . creamylight brown head .
appearance : bright pale golden-yellow in colour with a dense rocky/frothy white head that hold its ground by staying around for the duration .
appearance : pours a hazy copper . a fluffy , beige head thins to a half-inch layer , laving sheets of lace .

a : pours a half finger head of poor cream , thickness , and retention . colour is an unappealing dark copper . i recall the head being better in the bottled version . sm : absolutely nothing . me broken nose ca n't detect anything . all apologies , lads .
a : the beer is a pale yellow color , with a very thin white head that fades almost instantly and leaves very little lace on the glass .
a : hard pour yields a 2 finger , fluffy white head that 's rough around the edges and collapses rather quickly into a thin white film . beer is a cloudy white peach . lacing is non-existent
a : wow ! outstanding , large fluffy head above a burnt golden ale . so pretty i wanted to take a picture !
appearance : from a rough pour little head is produced . the beer is crystal clear and copper in color .
appearance : pours a 1 finger head , clear yellow and orange with a hint of brown .
a : slightly hazy amber with two-finger , frothy white head that stays awhile . nice bubbles and very good lacing .
a : beautiful - pours perfectly in the glass - head lasts longer than i ever could imagine from this brewer and the lacing is amazing - perfect .
appearance : pours medium-light copper , retains good creamy white , medium dense head , leaves foam on glass walls . perhaps its best attribute .
a : this is about as dark as beer gets .
a : very red , almost like saffron . or perhaps strawberry and cherry juice blended ... well hazed . thick , creamy off white head .
a : amber colored small white head .
a : golden straw , only slightly murky . pours with a nice off-white head , but it quickly dissipates .
appearance : golden amber with half an inch of head . poured a bit carbonated .
a : pours a cloudy golden amber , with 2 fingers of frothy white head .
a : murkey copper with specks of golden yeast chunks . no head , just a tiny white ring around the rim of the glass .
appearance : pours black with a finger of thick tan head . there is a good amount of retention and nice lacing . very good looking beer .

a : four finger head is very thin , lacks cream , and retains badly . gold-copper colour . sm : slight nut hop scent . it 's very difficult to detect individual notes with me broken nose . all apologies , lads .
appearance : very pale gold/yellow , flacid layer of white spittle-like foam that slowly fades out of existance

appearance : pours a very small and thin looking tan film that quickly disappears totally , leaving a bit of a wisp and a small ring of foam . pitch black on color and medium carbonation evident . a ring of film remains but leaves no lacing down the glass . boring .
a : pours a jet black that doesnt show anything lighter when held up to the light . it pours a one finger tan head that lingers .

a : poured very dark amber color , no head/lace , looked viscous as it poured . i did not know what style this was supposed to be until i looked it up here , never would have guessed this was a pale ale .
appearance : dark brown to black in color . wispy head falls immediately to some spotty surface bubbles . no lacing develops .
a : pours a hazy orange with a light head , poor retention , light lace .
appearance : golden yellow body with a decent head and lacing . marked down a bit due to the cloudiness .
a : pours a hazy blonde with a fleeting head . there is a faint ring on the outside of the glass ; no lacing .
a : no head at all . pathetic . colour is a clear yellow . sm : heavily malted barley and light cream . that 's it . the aroma is moderately strong .
appearance : a one finger creamy ivory head that has some retention . the color of the beer is a dark amber with copper hues . the clarity of the beer is clear . the head is leaving some lacing .

appearance : the beer was poured very carefully and still yeilded a 3 '' head of pillowey white foam with a thick vortex of bubbles rising to make the head grow slightly after the pour . it was many minutes later that the head started to fall and left solid islands of lace on the edge of the glass . the beer itself is very clear and light yellow gold . overall this is a very well presented beer .
a : pours amber with a light one finger white head , fizzy carbonation . below average retention , no lace .
a : deep brown pour that resembles root beer . 2 fingers of light tan head that 's a bit fizzy . decent retention and some nice lacing .
a : super cool translucent golden color . even cooler because it gives you the perception of being flat , but it 's not .
appearance : very pale yellow , near colorless . urine has more color . no head as served ( poured part in glass of ice at bartender 's recommendation ) . plenty of bubbly action .
a : nice 2-finger head , and color is a pale straw . a lot of visible carbonation , looks almost like champagne .
appearance : very deep color . really nice red color when held up to the light . toasty tan head color .
a : do n't know but probably looks similar to pee .
a : pours a hazy lemon yellow with absolutely no head to speak of . no lace and no retention .
a : poured jet black with lower carbonation leaving a flat tannish head . like a tomme arthur beer
appearance : clear , light straw color with a fluffy white head that forms large bubbles and quickly colapses on itself .
a : slightly milky golden brown . very nice .
a : aggressive pour yields 3/4 finger of white pillowy head with good retention . the best retention i 've seen from a lager ! crystal clear dark red liquid . very pretty .
a : pours black but not totally opaque . head is beige and very very strong . lacing is medium . head retention is good .

a : pours black with a little dark ruby red when held to the light . 2 1/2 finger light brown head that is super foamy and seems to last forever . beautiful web-like lacing completely covered my glass .
appearance : pours a red amber , filled with yeast sediment . presents a billowing head with faint peachy color . retention is superb , and lacing is phenomenal .
a : pours like a normal stout would , builds a light brown head that fades quickly .
appearance : pink and fizzy like soda instead of foamy like beer . it looks like cloudy strawberry fanta .

appearance : the body of the beer is an impenetrable blackness . the head of the beer is two fingers high with the color of lightly creamed coffee . the head of the beer must have dipped into the viagra because it never showed any signs of letting up . if the head last more than four hours what do i do ? major lacing roadmapped my glass marking the beers passage from my glass .
appearance : could not get a head , and what i did get disappeared . what was left was a bright yellow orange cloudy liquid with no trace of carbonation . it looks like a good fruit juice .
appearance : pours a dark orange color with a thick , creamy looking , off-white head that stuck around for a while .
a : deep gold color with good clarity and mild carbonation . white head starts out firm , but quickly disappears .
a : best part of the experience . big fluffy head on top of a cloudy goldenrod brew . leaves nice lacing down the glass .
a : pale straw topped with a foamy white short lived head .
a : cloudy light straw ? honey color . with a ridiculous billowing and rocky head leaving titanic lacing .
appearance : pours a clear amber/copper in color , nice fluffy head atop this brew . head retention and lacing are all up to par .

a : poured a clear golden/light caramel color with a slight reddish color on the head edge . thick cream colored head good lacing . very clean and clear.. ar : citrus and herb hop blast with a touch of malt in the back round .
a : nice burnt hue to it ... dark amber with a touch of cloud nice fluffy white head that retreats unevenly and fast . tons of lacing and sticky sticky look to it .
a : honey pot yellow . lingering foamy milk colored head
a : pours a dark brown , smallish head , retreats very quickly , virtually no retention , leaves some slight clear , alcoholic ethanol lacing .
a : pale brown in color with a tint of orange and turbid . average sized head with little lacing .

a : pours a one finger head of fair cream , decent thickness , and okay retention . colour is a transparent amber . sm : caramel , interesting yeast , a milky lactic notes , and great hops . a moderate strength aroma .
appearance : a pale orangeish colour w/ a white like head the dissipates quickly
a : pours a pink grapefruit color . head is similar to that of coca-cola or any other heavily carbonated beverage . leaves no lacing .
a : medium brown pour . super dark brown and very light on the edges . one finger light tan head with good retention and great lacing .
appearance : mild clear brown with a big beige head and great retention . this is as goof as this beer will get . i was thrilled by the appearance . ( 4.5 )
a : this beer pours a deep , amber color with very little head .

a : pale gold and fizzy , with one finger of white head that diminishes quickly . remarkably clear for a wheat beer that claims to be unfiltered . yeast sediment is visible at the bottom of the glass . no lacing remains .
appearance : yellowish-orange color with a natural light haze .

appearance : as with many of the sam adams , it looks amazing , especially within their glasses , lol . dark red , almost burgandy in color , with a wispy head that does n't quite disapate , but definitely is n't as pronounced as the boston lager .
appearance : looks exactly like ginger ale , which to my mind is a bit too light . some small bubble carbonation , and a dusting of white foam .
a : pours a pale gold with a light white head , poor retention , no lace .
a : pours a clear garnet red color . a bubbly white head rises to about a finger , and recedes in a second . no lace .
a : straw-golden . good head that dissipates quickly and does n't lace much . low carbonation
a : translucent brown with a razor thin collar of head , minimal lacing
a : poured a straw color with good carbonation and a nice white cap . this was a lively beer throwing off lots of bubbles and it looked very appealing
appearance : pours a very pale yellow with a head that fades quickly to nothing .
a : thin layer of head that has stuck around for 5 minutes , vibrant gold - 4.25 ,

a : started to erupt slowly as i opened it , being about 6+ months old that 's not a good sign . it has a bleached white fluffy 1 finger head that retains very well as billions of bubbles rise up . it has a toasty orange color that is very clear . n : oh yeah , infection ! i can smell the sour fruit and funk . aside from the sour fruit and funk , i get some toasted malts , lightly sweet malts , rice , and perhaps a hint of hops .
appearance : a pleasing copper-amber color . pour yielded a nice 2 finger head that stayed for over 4 minutes..meaning i did n't wait for it to dissappate .
a : average copper/amber pour , think brooklyn lager . very nice clarity . no head when it arrived and produces very little lacing .

a : color is black . pours with a thin tan head that disappears quickly , leaving some spotty lacing and a thin film on top of the beer . edit : poured the second half of the bottle after completing the review and there was a substantial amount ( i mean a lot ) of particulates floating in the beer . i would say once settled that there was a good tablespoon of material floating in the beer . dropped appearance score accordingly .
a : moderate pour yields one finger head that quickly dissipates to nothing . highly fizzy . crystal clear , light straw color .

a : this might be the most interesting liquid i 've ever seen . medium dark brown with prominent tints of red & orange . 100 % absolutely , positively , clear . thin medium brown colored head that quickly disappeared and was never to be seen again .
a : served with a light layer of fine white head with poor retention . beer is a semi-cloudy deep brown . very spotty and sparse lacing with no stick .
appearance : clear and tawny brown , the thin bubbly lace holds virtually no retention at all .
a : pours very dark , permitting only a small amount of light to shine through at the edges . big , thick tan head . good lacing .
a : a vigorous pour reveals a dark ale with a tan bubbly head with some nice sticky lacing around the glass . a closer inspection shows a lot of little bubbles receding towards the top .
a : cloudy , pale amber with a short foamy head , lighting lacing

a : cork ejects with a moderate pop ! this beer is carbonated ! goodie ! ! ! standard pour yields a .5 finger fine light brown head that dissipates quickly . a thick layer of foam clings to the side of the brew . beer is a cloudy , near opaque dark brown . lacing is spotty and sparse with little cling . nice legs though . pretty standard for the style and needs a little help in terms of clarity .
appearance : pours black with very little tan head that goes away completely .

a : pours a perfectly clear , dark ruby red , nearly brown . bottle-conditioned , but the nice compact sediment stays behind . white head persists remarkably well and provides a little lacing - very impressive in a 10.4 % beer .
a : pours a slightly hazy golden-amber body . a 1 '' head fades to a thin film . lacing is extremely light , only a thin strand is formed and fades quickly .
appearance : reddish brown with a slightly yellow head that last the entire beer with a medium amount of lacing .

a : right off the bat i can tell that it 's pretty clear , with only enough haze to make it impossible to read through . it refracts all different colors as light passes through , it shades of medium gold to dark amber . the head is very small and goes away fast , and there is n't any lacing .
a : fairly thin-looking black body with clear reddish-brown highlights around the edges . basically no head , or lace , which is a bit of a disappointment .
a : pallid yellow , indeed the color of urine as is often lamented . thin head .
appearance : the beer pours dead black . the head at first was massive ; however , the head quickly resolved into a ring of foam . there was thick lacing left behind on the glass .
a : good russet color , signs of carbonation , minimal head that quickly vanishes into light lacing that does n't last .
appearance : pours a nice amber orange . small amount of head at the top of the glass . trails of lacing down the pint .
appearance : gorgeous red with thick pink head and nice lacing .

appearance : clear , light amber color on the light side of style . low head retention also good for style . flavor : very rich malt and caramel . warming with some alcohol spiciness . low hop flavor but balanced . finishes dry .
appearance : ( 3 ) pale cloudy orange with a thin frothy head .
a : sorry about the rating on appearance but i drank it straight from the bottle and the only fair way to rate it is put it in the middle .
a : pours pitch-oil slick black , no highlights when held to a back light , no head what so ever , no lacing .
a : color borders between pale and medium brushed amber . no effervescence , head or lacing .
a : pours a brownish-ruby amber with an unimpressively thin tan head that quickly disappeared despite a very rigorous pour .
appearance : pours a really nice amber color , two-finger head which within a minute quickly dissipates . little to no lacing involved .
a : pale amber color not very brilliant with some sediments , a medium head almost white with little retention .
appearance : completely opaque hue ; thick , beautiful , cocoa-brown head ; d-cup 's worth of lace ; fairly good head retention .
a : deep garnet color borders on black . small and fizzy tan head has poor retention , but leaves bits of lace .
a : clear straw body with an inch of creamy white foam . great retention and lacing . beautiful tripel .
a : brightest , yellowest body possible with a big loose head that quickly dissipates leaving no lacing , and a thin bubbly cover .
appearance : light brown with some sediment floating in the beer . the head quickly dissipated and left no lacing , nor a ring around the side of the glass .

a : 330ml bottle -- & gt ; maredsous chalice . pours a beautiful dark shade of orange with lots of carbonation . yields one finger of frothy head with good retention and lots of lacy spiderwebs left behind .
a : this pours a clear , dark red color with a finger of creamy head , and terrific retention and lacing .
a : interesting copper / ruby color . nice thick off-white head that never completely dies . very good looking .
a : pours light golden color with one finger of white foamy head on top , really dense . nice foamy lacing on the sides . lots of carbonation being released to the top .

a : the beer is slightly hazy golden yellow in color and has a very high amount of carbonation , the amount of bubbles that one would expect in a hefeweizen . it poured with a two finger high off white head that has excellent retention properties and consistently covered the surface..
appearance : lots of carbonation and a thick off-white head with medium retention and great lacing . the beer is a light amber color .
appearance : pours a slightly cloudy orangish golden color with a finger and a half of fluffy off white head . great retention and lacing .
a : pours a hazy deep copper color with a white head . the second pour from this bottle left a ton of sediment in the glass , seriously i 've never seen that much come out of a bottle .
appearance : poured a clear gold olour with a small white head . settling to a lacey ring .
a : pours a nice orange with golden streaks when held to a light . it has two fingers worth of foamy off white head . settles to a nice cap and left tons of lacing .
appearance : very dark brown , nearly pitch black with a densely frothy head with an above par retention .

appearance : comes to me quickly ( as i was seated near the bar ) , a gorgeous orange amber-hued beer , replete with medium-speed but small-sized effervescence . the head is foamy , and jiggles as a unit if you bang the table - marvelous stickage . it 's about one finger high , a very light shade of pale tan , and it clings remarkably well to the sides of the glass . a near-perfect looking apa .
a : less than a half finger head , barely any rising carbonation , light gold .
appearance : red copper darker lager , huge head with tons of carbonation
a : endurance takes on the color of good bourbon , with a golden-straw hue . head retention is minimal , and lacing is moderate . clarity is impressive .
appearance : gorgeous ruby-shaded gold . perfect clarity with a creamy , but short-lived head .
a : clear copper with essentially no head .

a : slight ruby in hue . a hard , forceful pour leads to zero head . none . nada . i bobby brown'ed the hell out of it , yet nary an ounce of froth or even a smidgen of lacing appeared . quite dissapointing .
appearance : looked good , nice dark brown like a good porter should be . unfortunately , that was the only good thing about the beer .
a : pours a dark brown , with a medium tan head into a pint glass , poor head retention and no lacing .

a : the color is dark brown with a very rich dark shade of red as the light passes through . there is a wonderful thick head that is eggshell white and laces well . the beer is very transparent and i can read through it , despite the dark color . the head drops down to a thin head , but covers the whole surface .
a : very cloudy , deep straw color . a smooth pour produces minimal head that does retain well , and leaves some spotty lace .
a : pours a dark brown color with thin , pale tan head . no retention and little lace .
a : stone always makes excellent looking brews and this is no exception . virtually perfect . creamy golden color with an inch of white head .

a : pours a slightly translucent dark brown amber , with a large amount of dense tan head . great retention , with a solid blanket lasting nearly through the end of the glass , and leaves thick clumps of lacing .
a : very , very pale yellow inside of its clear bottle . almost like very watered down lemonade .
appearance : pitch black in colour , poured an out of place fizzy head which did not stick around . had n't seen a beer quite like this .
a : clear copper with a decent head
a : pours the color of apple cider , with a one-finger head that dissipates quickly leaving almost no remaining head and no lacing .

appearance : beautiful crisp clear amber . nice two finger thick light colored head which lasts awhile , and goes down to a nice lacing on the sides of the glass and on top of hte beer . minimal bubbliness adds to crisp `` sparkley '' look . this is how i want my beer to look !
a : a very nice brown/red color with almost no head . i was rather dissapointed that on the bottle it said that artificial colorants were added . not my style .
a : soft white fluffy head that sticks surprisingly well over a pale straw body .
a : somewhere between straw and golden pale amber . a wonderful , frothy head grows on this and breaks down in cascading rolls . very nice .

appearance : a deep amber brown murky but so appeasing to the eye poured into my 20oz . gulden draak this is the life , vivacious tan billowing head what eye candy , big patches of lace here nice carbonation perfect appearance .

appearance : pours a 2+ finger thicker looking white head with great retention . perfectly clear with medium carbonation evident . amber-orange in color when held to the light , though more gamboge when not . a good film remains until the end and leaves lots of lacing down the glass . pretty nice looking .
a : pours a slightly cloudy golden , not a lot of head , not much retention
a : pours a dark brown with a one finger off white head . quick dissipation to a small layer of bubbles on top . decent lacing .

a : a creamy textured , sandy colored head 3 1/2 fingers high is produced on a pour staright down the middle of the glass . very long lasting . the body has remarkable clarity showcasing its dark amber-tawny color . thick web-like lacing is left from the head , with only a spare amount being contributed from the body of the beer .

appearance : a deep orange/gold with a -- am i seeing this ? -- pale yellow head . that 's a first . the head is massive and has great retention . slightly cloudy . good lace . very active carbonation . i do n't see how it could get too much better .
appearance : red/amber color with a small white head . there was some lace on the glass but nothing too great .
a : pours a clear , glowing dark orange with good carbonation and a nice frothy white cap
a : neon yellow . no foam . no lace . hazy like turbid piss . think uti .
a : pours a dark ruby red , almost brown color . a small bubbly white head forms , and leaves little lace .
a : pours a dark syrupy amber with a very light head which fizzes away fast . nice colour though .
appearance : orange-gold , a slight haze , big head .
a : dark reddish brown color with a tan head .
a : poured a crystal clear golden color with a nice head and lacing . very impressive clarity .

a : i 'm being generous here because i liked the beer and i do n't think looks are all that important . this looked like a hefe . it was even cloudier than a lot of hefes . it was served to me with a large soapy head .
appearance : pours a deep hazy brown with hints of orange topped by over an inch of foamy tan head that settles slowly .
appearance : props for putting a jalapeno in the beer so that has some curb appeal . golden yellow with 1 finger head that dissipates quickly .
appearance : cloudy faint yellow , and brown with large bubbles with very little head retention . no lacing .
appearance : amber almost orange/gold in color . i poured it nicely , yet a 1 inch head still appeared , and took awhile to dissapear .
appearance : deep ruby-bronze pour with a lush , frothy tan head that leaves creamy lace on everything it touches . pretty .
appearance : coca cola brown with a lackluster mocha head and a lot of bubbles . subpar lacing . much of this is due to the aging i think .
a : light copper color with maybe a centimeter head despite a pretty hard pour

a : beautiful orange-copper liquid . a bazillion parading bubbles marching to the top . a large fluffy tan head that eventually shrinks to a healthy beige film atop the liquid ... but only after oh , maybe 20 minutes . the head sticks around for a long time . the lacing is a testament to , well , lacing . the glass is lined top to bottom with perfectly defined rings that marked each time i put the glass down .
a : cloudy yellow body with two fingers of fine , creamy white foam . nice retention and lacing . very attractive .
a : jet black with a finger and a half of khaki colored head that dissipates slowly .
a : pours a very pale murky straw yellow color with a struggling white head .
a : cloudy dark amber , with more good lacing . the head was very minimal and dissipated quickly .
a : pours pale yellow with a firm , small white head , average retention , no lacing , fizzy .
a : pours like a flat dipa . i understand this is a pale ale late-hopped like a double . medium-cloudy brown . looks like a good carb profile .
a : pours an opaque pitch-black with dark , mahogany highlights . 2-finger rocky tan head settles to a thin cap , leaving a nice amount of lacing on the glass .
a : overcarbonated ? sure seemed that way when it poured . solid amber with a tan , foamy 2-inch head . looks like a standard strong ale ( sans the crazy carbonation ) .
a : pours a golden amber , just on the verge of `` pale '' . head is a nice one finger , but short lived , and leaves little to no lace .

appearance : clear orange in color with a nice 2 finger head . plenty of miniscule carbonation bubbles rising quickly to the top of the glass . the head lasts quite a while . thin paint-like lace develops through the drink .
a : a transparent abourn . an ominous sign .
appearance : reddish-orange-gold color with a big , frothy white head on top . very good retention of the head but there was some uneven and pitted settling of the head that was kind of weird .

appearance : hmm ... absolutely no head on this hard pour . a few dozen ( literally ) large bubbles appear , and even those look pretty pathetic . after a few minutes , they are gone . however , there are some bubbles sticking to the bottom of the glass . the beer itself is dark burgundy , with notes of brown . very dark , not at all transparent , and a little dull .
appearance : it looks like piss . if memory serves , it was also presented in a plastic bottle .
a : pours golden orange , almost no head to speak of .
a : pours a cloudy , orange-chestnut body with poorly retaining off-white head .
appearance : cloudy yellow that looks like a fresh glass of lemonade head : big white head
a : cloudy orange/dark amber with brownish tones . tiny , kind of foamy , head with some lacing .

appearance : i popped the cap , got my glass and then went into the other room to get my notepad , and by then the head in the bottle was slowly growing and pouring out onto the counter . i hate it when that happens . poured a clear , light amber with a very large , thick , pillowy , off-white head with good retention as it slowly diminished to chunks of head . good amount of thick lacing .

a : an odd light hazy straw yellow . it almost looked like lemon lime gatorade with a large white head . the color was awful , but i was impressed with the head retention and lacing all the way through .
appearance : pours a golden yellow , with medium head retention .
appearance : severely dark with a mystical creamy tan 2.5 '' head that transitions into the body .
a : a deep black color with a light brown one finger head . minimal lacing .
a : pours a deep amber color that is slightly hazy with a large amount of thick head
a : pours midnight black with a large , bubbly , dark tan head . good sustain with heavy lacing .
a : straw yellow with about 1/2 a fingers worth of head that dissipates very quickly with no lacing at all .

appearance : when i popped the cap , there was hardly any hiss whatsoever , and upon pouring this one into the glass , my fears were confirmed . a hard pour yields hardly any head , with no retention either . body is hazy copper-amber . flavor : again , the canned green peas are there again . i believe this is a combo between hop flavor and a possible dms issue . the beer has very strong bitterness for an ipa . not sure whether this is a batch issue or a brewer issue . based on the beers that i tried during my recent visit , i 'm definitely leaning toward a batch issue .
a : red body , pink , fizzy head . brownish tint to the red body . no retention , no lacing -- too fizzy for either . excellent clarity .
a : pours pitch , motor-oil black with an enormous tall brown thick head ; it 's so very thick , almost like hard whipped cream . slow dissipation leaves quite nice lacings .
a : it poured a thick , frothy milk chocolate head that slowly died to a thick lace . it 's jet black with a thin amber brown hue .
appearance : uhm ... no head . none . this poured a coarse , little head that vanished . the actual beer itself looks appetizing enough , but no head ? what the hell ? far too flat looking .
appearance : pours a clear pale golden color with lots of foamy suds and great lacing
a : nice lager appearance with clear straw yellow hue

a : an initial strong pour gives a 2-finger spongy , mocha-tan head , crackling softly as it drops to a denser , slightly rocky froth . this sits atop a deep , almost impenetrable ebony , tinged with a bit of garnet at the edges . second pour is even loftier , nearly 4 fingers of crackling head . terrific sticky/sudsy lacing . look , overall , is outstanding for me ...
a : piss yellow with a foamy head that does n't stick around .
a : poured a deep black with a nice brown head that just stayed there . looked amazing , even as i drank there was lots of bubbles
appearance : straw-colored golden . good head which dissipated fairly quickly .
appearance : a creamy mocha crown acts as a barrier between the air and the absolute darkness of this beer .
a : certainly pours a red or deep amber ... sandy coloured head forms magnificently on top , with modest retention but a full on coat of lace left as a souvenir .
a : pours a dark , murky brown , with a small , slightly tan head , with poor retention and no lacing . lots of sediment , with lots of floaties in the brew solution .
appearance : amber in color , reddish tint , little carbonation and almost no head
appearance : clear golden with a killer head that has perhaps one of the best head retentions we have ever seen .

appearance : body was cloudy and very pale yellow . a thin , white film sat on top and clung to the glass perimeter . streams of carbonation could be seen rising along the edges . very odd , but so is the style ( this was my first gose ) .

a : pretty scared opening this one . okay first it pours like motor oil very thick looking . color is a deep brown almost black color with little black specks floating all inside it . head was this thing supposed to be carbonated . it was nonexistent .
appearance : clear , pale amber/straw color , weak soapy head with poor retention . medium carbonation .
a : light yellow with a huge foamy white head .
a : a nice amber color , maybe with more of a golden hue , with a nice head that laces well ...
a : healthy pour yields a 1 finger semi-fine white head with decent retention . beer is a clear , pinkish-peach . lacing is ringed and patchy with decent stick .

a : pours a five finger head with an impressive upward bubble show that lasts about twenty seconds . lovely brilliant cream lacing and wonderful perfect thickness for a stout . soft and velvety appearance . retention is incredible as always ; the bottle did n't have a nitro-widget and does n't need one . dark ruby-black colour . highly appealing . sm : where to start ? cream , coffee , toffee , chocolate , roasted ( and thankfully unmalted ) barley , caramel , and assorted nutty hop hints . brilliantly complex and appealing , but not overbearing . relatively light strength .
a : clear orange pour . small head at first , but quickly fizzles to nothing
a : the beer is a very pale yellow color with a very thin white head that fades quickly and leaves very little lace on the glass .

appearance : beautiful rubies translucent with a thick head that moderately disappears and a lace that lasts to the last drop flavor : toasty malt with light coffee low hop bitterness and moderated alcohol
a : dark to obsidian with dark tan head - one finger high . foam lacing lingers as you drink .
appearance : gorgeous dark colour with mahogony hi-lites . head pours like a rootbeer float , lasts quite some time and has excellent lacing . this head lasts forever .
a : pours a clear dark yellow/golden with one finger worth of foamy head . settles to a solid cap and left quite a bit of lace .
a : color is a very cloudy , straw , dull yellow . pours with a one-inch eggshell head .
a : light mahogany , 1 finger off-white head dissipates moderately , little lacing that shimmers in the light .
a : the beer pours a weird orangey brown color with a small off-white head ...
a : the beer pours a hazy pinkish-orange color with almost no head .

a : the pour of a guinness is a beautiful thing to watch . the way the head forms and the wonderful tan color of it . the beer is very dark almost black looking but small bits of light do manage to penetrate .
appearance : slight chill haze with an orange-amber pour . there is a tall and super bubbly/foamy ivory head that settles very quickly and has absolutely no head retention and leaves no lace behind .
a : clear , bright ruby color . no head . no lacing .

appearance : pours to a murky caramel-brown at first , then clears up to an amber-yellow . the head , however is simply fantastic . the widget creates a huge , thick and creamy light tan head that settles and retains a 2 finger froth that simply does not go away .
a : pours a golden colour with quite a lot of floating sediment visible . 2 finger white head with good retention and leaves a sticky lace .

a : deep dark brown with ruby highlights . murkily opaque . pours with a thick tan head with a persistent quarter inch head stand . this beer has some serious legs as well . sticky lacing develops as my nonic is drained .
a : black , a little quilt of dark mocha foam falls to a web on the surface . no lace . opaque .
a : the appearance is really nice , it is a deep gold , with a long lived fluffy head and nice lacing .

a : pours a light amber tinged golden with a large , dense , bright white head that slowly faded into a very thick and fuzzy film that left streaks of lacing down the glass . carbonation looks very active .
a : short to little , and completely no head retention . a light blonde , whiskey color .

a : crystal clear and light yellow in color , this beer is teeming with an even , methodical effervescence . the head is a finger thick , displays admirable staying power , and leaves a good amount of lacing on the glass .
a : dirty dark brown pour , no head , soft white ring near the top
a : looks very good . dark with ruby highlights . thick off-white head that fades medium .

a : the body pours a rich copper hue , with no head formation at the start and the slight amount of carbonation bubbles form a thin ring around the top of the glass , that holds on very slightly . the levels of carbonation in the body are very minimal .
a : a nice amber color , with no head at all , just some faint bubbling at the top of the beer ...
a : brown , light orange head
a : pours with an average head of 1 1/2 fingers , off-white in color , fizzy and rapidly diminishing . the body is light amber orange in color and is ridiculously clear . no lacing to speak of .
a : thick misty gold , very exceptional here in finland . head left me unimpressed being only about a centimeter thick and disappeared quickly .
appearance : very generous , creamy head . chilled haze , body orange-amber . thick lacing all around .
a : amber color , sudsy finger of head that retains nicely . nice suds of lace to boot . nice look .
a : super deep black with a finger of tan head . some lacing .

a : well , after taking the cap off , foam oozed out the head of this for at least a minute before i stopped it . not off to a good start . when poured into my glass , calmly , i got about 1 cm of beer to ~7 fingers of head . the beer is a clear reddish brown and the head is light brown . after the head settled down , i had just over an inch of beer left in the glass .

appearance : pours out to nearly the clearest yellow i 've ever seen , even including light beers , with a thin wispy white head which disappears as quickly as is foamed up . it may be darker after i 've finished with it ...
a : ruby-brown-black , off-white head , initially a little lace , but no retention . perhaps due to the age of the bottle ? ( i think it may have been brewed in september ) .
appearance : quite a darker shade of brown , the head was more subdued and was greyer , and had a few dusky chunks in there ...

a : pours an oily , tar-like impenetrable black with 1 finger of chestnut brown , fine-laced head that dissipates slowly . a nice thick layer of creamy lacing clings to the side of the glass and does not let go . extremely impressive ! n : espresso , rich toffee , molasses , roasted barley , bittersweet chocolate and hints of citrusy hops .
appearance : yellowish-gold hue with a tantalizing layer of pure-white head ( creamy on top and spongey beneath ) , slight haziness , some varied-size bubbles rising quickly
appearance : thin lacing to start with shows that the head is deficient . bright brassy brownish amber gives off clarity .
appearance : light yellow , golden !
a : a slightly hazy deep honey-amber . head is almost inexistant , and even with an aggressive pour , is very short and drops to all but nothing in no time .

a : nice lighter orangey-amber color , with an inch of creamy head that recedes and leaves a good ring of lace throughout . i expected something a little lighter in color , possibly a darkish golden/straw color , and im pleasantly surprised by this appearance . i hope it tastes as good as it looks .
a : dark brown , thin white foam rings the glass
a : the pour is certainly fitting for the style . nearly black in color with an initially formbidable tan head that eventually settles down to a thin cap .
a : nice dark reddish-brown in color . nice 2 finger head that dissipates pretty quickly but had very nice lacing ... . good looking beer
a : first off it comes in a cool jug like quart bottle but ounce its poured it a nice foamy head which leaves a good laceing . the color is a nice dark amber brown .
appearance : it has a cola colored body with a reddish tint . the head is brow/tan that disappears quickly to form a thin line of lace . there is not much for lace just a little bubble island .

a : breathtaking beer . pours a clear gold topped with a full three inches of rich , chunky white head - three times in a row . the head is so clingy that what sticks to the glass can hardly be called lace : it 's like half the head never goes away . the final pour from the bottle brings some cloudy yeastiness , but up until then the clarity left a great view of the carbonation rising steadily from the etched `` d '' on the bottom of the glass . epic .
a : pours a dark brown and is topped by a thin sheet of foam that sticks to the outer walls of the glass . one of the more enticing appearances of a pumpkin ale .
a : burnt amber beer with a frothy two finger cappuccino colored head and excellent lacing .
a : darker amber color with a medium haze . one finger rocky white head with great retention and lacing .
a : brilliantly clear pale yellow color with huge 3+ finger head that fades very slowly n : nose of a light belgian type wit with some light malts , touch of spices , toasted quality , touch of yeast
appearance : the body is a semi-transparent dark brown , with a golden tint , and a super-thin head that just rings the glass ever so slightly , leaving essentially no lacing
a : pours a bright golden color with a rocky three-finger head that dissipated quickly .

appearance : poured well , with no head to speak of , just some large bubbles that did n't stick around too long . color of apple cider . i must say at this point , i 'm a little dissapointed , as reviews i 've read mention a 1 to 2 finger white head . no head for me , story of my life .
a : pours out a very hazy honey orange with glinting highlights of marigold yellow . slim white head of about half a finger rises and then slowly melts into the body of the beer .
a : yeast specks detract from the experience .
appearance : dark , thin film , no lacing
appearance : dark with nitro waterfall action .
a : very pale golden color with some good lacing .

appearance : poured into a half liter weizen glass . i think this bottle was on the shelf a little too long . poured a clear , deep straw yellow , but i noticed a huge hunk of dark yeast at the bottom as i swirled the remainder . i managed to break it loose and pour it into the glass . after that the color darkened to a diarrhea dark yellow/brown , and larger pieces of the yeast settled to the bottom . surprisingly little head developed for a hefe . it does n't look very appetizing .
a : pours a reddish amber color . a white head forms , but recedes to nothing in a second . no lace .
a : bodacious carbonation produces a stunning whipped butter 2 inch head . the body is hazy , the color of rusy caramel . so far , so good .

appearance : hazy amber pour with a sticky and sudsy off-white head that retains well . flavor : ick . corn-like sweetness followed by some earthy bitterness . onion-like flavors follow and more grassy hop notes . straw-like hops and fresh cut grass . balance is to the hops . finish is clean and dry . aftertaste is long and oniony .
a : the beer is a very pale yellow color and as close to clear as ive ever seen in a beer , with a large white head that fades very quickly and leaves a spotty lace on the glass .
a : pour is dark brown with red notes . there 's a brown large light head that dissipates medium-fast leaving some lacings .
a : amber in color . clear with a good deal of active carbonation . a thin head quickly recedes leaving nary a cap nor a trace of lace .

a : the ale is a pale straw color that is absolutely the most brilliantly clear beer that i 've ever seen . it is a stunning beer to look at , to see the steady stream of carbonation . just beautiful .
appearance : clear light yellowish color with almost no head despite a vigorous pour . carbonation bubbles show its not dead .
a : copper body under a good sized , puffy white head . excellent retention .

a : served from a can , and let me tell ya , i got a kick out of the can . it has 2 bars at the bottom , to tell me not only when my beer is cold , but when its super cold , what ever the hell super cold is , also advertises its wide mouth , and a vent off the mouth that supposedly helps pouring . its kind of like miller lite with its vortex neck , if your beer tastes like swill you have to throw in some gimmicks . i talk of the can , cause there 's nothing to good to talk about the beer 's appearance . the head disappeared almost immediatley , no lacing , and overly bubbly . also a very pale yellow , almost like someone poured water into a beer .
appearance : poured a sick yellow with minimal head . retained no head throughout the session .
a : pours a clear , radiant orange-amber into a stein , with about a finger of fizzy head that dissipates rather quickly .

a : pours from the can with a light golden colour , and with a loud fizzy effervescence . you could hear the fizz all the way from the other side of the room . the half inch head settled to nothing in under 30 seconds . the carbonation went flat by the time the beer was finished . ( less than 10 minutes ) .
a : pours a very dark black color with a beautiful tan head and slight lacing .
a : deep red color towards top , tends more light towards the bottom of the pilsener glass . s &
a : pours a light amber color with thin head that dissipated very quickly

a : what always impresses me with the belgian ipas made in belgium is the head . nothing else comes close . it seperates and looks like a chunk of marshmallow is floating around in liquid marshmallow . the beer itself is a hazy golden color .
a : hazy yellow/gold , no head , no lace .

appearance : poured a medium brown , semi transparent , very hazy . two finger head , which quickly dissapeard . little to no laceing . poured some of the chunks accidentally into my glass . no biggie , my homebrew hasnt killed me , this shouldnt .
a : well there is more than enough carbonation . the beer is a darker shade of amber and hazy . a thin but good head will remain on the beer after it largely subsides . there is good lacing .
appearance : pours a nice clear red with a great deal of head that fades somewhat quickly . does leave behind some nice lacing .
appearance : very impressive . a big head seems to coat the glass all the way down . body is a brilliant hazy straw color with a neverending stream of bubbles rising to the top .
a : pours deep dark brownish red with a tall brown compact head that quickly sinks into no lacins .
a : hazy deep orange body with absolutely no head . a few miniscule bubbles can be discerned clinging to the sides of the glass , but this looks essentially flat .
appearance : jet black with brown creamy head . spotty/ layer lacing .

a : pours a rather dark burnt-orange with a billowing , dense and oily light tan head that took many minutes to collapse under its own weight into a thick and chunky mountain of foam . nearly a solid sheet of lacing was left down the glass as this butte of a head dissipated . this is a thing of beauty .
a : pours a light copper color with a fluffy white head that recedes to a thin head but leaves nice sticky lacing in its absence .
appearance : black , opaque , light brown head and lots of lacing .
appearance : four finger shaving cream egg shell white head , amazing retention , deep dark amber color , lots of carb , really great lacing .

a : enorrmous chunky/fluffy white head , with great retention - almost 3 fingers high - there are very few beers that come close to this kind of rockiness . a hazy straw-colored golden with copious amounts of tiny carbonation .
a : nice copper color , not very transparent . about a 1.5 finger very puffy off-white head with great retention . not very bubbly at all . however this has some of the best lacing i 've ever seen .
appearance : very clear with a light gold colour . the head is white , large , frothy and presents a good retention .
a : pours a deep amber/garnet color with 2 fingers of fluffy tan head that fades slowly leaving plenty of lacing all over .
appearance : murky orange . head pours slightly off white and retreats quickly to the sides .
a : light copper and mahogany , with a head that disappears to a couple clusters of big bubbles clinging to one side of the snifter . brilliantly clear .

appearance : a gorgeous , clear golden hue , with a big , frothy , foamy head , and possibly the stickiest lacing i 've ever seen . the lacing on the side of the glass is literally visibly three-dimensional , rigidly jumping off of the walls . scatters the light beautifully - just stunning .
appearance : pours a brownish-red color . it has a thin fizzy head that dissipates almost immediately and leaves no lacing at all .
a : crystal clear bright golden color with a one-and-a-half finger foamy white head . visibly highly carbonated .

a : judgment day pours cola brown with a massive 5-finger head . held up to a light , some red streaks through , but otherwise the color is clear maple . jd 's tan head is both a blessing and a curse . because the carbonation is so high , it takes a 5-minute settling time and a repour to get a decent fill . then , the head forces more wait time to access the beer . however , the head is persistent , and moussy , and leaves giant globs of foam on glass . i can think of no beer that 's left this much head behind - cocoons of cream adorn the sides of glass , clinging on to the end .
a : bright straw body with a big loose white head that quickly dissipates leaving little lacing , and no cover . nothing special .
a : appears deep black , opaque , nice cocoa colored head with spotty lacing , decent retention
appearance : a reddish bronze color with a wispy head that disappeared quickly .
a : very light coloring , ridiculously large pillow on top that i have rarely seen on any other beer . added a lot to the experience of the beer .
a : pours a hazy , dusky apricot colored ale with no head , no evidence of carbonation . no lacing .
appearance : poured a golden amber with two fingers of bubbly/pillowy off-white head . decent retention . plenty of visible carbonation . nice lacing . great looking beer .
a : amber-orange , not cloudy at all ; initially a little white head , no retention or lace . where 's the wheat protein ?
a : very thin head tops a caramel copper colored pour without much carbonation visible .
