a : 1.5 finger head of slight cream , nice thickness , and good retention . colour is a hazy murky yellow-gold . sm : fresh sliced apple is very dominant and very luscious . maybe some spice is present as well . a strong scent , and a pleasant one . bravo .

a : pours a hazy copper-amber body with a couple of inches of fluffy foam . retention is impressively long ; over 5 minutes the head collapses in sections before leaving a thick island clump on top , which floats around as i drink . there is also a thick collar around the edges that leaves some beautiful lacing down the sides of the glass .
appearance : autumn brown/orange look with a patchy beige/orange head . carbonation rises to the surface in perfectly straight verticle lines on the side of the glass .
appearance : lightness personified , clear yellow , with a short , soon dead head , leaving only upwardly migrating bubbles , but nothing lasting on top .
a : very dark brown . good head formation and nice retention .
a : pours a dark brown with red hues . thick brown head with good retention . left good lacing down the glass .
appearance : looks good , looks attractive , burnished gold look to it .
appearance : pours a cloudy orangish amber with under a finger of off white head that disappears completely .
a : dark brown . no head , just white foam along the edge of the glass . no lacing .
a : standard pour yields a 1.5 finger head coarse pink head with moderate retention . beer is a gorgeous crystal clear dark red satin . lacing is spotty but hangs out for longer than expected .
a : very dark brn , fizzy minimal head
appearance : dark brown and relatively opaque . pours a 1-finger thick tan head that slowly dissipates into a healthy film . leaves some good lacing down the sides and looks good the whole way .

a : almost no head on this one , poured about about a knuckle high and quickly died down to a thin film hovering over the beer . there is some substantial lacing , whatever is left of the head really sticks ! the beer poured a cloudy amber , looks like there is little activity going on as far as carbonation is concerned , but the color is very inviting .
a : perfect amount of carbonation , 1.25 inch head with tiny to small bubbles . plenty of rising carbonation . dense yet warm and bright yellow in color .
a : pours a red/copper with a three-finger frothy head with great sustain . good lacing .
appearance : clear light yellow/golden color . head very thin and then quickly gone . head very similar to their raspberry wheat ale . no lace left .
appearance : pours a hazy , dull-looking golden body with a very , very scant white head that disappears nigh instantly .

a : great looking brew ! golden orange with a big foamy white head that does n't want to ever go away , and leaves sticky lacing . constant show of bubbles continues throughout which keeps a good amount of head in tact the entire time .
appearance : pours a cloudy dark apricot-brown color . minimal off-white head for the first 10 seconds , but then it is gone and you can just see tons of carbonation at the surface .

appearance : bloody red body which has a perfectly clear sheen . flamingo pink creamy head starts at 1 thick and settles to a more accommodating thick uniform cap . little to no sign of any carbonation but great looks nonetheless .
a : dark brown with a small amount of head and not much lacing .
appearance : very dark , no light penetrates . a smallish one finger lightly colored head covers the beer but disapates within a few minutes .
a : garnet in color with a cream head that lasts through the entire experience . the head sticks to the glass in rings , marking your progress .
a : pours a dark cloudy reddish brown , with two fingers head- viewed from the top , my glass looks like a bowl of oatmeal . excellent lacing as well .
a : clear yellow piss with a few bubbles lurking throughout , but nothing to write home about .
a : pours a cloudy yellow with huge gobs of sediment . good head formation , but not so great on sustain or lacing .
appearance : dark , ruby red beer . off white frothy head stands tall and sticks well..just sheets of lace stuck to the glass in clumps .
appearance : hazy orangish , not super appealing to look at , minor lacing along glass . whispy foam , light carbonation .
a : light yellow apperance with a white head of foam that was not unlike the 7-up i poured at lunch . medium low carbonation .
a : beautiful blood orange ale with excellent clarity . single finger falls to a quilt of pretty pink velvet foam . cobweb lacing .
a : deep amber color with a modest sized head that holds well and leaves ok lace . not much rising carbonation , but very good clarity

appearance : pours a thin 1 finger white head that quickly fizzes away to a thin film . medium to low end carbonation evident . colour is a dark orange peel with lots of little floaties . a thin film remains but leaves no lacing down the glass . below average for the style , unfortunately .
a : filtered golden color with a decent long lasting white head .
a : pours jet black and a finger size of mocha colored foam head that settles slightly and leaves a very nice thin cover over the top . there is nice lacing to the glass as well
a : extremely dark with little head activity , and before the head quickly fades it 's a light brown head .
a : un-wheat beer like clear pale golden color with rising bubbles and a white head that quickly dissipates to a thin film
appearance : dark brown , little to no head retention
appearance : loke a lot of other reviewers sampling this after a couple of years , the beer pours a hazy russet with very little head and just a few dots of lace
a : pours a half finger head of fair cream , decent thickness , and bad retention . colour is a solid black . sm : vanilla , nuts , caramel , and light chocolate . a moderate strength aroma .
appearance : bright gold body which is clear and full of bubbles . the head is barely 2 fingers though and recedes rapidly .

a : a clear , pale straw color until the sediment is agitated , then it takes on a hazy golden orange . a foamy rich head with no lacing and low retention . the head forms a small ring around the glass .

appearance : this beer pours with a murky amber appearance and has yellow grain like particles floating in it . not very impressed by the lacing as it was barely a finger and does n't seem to lace or retain . shows some solid signs of carbonation though .
a : deep , rich copper under a small creamy white head . great retention , creamy through out with really nice lace . a perfect looking lager .

a : four fingers of bright white , stiff foamy head with excellent retention . the color of the body has a rustic amber-orange character . bottle conditioning produces a light cloudiness and lots of interior bubbles . lacing is more than adequate . s &
appearance : a fall orange with a slightly brown hued head . looks like your average beer .
appearance : this beer has a pale golden color , with a nice thick head of white foam .
a : a fairly rough pour results in two inches of tight , creamy tan head atop a clear , orange-amber body . terrific , rocky retention and plenty of lace . gorgeous beer .
appearance : no head or retention . looks like a watered down mountain dew .
a : the usual ultra pale yellow , very clear . pretty moderate sized head that leaves behind some nice lacing .
a : very dark , slight garnet hues when held up to the light . thick off white head , great lacing down the glass . bubbles sit on the bottom of the glass .
a : dark garnet in color . nice thick creamy white head .
a : poured a light golden color with a minimal , fizzy head .
a : dark brown with a slightly reddish hue and an absolutely perfect creamy head . reminded me of the head of a proper irish guinness .

appearance : clear golden blonde , but with tiny little freckles that danced in suspended animation , crowned with very nice head that seemed to have two layers of head ; large , soapy bubbles were trapped underneath a thick dense foam on top .

appearance : this beer 's party trick is in its appearance . most of it is standard to the style ; clear amber and a 1 and half finger head . with an aggressive pour i was able to generate a 1 and a half finger head that was foamy . the head dissipated slowly into an equally as frothy lacing . i have never seen the lacing of a mild pale ale cling to a glass like this . my glass was a mess of sticky lacing after i was done . an impressive appearance .
a : pours a slightly hazy orange with a finger of white head that recedes into a sudsy ring with no lacing .
appearance : a very pale orangy-gold coloured beer , but with some chill-haze . head settles very quickly to a very thin white whispy lace .
appearance : apple juice color , no head , runny lacing .
appearance : dark end of pale . hazey . malts body is inviting under the white neglige of moderate head .
a : black color . two fingers of fizzy , light brown head that fell at breakneck speed and left no lacing . 4.0
a : brownish orange color . the beer is unfiltered . aggressive pour did n't give much of the off white head and the little i had did n't have much retention or lacing .

a : perfection . pours completely clear with a thick pillowy head that sticks around for awhile . great carbonation level along with a perfect deep copper color . exactly what an ipa should look like .
a : ruddy dark clay brown . single finger of taupe foam falls to a sheet of the same . no lace . murky .
appearance : deep brown , with a touch of orange seen when held up to a bright light . two fingers of dense light tan foam , having decent retention . left extensive lacing .

a : i never really knew what an appearance of 1 would look like , but this is definitely that bad . most american macros have a warm yellow color even if they do n't have taste to back it up . this is the thinnest beer i 've ever seen - extremely pale not quite green , not quite yellow , not quite clear .
a : tons of yeast . bottle-conditioned to the max ( literally ... there 's yeast on the cap ! ) . orange-brown , off-white head , some retention & lace .

a : pours a really neat cola ale with a single finger of light tan head which falls quickly to a centrally capped sheet of the same . little/no lacing . gotsta give some recognition here , man it 's brilliant , never seen a quad with this much clarity .
a : exceptionally bright amber/gold with a dense pure white head with excellent retention . some light lacing .

a : pours a very much port like dark purple almost merlot color with a completely non-existent head . swirl this bad boy and you get some serious oily caramel colored residue on the glass . this guy has some amazing wine/alcohol legs to it -- thick and evenly spaced . again , is this a port or a beer ?
a : pours a slightly translucent hazy orange with a creamy offwhite bubbly 1 '' head on the top . a picture of perfection .
a : light golden in color , with hints of orange . one inch of foamy off-white head . thin lacing .
appearance : pours jet black with a 1/2 '' dark brown head . it dissipates quickly and leaves a murky surface above the beer . no laving remains .

a : pours a hazy , light golden color . head is moderate ; the pour unlocks a finger or less of foam , with short retention and little lacing down the glass . i do n't know if it 's an off bottle , but this and the lack of clarity are two dings . too bad the appearance is weighted so heavily .

a : clear medium-amber body with a thin , faint , ephemeral off-white head ; decent lacing . might have been better-looking with a more vigorous pour , but pretty boring as-is . let 's hope the lack of a real head promises more intense hoppiness to come .
a : a dense , dark brown color with some chestnut hints . the head is quite large , foamy , and fluffy , with a light tan color . retention is very nice , with attractive lacing .
a : really nice looking brownish red color . poured with a finger of slightly off white head .

appearance : arrives a transparent ruby-tinged brown with an opaque center and no head , very sedentary . a little unattractive , though the vivid mahogany around the edges of the glass is pleasant . a thin ring of foam ( and no ancillary lacing of any type - on the surface of the beer or the sides of the glass ) is all that remains of what i assume was once a head . not attractive , but understandable , given the style and the barrel aging .
a : golden , slightly amber color . one and a half finger head fluffy white head . lots of lacing .
a : perfectly clear deep ruby , edging toward brown . pours with a two-finger whitish head that lasts all the way down . perfect lacing . literally `` can not improve anymore '' .

appearance : careful , decanting pour to prevent disturbing sediment as recommended on tag attached to bottle . slight chill-haze copper-amber body . weak , fizzy , off-white head that quickly fades to a small sustained edge ring . no lacing to speak of .

a : viscous pour yields a .5 finger coarse , dark beise head with poor retention . beer is one of the only brown ales that i 've seen that 's actually brown . near opaque . lacing is sparse and spotty with little cling .
a : nice head with good lacing . good balance of color and superb clarity . ruddy walnut color .

appearance : clear medium golden color with a moderate snow-white head , which collapses to scattered islands of foam in less than a minute . lively fast-rising carbonation does little to sustain the head .

appearance : pouring a beer in the normal fashion yields little head , you end up with something that looks like a stadium pour . the only way to generate a head from this beer is to pour it down the middle which yields a 1 and a half finger head that dissipates all too rapidly . lacing is thin . the color is a reddish tinted amber . clear with a slight haze .

a : slightly hazy light and pale wheat . the pour explodes with a huge head of white foam that overfills my glass , thought i had passed beer pouring 101 years ago ! yikes this resembles a washing machine with too much soap ! it just will not lay down
a : very dark body ( near black ) with a very disappointing non existent head ... no signs of lacing .
a : pours an amber body with a small white head without much retention and lacing to speak up . head seemed to dissipate pretty quickly , leaving very minimal lacing as i drank the beer .
appearance : murky orange yellow low carbonation and no head

a : dark brown , almost black ; no light comes through , even on the edges . pored & lt ; 1/2 finger chocolate-colored head that dissipated quickly to a skim around the edge . laced in intermittent wavy rings .

appearance : the bottle itself is intriguing with an interesting shape and stylish metallic label . from the pour there is very minimal white head , which results in a completely nonexistent lacing . the color of the beer is a light amber , almost a light reddish shade of gold .

appearance : pours a beautiful raspberry brown to copper with an amazing 3 finger crown that is slightly mocha with a hint of red . retention is strong and lace is everywhere . top notch looking fruit beer !
appearance : pours a murky-as-hell amber with all variety of shit floating around in it . i think this might be unfiltered . head retention is excellent however .
appearance : pours a very dark brown with a reasonable amount of light coming through . there are three fingers of off white fluffy head and a good layer of head remains throughout .
appearance : pours a clear orange color with no head other than a few surface bubbles . no lacing develops .
a : pours a clear copper color with about a finger of white head that quickly recedes into a tiny ring with almost no lacing .
appearance : cloudy murky stray colored . no head . no lacing

appearance : cracked the cap with a nice whoosh of carbonation . the beer pours an opaque jet black with a ton of carbonation . almost 3 fingers of mocha tan colored head that recedes slowly leaving a huge billowy layer along the top and great lacing down the edges of the glass . the liquid itself is amazingly dark . most oatmeal stouts let in some browns around the edges , but this one is all dark and mysterious . love it !
a : the pour looks like piss but with less carbonation : neon-yellow piss color with no head at all .

a : stunning shade of brownish-burgundy red ( machine gun metal rust , mudslides , fresh blood , `` cooked '' pinot noir , vintage port at its prime , sherry ) that positively glows like nothing else i have seen in a glass . a little fizz , no head , but no matter : nothing else is like this . n : strong hit of apple cider/red wine vinegar rounded off by slabs of oak and odd fruit ( plums , cherries , apples ) . honestly , it frightened me at first and i wondered if perhaps i had gotten a bad bottle , but then of course i realized it 's flanders red we 're talking about here . not wonderful , but not awful , but really free your mindset for this and you shall be rewarded . p/m : unlike anything else . immediate hit is oak drenched sourness , bordering on apple cider/red wine vinegar again but also with some strong sweet centrist flavors ( almost sugar sweet , but not quite as it gets swallowed up by the intense sourness ) . surrounding this vertical attack are bits of sweet fruit and just pure intensity , rounded off in the end by a long and slow burning finish of hot pepper , vinegar sourness , and a creaminess that is simply wild . smooth finish . this is hard to rate in terms of taste because it 's almost too intense in comparison to panil , yet more complex . i 'm impressed by the uniqueness of the style but this really is an epic journey into the most extreme netherworlds of beer . i could see how some folks would or could adore this . the after effects of drinking this left me a little shuddered and craving seltzer since all i could taste and feel was vinegar .

appearance : served in a straight half-pint glass , it pours slightly hazy , copper colour , with an interestingly sparse white head reminiscent of some forcefully-poured plum or longan-fruit tea . not too impressive for a decent pint , that is .
a : pours a black cola color , very small head that dissipates rather quickly , zero lacing

appearance : pale golden colour , visible carbonation , thin white head . last few drops from the 120z bottle were completely made up of sediment that mesmerizingly swam down to the bottom of my weizen glass . by the time it all settles , it was rather cloudy .
a : poured into a snifter . gorgeous hazy apricot with about 1 finger of head .
a : pours a beautiful dark amber color with a thick rocky light tan head . very clear with red highlights , very nice looking beer .
a : the beer pours a dark amber color , almost copper with a finger of slightly off-white head .
appearance : clear dark brown , almost black in color . no head forms even with vigorous pour . no lacing develops .
appearance : pours a very clear amber color with a small amount of white head that goes away almost completely .

appearance : a- , pours a dark amber/brown , the color resembling apple cider , with a one a half finger width cream colored head . very opaque appearance , even for a wheat ale . decent retention at first that thinned to almost nothing about 1/3 of the way down the glass . very slight lacing . appealing look , i was excited to drink this beer .

a : well , pitch black of course . unbelievable head retention that is sitting at about one fingers worth so far . the head itself is a light brown/tan , hinting at some of that bourbon barrel effect . not really sure where a bourbon barrel stout could improve here .
appearance : it 's the reddish-brown color of spiced rum . poor head retention .
a : a great looking beer . pale and crystal clear with a thick fluffy white head that left substantial lacing through the entire 30 min drink ...

appearance : pours with over three fingers of light tan head . this sticks around , only settling a small amount , and leaving some nice sticky lacing in its retreat . the lacing continues all down the glass as i drink , very nice ! the beer itself is a rich orange/copper color and perfectly clear .
a : dark golden body with three fingers of white fluffy head . leaves loads of thick lacing and has great retention .
a : hazy yellow-orange gold colour , with some small bubbles rising . the head is white , plentiful and quite creamy . very good head retention and wonderful lacing .
a : clear light-gold body under a finger of tight , creamy white head . good retention and lots of light lace . pretty great for a fizzy yellow beer .
a : clearish amber with a steady stream of small bubbles . a nice finger of head leaves behind nice lacing . a pretty beer , but nothing exceptional .
a : damn . this beer is bubbling up like a champagne . it 's got a great golden color and a thick white head . the head almost seems like one of those `` phonies '' from the big breweries .
a : a scant 1 finger head of off-white bubbles sits above an orange , glowing body , very hazy .
a : pours semi-viscously with about a finger of creamy head with surprisingly retention . utterly opaque and almost black . good looking stout . ridiculous lace .
a : dark chestnut body with a perfect mountainous tan head . excellent .

a : pours a very fizzy but somewhat aggressive head , that fades pretty quickly , but is quickly subdued by the huge number of bubbles rising from the etch at the bottom . the head is a messy bastard with lots of big bubbles , and pieces of head caught on the glass like dead bodies littering a war zone . the beer itself is brilliantly clear , a lot more than my fogged up glasses , and has a light tan straw pilsner like color . n : nose starts with a definite pilsner aroma , with some sweet malts , wheat , straw , sounds about right . a little bit of toasty malts , with some sweet crisp lager yeast aroma . however , there is a slight ... not skunked aroma , but a weird not so fresh aroma . i ca n't really describe it better , but whatever it is its very light . the nose in general is very light .
a : it looked dark . really dark . nearly black body with just a thing white head . left behind thin white lacing as well .
appearance : pours a pallid straw-like color with a bashful head colored the purest of whites . retention is quite brief , as the head recedes into a meager ring around the top of the beer .

appearance : maybe the best of the style i 've ever seen in a glass . huge and round and gorgeous looking white thick rings of lacing i keep having to stare at , for one . the head refuses to go beyond about 1/4 '' and the brew 's almost 3/4 of the way consumed . i do n't know if i poured this miraculously or what , but damn . not to mention the nice copper color and the myriad bubbles still cascading around in the glass .
a : pours a deep brown , nearly black color with a 1/2 ' thick creamy brown head appearing at the top of the pour . no lacing on the sides of the glass .
a : with that cascading effect , this one is prettier than guinness . eventually settled with a beautiful 2 finger dark tan head w/ good retention & lacing .
a : very nice dark brown/black color . nice brown head but faded quickly with little to no lacing .
a : a dark copper color with absolutely no head and no glass lacing . uh oh , this beer is dead flat .

appearance : a dark reddish color in the beer . there is a quarter inch tan ring around the glass , it has some retention . the clarity of the beer is slightly opaque with brownish garnet highlights .

appearance : cola colored brown and reddish colored body with a creamy small-bubbled 1 '' beige head . carbonation climbs the sides of my glass . a consistent foam layer sits on top along with clingy lacing .
a : dark-golden pilsner color , nicely spritzy .

a : nice redish brown with a light tan head . the head is fed for a qhile from the carbonation . the beer looks nice except it seems to look dirty . either this is an unfiltered offering , which i doubt or it seems to have specs of things clinging to the glass as carbonation bubbles past . do n't inspect closely for a good looking beer . s and
a : bright yellow , little head disapear quickly with some lacing , high carbonation .
a : pours a dark maroon body with a smattering of tan bubbles on top of the beer .
appearance : glowing amber with quite a bit of haziness . the head does n't rise very high , but retains nicely .
appearance : nice reddish/tan color with a good froathy head .
a : you do n't need me to describe it . you can see what it looks like in the bottle . suffice to say it 's not very appealing .
a : pours a medium orange with an impressive white nitro head , thick lace .

a : far and away the most impressive aspect of this beer . the head was huge ! ( 3 fingers ) , frothy and mountainous . and it lasted forever . i was left with a rocky island of head in the middle of my glass . super sticky . the lacing was so impressive that i actually felt bad rinsing out the intricate design left behind . it was remarkably consistent . the body was clear and sparkling , half way in between yellow & copper . s &
appearance : a nice golden/ amber color with a small white frothy head .
a : it pours a clear and almost glowing orange color with no head .
a : very pretty nitro pour . thick , cascading , creamy looking head atop a dark brown body .

a : black as night . it could possibly have the highest lovibond i have seen , true black . the head was also incredibly dark and unwaivering . it was the color of some chocolate milk on steroids , and the head retained intself the entire time . i was amazed that a beer at 17.5 % abv could have that kind of head retention .
a : very inviting brown amber color with purple hues . i do n't think i 've seen such a color . thick creamy lacing with awesome retention and tons of lacing . near perfection . 4.0
a : pours light golden with a large white airy head that sets into decent lacings .

appearance : dark yellow/orange with a large amount of yeast suspended in the beer and at the bottom of the glass . small this white/beige foamy head that lasted throughout drinking . small amount of lacing .

a : pours a dark black with a tan head with a nice cascade as the head builds up to the rim of the glass then lingers for the rest of the session . i swear the head stayed the same size the entire way through . that 's about where the good things stop happening .

appearance : as it was poured slowly , there was virtually no head and what there was dissipated very quickly , just the way i like it . however , the colour of the beer was more reminiscent of urine than anything else . i had the distinct feeling that i was drinking carbonated piss water as i downed this brew . not a very good conception .
a : pours black , with no highlights . half-inch beige head which completely disappeared before i took the first sip .

a : tawny on the pour with a glass engulfing rigid foam head of & gt ; 50 % occupancy that was beige in color and lapsed at glacier speed leaving a generous amount of speckled delight after much time and patience . im guessing this either suffers from infection or came compliments of a belgian yeast strain . either way a spectacular lacing and had gives this an extra umph in the visual appeal department .

a : after peeling of the top of this can ( yeah , peel top , like a can of soup ) , i immediately had worries strewn about . i poured it and then was reminded of a jacuzzi . the head steadily rose for a while , then dissipated all in one go . it is quite clear , and suds are pouring out from every edge of the glass . unusually sudsy . i wonder if the color was injected , because everything else seems synthetic so far .

appearance : every pour is a tsunami of a head . nothing backs down . tons of rain forest and windshield lacing . hazy darker copper amber body . have n't seen retention or a head this good , first pour or last , on any esb , ever .
appearance : medium-dark copper body disappointingly topped with1/4 finger collar of foam which dissipated within 30 '' .
a : pours a light brown with a remarkably long lasting head , amazing .
appearance : dark chocolate brown in color , kinda murky . two fingers of foamy ivory/dirty white head that dissipates down to about half a finger and lingers
a : pours a dark mahogany brown , with a full white/tan head which makes it really inviting , poured into a chimay chalice .

a : the bottom of the glass has the look of a cloudy dark tan . this gets darker the closer to the top of the glass in which it turns to a brown . the first glass had a lot of carbonation which can be seen . caused for a giant head , of a light tan that looks almost white , with each pour .
appearance : nice deep brown/amber color with a superior head ( basically got an 8 oz bottle and the foam filled the rest of the 12 oz glass ) .

a : a straight , unhurried pour yields a clear dark-brown , effectively black , body under a lovely three-finger head of creamy , mocha-colored foam . great retention , tons of lace . gorgeous stout , plain and simple .
a : orange-brown , pours with a rediculous amount of creamy , off-white head . lots of head retention , leaves a nice lace . who could ask for more ?
a : rich and dark with a beautiful , thick head at pour . head disappears rather quickly , however , and there 's no lacing to speak of , so it loses a few points here .
appearance : watery , light yellow .
a : pours orange with a very limited head . wisp of carbonation , but mostly just gloopy bubbles .
a : crystal clear copper with tiny bubbles fighting for surface supremacy . lots of thick creamy head that leaves a spackling of lacing all the way down to the last drop .

appearance : very hazy - like unfiltered honey - same golden amber . deep and bitter . the malts are complex ; sweet like brown sugar and burnt . hops are very present . very grassy and mildly lemony . the alcohol is noticeable , but not over-powering . feel is lively .
appearance : poured into a duvel sniffter ; black as night with an overflowing dense mocha head . excellent retention with a ridiculous smooth layer of lacing as it 's being enjoyed .
appearance : pours a beautiful , hazy reddish-copper with a thick , beige head that fades to a film leaving heavy but patchy lace on the inside of the glass . i really love the color .
a : pours jet black with a rocky tan head . very good retention , and overall , a great looking porter .
a : cloudy dark golden . 1/4 '' head that quickly fades . minimal lacing .
a : pours a clear amber with an intense forming bubbly head , which then disappears into nothing . extreme carbonation .

a : pours a cloudy , milky straw-colored body capped with a foamy , off-white head . this looks like a standard hefeweizen . i absolutely love the milky , unfiltered look for this style , and this one is no different . only the head fails to retain well , so i 'm a little disappointed .
a : this was a hazy coppery color with golden , peachy highlights . it poured with a big , sticky , off-white head that lasted quite a while .

a : absolutely impenetrable black , no highlights or edges when held to a lamp . just incredibly thick looking . would be a 4 or higher if it were n't completely flat . no head , no lace , nothing . yeah , it captures the color , but that 's not really too hard .
a : pours murky brown in the glass . it 's amply carbonated , with a good cap that remains for the duration of the drink . the bottle is a slow gusher . sigh .
appearance : pours into a pint glass ... as pale as can be , clear , watery straw color , light white foam head with little retention ... completely unappealing
a : ultra clear medium orange color . two fingers of frothy head with excellent retention and good lacing . 3.0
a : golden opaque
appearance : pale golden color with a finger or two of rapidly dissipating light foam head . not great . this style of beer really needs a head .
a : ok carbonation ; purplish black ( like a porter ) ; no head

appearance : a finger and a half of creamy head the stuck around and produced some lacing does it favours . as does a crystal clear body that defines the word amber . slow steady carbonation gives it an almost regal look . more lace and more retention and it would have got the perfect score .

appearance : very dark brown , with a tinge of cranberry color beaming through the beer . small but vigorous head only climbs to less than an inch and subsides quickly . the head is tan with a small bit of lace left on the sides of the glass .
appearance : golden amber hue with a head that dissipates too quickly for my liking .
a : super pale yellow brew with almost no head at all ( pure white ) . the head has almost no retention with absolutely no lacing .
appearance : dirty amber-brown brew with minimal lacing .
a : literally the thickest head i 've ever seen , four fingers , and takes forever to die down leaving behind streaks of soapy lace .
a : clear but not crystal , amber colored , nice frothy one finger head is slow to dissipate , with great retention and huge rings of lace to recommend it .
appearance : pours into my delirium tulip pitch black with a mocha brown head . it starts at a finger 's height and barely shrinks down at all . phenomenal .

a : pours a one finger head of poor cream but fair thickness and retention . colour is a clear yellow . there was a brief bubble show . sm : a bit o ' cream , barley , some nutty hops . a moderate strength aroma .
appearance : nice head on this beer that retained it 's lacing quite well . poured out into a nice cloudy chestnut brown .
a : standard pour yields a 1 finger slightly off-white semi-fine head with good retention . beer is a clear reddish-copper . lacing is thin but with great patterns and stick .
a : poured from bottle to pint glass . not much head goin on here . very average appearence , but who really cares .
a : beautiful 2 finger off white head . medium-dark amber color with some ruby-red tones as well . excellent head retention and excellent lacing .
a : evenly hazy copper color . poured a 3 finger rocky off-white head with excellent retention to a 2 finger cap . decanted lightly . laced in rings with legs extending down the glass .
a : black , finger of light cream foam falls to a broken sheet .
appearance : pours a medium brown body with a prodigious head that leaves wafts of lacing all over the place

a : standard pour creates a 2.5 finger fine , fluffy , white head with moderate retention . brew itself is a semi-clear orange tangerine color . lacing is ample , web-like and almost creates a waterfall effect with massive outlines of bubbles . a real pretty beer .
a : an amber/red pour . head is a little lacking , and leaves just a trim of lacing .

a : the head on this thing is crazy huge . it 's tan and creamy like the head of a rootbeer float poured directly over ice cream . the beer itself is black and very dark brown at the bottom of the glass . lacing is immense , and does not back down while drinking .

appearance : body is brownish red ( mahogany ) , bright , and clear ( need to hold it to light ) . a ring of khaki-colored foam sits on top and drags a bit of lacing . i 'd actually like to see something a bit murkier/more mysterious , but it looks pretty nice overall .
a : cloudy , orange amber , not much head at all . i guess you could say that the cloudiness is consistent with the base beer being a wheat , but it is a bit dull and muddy

a : same as the normal hefe as far as head pour and retention . pours like a champ and then it disappears . no lace no residue . it is `` dunkel '' meaning dark . it is brown and cloudy and highly carbonated .
appearance : cloudy golden to straw color . cakey smooth white and sticky head , with moderate levels of lace .

appearance : into a deus flute . pours with a vigorous rush of carbonation and foam . light straw and perfectly clear with a nice frothy head and patches of lace . constant carbonation rising to the top .

appearance : clear and golden with a minimal amount of carbonation . i got just about no sign of a head and absolutely no lacing . really quite disappointed with the appearance of this beer . i was hoping for something spectacular being that it is supposed to be the real king of beers .
a : pure clear lemon juice with a huge paper white head . ridiculous lacing . 5/5
a : holy hell is this an ugly beer . incredibly turbid and not even brown , we 'll call it a mahogany color , with almost no head .
appearance : dark orange body filled with haze that poured from the bottom of the bottle . almost no head .
a : golden straw hue lends itself well to the body , with a 2cm chalk head that reduced to half a centimeter . nothing special .
a : pours a translucent yellowish-golden color with a tiny head that disappeared before i could walk 15 feet from my kitchen to my couch . i looked but could not even find a hint of lacing . .
a : pours a shiny golden color with a thin white head which leaves nice sticky lacing .
appearance : cloudy hazy loght tan colored . thick billowy head that lingers . minimal lacing .
a : a nice darker amber color , with a large white head , nice lacing down the side of the glass ...
a : pours a bright , slightly opaque golden with a large birch-bark coloured head . bubbles make the voyage from the bottom to the top of the glass with regularity . some floaties .
appearance : copper-pumpkin in color , average lacing , little head .

appearance : the bottle opens with a minimal `` pffft '' of released air . after a vigorous pour , there are some sudsy , rather unattractive bubbles surrounding thin clouds of foam on the surface . the color is straw gold with a hint of orange , and it is quite hazy . when i tilt the beer up on the walls of the glass it looks moderately viscous and leaves bits of sticky foam behind . this one really is n't much to look at , but i 'm thinking there might be plenty to enjoy in the aroma ...
a : pours a dark and murky reddish/brown color . a minimal brown head forms , and sticks around as a ring . very little lace is left behind .
appearance : soda like head that dissipated instantly . with an apple cider color and what appears to be a high carbonation this looks more like sparkling cider then a beer .
appearance : amber color , orange almost . the brew looks amazing , exactly what i expect a pumpkin ale to look like . reminds me of october already !

appearance : deep opal or opaque . clear with ruby highlights when put up to the light . a creamy off white head retention . flavor : sweet up front then a burst of chocolate and roasted flavors that finishes with a light bitterness . hints of licorice .
appearance : slightly hazy orange body that supports a thick , frothy head ...

appearance : the alaskan ipa pours an extremely clear , almost disturbingly clear , pale yellow color . it looks more like an adjunct lager than an ipa . the head , however , is big and fluffy , close to two fingers . it dissipates very quickly though and without much lacing .
a : pours opaque black with a thin dark tan head . nice lacing .
a : this interesting ale has a tan , very low head . brown/ deep orange color . decent off white lacing . appearance was characteristic of an ale .
a : very very dark brown in color with almost no light shining through . a nice rocky light tan head tops it off . great retention and very nice lacing .
a : gold/yellow in color . very small white head and a little lace .

appearance : pours into my unibroue tulip a vaguely hazy bright orange gold with hints of red . the off-white head is huge and loose-bubbled and drops to a very solid cap . lacing comes in a few splotchy sheets .
appearance : crystal clear , little white head .
appearance : pours a carbonation free burnt caramel that leaves no lace
appearance : pours a watered down koolaide color . nice inch thick pink head . moderate lacing .
a : orange/copper in color . light tan head of about 1 finger that left good lacing .
appearance : slightly hazy ; weak , pale gold ; half-inch , snow-white head ; not much lacing ; poor head retention .
a : uber dark brown , almost black body . gorgeous fluffy oatmeal colored head forms unique mounds like mashed potatoes .
appearance : pours a dull gold color . the white head is but a thin film by the first sip .
appearance : light straw yellow . almost no head formatio and no lace retention .
appearance : pale golden color . after a hard pour , the head fizzed and disappeared the same way a diet coke 's foam does . not appetizing at all .

appearance : the beer pours a dead black . there is no opaqueness to light . the head is nearly three fingers high with a creamed coffee coloration . the head seemed to last forever . the lacing was like pancake batter on the side of my glass .
a : pale golden yellow color , a little hazy , not some carbonation that dissipates somewhat quickly .
appearance : nice looking flip top blue bottle . pours a dark brown color with only a spot or two of surface foam . no lacing develops during the session .

appearance : great amber/orange color , but a short lived white head didnt lace . flavor : nice malt accent with some mild fruit cup tastes . some hints of chocolate , nuts and yeast . a mild alcohol taste comes in as it warms , but melds nicely with the beer .
a : finger and a half of slightly off white head on top of a lighter copper body . the beer is totally clear with lacing . the head just does not go away .
a : i will be blunt , it 's piss yellow with a wack of fizz and a thin white head .

appearance : a glowing orange color with peachy-sunset red tints . a beige head that had nearly all but disappeared by the time the beer arrived . the head eventually rested and stayed as a thin covering . the lack of a head spoils the looks to be honest . half-way down the drink , with no lacing , the beer looked sadly flat and unappealing at times .
a : nice hazy amber color , but no real head at all ...
appearance : a crystal clear golden beer with a thin white foam lace . settles to a ring around the glass .
appearance : this has a dark brown hue with light brown edges . totally flat , no head or carbonation .

appearance : pours a clear dark chestnut color with a very stiff looking 1/8 head of tannish foam . there dont appear to be many bubbles rising to maintain the head , but the thickness of it lets it remain a thin layer across the top of the beer .
appearance : reddish orange in color . no head at all and no visible carbonation . the beer looked dead .
a : pours a dark black color , no light coming through . provides a 2 finger thick dark brown foam head . there is some spotty lacing .
a : the nicest looking wheatwine that i have ever seen . very nice garnet colored beer . looks brown until it is held up to the light .
appearance : not much of a head generated . it 's pretty easy to see through this beer .

a : two fingers of incredibly dark head . jet black about 98 % of the brew 's volume . thick appearance , if that makes sense . great lacing , and the dark brown head retains as a thick cap and ring .

a : a frothy , medium brown head of 1 finger goes quickly . the body is completely black and nothing can be seen through the other side of the glass . as the drinking continues , half sheets of lace are stuck behind . not bad , but a very standard appearance . s &

a : slightly hazy , pale golden color with less than one finger of diminishing white foam head . heavy lacing remains on the glass . a few bubbles are observed to rise in the column while tiny floaties are plentiful , hanging motionless .

a : this poured quite an interesting head , the head was thickly carbonated with over 4 fingers in size . this poured black , but it seemed almost like a black molasses color . laces quite amazingly .
a : cloudy amber/orange with a large head that laces down the glass to the last drop . perfect
a : deep gold color with good clarity and and very active carbonation . white head starts out firm , but quickly disappears .
a : hazy brown with some sediment suspended in the beer . thin off-white colored head .
appearance : shimmering off white lace that leaves a web-like trail , the pancake of a head stays for a while floating above the bright golden liquid .
appearance : blue , very blue
a : pours an oh-so-clear honey golden color . head started off a big fluffy white pillow , but is now a scant layer of suds . zero lacing .

appearance : just about as good as a beer can get . dark golden amber color , almost brown ... looks gorgeous . moderate amount of carbonation bubbles rising and sticking to the sides of the glass . head is creamy light tan with lacing down the glass . looks great .
a : light coloring for a fest beer and the head was thin and lifeless .
a : beautiful golden hue to the body and a soft white head on top . good lacing . heck , even the label is nice with its cheerful , springy colors .

a : pours jet black with a mahogany tinge around the edges . very minimal head that is quickly reduced to nothing . thick film clings to the glass leaving behind some webbed lacing . n : excellent bourbon and vanilla notes waft up right away . there 's also rich dark chocolate , roasted barley , toffee , light booze and some nuttiness ( pecans ? ) .
a : nothing at all to get excited by , a murky bread-crust amber with a brief and quick-dying head . decent carbonation a few streams of small bubbliness up to ... nothing . zero lace .

appearance : remarkably un-cloudy for a wheat ale ? the body was a lightly hazy honey gold/orange , topped by a foamy 2-finger head of an eggshell color which fades pretty quickly . lots of carbonation bubbles rise to the top , but there is only decent lacing left behind . meh .

appearance : pours thick and black looking with a small head of tan bubbles after a pretty aggressive pour . the head faded while i was typing my notes , so it was gone within 20 seconds or so . the beer looks a bit like coffee sitting in my glass with no foam or anything .
appearance : pours a slightly hazy orange-copper color . big rocky slightly off-white head has good retention and leaves a good amount of lacing .
a : very appealing hazy golden color with foamy one inch head . active carbonation shooting up from the bottom of the glass
a : straw yellow with a large , fluffy white head .
appearance : medium amber color with a thick , solid ecru-colored nitro head . crystal clear .
appearance : slightly cloudy , light gold appearance . small head quickly recedes leaving only a faint layer of film on top .
a : a finger and a half of head but it disappears very quickly and leaves a light ring around the glass . pale yellow color like most adjunct beers .

a : color is right with a deep brown almost black that when held to the light shows a ruby hint . the head is way too thin and fizzles out quickly . the color is not enough to compensate for the pathetic head . s/t : clearly cocoa and roast grain in both nose and palate . neither flavor is overpowering . i like it but do n't think it has the complexity to rank among the best stouts .
a : amber color with fast dissipation of the head
appearance : barely hazy yellow orange with a nice thick thats a little rocky and leaves some lacing as we go . looks great .
a : pours a hazy brownish-gold with a finger of white head that recedes into a thin layer with little lacing .
appearance : a hazy orange amber with very thin off-white head that does n't stay long even with a rough pour .
a : perfectly golden , but uterlelly devoid of either head or carbonation . as pretty as the color is , i must deduct for lack of carbonation ...
a : orange , very cloudy ( more than what would be expected from a dry hopped beer ) , no head . like a flat hefe a sweet citrusy , spicy aroma .

appearance : clear amber pour with sudsy white head . still looking in the glass . flavor : more malt driven character that reminds me of wheat bread , buckwheat pancakes , and dark grain flavors . balance is nearly even with a slight lean towards the malt . finish is clean and dry .

a : fantastic . a lovely clear amber that takes on an unexpected pinkish hue in the light . reminiscent of a sunset at sea . a finger of head devolves into multi-bubbled patterns . great lacing . top-notch .
a : this pours a hazy dark orange color with a huge two-finger head of very thick foam that leaves enormous clumps of lace that hold for a long time .
a : jet black . head had a chocolate color . head popped up at the end of the pour and then quickly minimized .
a : pours a hazy muddy brown body with a garnet hue . head is about 1 finger and short lasting ; spotty to almost no lacing .

a : black as night ... the folks from the brewery were n't lying when they said that there 's literally no light coming through this one . really thin khaki head that disappears quickly , leaving just a tiny bit of lacing .
appearance : the best part of this beer . dark brown in color , minimal white head with suprisingly good lacing , a pretty nice looking belgian pale..
a : a deep golden color with a very thin head that falls quickly , leaving no lace and hardly any retention over the top .
a : pours pale golden yellow . extreme carbonation , looks good . white creamy head with little lacing .
appearance : pale , yellow colour , and a white , kind of weak head .

appearance : there was a two finger head that quickly dissipated . the head was a light tan color that is creamy and foamy . the body of the beer is a dark copper color that has reddish hues . there are little particles that seem suspended in the beer . the clarity of the beer is hazy .

a : pours a clear straw-golden body . it 's fizzy , with ample carbonation up the glass , but it never develops a huge head . good retention , with some spots of lacing down the glass . i expected much more carbonation and lacing from a belgian pale .
appearance : pitch black , no light can be seen through this beer . chocolate shake like head in the beginning , but it dissipated very quickly . no head retention at all .
appearance : beyond hazy . appearance is very muddy ; an opaque yellow/orange .
appearance : dark ruby read crystal clear with a billoy tan thick head that lasts forever . nice lacing .
appearance : its pitch black with white/tan head that has good lace and very small fine bubbles . looks all around like a good beer .

a : poured pretty much black and contained absolutely no head , lacing , or carbonation . even after pouring from about 6 to 12 inches above the glass , i still was unable to get any trace of the previously mentioned characteristics . very disappointing .
appearance : poured with 2 fingers of bubbly tan head that dissipated to a rim around the top of the glass leaving no lacing . the beer is dark brown and does n't let any light thtough .
appearance : typical pale see through yellow macro brew color . very thin head that does a quick disappearing act .

a : one finger head of nice cream and good thickness , but unfortunately rather poor retention . semitransparent darker yellow colour . sm : extremely light delicately vague hint of a scent of barley and cream . extraordinarily light and barely detectable .
a : not a sound as the cork comes out . pours pitch black and completely flat . this gets a 2.0 because it 's a pretty big fuck you to not carbonate a $ 35 bottle .
appearance : beautiful brown color , crystal clear with a nice tan creamy dense head . medium lacing .
appearance : a dark brown beer topped with a creamy biege foam head ; loads of stick and retention . the head appeared extra-creamy ... much eye candy .
a : the best feature of this beer . looks like cranberry juice , yet tastes a whole lot better .
a : golden yellow , clear , with about 1/2 '' of white foamy head . great head retention with tiny clinging bubbles lacing down the glass . looks fantastic !
appearance : relatively clear with some haze and a tawny golden colour . the head is smooth with chunky bubbles and clings .

appearance : pours a sort of cloudy reddish orange color with very little head . the head is ivory in color and quickly fades . swirling the beer leaves some flecks of lace on the sides of the glass .
a : golden blonde , quite clear ... starked white head , about a half finger tall , with good retention . . s +
appearance : slightly cloudy with a light brown colour . the head is deep tan , frothy , and moderately large with impaired retention and no lacing .
a : color is somewhere mid way between orange and copper . low head that dies quickly .
a : nice in appearance with a cloudy , copper red color . appearance is the best thing about this ale .

a : one finger head of nice cream lacing , good thickness , and fair to bad retention . colour is a solid black . sm : raspberry fruit ester hops , cream , caramelized malt , and i assume barley . me nose is broken ; sorry lads .
appearance : it 's a clear , very light golden color . very modest head with little retention and lacing .
a : pours a brown body with a small white head with no real retention and minimal lacing along the glass .
a : pale straw in color , there was little head and it dissipated quickly .
appearance : clear orangish hue , two finger head that quickly disappeared into nothing no trace of lacing behind .

appearance : off-white 1.5 finger head quickly disappears to a thin layer of foam . would have liked better head retention . iced tea-colored body with a slight chill haze . flavor : rich toffee , caramelized sugar , and cracker jack . bittersweet finish with slight metallic twang .

appearance : wow ! this is one of the prettiest beers ive ever poured . the body is almost as dark as burnished copper ( i think darker even than dreadnaught ) with lovely , rustic , fine flakes in an almost colloidal suspension , lending the beer a thick , cloudy appearance . floating on top of this liquid was a rich , beige , ultra-fine-grained , whipped egg-white head that left a solid , continuous sheath down the glass . tiny bubbles seemed like seed-pearls embedded in amber .
a : moderate pour yields 3 fingers of rocky white head with retention that is too good . hazy ( ? ) straw yellow liquid . final pour brought yeast with : - (

a : big , frothy , 2-finger off-white head sits on top of a hazy amber beer . the cork popped with a lot carbonation , and carbonation is readily visible rising from the bottom of this glass . ( 4.5 )
appearance : pours a very pale and light yellow color indicative of urine . the head is 4 '' huge with a nice white color . great retention and lots of sticky , foamy , lace .
a : cloudy ruddy~brown in color . no head . no lacing .
a : pours a clear amber color into a six sided pint glass with a thin skim of slightly off white head .

appearance : poured into a belgian tulip , a medium 1 '' head that rapidly fades . steady carbonation of small bubbles that dissipate into a medium sized head bubble . medium gold in color , medium clarity with a slight haze . lack of brussels lace .
appearance : very small mocha colored head , very dark brown almost black appearance
a : very boring , clear pale yellow with hardly any head at all . what little there was dissipated into little wisp of lace on top . looks like a bad adjunct .
a : pours gold with a pallid light white head , fair retention no lace .
appearance : i dunno . its in a green bottle . anything that comes in a green bottle i leave in the green bottle . through the green glass it 's quite clear .
a : hazy bronze/light copper color . sediment chunks contradict the purported filtering . i do n't mind the haze and chunkage so much , but why call it filtered ? voluminous head is persistent .
a : the beer poured clear amber in color and has lacy patterns of bubbles floating on the surface .
a : cloudy yellow orange colour and a big 1 cm head that lasts very well . 5
a : pours a deep reddish brown . minimal head with tight bubbles . i noticed it was pretty thick as i poured and it has some legs to it , taking a bit to settle back down .
a : 3 months old . gentle pour to retain yeast leaves little ring of white head . straw amber liquid is slightly hazy . i 'd like better head or no sediment so i can pour more aggressively .

appearance : pours very thick , looks bold . swirled around the snifter it coats the sides with a light amber colored syrupy looking ... .syrup . beer is brown , almost black . held into the light liquid is burgundy around the edges .
a : i drank from the can but could see the pale ting of golden color that is more likely an artifact of artificial food coloring than a product of grains and hops .
a : this beer poured a cloudy orange/pumpkin color . it was also totally flat . probably the worst looking beer i 've poured . was thinking it may be a drain pour .
a : pours a dark brown with some clarity , ruby highlights , thin head , little retention
appearance : golden in color . nice head , ok lacing .
a : clear dark amber body with a 1/2 '' off-white head . poor retention and no lace . no better than what i 'd expect for a beer this strong .
appearance : a crystal-clear straw-colored body capped by two fingers of fluffy white head that burns out quickly and leaves no lace .
a : golden yellow with a hint of red/orange . a tiny bit of cloudiness . decent head that last for a couple minutes .
a : clear , dark golden amber with an orangeish hue . foamy head with an assortments of large and small bubbles .
appearance : brilliant orange/garnet with a dense meringue head that lasts for a few minutes . leaving a slight foam layer with delicate lacing .
a : a hazy golden-brown color with a full half inch of white head . a lot of lacing and well carbonated . this beer looks amazing .
a : poured from a bottle to a pint glass . had an amber color and a cloudy consistency . there was a huge amount of creamy/fluffy , long-lasting head . great lacing . an excellent-looking beer .

a : an extended pour yields a 1 finger creamy white head with moderate retention . beer is a clear tangerine sunrise . lacing is spotty and stringy with little stick . lack of head retention and lace really hurts appearance in this style .
a : a bunch of junk in there . no head . copper brown funk .
a : nice amber color with great clarity and somewhat active carbonation . fizzy orange tinged head comes and goes quickly . leaves no lace .
appearance : hazy dark brown body , moderate tan head fades fast .
appearance : this was an amber , slightly copper , beer that poured with a course , fizzy head . it disappeared very quickly and left no lace on the glass .
appearance : pale yellow body with 2-3 fingers worth of head that disappears to nothing in less than a minute .
a : really nice reddish copper color . head is soapy looking but otherwise a pleasant looking beer .

a : standard pour yields a .25 finger coarse , mocha colored head with poor retention . beer is an opaque black . lacing is non-existant . i like the color on this one but everything else is pretty subpar .
appearance : pours a pale tangerine ; somewhat hazy ; smallish , snow-white head ; b-cup 's worth of lace ; not much in the way of head retention .
appearance : light gold , 3 finger head that dissolves into nothing . little to no lacing
appearance : a nice amber transparent colored beer with hues of orange . a tan rocky head ... with good sticking/lace . great retention . stays with a sheet of head forever .
appearance : pours a very opaque brown body with some distinct ruby overtones . a thin 1 finger foam that disappears fairly quickly .
appearance : a very deep shade of brown , and very little head after being poured into a terrapin snifter . not much lacing either , and it disappears rather quickly anyways
a : dark brown/black with a big tan head that leaves a littles lace ( not as much as i was expecting ) . very good overall .
a : straw yellow and clear with two fingers of white head that top quickly and leave a touch of lacing .
a : foamy 2 inch head , quickly dispersed , faint lacing . beer is golden yellow
a : pours a pale yellow with a small white fizzy head that 's gone instantly and leaves nothing else .
a : poured a cloudy grapefruit color with good carbonation and a white cap and bubbles

appearance : steady pour yields a three inch rocky , bubbly tan head that dissipates very slowly leaving thick rings and islands of lacing , and a dollop of foam . pours a semi-translucent dark red brown . lacing is such that the glass looks like a map densely packed with archipelagos and small continents .
a : deep brown with garnet hues . the small tan head quickly disappears to a ring at the edge of the beer . leaves no lace .

a : this pours literally all beige foam . it instantly converts to pure foam upon exiting the bottle . retention is outstanding . i have to wait something like 10 minutes for it to calm down enough for me to take a sip .

appearance : glass is full of floaties , looks like yeast or some sediment ; scary given the very bright yellow color . has a trace cover of white with a small collar , no lace . flavor : fairly clean , the corn/adjunct taste is there but mild and has a slight citric/lemon note . very watery
a : pours a thick bubbly head with visible carbonation . color is a dark yellowish-gold . slowly dissipating head that leaves little lacing .
a : dark mohogany ; light tan head is fluffy ; great retention and lace . exceptional for a porter !
a : dark black in the glass , the pour produces a small dark tan head , which quickly dissipates .
a : dark orange , lacing minimal and found around the edges , looks a little flat
a : light yellow color with the typical macro head .
a : a very bright and saturated yellow with just a hint of orange . quite carbonated .

appearance : pours out of the can into my sa perfect pint with fantastic , rocky , 2 finger mocha colored head , which never really dissipates . leaves some nice lacing on the glass as well . the darkness , the black , of this beer absorbs all the light , with a tiny bit of ruby on the edges . excellent .
a : pours a caramel-amber color with a large , somewhat foamy off-white head with awesome retention and very good lacing .

a : opaque black in color . pours with ever the slightest little smidgen of beautifully tan head that practically evaporates into the air , leaving what appears to be a clear puddle of mud in my glass . absolutely no lacing .
appearance : in a goblet it pours a dark orange or dark amber colour , with a fast-disappearing head and minimum carbonation ; looking just normal , a bit lack of character for a bottled ale .
a : dark caramel brown hazy color with a creamy head and lots of lacing . plenty of sediment at the bottom too .

appearance : poured generously into a white wine glass . honey yellow , thick and hazy . big bleached white head blossoms to about 1.5 '' and stays there for a long time . lacing is superb -- thick , full , and persistent .
appearance : hazy , no head . not appetizing

a : incredibly murky , turbid copper color with a thin froth of white head , an aggressive pour only yielded about a quarter of an inch that has receded to a cap . nice lacing is left behind though as i drink . this is really really murky .
a : poured this wheat bear into a weizen glass and watched the eggshell white head rise aggressively about two inches with big bubbles at the bottom and fine frothy foam at the top of the head .
appearance : pours a clear , copper body with a large , frothy , white head . gobs of sticky lace on the way down .
a : dull amber color . head evaporates almost instantly . no lacing .
appearance : dark copper in color with a two finger head that slowly falls to a thick surface foam . thick lace coats the glass . lovely looking beer that yells `` drink me '' .
a : deep mahagoney brownish red . translucent , allowing awesome crimson kicks to occur . head is a quality , beigeish white that is at a very respectable level
appearance : pours a cloudy yellow color with a fizzy head that dies very quickly even with a strong pour . no lacing to speak of . smell &

a : this is n't the best looking pour of guinness i have seen , but even so , it 's a pretty sight . the beer is dark brown , bordering on black . the head is thick , creamy and leaves a thick sheet of lacing around the perimeter of the glass .
appearance : typical slight dark amber bock color . this got me excited . low head quickly dissipates , also typical for a bock .

a : pours a very dark mahogany with a bit of an almost purple hue . pours with one of the most massively billowing heads i 've seen and it stays up for a long , long time , leaving thick lacing in its wake .
a : beautiful sunset orange in color . it 's slightly cloudy , but wow - it 's simply gorgeous . a good pour yields a 1.75 head and moderate lacing .

a : pours with the expected frothy , creamy , white head with loads of cascading bubbles . the head is retained indefinitely and coats the sides of the glass . the color is a clear copper with lots of carbonation .
a : foams aggressively in my tulip . the big , fluffy white head has good retention and nice lacing . pleasing golden color .
a : toffee and caramel malts dominate the aroma . no real hop presence . no diacetyl , no esthers .
appearance : a beautifully robust indian red color , covered by and enormous off-white , almost orange , layer of foamy head . beautiful looking beer .

a : pours a clear golden amber with a huge off-white head that took forever to slowly fade into a thick film with a butte of foam in the center of the glass . thick lines of lacing were left down the glass .
a : beautiful light golden color with mild haze . head pours loose and frothy and leaves plentiful uneven head . head dissipates slowly .

appearance : standard pour nets a short , consistent , layer of brown foam , which descends to a wispy crown fairly quickly . body is pitch black ; opaque , even when held to light . thick blankets of lacing follow the beer all the way down . looks great !
a : bottle opened with a loud pop . poured into a tulip with an enormous ( 3 inch ) head that receeds slowly leaving nice lacing . light orange and very clear .
appearance : very dark brown almost black . a richer head than the traditional stone ris , about a that recedes to a and hangs around , nice lacing too .
appearance : too foggy
appearance : a rather cloudy beer with some protein haze , unexpected for style . a light golden color , ok. good carbonation , head retention .
appearance : poured with a large fizzy light tan head that dissipated quickly to a thin layer leaving no lacing on the glass . the beer is clear with a reddish/orange brown color .
appearance : opaque and jet black in my glass with a short , caramel colored head . on close inspection , the beer is actually a clear , deep amber brown .
a : beautiful black with a thick brown head that does n't dissipate easily .

a : the look is a stunner ; so dark it appears 'black ' at first glance . closer inspection showsdeep , alluring mocha with traces of glowing ruby . head is a thick mound of tan meringue , taking over 5 minutes to drop from its 2-finger apex to a thin coating sheet . lace is strong , a webwork of sponge-like blots .

a : no head . at all . there 's a tan colour floater . it 's lovely for what is present . the abv is taking its toll . colour is a solid black . sm : a strong aroma of rich chocolate , cocoa , vanilla , caramel , alcohol , and slight esters . a strong aroma .
appearance : pours a hazy orange color with no head , just some surface spots of foam .
a : black with a light tan head , great retention & lace . a bit dark for a brown ale , but i 'm not complaining .

a : retention and lacing are , of course , wonderful . the beer is an ever so slightly hazy golden/orange . the part of the pour that is actually liquid looks nice . brownish specks come out at the end of the pour ; ca n't be sure if they 're yeast or something less pleasant .

a : pours a two finger head of slight cream , decent thickness , and alright retention . colour is a cloudy dark orange . not real appealing , truth be told . sm : aroma is light in strength . dirty orange esters dominate . no cream is present .
appearance : pours a dark brown body with a creamy , off-white head .

appearance : a deep , dark ruddy brown body with garnet and ruby hues , hints of orange around the periphery even , a truly gorgeous , foamy tan head - seriously , i had to ask if this was on nitro-tap , it 's so immaculate and immobile and meringue-like - with great retention that leaves huge three-dimensional lacing . an amazing-looking beer .
a : poured from a bottle to a tulip glass . had a brownish color and a cloudy texture . there was a big , foamy , long-lasting head . very good lacing .
appearance : looks good with a dark red/brownish color . no head at all , and no lacing . appears to have no carbonation whatsoever .
appearance : clear brownish amber with a finger sized head that disappears into nothingness . a good bock should have a good sized off white head that lasts .
a : very light colored lager , akin to a macro-adjunct lager . foam ? lacing ? hello ? i guess nobody 's home .

a : pours a deep brown with nice ruby hues when back lit . 1 1/2 fingers of beautiful light toffee head forms tight and remains that way for the entire slow descent . a nice fluffy skim remains at the end . great blanketing and ringed lacing throughout .
appearance : golden with a chill haze . extremely thin white lace .
a : ugh . almost watered down looking . a very , very , very weak straw with no head after 2 minutes .

appearance : a little darker than most pilsners , but still golden in hue . heavy carbonation from the bottle supports a thick , pillow head the color of sand . slightly hazy on the pour , more akin to a hefe than a pils , so i took some off . good lacing effects .
a : i dunno . i love the appearance of golden body in contrast to the white , gold , and red of the label .
a : the appearance of this beer is just perfect for a nut brown . it is a deep , rich mahogany brown/ copper with a decent half inch head that lingers for quite a while .
appearance : pitch black body with an almost none existent head , there are just a few large tan bubbles and that 's it . the carbonation is minimal .

a : pours a brillant clear , golden body , allowing one to see some visible carbonation . i do n't know if it was the waitress ' fault ( both times ) , but no head except a small white ring around the edge of the glass .
a : nice garnet color with an orange-ish head that holds up well . this beer is very clear .
appearance : pitch black with a thick mousse-like brown head . excellent head retention , an all-around decent looking beer .

a : pours what looks like a hazy woody brown , but when held to the light is actually a hazy , almost opaque blood orange with two fingers of persistent , fluffy tan head . large carbonation bubbles make themselves seen fairly obviously as they float to the top of the glass and keep the head strong . the bubbles almost look as if they 're suspended in a gel , not in the way they move , but in the way they stand out against the hazy translucent brew . there 's a bit of lacing as it 's drunk , and the combination of that and the head is very impressive for such a high abv . the carbonation 's appearance is honestly what impresses me the most , however .
appearance : dark cherry red with a light tan rocky head . tons of carbonation . good retention .
appearance : pours a hazy russet body with a prodigious head that provides loads of splashy lacing

a : color is a pale yellow with a light gold tint , very much like urine . there is a touch of cloudiness . head was a solid two inches , compact , bright white . slowly disippated , leaving foamy lacing .
appearance : bright with a straw colour . the head is white , medium-sized , frothy and fades rather quickly .
appearance : pours a golden-copper , hazy at first but clears pretty quickly . two fingers of white head with decent retention . tons of lacing . slightly darker then i expected for a dipa .
a : pale , pale , oh so pale . one of the palest brews i have come across . bubbles floated from the bottom of the glass almost through the entire 12 oz .
a : a fairly assertive pour yields a perfect two-finger head of dense tan foam atop a crystal-clear garnet body . terrific retention and some soft lacing . gorgeous beer , plain and simple .

appearance : pours copper with a 3-finger fluffy as a cloud off-white head . lacing in patchy clumps . head retention is pretty good , seems to be staying around . beer is absolutely and completely translucent . plenty of carbonation bubbles can be seen floating to the top .

appearance : quite dark and black , cola brown gets let in at the edges . the head is a dark tan , but this dies back to a think ring which eventually goes away completely . not much in the way of lacing either . not much to look at for a belgian strong dark ale .

a : i honestly thought this is one of the best looking beers i 've poured . pours a very dark brown/amber ( almost black ) that has a small mocha head at first that dissipates quickly , but leaves a nice , creamy , `` puddle '' in the middle and to the sides .
a : dark brown almost black body with only a thin ring of head . no head to speak of .
appearance : pours black with copper tones , with a large tan head .
a : dark mahagony brown . poor carbonation , literally fizzed at the surface . no head to speak of since then .
a : pours a cloudy puke-brown ; barely any head , light lacing
a : very dark brown with ruby edges , a small ring of espresso bubbles , fairly thin looking with minimal legs . 2/5
a : pours a boring yellow-brown , clear , with almost no head at all .
appearance : poured a clear , piss-colored yellow ( this really is the most accurate description of the color ) . a two finger head that quickly dissipates into soapy suds . boo

a : like the look so far , crystal clear if the crystal were a shade of amber . could stand to be a little darker , but the head is where it needs to be , looks sticky and is leaving some lace behind without me even taking a sip yet .
appearance : very pale amber , with little head and no lacing . pretty light in color for the style .
appearance : great black color , no light gets through at all . large , dark tan head which forebodes the taste to come !

a : this is probably the ugliest looking beer . yellow , with a cloudy suspension to it . sorry , it really looks like urine to me . but than again , i weight appearance much less than the other categories .
a : black as night . thin brown head that dissipated into nothingness quickly . zero lacing .

a : what a good looking beer ! two fingers of a fluffy cream-colored head sit atop a orange-red haze . the color of this red ale is perfect and a little light will bring out some beautiful highlights . as the head recedes , the foam remains stuck to the side of the glass .
a : pours pitch black with a small uneven tan head . dissipates very quickly into no lacings .
a : served a clear gold and is topped by a wispy head that soon dissipates into nothingness . no lacing whatsoever .
appearance : nice dark amber color . the head is huge and sticks around forever . the head is barely off-white . it makes for a very pretty beer .
a : darkish yellow/golden color . nice foam , so-so lacing .
appearance : pale gold color , low level of carbonation visible . decent head that fades into lacing around the top of the beer . perfect for a pale ale .
appearance : it 's a nitro-poured guinness . how much `` prettier '' does it get ? a head that never quits , classic cascade , liquid black as coal ; i ca n't ask for more as far as looks .
appearance : dark dark brown , zero head , turbid and murky .
a : pours a full 2+ finger head . a murky brown color .

a : pours a deep black with dark ruby highlights and a vigorus pour barely yielded the smallest head and it quickly faded to a ring with a tiny bit of lacing . when i pulled the cork out there was no pop or anything and given lost abbey 's reputation i was n't that surprised .

appearance : this is a hallmark of this beer : the soapy , lingering suds of the head stay there for a long time after poruing and there are also legs of foam that build up as you drink . color is a deep amber , with orange highlights on the rims . almost a browness core to it .
appearance : the standard crystal-clear , pale straw-yellow body with a fizzy white head that recedes rapidly .
a : pours a light golden-straw color ; small head that dissipates quickly , not much lacing
a : it 's a dark brown color with a light tan head about a thumbs width . the head on this beer is very full and creamy . there 's great lacing in the glass .

a : standard pour yields a coarse ring of white bubbles atop a cloudy , light silt-colored beer . rather small legs with some spotty lacing with moderate to low retention . not the most attractive beer .
a : a big white frothy head with excellent lacing that followed . brilliant looking deepstraw/gold color and very appealing .
a : poured with a nice head that stuck around for a long time . the color was amber but definitely hazy ... extremely hazy .

appearance : pours out thick , flat and murky . looks uncarbonated . no head whatsoever . body is nearly opaque and muddy brown in color . looks ... swampy ? this beer is also surprisingly clean , leaving no lacing or oily residue on the walls of the glass . interesting .
appearance : amber orange . lacing along the glass .
a : pours dark brown with purple hue , has a cloudy appearance ... similar to dark chocolate milk . no head retention .
a : watery tan of coors light fame .
a : very dark -- nearly black but with a hint of redness ; beautiful , dense head ; wonderful , even lacing
a : absolutely beautiful . brilliant red body with a nice white head .
a : pours a murky red with a full white head , long lasting , great lace .
a : no head at all . colour is a semitransparent gold . sm : light bacteria , yeast , and barley . a mild strength aroma .
a : deep amber , light copper color , with a minimal frothy off white head . great full coating of lacing around the glass .

a : you can immediately tell the bottle-conditioning from the yeast sediment that trickles into the glass as you pour ; fairly thin-looking ruby-red/copper/amber color , very sparkly , decent head and very minor lacing .

appearance : served in an eight-ounce glass , it comes with a superb tan head , almost overflowing from the glass . perfect one-finger height/depth and lots of bubbles . does n't die ! outrageous retention , stays on and on . fantastic lacing as well .

a : pours a crystal clear straw with a half finger of head that dissipates extremely quick . light-medium carbonation with poor lacing . n : honey , red licorice straws , creams soda , orange zest , white grapes and perhaps some corn .

a : very large head , maybe too large . nice , off white color though and good dexterity . lots of texture . sparse but consistent lacing . brownish amber coloring , very clear . no active carbonation though .
a : dark coffee brown . bordered cherry hued . rare lace .
a : black with a massive and dark tan , creamy looking head that has great lasing .
appearance : pale amber color with a fair head .

appearance : pours that lovely double ipa golden amber . this one is particularly hazy , which i love . an impressive , bubbly 2 finger head , which sticks around and leaves major league lacing . this is what a double ipa should look like .
appearance : pours out a reddish mahogany color , with 2 '' of light khaki head . retention is incredible on this beer , and the lacing is awesome as well .
