a : poured an opaque black / hints of brown when held in the light / nice head / very elegant

appearance : amberish ... like a dark unfiltered apple cider , almost non-existent off white head , looks viscous flavor : malty ... bread , nuttiness , and some citrus notes . too sweet for a true triple , almost boarding on a barleywine like flavor with belgian yeast
a : cinnamon brown , no head , no lace . uh oh !
appearance : very deep and dark reddish amber color with a massive , offwhite and foamy head with good retention , that left lots of lace .
a : looks more like apple juice . barely any bubbles , almost no head that dissipated extremely quick . it is a nice yellow in color though for a pale .
a : quite a bit of sediment on the bottom tried to leave most in the bottle . pour a nice black color . the head dissapoints ... there is none .
a : pale amber , not as dark orange as some . nice 1 '' head , medium bubbles and moderate retention . some lacing .

appearance : slow motion gusher as i took the cap . lava lamp coagulation is disappointing as i am in the age range suggested by the label , if at the tail end of it . im patiently waiting and most of it is settling toward the bottom of my glass . hazy deep brown with a skimpy cover of tiny light tan bubbles but a good collar flavor : firm alcoholic note but not hot . malt fruit note is pure and simple , im guessing special b and candy sugar in the brewing . there is a mild bubble gum note as well . there is an earthy quality as well , like sugar beets . definite belgian yeast quality lends it a trappist air .

appearance : the beer comes to me in an imperial pint with a big , fluffy khaki head . after the head recedes , a lasting , chunky layer remains . as the glass is drained , a nice layer of lacing is left behind . the beer itself is a ruby brown in color .
a : pours a light brown iced tea like color . not much head at all .
a : clear medium amber body with an inch of dense , creamy , off-white head . terrific retention and solid lace . gorgeous beer , plain and simple .
a : pours dark brown with a soft white head , some lace .
a : peachy orange ; no head ( ! ) ; good carb action ; looks viscuous
appearance : reddish drak amber tint
a : poured into a franziskaner glass , a billowing soft white 2 '' thick head above a hazy amber body .
a : pours a hazy orange body with a sudsy white head that leaves light lacing .
a : the beer pours dark brown in color with a little bit of murkiness to it . minimal head ( insert joke here ) .
a : surely one of the best looking beer ever . the head is nice off white and really creamy and how the bubbles makes it brownish at first is awesome !

a : deep brown with a fantastic ruby hue . pours with a light head that reduces to light layer of bubbles and thick ring around the glass . very nice lacing . this is what a barley wine should look like !
a : a reddish-amber color with a one-and-half finger white head that turns in a nice white lace .
appearance : tawny , pilsner body with busy effervesence unfortunately props a head that is thin and inconsistent ...

appearance : wow , i actually had to pull the cork out of the bottle . no pop at all ! not a good start . poured out murky brown and completely flat . when swirled vigorously , a hair-thin light brown head forms on top . body is opaque , dark brown , and slick . no lacing . second pour produced a bit more head - looked much nicer .
appearance : cola . stiff pour resulted in slow forming head that overflowed . think sustaining head .
a : 11.2 oz bottle . a soild 3 fingers worth of head . medium lacing , straw yellow in color .
a : much thicker head than i would have thought with something this high gravity . it is a deep amber color but nothing noticeably different than a standard ipa . still nice looking .
a : incredibly black with a dark tan head that froths and bubbles like a mud pot
a : thin white head w/ no retention or lacing . pale golden body .
a : stiff pour in pils glass results in beautiful golden/orange with thick tannish head that flattens out . lacing remains throughout drink .
a : the beer is a very pale yellow color with a thin white head that fades quickly and leaves a thin lace on the glass .
appearance : pours a lovely coffee-bean brown with a well-retained 3/4 finger chocolate brown , thick , soft head and bubbly lacing around the glass . very dark and viscous .
a : light golden color with small head that fades quickly .
a : this is quite a pale ale , clear gold with a light one-finger head that fades to a collar .

a : pours pitch black . absolutely no light penetrates . anywhere . in fact , this beer allowed my glass to reflect everything as clearly as a mirror . beautiful , thick , dense foam with bubbles so tiny you can barely even notice them . almost like yeast cake . there is considerable , sticky lacing all over the glass except in the area where the top layer of foam is desperately clinging for dear life to the top of the glass . that area is simply caked with lacing . it just will not let go ! magnificent .
a : no head ! nice carbonation , but no head ; cloudy , pale yellow

a : a long , smooth , straight pour from on high results in a perfectly gorgeous stout : the opaque black body sits placidly underneath a dense dark-brown head that lifts itself almost to the brim of the over-sized tulip ; from there the chocolate-colored foam slowly dies down , leaving chunky lacing all down the sides of the glass . beautiful .
appearance : dark black with a 2 finger mocha head
a : it would appear that this beer is bottle conditioned . it has thick sediment at the bottom of the bottle . pours a very cloudy orange color . nice retention and decent lacing .
a : opaque dark red body with a finger of frothy reddish-tan head . ok retention and spotty lace . not particularly memorable-looking .
a : thick , lacy , amazing head with this awesome falling bubble action -- like guinness but so much more visible & brilliant . clings well . very dark , amber brown body .
appearance : pale very light orange-bronze colour . very clear . the head is slightly off-white , moderately low and foamy . impaired retention and very little lacing .
a : dark brown body with no head and leaves no lacing .
appearance : nothing special -- an almost cloudy straw color . it keeps a small creamy head which i like .

appearance : pours a mahogany , ruby amber . zero carbonation , no pressure when cork removed , absolutely flat . from other reviews , this seems to be the norm but i ca n't help but subtract points for it .
appearance : golden with heavy carbonation . nice head , soft and pure white . sheets of lacing
appearance : clean copper in color . 1/2 inch thick white head . minute lacing .

appearance : the backwoods bastard is a turbid brew , with a color between reddish-amber and auburn . it pours with very little evidence of carbonation . swirling the glass raises only a thin veil of ivory colored foam which dissipates quickly , though the foam does tend to hang around longer as the beer warms . this beer does n't create much lacing , just some sticky dots of foam on the glass . not very attractive , but maybe this beer has a nice personality .

a : let me start off by saying that this is a breathtakingly beautiful beer . the body is a deep , clear , luminous garnet hue and sits invitingly beneath a 1-finger head of the creamiest foam i 've ever seen . retention is off the charts , and copious amounts of fluffy lace coat the sides of the glass all the way down . gorgeous .

appearance : this beer is surprisingly beautiful . it 's amber hued dark brown in color with a thick and creamy off white head . there 's some great retention to the head but there is n't much lacing going on .
a : copper colored with a substantial head that fades to impressive lacing .
a : beautiful dark ruby . head was about a finger and a half and mostly white with a yellowish tint .

a : this is a 5 for the can along . my father smiled just seeing it . he began to talk about work trips to rochester back in the 70s and drinking the piss out of genny . beer wise a fairly clear brown . poured with 2 fingers of white head that quickly went away .
a : pours a nice cherry / brown with a thin head that quickly dissipates . looks great .

a : poured clear ( yes i said clear ) bubbles with no head formation at all . this one is looking quite rough . there 's a murky toffee/carmel body that looks a bit redeeming , but the lack of head has me concerned . obviously there 's no lacing to speak of . this reminds me of so many `` brandy barrel aged '' offerings i 've had . however , i do n't think this thing has ever seen a barrel .

appearance : an easy 3 finger head that just wo n't quit with amazing retention and spider web-like lines crisscrossing in the glass . the body is a dark amber bordering on brown with a very hazy aspect .
a : aggressive pour yields 2 fingers of off-white head with good retention . copper colored liquid .
a : pours jet black , no light passes through . builds an impressive black/brownish head .
a : black body with great looking mocha head of a pinky that never goes away and leaves mountains of lacing in its wake . awesome .
a : bright , clear gold yellow color . poured a 2 finger frothy white head that gave way to a broken skim . decanted lightly . laced in thin rings .
appearance : a good looking clear pale amber color with a nice looking white head . leaves nice lacing on the glass . forget it after this .

a : a fairly virorous pour yeilds quite an impressive head four inches at first then cascades beautifully into a two inch fluffy coffee colored masterpiece of a head that stays a cap for the length of the tasting . a jet black beauty with suprisingly sticky lace . very inviting , almost seductive when the glass is paired with the bottle .

appearance : so black i could n't see even a hint of light through it when i held it next to a 60w bulb . the head betrayed it ... too foamy , too lacey , not thick like you 'd expect from such a dark stout .
a : poured very dark brown into a pint glass - chunky amber head disapated quickly , leaving nothing on the glass .

a : a hazy honey / light amber body with gold tint when held to the light . pours with a finger of head that quickly recedes into nothing , despite a vigorous pour . uh oh . i think this one is flat , too . that explains why it took so much work to pull out the cork .

appearance : this was an orange brew with an incredible sustained bead . the head was thick and fluffy and just would n't go away , being fueled by all the rising bubles . it coated the sides of the goblet with lace , sometimes in solid sheets .
a : it poured a clear diluted yellow body and a slender white head that did not generate much lacing but did support sticky long legs .
a : pale slightly hazy apricot body with a big fluffy white head . the head sticks around for a while and leaves lots of clumpy lacing as it recedes . great looking beer . 5/5

appearance : poured into a pint glass . seems like this is the weakest looking of the doppelbock style - a style that i usally associate with a very dark and opaque appearance . a clear amber color , you can see right through it , giving it a deceptively weak appearance . michelob amber bock is darker than this , which is a big negative . one finger head quickly dissipates ( if it even forms at all ) . not a strong point here . way below average . made me not want to drink it .

a : pours a clear , bright gold body with moderate effervescence underneath a 3/4 '' , reasonably dense , white foam head . retention is mediocre at best , but there 's some nice solid lacing left behind . looks refreshing .
a : a deep mahogany with a thin dirty white head that thins slowly and only leaves spotted lacing . poured in an american shaker pint

a : pours a slightly murky amber / maroon body in my 1l hofbrau mug . the first pour is literally more than half foam , with a fluffy 5-finger-thick cap enveloping most of the mug . it retains for over a minute , crackling and snapping all the while , leaving a few wispy trails of lacing in its wake .

appearance : a dark amber red with a copper hue . there is a quarter inch white ring around the glass with some creaminess . there is some effervescence in the glass , and some bubbles on the bottom of the glass . the clarity is slightly hazy , but mostly clear .
appearance : dark , ruby red body . nice head on pour , but it dissipates rapidly , leaving very little lacing on the glass and very little head left as you finish the glass .
a : orange pale color of an ipa almost . chestnut off white head with little lacing and good haziness . fluffy head dissipated fast .
a : bright yellow color with a thick white foam head that quickly dissipates . little to no lacing .
a : pours a light orange rind , hazy . decent sized off white head forms and holds for a bit . decent lacing .

a : pours a cloudy orange-caramel body . 1/4 '' tannish-white head fades to nothing very quickly , but surges back to 1/8 '' after every sip . a lot of yeast sediment floating around at the bottom of the glass .
a : carbonation not great ; a thin head sits on a very black body ( with perhaps a trace of purple )
a : pours a dark nearly opaque brown . at first a two finger beige head forms . it gently recedes in a minute and leaves lots of spiderweb looking lace .

appearance : pours a very clear ruddy amber into a shaker pint . a 2-finger , off-white head forms on top and drops to a full cap of foam . lacing comes in solid sheets draping the entire height of the glass .
appearance : pours opaque black with a very large brown head that dissipates slowly and leaves good lacing behind .
a : hazy body , bubbly head that doesnt last or stick long enough . agitation doesnt bring enough back either .
a : loads of carbonation while pouring , and a sizable head . it 's a light amber color and is very transparent . sparse carbonation bubbles .
a : it poured a very cloudy amber with a pink hue . beautiful looking glass of beer . there was pretty much no head at all and the little it had dissipated fast .
a : pours a dark honey color with 2-3 fingers of light khaki head , which retains well and leaves good lacing .
a : pours dark brown with a massive frothy head . the thickist lacing i 've ever seen covers the glass .

a : pours a ridiculously opaque black with mild brown edges when held to the light . the head is three and a half fingers of dark chocolate cappucino head . head retention is incredible . in fact , it 's as good as i 've ever seen .
appearance : a nice offwhite head with good retention . the beer is an opaque light amber color . good looking belgium ale .
a : deep , hazy golden under a large white head . some lace and nice retention . nice looking beer .

appearance : 12 oz bottle with no freshness date . i dropped this one into a samuel smith 's imperial pint glass at about 45 degrees . she pours a mildly cloudy , dark amber at the top with an orangish bottom . i am greeted with a light tan 1/8 inch head . after the initial pour , there 's only a couple fizzes coming up to the top and the head retains nicely .
a : pours so dark brown that i almost think it 's black . the head is a joke ; very small , very airy and leaves almost no lacings .

appearance : can was a little explosive when first opened , it had been sitting still for a while . the glass was mostly foam , but that quickly settled into some beer and two distinct heads . the `` bottom '' head is a pale yellow and cascading down into the beer . the `` top '' head is almost pure white with the heavy foam typical of nitros . the beer itself is a nice , crystal clear copper .
appearance : somewhat clear , with a sort of bronze-y/copper look to it when poured .

a : wow , this beer just out guinnessed guinness . not only were their falling bubbles in the head , there were lines of them . the black black bottom layer , the layer of bubbly head mixed with some more beer , and a layer of just liquidy foam , all racing for the bottom , defying the rules of physics . this beer is an obsidian black , no light comes through , not even from a maglight at point blank range . the head is dark tan and creamy , leaving a great lace as it goes down .

appearance : an amber color with orangish hues . there was a one finger head but dissipated to a quarter inch white foam ring around the glass . the beer displays some effervescence . the clarity of the beer is slightly hazy , but for the most part clear .
appearance : poured into a tulip . lots of sudsy , creamy white head atop a translucent but hazy orange gold brew .
a : pours dark brown with a big tan head that erupted late into the pour . lots of thick lacing and a head retention .
a : deep reddish brown color with a thick light tan head and moderate lacing .
a : a nice clear golden copper with a big 1+ inch off-white head that fades at a decent pace , but never completely disappears . very good .
a : when poured it leaves an amazing 2 in foam which then recedes into about an inch of foam which lasts for awhile .
appearance : very pale yellow with a small head that does a real fast disappearing act .
appearance : 5/5
a : pours a very dark brown with a small brown head with poor retention and no lacing .
appearance : pours a hazy dark golden color with a bountiful head that leaves loads of splashy lacing
a : pours a rusty brown , reddish , under a big off white head . excellent retention and lace .
appearance : yellow
a : poured a bold golden color with a thin completely diminishing head and no lacing on the glass .
a : pale light amber in color with a big fluffy white head that recedes slowly leaving adequate lacing . off to a great start . 4/5
a : dark amber in color , 1 fingers worth of fluffy white head that settles to a nice layer that sticks around for the entire session , lacing is wonderful . great looking beer .
a : the beer served up a nice dark brown , call it cola , with a nice brownish head that was not all that well retained , except for a small thin cap . this is the best part of the beer .
appearance : poured a pale yellow color , clear . one finger bubbly had with minimal retention . visible carbonation . no lacing .

appearance : beer is brownish with slight amber hues . high clarity , could read the other side of my glass through it . small white head , fades quickly . flavor : subdued chocolate and caramel flavors . getting some type of sugary taste . higher bitterness than expected . alcoholic in finish . very clean beer .
appearance : a crystal-clear golden body capped by two fingers of fluffy white head that burns off quickly and leaves no lacing .
a : pale golden , great white lacing , constant bubbles ... awesome .

appearance : very bright , clear amber colour topped by a thick off-white head . retention was excellent without the aid of high carbonation and thick foam stuck to the side of the glass all the way to the end .
appearance : reddish orange with almost no head which is acceptable for a 14 abv . but not `` the most extraordinary beer in the world ``
a : pours a pale gold with a thin white head that dissipates down into nothing . no lacing to be seen .
appearance : pours a copper / burgandy color with a large 3 '' fluffy head that sticks around a while . nice lacing develops .
a : a deep orange-red body with no head to speak of to really speak of .
a : clear , light amber with over one finger of persistent white foam . lacing is heavy on the glass with clear step-wise progression for the first two inches .
a : a cloudy light golden yellow color that was unfiltered . i really liked the long lasting thick head and dense lacing on the glass .
a : pours a crisp reddish/amber . two-finger head and great lacing around the glass . carbonation originating from one point at the bottom of the glass . looks like smoke rising from a chimney .
a : crystal clear mahogany body with two inches of ultra-fine off-white head . great retention and lacing . stellar .

appearance : poured a nice light tan head that lasted the whole way down . plenty of lacing too . the beer is a dark brown on the table , but definitely has garnet notes when held up to the light . plenty of bubbles coming up slowly through the beer when held up to the light .
appearance : wow . black gold , totally effin ' nailed the name , i thought i was pouring oil into my glass that was thinned down with paint thinner !
appearance : the beer is just beautiful . a nice dark tone that does n't look sloppy . you can see that it is a nice thick , heavy beer .
a : brown amber color with very little to no head . despite the dark color , it was very clear with no signs of effervescence or bubbles .
appearance : a nice golden/honeyish color , somewhat of a hazy appearance with a ivory white head . decent head retention and lacing .
a : clear , tawny red color , poured with a head that quickly dissipated
appearance : clear , golden color . plenty of carbonation . head pours nicely then recedes to a thin/flimsy head with minimal glass sticking .
a : basically no head , little carbonation , light gold .
a : opaque deep brown to black body topped with a small fizzy tan head that quickly dissipates leaving no lace and just a ring of bubbly cover .
a : brown with red highlights . pretty clear . one finger tan head with great retention and lacing .
a : cloudy red/amber color . poured a 1 finger white head that dissipated quickly . laced in light , inconsistent broken rings .
appearance : pours a clear , pale yellow , heavily carbonated , yet no lasting foaming or lacing .

a : umm ... more than a little bit fugly . even after letting this bottle sit for a couple weeks to let the setiment settle , this beer goes beyond hazy . murky with heavy , heavy setiment . very slight bubbled ring tops brownish red swamp of a beer .
a : pours a cloudy peach color with honey-colored highlights at the edges . has very little head to speak of , and only the faintest wisp of a donut collar , made up of fine champagne bubbles .
a : the beer is a light yellow color , with a medium-sized white head that fades very quickly and leaves very little lace on the glass .

a : well , perhaps i have to blame myself for using my tulip for this , but this is actually pretty good looking ( for the style , of course ) . a brilliant gold body with lively carbonation starts out topped by two inches of surprisingly dense white foam . after a while ( much longer than i expected ) it settles into a thin cap and ring , with a bit of lace left around the sides . not bad at all .
a : reddish-brown , absolutely no head .
a : no real head at all . amber colour . sm : very light amber hops . that 's it . a bit bland .
a : pours an orange amber with excellent clarity . 1-2 finger peanut head dissipates to a moderate sheet of the same . thick , sheeted lace ( not plural , all one wave - nice )
a : clear yellow-gould , four finger thick head reduces to two figers in a minute . decent bubble display .
appearance : blood red with a fine lace .
a : clear , light amber color with one finger of lofty and persistent off-white foam head . heavy lacing remains -- nearly continuous toward the top .
a : love how the nitrogenated guinness looks , so ca n't expect the carbonated version to compare .
a : poured a reddish / brown in color with a 1-2 inch head that disappeared quickly to nothing and left very minimal lacing as i took the first sip .
appearance : always cool to watch a guinness after it 's poured , it just never gets old . black in color , but see-through in the light . really nice tan head .
a : color is a clear , thin straw . pours with moderate amounts of head , quickly dissipating with no lace . pretty much what one imagines horse urine to look like .
a : a crazy pink colour . from some angles it looks amber , from others , bright pink . bizarre . moderately carbonated with light head .

appearance : looks is the best attribute of this beer . it has a wonderful clear , deep maghogany color . it pours with a thick bright white head that quickly desipates to one-half finger in thickness . it does produce moderate lacing .
a : 3/4 '' white head that dissipated quickly over straw coloured liquid with excellent clarity .
a : pours an even black with a thick , dense , light brown head that quickly faded into a fuzzy film . some streaks of soapy lace are present but it quickly disappears .
a : light straw color fair amount of caronation . little head that reduces very quicly
a : poured from the green bottle into a pint glass . somewhat of an aggressive pour left a rather large head ... that left rather quickly . a yellow translucent body , that is n't all that inviting .
a : dark ale with limited translucency and little head . only a centralized light peanut cap evidencing the carbonation in the beer . no lacing .
a : great looking beer , dark and deadly , with an cloudy 2 cm brown leather head . lacing was pretty awesome on this stout as it clung on for it 's carbonated life .

a : poured a golden straw yellow color with a one-finger head of creamy white foam and ample carbonation . lacing is the best part of the appearance , as it leaves a full sheet of webby lace down the opposite wall of the glass .
a : perfectly translucent light amber color . head is pure white and looks very creamy . retention and lacing are phenomenal considering the low abv . one of the best looking beer i 've see .
a : black , touch of tan head , no retention , hint of leg .
a : this beer looks quite good , fluffy bright white head atop a crystal clear dark-honey colored malt base sporting visible carbonation bubbles .
a : poured a very nice hazy amber , decent head
appearance : perfect for an imperial stout . thick chocolate brown-black that pours more viscous than an irish stout . the head is huge and hangs around like a cappuccino . ( 4.5 )
a : pours a hazy copper orange color . the head is almost soda like - fizzing away almost immediately after the pour .

appearance : a somewhat cloudy and dark brown beer , with ruby highlights . the head zoomed to the top of the glass , and amassed over three inches in height . the head is tan in color and is quite cakey . lots of sticky looking lace clings on , from top to bottom .
a : poured a huge three finger dark tan head with great retention , leaving lots of lacing . black body .

a : pretty color , a warming blend of muddled orange and apricot hues and a deeper ruddy pomegranate . hardly any head , a quick fizzle of froth and gone in seconds . almost no carbonation either , a few sleepy rising bubbles . no lace .
appearance : a hazy amber body with three fingers of white foam . this stuff is intensely carbonated - a torrent of rising bubbles keeps the head going for what seems like forever .

a : pours golden clear with a lingering white foamy head . this head lasted the entire beer and left a beautiful lace . i do n't know if you could ask for anything better on appearance from a beer imho .

appearance : dirty ruby-orange body with lots of carbonation and a head that just wont quit . the beige crown is exceptionally thick both in dimension and in density . this froth reminds me of a trick a czech broad taught me years ago when i was staying with her in france . if one could balance a small coin , the pre-euro czech equivalent to the dime on the head of a beer for ten seconds , then the beer was good . well this beer looks like its froth could balance a half dollar for a minute !
a : deep brown with an off-white head , awesome retention & lace .
appearance : very murky orange , descent carbonation , unimpressive head .
a : clear golden in color with a good sized frothy head . nice looking bubbles through out , nice lacing .
a : clear golden color . agressive pour resulted in half a finger of head that fell quickly , but surprisingly left a decent amount of lacing . 4.0
a : nice dark golden straw ( can we say wheat ) ; had a thick white head reduced slowly and laced down , ok.
a : pours a cloudy orange with very little head or lacing .

appearance : deep brown with ruby edges . a nice multi-sized leather head formed then retreated to a thin cover . it formed some respectable lace . flavor : rich malt base with the slightest smoky peat edge . i normally dont like scotch ales because of the strong peat/scotch taste , but this is well proportioned . i get some sweet milk chocolate flavor as well . the alcohol is felt more than tasted , its warming my chest . a nice caramel flavor runs through the beer like a ribbon through ice cream .
appearance : poured black , with 3 finger dark brown head . completely opaque . the head has good retention and has a good thick foam . very nice lacing all the way down .
appearance : light copper color , sudsy head sticks around for a while , good clarity , inviting

appearance : deep dark brown body . thick tan head just wo n't die ! ca n't think of many other beers that maintain such a great head for so long . beautiful lacing . a fair amount of sediment i did n't notice in previous tastings even with a fairly careful pour .

a : nearly two fingers of a creamy nitro head firmly settles over an amber to caramel hue . i ca n't see through the glass because the lacing left behind by the wonderful retention is covering every speck of the pint .
a : pale clear yellow with less than a finger of white head .
a : the beer pours a murky , maybe chill haze , with only a little ring of white head and not much lacing ...
a : big ass pillowy head . nice retention throughout and very strong lacing . poured very slowly resulting in a perfectly clear golden color .

appearance : : it pours a deep and hazy amber with lots of visible carbonation . the head was small for the style ( may have been a bad pour ) and did n't retain particularly well but had a nice even lacing .
appearance : pours black with just a bit of red around the edges and a respectable head . fades slowly to leave quite a bit of lacing on top of the beer and the galss .
appearance : pours a zero head , dark cloudy and brown .
appearance : pours a red-orange color with a one inch head that quickly dissipates . moderate lace clings to the glass and stays put . no carbonation is present .
appearance : which color ? this beer has no color . a finger height of foam .
a : this was black and it poured with a huge , uneven , extremely sticky , and very long lasting tan head .
a : coloring reminds me of iced tea with minimal lacing at the top
a : decent head , but weak retention . gold color ... nothing special .
appearance : pours a very very pale , clear , straw yellow with a fizzy white head , diminishing extremely fast to nothing .
a : pours a light amber/blonde , with a small white head with poor retention , no real lacing to be seen .
a : looks like muddy water when poured into my glass . zero head .
appearance : pours a pitch black color with a head that rises to only 1/2 '' , off-white in color , and recedes rather quickly . it was presented to me with no head left , or any lace .
a : yellowish gold , mild head - nothing special
a : a bustling carbonation can be seen among a deep , dark red body . head nearly topples my glass , nearly doubling the size of the beer . retention is thorough . so is the lacing .
a : poured a burgandy brown with a thin head and a little sticky lacing .

appearance : a murky concoction , a deep amber body with a thin off-white head . virtually no head retention and zero lacing , this beer is merely ok to look at . lots of yeasty floaties in the final pour , chances are this was bottled several years ago .
a : cloudy thin light yellow , hazy translucent , unfiltered . it looks a little funky , albeit inviting and tasty .

appearance : arrived at the table with a thin , compressed , undulating , white head perched on top . body was opaque and golden-orange - looked exactly as it should ( in my opinion , anyway ) . active carbonation allowed the head to sustain itself for the entire session . long , leggy lacing stretched the entire length of the glass .
a : perfect . golden wheat yellow with nice carbonation and great lacing .

a : the bcs beers are n't know for the good looks and this is the same . poured a thick , viscous black color . the amount of fizzy medium brown head peaked about about one finger before quickly falling back into the bourbony abyss below . 4.5

appearance : very clear golden glass holds a nice head of white that laces impressively . flavor : mild sweetness has a slight artificial edge . corn flavor competes with a earthy hop that is almost powdery . no skunk in a clear bottle is pretty impressive .
a : orange as juice , honestly , i might have thought that 's what it was if i was n't at a bar . there was no head , and no active carbonation that i could see .
appearance : this is a dark viscous looking beer . with a thin brown head that dissapates fairly quickly .
a : it pours a murky burnt orange color with no head ( just like dfh but much cloudier ) .
a : pours a somewhat murky dark mahogany , nearly opaque , with some ruby highlights when held to light . head is compact and dissipates , but leaves a one centimeter cap . little lacing .

appearance : clear deep yellow mug with a firm half finger of snowy white head that leaves thick sheets of lace with tidemarks . flavor : wet grain is the main flavor , some mild hop , a slight metallic twang , and very light fruit ester . what i dont taste is alcohol , which given the style , is a good sign . as it warms a bit , the flavor goes down hill , with the metallic note growing joined by a bit of cloying sweetness . serving suggestion : go cold , in a frosted mug .
a : pours a dark shade of gold . see through body with an tremendous white head ! lacing leaves layers after every sip .

a : very dark plum with a finger of brilliant pink head . thick and heavy legs visibly show the hefty gravity this beer still possesses . very minimal lacing leaves about a half dozen spots on the glass . it looks big , it looks foreboding , it looks most impressive . 5/5
a : pours a very pale yellow color with large head that fades quickly .
appearance : served in a great dane nonic pint , clear copper-amber , fluffy white cap with decent retention
appearance : poured a very pale yellow , clear . no head at all , not even a coating . visible carbonation . no lacing
a : poured a caramel color with a thin , lacy white head .
appearance : deep red , orangish brown . pours with a nice large head that has good retention . small amount of lacing as well . very transparent .

a : poured it into a la chouffe tulip glass which turned out to be a good call . it has a dark amber/ medium brown color . the head on this stuff is unreal . just off white in color and has fairly large bubbles . perhaps some of the best head retention i have ever seen i think if i wanted to i could not only float a bottle cap on this stuff but an entire beer bottle . lacing all over the class in rings like the aging of a tree . it has taken at least 10 min for the the foam to subside and even now there is a good quarter inch remaining . well done .
a : it pours a very crystal clear pale amber . once it 's in the glass it becomes a rosy red ... blood orange color . the bottom of the bottle has yeast in it . there is no head at all .

appearance : 5/5 . crisp , golden color and clarity were on point . small head that did n't dissipate and held its own until the bottom third of the beer , but also not too thick and did n't lace the glass . ca n't say too much about a 5/5 ... they nailed it .
a : golden in color ; pours a good amount of non-retentive head which left minimal lacing on my mug .
a : cloudy orange with big white chunks . bottle has sat undisturbed for about a week . not sure why the chunks are there . a thick off-white head that leaves oily laces down the glass .
appearance : clear deep amber in color , with a large , moderately coarse white head , which gradually subsides to a thin layer of foam , with thin , glass-coating lace .
a : dark brown color , clear , thick head that settles to very nice 2 fingers deep , lots of lacing
a : pours a completely transparent straw color . head is small , white , and retention is terrible ( lasting only a second or two )
a : 12oz into a tulip . pours abyss black with a tan/brown head with really nice retention . it leaves some creamy lacing .
a : clear ruby-amber body with a miniscule , quickly evaporating head . no lace . looks undercarbonated in the extreme .

a : pours an endless black , with one of the darkest brown heads i 've ever seen on a beer . an old man sitting adjacent to me said to his wife , `` did you see how dark that is ? '' great head retention and extensive , thick lacing , to start a great looking imperial stout .
a : pours a medium umber brown , with a small white head leaving no lacing .
appearance : head is delicious with nice lacing . head retention is strong . color is a cloudy brown with hints of amber .
a : black body with a dense tan head . great lacing .
appearance : murky cloudy brown . no head .

appearance : dark brown to ruby reddish with a thin creamy head . this beer is like a dumb blonde . the best thing it has going for it is its looks . once you get past the good looks it 's all down hill .

a : pours a very flat-bodied , dirty , dark amber tea-ish colour , consisting of plenty of chunky yeast sediments of all sizes floating in the glass ... even after a force-pour , the beer head still comes to nothing , also suggesting a flat body .

a : the can functions exactly as advertised . poured a light tan suspension of tiny bubbles . as bubbles rose to the top , a clear . golden amber color was topped off with a thick , white , creamy head ( +0.5 ) . good head retention .
a : poured into a pint glass . has a dull orange , brown appearance with some floating particles . has a one-finger head with lacing that remained on the glass .
appearance : pours a ruby brown color with a short 1 finger head that disappears quickly . no lacing develops .

a : hazy orange in color , with some pronounced amber tones to it , especially near the top . pours with a full 2 inches of smooth head with big bubbles at first , whitish in color . sticky but spotty sheets of lacing . esepcially after warming a bit , on the second pour from the bomber , this beer has an awesome color and an amazing creamy head that looks oh so enticing .
a : pours a hazy reddish brown with a good sized head to it that lasts .
appearance : caramel amber brown the white two finger sized leaves some fine belgian style lacing down my snifter .
appearance : dark oaky brown colour when poured from bottle , good head which quickly dissolved into patchy foam .
a : sanguinal ( venal blood ) with hints of gray and a nice , off-white head . this was one of the cloudier and more attractive looking ( if mysterious ) barleywines i 've seen .

appearance : dark ! ! ! ( as sam elliot said in the big lebowski , `` black as a steer 's tuckus on a moonless prairie night '' ) , almost entirely opaque , thick creamy/fluffy dark tan head , great retention , and lots of perma-lacing , max points in the looks department
a : cloudy pure yellow with minimal head and not much lacing . good carbonation .
appearance : served a gorgeous jet black color with a creamy light chocolate head and thick curtains of sticky lace paste over every inch of my glass . the head never receded . magnificent !
a : pale , nearly head-less yellow .
a : look is slightly hazy ; very pale and carbonated . nothing unusual for the style .
appearance : very , very light , clear golden color . head is foamy and about a finger and a half . very short retention and average lacing .

a : pours an amazingly beautiful dark black with a creamy , dark mocha head . the head quickly grows from nothing into a lovely cascade that spawns two fingers of some of the best retaining head i 've ever seen . rings , sheets , and specs of lace were left behind in a beautiful mess !
a : this one is exceptional looking . golden color with huge foaming head that leaves fantastic looking lacing down the glass .

a : cloudy and hazy light orange body with a thick , creamy off-white head . tons of sediment floaties in the glass due to the obvious unfiltered nature of these ithaca series beers . kind of disturbs the overall appearance .

appearance : not a very picturesque irish dry stout . pours black/brown with a twinge of ruby . initially , a vigorous head , but it eventually bids farewell leaving being only a skimpy membrane of tan bubbles . certified organic ? well , that 's a relief !
appearance : light copper body with bubbles clinging to every edge in the tumbler ; white , fizzy , foamy head thins quickly -- definitely filtered ...
appearance : a foggy pale yellow . high visual carbonation , but no head .
appearance : crystal clear . huge head . nice lacing . reddish brown colored . beautiful
appearance : golden color with a nice sized head . laces nicely . very nice .
appearance : pours a very murky dark brown with a reddish hue . there is a small layer of tan head that goes away completely .
a : very brilliant copper colored with red-orange hues against the right light . beautifully fluffy creamy mocha colored head that laced from the top of the glass to the bottom .
a : pours extremely dark brown/black with more than a finger of foamy brown head . perfect stout appearance .

appearance : the color is of pale straw . very small head when i poured it . the head situation just got worse as i drank it , eventually there was no head . this made the beer look like piss swill . next time i 'll drink it from the bottle .
appearance : pours a pure white head , small bubbles , and very creamy looking , decent lacing on the glass . nice yellow hugh to the beer .
a : golden-yellow with a minimal head . looks almost like a lager .

appearance : pours a clear amber color with a thick creamy inch plus of head at first pour . there are a whole lot of bubbles rising to keep the head going for quite some time . there is a whole lot of lacing left after you drink it .
a : pours a hazy gold with no head . leaves no lacing . lots of particulate .

a : as dark as an imperial stout , with a light brown head that sticks to the side of the glass almost obnoxiously ( this thing 's going to take some extra rinsing after i finish ) , it 's gorgeous all the way , for a porter with less than 6 % alcohol , this one has quite the threatening pour and presence .
a : dark amber body with a thin , short-lived head of coarse white foam . forgettable .

a : pours with a ferociously rocky , barely off white head . plenty of stick-to-the-glass so far . excellent retention . very volatile appearance but also very rich and luscious looking . appearance is hazy with a completely opaque burnt sienna , twenty year old penny color . the head is falling at a ridiculously inconsistent rate , creating lopsided mountains . 5.0 hands down . s &
a : an unhealthy pale urine-like color with soda fizz : barely pale yellow with some brown tones . if you ever pee like this , see a doctor .

appearance : came in a uniquely shaped bottle with comments on how it was brewed in honor of the battle of britain . pours with a solid thumb and half finger of head that looks slightly creamy . the head itself laces like crazy and retains quite well . the beer itself is a crystal clear brown however the carbonation looks to be a little be excessive . still , impressive thus far .
a : a very pale golden yellow color with minimal white head .
a : pours a cloudy yellow with a medium white head with good retention , thick lacing .
a : pours a mildly hazy rose color with no head to speak of . a thin crown of white bubbles lines the top ring with some spotty lacing across the top .
a : pours a dark red color , nice sized head with great lacing down the glass
a : looks just like soda ( coca-cola ) .
appearance : slightly hazy yellow body with a very , very small , white head .
a : poured vigorously into my tulip leaving a few small bubbles on the surface that fade in a completely flat surface . bottle stated very low carbonation so i expected this .

appearance : clear honey-gold body with a creamy 1-finger , white head . head is pretty damn sticky and actually drags some lacing behind it . a very active carbonation feeds the head throughout the session , providing fantastic retention ! i 'm not really a pilsener man , but this looks damn good .
appearance : beautiful , highly carbonated amber color with a thick , white , two fingered head .

a : poured into my stone tulip . this is golden orange with crispy tangerine highlighting . head is about two fingers of snowy white bubbles . retention is very solid . lacing clings in ring like patterns all around the glass . i was n't overly impressed with the appearance but i quickly learned the old adage about judging a book by its cover .

appearance : a slightly hazy , solidly orange-bodied beer , with pinprick-fine carbonation , a healthy one-finger head with relatively brief retention , and fantastic lacing . it 's incredibly fine , with minuscule points of foam forming large , complex patterns inside even larger , more complex patterns . remains throughout the entirety of the drink . how a pale ale/ipa should look .
a : pours a clear deep golden with 2 fingers worth of white creamy head . settles to a finger thick head the entire time and leaves thick walls of lace all over the glass .
a : pours dark black color , small tan head , slight lacing down the glass
a : very dark red with slight very light tab head that stays slightly over the top with nice lacing on the glass 4
a : blond color , creamy foamy head that dissappears almost instantly , the logo says it 's the original pilsener ;
appearance : takes a while to pour , forms a mammoth fluffy white head , good retention . well hazed orange body .
appearance : bright golden yellow , very lively ; 1 finger head , off white , disperses quickly with little lacing
a : light amber looks like honey ! half finger head which turns into nothing , with no lacing .
a : clear yellow gold crowned by a rocky massive white head . the head starts a fine bubbly fizz but refines itself as a thick mouse like foam . this foam clings to everything and laces beautifully .
a : dark , dark brown with a medium brown head that measures 2 fingers . excellent retention and lacing .
appearance : served in a small pint glass . clean amber body with a frothy and lasting head . bubbly .
a : red with a white-tan head . nice 2-finger head with good retention and wonderful lacing . could n't ask for better .
a : dark borwn , almost black body boasting a huge four fingers of off white foamy head . retention is great through the entire drink leaves amazing lacing .
a : standard pour yields a 1 finger , fine chocolate head with poor retention . beer is opaque black . lacing is patchy but with very little cling .

appearance : dark brown body , with little to no head when it settles . finishes looking like a flat lifeless porter . the head is a thin light brown colored halo which struggles to survive . staid rather depressing looks .

a : aggressive pour yields 1/2 finger of tan head with okay retention . translucent dark brown liquid is too light for a stout . maybe a light colored porter or a dark nut brown - minus points for this .
appearance : pours a clear medium amber color with an extraordinarily firm head that laces like a cask ale
a : not much head which quickly fades , hardly any lacing . it has a pleasant reddish brown color .
a : pours a medium to dark amber color , good sized head that stays for the whole drink and excellent lacing . truly a good looking beer .

appearance : got that pale apple juice color to it , with minimal head that soon disappears , as quick as it was poured . the lace is non-existent on this one . was expecting a bit more with the look .
a : light gold color with a thick 2 inch white head that fades slowly . awesome look .
appearance : pours a hazy golden/copper with some orange highlights ; hazy . a beautiful and rich two-inch off-white head forms . stunning head retention - like that of a nitro pour .
a : dark copper hued , slightly hazy , with well-sustained white beer head leaving creamy and tight lacing . good sign that it 's very fresh .
appearance : a nice golden color with an absolutely beautiful head . every time i have poured one of these i got a perfect head . my good friend described it as looking like `` a beer commercial . ''

appearance : much better than average , especially for an aussie beer , and especially for one that does n't use chemicals to make it look good and hold head better - just about every aussie lager does this . if it really is brewed without additives , this is very impressive . lacing and carbonation are also attractive .
a : super deep dark cherry red . almost like a deep red wine . crystal clear with a 1/2 inch white head that fades at a decent pace . very good .
a : the beer is very effervescent and light yellow in color . atop fthe beer sits a white head approximately a half inch thick .

appearance : very clear bright peach yellow with a head of snow colors tiny bubbles . head after pour settled down to a thin spotty coat actively fed with carbonation . no lace and the head died off . flavor : a milder flavor than im used to , ive been drinking heavy beers lately , so this is a radical change of pace . its a very clean beer , no off tastes to be found . magnificent balance , it has a touch of sweet and a touch of bitter . the wheat is left to take center stage .

appearance : beautiful cascading head , typical of all nitro cans ... but i never get sick of it . effect lasts for a minute or two , then settles into a modest , creamy head so dense that you could cut it with a knife . leaves a nice lacing as well..
a : a mirky reddish concoction that just screams pour me out .

appearance : dark brown with amber edges . the off white head died down to a thin film and collar quickly , but is still actively carbonated . left the slightest tidemarks as lace . flavor : the almost lambic sour finish defines the taste . there is also some banana and bubblegum flavors in the background , as well as a touch of the malt , although this is very well balanced to allow the more subtle yeast and a bit of bitter chocolate/coffee tastes to come out , although their appearance is brief .
appearance : thick black body . mousse like dark brown head . thick and rocky . moderate amounts of patchy lace are left behind as i drink .
appearance : pours a very pale golden color . cloudy , but not too cloudy for an unfiltered wheat beer . very little head and what there is dissipates quickly .
appearance : pours a hazy , orange-tinged gold ; foamy , one-inch , milk-white head ( with a rough pour ) ; not much in the way of lacing or head retention .
appearance : very dark for a pale ale . color is that of an amber ale . slightly hazy , bordering on cloudy . large head and good retention . moderate amount of lacing .
appearance : the clarity is fine with a bright pale straw golden hue , the lace lacks retention is reduces to a spotty lace .

a : pours a dark burgundy body , opaque in the thickest regions but surprisingly clear toward the edges . no head , no carbonation up the center , no legs . just a bubble or two from an aggressive pour . no lacing . sadness .
a : very hazy yellowish orange with a fast fading finger of froth .
appearance : pours very dark with a creamy just off white nitro head . i got to say that when it comes to classy looking beers ... this one takes the cake , it literally pours perfect every time .
a : the beer is a very pale yellow color with a very thin white head that fades quickly and leaves almost no lace on the glass .
a : one finger head of decent thickness and okay cream . retention is pretty good considering the high abv and wide-mouthed goblet . clear yellow colour . sm : light scent of cream and barley .
a : frothy head , consistent lacing , and straw gold in color . 10 minutes in and its still pumping fizz .
a : clear , pale gold color . quickly dissipating head .
appearance : light traces of copper are found in a gold base but looks a little bland . beautiful lacing covers a half-empty glass
a : gold color , not much head , not much retention . no lacing . average .
appearance : poured with a 1 cm bubbly tan head that dissipated quickly and left no lacing . the beer is very dark brown and lets no light through .
appearance : transparent golden color with a 1.5 inch head . no carbonation is coming up from the bottom . head is off white . lots of bubble sizes and lace is large in quantity .
a : clear , dark brown color that drowns out all light at the center . on top is two fingers of beige foam head that leaves heavy lacing on the glass .
appearance : penny copper in color , minimal size head with a good pour , nice lacing and retention .
a : pours black with a light tan head , average retention , no lace .
a : this is perhaps the finest looking beer i 've ever seen in my life . the color is amazing and everchanging from a neon orange to a deep mahogany . decent head retention and lots of lacing . 4.0

a : deep amber/mahogany body with a matrix of fine yeast particles in suspension - so fine as to appear clear from a distance . 2 inches of solid off-white head with strong retention and tons of frothy lacing . gorgeous , nay , perfect unfiltered ipa appearance .
a : very dark brown but good clarity when held up to light . decent 1 finger creamy tan head . 4.5
appearance : possibly one of the best looking ipas i have ever seen . perfect bright orange with about a 3/4 inch white head . ( i tend to pour gently )
a : poured into a pint glass . pours a dark black , with a tan , 2 finger head . head drops to a covering withing minutes .
a : dark brown , cola like color . head is off white , minimal and really does n't stay long . a bit hazy .
a : it has an unfiltered and hazy body with a light amber color .
a : very hazy deep amber color with small tan head . head does n't retain for long , but leaves a little bit of lace .
a : pours a bright yellow with a small white head which fades quickly . the only positive about the appearance is the bright body .

a : cap opens without so much as a hiss ... another winner from lost abbey . pours no head , just a coarse mocha colored ring of bubbles around the edge of the glass . beer is an opaque black . lacing is non-existant .
appearance : i 'd say it 's the blackest beer i 've ever seen . it has the darkest brown head too . as a genius once said , `` none more black . ''

appearance : i have seen some gushers but this beer takes the cake , creating a huge mess all over the kitchen counter and floor - by the time things settled down , half the bottle was lost ; what remains pours a cloudy amber color with a surprisingly modest head that left very little lace - imagine that !
a : incredibly deep dark brown with copper undertones - great rocky 1 1/2 inch head
a : pours black with a firm two finger cap of brown head , great thick lace and head retention . like its brother oaked aged yeti , this is one great looking beer .
appearance : poured a pale translucent color with a head that had no retention whatsoever , carbonation was minimal . best date : nov 09
a : small head , deep hazy amber/brown/burgundy , little lacing .
appearance : ca n't fault the beer here . dark red , almost black , with just enough light shining through to show the color .
appearance : pours a clear reddish brown color . super thick 3 '' fluffy tan head that lasts a long time . nice lacing develops through the drink .
a : pours a motor oil black . by the time i arrived , it was fairly flat , so there was no head . probably not fair to knock points off for it , but dammit , this is america .
a : yuck
appearance : beige and completely murky , like a backed up sink . translucent head with odd circular floaties ( unsettled proteins ) . `` what the hell is this ? ! `` , comes to mind .
appearance : good , dark beer with excellent head retention .
appearance : amber colored with a nice 2 '' fluffy head that lasts quite a while . lovely lace paints the glass during the session .
a : wow , beautiful motor oil flowing out of the bottle , giving way to a dark tan head and solid lacing . a truly opaque black , one of the best looking beers i 've seen , major props .

appearance : i just had to pour this beer into a maudite ( damned one ) snifter . this damned beer poured a dark and murky chestnut/chocolate brown color . it was so dark and murky that it it looked like a solid black beer from a short distance , but a wall light cleared that up . wow ! what a disappointing head of foam this quad had . there was a small off white clored skim of foam , but even that quickly dissipated into about 10 bubbly rings along the edge . it did n't bother to leave any kind of lace behind . the bottle 's appearance was better than the beer itself .

appearance : hazy lemon yellow with a short lived large bubble cap that didnt last or lace . flavor : coriander , which i love , is firm and fresh . none of the clove or banana you would expect from a hefe , so im leaning hard toward american wheat . lemon is the predominate fruit element , with a lemongrass finish .
appearance : rich full brown color . no noticeable haze or discoloration .
a : light golden color . medium carbonation pours into a half finger white bubbly head which dissipates quickly . carbonation continues to rise throughout . no lacing to speak of .
a : deep ruby with 2 fingers of solid off-white foam that holds up well . blotches of lacing stick to the glass and hold their ground .
appearance : an amber to copper color with a thin tan head . the head was very unimpressive considering its a hearty ipa . the lacing was very minimal , weak to non-existent .

a : half of a finger of medium-dark brown head is produced on the pour and fizzes out rather quickly . the body is the darkest brown imaginable with tawny tints along the top edges of the glass . lacing is spare .
a : amber orange , very clear with tons of bubbles screaming up from the bottom of the glass . thick , creamy tan head shows excellent retention . beautiful lacing . nothing wrong here !
a : hazy orange colour , with head , somewhat lasting
a : it pours a gorgeous reddish-coppery brown , with two fingers of fluffy , creamy , lacy white foam . terrific head retention and excellent lacing .

appearance : pours a beautiful dark opaque ruddy brown color with an ivory head that retains a frothy cap on the beer that lasts the duration . the massive lacing lined the walls of my goblet . gorgeous .
a : fizzy yellow beer with zero head . crummy wilted looking pepper floating around in it much like a turd in piss .
a : pours a deep burnt orange to brown . medium white head , average retention , limited lace .

appearance : pours pitch black , pretty opaque as well . no head at all . a few big bubbles at the top , but it 's certainly not a beer head whatsoever . looks like a kid blew bubbles in his juice through a straw . looks very flat with no carbonation evident . a slight bit of off-white film lines around the edges of the glass , but that 's the only thing stopping me from thinking it 's dark juice .
a : black , some brown hues ... and a superb rocky head .
a : mildly hazed orange brown color . one finger of frothy beige head that falls rapidly and leaves no lacing . 4.5

a : 5 what a pretty beast . gratuitous head retention , it just sits there like a patient fluffy tan cloud . tightly packed microscopic bubbles , just a coffeed cream dream of a head . body is pretty much black with some tan edge , but with an odd murky looking pour with a clear finish .
appearance : dark black all over ... including the edges . tan rocky head that sticks to the glass in chunks . has plenty of carbonation , but weak on retention .

appearance : poured a cloudy light orange with a massive head ( at least a couple inches , because of the mid-pour swirl ) that dissipated within a few minutes to a thin cap of foam . good lacing throughout .

appearance : black as black can be , this is a very dark beer , which allows no light to pass through . it pours with a nice , half-inch deep head . unfortunately , the head dissipates quickly , leaving a few islands of bubbles and a crown of bubbles around the top .
a : pours a beautiful , clear copper body underneath an inch of creamy white head . strong retention and tons of fine , spidery lace . perfectly gorgeous dipa

appearance : very foamy , persistent , light tan head . hazy , translucent , amber-brown body . flavor : a noticeable metallic twang appears at first . dry malty sweetness w/ an almost minty quality . light apple cider . interesting flavor profile , but not exactly what i was expecting for the style .
a : pours very little head with a single ring of big bubbles that hugs the edge of the glass . beer is an opaque black . lacing is non-existant .
appearance : the best aspect : deep amber with a fluffy creme-coloured head . fairly decent lacing too .
appearance : slightly hazy orange-amber beer with the faintest of white head at the edge of the glass . no lacing at all . is indeed a bit of a pumpkin color .
appearance : nice two fingers of tan foam . the body is a clear dark brown . almost black . good head retention and lacing .
appearance : a nice head atop a brownish tinted brew . head stayed and laced .
a : super deep ruby colored with a half finger of white head . poor head retention but that is to be expected .
a : a golden colour with a cm head that dissipates very quickly .

a : this had about a half inch of head after the poor but it went away almost immediately . it has a real muddy brownish red color to it . there was no lacing at all probably due to the head going away so fast .
appearance : pours a hazy golden orange color with very little white head . i would n't call this one pretty , it kind of glows .
appearance : pours to a beautiful orange-brown , with strong red undertones . nice , fluffy tan head that leaves thick , sticky lacing behind .
a : pitch black . no light coming through . huge creamy head , one of the darkest i 've seen . awesome retention and super sticky lacing .
appearance : very effervescent . a dark copper color that is somewhat hazy , with a mountain of thick , beige head . constant flow of bubbles from the bottom of the glass .
appearance : deep copper ( beautious ! ) , good clarity , nice fluffy tan head w/ good retention and excellent lacing
a : it 's a deep , dark brown/mahogany . not quite opaque . initially it pours a thick tan head that quickly recedes to a thin layer of lace that sticks decently all the way down the glass .
a : i could go without the stone-esque spiel on the bottle . light color hued for an ipa - almost a straw/gold color .
a : this beer has a excellent clear pale golden color to it
a : almost neon orange in color with hues of red . thick creamy head that retains exceptionally well and leaves tons of lacing . 3.5
appearance : black with a nice tan head .
appearance : the head was not much to talk about but was present , a bit on the hazy side donning a yellowish beige hue .

appearance : typical wheat cloudiness , goldenrod yellow in a glass but seemingly much lighter in the pour . i poured a bit aggressively and was surprised to end up with a 50/50 head/beer that stayed around for quite a while . definitely be gentle with your pour .
a : pale yellow body . 1/4 '' white head that disappeared leaving only a ring .
a : pours a deep , cloudy cold . not at all clear , there is a lot of sediment in here .

a : pours a motor oil thick jet black with very dark brown voluminous head that reaches upward to fill the glass . one of the darkest heads that i have ever seen . next to no light gets through this when held up to the light . this looks absolutely amazing , head hangs around for a while and leaves plenty of dark lacing around the glass .
appearance : pours a slightly cloudy yellow color with a one finger fluffy white head that leaves a layer . would n't call this one beautiful .

a : this beer pours a reddish amber with three fingers of rocky white foam . head lingers but slowly collapses , and leaves thick , ropy lacing behind . this is probably the absolute best thing about this beer - it 's really , really pretty .
a : black and clear , with ruby highlights . the head is tan and billowy , sitting 4+ fingers high . good retention and excellent lace in the glass .
a : pours a light goldenrod color with thick lingering head that grasps tightly along the sides of the glass .
a : the beer is a light yellow color , with a thin white head that fades quickly and leaves a very thin lace on the glass .
appearance : poured a medium brown with hints of orange that was relatively clear adorned by a half inch of white foam on top .
a : very nice dark orange/red ale . very nice creamy and big head that lasts a long long time . beautiful beer .
a : pours hazy orange/amber with a hint of white head . not too much bubbly but there is carbonation .
appearance : pale yellow and somewhat clear

appearance : poured from the 500 ml stubby bottle into a branded efes pint glass . the beer is a clear , light golden color with a 2 and a half finger pure white head that sticks around for a while and leaves lacing on the glass ...
a : pours a nearly flat dark dark brown color with a handful of bubbles as a head . tinny spots of soapy lacing were left down the glass .

a : pours a pitch , motor oil black , just as the can does . it is served in a snifter with 1.5 fingers of mocha-colored head . retention is fantastic for an imperial stout . i leave it alone for about an hour to warm , and a light cap remains on the brew the entire time ; when i finally start drinking , it leaves some spots of lace . this is just so outstanding , especially for a high-abv imperial stout , that i ca n't give it anything less than a perfect score here .
appearance : 22oz bomber shared amond friends . the beer pours a dark dar dark black color with a dark brown head . no light comes through the beer . it 's a nice looking stout .
a : this poured a cloudy leather color with a little light tan head and floating chunks of sediment . not the prettiest beer ever .
a : the brew pours with a thin head . dark amber . nothing notable here from a regular bock .
appearance : negligible head , dark brown , slight red .
a : bright , clear , deep orange-amber body with a steady stream of bubbles rising to the 2-finger head of extra-creamy tan foam . strong retention and plenty of lace . awesome .
appearance : poured into a pint glass ( made two pours ) black ( how black can black be ? ) , with a nice 1/2 inch brown head . this head has some staying power . leaves some good lacing .
a : pours a nice black color with absolutely no head . i was surprised by the lack of head .
a : pours a dark black with a nice very dark brown head that fades to a small layer leaving a ton of lacing on the glass . beautiful stout .
a : pours a hazy orange color , nice 2 finger width head with great lacing down the glass
a : medium amber coloring , not much head or lacing to speak of . not too impressive .

appearance : pours a three finger , medium looking , fluffy , crackly white head with very good retention . caps the glass nicely . cloudy gamboge orange with higher levels of carbonation for the style . head slowly fades to only a ring with carbonation bubbling up to the top . looks flat by the end and leaves no lacing down the glass . started out strong , but finished with a whimper .
a : beer pours no head and no lacing . barely carbed . color is a clear goldenrod . just below standard even given the style .
a : gentle pour yields just a thin ring of frothy lacing around the edge of the glass . beer is a semi-cloudy clay-brown . lacing is stringy and thick with moderate cling . pretty average .

appearance : clear straw yellow with active carbonation and a thick white head . a dense film of bubbles remained throughout consumption and left a thick sheet of lace on the plastic . i could n't see through it , it was so thick .
a : slides into the glass a deep mahogany color with some rusty highlights . no trace of carbonation , foam , or lace . some suspended sediment is visible . lifeless .
a : looks like a typical wiessbier , only a little more blonde : light hazy orange body with a creamy and dense white head .
appearance : pours a dark , hazy maroon , bordering on brown into my duvel tulip . the beer is topped by a small fizzy head the fades quickly . minimal lacing on the glass .
appearance : pours a deep brown ( but not black ) with ruby highlights when held up to the light . one finger head that dissipates slowly while i let the beer warm up .
a : pours a bit dark amber with a reddish tint -- cloudy . half finger head that clings to the edges of the glass .

a : very dark brown colour when seen againt the lamp on the wall , but it is pitch-black in the dim light on the first floor of this tavern ; comes with a beautiful , slightly yellowish , more-than-one-inch foamy creamy and long-lasting beerhead ... just brilliant .

a : there was a lack of 'whoosh ' upon removing the cork , and to no surprise the beer poured dead flat . a hint of bubbles on the edges . the body of the beer is a deep dark brown bordering on black .
appearance : pours a clear brown color with an orange/red highlight . the head is white and is so short-lived i do n't know how tall it actually was . swirling makes some lace .
a : 4.0 beer poured very cloudy buy quickly turned very a opaque golden coler . lots of carbonation moving around the glass .
a : dull golden-orange color . great clarity . huge rocky head is comprised of large bubbles . heavily carbonated , excellent retention . patchy lacing .
appearance : pours a lovely , clear copper body with a creamy-looking , lush white head .
a : black stout pours to gain no head , but vigorous stirring provides a minimal dark mocha film . little visible indicators of carbonation . no translucency whatsoever .
a : very nice looking dark , hazy amber/brown . nice thick , sticky head with great retention and leaves lots of thick lacing .
a : black with a huge , light-tan head ; good retention & a wonderful lacing .

appearance : poured into pint glass . weird pink hue that reminded me of pickled beets . i was afraid to spill in on my clothes for fear of a stain that would not come out . the head was this but stayed until the end with little lacing .
a : dark amber with a reddish hue , and a solid 3-finger head that leaves behind some great lace .

a : pours a 5 finger , rather creamy looking head . this beer is dark and *filtered* . the head dissipates down to a one and a half finger creamy head within a minute or two . a little lacing is noticeable , but not much .
a : brown/ruby color with a 2 finger lightbrown head .
a : pours a one finger head of decent thickness , no cream , and poor retention . colour is a nontransparent gold . sm : light malt . that 's it .
appearance : it has light-copper to dark-oolong tea colour , with limited carbonation and faint beerhead -- a pity .
appearance : cloudy , pale amber , with minimal head and lacing . but a disclaimer horse brass is dark .
a : the beer is cloudy light yellow in color and has a high amount of visible carbonation . it poured with a three finger high white head that has very good retention properties .
appearance : big bubbles rise through a brandy-amber body to form a head so weak and fizzy , i did n't even have time to notice its color before it disappeared . but i think it was off-white .
a : semi cloudy ruby red . decent head , some lace .
a : very dark , almost pitch black . a very nice creamy 1 finger head lasted throughout the glass .
a : pours a gorgeous purple with little to no head to speak of .
a : deep brown/amber with a silky head with decent retention

appearance : there is a monster 4 finger creamy off white head that is slowly showing the beer . the color of the beer a medium copper color with reddish hues . there is a lot of effervescence bubble in the beer . the clarity of the beer is clear .

appearance : pours into a duvel tulip very black with a thick , tan head . it 's quite sturdy and holds well with its combination of large and small bubbles . absolutely picture perfect with zero flaws .
a : pours a dark black body with chocolate hints on the sides . head is a solid three fingers of thick very creamy tan bubbles . very solid and falls slowly leaving very thick sticky webbed lacing .
appearance : poured a slightly cloudy brown color , with moderate visible carbonation . half-finger bubbly head that diminishes immediately . no lacing .

appearance : a beautiful yellow/gold color with a humungous white head . the head takes a a while to subside as it bellows over the edge of the glass . this is crystal clear until the yeast is poured in then it is very cloudy and more yellow .
a : the beer looks pretty bad . it 's as light and as carbonated as ginger ale , if not more so . there 's a thin plastic-looking head with no lacing .
a : this beer pours into my goblet and forms probably the most beautiful non-nitrous head i 've ever seen -- nice and big and creamy , brown on top , off white after a sip .
a : little head , dissipates quickly ; no lacing ; brandy-colored ( interesting ! )
appearance : dark dark brown . the tan head faded almost immediately .
a : fairly clear copper color . a finger of white head with good head retention . nice looking for an english pale . there was quite a bit of sediment in the bottle so be careful .
a : the beer is an extremely pale yellow color with a short white head that fades very quickly and leaves a very thin lace on the glass .
appearance : poured a very light golden brown with a slight pink tint . produced a white head which disappeared quickly leaving a small lacing . lots of bubbles are visible .
a : bright , hazy orange with a massive sudsy , frothy , bone white head ; leaves sheets of sticky , snow white lace .
a : just like the regular irs , this pours pitch black like an ebony goddess in the night . nice frothy brown head , maybe even creamier than the regular . 4.5
a : a pretty clear caramel hued body . a real slight haze on an otherwise pretty clear brew . a slightly reddish off-white head is very busty . great retention and lacing . good looking brew indeed .
appearance : dark with a bubbly chocolate head that dissipates quickly
a : golden-yellow , not much head . lots of sediment . unfortunately , the sediment did n't stick together , making it difficult to pour . i left 1/3 of the bottle behind with the first pour !

appearance : a massive white foamy creamy head . the beer is a light amber yellow color with a lot of effervescence in the beer . the clarity of the beer is cloudy . the head sticks to the glass leaving the wonderful lacing .
a : a golden color with absolutely no head . some lacing . a little hazy .
appearance : lame , packing-peanut styrofoamy white head atop an emaciated dandelion yellow body .
a : great appearance , this is what i picture when i think of a summer ale . light and clear with a thick foamy head . almost an inch of head .
appearance : this beer looks like double bastard on steroids ! deep red/brown/chai-tea color . super dark , hazy , intense . great head : foamy , caramel-y and bubbly ; lasts forever .
appearance : looks like a light orange yellowish glow head : nice big thick white head

appearance : it is a brilliant beer , with a touch of orange to nudge it just a smidge past gold , with a white creamy head that has some staying power and leaves laces as it recedes . drink with your eyes . this beer is inviting . aroma , taste , and
appearance : this looks great . it is a hazy golden yellow with a massive white head . this looks like a well built wheat beer .
a : pours a clear mahogany color . the head is fizzy at first but recedes quickly into nothing , with no lacing left behind .

appearance : 12oz bottle poured into a standard pint . colour is a pale , cloudy yellowish-white ; think the colour of pineapple gummi bears . 1/2 inch head fades quickly into a mere puff on the surface . very slight visible carbonation .
appearance : light brown ? ! ? ! in an imperial stout ? enormous head .
a : color is pitch black while the pale brown massive head is so very thick and creamy . slow dissipation leaves lacings galore .

appearance : a dark and murky copper pour . definite floaties in there and carbonation veins stream through the body of the beer . head retention is nice . an ivory color with a sudsy character to it .
appearance : murky brown bilge water but with gorgeous thick creamy head , with lacing that stayed .
a : pours black with a very small mocha head that goes straight to the sides . no lacing .

appearance : this one was a gusher for sure . watch out ! pours a big 3 finger medium-thin tan head . colour is an opaque very dark brown , close to black . no real carbonation evident . a thin film stays until the end and leaves some lacing down the glass , but nothing special .
appearance : huge creamy brown head and curtains of sticky lacing . imperial stout black as well

a : a bit darker than your typical hefeweizen , but otherwise quite similar . i should have poured this into a weizenglas out of interest . thin head though - it 's definitely an english ale . not very true to style , but all right .
appearance : looks like a typical macro pilsner , straw yellow with a foamy white head that receeds quickly . no lacing . yawn .

a : pours a clear amber-orange with substantial off-white foam filling my duvel tulip . it retreats slowly , falling in sections like a breaking iceberg , leaving beautiful , sticky clumps of lace down the sides of the glass .

a : i got ta give credit where credit is due . this is truly a picturesque beer . amazingly clear amber body filled with tons of quickly rising bubbles that form a thick rocky head on the top of the beer . i give this a 6 on appearance .
appearance : a bright gold in color with a bone white head and some lacing .
appearance : very clear with a deep orange color . adequate , intimidating head . solid lacing and very nobly resting in my glass . tip-top appearancewise .
a : poured cloudy orange/yellow with / small white head from a from a 750ml .

appearance : the pure hoppiness pours a bright , brilliantly clear yellow-orange-ish color with a nice half-inch head that sticks around for quite some time . a boat load of bubbles continuously rises from the bottom of the glass as well . the lacing is outstanding .
a : light leather brown with scant , fizzy off-white head with no retention and no lacing .
appearance : very dark with a ruby tinge , tan head that dissipates quickly
a : pour is light ; straw-colored . the large white head is kind of fluffy and dissipates rather quickly into rich lacings .
a : a pretty flat looking beer without much bubbles . pours a orange hay color .
a : red/orange , apple cider , hazy , very nice white head at first .
a : pours a clear honey with two fingers of white head that fades into a thin ring with no lacing .
a : looks good , crystal clear with a huge head that sticks all over the glass . lots of bubbles and a very very light yellow color .
appearance : pours a murky very dark brown with a half finger of tan head that goes away completely .
appearance : hazy grain color , with no head whatsoever , no lacing on the glass .

appearance : there was a one finger white head that lasted only a few seconds . there are a lot of effervescence in the beer . the clarity of the beer is hazy . the color of the beer is a nice orange color with yellow hues .
