a : orangish gold with a nice , long lasting , foamy , off white head
appearance : hazy , pale yellow brew with light carbonation and no head
a : one of the most attractive aspects of this beer is the inky blackness of it , topped with the mocha head that clings all the down the glass , right until the last swallow .
appearance : pitch black , poured a one finger mocha head that left nice lacing all the way down the glass as the beer was drank . there was also no clarity or signs of carbonation .
a : since it 's bottle conditioned and i do not like yest in my beer , i poured it carefully down the side of the glass producing no head .
a : tremendous 3 finger head , great cascading effect , pours very thick
a : clear gingerbread color beer with almost no head . really boring looking beer , does n't look very appealing .

appearance : pitch black body , and one finger of dark tan foam , which falls slowly . head leaves a nice layer of foam on inside of glass . nothing wrong here . flavor : similar to the aroma , unfortunately , but the tartness is a bit overwhelming . upon checking other reviews for this one , i quickly confirm what i 'd suspected . this brew was not meant to have a tart edge to it . it looks like an extremely unlucky time for me with one of my favorite breweries , ccb 's , brews ... two infected bottles in the past week .
a : poured a light , pale golden yellow with a two-finger head of fine , white foam . lager-like in appearance , so a bit lighter than i would 've liked it to be .

appearance : whoops ! heavy pour results in massively foamy head ( four or five iinches ... yikes ) which actually settles into a decent two-finger head after a moment . user error there . beer is a pale golden color with abundant carbonation which eases off after a few moments . looks filtered , not murky at all . the receding head leaves a light trace of foam around the inside of the glass . all things considered , it looks like an adjunct lager should .
appearance : light straw . very minimal carbonation . even with an aggresive pour i bet there 'd be no head retention here .
appearance : crystal clear . huge head . best part of this beer .
a : poured a cloudy lemon with an off-white foamy head . good carbonation and lacing .

appearance : a solvent-looking thing . no head whatsoever , completely tepid . no lacing , either . body is a murky shade of plain brown , but when light strikes it i get some pretty amber/red shades . the latter saves this from being scored lower . i can forgive the lack of head/solventness ( it is a barley wine , after all ) , but the color could use some sense of innovation .
appearance : it has a mild brass-orange color with a yellow hue . thin head and just a touch of lacing .
appearance : thick frothy tan head , cloudy brown amber color with alot of sediment particles lingering aroud . glass full of lace .
a : pours an orange-gold body with big foam head .

appearance : sparkling , clear pale yellow . the head at first is pretty nice ( great really ) , but there 's almost no retention ( gone in 2 minutes ) and no lace . that 's not how a tripel should look .
a : yellow golden , clear , pours with very little head that disappears instantly . no lacing .
a : dark dark black with a frothy lively light brown head on top that dissipated quickly but clung nicely to the glass . 5.0
a : pours a slightly hazy yellow-gold with a finger of white head that recedes into a thin layer with no lacing .
appearance : thin head . hazy pink/amber body . looks underwhelming .
a : the best aspect of this beer is definitely it 's appearance . it pours pitch black with a brown head .
a : super dark brown to black with dark tan head , though very weak and lasting only seconds after pour .
a : poured light brown ( med-light maple syrup color ) with absolutely no head .
appearance : like the other trout river bres , this one had very little head . however , it did pour a decent dark brown color .
a : this is a dark amber color .
appearance : purple colored brew with a frothy pink head
appearance : ever-so-slightly hazed , light copper-brown . chunky , dull , pale yellow head comes and goes rather quickly .
appearance : the color of apple juice . little to no foam retention . steaming carbonation almost invisible to the naked eye .
a : blonde orange , small head ; not much carbonation or lacing
a : beautiful medium-to-dark brown hazy body with good , creamy head . great , thick cap .
a : poured a glowing yellowish orange , cloudy , with a nice white cap . exceptional poor and appearance .
a : pours a dark , dirty brown , hazy with a full tan head . almost looks like sweet tea .
appearance : dark brown with a trace of red , quite clear . two fingers of frothy , dense , sticky-looking , light tan head . foam stayed around several minutes , leaving tons of lacing .
appearance : dark borwn in color with a nice 2 '' head that slowly falls to a thick surface foam . nice lacing develops .
appearance : opaque yellow with .5 finger head . carbonated with lots of tiny bubbles .

a : the bottle design is probably the best part about the beer . big sky has great continuity with their design . however , the idea of calling the beer `` slow elk '' with a drawing of a cow with elk antlers roped on is pretty funny . i digress ... the wear pours terribly into a snifter , for a stout that is . foams too heavy , carbonation does not rise like a stout usually does . dark body with an amber touch when put up to light . head is lumpy and whitish tan .
appearance : this beer poured a nice golden color , but produced absolutely no head , and seemed under carbonated . this could have been a by product of shipping .
a : little if any head which disappears when poured . leaving a very translucent orange/tan colored water .

appearance : opaque orange , very thin lacing and soapy bubbles . you 'd get a bit of head on it only after significant swirling . for something that 's been sitting a while in the cellar , it 's nothing unusual .
a : pours a cloudy dark brownish red that resembles apple cider . a vigorous pour leaves only a very mall ring around the perimeter of the liquid
appearance : gorgeous orange color , great two finger head , and decent lacing . extremely active carbonation ... do n't see a beer with this type of carbonation often .
appearance : a very clear , alsmost watery looking golden with no carbonation bubbles floating at all . the head is beautifully thick with very tiny bubbles . very creamy .
a : looks nice ! good copper/bronze color , nice thick head .
a : huge head , lots of carbonation and lacing . this beer is light in color but cloudy with carbonation .
a : poured a very dark brown with a finger head and pretty good lacing sticking to the glass .
appearance : pours a nice urine looking light yellow w/ a non-existent head

a : this brew pours a beautiful sunset orange , effervescent with bubbles riding on their little bubble elevators up to the head , where they frolic upon the frothy , sticky stubbornness and bask in the lamplight under which i am ogling this inviting beverage .
a : pours a lightly hazy yellow with a light white head , some lace .
appearance : very cloudy , as it should be ; white head ; questionable head retention
appearance : opaque burnt amber with a creamy white head . the head retains well , and leaves a really beautiful lace .
a : looks just like an imperial russian stout should - thick , heavy head , great lacing , very dark with brownish head .
a : very nice deep brown color , great thick velvety head
a : extremely cloudy dark amber body under a finger of creamy tan head . average retention for the strength and some spotty lacing . not bad , but hazy to the point of muddiness .
a : more golden than expected , but the big knocks are the lack of lacing , head retention and the surprising amount of floaters in the glass

appearance : a pale yellow color with orange highlights . there was no head did a hard pour at the end and it resulted into nothing . there are couple bubbles coming from the bottom . the clarity of the beer is slightly hazy .
appearance : a dark red , light brown tone with little carbonation .
appearance : a very weak , pale yellow color .
a : pours on the lighter side for an ipa ; it 's a clear orange-amber with short-lived off-white head . some lace .
appearance : light straw color , lustrous snow-white resilient head , bubbly , tasteful amount of haze ( after swirling the last bit of beer and dumping it in )
appearance : very clear gold color . head is strong at frist and then goes away quickly . left looking like dishwater .
a : ruddy dark plum color . no head . 3.5
appearance : reddish brown , no head , and no lacing .
a : pours a beautiful golden into the glass . disappointed with the head retention .
a : not sure if anyone would buy this beer if they saw it poured in a glass ... cloudy with little to no white head ...
a : pours mahogany color with a large beige head . lots of sticky lace is left behind as the head recedes .
a : gorgeous . love this blood red to burnt orange appearance.there is just something very alluring about this tone .
a : incredibly foamy . head filled 3/4 of the glass and took minutes to die down . tons of greenish whitish milky sediment at the end of the pour .

a : we opened this up over the sink to be on the safe side , but it showed no inclination to gush whatsoever . could this somehow be an exception to the rampant infection issues besetting this beer ? do you believe in miracles ? it pours a black body with a finger of coarse tan foam . decent retention and light lacing . nice enough .
a : pours a deep burgundy with a medium off-white head , light lace .
a : huge light tan head , brownish read color . lookin ' good !
a : pours a nice amber gold with a 1cm frothy white head that plummeted away in record time . 2nd cannery product , same result ...
a : no head ( too cold ? ) and is a deep rich molasses

appearance : pours a transparent golden/yellow/orange with a thick 2 '' head that is off-white . active carbonation shoots streams of tiny bubbles towards the surface . thick , foamy head with tons of lace . excellent .
a : light yellow pour . no head or lacing .
appearance : very cloudy , muddy pour , a dark ruby-purple .

a : pours quite dark with an average sized head ; there are large chunks of yeast at the bottom of the bottle and lots of it . i usually do n't mind the yeast , but the chunks just make this beer look unappetizing .
a : looks great . nearly three fingers of thick frothy head . great retention and plenty of lacing . 3.0

a : very dark brown verging on black , a few tan bubbles surfaced but quickly disappeared , no lacing , mostly cloudy from what i can tell . some highlights of red and dark brown when held to the light .
appearance : deep gold with a fluffy 1 '' white head .
a : light yellow with an inch of white head
appearance : opaque black covered by a thin sheet of persistent head on top , with stubborn , cohesive lace coating the sides .
appearance : pours wonderfully and has a slow-developing head ( very similar to guinness ) . once it settles it has a nice , rich look .

a : pours out a light , slightly chill hazed peachy brown , looks a little bit like iced tea , especially with the thin and wispy cap of sandy white head that tops this beer . head fades into a ring rather quickly , no lacing , but a decent amount of carbonation showing through in some slowly rising ropes .
a : pours a hazy orange with three fingers of beige head that recedes into a thin ring with little lacing .

appearance : a nice medium tan head that boils up filling the glass if you do n't use the sneak-it-down-the-side pour technique . the head has large bubbles and they form larger air pocket/bubbles as it goes down . the beer is a dark brown slightly black color . hold it to the light and you get some significant red garnet coming through . not as thick black as the label describes . the head fades down and get 's thicker and creamy on top .
a : poured from a `` fourty , '' colt 45 is a clear straw yellow with a very little head . looks like every other mass produced lager you 'll see .

appearance : pours a nice black liquid with a huge amount of dark brown head . i thought the head was due to my pour or something with my glass but after reading the other reviews , i see that this is just one of the features of this beer .

a : wow . what a beautiful beer . from bottle to pint , it pours beautifully , giving a thick , deep , deep red body with sediments within , about as buoyant as the brew itself . small amount of strong ivory head . minimal trace , but resonates .
a : pours clear , pale gold , bordering on straw . huge , cloudy head erupts and melts slowly , leaving impressive brussels lacing .

a : this beer is gorgeous . pale amber color has great clarity and the beer is filled with swirling carbonation from tiny bubbles . the carbonation supports a rocky amber tinged cap that starts big , stays strong and floats on top of the beer the whole way down the glass . heavy sheets of lace are left in the beer 's wake .
a : clear copper under a medium white head . excellent lace and retention . very good looking bber .
a : pours a muddy murky brown , but then settles very black . nice bit of very creamy head on top . looks delicious .
appearance : pours a clear amber color with a finger of fluffy off white head . this beer has some great head retention .
a : pours a rather clear orange-ish copper . a relatively small , but fluffy , ivory head comes from a semi-vigorous pour . head displays decent retention . nice lacing .
a : pours jet black with a big frothy head . good sustain and tons of lacing .
a : pale , filtered wheat . boring . what the heck are they trying to do ?
a : murky brown and amber color with a robust head that dissipates really quickly . it 's like a soda type carbonation .
a : pours jet black with about 2 fingers of dark brown head which quickly receded to a thin layer on top .
a : this beer pours a beautiful clear copper , amberish color with a one finger of offwhite head . head recedes somewhat quickly without leaving any lacing .
a : poured a clear pale orange-yellow color wit ha thin white head that faded quickly .

a : a pretty , lightly hazed amber-garnet with scattered rising bubbles . unimpressive , a barely-covering film , dwindling to a star-shaped splotch , to a completely irrelevant sheen . despite a nice color , an otherwise sad and lifeless pour .
appearance : pours a fairly bright amber with a nice two finger white foam white , which sadly falls flat within minutes .
a : poured a brownish burgundy with a thin head and left good lacing on the glass .
a : pours a hazy yellow-orange with three fingers of white head that fades into a thin cap with a solid sheet of lacing .
a : great cascade and head . reddish , thick lager . thick lace . awesome looking .
appearance : the bubbles ! oh the bubbles ! they really do sink ! it 's amazing ! perfect lacing and foam . nice dark brown color , almost red when it 's in the light . nothing beats this .
a : completely black ( no surprise ) with an almost non-existent cappuccino colored head that disappears immediately leaving no lace .

appearance : pours out completely pitch black and very viscous-looking . about a finger of a dark brown/orangish tinted head forms . a bit in the way of lacing , and okay retention . this is definitely one of the more impressive imperial stouts as far as viscosity that i 've seen , which really picks this beer up from an appearance standpoint .
appearance : dark golden color , pale white head , a little bit of lacing
a : looks like prune juice with absolutely no head . the lacing comes in small amounts .
appearance : excellent clear golden amber color . filtered .
a : bronze , good head , lace
appearance : clear , light amber color with a white rocky head that sticks well to the glass . light carbonation .
appearance : golden and translucent ... left a nice head which dissapated quickly and left little lacing ... nothing too special .
a : very light golden brown and lightly hazed . head is not really there , much like the last terrapin beers i had ... bit off white and a very minor ring around the glass .

appearance : mocha bomb looks awesome on the pour , very dark brown and it looks pretty thick . about 3 fingers of mocha colored head forms . retention is great , as is the lacing . one of the best looking imperial stouts i 've tried .
appearance : very hazy from the yeast with a pale yellow hue , varied bubbled white lace that holds a great retention and stays until he beer is gone .
appearance : a very white head that is easily 3-4 fingers and lasts quite a while . the body is a hazy lemonade color .
a : very pale straw colored brew . pours thin head that quickly dissipates like soda fizz . leaves no trace on the surface of the beer .
appearance : poured with very , very little head despite my best efforts . when held up to the light , beer shows the smallest glimmer of red mahogany . 2.5/5
a : pours pretty much opaque black . a two finger tan head rises with good retention . light lace is left as the foam gently recedes after a few minutes .
a : its very foamy when poured and it takes a while for the head to settle and when it does it looks like cat pee
a : pours a beautifully clear orange/amber , with an off-white foamy head , that slowly bursts its bubbles down to a thin raft . good lace hanging on .
appearance : pale cloudy straw w/ thick white head that leaves a nice lace
appearance : red/amber , clear color . enough carbonation but a weak head . immediately goes to a thick collar-never a tall or thick head . some lacing .
a : this beer pours very light-coloured ( remainds me of very light german white wine ) with a white head that dissipates very quickly .
appearance : dark cola brown with reddish hues when looked through the light . barely a crown of lace .

a : pours a deep cooper/pink color that is extremely intriguing . pours about a 2 finger off-white/pink head which leads to a nice persistent lace . carbonation looks relatively strong , with tiny bibbles .
appearance : pours a super clear burnt copper with honey folds . the crown is 2 fingers , slightly off white ( light khaki ) , shows good retention and good lace .
a : pours a copper color with a small off-white head that dissipates quickly .

appearance : pours the translucent , pale-yellow color common in most macro lagers . what little fizzy head there was dissipates immediately leaving absolutely no lacing . i wonder if this beer is best had straight from the bottle rather than poured ...

appearance : after pouring this beer into my glass , i said i might have to pass . a light honey , golden color . the appearance brought about a dissapearance in my excitement . a litle cloudy , with very little lacing , half finger head , quite a mysterious spread for an ipa .
appearance : clear orange-brown big head and lots of lacing .
a : motor oil with satanic red head . i love it already .

appearance : pours a coffee color with ruby tints when held to light . 1+ finger , off white head . fades quickly and leaves very little lacing . i have to say that this is one of my favorite bottle labels .

appearance : an aggressive pour yields a transparent beer with an off white head that rises to oveer two inches and almost spills over the glass . bubbles are varied in size and lace has no qualms about hanging out on the sides of the glass .
a : clear golden or yellow color with a large head , no lacing , and the head was gone in a few minutes ...

appearance : a medium amber color with a slight orangish tint . there was a one finger foamy head but it dropped like a rock . there is only a visible white ring around the pint glass . there is a lot of effervescence at first but it slowed down to a medium pace . the clarity of the beer is clear and brilliant .
a : a little bit of a disappointment in the pour . a pale golden , with a rather fizzly head - i could almost confuse this with ginger ale or something . s +
appearance : well , it only produced a finger of head that did n't lace or sustain whatsoever . the body is as dark as night but show cases decent carbonation and a deep and dark ruby .
a : 1/2 finger of creamy white head with great retention . cloudy dark orange color . very pretty .
appearance : miller lite like body . white head that dissipates quickly . disappointing .
a : 1/4 '' white head that fell to a cloud leaving no lacing on the glass at all . hazy orange/lt brown body .
a : not much head ; good carbonation ; clear ruddy color
a : black color . less than one finger of short lived light brown head . no lacing . 4.5
a : pours a clear amber color with a considerable amount of head that leaves minimal lacing .
appearance : what a beautiful ale ! pours a deep ruby , almost mahogany color with a nice head and plenty of lacing . unfortunately , it 's not much more than a great looker .
a : pours a deep reddish brown with a nice head , but little retention . carbonation is plenty as it clings to the glass in clumps . not much lacing .

a : pours a glowing , clear dark red with a fluffy , soft white head that has a light pink tinge to it . head took forever to slowly fade into a thick film that lasted the whole beer through and left a dense sheet of lacing down the glass .
appearance : cloudy lemon yellow with a thick , foamy white head . the yeast from the bottle conditioning hangs out like someone hocked a loogie in your beer .

a : the beer arrives with a small tan head that is quick to disappear and settles in without any film , collar or lacing . the color of the body is a notch below pitch black . zero transparency - even at the edges and the thinnest parts of the glass .
appearance : bright golden beer with a lot of fairly large yeast sediment floating about in suspension . there 's vibrant carbonation , and a snow white cap that soon fades to a persistent film .
appearance : clear golden color , with a big head that settles down after a moment to about a finger 's width of foam . beer is unusually clear for a hefeweizen .

appearance : poured rather gently into a pint glass . mid-sized head dissipated into a ring after about a minute . the overall appearance of the rest of it was fantastic though ; a beautiful golden orange , sort of amber color . held up to the light it 's almost opaque .

appearance : this pours a cloudy , dark golden color , with a little bit of an amber tint . there is a very small head , leaving a thin collar . however , it does leave some lacing on the glass . visibly apparent are the floating yeast particles .
a : pours out a clear golden color with a small fizzy white head . quickly subsides to nothing . no perceptible lacing . odd , not even a trace of orange in it .
a : pours a still dark brown with a small off white head that recedes quickly . not the prettiest looking beer in the world .
a : clear , straw yellow with slow effervescence and a copious head .
appearance : served in an 8-oz glass . abundant , frothy white head , a bit over a finger , lots of bubbles . great lacing and retention . outstanding looks !
a : pours a clear , deep amber . 3/4 '' head fades quick to nearly nothing . almost no lacing on the glass . a few tiny carbonation bubbles here and there rise quickly .
appearance : overall very flat . pale neon yellow , highly carbonated . there 's not much else to say here .
a : dark , black with deep brown tinges around the edge .
a : one of the better looking beers i 've had in quite a long time . pours a true amber color with a huge two finger head that leaves loads of lace on the glass .
a : it pours a dark brown to mahogany colour , with a thick , fluffy yet foamy-looking off-white beer head . reasonable retention .
a : pours out a clear , amber and mahogany , topped with an inch of sandy brown head it sadly dissipates into a ring in a matter of minutes .

a : pours a creamy , 1 finger milk chocolate colored head with possibly the best retention i 've seen on an imperial stout . beer is viscous , oily , and pitch black . lacing is patchy and stringy but sparse with decent stick and nice legs . overall a fantastically beautiful brew .

a : clear , brilliant copper/mahogany body with a 3/4 '' , creamy , light tan head ; solid retention and tons of tight-knit lacing . beautiful , rich-looking beer - by far the best i 've ever seen come out of a plastic milk jug !

a : pours deep brown going-on-black , with a tinge of amber around the edge of the glass when held up to the light . even a straight pour produces almost no head which dissipates quickly and leaves no lacing .

appearance : very clear . orangish copper . beautiful and brilliant before pouring the yeast at the bottom . slight off white head retention . flavor : sweet malt up front . pears and biscuit toastiness . alcohol ! ! ends up with a huge peppery bitterness that lingers a bit but not too bad given it 's huge sweetness . maltier lager just like an octoberfest should be .

a : it pours an incredibly murky brown color . very hazy , very brown . there is nothing red about this beer . in fact , this does not look like a red at all . that 's not a bad thing . actually , it 's strangely compelling , what with the 1.5 fingers of off-white head . an interesting take on the style .

a : pours deep mahogany/brown color with an impressive foamy head on top , about 1.5 fingers in height , just off-white in color . really nice retention , this thing is not going anywhere . nice lacing all around the glass .
a : unimpressive . very clear yellow-amber with two-fingers of light head .
a : cloudy orange with a nice fluffy head that sticks around forever . amazing look .
a : pours a clear gold with a two finger white head , average retention , no lace .
a : brilliantly clear , dark amber with a small off white head .

a : a standard pour showed lots of carbonation and resulted in a 3.5 finger cream colored head that left beautiful ring lace down the glass . the head was retained very well eventually reducing to a frothy cap . color was amber and clear .
appearance : fizzy yellow beer with a fizzy white head . clear as day with lots of bubbles and poor retention .
appearance : pale yellow colour with very little head . not much carbonation is evident . a very inauspicious start .
appearance : a very clear golden color with little to no head and less carbonation than i had expected from this skunky euro lager
a : fairly murky light orange . rich brown head , dissipates quickly . some debris floating inside which makes my nervous . what are these clumps floating inside ?
appearance : the head was a quick fizzle that only lasted a couple seconds . the body is yellow and mostly clear . worst looking witbier i 've ever had .

a : pours a half finger head of fair cream , good thickness , and pretty bad retention - though the abv is a decent excuse . colour is a dark amber . nontransparent . sm : dark fruit , heavy yeast , and caramel . a mild strength aroma .
appearance : the ale has a deep brown color with a decent foamy head .
a : this was a lightly hazy , extremely pale golden corn color . it poured with a fast living fizzy head .
appearance : slightly cloudy amber-gold color . poor head retention , all foam disappearing fast .

appearance : from the bottle this beer pours clear darkish yellow straw color . according to the label on the beer , our passing is brewing and well my passion is head ... and i didnt get any on this beer at all . i was really surprised . zero , zilch , nada . not even a thin one . odd . this beer did have good carbonation .

appearance : a coppery orange color that had a one finger head . there is carbonation in the beer . the head dissipated to a quarter inch and it is slightly foamy . the beers clarity is slightly hazy , probably from dry hopping . the carbonation bubbles are forming a slightly foamy lily pads on the beer .
a : light brown appearance with hints of ruby red , along with a beautiful white frothy head . lacing was also quite impressive on this beer .
a : moderate pour yields 3/4 finger dense , dark tan head . great head retention . pitch black liquid , very opaque . appearance is spot on for the style .
a : ruby/red/brown in color . one finger white head that fades fast and leaves some spotty lace . this turned out to be the best part of the beer . i thought i was in for something special .
a : gentle pour yields a .25 finger fine , light mocha head with poor retention . beer is a dark , near opaque mahogany-brown . lacing is stringy and spotty with little cling .
a : brilliantly clear light yellow , a finger of head that leaves a touch of lacing . generic industrial lager ?
appearance : dark mahogany . head reminiscent of crema on a good cappuccino . very persistent .
a : pour is dark brown with rich hints of red . white kind of airy white head dissipates into nice lacings .

a : fairly deep brown color with only a thin layer of light tan head which has zero retention . some very light lacing on the glass as the beer goes down in the glass . looks kind of watery , thin and flat to be honest .
appearance : bright gold , moderate head , lots of bubbles . very nice .
appearance : dark amber color with a strong head at first that leaves good lacing .
a : pale straw color . lots of bubbles . foam disappears quickly .
a : cloudy , burnt orange hefeweizen-like color and extremely overcarbonated . the tan head was fluffy but so giant that it required a pour-wait-pour and left little lacing .
appearance : very rich , golden color . cloudy with good lacing and a nice head .
appearance : caramel in color , rich with carbonation , mildly translucent
a : pale/slight orange tint , clear , minimal carbonation . but the head is the real beauty for this one ; a duvel like frothy/clingy head with tons of retention and copious lacing . 5/5
a : piss yellow . actually , a tad paler than that .
appearance : pours black but sits totally still in the glass . pitch black body , but no head and no carbonation whatsoever . disappointing beginning .
appearance : 5 |
appearance : pours a hazy amber color with a very poor head that quickly dissolves to a ringlet , leaving no trace of lace behind
a : cloudy deep yellow/orange hue , trace head , zero lacing
a : pours an opaque light amber . rather thin head that disappears immediately and becomes faint lacing . very faint . i 'd call it `` eleven bubbles '' before i 'd call it lacing .
appearance : sludgy , cola-brown , barely any head at all , just a really thin veil . it 's pretty much average looking for the style , it does n't mean i have to like it ...
appearance : slips out a hazed , amber-hued body with a delightfully frothy , long lasting , off-white head .
a : it pours more of dark mahogany color -- almost black . average sized head on an aggressive pour with no lacing on the glass .
a : clear yellow , huge fluffy white head , some retention , awesome lace .
a : a great dark beer with a nice head . it was a little too dark for me to get a real picture of the color , but it was dark and the head was nice . lacing stayed throughout the glass .
appearance : very dark amber , not cloudy at all . has a 1/4inch light amber head .

a : pours thick into a glass tumbler , with a thin tan head that clears quickly . on the second bottle , i purposely created a larger head , but even that cleared quickly . almost opaque , but overall looked exactly how you want a porter .
a : as expected low carbonation and not to much head . thin lacing . very dark stout like color .

a : moderate pour yields a 1 finger coarse , coffee head that dissipates rather quickly . beer is pitch black and thick like used motor oil . lacing is near non-existent , with spottiness here and there and near no cling .
appearance : pours a translucent golden color , like a typical american macro . the almost non-existant head dissipates quickly leaving absolutely no lacing .

a : pours a deep redish brown with the smallest head i 've ever seen which fades as quickly as it forms and leavs no lacing on the glass . i poured it pretty aggresively so i 'm not sure if this is normal ... the cap gave a hiss when i opened it so the lack of a head was a bit surprising .
a : pours a dark amber brown color . a thin bubbly white head forms at first though dissapears in a second . no lace , and looks dead and lifeless .

a : with a slight gurgle from the widget as i cracked open the can , a bit of foam seeped from the top . the pour yielded a beautiful , almost pure black beer topped with a light tan , one finger thick layer of head that i ca n't really say was foam because it stuck around so damn long . a good looking beer .
appearance : persistent , pillowy head . exceptional lacing -- extended the length of the glass ! muted blonde color . active , champagny bubble formation to the end
a : the beer is a light gold color with a medium white head that fades quickly and leaves a thin spotty lace on the glass .

a : luminous , clear red-amber body with just the faintest and most fleeting of heads . absolutely no cap , ring , or lacing of any kind- appears purely still . gorgeous color , but i 'd like at least a bit more visible carbonation .
appearance : surprisingly dark , slightly opaque brown beer with a light head due to a weak pour ... yet it stuck around in a weak ring
a : pours an effervescent straw color with golden hues . a thin head fizzes away quickly and leaves a small lace that clings to the edge of the glass . appears a little lifeless .

appearance : a little on the hazy side with a white , quarter-inch head resting on top of a golden yellow beer . the head dissipated fairly quickly and leaves behind a few wisps of foam on the surface .
a : rosy brown . not much head .

a : pours pitch black , 2 finger deep tan head , settles into a full , yet thin , cap , leaves lacing everywhere and desperately tries to hold on , which it eventually loses . held to light , it 's letting zero light through . wonderful looking stout .
a : clear dark orange with hues of brown.thick off-white head boasts great retention . rings of foamy lacing cling everywhere . it is a nice looking beer .
a : amber in color , fairly clear with a nice white head .
a : crimson highlights to black dark brown body . no head even with a vigorous shake . no lacing . not good start .
a : ruby-brown , pours with an impressive off-white head . not a lot of head retention , but some wonderful belgian lace .
a : deep brown color . poured a wisp of a tan head . minimal lacing .

appearance : a one finger white head that was creamy and foamy and , lasted only a few seconds . the color of the beer is a medium amber color with orange hues . there is some carbonation in the beer . the clarity of the beer is mostly clear with a touch of haziness .
a : murky pinkish purple with a small head . really cloudy .
appearance : clear pale gold with a short white head that settles quickly and leaves no lacing , nor has any retention .
a : pours a hazy glowing tangerine color with a huge think rocky head that slowly faded into a thick fluffy layer that left a solid sheet of sticky lacing down the glass .

a : pours dark brown with a khaki to light tan head . the beer shines dark amber when held up to a light . the head retention is really great considering the alcohol level and the lacing is pretty nice .

a : my initial pour was with way too much enthusiasm . gave it another more careful pour and this one is a hazy pale and light whitewashed gold color . the head on this beer was awesome . massive , white , and frosty . impeccable retention and sheets of rowed lacing down the glass .
a : two finger width head , which dissolves into 1/2 . golden yellow much akin to a pear . has a strong lace that stays throughout the life of the brew .
a : pours black with no head or lacing , might have been a bad pour though .
a : cloudy brown in color with hues of yellow and orange . little head , with little lacing .
a : pale yellow color , fully translucent . pure white fizzy head . not much volume at all , not much retention and no lacing at all .
appearance : clearly the best thing about this beer is the way it pours - a clear amber color with a massive and impressive head that leaves clumps of lace

appearance : a cautious pour yields a thicker , fluffy looking tan head that fits the top of the glass perfectly . colour is a nice opaque seal brown with some carbonation evident , which quickly dies off . head has good retention and eventually fades to a decently thick film . film remains until the end and leaves some nice lacing down the glass . the look of this beer is fantastic , and it looks like a piece of art in the beautifully crafted rochefort glass . i 'd almost rather take a picture of it instead .
appearance : pours a foggy brown with a healthy tinge of orange ; 1/2 '' , macro-bubbled , off-white head which quickly recedes ; light , unprincipled lacing .

a : standard pour yields a 1.5 finger cream colored frothy head with good retention . beer is a clear , deep , amber-orange . lacing is outstanding . frothy and layered with awesome legs and great retention .
a : pours a dark black with thin very dark brown head . inviting .
appearance : beautiful clear amber color with a thick white head that seems to never dissipate . looks exactly the way an ipa should look .
a : pours a clear brown with a medium white head , solid retention .
a : pours a bright almost neon yellow color . hardly any head to speak of . looks carbonated more like a soda than a beer .
appearance : a nice gold color . a nice size head that is dissipating slowly .

a : this is n't the best looking ipa i 've seen . that much i 'm sure of . deeply hazed orange amber color . about two fingers of white , foamy head that falls quickly and leaves small touches of lacing . 5.0
a : very clean yellow , big head ; very nice post-quaff lacing

appearance : this beer pours a chestnut color , brown and black highlights are a part of it . the tan head rose way up to the top of my glass . it was about 3.5 inches in height . it is quite cakey , with plenty of lace left over .
appearance : a honey amber colour , a bit murky w/ a light head that lingers some
a : pours a beautiful cloudy yellow body with four fingers of white frothy head in a weizen glass . retention is good with blotchy lacing .

a : pours a dark chocolate color with about a finger of head . i 'd recommend pouring this pretty hard for future reference . nice look in the glass but head disappears quickly and does n't leave much lace .

a : ... a loud pfssst chhsstap upon opening ... yet no exploding foam . carbonation is amazingly contained , that said it explodes into the glass and forms some nice brussels lace going on . light golden color with a fury of carbonation bubbles , head is off white and amazingly thick with amazing retention .
appearance : pours a clear straw golden fizzy hue with a bubbly short lived white head , absolutely no lacing to note here .
appearance : this is the epitome of fizzy yellow . the head is a thin white colortion . wait a minute the head looks like it has mold on it . lacing who am i kidding .
a : in a snifter , this has impenetrable blackness . it looks like a candle in the glass , with a gelatinous chocolate mousse head .

a : pours black with almost no translucenty even when held to the light . i nice two finger light brown head with good retention . lacing is good and sticks all the way down the glass . a really good looking stout .

a : this beer pours a rich copper/red brown with orange highlights . i usually pour my beers rather vigorously to try to generate a nice big head , but a huge frothy off white head formed from a gentle pour . it lingered for a very long time and left amazing lacing down the glass .
a : awesome looking beer ! golden honey-like color with a very pillowy white head and visible carbonation bubbles supporting it .
a : great color and a solid head .

a : very pale straw hue , appears clear but when held to bright light some bits of sediment are visible . poured vigorously but resulted in a rather thin head . rather poor compared to other euro pale lagers .
a : clear amber with pitiful off-white head that disappeared quickly and left no lace . not promising .
a : pours a medium-sized head that dissipates rather quickly . dark , cholately-brown color almost reminiscent of coca-cola .

a : this is quite a dark one with pitch black color . two and a half fingers of frothy , creamy light brown head that has good retention to the last 1/2 inch , then refuses to fall any more for several minutes . lacing is spotty , but plentiful . 4.5
a : we 've got a gusher . perhaps bottle-conditioning a pils was n't such a good idea . pours a hazy yellow , like a kellerbier , big ol ' head . looks more like a hefe than a pils .

a : first of all , love the look of the bottle , and that is actually something i do take into consideration when i 'm rating the appearance . i take into account the overall presentation of a beer . cap , bottle , and actual look of the beer are all things i look at . clear bright goldenrod/honey hue . 1 to 2 finger thick fluffly head which disipated at a moderate speed . the head leaves a nice blanket on top of the beer and also leaves sticky foamy lacing on the glass that dries into place . looks like a great beer .
appearance : clear bronze and mahogony red color . thick and fluffy 3 '' + head lasts forever which was surprising for a higher alcohol beer . some decent lacing developed .
appearance : pours amber in color with a small off-white head . leaves some lacing .
a : pours black , held to light shows very little ruby highlighting . 1 finger off white/tan head that settles into a skin and ring . some small lacing holds on .
a : huge frothy head when poured from the bottle . filled two pint size cups with creamy foam that retained forever . ruby-brown liquid is very dark once it 's settled .
a : typical stout , appeared to be nitogenated . black body with cream two finger head .
a : cloudy orange , 2-finger head ( dissipates quickly ) , decent carb .
a : pours deep black - dark coffee , topped with a light caramel frothy head

appearance : there was a solid off-gas when the top was popped , so this beer must be pretty well carbonated . it pours a somewhat cloudy burnt orange color with a very small & lt ; 1/8 '' head after a pretty quick pour ... surprising after the off-gas . there really is n't any lace left , and the beer does n't really do that much else visually

a : nice dark amber colour , minimal lacing but lasts well in the glass . unfortunately , the yeast seems to be a not particularly flocculent variety which makes it hard to pour without getting a lot of yeast into the beer and clouding the whole thing up .
a : straw yellow and very clear . 2 finger head rapidly dissipates .

a : pours a clear , light pale 'wheat ' yellow . capped with just a thin white head , a 1/4 '' at best , which fades away quickly . relatively little rising carbonation , no head , virtually no lace .
a : pours a small frothy white head while the body of the beer is kind of an ugly yellow beige color . the head did not last too long and the lacing was sub-par .
appearance : pours a dark hazy ruby with a head that dissipates quickly , really dark for an aipa .
a : a nice look with a tan head and plenty of lacing left on the glass . dark dark brown hue and a nice fluffy pinky of head that remains for a while .

a : starts off nice , with a pretty half inch white head on top of a golden , pumpkin ( what else ! ) color . almost like a jack-o-lantern in a glass . unfortunately , that was only good thing about this beer , imo .
a : pours a solid black with an abundant head of very dark brown bubbles which show incredible retention -- perhaps the best looking ris i am yet to encounter .
a : liquid orange-gold like honey with a stretched out high flow viscosity . active carbonation . pillowy big bubble head . sticky . nice eye candy .

a : really light looking , thin brown cheap maple syrup with perhaps even some lighter cranberry juice character to the body . this really could pass for a plum iced tea with the complete lack of head . literally no head formation , no lacing .
appearance : lovely amber pour with light cream colored head . very effervescent . head retention poor for style .
a : medium-dark amber with dense white head that stays around . i was surprised at the head retention ; it just wo n't die .
a : light gold hazy body , a robust head that was quick to run off . nothing spectacular , more a weak start to a damn fine brew .

appearance : a comparatively dark pour yields a small , one finger , thinner looking , really noisy , light tan head that quickly vanishes . black body with higher levels of carbonation decorating the top of the brew . head quickly fades to a splotchy wisp with lots of carbonation fizzing to the top . ring remains with no wisp , leaving no lacing at all . looks like fizzy coke by the half way point .
a : pours a ruddy dark red with no head .
appearance : pours a super cloudy golden/light amber color with two fingers of thick off white head . there is a layer of head that sticks with the beer throughout .
a : pours a mild amber , not particulary cloudy , soft medium cap of white foam , no lacing .
a : almost clear golden yellow , super thin white head sl : grain , maybe some corn , but not much really
appearance : clear , medium-light straw with a large , white , foamy head that quickly diminished . only a little lacing early .

a : pours a beautiful 1 1/2 finger dark brown head . the liquid is viscous , has great bubbles throughout , some yeasty floaters , and coats the glass with exceptional lacing . even leaves a little particulate behind in the lacing which i find to be a great thing . it pours a deep black that only allows a little light around the edges in mahogany tones . this is a great looking beer in every way .
a : pours an attractive bloody amber . two solid fingers of stiff tight head forms and holds like a champ . good lacing .
a : the ale has an auburn color with thin ring of head and a bit of lace .
a : perfectly translucent amber color with off white creamy head . good retention and very good lacing .
appearance : amber with hints of brown . solid head of nicely shaped large bubbles . good retentive head .
appearance : pours a clear golden yellow with a 1-2 finger foamy white head which dissipates quickly . looks like a macro lager . no lacing whatsoever .
appearance : the body is an opaque brown color . the head is two fingers tall , light tan , great retention and lots of sticky lacing .

appearance : a monster two finger head that has good retention with a nice off white color ; furthermore , the head is frothy and creamy and there is some lacing on the glass . the color of the beer is a beautiful orange color with some copper hues . the clarity of the beer is hazy from yeast ; however , there are some carbonation bubbles visible on the side of the glass .
appearance : dark amber , good clarity , not much head development
a : deep amber , almost opaque-looking unless you hold it up to a light . little itty bitty head , surprising because i gave this a fairly aggressive pour and it seems pretty sparkley .
appearance : beautiful red , super fine bubbles . glorius .
appearance : light gold/straw color with a hint of opaqueness . practically no head at all .
a : pours clear with a slight yellow tinge to it . two finger white soapy head that disappeared so fast i barely put the bottle down and it was gone .
a : two finger head devoid of cream , very thin , and of bad retention . hazy murky dark yellow-gold colour . sm : citrusy orange fruit ester hops over top a moderately full barley body .

appearance : a black pour produces a very small , faint , tan head that vanishes almost immediately . head barely makes an appearance and is gone . a stringy wisp and ring remain . jet black body with zero carbonation evident . ring remains but leaves no lacing down the glass . thick looking stout , but average at best .
a : a clear muted amber with an active but unsettled head , quickly fading in to what looks to be spit ?
a : clear , medium golden color with over two fingers of persistent white foam head . heavy lacing remains on the glass and a lone bubble occasionally climbs slowly in the column .
a : amber colour and a 15 mm head that fades to very good lacing . 4.5

appearance : a very dark black pour , and relatively thick as well . a one finger , medium-thin , noisy , tan head with lousy retention forms and quickly crackles down to a slight wisp and ring . jet black body , opaque , with no carbonation evident . only a slight ring remains leaving no lacing down the sides , and it looks a little flat by the end . thick , dark pour and body , but lousy head .
a : larger sized bubbles than the cervoise , but also vigorous carbonation , strawberry in color .

a : pours a clear orange body with 3 fingers of off-white head . retention is spectacular , and the film collapses in sections over several minutes into a light collar on the brew . there is a thick sheet of sticky lacing down the glass as i drink . lazy bubbles up the glass .
a : clear , deep copper body with a modestly sized but stout and somewhat persistent cream white head . no lacing to be found however .

a : i do n't often give beers 5 for anything , and almost never appearance . but this is amazing . the falling bubbles , the swirls , the creamy head that does n't just have a harsh stop to it but sort of melts into the beer . it 's black body with a sandy colored solid head . saying this sounds disgusting but in reality , it looks like solidified bacon fat .

a : pour a vibrant golden yellow with a beautiful towering white fluffy head . i have never in my life seen so many bubbles fleeing from the bottom of the glass , this is amazing . its almost violent . the sediment is getting throw around like it was in a tumble dryer .
a : very cloudy , light tan , some light lacing , and a little head .

a : the serving container for this beer was a plastic jug , as it had been brought from the widmer cellar by our host . frankly , the color of muscat love and it 's cloudy plastic vessel reminded me of a urine sample ! in the glass , the golden liquid retained most of those characteristics , unfortunately ... however ...
a : apple juice color . lots of fizzy head that dissipates in seconds . less head then a soda . bubbles of co2 remind me of champagne .
a : light yellow cream foam dissipates leaving a dim amber ale .
a : very deep reddish brown with a 2-finger tan head that settles nicely to 1/2 a finger .
a : as pale lagers go , this one has a stellar look . straw yellow with a high and dense white head that drops very slowly leaving chunks of lacing . not what i was expecting here .
a : this one pours a bright amber color and is topped with an off white head . fantastic head retention as well as lacing .
a : hazy ( almost dirty ) brown color . poured no head , outside a tan skim that stayed to the edges . a few thin rings of lacing .

appearance : mahogany with ruby highlights and a clear body , this beer does n't really look much like mud . pours a pleasant off-white creamy head that slowly settles into a creamy skin and then mild lacing .

appearance : the pour yields that classic guinness settling action , which is always pretty cool . it looks great but it still looks better on tap . a thin tan head sits atop a body of darkest crimson/brown . the beer looks black unless it 's held up to the light .
appearance : pours a deep space black . it 's questionable whether light can escape from the glass . a gorgeous thick tan head that leaves major league lacing accents what is a beautiful beer .

a : hazy orange body with only a wisp of foam atop the exceedingly full pour . i blame the bartender more than the beer though , but of course getting an extra ounce of liquid beer is n't exactly something to complain about .
appearance : nice mix of gold and brown chestnut . good enough head retention . no lacing .

a : an initial pour down the far side of the upright tulip explodes with carbonation ; the next 10 ounces go in with great trepidation and multiple top-offs , resulting in a towering off-white head with creamy foam sticking nearly an inch above the rim of the already-oversized glass . now that 's a ton of head . the body is a fairly dark reddish-amber , with some spiraling tendrils of sediment and a solid column of vigorous carbonation rising from the etched bottom . the massive head sticks around for quite a while , receding in chunks and leaving lots of lace . it 's beautiful , but i 'm afraid that the over-the-top effervescence could forebode infection . still , that fear should n't take away credit from a gorgeous beer .
a : mahogany in color and crystal-clear , allowing the extravagant lacing to be fully visible . a cream colored head quickly fades to a thick foam .

a : deep gold , with very good clarity for a bottle conditioned beer . a soapy white cap starts huge before disappearing to a small ring at the beer 's edge . leaves occasional spots of lace . the beer 's weak spot .
a : pours with a small off-white head that disappears quickly . relatively speaking , the body is a dark shade of amber orange . lacing is spare to none .
a : beautiful dark amber color with an excellent bubbly head that lasted the entire beer . laced in feathery clumps that only attended to the wonderful appearance .
a : nice amber color with a golden/brownish tint . solid finger and half head that leaves slowly . flying dog makes some beautiful beers .
a : the beer is a very pale yellow color , with a thin white head that fades very quickly and leaves very little lace on the glass .
a : cloudy herbal tea color with a minimalist white head . head retention is poor and no lace is left behind .
a : transparent mahogany , reddish brown tint . practically no head whatsoever , hardly any lacing as well . this looks intimidating .

a : pours a dark reddish brown color with good clarity as a lager should . a huge beige head forms and takes a minute to recede . spiderweb looking lace is left all the way down the glass . this is a looker .

a : this could be the prettiest ipa i 've ever poured ... perfectly clear , yet seductively deep , copper/caramel orange . a blizzard of swirling carbonation fills the glass and that first pour builds a billowing 3-fingers of fluffy ivory . head drops slowly in rocky chunks , leaving a thick lace of sparkling cream . if not perfect-looking , damn close to it .
a : aggressive pour yields 1.5 fingers of thick pillowy brown head with excellent retention . opaque light black/dark brown liquid . stunning beer .
a : oily black in color and appearance . deep caramel head pours thick , stay thick . lacing is great .
a : deep amber color with good clarity . little head despite a vigorous pour . what head did form had compact bubbles , but they dissolved too quickly . left a tiny amount of lace .
appearance : pours a crystal-clear golden orange , with tons of frothy , off-white head that lingers . tons of lacing . beautiful looking beer .
a : it poured a deep orange tinted gold with a mammoth off-white head of better than four fingers . the head very slowly receded leaving a beautiful lacing down the side of the glass .
a : hazy , medium amber color with a diminishing residue of parchment-tinted foam . no lacing remains on the glass , and some scattered yeast sediment is visible at the bottom .

a : just like any good old stout ... black , with some translucent properties when held up to light . not sure whether it was the glass or not , but the head was on the weaker side as was the lacing .
a : nearly opaque , with hints of molasses towards the top of the glass . this brew pours with a vigorous head that is quite persistent .
a : nice dark amber with minimal head . no lacing .
a : this beer pours a beautiful color - a nice amber , red / orange & a little hazy ... not much head here .
a : clear yellow-gold colour . a half-finger thin head of decent soft cream and good retention . sm : fresh barley , kind of a crystal hops meets malt scent . a light to mild strength aroma .
appearance : cloudy vanilla cream color . perfect . thick white head . great retention and lace properties . looks the part . eye candy .
a : pours very light golden color , very slight head that goes away quickly . bubbles rise from the bottom quickly and constantly in large number .
appearance : it has a hazy darker pink/ almost red coloration . produced a fingers width head that quickly went away leaving a trace pink film on the surface of the beer .
appearance : pours a dark brown color that is impenetrable once in the glass . about 1 1/2 '' of light tan head forms . excellent retention , and lacing is superb . super looking beer .
a : pours a half finger head , thick , without cream , and of abysmal retention . transparent yellow colour . sm : barley . that 's it . light in strength .
a : pours a hazy amber colour . 2 fingers of fluffy white head and great retention . nice lacing as well .

a : not that impressive . pours more like a big brown ale . an earthy , hazy brown that lets some light though atound the edges . has a thinner than expected look . small head does n't last long . reduced to a thin ring in less than a minute .
a : pours a bubbly clear straw color with a fair amount of dense white head . some retains , leaving a small amount of lacing .

appearance : golden-orange that was just slightly hazy with some fine sediment floating around with the moderate bubbles . this brew had a huge , thick , foamy , white head that left thick lacing and lasted until the last drop and then some ... perfect ! ( reason for the 5.0 rating ) .
a : black in color , no haze , on finger tan head that settle to a dusting , good lacing . by looks , appears to be a stout or porter .
a : stellar ... beautiful red . thick foamy head that makes you wait ... damnit .
a : very thin head that goes fast minimal to none lacing . typical amber coloring but much lighter than most . not a great looking ale but i do n't care too much about appearance .
a : very pretty golden amber color with a half finger head

appearance : very clear oil yellow . it looks rather limpid and not all that inviting . the head did n't really get all that high . lacing is minimal . this should look crisp and refreshing -- it does n't .
a : poured a syrupy dark black color . not really much head at all . no lacing down the glass .
appearance : the beer has a very good looking amber and orange combo . the head was 2 fingers high biege in coloration . the head had major retention . thick rings of lacing remained on the glass .
a : light cloudy straw/amber color . poured a 3 finger white head with excellent retention to a 1 finger cap . laced in webs and rings .

appearance : brilliant ruby colored pour with a sudsy white 1-finger head . flavor : bittering hops , peppery spiciness dominate the palate . just a hint of some malty sweetness but this is followed by a bittering dry finish .
appearance : beautiful light-amber color . great head retention and lacing .
a : pours an opaque , maroon body with a finger of tan foam that retains well .
a : pours a orangish golden color with a thick soft white pillow of head with moderate retention . lots of thick clingy lacing .

a : there 's nothing special about the way this beer looks . it 's clear yellow , and there 's absolutely no head nor lacing . very very little carbonation is present . it pretty much looks like colored water .
a : sparkling clear , light golden straw colored
appearance : copper gold with thick white head . a mildly aggressive pour helped create this beautiful head that had some real staying power .

appearance : very hazy dark copper amber glass sported a short lived whitish head that dropped to the barest of collars . flavor : very fruity , again , mostly grapefruit rind and juice . signature st. arnolds taste , yeast im guessing , runs as a ribbon through the hop field . hops are sticky west coast , almost too intense , but supported with a good base to keep your head from imploding . the finish comes across as a little green , which might mellow with some aging .
a : pours copper with a really small white head that leaves some lacings .

appearance : 8 oz serving in a medium sized snifter , ned 's red pours a purplish , shoe polish color with deep red hues and an off white cake head that rapidly dissipates to leave rather attractive lacing .
appearance : pours a dark black with a large tan head . the head lasted as long as the beer did . leaves a nice lacing all the way down the glass as i drink it .
a : a crisp looking , dark-brown cream-ale . 2-finger head thats lasts for 20 minutes+ .

a : awesome appearance and spot on for a witbier . cloudy like a cumulonimbus . completely murky and no chance to see through to the other side . very turbid . light whitish yellow in color with a white , creamy head , kind of spare . almost no lacing .
a : fizzy clear light yellow . almost no head at all with no lacing .
a : burnt caramel brown , some amber notes through the light , a good finger head which slowly dissipates . decent lacing throughout .
a : pours bright cloudy yellow , with a frothy two finger white head . head does leave some chunks of lacing . looks great .
appearance : all foam ; great retention , but looks like a ski resort
appearance : deep red-mahogany with particulates floating ( the reason for the low score ) . loud , crackling , thick tan head .
appearance : pours a generic pale gold/straw color , very clear . nice airy white head , but it does n't last long at all .
appearance : lightly hazy , orangey-amber body with a frothy , off-white head .

appearance : ok look , nothing in the price range or reaching to ~ $ 5 per 6 pack has a compelling appearance . this beer is ultra pale in color . it will pour a huge head if you demand it ( pour hard ) , and it diminishes rather quickly ( like all beers of the type ) , although freshness seems to play a role .
a : tame pour yields 3 fingers of head . cloudy , beautiful gold color , some particles on bottom . the head is tight and shapely .

appearance : it was a little light looking , though of a good straw colour , actually kind of reminds me of apple cider , in terms of appearance . good level of carbonation , though not much of a head when poured into a glass .
a : milky , creamy tan with a yellow hue . head all but disappeared after a few sips , but the carbonation was great throughout .
a : right from the start of the pour , massive off-white/tan head . clear red-amber body with lots of carbonation running around . impressive sheet lacing on the inside of the glass .

appearance : icky floatys . i & # 8217 ; m a fan of yeast in the glass and don & # 8217 ; t mind the taste at all , but this was just a bit too much . layers of thick globs of yeast on a fairly gentle pour , it just took a good bit away from my enjoyment of the brew . flavor : a light overall flavor . i noted cherry and chocolate notes .
a : mostly clear golden amber color with a two-finger , creamy , white head that lasted more than a few minutes . nice lacing .

appearance : apple juice color with the same amount of carbonation and head that i 'd get if i actually poured apple juice into my duvel glass . an increasingly aggressive pour resulted in absolutely zero head and only an occasional random clump of carbonation that wandered listlessly to the surface . not a very encouraging start ...

appearance : pours black but not as thick as you would think it might be . it had a bit of good head to begin with but quickly died down . it only took a few moments for me to grab my camera before it was basically completely gone as you can see in the photograph . compared to other black lagers this one does n't have the appearance youd expect . absolutely no lacing ... zero . dissapointing really . this beer is n't much to look at . basically it 's a darker carbonated pepsi .

a : moderate pour yields a 2.5 finger light , fine , milk chocolate head with good retention . beer is near opaque but as i hold it up to the light , i get a nice amber quality . lacing is spotty and string but with nice stick .
a : super dark , clear amber with many bubbles . this is good .
a : pours a murky but clean burnt orange with a light white head , average retention , no head after a few minutes .
appearance : a beautiful birch beer colored brew . small to medium sized head is light tan in color . leaves some lacing . moderate carbonation is visible . looks inviting .

a : poured a rich dark brown that borders on black . head was a pillowing caramel color with toasted almond tinting . impressive and long lasting retention . lacing clung around the glass in chestnut hues . overall the appearance is noteworthy .

a : head builds during pouring about as fast as it dissipates after finishing the pour . slightly brown but mainly white head . fizzles down to a slight ring with practically no lacing . orange brown color .
appearance : a pure white 3 finger head with a mostly clear pale gold body . retention is better than expected with even some moderate lacing .
a : black body with clear red highlights under a thin head of coarse brown foam . pretty standard .
appearance : one of the hazier blonde ales in the market , quite active carbonation holds the white lace together .
a : pours a crystal clear golden straw wuth a quickly dissipating frothy and soapy white head that leaves only a whispy ring .
appearance : pours a deep dark amber with a lot of cream colored foam on top of it .
a : little to no head . goldn color with standard wheat cloudiness .
appearance : cloudy brown . moderate off white head .
a : the pour is a fizzy , light golden color with pretty much no head .
appearance : pale olive oil yellow with some minor bubbles from carbonation . head is snow white and puffy , but quickly deflates . minor lacing
appearance : dark beer , nothing out of the ordinary .
a : clear , bright blonde with great carbonation . very pretty , with a lacy head .
appearance : ruby red in color with a large and persistent off-white head , scattered patchy lacing with little carbonation . quite attractive in all .
a : pours a dark cloudy amber , very dark for style , minimal head
appearance : looks like a still cider , with a cloudy apple juice color and no head or visible carbonation
appearance : gold-peach pour with an enormous head , took up 90 % of the glass
a : clear , straw/yellow , medium carbonation . finger-width head with thickness and some lacing . not bad for a macrolager . 2/5
appearance : slightly cloudy amber . big ass pillowy head with lots of thick lingering lacing . beautiful
appearance : pours to a clear deep amber color with light foam that fades quickly with almost no lacing .
a : pours an extremely dark brown with a billowing light brown head that took forever to slowly fade into a thick oily film that left a beautiful sheet of sticky lacing down the glass .
a : pours an opaque black as dark as oil with a one-finger dark tan head . not too much retention or lacing here .
a : a dark ruby with some darker hints of brown throughout . good sized tan head . eventually dies down with good lacing . head continues to cover through out . great looking beer .
a : yellow straw with a very thin bubbly head that dissipated in matter of seconds . not even a slight ring was left . definitely not impressed .
a : it looked like yellow sprite . it poured with a fluffy head reminiscent of soda pop but that faded pretty quick completely . meh .
a : pours a amberish orange color with a small slightly off white foam head with not much retention . there is ample lacing .
a : twist off cap . very carbonated , clear macro color . one inch of white head , which goes away with no lacing . bubbles cling to glass .

a : well , we can definitely say packaging was everything here . sweet blue tinted bottle with black wrapped cork . small but after drinking it , i understand why . poured like a motor oil into my oil pan . no head no matter how much i tried . when held up to the light , hints of cherry coloring highlighted the absence of light .
appearance : extremely pale . fizzy and foamy . little head retention .

appearance : this beer pours a jet black color , kind of like batman 's cape at midnight . ( do n't ask me where that came from ) when i hold the glass up to the light its not even letting the slightest amount pass through it . again , i reached for my trusty dogfish head snifter to enjoy this ale and i gave it yet another straight on pour to entice a creamy head but sadly i did n't get it . i have read many reviews about lost abbey 's big beer series and how they tend to have little to no head when poured . i always wondered if this was a habitual problem of just an intentional doing .
a : translucent ; slight yeast settling on the bottom of the glass due to being unfiltered .
a : dark cloudy copper color . had to force a head that poured white , but it did n't hold . thin lacing slid down the side of the glass and faded .
a : hazy redish , brown with a 1.5 inch thick and steady head ; lacing is decent
a : pours a mostly opaque brownish-black with russet highlights . 1-finger head settles quickly and leaves no lacing .
a : slightly hazy golden . pours with minimal head . not exactly beautiful , but it works .
appearance : watered-down urine
a : pours a shinny dark brown with a thin white head , which does not last very long . leaves little lacing .
a : the honey porter had a dark body with a 1-finger creamy beige head that made the beer look like candy . it pours beautifully and keeps it 's head throughout .
a : excellent - clear copper coloured beer with a super fluffy belgian style head which never seems to fade and laces all down the glass .
a : pours dark brown , with the slightest ruby tinge around the edges of the pint . disappointing small head that disappears immediately .
a : slightly cloudy , straw gold . little head .

appearance : light black colour with some deep ruby highlights when put against the light . head : dark beige colour , moussy and moderately low . it fades rather quickly but successfully maintains a little bit of the foam as the beer is consumed . good amount of lacing .
a : the beer pours a very bubbly bright golden color , its somewhat hazy , and have a wonderfully thick white head and awesome lacing , perfect looking beer ...
a : perfect . pitch black with a thick mocha colored head that fades perfectly .

appearance : a brilliant , quarter-inch thick white head rested on top of a slightly opaque , deep copper beer . it looked very rich and the lacing was very impressive with a ton of glass coverage all the way around except for the side i was drinking from .
a : piss colored beer ; it looks like every other cheap light beer , yellow and very carbonated .
a : pours with an overflowing foam head that took several minutes to dissipate . it also poured jet black , in which no light could be shown through .
a : rich deep amber coloring with nice frothy head that stuck around for a little bit . really nice looking brew .
a : pours black with 2.5 fingers worth of tan creamy head . settles to a nice cap and left a decent amount of lacing on the glass .

a : pours a citrus golden color with an incredible , thick , chunky , rocky , billowing white head that took its sweet time to die down into a thick film that left chunks and sheets of sticky lacing down the side of the glass .
a : light amber beer with a white , disappearing head . no lacing .

a : pours a turbid copper ale with less than a single finger of light peanut foam . this dissipates rather quickly to a mirror surface and a central cap of foam . no lacing . surprised at how turbid this is .
a : pale copper , no head , light carbonation , no lacing
a : pours brown , dark brown with a transient finger of light latte head . this leaves an etched surface with a ringlet left . no lace .
a : awesome ! mostly clear golden color with a touch of orange in the light ; abundant puffy white head that lasts and some great lacing .
a : black , opaque with nice thick head that holds up pretty well .
appearance : this selection pours as a hazy honey color . head is moderately thin but with good sustain . nothing special here .

appearance : i ca n't think of a single thing to take away from this . poured with two fingers of creamy head that both sustained and laced well . the beer itself is everything i 'd expect a red ale to be , and nice deep and dark crimson and the body boasts good carbonation with no signs of sediment .
a : pours a turbid goldenrod capped with off-white foam . the murkiness is a distinct turnoff ; even a careful pour could n't avoid it , so i do n't think it 's sediment .
a : pours a very pale ipa ... hazy , pillow white head , more on the golden yellow side . nice retention on the head with some pretty lacing .
a : pours with a think , dense head with great retention -- the color of the head reminds me of the froth of a cappuccino . the rest is a semiopaque light brown/copper .
a : dark reddish amber in color , slightly hazy , and a nice one finger tan head of foam .

a : beautiful pour ... the head formed in a strange rumbling way ... deceptively clear reddish-brown color.. one finger white head ... lacing is sticky as glue , doesnt want to leave the sides ... i can already tell the carbonation is going to be unique from the way it bubbles up
a : very nice golden color with a large fluffy long lasting head . lacing all down the glass .
appearance : gold with a slight haze and a 1/4 '' white head on the pour ... .looks ok

a : very nice pinky of white bubbly head and leaving huge legs of lacing . orange semi clear look . s/t : interesting and certainly not characteristic of an ipa in both smell and taste . at first i likened it to a style from a brewery an hour north in jolly pumpkin because of the dirty farmhouse belgian yeasty saison notes and the dry and crisp malts of a biere de garde . some fruity hops but not much . just a bubblegum like taste and smell overall with maybe a tinge of tartness , though perhaps thats my palate putting that in there since the malts and yeast seem like tartness would be welcomed here . not oxidized to my palate , just an off recipe and style .

appearance : the appearance started of on the wrong foot as i am pouring along normally , getting minimal head , i increase the speed of my pour as i near the end of the beer , then ... panic , `` shit ! what is that ! '' comes out of my mouth . there are big thick disgusting looking white chunks of an unknown substance that are floating in this beer . i am not new to bottle conditioned beers . i often enjoy adding the yeast . this is not that type of matter . it is flaky dandruff that is quite unappealing . nonetheless , i got over it and moved on . if you eliminate the mysterious substance , the rest of the appearance is decent . its a light orange almost peach colored beer with a small off white head and nice lacing .

a : pours a very cloudy orange color . nasty cloudy for a non homebrew . has stuff floating all thoroughout it . seen live beers before , but this is new . looks like more like unfiltered trub than dead yeasties , its all throughout the beer . glass was clean , had just washed it . whatever it is came from the bottle . needless to say cloudy beer with floating crap inside doent quite help the score . only saving grace is that it poured with nice head and great lace !
appearance : 3 |
a : very dark brown with only a mild amount of head on top . no lacing present either which is dissappointing
a : nice dense off white head with good retention . dark maple red colour with some haze .
a : straw blonde , nice thick head , loads of carbonation

a : drab apricot juice colored brew , hazy as hell . well carbonated , the beer was in a hurry to get out of the bottle . it produced a very nice rocky top head ... i mean very nice and it lasted the entire beer . great looking beer in my opinion .
a : poured from bottle into pint glass . color was dark brown but translucent in the light . virtually no head and zero lacing .

a : i am a sucker for the cascading with nitro beers , especially a stout . this looked great -- 1 minute cascading left an opaque , black beer with a 2 finger tan head . lots of lacing with permanent rings from every gulp .

appearance : hm.. i wish i didnt have to do it , but when i opened my bottle , the head slowly started growing out , like a mutant brain or alien slime in a 50s horror film . took quite a while to pour the whole thing , as it left behind a nice , if massive , off white rocky head . probably the nicest ( if also excessive ) feature in the appearance , as the body was a murky , almost opaque brown , not too unlike the bottom of a jug of cider . oh well .
a : one finger khaki colored head , quick to diminish . murky body with a rustic orange color . spare lacing .
appearance : pours a cloudy , lake water brown color with almost no head . maybe one or two spots of lacing . pretty pitiful appearance for an imperial stout .
a : big rocky head with great retention . bright light yellow body , and nice lacing .
appearance : pours a dark brown , near black body with no real substantial head formation , but i was running my damn mouth , so i could 've just missed it .
appearance : pale straw gold color with a hint of amber . incredible pillowy off-white head that leaves plenty of sticky lacing on the glass .

a : this beer pours a very average watery black that one has become accustomed to with a low-ish abv stout . nothing special . an off-white head that laces well , but does n't get as sticky as some beers do . you would n't think this would be one of the best pumpkin beers ever conceived by looking at it .
a : poured a beautiful dark golden with 1-finger foamy off-white head . great carbonation , lacing , and color .

appearance : poured from a limited release chubby 12oz , the color is a nice deep amber brown with a translucent appearance and a bunch o carbonation bubbles . the head is a whopping 2 1/2 finger length head that retains its whole way down the glass leaving behind a sticky residue .
appearance : a frothy golden color that surprisingly does n't clear . the color of cloudy urine in the toliet bowl .
a : supremely dark with a beautiful tan head and some good lacing down the side of the glass . this is what all porters should look like .

appearance : medium golden colored with slight green notes . did she dye her hair a few months ago ? the head is most disappointing , a solid inch foams up , sounding like a soda poured over ice , and then it quickly fades away , leaving the beer wearing next to nothing . cat call ! there is a very mild haze that does not detract from the appearance .
a : looks like thick motor oil as it 's poured . this is one dark mofo . opaque , pitch black , with a creamy brown head with good retention . it 's the colour that makes this though .
a : pours a dark amber , with a pretty weak white head , which dissipates quite fast .
appearance : a truly beautiful , clear , deep burgundy . thick creamy head which dissipates slowly into fine lace .
a : pours an inky black with a nice tan head that laces well . a perfect looking pint .
appearance : medium translucent brown . thin tan head that doesnt last long at all .
a : pours a deep ruby red that glows wonderfully in the light . highly carbonated and pours a lovely white-pink head that fizzles out after a few seconds .
