a : i was n't planning on reviewing this beer yet ... until i poured it . the initial pour was beautiful . an opaque brown , only shades from black with a huge creamy tan head . a nice web of lacing follows every sip .

a : as i grabbed the cork to pull it out it immediately broke off in my hand ( without much force i might add ) , and when i tried to screw a corkscrew into the remaining cork in the bottle the cork just fell down into the beer , so we 're off to a good start . the beer itself is flat , which is n't a huge surprise . the color is similar to motor oil , black with murky brown edges , and it 's just as greasy looking . it turns out having a piece of the cork in the bottle was a good thing because it prevented most of the sediment from entering my glass . in fact , i did n't know just how much crap was left in the bottle until i went to rinse it out . the liquid that was left came out like sewage , full of chunks and sludge . also , it turns out the bottle is clear blue and not black ! who knew ? there was a thick black crust covering the entire inside of the bottle that broke free into shards as i rinsed it free . glad i did n't get any of that crap in my glass .
a : dark orange/medium amber in the glass . despite a very careful pour , tons of heavy sediment in the glass . no head whatsoever . visible carbonation is very light .
a : looks honey colored with a decent 1 inch white head .
appearance : clear orange in color with a big fluffy 2 '' head . thick lacing paints the glass during thee session .
appearance : amber with a small head that faded quickly , lively carbonation .
a : pitch black . seriously pitch black with zero light coming through . you could probably put this in a capillary and not be able to see through . very fitting name , this .
a : nothing special , very yellow with little to no head or lacing . lots of bubbles .
a : poured from a bottle to a pint glass . had a jet black color and a thick consistency . there was a huge , foamy , tan-colored , long-lasting head . excellent lacing . a great-looking beer .

appearance : goldish , apricot colored . poured a nice but quickly subsiding head . quite a bit of sediment in this beer . i know its quite a bit more than usual , so this might be an old bottle . its a bit disconcerting . i 'll see how it tastes .
a : 100 % opaque looking purple-ish colored beer . head has not much volume , retention is low and lacing is ok. head is light pink .
appearance : poured a cloudy orange w/ a lovely one finger head . plenty of carbonation kept ample lacing the whole time while drink . very nice

a : pours a translucent , dark brown / purple color with amber highlights when held to the light . slow carbonation up the side of the glass . half an inch of head on the pour recedes to a ring around the glass , with light trails of lacing down as i drink .

a : pours a golden/orange with an explosive , creamy head that dissipates extremely slow leaving behind a thick layer of lacing . excellent clarity and moderate-heavy carbonation . n : smells very tart . sour green apple , champagne and white grapes .
a : uniformly opaque black , with almost one finger of beige foam head . moderate lacing remains on the glass .

appearance : the color is a beautiful light gold with a slight shade of orange . slowly rising carbonation is visible since the beer is translucent as opposed to cloudy . head formation is minimal but the lacing and retention are n't too bad .
a : the pour is a dark brown , nearly black color with a big tan head on it .
appearance : beautiful , copperish in color with a very nice candy apple red hue . small , off white head that collapsed very quickly .
appearance : quite dark . not totally black , but almost . mine poured with a fluffy tan head . probably due to an overly rambunctious pouring hand .

appearance : pours a two finger , thinner looking , fizzy , light tan head with decent retention . clear maroon brownish/red with lots of active carbonation . head quickly fades to a thin , bubby wisp . a few bubbles remain until the end but leaves no real lacing down the glass . looks relatively flat by the end .
a : pours a dark brown with a frothy one and a half finger caramel colored head . retention of a good thick film on top with and fine lacing .

appearance : pours a medium chocolate color with a slight ruby tint . the color is just a bit darker than iced tea . basically no head at all , maybe 1/5 finger which dissipates almost immediately . no lacing .
a : pours a copper colored ale with excellent clarity . a two finger top of creamy , fine foam falls slowly to a thick quilt of the same . sheeted lacing .
appearance : opaque brown . moderate tan head . very ugly .
a : pours a hazy amber . head is a dull white . it foamed up to about a finger and a half , then receded quickly . there is some decent lacing .
a : a dark clear amber , almost brown , body with a one finger off-white head ; light spotty lacing .
appearance : a finger of head quickly dissipated and did not lace at all . a clear light orange bod boasts some slow but steady carbonation , nothing too impressive here .
appearance : almost completely black . just under syrupy in the pour . nice off white to golden head . compact bubbles form a 1 inch head that remains chuncky and thick .
a : light golden color , quite a few bubbles . snow-white head that quickly dissipates leaving minimal lacing
a : resembles unfiltered apple cider with a little more orange color . no head at all , no carbonation when removing the cork or during the pour .
a : poured into a pint glass . beautiful copper color . nice 3/4 '' head with great lacing .

appearance : poured from the 17 fl oz bottle into a weizen glass . after consuming some beers with rather weak heads over the last couple weeks , i was a little over aggressive in my initial pour which resulted in a head that filled half the glass . the foam is a nice light brown , fluffy , it took a while for it to settle so i could finish pouring the beer . lace clings to the sides of my glass as the beer is consumed . the beer itself is a nice dark brown which i can not see through . i love the look of this beer .
a : pours brown with a minimal head at best , no retention or lace . looks like old pepsi .
a : light bronze colour , and small head that leaves rather quickly . not very carbonated
appearance : pours a crystal-clear honey-wheat color , heavy carbonation . took a full point off because no head formed on the pour . and i mean none - was n't even the ghost of one .
appearance : pours dark as night with a 2 finger brown crown that displays good retention and lace .
a : pale yellow and crystal clear . similar to clear lemonade . lots and lots of bubbles .
a : clear golden orange color . two fingers of mainly fizzy white head that falls quickly and leaves no lacing . 3.5
a : clear , straw golden body with a never-disappearing white head head that laces the whole way .
a : poured an interesting mix between a murky red and orange . came with three fingers of white head as it did gush a little bit upon opening .
a : golden and clean , with a small but substantial head -- very white .

appearance : huge somewhat bubbly head that 's very persistent . head goes down to a nice thick layer that sticks around until you 're through . beautiful lacing as well . very dark brown and shows some very dark read when held to the light . i 've had a good number of these dubbels and this is probably the best looking one i 've seen so far .

a : i always love how nitro stouts pour . i got a beautiful three finger head out of this over a pitch black liquid . the dense light tan colored head slowly faded into a thick creamy film that a sticky network of lacing down the glass .
a : cloudy , somewhat lighter yellow than expected , initally a decent head that reduced much too quickly leaving no lacing nor cap .
appearance : pours a cloudy honey orange color with a finger of head . lacing is playing at the top of the glass . as the pour sits in the tulip glass for a few minutes it becomes more clear .

appearance : best before date of 12 april 2006 is printed on the reverse label . a somewhat vigorous pour into the snifter creates a .5 '' tan head that recedes steadily , leaving only a ring around the glass . the beer itself is a very dark , reddish mahogany .
appearance : pale , hazy straw yellow with a huge white pillowy head that lasts and lasts . perfect in my book . and the swing-top bottle puts it over the top .
appearance : reddish amber , with a clingy , mother of pearl head .
a : very hazy straw colored beer . white head is small , with ok retention . leaves a little bit of lace .
appearance : pours a lovely golden/copper colour with a nice white head , retaining to a beautiful lace .

a : pours with a large 3 finger off-white head that is rocky , creamy and lasts forever . eventually the head evens out as it continues to recede . the caramel colored body is crystal clear . looking through it is like looking through sepia toned sunglasses . this beer looks gorgeous .
appearance : beautiful amber red

appearance : rich golden hue with a somewhat hazy body . head is a finger of fizzy ivory foam which dissipated quickly . there are some clouds of suspended yeast material in the body as well . not bad , but could be prettier .
a : poured quite light golden amber with huge head and substantial lacing . really nice looking brew .
a : pours as black as most ris i have seen with an off white brownish head .
a : pours a clear , reddish/orange color . head is about 1/2 '' and lacing is solid .
a : a very dark brown color with a very small tan head that quickly recedes to nothing . murky & muddy .

a : pours a golden yellowy fluid that seems unfiltered in that it is not translucent . the head that formed quickly ( and dominated the glass ) is luxuriant and fluffy with larger bubbles near the outside and smaller foam bubbles at the center . even on the second pour , the head was huge and frothy . carbonation continues to sneak through the fluid as it sits in the glass .
a : this is what a stout should look like , imo . deep , rich , black color with creamy head . inviting and delicious-looking .
a : pours a clear , wheat-orange brew with some decent carbonation , topped by a shallow foam head that dissipates quickly . does n't look like anything special .

a : like all of his brothers , this is not a good looking brew . deeply hazed yellowish brown color . the head that forms falls almost as quickly as it is made . particulates collect at the bottom of the glass . 4.5

a : pour a clear dark apple juice color with just an amazingly beautiful billowingly thick bright white head that did not move at all for a full 5 minutes . finally this epic head slowly started to collapse under its own weight into an extremely thick frothy head . great head retention , super dense solid sheet of lace . very impressive .

appearance : served in the same goddamn sierra snifter i 've poured every single big beer in since i lived in baltimore and got this glass at max 's during a sierra event ( thanks , jessica , i miss you ) . unexpectedly smooth pour for an imperial stout ( aged to boot ) , no gurgle or glug . perfect one-finger tan head , though , with nice thick bubbles . after said head quickly passes away , a tan mantle of foam and bubbles remains . color is impressively black and dark , i do n't think there are brown/ruby nuances here ! ( ok , maybe some auburn tones )
a : pours a nice 1 finger coarse white head that dissipates quickly . beer is a semi-cloudy pear . lacing is stringy and light with little cling .
appearance : very dark red body , lets very little light through . grand off-white head , slow fading .
a : has a nice caramel color but very little carbonation and practically no head . ( this could be because the keg was a little flat )
a : pours a rich amber color , almost like cider . has a thick off-white head that sticks around and leaves a sticky lace behind .

appearance : the body has a very clear appearance with some visible carbonation and a bright golden color . its head is light and sudsy , bright white in color and fades out quickly leaving no lacing at all .
appearance : a wonderful black stout with a nice tan head that slowely goes away leaving a nice layer on top that sticks to the glass .
appearance : clear , golden . no head . light film .
a : orange in color . hazy . some head that went away quickly and no lacing .
a : i 've never given a 5 for appearance , but this beer is beautiful when light shines through . cloudy , just a little darker than the average weizen .
a : jet black with an inch-thick dark brown head . looks very impressive with some lacing .
appearance : pale hazy yellow with dish-soap head , quickly dissipates and leaves a light film . no lacing .
a : the beer is a very pale yellow color with a very thin white head that fades almost instantly and leaves almost no lace on the glass .
a : pours a cola color , head disappears quickly .
a : pours a very muddy brown with some hints at an underlying purple . no head . light carb .
a : deep garnet , almost opaque with a towering light tan head .
a : pours a pale amber with a big white head . : great appearance . more foam in the glass than anything .
a : its dark brown , and it has a thin outer tan head . some very minor lacing .
a : yellow-straw , slightly cloudy , white head , no retention or lace .
a : hazy yellow serving , thick , large bubbles with good retention
a : pours a 1 finger quickly evaporating coarse white head . beer is a cloudy lemon-yellow . lacing is non-existant with the tiny bit of spottiness here and there .
appearance : poured a clear reddish amber , with a thin frothy head . no real lacing left behind . appears to have good carbonation .
appearance : clear , pale slightly-brownish yellow with a meduim-sized , white , fizzy head that quickly diminished to a very light film .
appearance : big white head that quickly slinks away into a thin white veneer coating the top of the beer . bright pale straw color , a touch darker than bud light ?
a : golden , deep amber . good clarity . no ribbons , no head . flat sheet of foam .
a : half finger head of slight cream and fair thickness . abysmally laughable retention . dark ruby colour . solid and nontransparent . sm : heavy cherry and alcohol . moderate strength scent

appearance : pours a beautiful thick 2 finger off-white head . colour is dark brown and it 's somewhat clear . basically zero carbonation . head is pretty persistent and fades into a thick cap , then eventually to a decent film . leaves nice lacing all the way down . very good looking pint .
a : pours a orange rudy ale with excellent clarity . single finger peanut head sticks around and loosely creates a medium quilt . little lacing .

appearance : pours a hazy ruby brown color with lots of head that builds quickly and rises to 3 '' . it is light tan in color and shows great retention . the bubbles are minute and there is plenty of lace that remains . i love the red glow that makes up the outer edges of the beer .

appearance : pours a translucent , apple-juice color . has a thin , fizzy head that dissipates almost immediately and leaves absolutely no head or lacing . it looks more like sparkling cider than beer .
a : poured copper colored , very clear with very little visible carbonation . less than a fingers worth of head that dissipates very quickly ... little to no lacing to speak of .
a : pours a golden straw color . sits clear and faint pale yellow . unremarkable head and minimal lacing .
a : a beautiful dark red amber . magnificent head with surprisingly creaminess and retention . good lacing .
a : opaque , jet black , no head
appearance : fizzy carbonation leads to a soda like look as the head virtually disappears in the matter of seconds . tiny particles float around and put a thin robe of haze around the beer .

a : amber hues are fused with golds and yellows around the edges . i poured cautiously and yet the head was incredibly eager to form . it did so in an out of control manner . to be honest , the densely foamed cream white cap was rather impressive and lasting . my glass was coated with streaks and spiderwebbing as a result . high marks for the head and lace
a : very dark yet lucid yellow and gold hue . lots of lacing , very spread out but prominent in its size and shape . does n't actually look as good as it tastes which is mostly a rare situation imo .

a : hazed orange with a bit of particulate that can be seen . head is a bit disappointing , off-white half inch sized head dies quickly without very good retention . and it aint the glass . some lacing .
a : pours a very dark brown with about a finger of light tan head which recedes into a nice , thick layer with some good lacing .
appearance : pours a cloudy light amber color with a finger of fluffy white head , that seems very fitting . the head dissipates leaving just a layer . pretty beer .
appearance : absolutely gorgeous pour into a pint glass . nice cascading effect , with a good 3/4 inch of a thick , creamy head . unfortunately everything good ends here .
a : a golden orange color , which was not similar to much i 've seen before , beautiful certainly . the head was slightly less impressive , tight and pale - about 1/2 '' and diminished quickly .

a : as i begin to pour this beer straight into the tulip , i notice that there does n't appear to be any carbonation . i pour from higher up . nothing . higher still . nada . i dumb the last ounce of beer in with some force behind it , and finally get about half an inch of huge white bubbles to show up , but they do n't stay long . this one looks to be completely uncarbonated , and to make matters worse the medium-amber body is absolutely awash with huge chunks of swirling particulate . i 'm sure i dislodged some with my rough pour , but this amount is seriously unnerving . this makes even the most unfiltered of ipas look crystal clear . definitely one of the least appealing brews i 've ever seen , but i 'll bump it up a half-point for being a nice color for the style .
a : pours a cloudy copper color , with a small off-white head , but fluffy with huge and tiny bubbles . moderate lacing .

appearance : this beer had been in the back of a friend 's fridge for at least a year . needless to say , there were hefty chunks of sediment floating around the glass , but these dissipated as the beer was swirled around .
appearance : this has a starkly different appearance from the regular version ( served side by side ) . this has a clear copper color with a perfect natural creamy foam head 2 inches high .
a : a tiny froth of head struggles to form and is having an even harder time retaining or forming lace anywhere on the pint . the body is amber with ruby hues .
a : cloudy yellow , huge fluffy white head . extra chunky .
appearance : light yellow , to basically clear , even more clear than others
a : the beer poured a nice fizzy yellow pale color with a small white head which had decent lacing ...
appearance : pale cloudy body with a sticky white head .
appearance : dark to medium amber color . not quite dark enough to call it a porter . and the head was good , for about 2 minutes .
a : 1/2 '' off white head , clumpy skim foam . looks like apple cider , kinda cloudy , hard to see through , rich amber
a : pours a hazy , straw yellow with two fingers of white head that recedes into a foamy ring with no lacing .
a : pale yellow with a small white head .
appearance : it poured a very deep ruby red color . looks almost black . it had a huge beautiful head that lasted a while . it settled to a thin layer of foam with a beautiful lace .
a : pitch black . 2 finger khaki/cream head . sticky lacy down the glass .

appearance : pours a clear copper , with lots of tiny bubbles running quickly to the surface . despite the bubbles , not much head to speak of , though what little there was stuck around and laced nicely .
a : nice clear golden colour with a tight creamy head .
a : pours a darker opaque yellow-orange into my piraat tulip glass with a rock-solid white head that leaves the glass clean as it moves down slowly .
a : rich leathery brown to black , with a nice 1.25 finger head . minimal lacing remains throughout my tasting .
a : deep redish color , absolutely gorgeous to look at .
a : pours a clear golden-orange body . 1 '' frothy head slowly fades to a thick frothy film . a large stream of medium sized carbonation bubbles rise from the center of the glass at a rapid rate .
a : black in color with khaki colored head with a nice 2 inch head . this beer is the quintessential ris in appearance . great looking beer .

a : pours a slightly murky amber with copper tones when held to the light . the first pour yields a fluffy off-white head that covers the top 1.5 '' of the glass . retention is substantial , so much that i actually notice the head sticking around and preventing me from dipping into the beer . as it recedes into a light cap on the brew , it leaves a sticky web of dense lacing down the sides of the glass .
a : bright gold , lots of rising carbonation , single finger head . uniform coated lacing .
appearance : glowing , hazy , burnt orange in color with a decent amount of carbonation and a healthy amount of lacing around the edge .
a : this pours a dark red color with lots of sediment and a thick , one-finger , creamy head that is quite typical with bottle conditioning . it also has considerable lacing .

a : brightest , yellowest beer possible . the glass is more opaque than the contents . huge loose head that vanishes almost instantly leaving absolutely no lacing , and not even a ring of cover . the color is decent , the head is blasphemous .
a : pours a hazy light copper with a bubbly white head . no lacing .
appearance : pours a pleasant clear amber color , with 2 fingers of foamy head in my darkness tulip . as the head begins to recede , sticky lacing clings to the edge of the glass .

appearance : the label reads `` batch # 11/2009/bottle # 437 ; i am a sucker for stuff like that . it pours a dark , somewhat reddish amber . a moderately rough pour produces only a smallish off-white head , but man ...
appearance : looks like a glass of ice tea but with nice head

a : pours a completely translucent wheat yellow like you 'd expect from any other lager , with a stark white and foamy three finger head . plenty of carbonation flowing up toward the top of the glass . an impressive amount of lacing .
a : really nice amber-peach color , decent amount of light head . really beautiful .
a : pours orange , amber color . minimal to no head upon pouring .
appearance : i thought it was a little dark for a marzen . it was brown with a nice off white head and lace .
a : pours a murky mud brown with a huge , massive tan head . it looks like cola . constant stream of fuzzy bubbles rise from the start .
a : hazy , reddish brown . pours with zero head . again with this total lack of carbonation from lost abbey . not sure why this continues to be a trend . not a particularly attractive brew .
a : light orangish yellow in color . very hazy . half finger head that disappears instantly . hardly any lacing .
a : pours a hazy orange-yellow with three fingers of white head that recedes into a thin ring with no lacing .

a : wow . props to bells ' for this beautiful single ipa . it has a hazy orange/amber color with three plus fingers of foamy , rocky white head . it 's enormous and has great retention . very dramatic lacing goes down my entire sa perfect pint glass .
appearance : pours a very clear pale light yellow that was surprisingly the lightest colored beer i have experienced . head lasted about 3 seconds before breaking apart .

appearance : pours a slightly orange/yellow beer with active carbonation from the bottom to top . the head is a generous 3 '' of slightly yellow , foamy , craterous head . it has excellent retention and leaves plenty of spidery lace on the glass . a picturesque beer .
a : i feel like these guys do a great job with head ; this one is thick and tightly bubbled and sits on top of a clear amber body
a : a clear copper color with a small whitish head that recedes quickly .
appearance : pours a very yellowy-brown , with a decent-sized head . color is a bit light for a `` dark '' beer , though that often happens with belgians .

a : when poured from a 12 once bottle into a pint glass i see a very small head , though the pour was rather vigorous . this ipa is a bit lighter in color than some other ipa 's i drink , more of an orange like color , rather than the dark and amber of say a 90 min . the appearance seams to suggest a hoppier more bitter beer rather than the maltiness of the aforementioned .
a : served with 1/2 a finger of off-white head that quickly disappears . not even a film or collar . the body is a radiant amber orange with 80 % transparency . absolutely no lacing . s &
a : poured very tank , with a quickly dissipating *very* thin head . no lacing present whatsoever . closer inspection reveals a ruby red color when held up the light .
a : very , very light golden yellow with a 1 inch qhite head that very quickly fades to a small lace atop the brew . good .
a : slightly hazy gold color . poured a 1 finger white head that fell quickly to a broken skim that clung on the edges . inconsistent , broken lacing .
appearance : major foam in my flute . an amber golden body with a very long lasting head and major lacing . perfect appearance in my books .
appearance : pours a cloudy amber orange with a finger of head . lacing towards the top of the glass .

appearance : this brew pours wonderful tan full head . lacings are insanely plentiful . can you believe it ? i swear even the head had lacings ! ! ! that was a first for me ! ( even being a homebrewer that would be a noble goal ) color is a deep reddish brown . carbonation is average for american ales but a little high for english styles .
a : light golden color . not much of a head with very little lacing .
appearance : this was a hazy , straw colored beer . the head was tiny and disappeared instantly , just like a soda . there was no trace of it left at all .
a : hazy , murky orangeish brown color . had ample amount of foamy off-white head . tons of white / cream colored sediment suspended throughout and also gathered at the bottom of the glass .
appearance : nice golden color , two fingers of white lush foam , good head retention , great clarity , lacey

a : deep amber-gold , small head with very thin lace . incredibly hazy with suspended chunks . i really looked for something to indicate that this was intended but i can not find anything . hopefully a one batch thing .
a : hazy gold . big white head that has stuck with it . little patches of lacing down the side of the glass . minimal/no carbonation rising from the bottom of the glass .

a : the pour gives you blend of rich , dark brown color streaked with cream , then the cascading effect kicks in ( cascading from a can = awesome ! ) . once the cascading settles , you 're left with a deep , opaque brown body and a thick , ultra creamy , khaki colored head , two fingers thick - it looks as if someone has poured a layer of creamy vanilla milkshake over top of my guinness .
appearance : pale glowing amber body forms a thin cream head which dwindles rather quickly leaving little or no lacing , carbonation issues well maybe .
appearance : looks like budweiser .
a : love the golden look to this beer , when poured it held a semi thick head for longer than what i thought it would ( 2-3 min ) and it laced really nice . logo rocks too .
a : pour is very light in color - looks almost like an adjunct lager . the white head is pretty large , but sinks quickly into no lacings .
appearance : a murky shade of brown , sort of like a watered down cheap coffee , the head was brown and thin .
a : must have been sitting on the bar for a while . by the time it got to me , there was no head to speak of , just some foam floating .
a : pours an ultra-clear straw color with some massive head that fades slowly . moderate carbonation . n : pale malts , grass and lemon .
a : pours a super murky redish brown with a small white head that fades to a ring pretty quickly leaving no real lacing on the glass .
a : pours , glugs , out super thick , black as night . very little head chocolate milk head , only there for a couple of seconds .

a : poured into a nonic glass , this beautiful enough to frame and hang up on the wall . a rich black beer that is impenetrable by light shares the glass with an equally rich inch high head . the head subsides to practically nothing with a bit of lace .

a : not much head ; what there is disappears almost immediately . there was a significant amount of yeast in the bottle , some of which made it into the glass . this probably contributed to the cloudiness of the beer . color is muddy brown with a red/orange highlights .
appearance : light brown with cranberry red hues in the colour . the head was awesome at first with a big fluffy and think meringue look , unfortunately it dissipated to almost nothing .

appearance : a nice thumb and a half of head that produced solid lacing . the body is a bright yellow that has a very fine amount of particulate yeast that i would expect from the style and ample carbonation . excellent retention as well , all 's it needs is a bit more lace .

a : pours with the whitest head imaginable . only one finger high but the retention is amazing . the head starts out fluffy , becomes fizzy , and lands on creamy as it is constantly being fed by a relentless rush of bubbles . sea foam style lace is immaculate and sticks to the glass in sheets . the body is perfectly clear and the typical light honeycomb yellow pilsner color . perfect appearance , no questions asked .
a : pours a deep copper , clear , with nearly 3 fingers of a tight white head with really good retention . leaves a lot of lacing .
a : orangish amber in color . quarter inch head . sporadic lacing . not impressive .
a : pours a gorgeous deep orangey/yellow color that reminds me of a fire . nice 1 1/2 finger head too with great lacing on the glass . it does n't get much better than this .
appearance : golden red in color and a bit cloudy with a significant amount of large sediment . unappetizing .

appearance : pours a pretty dull and lifeless color , sort of a chalky amber . a fast-fading almost-white head tops this one and leaves nothing but a sheen of foam once it fades . lacing is splotchy and inconsistent , runny and glittery . carbonation is fast and fine-bubbled , incredibly dense . a strange-looking beer .
a : clear poor into a snifter , generates ample , white , head that dissipates quickly and leaves minimal lacing . the beer is a dark red/amber color
appearance : pale yellow , like easter egg yellow that 's diluted . lackluster head disappeared . now there 's a thin , thin , thin ring of white .
a : hazy orange , very cloudy and active . tons of foamy white head everywhere . its great retention leaves a sticky trace of white lace behind .
appearance : one finger of an oppwhite head and pours a dark brown but a lot of light penetrates . i like my imperial stouts pitch black .
a : dark like a black iced coffee . small white head that dissapates quickly
appearance : deep black pour with a tan pancake batter head . the head slowly fades and sticks to the glass .

appearance : as poured the beer is a dark brown , almost black , liquid with a 1 light brown head composed of lots of medium and small sized bubbles . as the beer slowly but visibly recedes it leaves some foam around the sides of the glass and some leggy lacing sticking to the glass . sipping creates a line of a ring that arches over lots of small speckles of lacing .
appearance : pours an orangey-copper body with a lush , frothy white head . very nice lookin ' .

appearance : pours into my delirium tulip a pitch black with a one and a half finger high , loose-bubbled , light brown head . this is one of the biggest heads i 've ever seen on an imperial stout . it has nice staying power too and leaves wall of lacing down the glass . can i give this a 5.5 ? or 8.0 ?
a : pours an orangish copper color with a thick finger of head that dissipates but a nice foam film remains .
a : almost 4 fingers of head . great etching lacing . tons of yeast floating with the carbonation . i have never seen so much yeast in a dipa .
a : pours a very dark brown with hints of red . one inch lasting creamy looking tan head .
a : pours an orange color w/ 3 fingers of head . very foamy , big bubbles dissipate slowly .
a : typical saison . cloudy light-gold color with a fluffy , white head .
appearance : pours a cloudy yellow-brown , carbonation is on the lighter side , very little foam and no lacing .

a : standard pour yields a thin barely-there layer of light mocha that dissipates quickly . beer is an appropriate opaque black . lacing is minimal with no stick . nice legs though . head and lacing lose points that the legs make up for a touch . slightly below average . hardly carbonated .

a : pours a nice rich brown color with a largish , 2.5 finger tan head . the beer is quite clear with excellent active carbonation . the head has a nice texture to the hop and a variety of bubble sizes . attractive . 4.5
a : clear rusty brown under a small white head . no lace , no retention .

a : golden body with thick clouds and no head , lacing , or cover . lots of floating particulate matter as well . pretty poor really , but this could easily be a carbonation issue due to a defect in the rubber seal .

appearance : rusty copper-tone amber , light orange pigment on the bottom , darkened rubber-oaken look ; a a very cupidinously froth-craze , masterful lace -- powerful sell . score ! adil , hoy definitely know how to pick ... from light session , to strong seasonal , this makes your mark .

a : it arrived to me a beautiful , shining auburn color with a big , white , milky head . gorgeous . pale but powerful . the head stays the same size ( and just as thick , for that matter ) all the way to the last drink .

appearance : pours a dead-looking , nearly pitch black-bodied brew , completely devoid of head save for a few faint bubbles atop the surface around the collar and a faint dusting that actually disappears kinda quickly . god how i wish this one were carbonated .
appearance : it pours a deep blood red with a fluffy , tight bubbled , head . it is very clear and the head leaves a very sticky lace .
a : very strange orange color to a style that is a yellow beer in general . filtered . no head which for a helles is a big no no . not to mention it should be in a helles glass , but i digress .

appearance : pours a massive 4 finger white medium thick fluffy head that mounds out of the glass like a mountain . a decent amount of carbonation is evident with tiny little bubbles . quite a few floaties unfortunately . colour is tangerine orange with some amber at the bottom . head is pretty persistent and a thick cap remains to the end leaving some decent lacing down the glass . very nice looking .

a : slightly hazy , medium orangish-gold color with over one finger of lofty , cottony white foam that diminishes to a persistent iceberg covering over half of the surface . heavy lacing , showing obvious relief in places , remains on the glass . a few bubbles rise lazily in the column .
a : a fairly vigorous pour results in two full fingers of creamy tan head atop a crystal-clear , dark mahogany body . amazing retention and lacing for an 11 % beer . color me impressed .
appearance : nothing special , a regular straw color of most american macro beers ; but with .
appearance : pours black into a nonic pint . the head is small and drops immediately to a thin collar with a hazy surface .

a : wow , this is a great looking ale . it is a very deep amber , bordering on brown . murky , with a hint of gold right at the stem of the glass . the head , which was a full 2 fingers plus , is a light golden/tan . i got some nice lacing . head held up for a while , but died out halfway through the drink .

appearance : painfully clear light yellow with a short lived large bubbled head . flavor : very sweet , cloying , with the main flavors being corn and corn syrup . no agave flavors noted ( and this from a fairly dedicated tequila drinker ) but a fair shot of lime straight from one of those green plastic limes .

appearance : this is the beers shining moment . the body of the beer is a bright shining caramel amber coloration . the head of the beer looks a creamy caramel tinged off white . no real head retention but not expected for the abv . the beer is wearing a wonder bra . now you may ask what brings a wonder bra to mind ? you think your girl has a great rack and she takes her bra off and you wonder where her tits went . the beer looks like its got a great rack but leave me wondering what the hell happened ?
a : pours a hazy gold with noticeable bits of sediment , and a head that is gone almost as soon as you set down the bottle .
a : apple juice amber , two finger head . bubbles rising to the surface . white frothy head .
a : fluffy and pitch black . this is a beautiful looking brew with a half in head that is sinfully dark brown . sticky sticky foam .

a : well this is gorgeous , is n't it ? a tawny orangeish-brown body , murky and cloudy as hell . absolutely huge head , mountainous and frothy . it seemed to last an eternity . can i drink my beer already ? s &
appearance : pale yellow color , medium head , a little lacing

a : not the most attractive looking beer . black , with no sign of carbonation yet again ( see my past lost abbey reviews for more on the lack of carbonation ) . it could have been sitting out all night for all i know -- that 's what it looked like .
a : it looked like beer , gold , no head , slightly fizzy

a : pours out with the slightest bit of haze that eventually settle to the bottom of my glass . think of a gumballhead , then add a drop of orange food coloring , tada ! now you have pride and joy . head is a bit soapy , leaves a bit of lacing , nothing to write home about .
a : pale yellow , cloudy , carbs dissipate quickly ; lacing is very thin and spotty
a : i like the ruby red look of it . definitely inviting .
a : the pour is clear golden with a large thick white head that sinks , rather slowly , into nice lacings .
a : dirty dark amber with large oily off-white head that reduced to a thick film that lasted the whole way through . left lots of sticky lacing on the glass .

a : the beer pours a nice reddish brown pour that turns ruby red when held up to a light . the head is a light khaki color and is very frothy . great retention and great lacing as well as ample carbonation .
a : pours a clear yellow with a full , lasting white head , excellent lacing .
a : pours out cough-drop yellow with a fairly impressive and fluffy two finger , pure white head . not much carbonation to speak of . beer is supposed to be carbonated , right ?
appearance : lemony , sunshine yellow with a creamy white head that disappeared quickly . left minimal lacing .
a : pours the color of honey . brilliant , vibrant golden orange . beautiful . 1.5 fingers of creamy white head .
a : dark brownish red color with light haze . tan head , very soapy , not too much volume . lacing is minimal and not much retention .

a : pale yellow . almost clear . starts out with a decent sized soapy white head . but it disappears to almost nothing within a minute or two . after a few more , you basically have yellow water . small amount of carbonation has tiny bubbles .

a : poured into a sa perfect pint glass . it 's a very dark brown almost black . has a very creamy , thick almost two finger head . it sticks around for quite awhile . leaves nice lacing the entire time .
appearance : cloudy , light-brown/copper color with a fleeting white champagne-like head that leaves no surface layer or noticeable lacing .
a : a straw gold color , with virtually no head or lacing whatsoever .
appearance : pours a tawny port color with a massive belgian beige head that retains beautifully and leaves thick clumps of foam sticking to the nonic
appearance : a bronzed golden yellow color . a large white head rests on top . the color is darker than other tripels .
a : perfect look . deep ruby color with a thick mocha colored head that disappates fairly quickly .
a : clear , bright amber body with a tight cap of white foam . good retention , light lace . pretty enough .
a : hazy brownish yellow color . agressive pour resulted in half a finger of head that fell quickly , but surprisingly left a decent amount of lacing . 2.0

appearance : the beer is black colored . there is no ruby opaqueness to light . the head was a thick creamy burnt creamed coffee coloration . the head was about an inch thick . there is very nice thick lacing on the glass .
a : this pours a brownish/black color with some ruby highlights around the edges . a huge tan head forms and recedes very slowly to a ring leaving a decent amount of lace behind .

appearance : black , with a light tan head that settles to about a half-inch and stays put all the way to the bottom of the glass . that 's not stout on my moustache , that 's `` later snack value . '' very strong lacing . watching a pub can of stout settle is one of life 's great joys .
a : weakest part of the beer . dark walnut color with a somewhat firm tan head . the head dissolves quickly and leaves very little lace .
a : pours a clear golden with a slightly off-white head of about 1/2 a finger that sticks around for just a little .

a : 3 fingers worth of creamy off white head . retention of the head was one of the best i have ever seen . it was there till the very last drop . fred poured a dark gold almost burnt orange color . lacing was a piece of art . so much of it left on glass .

appearance : when poured into my tulip glass , the beer was this really nice hazy golden color with a massive and i mean massive head of white foam . in fact when i first popped the cap , the foam was nearly jumping out of the bottle and when i poured it , i had to stop half way because it would have overflowed all over the place . excellent retention and if left plenty of white sticky lace around the glass .
a : beautiful golden hazy color with about a fingers worth of creamy white head . left behind some nice lacing . this beer really looked special . amazing .
a : pours a clear orange with a fizzy white head which does n't last long .

a : only 1 1/2 fingers is produced with a rather vigorous pour . the head is creamy and frothy with decent retention and becomes an everlasting film . the body is very dark brown with ruby/amber edges and a 90 % opacity that improves only marginally when held to light . lacing is spare to none .
a : drank from a bottle , did n't get a good look .
a : pours a clear bright slightly golden yellow color . provides a thick white foam head that has exceelent retention . there is plenty of lacing . the carbonation is quite visible .
a : murky brown color . the bottle hissed during the cap removal , but there is n't any damn head . this is one damn ugly brew . 4.5
a : looks awesome in a glass as a purely opaque beer with an awesome head that follows your progession down the glass .

a : pours a cloudy straw body . 1 '' white head slowly fades to a thick film . tiny carbonation bubbles rise quickly from the center of the glass . lots of thick lacing on the glass from the initial head , but after that there 's very little .
appearance : bright yellow , nice head and beautiful lace .
a : nice yellowish-brown color

a : pours a brilliant pale/golden orange with an opaque color . the head is thick and last well . initially this beer must be poured slowly as to not over foam . the lacing on the inside of the glass is beautiful and fades slowly .
a : pours a clear amber color . carbonation is evident up the glass , but the head is limpid at best despite a vigorous pour ; retention is short ; lacing is a pipe dream .
a : poured into a mug . a really nice orange red color , almost copper . pours a nice 2 finger head with some nice retention .
a : pours an amber color with an off white head with okay retention and poor lacing .
a : a slightly reddish-golden pour . head is a bit fizzy , but falls back to all but nothing quite quickly .
a : pours a light , hazy copper with a thin , khaki-colored head and minimal lacing .
appearance : hazy , honey gold color . pours with a large head . good carbonation . nice lacing . flavor : sweet light , mild and crisp overall , finishes quickly with little after taste
a : pours a lightly pumpkin tinted amber . very small head on the pour and no retention . no lacing .
appearance : poured a light yellow amber . half-finger fizzy/bubbly white head that disappears immediately . visible carbonation . no lacing .

a : a 4 finger light brown head is both foamy and creamy . the retention is incredible and the head lasts considerably longer than the other versions . the body is amber-orange with deep red tints , hazy with about 65 % opacity . lacing is beyond excellent , sticking on all sides of the glass in torn sheets .
a : a hazy , almost clear , gold body with no head to actually speak of even when i tried to force one .

a : clear , pale straw yellow with a bright white , very light and foamy head that rises slightly above the rim of the glass and does n't fall over . clusters of carbonation cling to the sides of the glass . moderately full lacing .

appearance : this beer pours a deep onxy black with a creamy thick light brown head . the head is definitely here to stay as it is still standing strong after literally thirty minutes of letting the beer warm to an appropriate drinking temperature .

appearance : pours a clear , transparent brown and forms a 2+ finger , medium looking , fluffy , off-white head with great retention . dark brown and very transparent for the style , with higher levels of carbonation evident . head slowly fades to nice foam cap . a ring and splotchy wisp remain until the end leaving some decent lacing down the glass . head was alright , though somewhat too big for the style , but this one was simply too thin and transparent to be an imperial stout .
a : amber color with about a half inch of head that dissapears fast leaving an average amount of lacing

a : pours a reddish amber rather than the brown i was expecting , one finger tan head dissipates quickly . lots of suspended sediment is present ( batch # 9981 so i assume it 's not left over from last year ) .
appearance : coal black with a healthy brown head that dissipates into a thin head .
a : golden/orange , slightly hazy , moderate amount of head that retains pretty well . pretty good lacing .
a : perfect pilsner pour . clear golden color . a finger of white head with a little bit of lacing . perfect .

a : pours a hazy caramel amber color with a huge , very dense , light tan oily head that took its sweet time slowly receding into a thick film with a raised column of dense head in the middle of the beer . epic lacing was left as well . this is one good looking beer .

a : pours with a really heavy foam . takes some time for the foam to settle and it leaves a crown that lasts for a while . the colour it absolutely beautiful , perfect amber . it looks crisp , clear and delicious .

a : the appearance is just like their xxxx stout , almost black though slightly lighter in the silhouette when seen against light . the creamy and frothy head leaves very very fine sheets of brownish lace around the side of the glass . flawless -- for a nitro-tap poured beer .

a : pours a cloudy yellow-amber body . after an aggressive pour , a 1/4 '' bubbly head struggles to from and fades very quickly to a very thin film and a ring at the edge of the glass . some small carbonation bubbles rise slowly . teeny spots of lacing are left behind .

a : pours a one finger head which is thin , devoid of cream , and of bad retention . another casualty of the recklessness of camra 's misguided movement . semitransparent copper colour . appealing in a general sense . sm : caramel , cream , and slight bittering hops . a mild strength aroma .
a : exceptional foam head with a dark brown color almost like mousse .

appearance : pours a big two finger thicker looking tan head with great retention . head looks fluffy but creamy and thick as well . jet black body with next to zero carbonation evident . a thick cap remains until the end and leaves lots of nice rings of lacing down the glass . a thing of beauty .
a : pours a murky brown-orange with half a finger of beige head that almost completely vanishes with no lacing .

a : pours a four finger head of very slight soft cream , very thin , with good retention . colour is a dark transparent yellow . it 's actually not that appealing , but i suppose it 's par for the style . sm : very pleasant straw , yeast , and light lemon notes . it 's mild in strength but rather appealing .

a : pours a beautiful moderately hazy amber color . there is a foamy head of 2 fingers with amazing retention . on the side of the glass in the head , i can see a lot of small bubbles stacked on top of each other like jelly beans in a jar . as the head fades , it looks even creamier and small pockets reminiscent of the lunar surface appear on top of the still thick head .

a : pours a transparent straw color that looks very fizzy as soon as it is poured . the head produced is over carbonated and retains for about 1 second before receding back into the pint glass . lacing is non-existent .
a : very strong rich clear golden color with a robust soapy head .
a : thin , watery yellow . no head to speak of . what did you expect . it gets better from here .

appearance : this is by far the beer 's strong suit . it really does look a lot like champagne , or some other very light-colored sparkling wine . a copious amount of tiny bubbles punctuates the beer 's body , producing a bright white , dense-looking head that disappears after several minutes . bright , clean , and inviting .

a : pours with a bright white fizzy head , no more than one finger high . rapidly diminishing . the body is a pale golden straw color with a haziness providing 80 % opacity . no film , no collar , no lacing . none expected . s &
a : standard stout black , nice coffee colored head .
a : served in a flight of their 4 single hop ipas . orangey deep gold , slight chill haze , really nice dense lasting head and lacing .
a : extended pour yields a 1.5 finger , thick , coarse , light cream head with great retention . beer is a clear , almost opaque , dark mahogany . lacing is thick and layered with amazing cling .
a : first non-gusher of the upland lambics that i have had . pours a creamy purple . little foam , but the foam that is there is a purplish-white . beautiful looking beer .
appearance : cloudy . slight head . light tan .
a : light gold , pale yellow edges . thin white head , no retention .
appearance : pours a crystal clear pale straw colour with a medium bone white head , quickly receding to nothing . no lace whatsover .
a : pours a dark amber with a nice white head , good retention .
appearance : pours a cloudy amber color with very little off white head that disappears completely . not very attractive .
appearance : hazy golden glass does n't hold much of a head , just a thin coat that does n't lace . the thin head dropped off about half way through leaving a murky yellow glass .
appearance : cloudy with a pale light orange colour . no floating yeast . the head is white , moussy and substantial . it seldom persists and when it goes away it leaves very little lacing behind .
a : pours a mirky , orangish yellow . a couple fingers of foam and lots of lacings

appearance : a one finger foamy and bubbly white head with poor retention . this style of beer needs to have a lasting head . the color of the beer is an amber color with copper orange hues . there is some effervescence in the beer . the clarity of the beer is clear to brilliant .

a : pale yellow . rolling active carbonation . descent white bubbly head with slightly above average . s/t : i can not get over how much this beer smells and tastes like buttered popcorn . i think this is diacetyl in the beer . i am not sure if this is intended but it is not disguised by any amount of malt or hop character . if you read the back of this bottle , you might be expecting a traditional lager in the german style and this stuff makes bud taste better .
a : pours yellow-orange , with a light head and carbonation , good colour .

appearance : well , i thought i was really careful with my pour and dumped an ounce or so from the bottom , but ended up with lots -- lots of suspended yeast in my glass . it doesnt really alter my enjoyment that much , but it looks kinda gross . otherwise i think it would be clear ruby-orange with a nice head that leaves sheets and sheets of lacing .
a : frothy 2-finger head . the color is a pale gold .

a : an initially careless pour explodes into a mountain of froth , and even slowing down to a slanted trickle does n't let me get the whole beer poured right away . once things settle down a bit , a creamy , rocky tan head sits atop a murky reddish-brown body . while the clarity is n't what i would like and it appears a bit overcarbonated , i 'm still a fan . what can i say ? i 'm in love with lots of head .
appearance : was a hazy amber/ straw color in appearance , slight eggshell head with minimal lacing .

a : it poured a pale greenish yellow clear body with a mountain of bubbles from carbonation but a minor white head . the head was gone before i sat down and did not support much more than itty bitty clumps of lacing .
a : it pours a light yellow with a head that fades like that of coke poured into a glass . i could n't be more unimpressed .
a : pours a deep mahogany-brown and is capped with sudsy , short-lived khaki head . it quickly resembles root beer .

appearance : poured a beautiful hazy light ruby red color with a very thin head of foam . it did n't leave too much lace but did have some rings around my pilsner glass . although a nice color , but to me it is n't the usual dopplebock dark brown/ruby/black color .
a : pours an ugly muddy brown color with a half finger of fluffy white head . +.5 point for the beady lace on the glass .
appearance : an excellent white cappuccino-like froth that remained throughout the whole drink . unfiltered with a lot of yeast that did not take long to settle after the pour .
a : pretty brown . lots of yeast suspended . not a very atractive beer . small tannish head , that receeded quickly and left little lace .
appearance : a deep inviting reddish brown with a tan head
a : 3 fingers of frothy tan head over a fine looking black , featuring brown edges when held up to the light . there 's a nice froth of retention and good lacing .
a : fluffy banana milkshake head , thin dull gold with minimal rising carbonation
a : brilliantly red in color with a crisp foamy white head , sticks to the glass like no other - and perfectly clear .
appearance : pours with a big rocky white head which takes a while to dissipate . follow that is a rocky white lacing that clings to the glass . cloudy and light amber in color .
a : amber colored beer , clear with great frothy head
appearance : orangey-amber color , poured with about a finger of head which dissipated quickly . left little spots of lacing down the glass .
a : pours light brown with amber notes - surprisingly light . a very small head dissipates instantly leaving no lacings .
a : muddy brown body under a finger of fine light-brown foam . ok retention , minimal lace . kinda ugly .
a : murky brownish amber in color
a : murky light brown , poured with a little head consisting of big bubbles and a very thin collar .
a : dark brown/blackish stout . looks a bit thin ... but we 'll see . khaki head has fallen to respectable level
a : very murky and cloudy . golden in color . the head is high , little teeny bubbles that last for 5+ minutes .
appearance : dark brown but not 100 % opaque . no head.no lacing .
a : pours a golden clear body with a light white head that lasted better than expected with light lacing .

a : dark orange with red hues . looks like a cloudy irish red . not sure why this lager is not clear ( wheat maybe ) ... who knows . creamy off-white head that left pretty quickly . no significant lacing
a : very cloudy walnut brown . a fizzy cream head starts out strong , but quickly disappears . leaves no lace .
a : clear light golden color with a big foamy head , about 2 fingers worth . the head dissipated slowly settling to a nice layer leaving lots of lacing all the way down . great looking beer .

appearance : pours a medium 1 finger off-white head that 's thick and full looking . higher carbonation evident . dark brown in color , almost black , which some ruby hues around the edges . head slowly recedes and leaves some immediate lacing . a nice film stays and decent lacing down the glass . pretty nice looking .
a : very clear , slight golden hue ; fizzy white head , no retention or lace .
a : unfiltered , but very hazy and a bit too milky
a : pours copper , with a large soapy tan head . slow dissipation and rich lacings .
appearance : brownish caramel , with just a thin head that tapered off quite quickly .
appearance : looks just like a guiness on nitro ; great lacing
a : crystal clear , nice head that sticks around well . the head really surprised and impressed me , have n't seen a commercial pale ale that sticks around this long .
a : pours black with a small fizzy off-white head , good retention , light lacing .
a : clear , amber color , no head

appearance : out of the bottle it pours a clear amber reminiscent of cognac . no carbonation , head or lacing , but it does have a sticky look to it as it holds on to the sides of the snifter and slowly rolls down . beautiful . aroma 2 : still highly alcoholic , but also reminiscent of cognac , port , with nutty tones of pecans and hazelnuts and a sort of sugary sweetness . the alcohol really dries out your nose ! flavor : still amazed that this is a beer ! warming , alcoholic up front and notes of caramel and vanilla . it ends with the nuttiness described above .
appearance : a cloudy orange beer that pours with a huge white head . that fizzles away relatively fast .
appearance : a lovely pink with tints of orange . tons of little bubbles shooting up to the surface , especially in the middle .
a : poured an orangish copper color with good carbonation leaving a tan cap . pretty cloudy too
a : just a wee bit of head on it and as quickly as i poured , it disappeared . the brew has a golden brown hue .
appearance : pale yellow ; no head or lacing
a : pours a deep strawberry/blood red color . 1/4 inch pink head with nice retention .

appearance : when it was first poured , it was black on top and brown on the bottom . when it settled it went with the jet black color with a small amount of ruby highlights . it had a creamy tan colored head of foam the measured somewhere between 1 to 2 inches that left lots of lace . when first poured , i also saw the carbonation bubbles pop on top of the foam . a true delight !

a : no surprises here : it 's thick , black , and opaque with two fingers of solid , frothy brown head that sticks around admirably and leaves some nice lace . you ca n't ask for anything more from an ris .
a : clear yellow body with only vague remnants of a thin white head . insipid .

a : pours a deep , rich brown color which looks black , other than the highlights around the edges . the pour produces a fluffy billowy khaki color head that retains well and leaves lots of lacing along the glass

a : poured into a goblet fairly aggressive , revealing a nice off-white/cream colored head resting on a deep caramel colored liquid . bubbles continued to rise from the bottom of the glass as i waited impatiently to drink . good amount of lacing left on the glass . head retention was good .
appearance : looks more like a belgian than a stout ( as i would expect from ommegang ) with an espresso brown color and a rich , foamy head that leaves plenty of lacing

a : my biggest ding on this beer is the appearance . i like the color , an orangish yellow color but ... blue moon calls this a belgian white but it 's not anywhere near white ! ! not true to style . reclassify the beer to match the style ...
appearance : transparent light yellow in color . practically no head and light lace .

appearance : pours a cloudy brown color with some reddish tints . head is just a thin off-white film that does n't last long . some visible carbonation and lots of floating sediment ( that does n't seem to settle ) .
appearance : pours a light amber , one finger white head which dissipates quickly . clear .
appearance : pours a golden orange color with a very tall 5 '' cream colored head . it has great retention and gods of clinging , spidery lace . deep craters are formed in the head .

a : poured in to a german tumbler only to watch it explode with foam . after the pour , the off-white head slowly climbed over an inch above the rim of the glass . i am quite impressed with the vigorous lacing presented through a crystal clear , amber body .

a : pours a hazy amber to orange hue , with little carbonation that settles to a thin film on the surface . head retention is mediocre , and lacing is the same . i understand this is an unfiltered ipa , but the amount of floaties turns me off .
appearance : this beer was a reddish-orange color with just a little bit of haze . hardly any head at all and , therefore , no lace .
a : looks good , nearly black ( some faint red hues shine through ) and but a smaller than normal head ...

appearance : at least 4 inches of thick , creamy , dense head of a light brown color . excellent head retention . left a solid foamy film all around the glass and well down the sides . superb head ! deep chocolate brown color .

a : pouring into a pint glass out of the can is a beautiful thing to see and you can watch the nitro head just settle out on top . very deep gold/straw in color . with more bubbles clinging to the side of my glass .
appearance : a beautiful orange-brown but cloudy , damn near opaque even upon warming . the pour was good with a 0.5-1 inch head .
a : pours a light cloudy straw with a thick frothy head .
a : pours a deep and dark plum color with a very small , thin head . zero lacing and poor retention . the color is rich and nice , but the lack of a quality head is a bit disappointing .
a : modest head , little carbonation , clear dark ruddy red color
appearance : open up to a beer that pored with very little head , after a couple of minutes , a very small ring around the top . deep bronze in color .
appearance : this beer is extremly dark , with a very thick long lasting tan head . when held up to a light very little if any light comes though this wonderful stout .
a : hazy straw color , with yeast sediment in suspension . long lasting creamy white head .

a : very dark , black almost all the way through , except for the ruby red around the edges . nitrogen creates extremely small bubbles that create a tan head that lasts forever . excellent lasing . no carbonation .
appearance : an attractive cascade dancing through the darkness to coalesce into a half inch of heavy mocha foam . a good start !
a : pours a transparent pinkish/straw color that produces virtually no head . not too impressed with the pour
a : muddy black , supple tan head that left some great lacing and a moderate cap throughout the tasting .
a : dark , dark brown ... almost a black . thin head that soon disappears as soon as it was poured .
a : cloudy woody color beneath a thin film of a head . served in a chilled pint glass .
a : it has a golden amber to orange looking color .

appearance : a slightly oversized pint glass is recommended . the nitro-can pours beautifully , filling the glass with microbubbles as it builds a thick creamy head . the head , about one finger thick , lasts for a long time , leaving heavy foam all down the glass as you drink . the color , after the microbubbles clear , is a light brown .
appearance : really pale yellow color with some soda like bubbles on top .
a : brown red colour and a big 3 cm head that lasts pretty well . 5

a : the most noticeable aspect is this brew 's creamy head that boasts a beige hue . its retention is admirable ; i 've had this beer in front of me for 20 minutes and it has n't diminished a bit . body is deep caramel in color with a touch of haze .

appearance : black as you can get of of the darkest ive seen . light brown/ tanned head small streams of bubbles flowing up the side of the glass . wonderfull head and retention . perfect lacing in a symetrical pattern . perfect .
a : roasted malts , bitter-sweet chocolate , dark fruits , some oats , a tinge of coffee , a dash of pepper , and a spice of alcohol . quite pleasant to the olfactory sense , if i do say so myself .
appearance : clear pale yellow color . had a thick ( +1 '' ) head , but the foam looked like soap suds , not creamy . the head quickly fell to a ring which left little lacing .

a : pours a one finer head of fair cream , decent thickness , and bad retention ( ~ fifteen seconds ) , though with this high an abv it 's remarkable it has a head at all . colour is a murky hazy nontransparent caramel butterscotch . yeasty bits float about . sm : raisin , dark fruit ( grape ) esters , dark fermented apple juice/cider , yeast , caramelized malt , and maybe molasses . there 's certainly a sweetness , but also a funky note i ca n't quite put my finger on . i can smell it from a distance , but up close it 's merely moderately strong . all around it 's certainly an intriguing aroma . i 'm enticed .
appearance : pours a light golden straw color with a dismal ring of a head and leaves behind just a light dusting of a lacing .

appearance : this poured a dark brown , almost black , with a nice frothy head . not much in the way of lacing though . you definitely could not see through the glass , it was dark ... it looked like coffee , imagine that .

appearance : poured into a snifter . not head , even with a free , steady pour . this looks like a classic brown ale . actually , i had a 1985 version that was more ruby . this looks like a translucent brown ale . very unexpected . nothing wrong with the appearance , just uninspiring .
appearance : watched the super carbonated porter make a huge mess all over my coffee table . massive head , no lacing .
a : deep , dark reddish amber color . a quarter-finger of light beige head retains poorly and turns into a thin , big-bubbled collar with no lacing .
appearance : pitch black with cola edging . a fluffy tan head with moderate retention .
a : pours a glassy , crystal clear pale ochre with a half-finger head of fizzy , soapy bubs . they remain a thin , scummy top layer .
appearance : clear amber with a big solid head that falls quickly .
appearance : clumpy sediment in a cloudy brown body , head fades at a very fast , fizzy rate . kind of an ugly looking beer .
a : very cloudy and opaque golden/yellow tinted brew . short , mildly off-white head with some moderate lacing .
appearance : cloudy pale white-golden color with a typical wheat beer tiny lace .

a : pours with an absolutely amazing 4 finger light tan head that seems to defy gravity , it refuses to drop , when it does , the head seems to get even thicker and never completely disappears . the beer it self is completely black as would be expected . the amount of lace is extreme , almost impossible to see through .
a : a nice golden color , maybe a little darker than expected , and a spotty head , pretty bad lacing though ...
a : deep red , tall fluffy head , plenty of lacing .
appearance : transparent yellow body , some bubbles from carbonation , but with absolutely zero head .

appearance : cloudy , dark gold/orange body . huge off-white head . great retention , lots of little bubbles coming up the side of the glass . i almost want to just look at it instead of drinking ... nah .
appearance : bright yellow , fairly clear . not too much carbonation and the head lasted all of 4 seconds .
a : the pour is a clear , light golden color without much foam .
appearance : nothing like the appearance of a cask ale - cloudy apricot with a pillowy head ; great retention and sheets of lace
appearance : pours quickly and is pitch black , but with almost no head at all .
a : darker orange to amber , little head and base lace , looks a bit on the soda side .
a : pours a 1 finger whitish-coffee fine , fluffy head with excellent retention . brew itself is a nice clear deep , almost black amber . lacing is layered and full . great looking black ipa .
a : packaged in a clear bottle , the beer is very light in colour . a small head when poured which dissipated quickly .
appearance : pours a very dark brown with red highlights . light tan head that reaches 2.5 '' tall . ample lacing sticks to the glass .
appearance : light copper color . good carbonation . weak head that quickly dissipates , leaving behind light lacing .

a : well , it is n't flat . a hard pour yielded a thin ring of medium sized bubbles that quickly faded . this could be revived with a swirl . the body was a very dark , ruby tinted brown . it was almost opaque .
a : very dark brown almost black , with a big tan colored head . wonderful lacing
a : dark reddish brown with a tine white head . small amount of lacing .
a : this is a dark amber/orange color . it pours with a large white head that has good lace and retention .
a : half finger head of very light cream , slight thickness , and bad retention . clear yellow colour . sm : cream . that 's it .
a : cloudy oxidized copper body with not so much a head , as strong fizz . the sides of the glass are covered in small bubbles , not unlike sprite .
a : poured a cloudy citrus lemon bursting with carbonation . one-finger foamy head with lots of lacing . great looking tripel .

appearance : a golden pour with no head , wispy islands of carbonation bubbles float on the surface . i would think this was a tea of some type if i did n't see the carbonation rising in the glass . what lacing ? ? ?
appearance : pours a beautiful hazy honey colored body with a bountiful head that leaves plenty of lace

a : pours a hazy orange/amber with debris floating around . looks like this is probably unfiltered . i got about half a finger of bubbly head that dissipated quickly and low carbonation . n : valencia orange , clementine , caramel and maybe some honey .
a : pours a cloudy translucent yellow , with a thin white head , good retention , light lacing .
a : black color . just over a finger of frothy light brown head . retention is below average , even for the abv and no lacing left behind . 5.0
a : a very light amber almost pink brew . when they said it beet colored they werent joking . has a white , one-finger head that quickly dissipates into a wispy lace . no trail down the glass .

a : bright yellow/goldish color with great transparency , tons of rising carbonation and a nice fluffy white head that leaves really great lacing . head retention is very good as well . the only flaw was the pour had a bit too much carbonation otherwise this is very asthetically appealing
appearance : pours a crystal clear pale yellow straw colour with a tiny white head that vanishes with a blink .
a : great color . deep rusty reddish copper . creamy tan pillows of foam make up the head , which dissipates fairly quickly but leaves behind some intricate lacing . a good looking beer .

a : as beautiful as any stout , with deep brown bordering on black ( only the edges give it away ) , bubbles tumbling together as they rise to give the appearance of floating downward ( a glorious optical illusion ) until they gather at the surface to form a thick head the color of cafe au lait , a head that lingered to the point that 1/4 '' remained at the bottom of my glass after the last drop of beer was gone .

a : fluffy rose pedal bubbles rise like cupcakes over the red valentine body of love . very pretty looking beer , with a dainty femininity to it . pinks and reds , like a sappy love letter . i think i 'm in love . really though , this is truly a great looking beer , i did n't know bubbles could be so pink . i could see some high class drinking sessions where everybody is looking dapper in suits while sipping on this cotton candy headed brew .
appearance : pours a motor oil black right from the pour to the glass . the head is a slight 1/8 '' tall brown color , with little retention and slight lacing .
a : the appearance of this beer is great . a beautiful ruby red color with a thin bubbly head
a : big and frothy looking head along with a rich golden color .
a : pours pitch black , no lighting . a rough pour gets a big ass head in the snifter with some light cascading . nice sticky lacing .
a : pours a hazy purpleish red with a soapy looking white head

appearance : cloudy orange torso that looks like a jar of home-made marmalade . beige head is big and bubbly with some light spotty lacing on the sides . settles with a rather traditional fresh hard-core ipa look .

appearance : absolutely no carbonation and no head remaining after one minute . very light yellow , ultra clear . truly not impressed with this one . the best thing i can say is it does n't have floaties .
a : little hazy yellow color . one finger worth of a pure white head , very effervescent . retention is ok as well as lacing .
appearance : pours a clear yellowish orange color with a very short 1/4 '' head that falls to surface spots immediately , even though the pour was mildly agressive .
appearance : standard yellow , pale ale appearance with minimal head . the carbonation was ok , and i did n't notice lacing , but it may have occured .

appearance : great big pure white head lasts for a long time but does not condense into more liquid volume , giving the impression that it was quite light . lots of co2 is apparent . the beer is a pale yellow-gold
a : poured into a pint glass a dark amber with a thick thick off white head . the head retention is amazing . nice lacing on sides of glass . a mean looking beer .

appearance : deep golden . slight haze ok for this style . fantastic head formation and retention . it stuck around at full volume forever . perfect for an ipa . flavor : citrus , peach , some spicy and floral . i 'm also getting an interesting `` white grape '' flavor . nice malty quality in a fairly dry beer . very balanced but neither the hops or the malt are all that intense . moderate hop bitterness without very much resin . finishes with a nice lasting citrus note . again , reminds me of sn beers .

a : first off there is so much action going on in my sa perfect pint glass . lots of small bubbled carbonation coming up from all sides . 2+ fingers of off white head that 's extremely rocky on top . nice lacing . the color is a nice burnt caramel with exceptional clarity . this beer looks amazing !
a : deep copper . head dissipates pretty rapidly , there is a little bit of lacing but it is very runny .
appearance : seemed pretty clear . the yeast and sediment were weird little flakes that did n't easily stay in suspension when swirled .
a : deep brown beer with a good finger head no lacing .
a : pours a dark reddish brown , with a small white head , but it has excellent retention , and good lacing .
appearance : pours a nice light brown with a decent head , although it dissipated quickly with little to no lacing

appearance : pours out dark brown , almost black , and slightly transparent . slightly thicker than storm king . pour yields a small , medium looking , beige head with decent retention . black body with zero carbonation evident . head quickly fades to a ring only . a minimal ring remains for a while , but looks flat by the end with no lacing down the glass . eventually just looks like flat coke . disappointing .
a : the beer looks great , a bright golden color with a large white head that does lace very well ...
a : golden amber color with a creamy off-white head that leaves a fluffy film of lacing all the way down the glass .
a : pours a dark brown with virtually no head and no lacing ( i can perhaps fault the bar for unclean glasswear , but i could n't raise any real foam on this even with vigorous swirling ) .
appearance : pours a deep burgandy / brown color with a thick three finger tan head . nice lacing develops during the session .
a : pours a clear , golden color that resembles apple juice . it is lightly carbonated and had a non-existent head .
appearance : if held to the light it is deep copper with a kaki colored head , if not , it looks like muddy water .
a : pours golden with slight red hue , one-finger head with snow-white coloring . dissipates quickly leaving no lacing .

a : poured from a bottle to a pint glass . had a jet black color and a thick , opaque consistency . there was a big , creamy , tan-colored , long-lasting head . excellent lacing . an great-looking beer .
a : dark blackish brown . little head with no retention .

appearance : the head was a dark tan head with a reddish tint . the head is foamy and the retention is poor . the color of the beer is dark mahogany with reddish hues . the clarity of the beer is fairly opaque with garnet highlights .

a : a clear golden amber more indicative of a bmc offering than what i think of when i think of a dipa . there is certainly no characteristic head , disappointingly only offering a small thin ring of bubbles around the edge of the glass . overall , very disappointing .
appearance : poured with a nice creamy frothy tan head that dissipated to nothing leaving no lacing . the beer is very dark brown letting a very small amount of light through around the edges .
appearance : nearly flat with no head at all , cloudy tawny color with chunks floating around .
a : pours a cloudy orange with a very light white head , spotty lace .
a : pours a clear copper/orange color . a small white head forms , and recedes in a second . no lace to speak of .
a : black , shallow tight tan head .
a : clear golden and shimmering . thick white head . a perfect looking helles .
a : clear mahogany body capped by a solid inch of dense , creamy tan foam that demonstrates terrific retention and leaves plenty of sticky lace . quintessential brown ale .
appearance : i thought this was a stout ! it could pass as a bock ! thin , ruddy dark brown body with a nougaty beige-white head . good retention . but why is it so thin ? !

a : holy head ! i poured very gently into a slightly wet snifter and the head just grew insanely big ( 3+ fingers big ) . light brown , frothy/foamy , and it did n't recede ... when it finally did start dissipating , it became very pillowy . impressive . body is pitch black . leaves good lacing . so far this is quite the experience ! !

appearance : arrives at the table with a thick black body that extends 3/4 of the way down and sits on top of a clear amber base ; the entire concoction is topped with a creamy foam that sticks and provides plenty of lacing

appearance : near black body with thick rich root beer float looking brown head . extremely dense bubbles make the head appear quite lush . nice retention and lacing . very impressive looking porter .
appearance : dark brown with hints of ruby and amber

appearance : pours a fairly deep coppery color with faint hints of ruby ; starts with a one finger white head that fades quickly to a thin and uneven skim that has some thicker spots here and there ; body is clear ; oily residue and spotty lacing is left on the sides .
