appearance : pours a clear golden-orange color with a small , long-standing white head that leaves a touch of lace .
a : the beer is a light yellow color , its looks like water as it pours out , the head is a large fizzy one ...
a : this maroon color , no head and no lacing .
a : amber-brown with yeasty chunks , light tan head , no retention , slight lace .
a : i was blown away by the completely black body and the killer three-finger dark tan head . impressive head retention and excellent lacing .
appearance : amber-brown color with very small head .
a : standard pour yields a 1 finger coarse off-white head with poor retention . beer is a clear , dark amber . lacing is non-existant . not much to look at .
a : hazy golden color with a massive 3 fingers of pitted white head . some lacing .
a : clear , light amber color with over one finger of white foam head . moderate lacing remains around the top of the glass . occasional bubbles rise lazily in the column .
a : deep reddish-brown body with lots of black sediment floating around ; one finger of coarse white foam that quickly recedesto a frothy ring and leaves minimal lacing . meh .
a : opaque black with a subtle ruby highlight at the bottom of the glass . thick and creamy mocha colored head . great looking stout !

a : poured from a 750ml bottle into a standard pint glass ( wrong glassware , i know ) . the body is a dark brown with a red tint and an airy root beer head . it 's highly carbonated , as belgians tend to be . the head retention is terrific - i do n't know if it 's ever going to reduce to lacing ... .

appearance : poured a very dark brown/black , completely opaque . two finger thick off-white colored head , with downward cascading carbonation in the beer itself for about 20 seconds . excellent head retention and definition . very nice lacing .
a : golden copper/bronze , pours with lots of fluffy white head , some retention , beautiful lace . carefully decanted , but some chunks of yeast made their way into my glass .
a : great looking beer . very dark ruby red color , almost black with red around the edges . one finger tan head which faded quickly . some light lacing .

a : served in a half-pint slim lager glass , it pours an extremely clear , light straw hue , coming with a rocky and fluffy white beer head sustaining extremely well , supported rather well by the semi-fierce carbonation . looking quite enticing and thirst-quenching , like a lager .
a : pours clear copper with a large but aggresively sizzeling tan head . no lacings .

appearance : clear darkish golden body that poured with a very audible fizz as the head immediately formed and appeared , and then subsequently immediately disappeared . finished with no head at all . it looks awful i have to say , flatter than the netherlands and about as appetizing as a big mac to a vegetarian .
a : brown-reddish with a beige lace .
a : huge booming pop when the swing top is released . pours pitch black with health viscosity . huge deep mocha head forms and holds for quite a bit . a bit rocky . nice lacing .

appearance : pours a cler golden color with carbonation flowing to the miniscus of the beer . the head is ever so slightly off-white in color and rise to about 1.5 inches . lots of lace is left on the glass and the head is receeding slowly . the surface is retaining lots of moon-like craters . a good looking beer .
appearance : not impressed . it had shades of pink showing during the pour . pink ! that 's just not on my beer color wheel , i 'm afraid .
appearance : very light yellow , looks almost watered down .
appearance : blackish in color , small tan head that is literally nothing , not alot going on but it 's a porter , so it 's acceptable .

appearance : pours that wonderful to watch nitro-can effect - the foam cascading down the glass slowly clearing up to show a clear dark copper ( with shades of red ) beer with a very persistent and densely thick light tan head , about 1/2 '' thick . big sheets of lacing noted . outstanding looking beer .
appearance : clear copper body with thin , loose , white head . not lacing and very little retention . i might be a little off in this category as it was pretty dark inside .
a : pours a dark amber and crystal clear with a cream colored head that stays for a pretty good amount of time .

appearance : poured into 2 different glasses , one pint glass and one goblet . pitch black with a perfect one inch toffee head . this beer clung to the glass when swirled , leaving a heavy film that took minutes to ooze back down the glass .
appearance : pours a very clear straw colour with weak fizzy head that dissolves in blink , leaving zero lacing . is this really a propeller ?
a : deep brown hue with a frothy beige head .

a : pours a very , very dark brown , almost completely black . when held to light , the tiniest bit of light penetrates only through the top . a medium brown head with very tight bubbles sit on top and stubbornly sticks around most of the glass . minimal lacing left behind .
a : the beer pours an amazingly pale yellow color with a big white head that stays around for a surprising length of time for a light lager .
appearance : golden straw color , clear body . white fluffy head .

appearance : pours a light , slightly hazy golden body with a bit of carbonation racing in there ( phew ! ) . but again same story . thin ring literally disappears in seconds and leaves nothing behind ! even worse that the island red ( if that 's possible ! ) . not good and i dread what 's coming .
a : pours a very pale yellow with a decent fluffy white head the dissipates quickly .

a : it pours a clear maroon / ruby color with burgundy highlights when held to a light . it darkens to opaque in the center , but the edges reveal stunning translucence . no head , no carbonation . of all styles , quads are supposed to have high carbonation . not a good sign .
appearance : poured a dark yellow , zero head retention , clear with lots of bubbles drifting to the top .
a : this was the most gorgeous color of red i have ever seen . i know i should n't judge the color by holding it up to the light , but when i say beautiful ... wow .
a : deep golden color served in a tulip glass , capped with a dense white head that shows great retention
appearance : reddish-mahogany and slightly hazy . 3/4 inch off-white head recedes slowly into a ring of carbonation and surface film . beautiful lacing .
appearance : deep mahogany with a stunning amber highlights and a creamy , craggy head that leaves wonderful lacing . this is a very pretty beer .
a : poured from a nitro-can into a pint glass . starts off as 90 % thick foam on a brown liquid , retains a creamy head even after settling . cool .
a : pours a thin but somehow not totally clear thin light yellow color . a little bit of pure white head that dissipates quickly .

a : the ipa is a brilliant copper color , all shiny and new . the clarity is visually appealing . a foamy head , over two fingers , of craggy foam has left extensive lacing all around the glass . a nice looker .

appearance : pours a modest hazed orange-yellow color beneath a truly enormous , champagne peach-blush white satiny pillow of a head that sparkles like freshly fallen snow . solid and beautiful . excellent retention .
a : probably the best thing about this beer . if this were a lady it would be a `` full on monet '' a la clueless . decent head retention . reddish amber in color

appearance : clear straw to yellow body with a white head . flavor : sweet bready malts with a hint of corn ; probably a very lightly malt . mild hop presence where flavor is concerned , mostly bitterness in the back . floral notes .
a : hardly any head on the pour at all , even with a fairly rapid pour . left minimal lacing on the glass . looks more like a pale ale than a hefe weizen in the glass as far as color and clarity go .
a : dark orange with about a finger of white head that quickly dissipates into a small ring around the top but nothing else . very little lacing .
appearance : red as pomegranate juice , very slight haze , big spongey layer of pink foam , good head retention , some lace
appearance : the colour is pale yellow and i did n't get much of a head and i ca n't say much about the lacing because there was n't any .
a : the fairly typical looking imperial stout ... jet black , brown head , retention is good . there 's not a whole lot more going that makes it stand out from others . s +
a : not much carbonation , arrived with basically no head . cloudy yellow/orange .
a : beautiful deep golden , best feature of this beer
a : deep amber with a fluffy , off-white head . plenty of head , retention and lacing . could n't ask for more .

a : first time i 've had this on tap , and i was very impressed by the cascading foam effect from the nitrogen . one finger of nice whipped cream style head , which settles pleasantly atop an almost opaque , dark brown body .

a : pours a one finger head of fair cream and thickness , and okay retention . colour is a dark copper . sm : amber hops and other bittering hops . perhaps too many hops for the balance ? a decent aroma .
a : dark cocoa body with a mocha head . looks promising !
appearance : this was one nasty pour , murky orange-peach mississippi gumbo of yeast and some other particulate matter .
appearance : moderate pour yields a 3/4 inch head that dissipates steadily and leaves sparse lacing . pours a very hazy yellow , and leaves no lacing .
a : looks like an orange soda in many ways , with a short and fizzly head . it has a bit of murkiness that gives it a beer quality .
a : pours a nice clear reddish color with a foamy light tan head . a few carbonation bubbles present .
a : fuzzy yellow with a nice white head .

appearance : disappointing head , not sure what to expect from a 4.4 % beer from stone ( who knew they made such a sessionable beer ? ) color , however , is perfect for an amber . this looks like a tamer version of arrogant bastard .

appearance : lovely smooth pour that revealed a very dark brown body , huge amounts of natural dissolved carbonation demonstrated that this was properly cask-conditioned beer as opposed to just being a racked off beer from a cask . nice . a smooth creamy light brown head formed slowly as the carbonation settled down . excellent lacing forms as the beer is imbibed . fantastic presentation .
a : pours almost straw-colored with a really tall white compact head that quickly sinks into decent lacings .
appearance : big chunks of tan foam stick to the glass , lace thins out a bit but the retention is great . the pitch black colour lets no light through .
a : cloudy golden yellow ; very think head ; light carbonation ; no lacing

appearance : black pour with a huge , creamy light cocoa head that settles very slowly and has outstanding retention . this beer leaves many many rings of lace all the way down the glass . an aggressive pour shows off this beer 's deep , penetrating , cascading head . very nice .
a : clear golden body with two inches of creamy white head . good retention and moderate lacing .
a : this hazy , dark amber brew was highly overcarbonated , requiring several pour-and-waits and leaving a mountain of billowy , tan foam but very little lacing .
a : pours light golden with a few , but large bubbles in the liquid . a small white head dissipates rather fast , leaving only little lacings .
appearance : less then inspiring head , virtually no lacing . clear reddish brown in color .
appearance : slightly hazy amber color with a half finger of white head .
a : dark red in color with a nice two finger head and fantastic lacing
a : light translucent amber with a slowly dissipating three finger head that settles to a nice and frothy single head . lacing present throughout .
a : black , tan head , very little retention .
a : very little head . dirty brown/orange color . no lacing . not impressed in the least .
a : half finger tan-colour head of very poor retention ( especially considering the low abv ) . dark red colour . sm : overpowering raspberry scent . pleasant .
a : i poured it into a tullip glass - dark brown with a thick creamy off-white head that takes a while before it dissipates leaving a nice crater and then nice lacings .
a : absolutely gorgeous amber with a slight haze . huge , chunky head . bubbles streaming up from the bottom of my dfh signature glass .
a : it poured as black as ink with a moderate one finger head consisting of massive bubbles that receded fast to a slight ring around the collar . there was little lacing .
a : black color . this is n't really much of a looker due to the head though . i only managed to form about one finger and it fell quickly . i think it was beige . 4.5
a : hazy golden in color . about a fingers worth of head that dissipates to a nice ring ... . no lacing .
a : pitch black , ink like brew with very thin almost faint tan/brown head . very imposing like a woman scorned .
appearance : pale , clear yellow , nothing special , huge head
a : two fingers of creamy head . the beer is dark brown in the shade and a clear , brilliant red in the light . some bubbles within . looks great !

a : the darkest pumpkin ale i 've ever seen . i mean really ... . wow ! it looked dark brown coming out of the bottle , but once collected in the glass , it 's maybe a shade or so lighter than pitch black . the head is marshmallowy and clingy .

appearance : luscious golden body with a perfect head . inch skim lasts the entire lifespan of the beer and lacing is simply marvelous all around the glass . i think the shape of the tulip has as much to do with this as the beer itself . it just looks great .
a : pours a dark , murky brown . poured aggressively , but did n't get a lot of head . hardly any carbonation . dissapointing really in terms of appearance .
a : poured a black , smooth liquid . thick as is to be expected of its brew , but not disgusting like mud . foamy tan head followed .
a : pours black with no head after a hard pour .
a : straw to yellow , very cloudy with a small whitish head that dissipates rather quickly ( which is uncharacteristic for this style ) .
a : pours a fairly dark brown with some copper hues to it . no head and no lacing .
a : the beer is a light yellow color , with a short white head that fades very quickly and leaves a spotty lace on the glass .
appearance : pours a hazy bronze-colored body with a thin , small white head . virtually no lacing to speak of .
appearance : kind of a purpley-red with a pinkish head . not very traditional , but we 're talking about a fruit beer here .
a : pours reddish amber color , 2 finger width frothy white head , good lacing down the glass
appearance : an effervescent , crystal-clear and amazingly pale straw body capped by a little less than a finger of white head that fizzes out quickly and leaves no lacing .
a : very pale yellow color with a tiny head that dissipates almost instantly .

a : a vigorous pour straight down the middle produces a sky-high off-white head that perfectly fills the oversized tulip glass . beneath lies an appropriately hazy , reddish orange body that sports lively carbonation . as the rocky 3 '' head slowly recedes it leaves tons of lace . in summation , gorgeous - far better looking that i ever expected .
a : poured cloudy with a deep yellow hue into a sturdy clear plastic cup . the appearance is similar to a hefeweizen , rather than what i come to expect from a well crafted made dipa .

appearance : a clear gold yellow with a minimal head and no lacing . smells : a super sweet hop character with a presence on alcohol . tastes : a super sweet imperial . the hop notes are out of the world in this ale with a candied citrus hint that leaves a wonderful finish .

a : pours a nice copper color , showing moderate carbonation with tiny bubbles . quite clear . absolutely no head , which is really the only flaw ( although not a minor one ) in the visual presentation .
a : dark brown body with an extremelly small to no tan head that dissipates quickly . holding up to the light , one can get a ruby highlight as well .
a : thin head ; light orangish brown ; a bit , but only , of lacing
appearance : a very attractive barleywine , with a hazy amber color and a head that retains nicely , while depositing a lot of lace

a : the best thing ( the good thing ? ) about the guinness nitro-widget-can is the visual of pouring it into a glass , a process that allows me to recreate the draft- pour experience . like pushing the plunger down on a french press batch of coffee , the double or triple pour -- and the dance between bubbles and liquid -- is very much part of the guinness experience . the nitro widget also leads to awesome head retention . the color was a few steps off opaque ( a hint of red-brown ) , but not by much . and then . . .
appearance : deep dark amber colored . with tan head . no lacing
a : standard pour creats a 1.5 finger coarse white head with poor retention . beer is a clear , straw-yellow . lacing is patchy and rises like the tides . does n't stick around though .

appearance : a crystal clear , light golden ale served with one and a half inches on tight , white head . tons of blanket-like lace and excellent head retention - especially for a trippel ! abundant visible carbonation throughout the tasting .
a : beautiful beer . pours with lots , albeit thin , head that hugs the glass on the way down . crystal clear and a crisp copper color . yum .
a : gentle pour yields a 1 finger , dense , off-white head that sits , immovable , atop the brew . beer is a semi-clear ruby red . lacing is thick , frothy , and ringed with great stick .
appearance : pale gold orange with lots of head .

appearance : a bit of a gusher with a massive mocha-colored head filling 3/4 of the glass . creamy and bubbling . the light brown pour belies the actual color which is an opaque brown with a slight cherry wood color on the bottom . chunks of lacing cling to the glass . lookin ' nice !

a : pours quite clear , bright golden yellow with a thickish head held up and together with some surprisingly significant hoppiness . head fades but some lacy hemming around the rims of the glass remains .
appearance : a very clear , amber , a decent off-white head with moderate head retention..

appearance : poured from a 12oz bottle into a large wine glass . the color of this one is a very murky , dark amber/brown . not much head to speak of and very little carbonation . there is also quite a bit of sediment in the glass ( which i do n't mind ) . but what i do mind is the large loogie looking thing floating in my glass . i 'm not sure if it is a one-batch anomaly , but there is seriously a tan , quarter-sized globule in my beer that looks like it came from the recesses of the lungs of an 80 year-old smoker .
appearance : light yellow with lots of carbonation .
a : pours an unappealing clear yellow , with a small white head
a : just like in the bottle , medium honey color . thin , filmy , uninspiring head . nice ice sheet lacing .

a : possibly the lightest colored beer i have ever seen . this is extremely comparable to slightly dirty water or extremely diluted apple cider vinegar . a rather large head appeared and maybe crisp bubbling noises as it quickly disappeared .

a : pours a hazy honey-citrus orange with a huge , billowing , dense , white collar head that kept increasing in size after i finished pouring my glass . the top of the head became firm like meringue and stayed as a dollop of cream on top of the beer the whole bottle through . a ton of very sticky lacing was left down the glass as well .
a : rusty , copper tone . hardly any head , but it leaves a hint of lace .

a : pours a hazy copper color with gold highlights when held to a lamp . a two-finger off-white head recedes into a filmy collar on top of the brew , leaving thick lacing down the glass in its wake . a beautiful appearance .
a : amber-gold ale with slight haziness . less than single finger head of coarse , tightly packed bubbles retires to a thin sheet of the same . spotty lacing .

appearance : pours a thoroughly hazed tangerine peach , with ( unusually ) one large stream of fast , densely-packed carbonation moving not nearly as fast as i would expect from a beer with this much head . that is , the beer looks it 's gon na be a thick one , but given the haziness of the whole thing , it 's neither a pro nor a con of the appearance . what 's truly fantastic about this beer is what 's truly fantastic about any quality saison - the head . it 's understandably explosive , requiring several of even the gentlest pours to get enough beer in this glass to get a proper review off of . at its height , it 's incredibly sticky , bulbous , rocky , clingy , & lt ; insert other appropriate adjectives here & gt ; . it fades at a snail 's pace , taking a good ten minutes to fade down to a mere ( stylistically ) half-finger . it 's white , dense , cloud-like , and leaves huge patches and swaths of thin , dry lacing . even on the `` sip '' side of the glass it clings admirably despite constant interruption , leaving dozens of flecks and remnants .
a : poured a deep wine purple with a half finger head and light sticky lacing left on the glass

a : pours a vigorous 1 finger light orange , cream colored fluffy head with excellent retention . brew itself is clear reddish brown and highly carbonated . lacing is stringy but ample and really sticks around .

appearance : black with mahogany highlights . tan head doesnt have much oomph to it ; reduces to a paper thin cap with very little if any lace , but that cap stuck around to the end . flavor : mmmmm right off that bat i really like this one . milk chocolate is really present without being annoying and making me think i grabbed a carton of the stuff . nice balance of the bitter aspect of the black patent and the sweet malt . burnt toast in the middle , and a dry finish with a little bit of green hops . very smooth character . wish it were a little more carbonated than it was , though . seems a little flat at the end .
a : pours a dark brown with a nice finger of tan colored head .
a : unfortunately i let this one cool too long and came close to freezing it , but had the copper/amber color and a nice head that lasted with a hazy clarity
a : hazy peach-gold with substantial 2-3 finger , off-white foamy head with craggy lacing all over the glass .
a : pours a dark brown with some edge translucence . a fluffy , light tan head that cascades beautifully into the body as it recedes . tons of sticky lace .
appearance : very good . pours a nice murky brown with very nice brown frothy head and ample lacing .
appearance : clear golden yellow in color with a thick and fluffy 3 '' head . moderate lacing paints the glass .
appearance : pours a somewhat brownish color that is semi-transparent . had a small head despite vigorous pour .
a : it poured a bright yellow with a ting of ruby , a bone-white head and nice lacing .

a : pours a beautiful amber with crimson center that just makes you stop to admire . the head is huge , then settles down to half a finger with perfect lacing . this is the best `` looking '' beer i think i 've ever seen .
a : nice dark orange color . very clear . fluffy off white one finger head with awesome retention and lacing .

appearance : black as night , with a nice tan head that faded , but remained , but wasn & # 8217 ; t up to the long haul . flavor : outstanding balance , while the hops are clearly present , they don & # 8217 ; t pucker , and the malt , while substantial , doesn & # 8217 ; t over-sweeten . nice roasted malt and chocolate flavors blend into everything a stout should be ; bold , but dry ; rich , but mellow . the hops started to assert themselves deeper into the beer as it warmed .

a : pours a mostly clear golden-amber body . 1-1/4 '' lightly creme colored head fades slowly . carbonation bubbles are almost non existent , only one or two tiny ones rise slowly now and then in the glass .

a : good thing appearance is n't everything as this beer is just plain ugly , unlike any other beer i 've ever seen . it 's a cloudy , murky , even opaque , yet it 's color is a pale yellow almost beige . small head and some lacing present .
a : bright straw body topped with a loose two-finger head that quickly dissipates leaving no lacing and only a bubbly ring of cover .
a : reddish color , looks like a bloody mary
a : a pale bubbly yellow with slight cloudiness . a vigorous pour produces only a small amount of white head that quickly reduces to a small island .
a : pours a deel golden/copper color that is cloudy with plenty of floating yeast bits . has a thick foamy head that is a nice milky white . leave considerable amount of lacing
a : very light blond with a slight yeast haze , big head , great retention & lacing .
appearance : cloudy dark brown with big fluffy tan head and decent lacing . only real detractor is huge chunks of yeast from overzealous pour
appearance : pours a light pale yellow color that almost looks clear on the outside of the glass . a few bubbles ride the surface .
appearance : very pale gold color , almost yellow . a bit of yeast cloudiness which fits the style . large creamy head that lasts a while .

a : cloudy orange with not much head and even less lacing . the unfiltered aspect makes it look good . have to note- these av bottles make it hard to buy these sometimes . n : hops and bitter grapefruit as the appearance would indicate . laden with west coast characteristics and sweetness . diverse .

appearance : opens with a swich and erupts rom the bottle so we are forced to pour quickly until the beer can control itsef . the beer is semi transparent and hazy orange with an off white cakey head . the head is quite thick and demonstrative , with plenty of cloudy pillows . very nice .

a : this is far and away the lightest double bock i have ever seen . i was convinced upon the pour that the beer was in the wrong bottle . pale gold/straw color with good clarity . thin head with minimal lacing . this scores really low since it is not to style .
a : pours a relatively thick black under a small brown head . almost no retention , no lace .

a : for those wondering - micro-carbonation appears to be a process that makes the bubbles smaller , they actually appear to be undetectable to the human eye since the beer actually looks flat ; take a sip however and there is indeed carbonation there . the head dissipates quickly of course and leaves no lacing . the beer itself is fairly amber for a macro adjunct lager .

appearance : deep , clear amber colored pour . a sticky white head that retains reasonably well . flavor : carmel malt notes up front . an earthy , spicy hop bitterness to balance . some darker fruit notes in the background . balance is nearly even . finish is clean and dry .
appearance : amber/orange with a thin white head . crystal clear . looks good !
a : murky brownish apricot , really not the most appetizing color in the world . no head , low carbonation evident .
appearance : pours to a light colored amber with a white , week head that quickly dissapears .
a : golden yellow . light carbonation . white fluffy head which almost disappears as fast as it forms . still looks tasty .
appearance : pours out a cloudy , sufficiently yellow-hued body underneath a tall , dense , near white head with steadfast retention . why , it 's positively elegant-looking .
appearance : 5 |

appearance : poured a viscous , sludgy black with little in the way of head , carbonation or lacing ; the 4oz . sampler i had on tap down at stone 's 7th anniversary showed a beautiful , cascading , cocoa-brown head with lots of lacing and good to very good retention ; it is upon the latter experience that i have graded this beer 's appearance ; bottled version would merit a 2.5 .
a : clear yellow with no head . very carbonated .
a : black coffee , no carbonation , half finger head .
a : its a hazy bright dark straw color , not quite as dark as an orange , but darker than straw . no head to speak of .
a : clear , amber , nice head of fine , creamy consistency . good retention .
a : pours a hazy yellowish orange . quickly fading creamy white head .
appearance : poured a reddish amber , with a one finger tan head . good head retention and sticky lacing . clear with a hint of cloudiness and some minimal visible carbonation .
a : very deep mahogany . as dark as some porters . clarity is a quite good . a small and fizzy nougat head comes and goes quickly . leaves no lace .
a : deep strawberry/cherry juice color . very clean and opaque . nice billowy off white head in standard belgium style . seriously great looking beer .
a : clear straw color with tiny whte head that dissapates quickly . highly carbonated .
a : pours clear and copper , nearly flat
a : terrible . pours like piss in a glass . really bad - has white foam - definitely not worthy of calling it head .
a : virtually no head , no lacing , bright golden yellow .
a : nice golden color , fully translucent . head is white and soapy . poor retention and lacing .
a : hazy copper with one finger head . good retention and lacing .
a : superbe couleur rafrachissante entre le ros et l'orange , contiennait normment de dpt de levure et/ou glatine ( assez grosses particules ) . recouverte d'une fabuleuse mousse paisse assez durable
a : poured tan with a 2 finger head and a very slight haze . impressive lacing held on to the pint glass it was in .

a : ruby red coloring with a white head that has just a tint of red . head is less than one finger and soon gone , but there is active carbonation and a little lacing . beer is dark and a little hazy , not at all crisp looking .
appearance : cloudy blonde with a bone white head and great lacing . just like a wheat beer should look , with the exception of what looks to be relatively low carbonation for the style .

a : pours a tiny white ring atop a clear orange-red brew . no real head and no retention . no lacing either . rather flat-looking overall if it were n't for the ample bubbles seen rising from the depth .

appearance : pours a pretty cloudy burnt orange color with a 1 '' head of off-white bubbles that was thick and creamy and looked like it was n't going anywhere anytime soon . on the side of my glass , i can see that there are numerous bubbles rising to maintain the head , and it does . a couple minutes after the pour there was no significant difference in the height of the head . there is a ton of thick lace left on the glass after drinking the beer . if it was a bit more clear , this would be a well presented beer .
a : a rich golden-yellow color with a small , foamy white head that settles to just a few bubbles of lace on the top . no lacing and poor head retention .

a : pours a cloudy amber body with orange tones against the light . has a fairly generous 2 inches of head with pretty good retention , taking between 5-10 minutes to collapse into a lighter cap on top of the brew before i can start drinking . thick scoops of lace down the sides from the head , and light register marks as i sip .
appearance : poured with a foamy off white head that dissipated leaving no lacing . the beer is clear with an orange golden color .
a : pours a clear , brown body with hints of amber . a massive 1-1/4 '' head nearly overflowed the glass , and seemed to take forever to fade to a thick film .
appearance : pours a hazy dark red-brown . not much head . some scant leggy lacing . really a very boring looking beer .
appearance : pours into pint glass a copper/amber color , not translucent somewhat hazy , with a thin white head , thinck creamy lacing .

appearance : perfectly brown and translucent with a huge , creamy head that leaves generous lacing . it has the color of maple syrup . the head is quite resilient and stays for nearly the whole glass .

appearance : a light gold in color , it was also crisp and transparent . the word i wrote in my notes on the phone was `` gorgeous '' . a nice , thin , but full layer of head provided a pretty white cap on top . lacing was minimal .
appearance : cloudy . small tan head that leaves quick .
appearance : very dark chocolate in color , looks almost like root beer with a minimal creamy tan head
a : straw , pale , no head .
a : golden , clear yellow . fast fade head .
appearance : crystal clear sunset orange . a little lacing from a thin , pure-white head .

a : clear , dark gold with a fluffy , clean white head and great retention to go with very good lace . i 'll make a note that this must have the straightest/cleanest break from beer to head that i 've ever seen . 4.5/5
appearance : this ris looks amazing . a perfect layer of creamy light brown head sit on top of the opaque body .

a : the appearance is red/brown solid with a big fluffy head . the slow head retention is nice and slow . plenty of time to enjoy the picture . if you drink it down a little you can see the mass amounts of lace on your glass .
a : pours a slightly hazy straw color with a thin fizzy head that dissipates into pretty much no head . no lacing , moderately active carbonation .
a : this is my second weizenbock that i tried and in comparation with aventinuz weizenbook this is in appearance much lighter , so i lprefere the aventinus appearance . one inch head
a : pours a translucent golden/light amber color . very little amount of head on the brew
a : dark copper color , did n't have much of a head at all
a : pours hazy amber with an enormous tan head that slowly sinks into quite nice lacings .
a : turbid , golden amber . no head to speak of from my bottle .
a : fucking gorgeous . a finger and a half of head -- creamy and tight . a beautiful red ; dark and darkly clear . nice scattered lacing .
a : a lightly carbonated appearance for a saison with minimal lacing . a ruddy orange color throughout .
a : pouring pitch black and impenetrable to light , this beer started with a 1cm head that settled to a lumpy thin layer across the entire beer
a : 1 finger head , amber color .
appearance : hazy , light gold colored beer . lots and lots of floating sediment . this bottled was handled and poured properly . yet ... tons of sediment . not to thrilled here .
a : bright yellow . heavy carbonation pours into a half finger , bubbly , white head . dissipates quickly into a smattering of bubbles . substantial carbonation continues to rise . no lacing .

appearance : poured a slightly opaque medium golden-amber with a sticky , foamy 1.5 finger head . the opaqueness dissapated a bit after a few minutes , but did n't dissapear altogether , and the head began to recede after a minute or two leaving a light lacing around the top . as far as the pour was concerned , things were looking pretty good .
appearance : it 's darker than coffee . the nitrogen helps it to produce an awesome brew to look perfect . i loved it to pour and to watch its great neck .
a : pours blonde , with a smallish white head , no lacing , fair retention .
a : perfect . black as the deepest parts of the depths of the ocean . thick 2 inch mocha colored head that slowly fades .
a : pours a rusty amber color with a thin , bone-white head that dissipates quickly . not much in the way of lacing .

appearance : not the most vigorous pour , but this beer produced hardly any head . even worse the retention had to be sub 50 seconds producing 0 lacing . golden color , cloudy with what i hope is yeast . bubbly , but not appearing to be too carbonated . not even the slightest bit of a lacing when agitated .
appearance : baby diarrhea or bilge water ( take your pick ) - either is unappealing to drink ; but big beautiful beige head compensates a little

appearance : colour of the beer is a murky brown with amber edges . carbonation creates a hissing noise as the beer is poured into the cup . flat head ... a bit of a dissapointment , but i do remember it being much better when i ordered it at 't brugs beertje in belgium .
a : ruddy copper with a finger of light yellow foam . this falls to a broken sheet of the same . spotty lace .
a : orange honey like cloudy appearance . poured into a weizen glass and developed an inch head of bright white fine foam that dissipated in about two minutes .
appearance : pale gold-straw color , clear . a little carbonation . thin head .
appearance : straw gold and clear with about 2 fingers of head . a slow dissipation leaves a thick lacing .
a : coppery , clear , no head at all , even after a fairly aggressive down-the-middle pour . there is also no lacing to speak of . thus far , i am not impressed .
a : reddish brown opaque beer with tan head . the head looks creamy , has really good retention and lacing .
a : murky deep honey color that is darker towards the top . finger and a half white fluffy head . chunks of white lacing .

a : this beer pours a bright , just off white head that fills up the entire glass before revealing a golden white body of beer with lots of active carbonation beneath it that slowly transitions to a stiller , golden color while the head remains bright white . it leaves a nice lace and is very clear . if the head would stay around a little more , i 'd be happier 4.5
a : deep black with a deep garnet through a light . thick tan head appears .
appearance : the appearance of this beer is phenomenal . a full cherry copper color with a rich , creamy white head . sheets of lace have great cling .
a : a very , very light golden , honestly just a bit darker than mainstream american lager . next to no head , with some lacing .
a : pale , quite a clear beer ... the chili added to the bottle causes a rather unusual , sharp bubbling . the head forms incredibly fizzly and immediately recedes to nothing .

appearance : this beer poured a clear amber that had just enough red highlights to be called copper colored . the off-white head rose up to two fingers easily . it lingered quite awhile , slowly dissipating and becoming dense and fluffly . as it sank back into the beer , it clung heavily to the side of the glass . there was some light lacing left behind as i drank .
appearance : pours a crystal clear , bronze-colored head with a rather brief , white head .
a : pours an extremely dark ruby red with a couple fingers of rather fizzy head that bubbled away into a faint collar . rather active carbonation in this one .
a : pours a bright golden yellow color with a thick tight 2 finger foam head with long lasting retention . there is lots of lacing all down the side of the glass .
a : a dark brown , which shines ruby red when held up to the light . there 's a 1 finger foamy head that sticks around for a bit , with decent lacing .
a : pours a clear light copper color . good 2 fingers worth of head that settles quickly to a small ring with no real lacing to speak of .
a : very golden color with mild carbonation . a little less carbonation than i 'd expect from the `` champagne of beers '' .

appearance : looks like flat cola . very thin and somewhat transparent . no head , even when swirled . obviously no lacing either . looks downright terrible . worst looking oatmeal stout i 've ever come across .

a : looks like corona . and pee ( same sh*t , right ? ) . golden yellow/orange , clear liquid . worthless yellowish head that foams up a lot when pouring and disappears quickly , like soda . does n't start out too well ...
a : 0 carbonation , more of a dark ruby than actually opaque , pours thick , but with no head whatsoever
a : this beers pours thin for a porter . it is a dark brown that has red hues .
a : pours a nice pale orange , with a huge , white , puffy head , with great retention , and nice sticky lacing .

a : no real head at all . it 's possible it disappeared from the pour to my table . colour is a dark caramel-ruby . sm : caramel , toasted malt , and maybe light citrus ester hops . a mild strength aroma .
a : thin head , little carbonation , no lacing
appearance : served in a brookyln shaker pint , extremely dull pale yellow - looks almost like lemonade
a : light yellow with a slight haze , white head , very little retention , no lacing ( where 's the protein ? ) .

a : wow . the only beer i can think of that pours like this is gonzo porter by flying dog ... it 's very thick and looks just like motor oil . even more shocking is the coffee-colored three-finger head that followed , although maybe it 's just because it 's an unbelievably fresh bottle that had quite a bit of energy packed behind a too-easy-to-get-out cork . quite the specimen .
a : robust pile of thick and espresso like head , the color reminds me of slightly tarnished copper , obvious lacing - 4.50 ,

a : yeugh . lots and lots of little floaties . i know they are n't bad for me , but they still make for an ugly beer . tall , pillowy white seafoam head crowns the top of this hazy honey-colored brew . lots of lacing around the rim of the glass .
a : pours a very effervescent beige head on a seemingly opaque dark brown body . retention is outstanding , with a thick cap on the beer and tons of sticky lace down the sides of the glass .
appearance : pale almost orange transparent , very thin head .
appearance : looks very pale , as if it was watered down . has the carbonation of most club sodas .

a : pours a nice looking pint . a moderate pour gives a 1.5 '' of ivory head that barely crests the rim of the glass . brew has a hazy honey appearance . head settles to almost nothing , just a meniscus clinging to the glass . lace is n't worth mentioning .

a : i knew this would be a gusher and it still took 3 glasses to hold this monster back . dogfish super glass comically oversized dogfish tulip and an ithaca pint glass . 12 ? fingers of slightly tan head . the beer itself is a nice looking deep burnt rusty brown color . tons of visible carbonation .
appearance : crystal clear , off white perfect to the style .
a : light golden in color with damn near no head .
a : awesomely pitch black with a thick 1 inch off-white head that fades at a decent pace . very good .
a : pours a brilliant clear gold , foamy white head , lots of lacing , great retention
a : pours medium yellow with a good sized head that settled quickly . very little lacing .
a : very drak brown with clumpy tan 2 finger head and plenty of lace .

appearance : a dark brown that reminds me of fender 's tobacco-burst design when it catches the light , albeit with more ruby hues . low/medium viscosity , with medium visibility . poured without a head , and very little lacing , though i suspect this had to do with the frosty glass provided by the establishment .
appearance : pale yellow with a small , somewhat retaining head .

a : pours a nice very dark black color reminiscent of a stout but it does show dark mahogany colors when held to the light , the head is about a half inch high but it comes down fairly quickly leaving a good amound of lacing
a : looks like a dark liquor poured into a pale beer . terrible and unattractive .
a : pours a clear light golden with an enormously billowing bright white head that slowly faded into a rocky film that left chunks of sticky lacing down the glass .
appearance : transparent with a great deal of carbonation . color is similar to that of ginger ale . head dissipates rather quickly .
appearance : pale yellow , minimal white head . looks like a light commercial beer almost .
appearance : draught served up with less than one finger of foam which dissapated within two minutes . slight lacing remains on brim of straight-side libby pint glass .
appearance : murky amber with a finger of tan head .
a : dirty brown with tiny white head . has a bunch of impurities that float around .

a : unfortunately , quite unimpressed . head was more fizzly like a soda may be and withered away to nothing quite quickly . brew itself is almost a cola colour , with more of a dark red & brown hue to it . that said , it 's the only attribute i was n't fond of .
a : a bold sienna with an enormous foamy head . leaves thick rings of lace on the glass .

appearance : pours a dark , dark brown , almost black - just a hint of light shines through at the bottom of the glass . three fingers of off-white head that dissipates slowly and leaves ton of lacing . as this type of beer should look .

a : gorgeous bright red . it 's astoundingly lovely - i can easily say that i 've seen a beer quite like it . a generous pour yields a 1.5 finger flaming pink head that looks like strawberry ice cream . the retention and lacing are top notch .
a : thin but creamy head . the colour is the darkest brown and opaque on the desk , but when held up to the light , it is translucent and brilliantly ruby-coloured . gorgeous !
a : : very clear deep copper in the glass . thick one finger head reduces to a thin white film with some lacing .
appearance : disappointing head , and unusually clear golden straw color .
a : pale yellow color , fully transluscent , insane amount of head , pure white and frothy with tons of lacing .

a : from a 750ml bottle with the usual lovely dwarf character reaping hops . very colorful design with a graphic depiction of the hops varieties used ( amarillo has a sombrero and so on ... ) . served into a la chouffe tulip . poured straw yellow with big crazy bubbles dancing all up to the massive cloudy head that sticks like cotton candy during the whole drinking session . amazing . *edit : actually more in the hues of golden yellow . will never review appearance with a computer screen as only light source ever again !
a : somewhere between straw and golden , slightly hazy . white head was n't around long , leaving just a tiny thin strip of lacing behind .
a : a very rich , deep amber.. clear , with nice white head.. a very pretty beer .
a : it pours a rusty nail brown with no evidence of carbonation . the beer is pretty murky at this point in its life , but i can still pick out some deep amber hues in the light .
a : pours a slightly hazy yellow-gold with half a finger of white head that quickly recedes into almost nothing with no lacing .
a : excellent clear amber under a pretty large head after a vigorous pour . good head retention and excellent lace .
a : hazy wheat-yellow , very little head and a thin ring . milky , but a little carbonation shows in the waning sunlight . fuller in the center , less opaque at the edges . small flecks of lace .
appearance : this beer poured a yellow hue with a bright white head that only stood up roughly one inch high and settled at a quarter inch . lots of beading inside and no much lace to speak of .
a : clear straw with white head , decent foam stand .
appearance : pours a clear amber color with a gorgeous head that sheets the pint glass with lace
a : poured a deep coppr/reddish color with a small white head that disappeared quickly .

appearance : pours dark brown and yields a small , dark tan or mocha colored head that appears out of nowhere . head fades relatively quickly to a wisp and ring . black body , though relatively transparent , with medium carbonation evident . a ring remains until the end and leaves touches of lacing down the glass .

a : clear , slightly hazy ( we 'll see whether or not that clears up when the beer warms , it remains hazy ) copper and golden amber , topped with a loosely packed , sandy white , half an inch head that fades into some lattice work lacing and a sort of spotty cap of a head . no lacing to speak of apart from a few specks here and there .

appearance : beautiful mezmorizing cascading effect . a 1+ finger thick looking tan head forms with great retention . beer is opaque and pitch black with no carbonation evident . a thick head remains and leaves lots of thick lacing down the glass . looks great , though i prefer a white head on my nitro stouts .
a : pours pitch black color , no head whatsoever .
appearance : black with a hint of copper . dark tan head that last a good while . flavor : sweetness on the tongue . chocolate and toffee flavors . moves to a dry finish and a caramel after taste .
a : lightly hazy , raisin juice colored ale . off white carbonation barely clings to life at the around the ring of the glass .
a : a great looking beer . a golden blond hue that pours with a thick white head . visibly effervescence . sticky lacing .

a : it pours a clear , dark copper hue , coming with a stunning , nice and frothy off-white beer head ( poured w/o a sparkler ) that lasts throughout the drink , and leaves extremely tight lacing curtains as it goes .

a : pours out a viscous tar black body seriously , if molasses was more molten , it would look like this . half finger head that looks like hot chocolate textured by a frothing wand rises quickly then fades .
a : clear , brassy golden color with one finger of white foam head . heavy step-wise lacing remains on the glass and a few solitary bubbles rise in the column .
appearance : a touch lighter than most octobers , coppery amber for sure , but leaning towards a dried apricot hue . little head to speak of , and the least amount of lacing or collar .
a : deep copper/amber color . opaque . weak head and head retention . quite unpleasant looking for a tripel .
a : pours a beautiful black that has a wonderful bubbly light brown display that turn into the creamy head of tiny tiny bubbles . one nice looking beer .

appearance : the white head exploded up to a whole four fingers as i poured this beer into my pilsner glass . as it settled down , it became a little fluffy and chunky . it took a long time to finally dissipate and left some nice chunks of foam on the side of the glass in its wake . also , a number of little floaties remained until i had finished the drink . those were all qualities that i found strange considering that this is a lager . the golden yellow liquid that sat below the foam had just a hint of haze to it and a relatively light bead .
a : half a finger of slight cream , decent thickness , and bad retention . semitransparent dark copper colour . sm : cream , pleasant hops , and caramelized malt . a moderate strength aroma .
a : incredibly pale yellow . as with many other light lagers , the appearance is incredibly reminiscent of water . there is a fluffy white head , initially , which quickly disappears .
a : pours a slightly hazy yellow , with not that much of head , fizzy bubbles at best , not cloudy enough for a wit as well .
a : appropriately opaque pale orange body topped by a finger of dense , creamy ecru head . great retention , solid lace . perfect looking witbier , and the proper glassware really seals the deal .
a : not much for a head , translucent slightly dark yellow . ca n't see any rising carbonation .
a : pours a dark reddish/orange color . a two finger head forms and recedes to a small cap . not much lace is left behind .
a : pours a light golden color with plenty of carbonation . pours with two fingers of frothy head and leaves a considerable amount of lacing .
appearance : well , you do n't see too many that look like this . a pink-tinged peach with a slighly rose colored head . fair retention . slightly cloudy with mild carbonation .

appearance : my wife bought me a case of this one at our favorite local distributor , in-n-out . the guys there are very knowledgeable and recommended this one to her and am i glad . this beer poured a beautiful thick frothy two finger head . as i drank the beer it got more impressive with amazing sticky lace . the side of the glass became covered from top to bottom . the color was a very clear orangish amber .
appearance : ruby brown with good clarity , a thin head of creamy coffee left no lace . flavor : over ripe apples , belgian banana , spiced apple and a hint of farm cider . fruity and rich in flavor
a : pours out a slightly hazy , orangish hue , with no head . there is no carb left in this beer .
a : pours a deep , clear copper-cola color . the medium sized head has a light brownish-tan tint and a modestly dense , foamy texture . retention is middling , with a few rings of decent lacing .

a : there are n't many things in the world of beer as delightful as the cascading nitro guinness . the `` waterfall '' . a clean and filtered brew much the color of dark cola . this beer does n't generate little streams of bubbles like a stand co2 beer will . the head is is a wonderfull khaki , smooth and creamy .
a : nice looking pour . not as dark as the one i recently had on tap . thick creamy off-white head .
appearance : pours oily black with a thick , chunky tan head that has ruby edges .
appearance : a dark body with a mocha head that fills half of the tulip . looks delicious to be honest .
a : pours a deep shoe leather brown , opaque . about a finger worth of light khaki head forms and holds nicely . decent lacing .
a : way too light to be an ipa . looks like a lager .
a : pours with no head ? dark , though not opaque . expecting way more for a 7.5 % stout
a : nice copper color to the body . nice-sized tan head , but it takes off rather quickly and does n't leave much behind .
a : pours an opaque black with a tight tan head , which leaves nice lacing behind .
a : amber color with small half-finger 's head that did n't last too long . not too impressive , so given its reputation , i blame myself for a bad pour .
appearance : an ugly beer , low alcohol or not . jaundiced pale yellow with a weak , white head and sparse carbonation .
appearance : the pour is a murky apple cider color with faded straw yellow edges . a small frothy off-white collar fades to nothing and leaves no lace .

a : pours a deep golden/light amber , quite clear but rich , with a huge , fluffy head that sticks to the sides of the glass . i pour about half the bottle , leave the room for a few minutes and the head is still at the top of the glass . this is a very handsome beer .
a : poured a dense black . holding the beer up to the light , the darkness remained exactly the same ; impenetrable . only about a one inch head , but great retention .

appearance : a black pour makes a one finger , medium-thin , fizzy , noisy , light brown head that quickly vanishes . poor retention and overly noisy . black body and some carbonation decorates the wisp at the top . head quickly fades to a ring and splotchy wisp . by the end , however , it looks totally flat and leaves no lacing down the glass . decent body , but the head is lousy .
a : very nice deep black with a prominent mocha colored head . sticky lacing left behind with good head retention . it settles to a nice film and perks back up with a quick swirl of the glass .
a : fairly clear golden color with a minimum ring of white head .
appearance : nondescript , clear yellow . white head with pitiful retention .
appearance : very pale yellow , minimal head , no lacing
a : this is one beautiful beer . bright , slightly cloudy amber color with a huge , creamy , white head . the lacing is phenomenal .
a : golden yellowish orange pour , somewhat cloudy . nice 2 fingers head with good retention and some decent lacing .

appearance : as to be expected , sam adams has incredibly tight quality control , and as such i expect them to pay attention to something other brewers may put on the backburner in order to concentrate on aroma or flavor : the appearance . i was n't disappointed , in that regard . poured with a really large , two finger coffee color/caramel color head , which settled only after about 3 to 5 minutes ( quite a while , really ) to a half-finger . still pretty robust looking head , though , at a half-finger . body is complete night black , totally opaque , and what you 'd hope for in an ris . lacing is exceptional - lasts until you take a sip or swirl again , patterns all over the place , mountainous , arms , and spots . a+ job on the appearance .
appearance : pours a clear , deep amber body with a foamy , creamyish , near-white head .
a : pours a very foamy white head like a coors . i hate coors-like foam . body is a pale amber color . otherwise , very clingy with much lacing .
a : pours a firm voluminous head over a somewhat murky light yellow body . thick , bulbous lacing forms a ring with hefty legs .
appearance : pours a nice coffee-colored clear body with a towering tan head that leaves lots of lacing as the liquid is consumed ; a great looker
appearance : pours a bright and clear golden yellow with a moderate amount of rising bubbles . about a finger of white head that quickly fades into a small thin patch . lacing is very light .
appearance : mahogany brown in color . no head at all when poured and no lacing . thick looking and even slightly cloudy . sort of bland looking .
a : peachy keen on the eye . lovely peachy pink with a quickly receding three finger head and no lacing .
appearance : pours a slightly hazy pale golden color with a beaten egg white head that leaves all kind of lacing

a : the beer poured a creaamy and nearly black hue . even back lit i could find not color other than black . an aggressive pour resulted in a massive sticky milk chocolate head of more than four fingers . the head receded leaving a beautiful tan lacing .
appearance : high-yellow , almost white when poured . huge white head , about half of which sticks around for a bit .
a : honey-gold with scant , wispy off-white head with a minimum of lace around the glass .
a : dark brown on the edges otherwise almost black . minimal tan head quickly dissipates to a spotty ring of lace .

appearance : golden yellow in color . crystal clear . poured with two fingers of smooth foam . plenty of lively carbonation . head had okay retention , lasting a couple of minutes . left plenty of lacing in clumps down the glass .
a : copper with a finger of off-white foam which falls quickly to a sheet of the same . near cobweb lace . excellent clarity .
appearance : beer is dark brown , the color of cola . head is disappointing , in that a vigorous pour yielded a head less that a finger thick . no visible carbonation or lacing .

appearance : mahogany , or close to midnight black color , with an evil ruby tint in just the very edge of the glass . a smooth , creamy brown head cascades a little bit before forming and retains nicely . thick sticky lace clings all over the glass .

a : pours a dirty reddish brown . on the first pour there was a significant oxidized pinkish head , but it reduced quickly and was never really seen again on the successive pours . reduced to nothingness - not even a surface coating . no lacing .
a : clear and golden , a lot of carbonation , and a small bubbly head that leaves very little lace . 2/5
a : pours a dark brown porter with little translucency . transient head whit dissappears and leaves a couple spots of burnt cream bubbles . no lacing .
a : hazel brown . many many co2 trails release from all over glass . pours half an inch of bubbly white head . holy effervescent . retains half an inch of head . leaves lace around glass .
appearance : copper and rust colored liquid with a minimal white head and slow flowing carbonation .

a : pours a somewhat brown color . it is mostly a really dark yellow , or almost amber . it wants to be brown , but you know what ? it 's not . it just is n't . got like a 1/4 inch of head that disappeared almost instantly . so sad . lots of active carbonation . i am noticing a trend here . these beers are all super carbonated are n't they ?
a : pours a translucent gold to light amber with a huge pillowy fluffy ice cream cone like head , with great retention .
appearance : golden hazed beauty in a robust 20oz tulip shaped glass with a magnificant foaming white head leaves great batches of belgian style lacing , wow .
appearance : pitch black throughout with a tight , inviting , 1.5 finger , light brown head on top . great retention and lacing - leaves thick notches at each resting point .

a : admitaly the beer was a bit warm when i poured it , but a regular pour resulted in a head eruption . the glass was about 30 % beer and 70 % head . i had to wait almost 10 minutes to finish pouring it . the body is deep black with ruby notes on the edge with a mocha colored head .
a : semi-clear orange-amber hue , excellent head retention ... nice froth from the initial pour .

a : pours a clear , apple cider gold with the tinyest suggestion of head on top . really . it barely reached 1/8 of a finger thick before it completely disappeared . not one speck of lace was left behind .
appearance : this is like water with yellow food coloring . the head is nonexistant , except for the carbonation at first .
appearance : copper in color , bright and perfectly clear . head retention is great for an 11 % beer , leaving plenty of lace sticking to the glass .
appearance : clear reddish golden color . head , well , i think there was a head . i blinked and it had disappeared .
a : pours a beautiful golden . tiny white head with absolutely no lacing left on the glass .
a : pitch black with a dark brown head . excellent head and lacing . it looks dark , rich and sexy !
a : dark , no head .
a : a nice clear mahogany with a one-finger creamy head that sticks .
a : pours a cloudy yellow color . a small white head forms , and recedes in a second . light lace is left behind .
a : pours blond with a minor white head , no lace , pallid .

appearance : i look at the beer and think i got the wrong one , the server assures me this is the right beer . the lazlo 's limited red ale is , well , not red . it was a dull copper/amber color , even a little orangish maybe , but nothing close to red . the beer was also a little hazy . moderately carbonated , i could see bubbles rising quickly throuigh the liquid . the beer was also very cold and served with no head , a ring around the glass and left no lacing . i notice a small note card on the table describing the beer from the description given , i guess this is really the red ale . personal note : here in the land of the huskers , we love our red meat , big red gum , and if a beer proclaims to be a red ale , then bygawd it had better be red .
a : black with brown hues around the edges . fat three head khaki . excellent retention and solid lacing . 5
a : pours black . no head or lacing . par for the course with these stout treatments .
appearance : clear , light gold with orange highlights and small head which disappears quickly and leaves no lacing . not too bubbly at all
appearance : very clear yellow . not much head .
a : pours solid black with good viscosity . 1 finger of head forms with a bit of a cascading effect . the head is deep mocha and has good retention . very good lacing throughout .

a : pale straw . pretty heavy carbonation pours into a 2 finger bubbly white head . settles quickly leaving only a smattering of bubbly carbonation on the surface of the brew . substantial carbonation continues to rise . no lacing .
a : yellow with a faint pinkish tinge to it . decent layer of suds .
appearance : pours a thick black color with a fluffy 3+ '' head . thick lacing coats the glass . the head lasts through the drink .
a : clear , light golden yellow like pee with a natrual white soda-style head and little rising bubbles throughout .

appearance : my glass was filled with an amber ale with golden edges , a nice off-white 1/4 '' head that quickly receeds to form a wispy sheet over the surface . there was a little lacing throughout the glass .

a : this pours [ insert poetic reference to darkness , absence of light , day becoming night , the breaking loneliness of a 14-year-old goth boy ] black . some edge translucence , but you really have to search for it . nicely dark . what impresses me is that the head , a tan color , has great retention and substantial lace . must be a lot of hop resins in this beer .
appearance : more of a brownish goldish color reminds me of apple cider , has a mild haze , looks flat , little to no head , little lace , does n't look attractive
a : i worked the cork out the bottle wondering what i 'd get . nada . no pop . poured out totally flat . color is a dark , murky brown .
appearance : deep red to light brown , minimal to zero head , light lacing . sure , it 's difficult to maintain head on a 8.2 % beer , but this one had almost none from the get-go .
appearance : pours into my delirium tulip a deep brown with a small light tan head . it drops instantaneously to a medium collar with some hazy bubbles floating across the surface .

appearance : aggressively dropped him right down the center of the glass and was left with nothing more than a few bubbles for head . dark brown body , with light only cracking through along the edges of the glass . this looks sludgy in the glass , closer to what i 'd expect from a quad or a stout than a flanders bruin .

a : during the pour , i noticed this had to be the lightest in color imperial stout i 've ever seen . the beer is dark brown with a nice creamy looking pale beige head with ok retention and ok lacing .

a : with 2-3 oz reserved , poured a clear , bright , ruby color ( +0.5 ) with a light amount of white head . head rapidly dissipated into a ring of white lacing with a small island of foam in the middle of my glass . pouring the remainder of the beer resulted in a little cloudiness and some fruit pectin at the bottom of my goblet ( +0.5 ) . this real-deal fruit beer ! like a hand-crafted fruit beer . my experience with fruit beers is that a persistent head is atypical and can be a flaw .
appearance : transparent yellow , reminiscent of piss .

a : pours a very deep brown with a 2.5 finger , slightly tan head , leaves copious lacing everywhere , and it 's retention is second to none . settles into a small cap . held to light shows a very dim amber hue around the extreme edges , but light does n't really get through . very beautiful beer , one of the best looking beers i 've ever seen , of any style .
a : crimson hue that painted my palm in a blood red glow as i held my glass . light bubbles on top after pouring , but no lacing to speak of . the way this brew plays with the light is captivating .
a : golden honey color with a thick 1 inch white head that fades at a decent rate . very good .
a : dark yellow with lots of bubbles . thick head full of large gnarly bubbles . very little lacing .

a : after giving the bottle a good roll on the table to release the yeast which had settled on the bottom of the bottle , this beer poured a beautiful , yeast-filled hazy straw color into my pint glass . just as i would hope and expect . a beautiful , well sustained 2 inch head slowly dissipates , leaving a nice lace on the glass as this beauty goes down .
a : lives up to its dark moniker , this is probably one of the darker scottish/scotch ales i have seen to date , being pretty opaque with a moderately lingering medium tan head .

appearance : typical yeti in that it pours dark as night , but there is a much more persistent creamy tan head maintained by a bunch of bubbles cascading to the top . this is going on pretty much the whole beer . there is also a pretty decent amount of lacing left on the glass after drinking .

a : hard pour gives a huge slowly-building brown head that tops out at ~2 '' and threatens to overflow the glass . settles very slowly to large bubbles and craters , leaving a thick solid curtain of lace on the glass . thick black brew lets zero light through , even when held to a bright light . perfect appearance .
a : pours a deep dark brown , almost black color . provides a one finger tan foam head with moderate retention and ample lacing .
appearance : dark brown with only a little transparency . not much of a head .
a : the beer pours a nice brown color , maybe dark brown with a small head , and very nice lacing ...
a : fizzy like cola - fine bubbles , thin `` head '' dissipates completely in 10 seconds . the color is the same as what i see when i head to the little boys room after drinking too many tsingtaos .
appearance : cloudy / sandy brown color , with a fair amount of sediment that poured out into the bottom of the glass . only a modest amount of head . uninspiring .
a : pours a light orange with a small white head , fair retention , no real lace .

a : i was very impressed with the appearance of this beer . i prefer an ipa with a more structured malt base , and this certainly did not disappoint . the beer poured a very nice rich golden color with a 2+ finger head that held on for several minutes . there was heavy lacing the whole way down the glass when i finished .
a : sort of a deep purple . no head , a few bubbles , barely anything going on .
appearance : cloudy beige orange , excellent head retention it seems to stick around forever .
appearance : golden hue with a bright clarity , obviously they were going for that deep golden honey colour . above par head retention , nice and bubbly with some stickiness .

appearance : pours a big two-finger tan head . head is medium thick , bumpy and bubbly . it settles with lots of pot holes and is very uneven . colour is black with ruby tints on the bottom of the glass , and it 's relatively opaque . head slowly dissipates leaving a healthy film behind , and some nice lacing falls down the glass .
a : pours a deep mahogany color , almost purple looking . thin puny little head with almost no retention . some water watery looking in terms of viscosity .

appearance : this beer poured a little thin for a stout , but it was a nice , dark brown color . light only penetrated it when the glass was held up to the light . the beige head rose up huge and settled very , very slowly . it was all rough and rocky and left thick , sticky chunks of foam behind on the side of the glass . the lacing was very heavy , sheeting the glass in solid bubbles in most places .
a : clear golden body with a non-existent white head that barely leaves a ring around the glass - this is either flat or it 's the most disappointing head i 've ever seen on a beer .
appearance : an aggressive pour yielded a full , five-fingered thick foamy , frothy head ... clear golden hue ...
a : poured a deep copper with slight red tint , 1/4 inch tan head

a : huge amounts of head fill the top halves of the glasses . tight and bubbly . very white with good retention . the beer is full of tiny champagne bubbles . scattered , wispy head clings to the sides . the beer is light coppery , just barely clear .
a : pours a soda like purple mixed with brown , the head is a half inch of pure whiteness which is an odd contrast with the purple liquid , no lacing .
a : beautiful ruby , red , tannish ( ? ) head
a : poured a very cloudy orange color , head faded very quickly , lots of sediment floating around .
appearance : golden with very small head and almost no retention
a : a fairly hard pour still only produces a finger of short-lived white foam atop the hazy pale orange body . what head there is disappears quickly and leaves no lace . pretty disappointing .
a : really clear , pale yellow , weak head , little retention , no lacing .

appearance : pours dark , almost black but relatively transparent , and produces a small , medium-looking tan head with half decent retention . head fades relatively quickly to a faint wisp and bubbly ring around the sides . black body and zero carbonation evident . a slight ring and touches of wisp remain , leaving a few dots of lacing down the glass . decent looking but nothing special .
a : pours headless pale straw ; sad
a : the appearance of this brew is very alluring as it shines a gorgeous orange .
a : really nice clarity on this one . almost beautiful . a half finger of white head with a nice amount of lacing .
appearance : pours a bright , yet hazy , yellow with big , soapy head . good amount of lacing and a surprisingly large amount of yeast .

a : slightly aggressive pour results in thin off-white head which dissipates in a minute or two . color of beer is a murky amber with very slight signs of carbonation . sparse lacing occures with good retention .
appearance : pours a dark brown , near black body that 's near still . it fails to form a head , but does cast a few large beige bubbles .
appearance : nice copper color . could n't wait to drink it . low head retention but expected from a cask .
a : pours a slightly golden yellow color with about a fingers worth of head that bubbles and fizzes away very quickly
appearance : served in an unbranded tulip - glowing pinkish red body with a big foamy pinkish beige wave that retains itself fully
a : the beer did not have a very good head , it poured a weak white color and never really stuck to the glass . the body has a nice pale autumn orange color .
appearance : an elegant golden beer with visible suspended yeast particles and a tightly wound white creamy cap arrives in a branded stange . very nice appearance .
appearance : pours a motor oil black with a 2-3 finger creamy chocolate brown head . excellent lacing . looks pretty much perfect for a stout .
appearance : black pour with a dense , foamy , lasting , 1 finger tan head .
a : excellent tan head and thick lacing , very dark brown/orange color ...
a : deep murky dark chocolate brown . dark beige rapidly depleting head is simply a now distant memory .
a : pours a cloudy deep amber body . a 1 '' off-white head slowly fades to a thick film . a few dots of lacing are left behind on the glass .
appearance : pours a beautiful dark reddish amber with a finger of fluffy off white head . there is a decent amount of retention and some very nice lacing . pretty beer .
appearance : pours a medium brown in color , slightly tan head starts to emerge and slowly dissapates into just a thin wisp of lace . head retention is decent , not enough to blow my socks off .
a : clear red-brown with two-finger , off-white , creamy head that lasted a more than a few minutes . great lacing .
appearance : light yellow , to basically clear , even more clear than others
a : previous a very murky orange with three fingers of very effervescent , khaki head that quickly recedes into a few fizzy bubbles with no lacing .

a : this beer is a beautiful golden hazy color that represents the style well . the last 1 inch of beer i swished in the bottle and pitched it into the beer to get the yeast well distributed . i got a 2 finger head , and that receded slowly to a 1/2 finger head that stayed there throughout drinking the entire bottle . the lacing on this beer is the absolute best i have ever seen . even beats sierra nevada pale ale .
a : hazy amber yellow . no visible carbonation , and no head .

a : dark and rather translucent for the style , almost looks like a dunkel . a three finger head quickly dissipates to a half finger head . the head does not appear to be creamy like other examples of the style . the head soon dissipates to a cap , this is a big no-no for this style .
appearance : slightly hazy medium brown . coarse , off-white head that 's barely there at all .
a : wow , i 'm impressed that the apparatus in the can really works . loud fizz when can opened . amber hue with finger or so of head that did not dissipate at all while drinking .
appearance : yellowish straw color , cloudy with a very thin white head that dissipates quickly . kind of looks like a bud regular actually , haha ...

a : bottle describes this as blacker than night . eh , i do not agree . it 's very dark with ruby highlights around the edges . tiny mocha colored head that fades quickly and leaves little lacing on the glass . nothing special .

a : pours a clear burnt amber with an insanely fluffy light tan head that took forever to fade into a dense oily film that looked like almost-melted vanilla ice-cream . i could not ask for better rocking lacing either .
a : straw yellow in color , about a fingers worth of head that settles to nothing . no lacing at all ... . no carbonation that i can see ... plain , nothing to see here .
appearance : quite lovely , and promising . autumnal oranges and browns , a frothy and bulbous off-white head , setting the tone .

appearance : poured from a 12oz bottle into a large wine glass . pours a golden/brown , with a frothy , tan , two-finger head . when the light hits it right , the beer has a slight ruby tinge to it . amazing head retention and some of the most spectacular lacing i 've seen .
a : beautiful pure copper color with a remarkably long lasting head .

a : after a loud pop upon uncorking , this beer pours with a large 2 1/2 finger cappuccino colored head , creamy/frothy texture and semi-long lasting . lingering film remains . the body is dark brown with amber edges along the glass when held to light . spare lacing . sediment is included on the last pour .
a : looks more like a blonde than a pale ale . very clear , slightly yellow , nice white head and lace .

appearance : motor oil . it was poured vigorously into a 13 oz . unibroue tulip , and still there was no froth or head to speak of . obviously my expectations were tempered by the age , but it was as flat as flat can be .
appearance : black , black hole black , multidimensional black , with a beautiful brown head .
appearance : gold . clear . two-finger thick head . just barely off-white . very creamy . impressive lacing and retention .
a : poured a deep black with good carbonation and a huge brown head

appearance : pours a dark amber body , very hazy , with an off-white head that is easily 3-4 fingers that gradually recedes but still remains persistent . the sides of the glass are literally coated with lacing . one of the best looking ipas i 've seen .
a : pitch black with a big , fluffy , dark brown head with great retention . lacing is awesome .

a : very thin ( 1/4 finger ) head formed then dissipated within 15 seconds . color is slightly amber to dark golden . bubbles still forming 3 minutes after it was poured are extremely large , like those in a soda . in fact , by appearance this beer looks exactly like a light cream soda or dark ginger ale -- no head , large bubbles , and lots of spritzy fizziness on the surface of the beer .
a : pours a hazy pink grapefruit colored body . a 1/2 '' loudly fizzy pinkish head fades extremely fast to nothing . lots of fat carbonation bubbles rise quickly . no lacing .
appearance : this beer looks perfect . beautiful copper color , nice 1 '' of medium thickness , off white head with above average retention . moderate carbonation . awesome .
a : pours a dark brown with marble and amber ruby tint . not much of a head on this one but it was a creamy caramel color with only slight lacing .

appearance : amber-copper with tiny particulates floating throughout the beer , not sure what that was about , possibly a bad bottle ? off-white , small , tight head that diminished quickly and left a little spotty lacing .
appearance : pale yellow with a quick forming and quick disappearing head that leaves nothing in its trail not even a thin lace , looks like apple juice or something else .

appearance : pours clear , about a shade `` golder '' than urine , with a fizzy white head that does n't really last . has slightly less carbonation than a soda , and it leaves a behind some thin white lacing on the glass . not terribly impressive , but standard for the style .

appearance : deep brown , clear when backlit . thin tan head that retreated quickly . given the abv , not unexpected . flavor : both the dark malt and the crisp hops come through in a nice 1-2 combo punch . full rich malt taste followed by a very clean , dry , slightly bitter finish that is quite refreshing . hops seem a bit strong for the style , but given the blending of aged and fresh beer , seems appropriate .

a : pours a pitch color with a very bubbly dark khaki head . it rises up to about three fingers in height before settling to a thick collar . there is tons of sticky webbing down the glass . looks phenomenal .
appearance : like diluted urine , over carbonated , little to no head retention
