appearance : the body of the beer is dead black . i love watching a beer reverse cascade and this one did a pleasing job of that . the head is thick a and pillowy . the coloration of the head is like nuget in a 3 musketeers bar . great head retention . we eat with our eyes first or so i am told . watching this beer pour makes me thirsty !

a : pours a very dark black color not able to see through at all even when held to the light . as poured , there is a tan on black affect as the head rises to to the top of the beer . there is an off white very creamy head that does not dissapear lacing all the way down the glass
a : dark brown , with a thick , white head , great retention , with excellent lacing .
a : murky , the color of bog water , almost no head , tiny cap and skinny lacing . i was n't expecting a giant head , but i expected more than this .
a : pours a .5 finger thick , creamy white head with poor retention . beer is a semi-clear reddish-purple . lacing is spotty and stringy with poor cling . pretty standard for the style .
a : cloudy brown body , thick rocky tight white head that leaves wonderful lacing .
a : pours a cloudy goldnerod/amber with no head , no bubbles , no anything .

appearance : pour not as thick as expected . produces a 1+ finger , thinner-looking mocha colored head with decent retention . very noisy head too . black body with higher levels of carbonation for the style . head slowly fades to a wisp with lots of carbonation decorating the top of the brew . a slight wisp and a ring remain , leaving some dots of lacing down the glass . too much carbonation for the style , and the head is simply too weak .
a : this is the highlight of the beer . it looks really good . nearly pitch black , and a creamy off white head that sticks to the glass perfectly ...
a : not impressed . super clear and very pale . little to no head . light bubbles .
a : light amber color . crystal clear with good carbonation rising up the glass . thick dense wall of lace . good thick head that goes away into a dense thin coating on top .

a : a rather aggressive pour is rewarded with 2+ inches of thick tan head above a nearly-black , clear vermillion body ; the head displays pretty good retention and leaves lovely cobwebs of rich lace as it recedes . gorgeous porter .

a : one finger head of poor cream , bad thickness , and abysmal retention . the retention is forgivable for the abv . sm : sweet mother mary bejaysus , this is damn near straight alcohol . she 's like : i 'm alcohol ! i could sterilize fetuses ! a bit aversive .
a : the pour is an extremely light yellow/gold color with an initially fluffy white head . that head dies down quickly .
a : pours a dark brown with some carbonation bubbles being released . small head formed but faded fast leaving a layer of foam on top . nice lacing down the side .
appearance : clear & bright orangy-amber in colour . head is thin foamy white lace .
appearance : very clear despite the dark amber colour . head : light brown colour , low and poor retention .
appearance : pours a cloudy , dull , pale yellow with a foamy , white head that rapidly becomes thin and eventually disappears altogether .
a : light orange amber color that has a cloudy translucency . light half finger head that disappears quickly .
appearance : pours a beautiful copper/amber color - a little hazy , with an amazing head that lasts forever - honestly , i do n't think ipas can look better than this
a : almost black with ruby light comeing through it
a : slightly copper cloudy with virtually no head . not what i expected for an extra stout .
a : lightly hazed golden yellow . no head formed . 4.5

a : oh my heavenly god , it 's the most beautiful beer i 've ever seen thus far . nice thick off-white head , a beautiful amber color with bubbles that just do n't want to quit ... climbing to the top like a bat out of hell ... and it keeps doing so for quite awhile . the head persists for a long time too . i 'm just floored .
a : pours into a snifter a brown color , slight head with a little bit of lace down the glass .
a : a clear amber pour with a thin head . even after a vigorous pour it does n't bubble up much . what does appear disappears quickly . light lacing as well .
a : very good looking . a nice 1 inch mocha colored head that quickly fades . brew is a black with ruby highlights around the edges .
a : to barrow a phrase from chris farley , this beer is darker than the inside of a coffin on a moonless night . pours very thick , with minimal head .

a : simply put , this is one of the best looking beers i 've seen . pours a vibrant amber , with a creamy , spongy looking slightly off-white head . some of the best head retention around , stuck with a one finger for a while , giving way to layers of rings of lacing .
a : clear amber body . huge off white head w/ lots of lacing everywhere .
a : copper and hazy . no head . spotty lacing . almost has a wheat appearance . low marks .

a : pours a murky , glowing coppery amber into a tulip . the head is about an inch of off-white foam , with big bubbles , and retention is pretty decent over a couple of minutes . thick sheets of lace down the sides of the glass . one of the best-looking ipas i have ever seen , bar none .
appearance : very good lacing , stick white and foamy . the clarity is fine in a yellow coloured brew .

appearance : ahh the nitro can ... pours into an imperial pint glass , massive chocolate milkshake pour settles into a solid black body and a huge creamy chocolate fluffy head . wonderful , it is absolutely beyond my comprehension how anybody could possibly rate the appearance below a 4 ... what irish stout are you comparing this to that i cant access ?
a : pleasant amber color and crystal clear , not a huge head because of the wine glass but whats there stays around well , additionally lots of little bubble coming up , looks well carbonated

a : standard pour yields an almost completely flat beer . no head . beer is a dark , almost opaque brown . no lacing with poor legs . does n't really get much worse . clarity saves it from being a 1 .
a : looks like your ordinary lager . pale yellow with no head .
a : not much to look at really . soapy foamy head sticks around awhile though , sort of a pale color , very still .
a : pours a dark yellow , copper color with a fizzy head .

a : this is one inviting brew . brilliant orange/copper color with loads of tiny bubbles that create a bit of haze . solid white foam that lingers and then settles into beautiful ring present all the way down to the last sip . the lacing sticks to the glass and stays right where it landed- no movement what so ever . just a wonderful looking beer .
a : orange colored body . hazy . lots of bubbles . weak head . half way through , the head completely dropped off and left the beer naked and unappealing .
appearance : 12oz bottle poured into a standard pint glass . colour is a cloudy , hazy amber . pours a 1 1/2 finger head that leaves a thick lacing . no visible carbonation .
appearance : very cloudy orange with a lot of floating chunks of what i assume to be the live yeast and hop particles .
appearance : pours a really ugly cloudy , pale blonde color with a rocky head that fizzes away without leaving much lace behind

appearance : normally , i do n't get too excited about a beer 's appearance , but this beer is absolutely beautiful ! ; pours a beautiful ruby and chestnut color ; starts with a one finger light tan frothy head with really good retention ; body is dark and just a little hazy , but shows strong carbonation ; head fades to a full , but uneven cap and leaves big swaths and patches of lacing .
appearance : pour the same color as a miller lite but with a decent white head that stuck around for a while .
a : hazy , bright yellow ; fluffy white head , great retention and lace .
a : hazy straw yellow with a soft-peaked head .
appearance : c- , pours a dark brown/black with almost no head . what little head it had disappated almost immediately and did n't even leave a film to sit atop the beer . absolutely no lacing .
a : sparkling dark brown . giant tan , rocky and creamy head that was fully lasting . the lacing was phenomenal .
a : pours a cloudy orange with a soft creamy white head , great retention for a-b , some soft lacing . looks the part of a wit .
appearance : thin , foamy head that disappears rather quickly with a yellowy gold color that is only a tiny bit cloudy .
a : beer is a dark brown , with no light coming through . looks like a darker version of root beer . provides a small tan foam head , with zero lacing .
a : clear yellow.. 2 finger head.. lots of active carbonation..
a : pours a frankly , ugly pale yellow , with little head , just a smattering of clear bubbles , though a nice ring does appear later , as the beer is drunk .
appearance : this is a good looking beer . nice gold color snow white head . tight lace .
a : gorgeous ! beautiful deep ruby color with a thick 1 inch white head the slowly fades but never completely disappears . awesome !

a : pours large 2 finger rich creamy head in my sa perfect pint glass . many little bubbles rise from the etch in the bottom preserving the head for a while . it 's a brilliantly clear toasty amber pale orange color . n : lots of nice hop aromas going on in there . some fresh earthy hops , with touches of chewy hops , spicy , grassy and piny , and some slight sweet malts . all very light but definitely there .

a : pours a hazy amber with golden highlights . low-medium carbonation and two fingers of fluffy white head that dissipates slowly give way to some excellent lacing . n : pear , apple , lemony citrus and grains .

a : maybe my beer was defective ! i had 3 millimeters of head which dissipated quickly with almost no lacing which seems differ as compared to recent reviews . very dark brown/black . like motor oil .

a : pours a dark mahogany-ruby color ; its translucence is immediately apparent in the small pour . the tan head is surprisingly generous for what is ( later discovered to be ) a nearly 10 % beer . retention is ok , lacing is poor .
a : very sizable light beige froth of head rises up and out . this ipa has the slightest haze and is straightforward copper . tons of frothy retention and lacing . the head is n't going away .

a : three fingers of light brown , long lasting head of creamy/frothy texture . the body is dark amber brown and so murky that it nearly opaque . there is a whole army of bubbles rising rapidly to the surface to maintain the head . as the drink goes down , a fair amount of straggly lace is left behind .
appearance : clear amber in color with a short 1/4 '' head that dissapated immediately . after the head fell , there was n't even any surface foam . no lacing develops .

appearance : red . this is the coolest looking beer i have ever seen ! it literally has a color like cranberry juice ( or , as is more appropriate for halloween , blood ) . has a crazy two finger pink head which takes a minute or two to dissipate and leaves some really cool pink lacing behind .
a : dark straw , cloudy body . huge white head that lasts for awhile . kinda reminds me of a triple karmelite .

appearance : bright yellow body with a billowy snow white head that slowly collapsed in on itself in valleys and craters . thick tide marks showed the progression of my enjoyment . flavor : light malt flavor balanced by a crisp hop . a pilsner taste that lingered and faded into a slight citric flavor ; slightly lemony .
a : used motor oil in color . one and a half fingers of thick , frothy foam . syrupy pour . 3.5
a : the pour is a clear light brown color with a finger of off-white head .
a : pours black with a firm light tan head , frothy in the glass , good retention , thick lace . as with most guinness products , the appearance is impressive .

a : pours a dark brown that is opaque in the center and lightly translucent at the edges of the glass . has a couple of inches of tan head that retreat to half an inch . retention is indefinite , and the head looks nice throughout the drink . good lacing too .
a : pours fizzy yellow , no head , not even over the etchings .

a : deep , dark copper color , almost a ruby tint to it . mostly clear , with just a touch of haze . half finger head dissipates down to a thumbnail , lightly ringing the sides of the glass . solid lacing .

a : corked ejects with a loud and crisp pop . standard pour yields a 1 finger dense , fine light mocha head with good retention . beer is a semi-cloudy , dark , nearly opaque purple . lacing is thick and patchy with nice cling . a really nice looking beer .
appearance : pours a deep cloudy amber in color , head built up fast and went away quickly , leaving behind no lacing whatsoever . very dissapointing to say the least .
a : not even a one finger head , very slight cream , and terrible retention . semitransparent yellow-gold colour . standard fare . sm : caramelized malt , slight cream , and moderately empty barley .

appearance : hazy golden glass holds a respectable thin white cover that fails to give lace and dropped off pretty early in the glass . flavor : wet grain base has a fairly sharp pepper note . some of the banana flavor comes back in but not nearly as much as in the aroma . some mild bubblegum comes out in the finish , but there is a lingering mild medicinal and apple aspect to the finish as well that didnt sit well with me .
a : i love the way this beer looks . copper and amberish . large bubbles dancing around . a little bit of head but not much . i watched this one for a few minutes as i sipped on it . awesome !
a : nice hazy golden color with a decent head that does n't really last very long .
appearance : it is a very cloudy amber color with very little head .

appearance : this got my highest score for this brew because it really is a great looking beer . an aggressive pour produced three fingers of fizzy white head ( not very thick ) . the beer is a beautiful reddish-almost orange-ish hue .

a : no justice is served by pouring this one at any cooler than 50 degrees - wow , is it impressive looking . deep , rich mahogany with hints of pomegranate redness , fairly clear when held to light . good carbonation . fantastic head , a full two-fingered topping of dense khaki cream . good retention and sturdy banding lace .
a : it pours mostly black with 2 fingers of light tan head that holds very well .
a : pours black with half a.finger.of dark tan head . it quickly fades , leaving behind a little lace .
a : a hazy straw into my trusted duvel glass with a finger of head that thins slowly and leaves little lacing .

appearance : slightly cloudy dark gold body with almost no head . as i poured it i tried in vain to produce some kind of froth , but nothing was happening . very inauspicious , uninspiring beginning .
a : its the same color going in as going out ...
appearance : near pitch black beer with dark brown hues and a clinging tan laced head -- good retention .
appearance : a hazy , deep dark brown body with ruby highlights and a finger and a half of caramel-tinged head . it leaves a fantastic curtain of lacing that leaves the glass virtually opaque .

appearance : pours a deep golden hazy brown , with bubbles lining the entire bottom of the glass . a thick light tan head sits initially , but dissipates to a smaller , more manageable head leaving lots of sticky lacing . the bubbles continue to rise . this is a damn pretty beer . tons of sticky lacing as the beer is drained from the glass .
a : dark iced tea brown flirting with some ruby red highlights . tiny head that quickly fades to a small lacing atop the brew . ok.

a : pours obviously quite thick - crude oil . broken , dark mocha foam coats the surface and then dissipates nearly immediately . no residual foam . no lacing . the beer coats the walls of the glass and tans the window .
appearance : pours a golden amber with a nice thick head that disappeared quickly .
a : bright cloudy yellow with a giant white head .
appearance : very dark with ruby highlights . brownish with hints of red in the head retention . flavor : focused on malt . a bit sweet with a very delicate hop bitterness .
appearance : golden yellow with little haze , but hardly any carbonation and no lacing . too cold ? not sure what 's going on , but does n't look like a tripel to me .

appearance : hazy amber orange with three thick fingers of creamy ivory foam with a little bit of an orange cast . head retention is great ( still there even as the glass is almost done ) and big , chunky lace is left . this is a trait of rye in my experience , and a good one . i 'm not thinking dipas get much better than this , visage-wise .
a : c & c bottle pops and pours a light golden ale with excellent clarity . atop is a blanket of white head which is constantly refilled with a continuous persistence of bubbling .
a : bright amber body topped with an enormous off-white head of wonderful retention that slowly gives way to thick sticky lacing and a thick creamy cover .
appearance : small fizzy head that lasts a shorter period of time than a nervous virgin , it has the distinct color of overhydrated piss .
appearance : a fetching hazy amber that triggers water bombs under the tongue .
a : crystal clear with plenty of fluffy white head . adequate retention for some very nice lacing .
a : nice thick , off-white frothy head . tons of lacing . orange hued body
a : hazy copper-amber , off-white head , some retention , great lacing .
a : dark copper-ish to dark ruby hue , coming with an effervescent , off-white frothy head which sustains brilliantly , supported by a constantly lively fizzy body .
appearance : pours a deep , smoky amber into my glass . small head contains very large bubbles - kinda weird . negligible lacing .
a : a nice rich dark brown color that is opaque with a two finger creamy coffee colored head ( yay adjectives )
a : a thin , transparent yellow with white , fizzy head
a : inviting ! about one finger head , followed by a touch of lacing on the glass ; this is gon na be great !
appearance : looks interesting , like a beer should . nice label .
a : very dark pour with about a finger of brown head . looks to be creamy , without a ton of retention but nice lacing . 4.5

appearance : served in a 14-oz pint , comes with a super frothy dark head with a myriad active bubbles in constant motion , weee ! ! ! ! a bit over one finger of head , with great retention and minimal carbonation ( this being a cask , it is expected ) . color is a deep-chestnut bronze , like a dark barleywine . a pretty face is about the only good thing this beer offers ...
appearance : slightle hazy . no head . brown colored . kinda un-appealing .
a : cloudy brown with little to no head .

a : a huge off-white head of 5 fingers begins to wear out it 's welcome with a retention that could seemingly be measured in days . the cap appears light and full of air , eventually collapsing in on itself . as the head slowly pulls away from the glass 's edge , it leaves a sticky , perfectly intermittent web of lace . the body is 70 % opaque with a medium value peachy-orange hue .
appearance : pours a rich copper . almost no head retention .
a : an intimidatingly dark brown , nearly black , with a thin , foamy , dark beige head that diminishes rather quickly , but leaves a nice trail of sticky lacing throughout .

a : pours what initially appears to be a nearly opaque black , but when held up to the light , the ale is actually a clear , dark , brownish amber . this ale pours with a tremendous , rocky beige head that laces deep into the glass . it 's really a good looking beer .
a : black with reddish-brown highlights , huge light tan head , good retention & lace .
a : pours a slightly hazy orange with a finger of off-white head that recedes into a thin ring with no lacing .
a : this beer pours hazy light copper color with a half finger of white head . head recedes immediately and leaves minor spider webbed lacing .
appearance : amber winter lager-ish .
appearance : it looked like any other pale ale except i 've seen industrial light lagers with a better head .
appearance : the only problem with this beer . very reddish brown with mild off white head and hardly any retention at all .
appearance : slightly hazed amber , small head that fades to nothing .
a : looks like white grape juice with a slight haze to it small head good laceing
appearance : poured nice with a good thick head . the beer had an orange-gold color that looked more like an amber ale than a pilsner .
a : muddy reddish-brown body with a half in chi of coarse tan foam . ok , but uninspiring .
a : pours a cloudy sun yellow , with a perfect cap of white foam , great retention , with extensive lacing .
a : golden color with a thin quickly dissipating head and barely hazy for an unfiltered beer really it 's completely transparent .

a : poured into a duvel tulip , the huge voluminous head i expect on this beers filled 80 % of the glass . i love the look of the froth on this thing . its sugar cube white and has the big rocky body of freshly proofed bread yeast . it takes several pours until i get half a glass of the crystal clear pale yellow liquid and was happy enough to take a seat on the couch . clumps of the sticky foam stick around the inside of the tulip . it does n't get any better than this . 5/5
a : pours a deep dark brown , almost black . a three finger tan head slowly settles to a spotty frothy cap , leaving a good amount of lacing behind .

appearance : pours a very cloudy orange amber . it was clear at first , but then i shitload of dregs poured out into my glass -- they do n't state that this is a very unfiltered brew . head is pillowy white with a creamy stickiness .
a : looks just like the on-tap serving at a pub . dark dark dark brown . lovley creamy thick head that continues to keep you company throught the visit , and leaves light-tan lacing .
appearance : pours a black body with tinges of brown & very thin head that quickly disappears .
a : beautiful reddish-bronze with frothy tan head leaving a healthy amount of lacing .
appearance : pours a relatively clear , copper color . head is pretty weak , if you ask me . looks decent to start but if you blink , you 'll miss it .

appearance : this murky beer was a very deep brown with strong , reddish-orange highlights . the brown and orange head ( kind of odd looking ) lept up and filled a third of my glass . as it settled down , it became dense and very rocky , leaving chunks and sheets of itself behind on the side of the glass . there was lots of lacing throughout the other glasses as well . very nice looking .
a : this beer pours a murky copper color with a thin offwhite film that sits on top . leaves a decent amount of wispy lacing on the side of the glass .
a : pours hazy pale gold with negligible head and lacing . searching through the haze , i find the beer quite bubbly .
a : the beer poors kind of ugly ! i mean its a nice darker golden color , so its not a `` helles '' which literally means bright , and the head is a spattering of bubbles , sub par lacing ...
appearance : pours a hazy copper color with a orange tint and small but foamy head .
a : looks like cider . a brownish orange color ; 1 finger head , disappearing quickly , with little lacing .
appearance : it has a light golden colored body with very good clarity and some visible streams of carbonation . the head on top is light and foamy , bright white in color and fades out quickly .
a : urine tinge amber , very little head that dissipated . typical macro lager uninspiring coloring .

a : pours like an imperial stout : pitch black in the glass , touches of brown , a mocha-colored head . retention is on the longer side for an imperial stout , with the cap sticking around for a few minutes before lapsing into a thick donut around the brew . lacing does n't stick much , but it does leave nice sheets on the glass during a swig .
a : almost clear yellow and the head disappears like a sad magic trick , leaving a light apple juice like thing
appearance : arrives beautifully at the table with a cloudy mocha body and a frothy tan head - looks like a lighter version of a stout ; plenty of creamy lacing
a : deep honey , amber in color . bits of yeast floating about . absolutely no head or lacing . the tiniest bit of foam on top .

appearance : attractive orange-straw color , with some haziness/cloudiness . head pours about 1 1/2 fingers thick , dissipated quickly . no lacing to speak of . i 'm docking points here because of the head .

a : beautiful deep amber with mahogany hues . succulent 2 inch , fluffy white head that lasts for quite a while . carbonation is perfect , not too powerful and not too weak . looks just like a beer should , seductive and inviting . picture perfect for me .
a : pours a cloudy murky yellow , with a soft , white acidic head .
appearance : light straw yellow . almost no head formation and no lace retention .
a : pours a dull straw yellow with a slight haze . the head is thin and leaves something to be desired . very light carbonation .

a : the perfect color for a pumpkin ale in my opinion . a deep copper/ amber color on the verge of brown , that reminds me of the leaves about to change in autumn . head does n't last long , but for this beer i do n't consider that a flaw because i was so enthralled with the color .

appearance : bubbly white head billows up with the pour then disintegrates into a ring that clings to the sides . gorgeous golden with just the right amount of haze . color and clarity are perfect but head is weak . .

a : pours a beautiful golden hued , deep pink color . a slightly off white two finger head . the head dissipates fairly quickly , but retains a nice foam cap for the duration of the glass . moderate lacing .
a : its filtered , problem # 1 . problem # 2 it doesnt have the bright straw like color expected from a mild filtered or unfiltered wheat beer . instead it has a dark urine like color .
a : gigantic white fluffy head . probably the best i 've ever seen . semi-clear orange-straw color . perfectly carbonated .
appearance : hazed orangey brown with a decent thin lacing .

a : jewel clarity and a warm , deep honey-amber color ; steady stream of small bubbles slowly rises to meet a foamy cream head that quickly dissipates to leave little/no lacing ; almost looks like apple juice after a minute or two

appearance : good finger of bright white head holds firmly . odd viscous sediment at the top of the glass at pour diffused into the formerly clear yellow beer turning it a uniform hazy dark gold . flavor : hearty wheat/grain flavor full of bubble gum yeast characteristics . a little banana flavor comes in as well . the grain flavor does n't really taste malty , and there 's not a lot of hop flavors going either ; all in all very well balanced .
appearance : very nice golden orange glowing body with a vibrant bubbly white head ( amazing retention ) , the lacing coats the sides of the glass with very large bubbles .
a : dark brown , with waaayy tomuch carbonation as it took about 15 minutes to pour to glass with a slow pour because the hed rose so quickly . the head was off white brown and fluffy
appearance : pale , golden , clear . the head is epic ... .just huge . nice lacing is seen .
appearance : weak yellow , no head , not enough carbonation . i know before i smell or taste the beer i 'm walking into a mine field .
a : it poured a gold colored body with a very weak head of less than one finger . the head was bone white and disappeared fast and without any lingering lacing .
a : such a pretty pretty shade of orange . one of the best shades i 've seen with a great head to go along with it .
a : dark brown with a thick white head that disappears . there was a lot of carbonation and the bottle foamed over when opened .
appearance : light brown , quite hazy , voluminous layer of off-white suds , good head retention
a : pours amber color , lots of bubbles in the glass . very small head , zero lacing down the glass . apperance is not impressive
appearance : medium amber with some possible chill haze , one inch off white head .
a : settles into an amber color with a fizzy head that doesnt stick around very long .
a : black with a nice amount of head . looks beautiful
appearance : pours a golden color with almost no head , and just wisps of retention . just a bit of lacing .

a : yellowish-gold with no head of which to speak . the most important aspect to note is the crazy amount of tiny yeast chunks suspended in the body . in all , this is sort of a flat , hazy , and somewhat uninspired looking beer .

appearance : pitch black body with a tall , dense , pile of brown foam on top . head retention is a m a z i n g. while i 've always loved the look of old rasputin , i 've never seen one quite like this . the nitro does some pretty incredible things for it . great lacing . fantastic colors . perfect !

appearance : light golden color . being an ale man , i find the color a little too light , but the light color just goes with the beer style . even so , it still seems light compared with a beer like heineken .
a : the pour is a muddy and hazy amber color with no carbonation and a few bubbles after the initial pour .

a : poured with delicacy , i have never seen such a frothy brew . huge chunks , big boulders of foam . lacing was out of this world as it formed intricate spider-webbing . beer is a deep , hazy crimson color
a : pours a 100 % transparent straw color that produces a very fizzly and carbonated head that lasts for about 30 seconds and leaves no lacing along the glass . very standard .
a : thick , black , viscous pour . opaque . two finger dark brown colored head with great retention . this is a perfect looking ris .
a : pours bright straw color with little white head that is gone after a second leaving a little film on the top .

a : small medium brown head that really resisted making an appearance . it was fizzy and did n't last long . the body was too dark to consider it 's clarity and if it was n't black , it was the darkest shade of brown imaginable . no lacing .
appearance : pours into glass a dark full brown color with a good sized tan that dissipated fairly quickly , not much in the way of lacing was left behind on the glass ,
a : head is huge off white , and lacing everywhere . retention is very good . body is black . pretty much stout like .
a : looks slightly deeper than the average ( light ? ) lager . head dissapears quickly and leaves almost no lacing . serious points taken off for the hokey bottle .
a : dark , opaque , thick pour . minimal 1/2inch dark brown head . no light 's getting through on this one .
a : cloudy , hazy straw colored beer with a nice white head that left good lacing . found it to have a good lasting head that others reported not seeing .
a : dark golden color with lost of medium sized bubbles . the head is off-white and large , and takes some time to dissipate and leaves some lacings .
a : average light brown , creamy head . lasts long and very sticky . very good lacing . the color was dark , dark brown and not quite black .
a : pours a crystal clear yellow with a full white head , good retention , very impressive looking in a weizen glass .
a : poured a cloudy yellow color , looks a lot like a wheat beer . very slight head , no lacing .
a : the beer pours a dark amber color with a thin layer of off-white foam .
a : the nearly white head is spare and fades quickly to a semi long lasting collar . the body is muddy with medium saturation of tawny orange color . s &

appearance : the beer poured a nice 3 finger chocolate colored head . a little reduction , but stays nicely . also , beer is pitch black with no clarity and no signs of carbonation . the head of beer has not come down yet and will have to say the retention is fantastic and lacing on the glass .
appearance : pours a reddish-gold translucent color . the thin and fizzy head is almost non-existant , it dissipates so fast . no lacing to speak of .
a : pours a brownish amber with a good head that reduces to a persistent ring . a light helps show off the cloudiness with some floaters .
a : thin greyish yellow color . quickly dissipating head with large bubbles .
a : dark yellow and cloudy from the sediment . pours with very little head .
appearance : hazy deep amber color when held to the light , while amber/brown under normal lighting . thin layer of head recedes following the pour to a very small amount .
a : almost amber colour , nice head at the pouring but 3 seconds it has dissaper .
appearance : beautiful stiff white head of 2 inches sits atop a hazy pale amber autumn brew . seriously pretty to look at !
a : very dark , opaque , with an inch and a half of dark tan head . head sinks slowly , lacing almost solid .
a : fantastic pour , dark loaded with ripples of brown to an excellent creamy head
appearance : pours a golden orange color with quite a vigorous head which is white . great retention , soapy entrails , tons of lacing . very nice .

a : pours a half finger head of brilliant beautiful cream , good thickness , and bad retention for the abv . the head is white in colour , while the beer is a very appealing dark ruby-black . i ca n't wait to dive in . sm : cherry , raspberry , strawberry - all light fruit hop esters ( as opposed to 'dark ' fruit like in the other three westvleteren beers i 've tried ) . it 's a very excellent fruit aroma all around . refreshing , and evocative of fruli or framboise summer beers . i did n't expect the fruits to smell as bright and pleasant as they do . amazing , pleasant , and perfect . incredibly subtle ; i think the age has done the aroma well .
a : looks uncarbonated . reddish to brown hue , no head or lacing .
a : pours pale gold almost strawlike . the large white head is uneven and soapy , sinks very quickly into faint lacings .
a : just like a regular light lager . yellow ...
a : pours a transparent golden straw color which produces a bubbly fizzy head that is slightly off-white . minor lacing
a : dark brown in color with less than a finger of tan head . sparse film and very little lacing .
a : the pour is a very pale yellow color with a thin layer of white foam on top , but plenty of bubbles coming up from the bottom of my glass .
a : poured from a bottle to a pint glass . had a golden brown color and a completely clear texture . there was a half inch of foamy , quickly dissipating head . zero lacing .
a : black and frothy with a thick , chewy , off-white head , very similar to what a layman would see in a guinness , but with an even thicker head .
a : pours a medium red to mahogany with light white head , no lace .
appearance : pours an attractive cherry pomegranate with a 1 finger off white ( slightly cherry tinged ) crown that displays moderate retention and decent lace .
appearance : the pour is a slightly hazy gold with a long lasting white head .

appearance : a hard pour into a pint glass ( where 'd my pils glass go ? ) reveals a thick head which quickly dies down to nothing . no lacing on side of glass either . slightly hazy lemony yellow color . nice , in my opinion .

appearance : poured from a 22oz . bomber into a pint glass . deep , dark brown with a thin head that dissipated quickly . only a few wisps of foam were able to cling to the glass . the color was impressive , the head and lacing left something to be desired .
appearance : looks identical to guinness extra stout when poured into a sam adams glass . head is brown with large standard beer co2 bubbles , nothing like nitrogen draught white frothy head

a : pours a bubbly fizzy mess . this is the second voodoo brew that is an absolute pain in the ass to pour . you pour , foam , let it die , more foam , it takes 30 min to pour this one and by the time you scrape off layer after layer of foam your 22 oz is barley 16 . enough of that . once poured it is a murky light yellow hue with tons of floaters . head , yeah i think i mentioned that . the retention is ridiculous . lace none .
a : no real head at all . unfortunate , especially for such a relatively low abv . hazy semitransparent gold colour . sm : caramelized malt is all me broken nose can detect . all apologies , lads .

appearance : deep , sunflowery orange-yellow with a fizzy , parchment-colored head . the head is pretty thin and disappears in the blink of an eye with splotchy lacing , followed by no lacing at all . i like the color , but it does n't make up for the lame head .
a : redest beer i 've ever seen . orange hues as well . decent white head .
appearance : pours a watery yellow with heavy carbonation which dissolves quickly leaving little lacing .

a : sort of like hot black desiato 's stunt ship , `` how much more black could it be ? none more black . '' really dark with a thick and creamy dark brown head . nice head retention and great lacing all the way through .
appearance : poured a clear golden amber . two finger white pillowy head . good retention . excellent lacing all the way down the glass .
appearance : pours a cloudy reddish amber with a gold hue . there is n't a whole lot of head , just an off white ring .

appearance : exceptionally clear . it actually reminds me of champagne quite a bit ; pale yellowy peach in color , long streams of big bubbles rising from the bottom , virtually no head , no matter how furiously i pour .
appearance : opaque , no highlights . two inches of light brown head with nice retention . the thickest of lacing . this looks perfect .

a : pours a cloudy orange/amber with yeast sediment floating around . produces 1 finger of head that dissipates quickly leaving behind great lacing . low carbonation . n : orange , papaya , lemon peel , grapefruit , bubblegum and caramel .
appearance : dark copper brown , great clarity , thick tannish creamy head on hard pour , some lacing
a : diarrhea feces brown with no head . but i will give it an average as i have never had an old ale before . may be what it is supposed to look like . but still , does n't look very pleasant .
a : huge head , outstanding lacing ; pours a slight-orange yellow
a : deep ruby with a tight nitro head ; looks just like a guinness .
a : pours a cloudy amber-orange with minimal head , not much lacing and a soft island of foam in the middle .
a : pours a deep golden color with bright gold hues when held to light . a nice finger of creamy white head crowns the brew .
a : pours black . beautiful dark brown 1.5 '' head .

appearance : jet black with moderate efferevescence noted . sticky off white head that retains moderately well . flavor : low fruity esters , more corn and vegetal flavors , sharp acidic and slighy vinegar notes . a little roasted grain comes through but more as an after thought . finish is dry and somewhat clean .
a : a huge thick lively white head sits on top of a hazy-golden-orange beer . i think i may have given this guy too-vigorous of a pour .
appearance : clear , dark red color with 1 finger of tan head that fades slowly with chunky lacing
a : pours a beautiful inky black with a gorgeous head that leaves light to low lacing .
a : very bright red beer with a thick head of grossly pink foam . not off to a good start here ...
appearance : the pour is golden with a massive white foamy head .
a : packaging ( can ) is adorable and all of the womyn in my bar are already raving
a : pours a cloudy brown with a firm off-white head . real nice belgian lace and very good head retention .
a : pours a nice deep gold almost amber . head did n't last too long and had hardly any lacing .

a : pours a murky , maroon body with burnt orange highlights against a lamp . despite a vigorous pour , i ca n't even froth up much head . it slowly rises to a half-finger in height . the beige bubbles quickly collapse into a thin film on the beer . no lacing , very minor collar .
a : pours a dark brown with some ruby around the edges . a tan head rises to over two fingers . rings of sticky lace is left behind .
appearance : hazy reddish-amber body with a fluffy cream colored head . flavor : extremely strong floral hops . mild citrus notes . faint hints of spice . subtle earthy malt sweetness .
a : clear ruby red with no head .
appearance : poured a slightly hazy amber color with no head or lacing . light carbonation . the color is typical , but the style should have some head retention and lacing .
a : pours a dark coppery brown with two fingers of off-white head that recedes into a thin ring with very little lacing .
appearance : pours out a brilliant , yellow body with a tall , white head .
a : deep red and cloudy with a nice reddish 2-finger head , dissipates slowly with beautiful lacing . how a beer should look .

a : hazy and cloudy orange/amber colored body with a fizzy , tight white head that has some quick dissipation . hardly any lace at all , in fact nothing but a thin ring around the edges after a few sips . some quick swirls bring it back to life but not for long . seems the barrels have adversely affected this .
a : light dull gold . white bubbly head didnt stick around for long . a mix of big and small carbonation bubbles .
a : pours a golden color with a two finger head that has amazing retention and leaves lacing all the way from top to bottom with bubbles of carbonation flowing for the entire drink .

appearance : pours a dark cola brown , almost black , with a 2 finger creamy light tan head consisting of very fine carbonation bubbles . excellent head retention and perfect lacing . i do n't see how it could look any better .
a : poured a cloudy , chunky lightly burn orange color with overwhelming carbonation , meaning overly carbonated and a big white cap that took five minutes to settle .
a : pours a lovely brown with amber hues . a striking , 2 inch head sits on top and sticks around at 1/2-1 inch for a bit . moderate-strong carbonation . looks lovely .

a : pours a honey blond with little head and a medium amount of carbonation is present . the beer is cloudy and not see through . looks to be golden in the light . after pouring a few minutes after the carbonation is still there .
appearance : pours to yellow in color with two finger white head . fair lacing .

appearance : it poured out a light brown color that quickly turned into a beautiful black color that you have no chance of seeing through . it poured with a beautiful thick finger and a half of darker tan head that just will not die down . there is also some really nice lacing . i mean this is just a beauty of a beer .
a : fizzy yellow beer . head is even smaller than your typical macro , falls very quickly , retains poorly , and leaves zero lacing .
appearance : pours a slightly hazy amber-peach color . unfortunately there is basically no head . just a few moderately large bubbles around the edge of the glass . little to no visible carbonation .
a : very funky looking beer . nice light gold/pink ale with very strong pure white head .

a : frankly , it sort of looks like a macro lager in the glass . yellow , well filtered , with a snow white head . certainly does n't beckon one from across the room , but this one is all about the flavor .
appearance : 4.5 black with slight brown tint . 1 inch brown cream head with very good lacing . head fades to incomplete surface covering .
appearance : cloudy , deep reddish brown . little to no head .
appearance : sparkling light golden color with a little amount of white head that settled quickly and leaves decent lacing .
appearance : sparkling brilliant yellowish clarity with a lace that holds together quite well .
a : enormous , light beige head . burnt umber with some red , cloudy . looks like dark cherry wood when held to the light .
a : dark , translucent chocolate color with 1 '' of white , fluffy head . the foam receded quickly into a ring , but left no lacing down the glass .
a : typical bmc-type appearance . overtly clear with decent head and active carbonation .
appearance : pours jet black with three fingers of thick tan head . a layer of carbonation remains throughout .

a : poured with a nearly black color , like light is getting sucked into it . no head , barely any lacing . head is n't expected for every style , but all stout styles should have a persistent head ( -1.0 ) .

appearance : very dark ruby red / dark brown . decent 3 cm head forms after a careful pour , leaving a thick collar , some nice lacing around the glass , and a small head that is reinvigorated by the internal carbonation . very interesting look .
a : poured with a 1-inch head that 's off-white and very dense . leaves good lacing .

a : intense sediment . seriously chunky . was handled carefully and stored undisturbed , but even with a delicate pour this was murky and full of debris . girlfriend was definitly put off by it . otherwise a fine amber tone with decent head that isnt too active .
a : like a typical nitro-can stout , this pours thick like a milkshake and the head slowly creeps away and yields a nice dark brew . the 1 finger nitro head lasts the whole time .
appearance : dark coppery orange/red in color . small head and good carbonation .
a : pours a clear gold , with a mild white head , solid retention , very mild lace .
a : light yellow , clear , little head .
appearance : pours an almost clear amber color with a small layer of off white head that goes away completely .
a : it pours pitch black with no colors reflecting at the edge . there is maybe a half a finger of tan colored head that disappears into a thin film . no lacing on the glass .
a : pours a deep brown with a fugly , lifeless , wimpy head . the little head there is comprised of huge bubbles that disappear soon .
a : pours a bright glowing golden with a huge frothy bright white head that slowly faded into a thick rocky film that left patches of sticky lacing down the glass .
a : transparent adjunct lager style , mild carbonation , thin character which looks like a cheap diamond with mellow yellowing throughout ,
a : pours dark amber with a full three finger white head which maintains it 's structure well above the glass . impressive , great retention and lace .
a : pitch black beer with a charcoal greyish-brown foamy 3-finger head leaving plenty of lacing all the way down . there 's even some foam left at the bottom of the glass .
a : pours a deep brown with zero head . no lacing .

appearance : a one finger foamy creamy head that has retention . the color of the beer is a straw color with yellow highlights . the beer 's clarity is clear to brilliant . there is a lot of carbonation in the beer . the appearance of the beer is very good for an adjunct lager .

appearance : must be using a ton of dry hops cause it 's cloudy . amber-copper in color with a medium head that dissapates quickly . flavor : firm bitterness , but not over the top . citrusy , resiny hop flavor brings the hops to the forefront , but is backed by considerable maltiness , a little unusual since i am used to cleaner , drier west coast ipas . it 's a big beer and some residual sweetness suggests attenuation a little less than desireable , but the hops balance it well . sweeter finish , like a barleywine .

appearance : this is a popular brew , and the first impression that this brew leaves is excellent ! the beer pours as a nice red amber . the head is a thick off white . plentiful carbonation threads and plentiful lacings . crystal clear . excellent !
a : im not going to lie , this beer looks like a glass of coffee mixed with chocolate milk and a nice ugly brown coloured head ( goes away instantly ) to top it off .
a : 1/4 finger of head ; amber color with a lot of carbonation rising .
appearance : deep brown/black color with a thin , light-tan head that fades quickly , leaving virtually no lacing .
a : bright copper to orange body with a small tight head of limited retention . very light lacing , and only a thin bubbly cover remain . not very impressive .
appearance : crystal clear and light gold in color .
a : pours is phenomenal with a dark black color and a nice mocha/dark khaki head . the head is a solid two finger size and lasts a long time . decent lacing .

appearance : the appearance was a nice redish brown typical bock look . there was not a good head however . the smell was somewhat chocolaty but not as much as i expected . it was pretty sweet though .
appearance : is just what you expect from boubon county it was like pouring used motor oil in the glass . a slight bit of light brown head formed but quickly disappears .
a : cloudy golden , hazy , no head ...
appearance : great unfiltered light straw color . minimum head .
appearance : very pale blonde with a thin veil of head . crystal clear .
a : quite a bit of head from initial pour but calms down to a nice layer atop . lots of full bodied lovely lacing when stirred .
appearance : pours a cloudy red-orange , with a rocky , pink head that retains well and leaves heavy lace on the inside of the glass .
a : dark mahogany , almost burnt brick . poured into a ommegang flute like chalice with a khaki head that does n't hang around a long time or leave a lot of lacing .
a : pour is a hazy light orange , almost like a creamsicle . 3 inches of frothy head sinks slowly back into the beer . tons of lacing clings stubbornly to the sides of my glass .

appearance : pour yields a two finger , loose , thin , fizzy , pot holed , light brown head with half-decent retention . pretty lousy head really . dark brown body , clear , with some carbonation penetrating the wisp on top . head fizzes down to a thin wisp . a bubbly wisp remains until the end leaves no lacing on the glass . looks quite flat by the end . poor look .
a : perfectly clear lite orange in color with a crispy white head .
appearance : pours a nice deep brown with some hints of crimson that is fairly crystal clear . topped by a very very thin head of wispy white head that vanishes instantly .
a : murky dark brown , it poured with a decent evanescent tan head that died almost immediately to ... nothing .
a : pours a .5 finger fine white head with moderate retention . beer is a stunning clear ruby . lacing is spotty and near non-existant .
appearance : pours a dark brown into an opaque black beer . a generous chocolate head that settles into a thin tan film .
appearance : excellent in all respects , color , carbonation , head , lacing . great looking stuff .
a : brown/black with a light brown head . head dissipates over a couple minutes .
a : pours a hazy orange yellow with a minimal white head . below average retention , no lace . a fair amount of floaties are in the beer .
appearance : jet black , completely opaque , brown head . looks like a stout should look .
a : had this in a bomber i brought back from a trip to washington . pours an orangish color with very good sized foamy white head . good lacing down the glass
a : poured a nice clear amber & selective yellow body with a creamy one fingered head , rises nicely . the lacing on this is outstanding .
appearance : a very light yellow color . not impressed .
appearance : intensely black . a beautiful shiny black . 1/4 inch head that remains for a while . some lacing .
a : oh jesus . an extremely small head after an aggressive pour that was composed of very clear bubbles and died off almost instantly . looks almost as flat as water .
a : dark chocoalte brown . huge three fingers of very light tan head . solid web of sticky lace . decent retention .
appearance : great head on this one . very fluffy that , after a few sips , recedes to a lower head . frothy would be the word for this head .
a : pours a jet black with a small one finger mocha colored head , big bubbles and falls very quickly into a thin foam ring around the edge of the glass .

appearance : extremely pale yellow colour , as clear as water . active carbonation is shown from the large amount of bubbles rising to the top , a big white foamy head forms and leaves a one fingered white lace for most of the time the beer is around before it is consumed .
appearance : poured with a large off white foamy head composed of large bubbles , which dissipated quickly leaving almost no lacing . the beer is slightly hazy with a orange/yellow golden color .
appearance : pours into a becker glass completely black in color . a light mocha-colored head forms on top at about a finger 's height . it slowly drops to a full , thick cap .
a : light copper color with a 1 finger head .
a : clear amber , w/ light effervescence ; fluffy tan head that falls slowly and leaves thinly dispersed lacing .

a : it had a cloudy , organgeish yellow body with a massive three finger head consisting of tight sticky bubbles . the head receded slowly then retained as a thin cover over the liquid . there was a nice leggy lacing .

a : one finger head of barley any cream , good thickness , and pretty good retention . a bile green murky colour ( i shit ye not ) . certainly an exciting appearance . sm : more artifical lime citrus ester than cactus , but some cactus does pull through . i know because i 've eaten cacti before .
a : a hazy golden amber with a frothy head constructed of individual , very fluffy bubbles . lacing is beastly . darker than expected for a single .
a : dark murky brown that started with a fizzy tan lace that did not retain at all . does not look very appealing at all , certainly not like a beer .
appearance : solid mahogany color . rich foamy head -- a few fingers ' worth , slow to subside . inviting and mysterious .

appearance : 2011 -- pours a clear ruby-mahogony with a finger of khaki head recedes into a thin ring with no lacing . 2010 -- pours a brown-mahogony with two fingers of khaki head that recedes into a thin ring with no lacing . 2009 -- slightly darker still , but other than that the same .

a : against natural lighting appeared a golden-honey with a brilliant clarity , enough so to easily read the finest of text through . random instances and burst of carbonation appear while the head was dirty white in color , porous and soapy in appearance , while short in execution .

appearance : i decided to pour this big time hoppy ale into my samuel smith imperial pint glass . maharaja poured a murky apple cider reddish orange color . if there was n't a head of foam on this beer , i could have sweared that there was a pint of apple cider in my glass . loved that color ! sitting on top of my apple cider colored beer was a beautiful creamy 3/4 to 1 inch head of white foam . now for the confusing part , the color of this foam . this white color was somewhere in between being a pure white color and an off white color . i did n't know such a shade of white existed , but thanks to maharaja , now i know there is one . this creamy head of foam had excellent slow retention that left behind a long lasting milky white film and a huge amount of sticky white streaks of lace . a top notch appearance !
a : beautiful copper color with clumpy white head but scant lacing
a : cloudy honey in color with a bit of yeast seen in the glass . head is ok for the style .

appearance : pours a clear , deep , orange-y copper color with plenty of bubbles from the carbonation . a somewhat rough pour only produces about a cm worth of head , and that fades very quickly leaving behind absolutely no lacing .
appearance : this is a gorgeous looking brew , amazing head retention it just about sticks everywhere . bright and tawny great clarity .

a : probably the worst single aspect of this beer . when i first poured it out of the glass i thought they accidentally put in corona . head is overcarbonated and fizzy typical of a macro brew . the head drops to nothing after only a few seconds . very weak lacing .
a : nothing to see here , literally . you 'd have to have a side-by-side with a glass of water to spot a difference .
a : deep copper color with compact , dense and full head , tiny bubbles , clear
a : pours a hazy orangie with a white head that quickly dissipates into a small white lace .

appearance : poured with barely an pinky of head , that did not retain at all . no lacing has been produced with this offering and to be honest the head i did get was not at all creamy like you 'd expect from a stout . body is a dark black with notes of brown .
appearance : a nice white finger of head with perfect pilsner color . i mean this is basically the perfect appearance for the style . there is even some lacing .
appearance : opaque brown with a hint of orange ; 1 '' head that is an off white which laces the glass nicely .
appearance : poured a very light golden color with a little head that quickly dissipated . this was probably the lightest beer i 've seen in a while .

a : poured a beautiful translucent red . when held to the light i picked up tinges of pink and orange . the & lt ; 2 finger head was almost white with the faintest hint of pinkish red . the head dissipated quickly and left minimal lacing . i was really excited by the unique color .
appearance : auburn in color , good clarity , reddish highlights . the head disappears within seconds of pouring , a byproduct of the 11 % abv and cherries i 'd guess .

a : golden appearance that pours 50/50 liquid and foam . i rated this 5 on appearance because this beer has the best head on a beer that i 've seen . it is rocky and tightly beaded , leaving a lace as it slowly recedes . also has clarity .
a : poured an orangish amber color , not much head , no lacing down the glass
a : looks great , deep red , very vibrant , with a nice off-white head and great head retention . fantastic lacing .
appearance : yellow with a thin white head ; not too impressive looking
a : blond color and big foamy head that quickly disappears , something cool , is that the bottle have a cap instead of cork ;

appearance : dark amber orange . definitely malt-centric from its appearance . however , the head was quite possibly one of the worst examples of head i 've seen . even for a mid-sized brewery lager , its poor . disappointed . a brewery like boston brew should be expected to do much better than this .

a : a slightly cloudy golden pour . huge , huge offwhite head with the most ridiculous lacing and retention i 've seen in a beer to be quite honest . there is a solid inch of head left after about 5 minutes of sitting . it never actually fully goes away either . i usually reserve 5s for the top stouts but this one is up there too .
a : nice amber to reddish color . head retention is good , carbonation is good , lacing is good .
a : nice dark amber color with a small white head that quickly dissipates ...
a : yellow-gold with some haziness , with a low whitish head will little retention and no lacing

a : ruby-tinted , active , large head quickly settled down to medium lacing and a bare millimeter of head . a nice popping fizz lasts a minute or two . the body is nearly black , blood red around the edges . really beautiful looking beer .

appearance : pours a beautiful , crystal clear , golden orange , with tons of bubbles and two fingers of slightly off-white head . the head subsided slowly , and left tons of lacing . this is what a pale ale should look like .
a : hazy straw , fluffy white head , lots of lace .
a : looked very promising . ruby-black , awesome plethora of fluffy , off-white head . unfortunately , there was very little retention or lace .
appearance : pours a really nice dark color with a thick creamy tan head . this is a fantastic looking beer .
a : very attractive ruby red color . about a half-inch off-white head that fizzled off fairly quickly . nice lacing .
a : a golden straw color with a 2 finger fluffy white head that has excellent retention and excellent lacing .
a : very pale yellow , clear , with thin , fizzy bright white head that disappears quickly to less than a thin cap .
a : murky reddish-brown color . poured a 2 finger light head that fell to a broken skim . lightly decanted . laced in thick , broken rings .
a : dark murky brown . big bubbles with a tiny head around the edges .
appearance : very little to no carbonation . in and of itself not a a big deal .

a : pours a half finger head of slight cream , fair thickness , and bad retention . colour is a transparent dark yellow . sm : caramel , some tame dark fruit ( albeit very little ) , too much malt , and some nuts . a moderately strong aroma .
a : clear like a kolsch should be with a straw/yellow hue .
a : pours a lazy red into my pint glass , with a small white head , no lacing .

a : one finger of foamy off-white head with big sudsy bubbles . above average retention leaves a sudsy film with lacing already grabbing a hold of the glass . the body is hazy , if not murky ( around 25 % transparency ) , and a rustic orange and brown combination of colors . lacing in nearly entire sheets . some light-colored small flecks of particulate hover in the beer .
a : a careful pour yields an impressive , jet black beer with a dense brown head which hangs around a while .
appearance : pours a very golden amber color . a foamy white head with very good retention . plenty of raising carbonation in the pilsner glass . beautiful .
a : pours a muddy burnt orange . no head no bubbles , like a liqueur . hard to rate this aspect .

a : i have never seen a beer with more full lacing in my life . pours with a huge 3+ finger white fluffy head that has great retention and layers with every sip . golden body . exceptional is an understatement .
a : golden , transparent , but with less than average head and lace retention .
a : pours a light , straw yellow with an ample white fizz head formed from large bubbles and settles quickly .
a : amber orange , hazy , no head
a : bold almost opaque yellow , with 2 finger white head and substantial lacing
a : opaque black , showing dark brown at the edges , with over one finger of diminishing beige foam head . heavy lacing remains on the glass .

appearance : pours a motor oil black with a 1 finger bubbly dark tan head which settles nicely without dissipating completely . nice lacing . looks very thick . this is what i expect an imperial stout to look like .
a : brown to dark brown . decent head but not very long lived . no lacing .
appearance : rhubarb sauce colored liquid with a short-lived , fizzy pink head .

a : nice orange color with a mild bit of carbonation that comes up from the bottom of the glass . a decent amount of head forms , half inch thick , with very nice lacing webs that remain . the head retention was decent

appearance : this beer seems to suffer from a lack of carbonation as it poured with half a finger of head that neither laced nor retained . the beer itself is your standard lager gold and boasts clarity as expected .

appearance : the bottle itself is small , blue , and unassuming . in fact , i 'd go so far as to call that delicate vessel attractive . what lurks inside , however , is repugnant . upon removing the placebo seal around the cork , and then the cork itself , i was greeted with no evidence of carbonated life . i did my best to pour the beer evenly into two glasses , and it lived up to its reputation : it looked like fetid pond water , rife with suspended algae and the long-rotting carcasses of various aquatic fauna . chunks of thick sediment clung to the insides of both the bottle and each glass . the end of the pour yielded an audible `` plop , '' the result of a slimy wad of what appeared to be manatee feces entering the glass . my god .
a : pours a copper color with 2+ fingers of head .
a : poured into a pint glass , has a deep amber color with a fizzy effervescence that rose and fell pretty quickly . no lacing to speak of .

a : pours a two finger head of fair cream , good thickness , and good retention . colour is a hazy nontransparent dirty gold . sm : biscuity yeast , caramel , light fruit ester hops , and cream . a mild strength aroma .

a : dark murky medium to dark brown body with absolutely no head on it . even with some vigorous swirls i could n't get any head to form . naturally , no lace or retention either . for being bourbon barrel aged i ca n't fault it too much as the barrel tends to kill some visuals , but it 's still not very attractive .
a : pours a nearly opaque black color . a small bubbly tan head forms , but recedes in a second . no lace . just a dense , black liquid .
appearance : pours a cloudy pale yellow with a very minimal 1/4 '' white head . no carbonation activity , no lacing .
a : hazy apricot ale with under a finger of fleeting white foam . this leaves and etched surface . rare spot lace .
a : kind of like a flanders oud bruin . sort of ruby brown . no head , no lace .

a : one to two finger head of relatively little cream , good thickness , and good retention . hazy gold colour . sm : fruit esters , malt , and slight cream . great subtlety , but me broken nose ca n't quite place distinct notes .
a : pours a reddish amber with virtually no head . the color is warm and very attractive , but the lack of head greatly reduces the beauty of the pour .

a : dark brown with some very obvious reddish/amber undertones towards the bottom of the glass . somewhat clear though it 's certainly dark enough to not see completely through . a huge frothy beige head forms and sticks around for quite some time . nice slow dissipation with great retention and some nice lace .
a : crystal clear ruby-brown body under a finger of tan foam . great retention and lacing . lovely .

appearance : cloudy golden-orange body with a fluffy slightly bubbly white head . flavor : mild singular malt taste . only a faint hint of bitterness on the back end . some citrus and spice notes throughout , but the dominate flavor is wheat and orange .
appearance : about a one finger head , with some of the better retention i 've ever seen . some constant carbonation is floating through this deep brown body - really unlike a color i 've ever seen .
a : black , no head

appearance : this would be a 1 if not for the initially impressive head , which is tall , dense , and snowy-white . body is far , far less appealing , probably the palest , most sickly-looking beer i 've ever seen .
a : dark black with a dirty white/light brown head . after agitating the beer i got about 1/4 inch head .

a : pretty rich black ... the slightest bit of red hue comes through on the bottom with the help of some light . a surprisingly long life on the head of this . about two and a half finger , creamy and sticky .
appearance : pours a dark black color , like tar . the head is small and tan . it dissipates quickly leaving little lacing .

a : if i had been handed this beer and not been told what style it was , i would have rated it higher than this . however when i read `` imperial stout '' on the label i expected something very , very dark , black , opaque . it is not the case here , it is a very dark brown ale . there is very little head to speak of , not even a finger . overall appearance is n't bad , it just does n't look like an imperial stout .
appearance : arrives at the bar with a black color and a tan head that displays great retention and leaves sheets of lace on the way down

a : say what you want but you have got to hand it to stone for making every one of their beers look damn amazing . this one is a gorgeous auburn brown color and semi opaque . a dare i say perfect rocky head forms which is a light tan color and clings to the glass about as well as it holds together . pancakes are ready .
appearance : deep straw color with a very thin head .

a : standard pour yields a 2 finger , fine , slightly off-white head with great retention . beer is a cloudy pale orange . lacing is outstanding . patchy , great cling , great legs . a damn fine looking beer !
a : pours a black stout with a little over one finger of caramel head , this falls to a moderate sheet of the same . some spotty lacing . pretty good looker .
appearance : honey in color with a big white head .
a : faint yellow ... if beer could be white , this would come close
a : lightly hazy , pale amber body ; gorgeous rocky , longly-lasting two inches of head . great retention and lacing . classically beautiful tripel .
a : pour from a 12 ounce bottle into a standard pint glass . nearly opaque body with a dark head . the head retention is

appearance : pours a big 3+ finger , but thin white head . a lot of carbonation evident ; bubbles flying up all over the place . colour is amber-orange and partially cloudy . not quite as opaque as others . head is pretty persistent ; levels out to a decent film but disappears and looks flat the last third of the pint . no real lacing to speak of . definately below par .
appearance : pours a burnished chestnut with a finger 's worth of head that leaves quite a few strands behind ; good retention
a : a beauty ! hazy copper with a creamy head with tons of retention and lace . 5/5
a : pours a dark brown color , murky in the center but translucent at the edges .
appearance : the thin white head quickly disappears leaving a few bubbles behind . the beer is a golden , light amber color .
appearance : dark orange . nice , off-white head .
appearance : pale yellow , great clarity , thin layer of white froth that mostly disappears
appearance : cloud , dark amber with an enormous , beautiful frothy head that took a while to dissipate . outstanding appearance . really had to restrain myself from diving right in .
a : cloudy , light gray/yellow color . no real head but decent froth , good visible carbonation .
a : golden , effervescent yellow . transparent . one inch head with nearly ping-pong sized bubbles
a : actually quite light in color for a bock , a cross between light brown and yellow . not much of a head and meagre lacing .
appearance : pours a dark brown body with a thinnish , beige-hued head .
appearance : a golden amber color . clear body and heavily carbonated . the head is thin , never pouring very tall .
a : pale piss color yellow . no head . no lacing .

appearance : pours with a solid thumb of head with a decent amount of lace , although the fact i got it mainly in plastic cups on the resort instead of standard glassware might have contributed . carbonation is steady and is pretty much your generic lager yellow .

a : a deceptively carbonated beer . gentle pour yields a slowly rising , and rising , and rising 3 finger , thick , rich , mocha head with great retention . beer itself is appropriately opaque black , thick , and viscous . lacing is pretty outrageous . patterned , good legs , and great stick .
a : moderate pour yields 1 finger of tight eggshell colored foam with great retention . hazy peachy-red liquid .
a : somewhat british looking beer . very nice reddish copper ale , fully translucent with light beige head . retention is poor as well as lacing .

a : aggressive pour shows a very dark brown color and yields a nice 2 finger dark white/tan head . carbonation appears to be great with a super frothy head that looks intense as it settles . great lacing is present as well .
a : deep amber reddish , creamy head .
a : pours a murky brown with amber highlights , capped by a one finger off white head . retention is solid and leaves some spotty lacing .
appearance : pale , pale golden yellow . almost clear . one inch head but the pour was very aggressive and it is already reduced to a thin lace . a lot of fizz .
a : bright copper body topped with a tight one finger head that quickly dissipates leaving light lacing , and only a modest ring of cover . i expect much more lacing from an ipa .
a : pours a clear golden yellow with high carbonation . one finger white head forms then quickly disappears , leaving no lacing .

a : served with a finger and a half of medium light brown head , frothy/creamy and excellent retention . big bubbles linger on top . excellent lacing in cracquelated sheets . thin film . dark brown body with opacity only when held to light , at which point it becomes ruby brown and much clearer than expected .
a : pale and bubbly . huge carbonation bubbles race to the top and demolish the tiny head that was built by a sturdy pour . crystal clear . crayola would call it `` straw . ''

appearance : tall fizzy head with large bubbles , a bit too much like soda . no lacing , head lasts about 60 seconds , then not a trace can be found . that 's a first ! oh well , smells good though . pale gold , a bit cloudy . no residue left at the bottom of the bottle after the pour . flavor : sweet malts , citrus , cinnamon and pumpkin . aftertaste is n't bad , mild citrus , slightly bitter veggie .
appearance : minimal and fast-farding white head , a hazy golden colored body , and practically no lacing . not a good start .

appearance : the head retention is pretty sad , a soda like crackle of the bubbles is a bit disturbing leave almost nothing to show . the clarity on the other had is bright with a deep garnet brown colour .

appearance : beautiful & # 8220 ; widget-can & # 8221 ; pour . super-tight , voluminous , bone-white head with furious cascading under it for at least a minute . body resolved to a crystal-clear red-gold color with a firm 1 & # 8221 ; replenishing cushion . filled the pint glass to perfection like it was auditioning for a commercial ( or like lana turner filled a sweater ) , this is what a beer should look like when poured .
a : clear orange-tinted amber with lots of tiny bubbles and a two-finger , off-white , rocky and creamy head that lasted a while . very nice lacing .

a : a pretty vigorous pour yields a foamy pure white and weirdly bubbly head . the beer itself is astonishingly clear and the color of golden straw with only a single vein of lazy carbonation trying its hardest to hold up the head which fades into a thin ring with no lacing
a : pale golden in colour , coming with a very creamy and thick off-white head that sustains throughout the drink , on top of light carbonation - looking superb !
a : poured a sexy orangle color with good carbonation and a nice fluffy white cap

appearance : cooper 's pale ale colour , dull cloudy dark gold/light amber . head retention low - dissipates quickly . medium carbonation - a small amount of lacing . does n't look too good towards the end of the beer .
appearance : cloudy . medium off white head .
a : pours an insipid , pale yellow , with no head after the first 3 seconds , very unattractive .
appearance : amber orange-hued body with nice fluffy haed . retained some , and had some stichy head bubbles all the way up the glass . nice
a : dark black , minimal tan-colored head . significant lacing . not a lot of carbonation .

appearance : a monster three finger head that has decent retention . the head is white , foamy , bubbly , and frothy . the color of the beer is a straw color with a yeast haziness . there is a lot of carbonation in the beer . the head left some lacing on the glass . the clarity is hazy .
a : a very smooth looking brownish red hue . perfect 2 finger head with nice lacing . and nice tight foam .
appearance : hazy amber with a sticky white lacy .
a : poured almost completely black with a clumpy , rocky head of tan foam . the lacing was terrific , and there was no light permeating the body of the brew .
a : the liquid pours a dark golden with a touch of amber beneath a thick , dense , dark tan head that slowly faded into a thick film leaving a great network of sticky lacing down the glass .
a : pours a pale yellow with really no head , dull and bland .
a : dark mahogany , bubbles with every drink restores a wonderful white head
a : pours a massive head that laces nicely . clear brown color , very bubbly . sounded like pouring champagne .
a : golden blonde . nice head that disappears quickly . very little lacing .
a : golden body , large dense white head with very good retention . lacing is also great .
a : pours a dark red , with a thick white head with great retention , and thick lacing all the way down , very impressive .
a : pours a clear golden straw body . a 1 '' bright white head fades slowly to a thick film . lots of sticky strings and dots of lacing are left behind .

a : pours a murky white that seems to glow from somewhere inside the body , capped off by an astronomically tall white head , into my hefeweizen glass . the head does n't dissipate like normal beers , but just clumps and floats on the liquid as it is being drunk .
a : espresso color , almost black with a tight creamy head . good luck letting ths bad boy sit in front of you and showing any restraint .
appearance : pours a hazy light-brown color . has almost no head and leaves almost no lacing on the glass .

a : a murky brown with highlights of red and purple ( ! ) with a nice head , though not very creamy . the head sticks around and laces the glass pretty nicely . the color is n't very appetizing , or really what i really expected ( i was expecting a red color for some reason ) . this does n't look like beer .
a : a blend of copper and amber . good retention and some lacing . a nice looking brew .
a : poured a rich copper/amber with zero head retention ( hope it 's not flat ! ) . decent lacing .
a : muddy redish brown with waaaayyy to much head that took forever to go away . the lacing was good
a : straw-yellow with only a thin cap of head with strands of lace down the glass . probably not the best pour in the world .

a : pours a dark burnt amber color with a very thick and greasy off-white head that took forever to fade into a thick oily film that left a complex network of lacing down the glass . very fresh , oily , and impressive . great head retention .

a : this beer pours a beautiful cloudy gold color with particles floating around ... a big three-finger head that leaves a thick spotty lace on the glass ... if you buy this beer , i strongly suggest that you pour it , because it is very hard to notice the beauty of this beer thru the brown bottle
appearance : very dark brown , tan head with some lacing .
appearance : pours a transparent brownish orange copper color with golden yellow highlights . 2.5 '' light tan head . good retention . lots of sticky lacing remains .

appearance : poured a brown amber , slightly hazy , with moderate visible carbonation . half finger bubbly head that disappears right away . not much lacing at all . does n't really strike me as classic witbier at all .
appearance : it pours a dark ruby brown practically black with a huge tan head leaves behind nice even lacing as it dwindles .
a : clear honey-gold color with medium-thick off-white head and ample lace . a very pretty beer .
appearance : this amber colored beer is a fair amount darker than the original mad hatter . it has a small amount of lacing .

appearance : cloudy , amber color . off white , very tall and very very thick head with good retention and some glass sticking . excessive amounts of carbonation ... everything it should look like in my book .

a : a large fluffy 2.5 finger head rises up and slowly fades over the very dark brownish-black color . n : nose actually has a lot of coffee , roast , some sweet syrupy malts , dark malts , a touch of vanilla , touch of chocolate .
a : pours a clear , maroon body with a tan head that retains poorly . it collapses into a bead on the glass , with some broken , milky swirls on top of the brew . no curtains during sips .
appearance : i drank it out of the bottle , so i did n't really get a good look at it . 3.0 by default .
appearance : black ... yummy black , with a chocolate brown head . this beer is absolutely gorgeous , i only wish the head remained a while longer .
a : into a pint glass . coppery-orange murky body with an ivory 1-finger head . lots of particles in suspension , including some fairly large chunks . good sheets of lacing left behind .
a : pours a ruby plum brown with a mild white head , fair retention , no lace .
a : a stark clear orange body with no head at all .
