a : hazy straw color , high carbonation , good tall head , but does n't last long .
a : pours like grape juice into my pint glass . minimal purple head .
a : pale yellow in color , mostly clear , with no real head or lacing .
a : deep , dark amber/copper . not hazy . got only a small head that disappeared after 90 seconds without leaving any lacing on the glass .

appearance : fluffy white head rises quickly and stops short of taking over half of my tall pilsner urquell glass , even with a careful pour . the head is large and thick , it laces nicely as the head drops to a honeycomb concave surface . high levels of carbonation yield a milky pool when swirled . once settled the solid crusty head and pale straw body certainly lend a typical lager appearance to this one .

a : dark brown , almost black . opaque with only a slight reddish hue around the extreme edge when held to the light . poured almost a 2 finger light brown head with fair retention . laced in thick sheets .
a : pours amber with an initial 2 finger head but drops down to a ring quick . no lace .
appearance : pours a translucent , dark red color . has large , foamy head that dissipates quickly and leaves some nice lacing .
a : pours pitch black with a tiny bubbly head . no lacing .
a : an orangeish gold body with nice white head that descends quickly and leaves to lacing . the beer is almost crystal clear ... disappointing .
appearance : pours a luscious opaque black beer with a light coffee coloured creamy foam head -- sticky with good retention .

appearance : pours a lot like a citrus soda , very fizzy . absolutely no head after about fifteen seconds ; not even any residual foam clinging to the edge of the glass . belgian dark ale ? only in color ... dark amber with ruby notes .
a : transparent golden amber color with very small white head that quickly fade down and no lacing left . carbonation is rather high and produce plenteous fizzy bubbles soar to the head .
appearance : maple red and quite pretty in color . i did n't get too much head on this and it left little to no lacing .
a : lighter copper colored beer with many particles in suspension , very little head that dissipated
a : cloudy orange , poor head retention , though , for a hefe , there are lots of floaties and yeasties in the drink , with literal black specs , floating around .
a : served a slightly hazy glowing golden citrus with a thin white head that faded into a long lasting collar . a few soapy spots of lacing were left down the glass after each sip .
a : a beautiful colored beer with a dark amber almost purplish hue . the head on this off white , thin and dissipates quickly . the beer has legs .
appearance : straw gold bodied beer with a white fizzy head that is gone almost by the time the beer is finished pouring .
a : pours a clear copper color with a fluffy head that fades to nothing very quickly , leaving no trace of lacing .
a : dark ruby body , dark brown highlights , with a fizzy pink head that does n't amount to much .
a : chocolate/dark mahogany color . caramel colored head dissolves quickly and leaves no lace .

appearance : it pours slowly and extremely foamy with an abundance of tiny tan bubbles . after a minute or so , the bubbles settle on top of the beer which is a lovely honey amber colored liquid . the head that forms is supper creamy , slightly oily and light tan in color . the lacing slides down the sides of the glass just above the head .
appearance : very pale yellow color . was n't able to coax out more than a finger of foam , which was gone in seconds . no lacing , nothing left to lace with .
a : the color of honey , mostly clear , just the smallest hint of a haze . nice cloudy white head , that seems to last for quite a while .
a : pours a very dark brown with two fingers of foamy light brown-orange head that reduced down into a thick film leaving some streaky lacing .
a : awesome look . deep ruby red color with 1 inch white head that fades at a decent pace .
a : jet black . little to no head . very little lacing
a : dark brown , slightly hazy , trickles of carbonation upon deeper view , thick foamy head settles to finger thickness , good lacing
appearance : bright amber , translucent body with a tight , off-white halo perched atop . really like the color . great head retention .
a : pours a golden straw color with a near non existent head that dissipates in a matter of 15 seconds . no lace to speak of .

appearance : poured from a one liter can into an irish pub style ( real ) pint glass on september 13th , 2010 , in low altitude galway , ireland . pours a thin head that quickly disappears . it 's a clear light yellow colour - you can see through it - and the carbonation appears a bit excessive .

a : it is a very pale yellow color , lighter than the color of straw . it looks like pear or light apple juice . there is a white fizzy head that disappears as quick as a soda would . the beer is opaque , and eventually leaves no head or lacing at all . it looks like fruit juice in the glass .
a : pours a very hazy dark orange honey color . enormous two finger , very frothy , beige head . heavy , layered lacing .
appearance : beer is black with very little head and low apparent carbonation .
a : the clearest double ipa i 've ever seen . a gorgeous red amber with a yellow tint . very nice ! no head to speak of .
a : it pours a clear brownish-copper color with some fizziness that dies almost immediately and leaves no head nor lace . i should have been warned by the metallic color .
a : pours a glowing yellowish orange with a small white head with poor retention but some remains along the edges .
a : standard porter color ... not a whole lot of head at all , but the half centimeter that was there stayed there .

a : this bee ris all looks . think a pretty v rod cycle of beers . frothy white head that lasts the whole delicious beer , the gorgeous copper rust color is also very attractive , in all honesty i have n't seen something not to like so it survives round one
appearance : cloudy orange/gold with a nice frothy head that retains for quite some time . looks inviting .
appearance : cloudy straw colored . white 1 finger head .
a : very dark brown/black with 1-2 finger creamy , off-white head with decent retention and rings of lace . the cascading is still a sight to behold .

a : pours a gorgeous burnt roasted orange color . clear with a real nice 1 finger khaki colored head . tons of bubbles streaming up the glass . real nice lacing . this one is definitely a `` looker '' .
a : the pour is quite dark , essentially black with a nice big tan head on it .
a : fairly pale yellow color . poured with a finger of white head . spotty lacing . looks kind of like a macro .

appearance : deep amber in color with a light tan head . the head is long lasting . good lacing . i 'm not sure i like how they call it an india pale ale right on the label , when it 's so dark . i want to compare it to nugget nectar and call it a hoppy amber/red .
appearance : pours pink , with a large pink head . lots of bubbles hence lots of carbonation .
a : a gorgeous deeep dark brown . nice head too .
a : the beer pours almost black in color with a finger of tan head .
a : beautiful ruby-brown near black body , with a solid dark-mocha head , with solid retention and lacing . no complaint here .
a : very little head but i believe i did n't pour it very vigorously so that might be why . head dissipates to patchy lacing . has a deep golden amber hue . crystal clear with no chill haze .
appearance : the beer pours a cloudy straw color with a foamy one finger head .
a : light yellow , clear
a : very dark pour which gives a huge head , coffee colored . fantastic sticky lacing all over the place

a : pours a very hazy , sediment-ridden body that ranges from pale rose to deep reddish brown ; on top there 's half an inch of fine white foam that comes and goes instantaneously , leaving only the faintest ring . disappointing .

a : clear dark copper body with some orange hues in the light . a tight , small white head dissipates quickly and leaves absolutely no retention or lacing of any kind . dismal , bland and boring for the style , oh well .
a : pours an extremely dark brown , almost black . about a quarter finger of mocha head fades right away . thin rings of lacing around the glass .
appearance : not impressed . it has dark , reddish color with a foamy head that dissipates very quickly leaving some lacing .
a : pours orange-yellow color with nice thick bubbly white head . slightly hazy , nearly perfect for style .

appearance : hazy golden brown . the bottle actually gushed a bit before i could pour , quite surprising ( thought only my homebrews did that ) . the beer had a very active head , intense carbonation that disappeared about 3/4ths the way through the beer . a small ring persisted , but did not lace the glass . flavor : first impression is the banana yeast , which mellows into a sweet fruity malt middle that has a mild hop bitter at the finish . fairly dry aftertaste . some alcohol noted , but very mild . some citric flavors come through as well , as the beer warmed , i noted an orange taste that was pleasing .
appearance : beautiful dark caramelly crystal clear body with huge foamy head with great lacing .
a : pours a clear gold with a soapy light white head . fizzy look , with no lace .
appearance : maroon , transparent with about a 3/4 '' off white head off the pour ; it seems to pour much like pop with a little crackling sound to for some carbonation
a : deep amber beer with two fingers of pale cappucino head which creates caters as it settles
a : amber/reddish-bronze ; light tan head ; some retention , great lace .
a : poured jet black with a huge frothy , tannish head
a : black , no bubbles , no head .
appearance : pale golden yellow with a minimal amount of head that quickly disappears .

appearance : i did n't have a small 12 oz . stange glass , so i decided just to use my 12 oz . pilsener glass that kinda looks like a small stange . the beer was a murky chestnut brown with a hint of honey to it . all i got was a small skim of white almost tan colored head of foam . it dissipated away too fast leaving behind a few white rings and no lace around the glass . i sure hope it was n't me using the wrong type of glassware that got that small skim of foam and no lace .
a : pours a golden yellow that is crystal clear with a steady stream of bubbles floating upward . a huge four finger white foamy head forms and falls slowly leaving very nice lacing behind .

a : wow , looks like strawberry juice except more vibrant . was n't expecting that . head is a nice pillowy , belgian looking head except a pronounced pink tinge runs through it . extremely sticky , leaving webbing everywhere on the glass .
a : pale , pale straw color , minimal head .
a : lightly hazed dark orange amber color . just half a finger of frothy beige head that fell quickly , leaving no lacing . 4.0

a : no head at all - it may have disappeared from the pour to my table . colour is a semitransparent hazy caramel-copper . sm : very hoppy . a touch floral . a standard ipa aroma . moderate in strength .
appearance : pours a crystal clear , pale golden yellow . very very light , but has a brilliant colour . fizzy bone white head with not much retention .
appearance : the color is the only part where the appearance gets points , there 's a nice dark ruby colors but other than that it looks like soda ; dismal head and syrupy with a hint of carb .

a : clear golden orange copper colored body with a rich and creamy slightly off-white head . a thick retention cap lasts throughout and amazingly splotchy patches of lacing on the walls . this is just a seriously killer looking beer for an ipa .
appearance : this baby is black ! oh man , the pour was a dark mofo . a mocha head with very light lacing . there is no seeing through this beer .
a : dark brown color . less than one finger of tan head that falls super quickly and leaves no lacing . some crap collected at the bottom . 3.5
appearance : pours a clear dark orange color with a 3 '' fluffy head that lasts a long time . thick lacing paints the glass .
appearance : pours a very dark brown pint with a finger length head that leaves behind a soapy lacing .

appearance : poured from a 22 oz bottle into a 19 oz crystal sniffer . this beer is just glorious in appearance . a beautiful golden orange color with equisite dancing carbonation coming from all sides . a perfect 2 cm white head that has the best head retention on any beer i 've ever had . i drank this one slowly and after an hour and half there was still a thin head on top . the 2 cm head lasted for at least 30 minutes . sweet sassy molassy , it is pretty . the head is made up of very fine bubbles that make it look so creamy but keeps it stiff . it was artwork in a glass .
appearance : a light tan head and a black body . light is able to just barely shine through . the head is really thick and creamy , it practically paints the sides of the glass .
a : a light amber color , well , depending on the lighting it gets a tad darker , but the head is non-existant , and doesnt lace ...
a : poured with a small head that dissipated quickly to a thin film . no real lacing to speak of . body is an amber/brown color , and almost completely clear .
appearance : color is a rich , dark mahogany with plum and crimson undertones ; a velvety caramel/tan head leaves heavy lacing as it recedes . this beer looks really , really good .
appearance : cloudy hazy gold , tightly carbonated with nice white head that dissipates quickly . good for style .
a : golden with amber hues . definitely lighter than i would expect for an american amber . good carbonation and nice lasting head though .

appearance : great looking english pale ale , clear deep golden body topped by a large white head that lasts acceptable well and leaves patchy lace . it looks refreshing and crisp - just what i want on a hot summers day .
a : a nice head , good lacing and promising color . appearance rivals any good lager !

appearance : free pour yields a one and a half inch rocky off-white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a few swatches and spots of lacing . pours a beautiful clear mahogany . leaves sweeping lacing around the glass . great looking beer .
a : it pours a cloudy amber-orange color with a huge three finger head that turns rocky late but lasts forever .
a : pours an orange color , huge head like most of the glass huge ... about 5 finger widths .

appearance : very clear light gold , with a slight warmth . pours with a light fine bubbled head that dissipates quickly leaving light lace . appealing . flavor : dominated by a metallic sourness of a single focus . lacking in complexity . moderated by a warm fuzzy moldy summer fruit ( peach like ) funk . finishes slightly astringent and papery . completely fails to deliver on what small promise there was in the aroma and appearance .

appearance : pours the darkest shade of brown possibly with no head and then suddenly loads of dark brown froth explodes . a healthy lace swirls like a hurricane and an 1/8 inch ring coats the glass .
a : clear , light amber color with a thin layer of foam residue . no lacing remains on the glass .

a : poured a rich dark mocha 3 finger head . deep rich black malt . ultra dark . head retention is great for such high alcohol content . lasted long with excellent lacing . by the end the top of the glass still held laced head .
appearance : clear amber-red woth lots of carbonation . head is quite audible , quickly dissipating , and an off-white color .

appearance : pours a slightly hazy yellowish amber color with a few floaties ... maybe hops ? ... i hope . there was about inch of creamy foam on top of the beer at first pour . the head retained for a couple minutes and was sustained by quite a few bubbles rising through the murky liquid .

a : clear , fizzy , pale yellow brew gives a big 3 '' of white head that settles after a while . actually a pretty good looking brew . head has decent retention , leaves spotty chunky lace and forms interesting 3d structure as it degrades .
appearance : pours a mildly cloudy golden/light amber color with two fingers of fluffy white head . a layer of head remains .
appearance : pale yellowish beige crystal clear colour , thin and struggling white lace from a semi-active carbonation .
a : clear pale yellow color with to much head but good lacing down the glass .
a : thin , watery , and yellow . kind of like what 's produced naturally after consuming beer . fizzy white head that dissipated quickly .
appearance : next to no head , and when it did occur it disappeared almost immediately . the body is a slightly lighter then average blonde that has some steady carbonation .
a : pours a clear dark reddish brown , with 1.5 fingers of bubbly light tan head . the head fades pretty fast , but leaves a thin layer on the surface . looks pretty nice .
appearance : pretty clear , golden or light amber color . three-quarters of an inch of head reduces to a thin , white layer . lacing mostly disappears but a minimal amount sticks around .
a : pours a brown color into snifter . huge and i mean wholly crap huge head ... took me several minutes to let the head disipate so i could drink it , good lacing down the glass .
appearance : orange-amber with off-white thick head that laced nicely . when first poured , lots of effervescence was evident as a continuous stream of bubbles continued to rise up to the head .
appearance : just a ring of lace lays on top , occasional bursts of carbonation after sipping give the lace some retention . nearly black in colour and a bit murky as well .
appearance : clear golden yellow in color with a spotty surface foam . no lacing develops .
appearance : light yellow , virtually no head , very little carbonation , but really clear
a : pours a dark , turbid brown , with a huge , voluminous white head , almost like a duvel in size , which leaves generous lacing .

appearance : a tad lighter than i had expected . the bottle obviously gives no hint to what is inside , but i was expecting something a bit more amber . a beautiful head is formed on the initial pour and holds wonderfully throughout the entire tasting . roughly a 9 srm . scent : the first thing i smell is a hint of that traditional belgian funk . nothing that takes over the beer , but just enough that says , `` we are now landing in belgium , i hope you enjoy your stay . '' the next thing on my nose is fruit . there 's banana from the esters , but also something sweeter , tropical , berry-like . we are talking bubble gum esters here . underneath all bubble gum is a malt driven beer that is just asking you to take a sip .
a : very light yellow color with almost no head , nothing interesting here .
appearance : two fingers of off-white foam . hazy amber body . great lacing and head retention .
a : solid black ; good carbonation , but very little head , dissipating quickly
a : deep golden , a little murky , inch of white head . spotty lace , head dies down to a very nice creamy layer . beautiful beer , looks like a mead or cider with a think layer of cream on top .
appearance : pours a clear amber color with a good size layer of off white head . good retention .
a : appearance is a nice crystal clear gold with a nice foamy head that lasted until finished .

appearance : crystal clear orange-gold body appears completely calm : no carbonation can be seen at all . the head is quite nice-looking : foamy , creamy , white , sticky ; looks like something you 'd see atop a good latte . lots of lace to be had , too .

appearance : ruby with chocolate hues , though this beer takes on brilliant strawberry pink hues under light . pours a big one inch head , with sticky lacing and good suds . medium visibility and low/medium viscosity . the development of the beer under light is pretty unique and impressive .
a : dark brown , nearly opaque , lovely cappuccino-colored head that falls into a persistent cap with nice lacing .
a : as the `` twilight '' hints - this is a dark dipa , medium chestnut brown in color with a long retained khaki head , heavy curtains of lace adorn the glass walls , gorgeous
appearance : looks like a less watery king cobra
appearance : pours a brown colour . vigousous pour leads to a thick off white head , lots of retention .
a : dark , translucent deep brown . like weak coffee . no head , no fizz at all .
a : black color . big fizzy light brown head degrades quickly to look like dish soap suds then further to nothing but dish soap lacing . one of the worst looking stouts i 've ever seen . 4.0
a : bright golden orange color . quite a bit of sediment floating around in the bottle . minimal white head with a decent amount of lacing .
appearance : pours a crystal clear pale gold with a fluffy white head on top . the head settles to a full cap with tons of spider web lacing covering the entire glass .

appearance : hazed pale orange body with some golden marmalade thrown in for good measure . big head on the initial pour , but it soon runs away and drops down to a thin broken scattered junk yard of froth . streamers add some excitement to the boredom .

a : medium cloudy amber color . very small head that fainted rather quickly which was a tad disappointing because i like bigger ones on wheat beer ( a weizen glass could have helped with this probably ? ) . decent small lacing .

a : poured from a 12oz bottle into a paulaner weizen glass . even with a delicate pour , there was a massive , 4 plus finger head ... .which sucks because now i can barely sip the beer . i dont know , this would be great if it were duvel , but hefeweizens should not have monster heads like this . cloudy bright golden color with strong carbonation . i did n't shake up the yeast on the bottom , so it 's not quite as hazy as it could be .
a : deep amber , quite opaque , very little head .
a : dark brown or black , but is not hazy or cloudy . a large white head which stuck to the glass .
appearance : amber-brownish color , murky . lots of carbonation . thick head that stick around . lacing looks good on the glass .
a : copper-bronze with a huge , off-white head , great retention & exceptional lacing .
appearance : pours a cola brown color with neither head nor lacing
a : pours black . about three fingers of thick , mostly creamy , secondarily frothy medium-brown-colored head . very good retention and lacing covering most of the glass . 4.5
a : this is one good looking beer . red with a cream colored head . leaves good lacing throughout . no haze or sediment . few tiny bubbles seen .
a : the beer pours brown in color with a small off-white head .

a : pours a nice amber color with a reddish tint ( semi-transparent ) and 1 1/2 finger head that is retained . the head began to conjugate in the middle after a minute or two . moderate lacing left on pint glass .

appearance : pours with an inch white head , dissipates fairly slowly . very clear , yellow-gold color . some lacing . flavor : sweet corn and grainy flavor masked somewhat by a harsh bitterness . some astringency .
a : anaemic , and a thrilling installment of the great disappearing head mystery .
a : exceedingly dark brown , nearly black . thick , frothy head with lots of lacing . a very good start . 3.5

a : pours a completely headless deep brown body . a few bubbles line the edge of the glass just after the pour , then no bubbles at all , just a flat , lifeless top . no lacing is formed . no carbonation is visible in the glass either .
a : hazy gold body , initial 1 '' white head quicky reducted to 1/4 '' & then stuck around for the entire glass . left a little lacing .
appearance : a thin whitish head that was gone as soon as it was there . the beer itself is a ruby reddish color , like the meat of a grapefruit .
appearance : very dark brown , gigantic head that cascades almost like a guinness , tons of head retention while i drank , tons of lacing .
appearance : clear dark copper color , moderate white head , fast fade .
appearance : poursa nice dark brown/red , like stained cherrywood . two fingers of creamy tan head leaves some lacing .
appearance : perfectly clear amber with two fingers of off-white foam . nice and frothy with good retention and stickage .

appearance : capped and corked , a very firm but smooth pull dislodged the cork without disturbing the noticeable sediment layer at the bottom . despite this effort , the bottle slowly but inexorably started to gush resulting in the loss of about half the bottle and churning the sediment into every nook and cranny of the beer . after it settled for a while , it poured a hazy gold with a massive white fluffy meringue head that lasted longer than the glass did .
a : pours an extremely dark brown with about an eighth of an inch of light brown head ( despite a rough pour ) that quickly vanished into the faintest collar .
a : beautiful hazy yellow-copper with a towering , rocky two-to-three finger head and sheets of lace

appearance : did n't pour out as dark as i had hoped , and once in the glass it 's completely transparent . body is deep blackish-brown in the middle and reddish-orange around the edges . a small , tan , foamy , head formed immediately , but it dissipated to a thin halo just as quickly . no lacing .

a : amber with a massive beige head that slowly recedes to a disk , leaving some sticky foam on the side of my glass . probably the best looking marzen of those i 've had in recent memory . crystal clear and gorgeous carbonation
appearance : a one finger foamy bubble head with poor retention and ivory in color . the color of the beer is medium brown color with garnet hues . the clarity of the beer is clear to brillaint .

appearance : an easy pour into my dfh off-centered ale glass , and the beer looks lifeless . the color is a light , cloudy yellow , and there is absolutely no head and no sign of carbonation . quickly looking through some other reviews , this appearance is pretty standard for this particular dfh brew .
a : very pretty - like glowing straw with carbonation streaming from the bottom - a gigantic pillowy head

a : pours a delicious ruby-chestnut body with a light rose-colored head that rises to 1.5 '' . the head recedes into a thick collar and some filming on the brew , with washes of lacing that track each swig and slide slowly down the glass . magnificent .

appearance : poured out thick , black and oily , forming a sinister char-brown red with red undertones . no light penetrates this beast ; it 's opaque all the way to the outermost edges . head retention is decent , it settles as a moderate-sized crown . stringy lacing .

appearance : black as night brew settles beneath a brown head , make thick from a vigorous pour . the strongest light ca n't penetrate that black body . head shows respectable longevity . as stouts go , it does n't get better than this .

appearance : pours into glass a very hazy/cloudy brownish color , does n't let any light through the glass at all , small head that quickly vanishes leaving a blanket over the surface of the beer . some patchy lacing remains on the glass with every sip .
appearance : this beer pours a dark shadowy brown color . not much head in this beer . what is there in terms of head is tan and quickly dissipating .
appearance : dark amber , mahogany color with a moderate head . thick lacing that lasted throughout .

appearance : pours a gorgeous crystal clear medium brown that is highlighted by orange and gold . over two inches of tight white foam sits atop and is slow to dissipate , lacing my stone ipa tulip nicely .
appearance : deep , clear red color with a very excited , very foamy white head that lasts forever . once in the glass this is a very impressive looking beer . great color on this one .
appearance : deep ruby/dark brown ( almost opaque ) with a tall tan head that lasted .

appearance : poured with a monstrously large amount of head that is reminiscent of a soft drink , and like a soft drink it did not stay around for more then a few seconds or lace . the body itself is a sickly pale yellow , that while clear , also seems to have small , lint like particles in it . the appearance of this beer looks disgusting and watered down beyond hope .
appearance : poured nicely with a thick airy head , the color of coffee cream . the head thins out rather quickly , but thin lace ring retained around the edge of the glass .
a : amber almost red color that is very clean and transparent . 1/2 finger white head quickly fades to a thin ring and a small amount of lacing .

appearance : holy crap , this beer is overcarbonated . i opened it ten minutes ago , and still ca n't fill the glass . every effort is repulsed by a tremendous avalanche of bubbles -- i waited until the head died entirely , then attempted to fill the glass several times with no success . i have no idea about quality control/consistency with watch city , but it looks like they rarely bottle their beers . this is supported by the very plain label with the alcohol content handwritten in black marker . anyway , other than the head , it 's a thick , cloudy dark brown .
appearance : dark brown without much of a head and with minimal , unimpressive lacing
a : pours an orangish amber color with a small white foam head that quickly dissipates . there is no lacing . a tad disappointed with the look .
appearance : nice jet black murky color with a deep brown head .
appearance : jet black with a huge billowy lingering lacing head .
a : highly carbonated like a true belgian . huge snow white head sits on top of an unfiltered golden hay colored body .
a : medium gold color . clean with scores of bubbles making their way to the surface . head is medium sized bubbles and unimpressive . beer should n't fizz like sprite when you pour it .
a : pours single finger head that dissipates quickly , leaving little foam on top . a golden honey color .

appearance : guinness is the archetype for stout , especially in appearance . watching the white head foam up out of the black body of the beer , waiting for it to settle out ... anticipation makes the drink that much better .
a : foam on top was thin and white , disappeared very quickly . dark caramel brown .
a : hazy ruby body ; totally flat . way too flat for a relatively non-ancient barleywine .

a : pours a cloudy orange / copper color with a thin white head that fades quickly . leaves some trace lacing down the glass . has slow carbonation up the center . this is n't the best-looking ipa i 've ever seen ; i prefer clearer-looking ones . thankfully , appearance is now a small weighting in the overall score .

appearance : it has a hazy yellow body with a thin white head . the head quickly fades to just a small ring of foam . lacing is minimal and slick , sliding right down the sides of the glass as i drink .
a : two thick fingers of head with medium-large bubbles . looks quite carbonated from a not so long pour . a deep amber color , quite impressed by its majestic hue of sunset .

appearance : that famous look -- dark brown to black , with ruby red notes at the bottom . the head is no more than a finger wide and is light tan and creamy-looking . it does n't just leave lacing , it leaves curtains !

a : this beer pours a jet black with a two/three finger head of light brown sudsy , rocky head . on the first pour receded quickly , second pour it hung around a bit longer . some minimal wispy lacing is left .
a : pour is pale golden almost a bit straw-colored . the white head is rather high and a bit creamy . dissipation takes some time and leaves great lacings .
appearance : nothing too distinct here just a nice golden look .
a : at least this beer looks good , because that 's all it has going for it . a black pour with a nice fluffy mocha colored head on top .
a : looks exactly like an unfiltered wheat beer should . a lovely , cloudy , pale atraw yellow .
appearance : pours a murky reddish brown with not much head at all . not particularly attractive .

appearance : all good ; warm deep brown color , very clear , tan big bubble head . good head retention - moderate lace . i 'd estimate srm at 24 . flavor : malty , sweet balanced , with a bit of roastiness , initially pleasant until the back flavors come through . then it 's just strange ; a strong dirty metallic flavor , plus a tinny sharp metallic flavor that just does n't seem like something you should drink .

appearance : even with about 3 oz reserved in the bottle , poured an opaque , copper-chocolate color . moderate cream head that dissipated completely . very little lacing . this style should typically be clear with a long-lasting head . this appearance is not typical of the style .
a : clear lager , medium head , low carbonation .
a : clear reddish clolor , disappointing head out of the bottle which dissipated quickly
appearance : one of the darkest black porters i 've ever seen . huge head , but it appears overly bubbly , like a soda .

appearance : free pour yields about 2 inches of fluffy , bone white head and 2 inches of beer . the head sticks around as long as that of orval or duvel , and like the beer it leaves thick , eternal walls of lacing . pours somewhere between dark copper and translucent ruby . really , this beer could n't look better .
appearance : thin white head that dissapears quickly , dark brown but red in the light ( an `` amber '' bock that 's a dark lager ? hmm ) a nice color though .
a : reddish amber color , fully translucent . minimal head with no retention at all . no lacing .
a : there was hardly any head and it only lasted for a millisecond . it poured more like a soda . i has a nice orange color . a little cloudy but it is a white . appears super carbonated .
a : dark copper amber , poured with a nice head that died to a thin collar .
a : pours with two fingers of white head . nice amount of lacing from the top of the glass down .
a : muddy orange body with some sediment and a fleeting hint of white foam . pretty much as flat and boring-looking as i 'd expect from a vintage english barleywine .
appearance : standard yellow gold body with a white , fast dissipating head . looks dreadfully over carbonated .
appearance : pours a tainted orange with minimal off white head that very quickly disperses and leaves nothing
a : pale yellow with a small head and little lace .
appearance : murky brown . no head . hazy . looks like gruel .
a : deep , dark brown . 2 finger cocoa colored head . lots of lacing . beautiful , simply beautiful .
a : pours a cloudy orange hue , with good head retention . a bottle conditioned beer that might have got roused up during distribution , should settle out if left in fridge for a few days .
a : `` thin '' looking . clear , looks like a light beer almost .
appearance : pours a hazy golden color with a billowy head that covered almost all of the glass with delicate belgian lace

a : murky , rather sickly looking pour , a grubby tan . among the more unappealing looking pours i recall : cloudy , thin head , scant film , lace is scattered at best . a roil of fizzy bubbles with each pour , gone in seconds - not winning any beauty pageants . a '3 ' feels generous ...
a : gorgeous , creamy head -- almost two fingers . ruddy amber-brown , clear in the light which highlights the thin streams of bubbles in the interior . good lacing . excellent .

appearance : pours with 1 finger of big-bubbled tan head . this settles very quickly to almost nothing , just a small island of thin foam . the beer itself is a medium brown and nearly opaque in the center . a very small amount of sediment remains in the bottle .

a : pours with a bunch of fluffy , slightly off-white head . very impressive for a barley wine ! there 's not a lot of retention , but it leaves a really nice lace . liquid is very clear , with a little copper/caramel colour .
a : nearly faultless . rich mahogany color , incredibly puffy 1 '' head that lasts forever , nice lacing .

appearance : out of the can , it pours a very nice dark brown with some reddish hues . the color is very opaque and is contrasted by a big coffee colored head . the head has some great retention , and slowly starts to die down , leaving some thick lacking along all sides of the glass .
a : pours a slightly hazy reddish amber , almost with a crimson tone . less than half a finger of head , but i like the color so much that it 's hard to knock appearance much .
appearance : pours a very clear golden straw color with minimal head , lading , and retention .

appearance : pours into my tall glass with an impressive 3 finger white head that dies back to a rocky finger leaving traces of lace before the first sip . glass is bright gold and like the label says , crystal clear . flavor : grain/wheat flavor is pronounced , hints of bubblegum and light fruit esters , slight lemon rind . overall , a clean and simple taste .
a : this is how a belgian beer should look . crystal clear pale body topped with a frothy white head and visible carbonation .
a : out of the bottle , a very slightly opaque clayish red . decent foamy head that leaves a decent lace .
a : poured into a snifter . poured a clear , but dark reddish-amber color in the glass . not much head , and it dissolved quickly into a collar of bubbles around the brew . no lacing .
a : pours a light golden with a three-finger white foamy head . surpisingly good sustain with lots of lacing .
appearance : huge head that never ends with a soft coco color . nice lace trails while pouring followed by deep dark chocolate color to finish it off .

appearance : always clouds in my beer , this is not chill haze , it was not ice cold . on a sidenote , why does appearance make up 20 % of the score and drinkability make up 10 % ? ? do n't we drink beer instead of stare at it ? ? i was not impressed with its color , it was a cloudy brown with a creamy head that would not go away until i started to drink it .
appearance : brown red body , opaque , with little head but a stupifying amount of floaties . i have never seen floaties like this . not even in the fantome products .
a : a beautiful , golden butterscotch colour . hazy
appearance : looks like black mud as it pours out of the bottle . thick . black . thick tan head . so thick not even superman can see through this beer .
a : hazy gold hue , slight head with almost no retention

appearance : `` thar she blows ! '' upon popping the cork to a loud `` pop ! `` , beer begins gushing rapidly from the bottle . by the time it settles down , i 've lost 1/4 of the beer . having paid $ 25 for this one , i was not a happy camper ... 2 finger off-white head disappears quickly , like the foam on a glass of soda . the body of the beer is opaque , and resembles pink grapefruit juice . ( did the little penguin in my refrigerator shake this one up on me or something ? ) chunks of pink cherry pulp can be seen rising and falling through the side of the glass . flavor : puckeringly tart . lemon meets sour cherry meets musty funk . very reminiscent of an `` umeboshi '' ( japanese pickled plum ) . the acidity worked very well with the thin slices of gruyere that i enjoyed alongside .
a : poured a nice thick black . held to light it has a nice hints of red peeking through . has a nice tan head that hangs out for a while . great lacing .
a : pours a light yellow colour , with great head retention , i was surprised at this and leaves some nice lacing , a very good-looking pale lager beer .
a : opaque black with the subtlest of amber highlights . great , frothy two-finger head , good retention , no lacing .
a : pours gold with a fizzy white head with poor head retention .
appearance : poured almost yellow-brown but is actually a deep ruby amber brown . very pretty . clear . little to no head that quickly disappeared .
a : poured with almost no head at all and what little there was dissipated in a matter of seconds leaving no lacing .
appearance : deep dark brown , lackig had retention badly . poured really rough , flat
appearance : arrives at the table with a hazy golden color and a modest head that did n't leave much lacing
a : does n't look like beer ! bright red almost pink . the head is literally pink
appearance : pours a reddish-orange copper translucent color with lots of hanging sediment visible . the head is a light and foamy off-white color with lots of staying power .

a : first of all , i do n't know if i got a funny bottle or what , but this beer was straight up chunky . not `` just a little sediment at the bottom '' , but large off-putting blobs of what i hope and assume was yeast throughout the glass , in suspension , after i poured it into a stein . i actually strained it into a another glass .
a : pours a hazy yellow-gold with two fingers of white head that recedes into a thin ring with no lacing .
appearance : pours a pitch black color with a 1/2 '' off-white head . not much lace and not much retention .

a : unfortunately , zon is the second beer from my boulevard sampler that did n't impress in the appearance department . the cloudy banana color gives a good beginning . a soapy eggshell cap forms on top only to disappear into nothing after a few minutes . a couple of wisps of lace were left behind .
a : pours a clear gold into an american shaker with a finger of head .
a : sky clear yellow colour with massive head .
appearance : poured a hazy brown/salmon color that produced a small light pink head that disappeared leaving lots of bubble rising to the top . very unique .
a : amber with a thin eggshell head . n : nothing but pure blueberry muffin . best smelling blueberry beer i can remember- inviting . some malt as well , nice .
appearance : black as pitch with coffee-colored head . however , if placed to the light it emits a reddish glow , like blood . very impressive .
appearance : pale golden color with almost no head .
a : dark red pour with a thick , two-finger width head . attractive , transparent appearance .
appearance : medium brown body , very small head that quickly dissipated .
appearance : blood red color , slightly hazy , peachy colored foam , quite a huge and spongey layer develops on a moderately hard pour , lacy

appearance : bottle 672 from 2006 . pours an amber brown into my aventinus glass . a very small head forms despite a vigorous pour . very few bubbles are left on the surface after just a short time . no lacing to speak of .
appearance : pours a deep red/brown color with almost no head . the little head that was on the beer did n't last at all .
a : clear amber orange color . light head , no real lacing . n : light malts , bit toasty reddish crystal malts . light earthy hops , slightly fruity hops .
a : it 's a very murky dark shade of oarange , nearly brown . there is a soft sliver of head , and no real lacing .
a : clear , deep amber beer with very thin head that dissipated immediately leaving no lacing at all .
a : bright yellow lemon/lager coloring with no head . i sure did get a lot of floaties too .
a : the beer looks decent , although a bit too light of a yellow color . the head is about what it should be ...
a : more transparent than what i was expecting . ( even for the style ) . white/slight yellowish head dissipated quickly . lacing did n't hang around much longer .
a : pitch black with a nice fluffy dark tan head that falls quickly and leaves minimal lacing .

appearance : a black pour makes a really small , thinner looking , overly fizzy , tan head with terrible retention . vanishes in a snap . black body and zero carbonation evident . a slight ring remains most of the way , but it looks rather flat by the end . boring .
a : really really watery , barely and color at all .
a : poured a glowing orange color , cloudy with a huge white cap , lots of foam and mighty fine looking
a : black , translucent body with dark brown glints . thin , fleeting head of off-white foam that settles into a ring . just fine .

appearance : pour creates a great looking dense head , very dense . it fades slowly , but almost seems to disappear the way it dissipates , and the fact that the head is so dense and frothy . some wispy swirls remain . the beer has a dark caramel color , very inviting .
a : pours a dark , hazy orange with a finger of dense white head that sticks around for the haul . it leaves a solid sheet of white lacing down the sides .
a : the head and coloring on this is flawless . beautiful thick rich creamy head that has staying power . never seen a head like this on macro lagers . color is not far off from an ipa .
appearance : clear , pale golden color with an initial one inch light white head which dissipated quickly to a thin layer of foam .

a : well , this one certainly isnt a looker . the body is a hazy rust red/brown , with so much haze that its almost opaque . no head whatsoever , just a ring of cream circling the outside of the glass ; theres literally just a mild discoloration over the rest of the beers surface . odd , but at least theres a nice web of bubble-cream as the beer starts to disappear . very thick and oily-looking , yet very flat .
a : pours golden straw , with a almost non-exsitant head , very visible carbonation .
appearance : mostly clear copper color with a large creamy off-white head .

a : it is black . that really does not do it justice though . this is the blackest beer that i have ever seen . the pour was in slow motion at it was really sticking to the snifters . more head than i thought would be on this beer . super deep mocha/ coffee colored . no lacing .
a : pours a slightly hazy honey color with a pithy finger of white head even after a vigorous pour . needless to say , not much in the way of lacing , either .
appearance : pour a carrot colored body with a good head and plenty of lacing
appearance : it is a very opaque like a stout there was not much for head or lace . what foam there was just formed a ring around the glass .

a : i am wondering if we have some type of a bottling condition discrepancy with this one . absolutely stagnant in the glass ! i poured vigorously , as always , and could not stir an ounce of motion . it says bottle `` batch-74-number . '' not sure what to think so far , i am considering aborting this post , but i guess i shall carry on . maple syrup in color with deep reds , nice color
appearance : about as dark as you can imagine a beer looking . except for at the edges of the glass , no light gets through at all . small brown head leaves some lacing .
appearance : clear straw yellow with a thin , fizzy head . looks like your typical macro .
a : deep brown , murky , very little head , carbonation is there but ever so slight .
a : fizzy yellow straw beer with a white fizzy head that had zero retention .
appearance : pours out like used motor oil from a 65 mustang that burns oil ! good head , about a finger or so . honestly it just looks pretty

appearance : murky honey-like color with very active carbonation . forms a huge offwhite head composed of large bubbles . it eventually settles down to a small layer of bubbles after about 5-6 minutes . this remains for a good while , at least the majority of the glass .
a : pours a clear amber in the glass . nice foamy head that retains moderately , lapsing into a thin film on top of the brew . foam lacing down the sides .
a : nice true golden color with a decent sized head that dissipates fairly quickly .
appearance : black body , white half-finger head that dissipates to very little lacing
a : pours a one finger head of bad thickness , no cream , and decent retention . colour is a cloudy yellow . sm : clove , banana , and wheat . a light aroma .
a : clear , dark mahogany , tan rocky head has above average retention and good lacing . unfortunately , it goes downhill fast from here ...

appearance : clear reddish brown color with thin , off-white lacing for a head . the carbonation slowly drifts to the top , almost like it does n't want to go . the head thins very quickly and swirling does n't really revive the head . it has no stickiness to it and barely stays together as on clump of bubbles .
a : standard pour produces a .5 finger foamy white head with poor retention . beer is a clear , kiwi brown . lacing is stringy with decent cling .

appearance : pouring creates a swirly cloud of foam that looks like milk being poured into espresso , in beautiful , downward-moving cascades of soft , creamy bubbles . foam comes to rest in a luscious , impossibly dense and creamy almond-off-white head with incredible retention . the whole thing is smooth as silk . a very , very attractive brew .

a : first off , as others have noted , the appearance is actually rather pleasing . it pours a very clean looking golden/ pale yellow with an impressive 3 finger head . retention was nice , and as it started to fade it left a great deal of spiderweb like lacing around the glass .
appearance : pours a dark amber with a finger and a half of fluffy foam .
a : muddy brown color , tiny beige head that settles quickly , minimal lacing .
appearance : poured into a duvel sniffter ; black as night , overflowing tan head , good retention and lacing .
appearance : pours a pale , golden , hazy color , like a witbier or other wheat beer . has a small , white head that dissipates quickly and leaves some spotty lacing .

appearance : the body has a pale hazy orange tan color with a small white head . the head fades out quickly leaving nothing behind and making no lacing at all . inside the body there are a few small deposits of yeast floating around .
a : deep dark brown to black in color . no head but a sparce line of bubbles barely formed a ring around my glass . no lacing .

appearance : turns up a one finger medium looking tan head with decent retention . black body , though it 's relatively thin and clear for the big abv , with basically no carbonation evident . head quickly fades to a wisp and a ring . only the ring remains until the end but leaves no lacing down the sides . a little lack luster , and not quite thick enough for what it is .

a : pours a crystal clear straw yellow with a creamy one and a half inch , creamy white head , good solid ropes of carbonation bubbling up from the bottom and does wonders for head retention which eventually bubbles away into a loose cap . could have benefited from some extra lacing because there is not much here .
appearance : pours a good lucking translucent to clear amber with a moderate head and quick dissipation . moderate lacing .
a : pours a hazy amber with a big light tan head that lasts for a while and leaves ton of lacing on the glass . this is the best part of this beer unfortunately .
a : poured a dark brown with not much carbonation and barely a head
a : barely any head on this one . gone in the blink of an eye . coloring is very coca-cola like . could all fit the style though .
appearance : looks like your typical macro lager . pours a translucent yellow color with lots of carbonation bubbles . the thin , fizzy head dissipates very quickly leaving some spotty lacing .

a : pours a solid black body , so dark even a flashlight was barely visible through it . a 3/4 '' slightly off-white head quickly fades to a tiny spot in the center and at the edges of the glass . lots of lacing is left on the glass , it almost looks like creme colored curtains .
appearance : pours a clear amber gold color w/ thin head that dissipates quickly . no lacing or retention .
a : pours black with a substantial mocha head . it looks like it might be infected .

appearance : a dark pour makes a small , medium looking , overly noisy , tan head that quickly dissipates to a fain , splotchy wisp and ring . black body with ebony hues around the edges , and zero carbonation evident . a slight ring remains but leaves no lacing down the glass . head is unimpressive , and it looks a little flat by the end .
a : amber/orange . it 's clarity reminds me of a precious jewel . pours a two-finger head which dissipates to a ring at the edge .

a : hazy golden in color . lots of bubbly carbonation and huge , soapy white head that has staying power ... has tons of nooks and cranies . great looking texture . once the head finally retreats into the beer , there 's a pretty thick film and lots sticky lacing . great looking beer .

a : pours a pale orange color ( not that bright ) with a minimal head and poor lacing which is to be expected . there are little floaters in the beer , not sure what they are , but i 'm sure it 's fine , just detracts from the appearance slightly .

appearance : so my experience started out simple enough , and this beer looked alright . poured a deep dark caramel brown ; started with a 1/4 finger head that 's creamy and tan and fades quickly to nothing but a thin whisp on the surface ; body is entirely opaque .

appearance : pours a clear dark ruby-brown color with a 2 finger , dark cream colored head . the head settles to 1/2 inch and sticks around the whole time leaving a moderate amount of lacing on the glass .

appearance : this was a pale , golden-orange beer . the head was white and coarse , disappearing quickly and leaving no lace behind . toward the end of the drink , all that was left of the foam was a light ring around the edge of the glass . the beer was slightly hazey with thin streamers of yeast that slowly diffused out into the beer .

appearance : wow , liquid tar pours out of the can and into the glass . this stuff looks like it could stain the glass its in . black as night . absolutely no light comes through ... the brewery could n't have said it better ... '' this dog 'll hunt ''

appearance : pours out brown and perfectly transparent . way too light and transparent for the style . makes a one finger , medium looking , tan head with decent retention . dark brown in the glass with medium carbonation evident . very transparent . head fades to a decent wisp and ring , but by the end only a faint ring remains and leaves no lacing down the glass . much too light for the style . disappointing .
a : pours a flat hazy dark purple with absolutely no head . some small bubbles formed a weak collar around the glass after a moment .

appearance : brilliant yellow in color , minimum but lasting bright white head flavor : good crisp hops up front ( floral , orange ) , some acidity , followed by a good base of grainy maltyness , and a pleasant bitter finish .
a : it looks like grape juice . no head or lace .
appearance : deep orange , almost red . nice white head that is fairly stable
a : light hazy straw yellow . half finger white head with decent retention and lacing .

appearance : a nice light tan head that has a 2 finger head with some retention . the body of the beer is a dark mahogany color with garnet highlights . the clarity of the beer is opaque with some highlights .
a : a very potent blend of fruity sweetness and peppery alcohol . honey lemon and sweet bananas are pretty detectable .

appearance : i actually really dig the rich reddish brown of this beer . it 's unfiltered so pretty opaque . i did n't notice much lacing or head retention , but then , i do n't pay much attention to that anymore .

appearance : racy head is not as bad as the previous two thiriez brews which i tried , but it does seem over-active . deep white head forms with a uniform topping at first , but it soon collapses in an irregular manner which produces a rocky surface . pale golden-yellow colored body looks thin at times , flashing with a faded straw look when back-lit . carbonation is like asti spumanti .
appearance : pours a clear orange ( this is syracuse , is n't it ) with a thick head that does a nice job stranding some lace
a : pours a hazy golden honey color with a massive white fluffy head that sticks around and laces the glass . impressive head is like a cloud . beautiful looking beer .
a : clear straw body with a thin , fleeting white head . mediocre .
a : hazy brown shish body with decent head that laces very lightly .
appearance : nice strong golden color with hints of copper present .
appearance : cloudy golden-brown color with a slight amber hue . smaller white head that dissipates quickly and does n't leave behind any lace . does n't really look at all like a hefeweizen .
a : poured dark brown with a moderate head . appeared thin . i was expecting a thicker beer for $ 16 a bottle .

appearance : pours a rather murky looking burnt orange color with a small head of active tan bubbles that were disappearing as fast as i poured the beer with nothing to remain , really . there is a very small ring where the beer meets the glass . there is no lacing left on the glass after drinking .
a : pours a viscous pitch black . a tan head gently rises to at least 3 inches , and sticks around . sticky lace all the way down the glass .
a : a lot browner than i expected . actually , more like a deep copper , with very few red tones if any at all . tiny rim of head , with not much lacing to speak of .

a : the rim of the top is doused in yeast . head is three fingers , quite thin , has only slight cream , and retains pretty poorly for a trappist beer even factoring in the 7.5 % abv . colour is a solid dark brown-amberish . floating yeast particles abound . not particularly appealing . sm : yeast and nuts . a moderate strength scent . me broken nose ca n't detect distinct notes . all apologies , lads .
a : not much head retention . no lacing either . typical porter shade - brown with red tint .
appearance : poured dark black ... like there 's any other kind of black ... could use more head and lacing .
a : clear , golden-yellow , with a ton of fluffy white head ( the 250ml bottle over-flowed the petrus glass ! ) . leaves some nice belgian lace .
a : one finger head of little cream and decent thickness . retains alright . sm : cream , caramel , vanilla , butterscotch . very appealing .
appearance : deep thick jet black , with a big fluffy medium brown head that leaves huge lacing . pretty much exactly what an imerial stout should and can be . yes : perfect .
a : pours a white wine yellow with an inch of quickly fading one inch bleached bone head , hadly even a ring at all on this one , bits of carbonation bubble up from the bottome of the glass .
a : pours dark brown with a good sized head that makes a late entrance . plenty of lacing .

appearance : amber glass , with maybe a suggestion induced purple bruising , has excellent clarity and holds a thin head that manages some respectable lacing before dropping to a scant collar . flavor : the blueberry note is pretty well balanced , not being overwhelming but up front and predominate . there is a light sweetness to the beer which complements the fruit . no hops noted . malt base is a bit toasted . mild bread flavor working as well ; total package makes me think blueberry bagel .
a : very pale yellow color with generous pure white head .
a : the beer is an extremely light yellow color , with a thin white head that fades quickly and leaves a thin lace on the glass .
a : gorgeous beer ! this looks like a lemon merangue pie . cloudy vibrant yellow body with a creamy snow white head .
a : pours a black with a thin tan head . decent lacing on the glass
a : pours a one finger head of soft slight cream , fair thickness , and terrible retention . colour is a cloudy yellow-gold . sm : bittering hops , cream , and barley . aroma is mild in strength .

appearance : holy foam , batman ! beer-to-head ratio is somewhere around 1:8 , even on a truly gentle pour . hmm ... well , head dimples down around the edges in an entertaining fashion , giving me time to enjoy the beautiful ochre styrofoam-like wispy lacing on the edges of the glass . beer itself is opaque-brown , with yellowish tints in the narrowest parts of the glass .
a : clear dark red-brown with two-finger , off-white , rocky head that lasted more than a few minutes . great lacing .

a : pours a very dark brown , with ruby highlights when held against the light . head is large on an agressive pour , but bubbles are enormous and the head sadly collapses very quickly to only a desultory ring around the surface . carbonation appears moderate .
appearance : pours a clear amber , with a pasty-white , watery head that quickly dissipates . lacing is abysmal .
a : pours clear amber . 1 finger head . looks tasty .
a : amber red in color but slightly darker and cloudy , good head to start and stuck around for a while .
a : golden , autumnal with little bubbles . excellent clarity . can agitate a transient head . no lacing .

a : wow ! this one is a sight to see . silky smooth black color , jet black . pours with a huge khaki colored head , that reduces slowly and leaves nice full cap on top . tremendous lacing . impressive .
a : staw colored brew with apricot highlights . very cloudy and mysterious . seriously aggresive carbonation with a towery mashed potato head . stunning .
a : the beer has a nice orange/yellow color that is very cloudy . a good white foamy head forms with a bit of lace down the glass .
a : perfect pour into an imperial pint . 1.5 '' head . midway between straw and copper , nice bubbling . good head retention .
appearance : pours a somewhat hazy , run-of-the-mill amber ; smallish , snow-white head ; a-cup 's worth of lace ; not much in the way of hed retention .
a : appears a brilliant clear copper with hues of red , creamy white 1 finger head , little lacing
appearance : light brownish/gold , hazy , poor head formation and not much retention of that which does form , a bit too brown for a wit
appearance : hazy orange in color , no head retention and no lacing . nice color , too bad there is no head to speak of .
a : pours a very dark brown near black color with two fingers of dense light tan head that slowly faded into a thick frothy film leaving rings of sticky lacing .

a : pours a nice dark brown with a huge fist sized head . this cork did not pop out with the same force as some other reviews but it did come out real easily . it took a while to pour this beer due to all the foam
a : clear , amber/yellow in color with a thin/quickly dissolving head . light to medium carbonation is evident . 2/5

appearance : very little head off the pour . the murky body sits calmly in my snifter , showing off brown edges and brash viscosity when held to light . white bubbles meander around the surface , but that 's it in terms of head ; looks flat . surprisingly weak glass-coating as well .
appearance : poured into a glass : a rich golden-brown with a nice thick foam head . looks very appealing , especially when the light hits the glass just right . mild lacing .
appearance : pours a cloudy golden color with two fingers of thick off white head . the head retention is quite good .
a : consistent burnt amber color . vigorous pour reveals only minimal head , which dissipates . not much carbonation .
appearance : pours up a clear , brown body with a frothed , ivory-hued head .
appearance : mildly cloudy , pale yellow color . it looks a bit like a cloudy budweiser or something . the head is about 2 fingers worth and dissipates quickly with little lacing .
a : dark reddish brown with some light escaping near the bottom of the glass . one inch of creamy lightly tanned head with good retention and leaves thick lacing .
appearance : pours a very dark brown with orange/brown highlights . a tall , 2 '' head that is cakey and shows great retention . lots of coating lace remains amongst the craters .
a : dark brown - amber color with low carbonation , the head is not to prominent and disappears somehow fast . light body and no layer of bubbles remains on top .
a : pours a murky amber with a half finger of off-white head that slowly fades .

a : i decanted this one slowly and this reveals a crystal clear ruby red beer with a beige two-finger thick head . lots of carbonation . the head recedes very slowly leaving gorgeous lacework . pretty !
a : poured a deep black with a tiny mocha head . by all accounts what a stout should look like

appearance : looks like a brown porter , dark mahogany , good clarity , thin head , not much retention ( but that 's not unusual for this style ) flavor : rather bland , some dark roastiness up front and a bit of a malt finish , not too much hop flavor/bitterness/aroma , quick finishing ( i.e.- the flavors that are there do n't linger at all ) , some graininess and a slight twinge of tartness
a : chocolate syrup brown with dense , oatmeal-colored 1-finger head that retains well and sheets the glass .

a : standard pour initially produces no head but one magically rises from the deep dark depth of this beer . .5 finger . it disappears almost just as quickly . possibly the blackest brew i 've ever seen . it not only does n't let any light through , it seems to suck up the light around it . lacing is spotty at best and does n't hand around .
a : murky brownish with a beige head that vanishes quickly .
a : head vanishes quickly and leaves no lacing . body looks like an ipa . nothing at all remarkable here .
a : reddish dark brown color with very little carmel color head . very light carbonation .

appearance : pours a startling contrast of yellowish at the bottom moving towards a dark orange copper near the head . cloudy throughout . the head is an off-white with tons of bubbles . it quickly recedes , but there remains quite a film around the tops of the beer and sticky lacing all down the sides of the glass .
a : deep brown almost black color . minimally carbonated and did not form a head . 4.0
appearance : pours an attractive garnet with honey folds , a small white crown , minimal retention or lace .
a : transparent dark golden and copper . zero head retention to speak of .
a : copper-orange ... actually dark pumpkin . just like the color of a pumpkin pie . slightly hazy , but almost no carbonation . thin white head dies quickly and leaves no lacing at all .
a : back , tan head ,

appearance : super high score except for the head , the appearnace is of a great apple cider just made in front of you ( of course due to non filtered/non pastuerized ) , the lace isnt much to comment about , so no 5 here . carbonation seems ok on looking .
a : clear than i was expecting and lighter too . a bright and clear copper and topped with a rather quickly disappearing bone white head .
appearance : dark copper with a reddish twinkle . very light tan , small but thick creamy head with good retention . excellent lacing , leaving rings as it goes down .

appearance : amber orange glass is topped by a good two fingers of head that started about 3 and a half and laced as it settled . flavor : coriander is strong , but under it i get some buttery biscuit notes and a hint of coriander infused hops .
a : pours yellow with a surprisingly long lasting head for an adjunct lager , no lacing .
appearance : a very nice yellow body with bronze notes , that while not showing much carbonation in the body , produces two fingers of head that both laced well and retained exceptionally .
a : a hazy light orange color with a soapy head . can see sediment suspended in beer .
a : fair cream and thickness , but bad retention . colour is a dark orange-gold . sm : cream , butterscotch , caramelized malt , and barley . a mild strength aroma .
a : pours dark brown with a finger of tannish foam which falls over a couple minutes to a sheet of the same . spotty lace . limited clarity . ( 3 )

a : opaque purplish black color . just a tiny , tiny frothy beige head despite an aggressive pour . i 'll give this a bit of a break since it 's four years old , but there still should be more carbonation in this . 4.0
a : clear golden color ; decent head but no lacing
appearance : golden-yellow-hued body , rapid rising bubbles . lager like , not head .
a : dark black with a decent tan head . when held up to the light there is a barely noticable hue of redness . mild lacing .
a : poured into a mug . sweet hallelujah -- ruby red color , thick egg-white head , a boatload of lacing . this deserves a 5 , which i do n't tend to give very often for appearance .

a : it 's funny that largadeer referred to this as looking like bile , because that was my first ( unspoken ) thought upon seeing the glass . it 's a murky puce body that does n't look all that appealing . swirling produced a nice head that lasted for a minute or so .
a : clear , yellowish , macrobrew look .
a : pours completely opaque black , no lighting . 1 1/2 fingers of tight mocha head forms and holds well . some decent lacing throughout .

appearance : when poured into a brooklyn brewery euro pint glass , this czech beer is a dark burgundy with a few dark ruby red highlights . the color was great , but the head of foam needed some work . it was less than a quarter of an inch in height and what appeared to be an off white color . it was too little to tell , but i 'm 95 % sure that it was an off white color . what little head of foam was there quickly dissipated into islands of white bubbles sitting on top of the beer . it did n't want to bother with leaving any rings or lace .
appearance : cloudy for the style . dark golden color ( not straw ) , a little dark for the style ?
a : beautiful nearly black with milk chocolate brown edges and a baking german chocolate cake head , 2-3 fingers , with prodigious amounts of lace .
appearance : the beer had a nice nitro head when served but the head discipated and left a little lace . i was n't sure why the head did n't last that long with the nitro .

a : at first glance , it looks like a standard lager . but no ! look further ! it 's light and clear with a straw color , but the carbonation is abundant . the head is thick , white , and totally creamy . and it does n't ever dissipate . tons of lace are left on the glass by the finish . this is as good as a light colored clear beer can look . 5/5
a : pours black with a two-finger foamy head . good retention and lacing .

a : this is a murky yellow brew . virtually no head , very thin . cloudy and reminds me slightly of toilet water that has recently been urinated in ... i once asked someone `` what makes a beer look bad ? `` ... this would be my answer ... but i do n't give it a 1 as i assume there still could be something worse out there .
a : crystal clear coppery amber in color ; good off-white colored head of about 3/4 '' reducing slowly into an uneven layer of bubbles . good lacing . it just looks pretty !
appearance : pours a light amber with a soapy looking head that fades fairly quick . no lacing . carbonation is also on the light side .
a : nice looking bottle . pale golden brown color with a soda-like fizzy head .
appearance : pours an opaque black but as it 's poured i see some definite brown tinges . insanely thick , frothy head that 's at least 3 fingers thick with a light mocha color .
a : perfect nitro pour with a creamy white head and a blood-red body .

a : pours a murky light brown with significant chill haze ( yes , i carefully decanted off the yeast ) . formed a nice head that settles to a tight cap and follows the beer down the glass . no lacing .
a : poured from a bottle into a weizen glass . clear yellow , with a large head of foam . there was no lacing left on the glass .

appearance : an amazingly hazy brown body capped by a simply massive fluffy off-white head that measures over four fingers . i 'm glad i was a little cautious with the pour , otherwise this would have probably taken 20 minutes to get into the glass . the head fades slowly and leaves the barest patches of lacing .
a : slightly cloudy yellow hue , with a white head . no retention or lace .
appearance : pours an extra cloudy , amber in color , very minimal size head here with not much lacing or head retention to say the least .
a : the beer 's glaring weak spot . deep chestnut brown with nice clarity . however , a small and fizzy cream head struggles to form , retreats to a ring quickly and leaves no lace .
a : pours black with two fingers of brown head . lacing lasts a few minutes .
appearance : hazy dirty orange color with some yellow highlights . short 1 '' head falls quickly , and some spotty lacing develops during he session .
a : pours a half-finger head of poor thickness and no cream . pathetic retention . colour is a clear gold . sm : very malty . some nutty hops .
appearance : i watched that pour , and was quite disappointed at the lack of head this beer produced . the color was a plane dark amber , and overall this was n't much to look at .
appearance : poured like a dream - was really excited to drink this after the healthy pour that came out . huge frothy head , beautiful reddish gold hue .
a : pours nicely with a yellowish color and mild carbonation .
a : pours great semi hazy yellow , pillowy head .

a : two fingers of dense foamy pristinely white head . excellent retention being aided by lazily paced bubbles . very hazy and opaque except when held to light . pale straw golden yellow body . looks divine in the glass . s &
appearance : a wickedly murky deep brown color , barely letting traces of light through at the edges , revealing a slightly lighter brown color .
appearance : pours a light golden color with just a fraction of head . does not last too long .
appearance : clear golden yellow in color sporting a bright white one finger head that lasted a while . mild lacing developed .
appearance : quite cloudy . orangish gold . minimal head dwindles to wispy minimal lacing that does n't last to long . some effervescence .
a : pours a bright clear golden color with a huge fluffy white head . lots of chunky lacing left behind .

a : i poured it fairly quickly , due to the note above , and it looked marvelous as the cascading effect allowed a thick , creamy head to form . after about a minute , a one finger layer of cream sat on top of a honey colored brew . i really enjoyed watching this .
appearance : dark brown - not black - with light brown around the edges . half inch light beige head that fades quickly leaving a few big patches . nearly no lacing .
a : dark brown , thick and appears chocoately , decent head , lots of lacing . looks good .

appearance : pours into an allagash tulip a deep burgundy brown with ruby red highlights . a 2-finger high light tan head forms on top and takes absolutely forever to drop . it settles out at a tightly bubbled , one finger high cap . lacing comes in a few spotty patches scattered about the glass .

appearance : comes in a big , badass , blue swing-top bottle , the usefulness of which will probably long outlast the beer it originally held ( i homebrew ) . pours a somewhat murky golden color with a decent head .
appearance : pours with a satisfying `` glug glug glug ... '' an attractive dark amber color . big , frothy head . good lace . very nice looking beer .
appearance : not too lively . with a color similar to water-dilluted urine , a thick head that fades within seconds .

appearance : ew . sounds like rice crispies . looks ... nasty . fizzy white head disappears in a matter of seconds . color is light copper , and body looks very watery . after about 45 seconds , there is no head left - absolutely none . i 've only seen one amber this bad before ( wingwalker ) and it was made by the same brewery . go figure .
a : jet black , as dark and opaque as the night sky in an arctic winter , with a thick , tan head , which leaves voluminous lacing .
appearance : pours a moderate colored yellow . there is very little head retention . nothing impressive .
a : a nice , light amber color with a foamy two finger head that sticks around for a while . nice lacing .

appearance : clear and bright golden . looks like very little carbonation , i can see a few bubbles , but not much . head dissipates rather quickly leaving a layer of foam..and i can see some lacing stick to the top already .
a : very clear orange/yellow color with what started out as a `` soda-like '' head that disappeared .
appearance : piss yellow , with a finger length of foam that quickly dissipates .
appearance : solid golden . pretty flat . not much foam or carbonation , unless you shake it a bit or take a sip .

a : appears a cloudy , reddish orange with a tan and dense head which leaves micro bubble lacing . i know they are going for the unfiltered thing to preserve all flavors , but this hazy red just does n't look the most appetizing.. its kind of murky
a : pours a clear amber body . no carbonation , but it has nice legs down the sides of my tulip .

a : this beer pours a solid copper color , minor sediment is visible in the class . a 1/2 inch of white colored head sits on top that recedes relatively quickly but leaves ample spotted sheets of lacing .
a : very clear yellow . lots of bubbles rushing to the top . soda pop-like head that lasted 20 seconds .
a : pours a hazy orange-gold body with a small beige head . good retention with some lace . s ,
appearance : wow ! a centimeter high head that disappears within 5 seconds . moderate carbonation . orange amber color . darker than most adjuncts . very little lacing .

appearance : after a fairly aggressive pour i was left with barely even half a finger of head , that of course did not retain nor lace . the beer itself is a orange and amber color that has a slight bit of haze and seems to be a bit lacking on carbonation .
appearance : pours a golden yellow with a nice puffy white head .
appearance : pours a very dark brown with light only coming through at the edges of the glass . there are two fingers of tan head with good retention and not much lacing .
a : dark , opaque beer with minimal head from a fairly agressive pour . what little bit that 's there is tan/mocha in color and there are some legs on it from the alcohol .

a : this looks great : at first it 's all foam , then the white large creamy head starts to set and reveals a golden to amber beverage . the head stays longer than it takes me to finish the beer and it stays creamy the whole time .

appearance : pours a smaller medium looking tan head that slowly pops away to a thin film . color is burnt umber with some ruby hues . minimal carbonation evident . a thin film remains until the end but leaves no lacing .
a : pours just as black as i have seen , with a foamy khaki tan head .

a : amazing . completly jet black , no light penetration whatsoever . thick tan head , at least an inch and a half that does not dissapear , it stays there for the entire duratation of the drink . i just recently found out that this was nitro-tapped and that is what gave the `` cascade '' head formation . it as amazing to look at and i found myself staring in awe at it for a long time before i started to actually drink it .
a : pours a murky , muddy chocolate color . little head or lacing .
a : fairly clear orange like color with a nice fluffy head . good lacing as head dissipates . good looking beer .
a : reddish amber with a very small head , spotted trails of lace
a : light yellow straw . barely any bubbles .
a : a dark brown to burgundy color , almost carbonation free , looks thin - 2.75 ,
a : what very little head there actually was recedes immediately amber color .

appearance : i got to say this is the highlight of this beer . the beer pours a nearly peach coloration . the head is big thick and biege . good retention is noted . very nice lacing remains behind on my glass .
a : pours a hazy dull orange color with a super frothy head that is just sitting there doing nothing , which is quite amazing .
