appearance : this brew resembled to every detail a very rich italian espresso , both the color of the beer and the color of the head . the beer is a deep espresso brown , with tiny espresso foam colored carbonation rising to the top . the head was thick , and ranged from light beige to brown . it settled fairly quickly , but left a nice lace in its trail . gave it a couple swirls and head bounced right back . so resilient !
a : clear amber orange color . poured a 2 finger off-white head that dissipated to a merangue-type dollup . lace in thick rings . lightly decanted .
a : a cloudy bright brown color with a superior creamy head .
a : this one is almost black , a very dark ruby red . it pours with a large white head ; lots of lace and good retention .
appearance : hazy peach colored glass does n't hold a head for long , not much to look at honestly .
a : brown or a thin mahogany in color . pours with a very large , stable , light tan head . good lacing .

appearance : as i pour , foam starts very slow and i 'm wondering if i 'll much but near the end it balloons to a solid 3 finger head . and retains itself for a few minutes at least . lacing around the rim and coats the glass all the way down . color is a hazy , dark amber .
a : hazy yellow color . nothing to write home here about . hardly a half cm of head that quickly went away .
a : pours a two finger head of lovely cream , decent thickness , and fair retention . black colour . sm : hoppy body . caramel . vanilla ?

a : the perfect pouring stout . nice large 3 finger espresso colored head that settles down nicely to a small pillow atop the brew . there is also very nice lacing down the glass . this one could make people ' magazines 100 most beautiful list .
a : deep ruby red , pale , pink head just is no more than a thin ring around the glass . beautiful to look at .

appearance : served a light amber with almost no head ( that was n't the bartender 's fault ) . what head there was disappeared before i had a chance to pick up the beer . the amber color was alright though , crisp and clear , similar to the taste .

appearance : golden , yellowish-straw in color . small head compared to a normal hefe/dunkel/weizen . almost zero lacing as well . i was expecting aventinus but hoppy but this brew looks more like a hefeweizen .

appearance : pours a hazy , light orange/coppery color and starts with a huge 3 finger head that is very foamy and slightly off-white ; solid retention and the head leaves large , puffy and dry swaths of lacing as it slowly fadfes to a full and rocky skim that is about 1/2 finger deep still ; as mentioned , body is a little hazy but still shows strong carbonation .

a : a massive off-white head almost explodes out of the tulip . body is a cloudy golden , amber and orange with floating yeast particles . head retains like creamy foam and sticks around for 2+ hours ( yes , i 've been sipping on the beer for that long ) .
a : pour a golden-peach color with a couple fingers of light bubbly white head that faded into an oily film that left rocky lacing down the glass .
appearance : arrives at the table with an espresso color and a foamy , thick tan head that sheets the pint glass with lace
a : pours surprisingly clear , looks like a pilsner ; fluffy white head , not much retention , but it leaves a little lace .
a : the beer pours a pitch black color with a small wimpy tan head ...
a : copper and hazy with a nice white head and gorgeous lacing . could n't ask for much more .
a : really beautiful crystal clear amber body with some straw highlights and a beautiful bubbly off-white head that has ok retention but sticks to the sides of the glass
a : it looks like a cola . there was no head whatsoever , just a dark brown cola looking , undercarbonated beverage .
a : what can i say ... perfect ! ! ! white one-finger head with a dark gold color . carbonation was visible and the beer itself was somewhat transparent . filtered quite nicely ! ! !
a : pale copper with a creamy white head . surprisingly light for an ipa .
appearance : pours a cloudy golden orange beer with a towering 3 '' off-white head . great retention with lots of soapy lace .
appearance : deep copper/amber , cloudy , disappearing orangey head
a : pale , unimpressive yellow . high clarity , no head to speak of . very little lacing .
a : pours a pale yellow , with a poor white head , bad retention , and no lacing . head dissipates in a matter of minutes .

a : well , okay . i have to admit , i 'm drinking this out of a can . seriously , who pours hamm 's into a glass ? not me ! up the punx ! ; ) but it 's your typical american lager . that 's what it looks like . nothing special .
a : this pours a bright golden color with a half-finger of fizzy white head that dissapates quickly .
a : looks like fred . amber in color with no head , collar or lacing . chunks and threads of peach veins are floating around . it actually looks kinda disgusting . 1.5/5

a : this was one of the best looking pours of stout i can recall . i 'm usually not much for appearance ratings to begin with , but this thing looked gorgeous - thick , ruddy brown head that stood 1 '' tall on a 3 '' pour in my tulip glass . the head remained for at least 5 minutes after the pour .
a : shiny transparent yellow with a thin but fluffy head . the lacing is not something i am usually impressed about but the rings that were left on this were the best ive ever seen from a beer .
appearance : brown and opaque . nice tan head with amazing retention .
a : light . yellow . slightly more deep in color than coors light , etc .

a : pours a half finger head of fair cream and decent thickness , but merely okay retention . colour is a nontransparent dark amber . sm : amber hops , light caramelized malt , and light grassy floral notes . also unexpected light nuts . a moderate strength aroma .
a : pours a deep brown with some light passing through , thin white head with good retention , splotchy lacing

a : clear pale amber body under a breathtaking 3-finger head that towers confidently above the rim of the glass . big , creamy , and white , this might be the best looking head i 've ever seen in a pint glass . amazing .
a : no head . shit clear yellow colour . unappealing . sm : water and barley . light as all hell .
appearance : pours a clear amber color with a finger of off white head . good retention .

a : pours a pitch black body with 2 fingers of dark mocha head capping the brew . retention is great -- even a bit frustrating . my hands are shaking . must have craft now . ca n't wait for head to die .
a : pours a clear , gorgeous ruby red with a big frothy head . heavy lacing and great retention .

a : perfectly clear orange-amber body sits sparklingly beneath two full fingers of frothy eggshell foam . the head initially peers just over the rim of the glass , then slowly recedes and leaves a nearly full coating of thick , sticky lace . the properly branded glassware certainly does n't hurt , but regardless this is a spectacularly beautiful ipa .
a : beautiful two finger fluffy white head . ruby red amber color . lacing and head remains for the entire beer .
appearance : hazed tan//maroon bottle , fine sediment visible throughout . not much head to speak of .
appearance : the best part of this beer . the color is a lovely brown with hints of copper around the edges .
appearance : a very pretty pour , with a clear pale lemon color and a massive head that leaves gobs of lace
a : dark brown with a 3 finger tan colored head that has excellent retention and lacing .
a : had a decent head out of the bottle . very light , but bubbly .
a : semi hazy straw yellow , smallish head , ok lace . 2 bb sizes chunks in bottom of bottle .
appearance : no opacity ... c'mon , this is a stout ! where 's the black patent ? minimal head .
a : looks great . black with a 1/2 '' thick dark brown head .
a : dark hazy brown body with a thin head of super fine white foam . not much retention , but a bit of delicate lacing . pretty forgettable .
a : a dull amber with a large fluffy white head . retention is decent . not entirely clear as i am able to see some particulate matter .
a : took about 3-4 minutes for the head to dissipate . dark chocolate brown in color .
a : pours an orange amber color with good clarity . head disappears completely with little lacing .
a : jet black , no head
a : golden with very little head .

a : this is one of the nicer pours i have had in a while ... deeper in colour than they will often be , it 's almost copper but has a gold hue to it , as well . head is frothy , creamy , and has something of an orange hue to it , and it loves to hang around . retention is great , with a nice wall of lace left all around the glass and about a quarter finger of head remaining as it is consumed .
appearance : pours a bright , clear brown brown with a foamy , light beige head .
a : pours a hazy gold with a huge off white head , leaving thick resiny lacing . lots of chunky goodness floating around in there .
a : pours a dark amber , with a thick soapy white head . thick lace .

appearance : im not quite sure how to rank the beer . it is bottle conditioned and carries a definite haze . i know this isnt stylistically appropriate for a pils but since this is an imperial pilsner , im not judging it to the classic standard . i still think that an imperial beer should retain some of the character of the base while exaggerating others . i am scoring it rather low in this category . the color is a copper with a slight patina which also doesnt correspond to what one would expect in the non-imperial version of this style . im not deducting any points for the color because this is what i expect when almost twice the normal amount of malt is used .
appearance : straw yellow .
a : pours a thick black with about a finger of coffee-colored head which quickly and completely vanishes into nothing with no lacing to speak of .
a : good clear red color . quarter inch of head , falls quickly and does n't leave much . looks like a quality brew .

appearance : pours into a sam adams glass a clear orangish gold with a 2-finger bone-white head . it shrinks to a full cap with amazing retention . the lacing forms as levels showing the size of each sip .
a : pours luscious deep gold . honey , amber and tawny highlights . one inch of creamy white head , with good retention and lacing .

a : the beer screams dipa . clear golden body ? check . finger and a half of white lacing ? check ? insane lacing ? check . the lacing was some of the finest i have ever seen . almost looked like a belgian ipa .
a : amazing . hazy , deep golden color . thick , billowy head . good lacing .
a : very cola esque but darker , but thicker , more syrupy . sporatic rising carbonation . no head .
appearance : slightly red hue and somewhat cloudy . has a nice head .

appearance : black , viscous , with a lasting brown head flavor : chocolate/coffee from dark malts , a bit of candied cherries , some slight oxidation , but not much in the way of typical bourbon barrel flavor . almost like a imperial porter but with more of a bite like an imperial stout .
a : black body under a medium sized tan head . good lace and retention . good looking beer .
appearance : pours dark with a caramel like head that quickly shrinks to nothing.no lacing occured while drinking , which disappointed me .
a : pours a clear , pale orange with half a finger of beige head that almost completely vanishes and leaves no lacing .

a : poured a dark , dark brown , nice 2 finger tanish head that settles into a thin cap , nice lacing on the sides of the glass . held up to light , there are nice deep ruby/garnet hues to the edges . beautiful beer .
a : no head , some bubbles . very high clarity with a light copper colour .

appearance : crikey mate ! pours a pitch black beer with a four finger chocolate milk coloured head that 's creamy , foamy , thick , sticky , clumpy and appears as if it 'll never go away . outrageous .

a : whoa , this head is fantastic . as soon as i poured , i knew it was going to be thick , but what happened next totally surprised me : the head stayed in place at the size of half my glass . it didnt appear to be moving at all . so i went and made a phone call , and , when i came back , there was still quite a bit of head to go . official time : seven minutes to move from half a glass to two fingers ! incredible ! and the lacing , too superb . add in its midnight-black color and this one has got to be one of the best looking imperial stouts ive ever laid eyes on .

a : one finger head , devoid of cream , rather thin , and of average retention . cloudy dark lemon-yellow colour . sm : muted lemon esters are disturbed by bland hops , a restrained pine note , and pleasant tree resin/sap .
a : thin brownish red with a solid white head , good retention , and great lacing . excelent carbonation streams . n : sweet malts and , uh , nothing else

appearance : pours an extremely dark brown , with some light coming through when held to light . less than a finger of light tan head formed after a pretty hard pour , and that dissipated pretty quickly . kind of disappointing in the looks department , actually ...
appearance : ultramirky deep dark almost purple brown with an eggshell white head .
a : pours a 1 finger frothy , white head with decent retention . beer is a deep , clear orange . lacing is sparse and with little stick .
a : bright . clear amber color . poured a half finger fizzy white head that that dissipated quickly to a thin skim . decanted continually . no lacing .
a : pours jet black . no light getting through this one . minimal frothy chocolate brown head that disappears quickly . sticky brown lacing .

appearance : a lighter orange/rust color which is kind of murky with the amount of sediment dancing around . not really an attractive color to me . a half-inch head develops which quickly dissolves to a thin layer of foam on surface .

a : poured vigorously , which earned me a lofty head , at least 3-fingers , of bubbly/frothy light tan . it subsides after a couple minutes , resting then as a denser cream upon a pitch dark porter . only a sliver of mahogany-brown shows when held to strong light .
a : pours a rich dark brown with almost no head to speak of .
appearance : pours a very light yellow color with a 1 '' head that breaks down immediately . no lace develops .

appearance : tonight i am reaching for one of my standard glasses in my cupboard , my dogfish head goblet which always creates a nice head due to the etching on the bottom . i proceeded to pull off the cage and pull the cork out and surprisingly it slipped out fairly easily . when the cork released there was almost no popping sound and this worried me right off the start but i went on . on the pour i decided to go slow and straight on trying to entice some form of head and i never got it . there is absolutely no bubbles or foam on this syrupy ale . when i hold my glass up to the light it is a murky hazy deep plum and brown color with no light passing through . something i noticed that was different was that there is a shiny sheen that catches the light every once and a while on top of my beer that resembles a oil slick . as typical i gave a generous swirl and was left with a fairly heavy lacing creeping down the glass walls .
a : slightly hazed , medium amber body with an inch of fine , creamy off-white head on top . terrific retention , sticky lace . great looking beer .
a : a hazy orange color ( not sure if the haze was my fault from handling ) . dinky white head died pretty quickly . loads of carbonation .
a : a very light amber/orange with a hint of yellow on the edges , quick dissipating head with a bit of lacing
appearance : black as night with a coffee-colored head .
a : clear , dark maple with less than one finger of diminishing off-white foam head . no lacing remains on the glass .

a : this beer looks heavy . it pours slowly , and looks very viscous . its a nice copper/orange color . the carbonation appears light . bubbles from the bottom of the glass are having a tough time getting through the beer to rise to the surface . impressive . i thought this might be unfiltered , but its crystal clear . the head really sticks to the glass well .
a : pours a beautiful deep mahogany color . a large creamy beige head forms and gently recedes and leaves sticky lace down the glass .

appearance : very hazy and not clear at all . kind of a brownish hue of orange , almost like an overripe orange in the fruit bowl . head leaves very impressive lacing that has n't budged an inch since the initial pour .
a : pours black with no head . meh .
a : pours a semi opaque amber brown with a very small off-white head with poor retention .
a : poured into pint glass . just a little head on it , with a bit of lace around the rim . brew is a light , clear , copper color .
a : pours a slightly hazy bright golden color with a thick slightly off-white foam head . there is nice lacing down the side .

a : pours with an enormous head that fills up most of the glass , rises over the edge , leaving maybe 4 oz of liquid on the bottom ... and i have n't even poured the entire bottle yet . the head is fluffy first and rocky later , ivory white in color and incredibly long lasting . huge peaks and craters cover the surface . as it eventually fades , chunky sea foam lace coats the glass . the body is rustic orange with medium saturation and very clear . very few interior bubbles .
a : umm ... . more like a `` brown lager '' . small bubbly head with very little lacing .
a : pours a wood stain brown with a perfect off-white head
a : poured a dark black color , small head that dissipated very quickly , no lacing .
a : pours a clear golden orange color with no head or lacing . to say that this was disappointing would be an understatement .
appearance : nice sized chocolatey brown head . real good retention and lacing . needless to say , the body is black .
appearance : solid black and thick as hell ( great looking stout )

a : outstanding . the beer looks dark as night when sitting on the counter ... however ... hold it up to light and you notice a wonderful ruby red translusence . beautiful . a medium tan 2 finger head sits atop it 's creator just waiting to be sniffed . it holds forever ...
a : has a roasted red appearence that is very inviting . poured smooth and looked rich and flavorful .
a : pours black . has a copper colored head .

a : a sultry auburn pour with a fizzy , fast-dying head of whiteness . remarkably devoid of character after some early sizzle ; the result ( after a few seconds ) is utterly devoid of carbonation and lace , a mildly murky dullness that wo n't impress even the most forgiving 'beer geek ' . a few floating bits , suspended like 'sea monkeys ' , but no lace or head at all .
a : pours a deep chestnut brown with a fluffy tan had that quickly settles .
a : crystal clear golden amber . solid three finger off white head . good retention . thick sticky lace clings to the glass .
a : probably the coolest label art ever . opens with a soft hiss . pours a dead black color with very little head . ( my only gripe with this beer . )

a : standard pour yields a barely-there cluster of large , dark mocha colored bubbles that dissipates quickly . a thin ring of chocolate colored foam serves as the only real head . beer is opaque and pitch black . lacing is non existant but the legs make my glass a dark tan color . lack of carbonation really hurts but the legs and color are nice .
a : opaque golden-orange . light carbonation and virtually no head . n : booze , banana and dust .
appearance : deep orange with a slightly brown-orange head . lots of co2 showing up in this one .

appearance : chocolate velvet with assertive lacing . pitch black . dark brown head like the bottom of a cup of turkish coffee . the bubbles are just plain fun to watch disperse after the pour . like a herd of wildebeests crossing the nile during gator mating season , these little black-brown bubbles scatter from the head back into the brew from which they came .
appearance : golden yellow in color with a thick 3 '' head that lasts a long time . nice lace paints the glass .
a : really pretty beer . nice brownish amber color with ruby highlights . 2+ fingers of off white head . extremely rocky with good retention and lacing . top marks by all counts .
a : pours a very deep brown with a creamy tan head , good retention , leaving nice lace .
a : poured from a bottle to a pint glass . had an amber color and a clear consistency . there was a small amount of foamy head that quickly dissipated . not a whole lot of lacing .

a : a semi vigorous pour produces 3 fingers of creamy/frothy light-brown head with lasting retention . the body is med-dark mahogany brown and magnifyingly clear . bb shot sheets of lace around the glass . good looking brew . s &

appearance : an obfuscated shade of titian ( obfuscated and titian being my secret words for today ) , with strange little chunks that came in two craptacular colors , cheese curd white and corky brown . thank goodness there were n't too many . the shallow cake of yeast made a half-moon in my glass .
a : extremely hazy orangish-yellow with a fluffy white head . it really is an attractive looking beer .
a : pours a clear golden yellow color with a white one-finger head . there 's an abnormal amount of carbonation flowing up toward the surface .

a : brilliant straw , with great clarity . a soapy head of huge bubbles comes and goes in a flash . active carbonation bubbles are the biggest i 've seen this side of a bottle of soda . leaves no lace .

a : what a lovely pour ! i think i agree with some others - this seems a bit too powerful to be called `` pale '' . a rich , rich golden colored ale , very slightly cloudy . the head was high and mighty , a nice contrasting eggshell color . lasted a fair amount of time considering the highish abv .

appearance : this beer looks incredibly promising when it is poured . it is a hazy golden orange color with a little more than 3 fingers of white head . lacing looks great when it reduces ; clumpy , fluffy , open and abundant that clings all over the glass .
a : pours pitch black with almost two fingers of light brown head . carbonation is very thick and seems to stick around forever . beautiful .
a : like used motor oil , black as midnight . the head was a good finger thick , toffee-colored . head lingered , as did the lacing .
a : pours a golden color with a little bit of white head .
a : great orange/amber color with cascading nitrogen foaming and staying on top throughout the beer . foam stuck to the glass and my upperlip .
a : pours a hazy bright golden with a massive foamy head as every good hefe should have . super-long sustain and massive lacing . perfect .
appearance : dark amber color with a tannish/offwhite head . the head was abundant , exploding into the glass and settled to about 1/2 finger thickness , never getting smaller .
a : clear , medium golden color with one finger of white foam head . heavy lacing remains on the glass .
appearance : i love the way a kriek looks , dark red in color with a bit of pink in the half inch of head . kinda girlish , but i still like it

a : poured bright orange with a filmy head and an unusual amount of sediment . odd brightness which almost came through like grapefruit juice . n : hops , lots o hops . ample and sweet fruity hops . some fuminess and more than just the bitterness as it warmed .
a : black coloring , like a cup of coffee ( duh ) . tan-colored head .

a : out of the bottle and into my pint glass , it has an orange hue that is probably better described as amber . very thin head disappears almost instantly and leaves neither lacing nor a crest behind . the brew is very translucent , and you can spot a tad bit of bubbling within .
appearance : with respect to the head , there is n't much ; formation ( ~0.5 fingers ) , retention , and lacing are minimal . the beer itself is colored a very dark brown with a hint of red .
appearance : pours very hazy with no head . color is golden with hints of amber
a : very dark and delightful , a wonderful looking stout . very nice creamy light brown head . s ; roasted coffee with a malt smell , pleasing , but not exceptional .
a : poured a 1 finger fluffy , creamy chocolate head with unbelievable retention . brew itself was near opaque black . frothy lacing was full and outstanding .
a : the barleywine is a deep copper red , very hazy , with a small white head and no lace .
a : pour is almost strawcolored with a soapy large white head that only leaves faint lacings .
appearance : pours a very cloudy golden/amber color with a bit or orange coming through . just a layer of white head that disappears right away . i hope this one tastes better than it looks .
a : pours clean and golden with copious amounts of thick , white head . excellent retention , leaves tons of lace . did n't know pilsners looked this good .
a : cooper color pour with big long last head . great lacing .
a : this may be the lightest colored beer i have ever seen . extremely pale yellow with a head that died in under a second . no lacing .
a : black with three fingers of persistent toasted foam . spotty lace .
appearance : copper hued . creamy with a tiny bubbled white lace .
a : the pour is a muddy brown color with very little to no head .
a : pours a dark , slightly hazy , hazel-amber with a very thin white head that reduced into a faint collar leaving no lace . looks a little bit like soda .

appearance : nitro can did it & # 8217 ; s job well , big frothy head which settled into 3 very distinct layers . the base was jet-black beer ; middle layer was darker , cascading foam , topped by a creamy mocha head . it all settled down into a good finger and a half of taupe creamy head that went the distance and laced wonderfully . this is eye candy from start to finish . flavor : the initial taste is entirely neutral . no real flavor at all , just mouthfeel ( see below ) . this beer is all about aftertaste . at the swallow , the beer starts a drying evaporation that leaves a complex taste . it seems to have a malt base because of a fine , table sugar mist that accompanies the drying . deeper in , a taste of smoked bread ( is there such a thing ? ) the hops come into play very late in the profile with a burnt coffee bitter that is very refreshing .

appearance : poured into these massive snifters that seemed like they could hold the full 750ml somehow ( probably an exaggeration ) ... dark mahogan body , huge chocolate beige foam head and great retention
a : pours a very pale yellow , with a light cap of fizzy white foam , spotty lace .
appearance : dark brown , with an active , overly zealous slightly off white head . do n't pour this baby too fast , or it 'll over flow the glass . carbonation is steady and rushing .
a : the beer is a light yellow color with a very thin white head that fades very quickly and leaves almost no lace on the glass .
appearance : pours a murky , dark brown color with some brown edges . the head is cream , 1/2 '' tall and short-lived , with some spotty lace that remains behind .

a : pours and opaque , light mahogany with no head , whatsoever . i 'm not sure if this was a result of a piss-poor pull or the chemistry of the beer . i did try to swirl things up and with the same results ...
a : as it 's poured on tap , the light amber colour comes with a very creamy and frothy white beer head and extremely fine bubbles attached to the glass ... leaving very tight lace too~~
appearance : a very pretty pour , with a clear amber color and a frothy head with good stickage and lace
appearance : the beer is a light golden amber color . there is a thin white head .
a : pours a cloudy brownish-copper , no head ; light , slick lacing that does n't stick at all
a : 2 fingers , small bubble , relatively even head . strawberry brown , no visible internal carbonation . quickly disappating head .
a : clear copper under a huge white head . good retention and great lace .
a : pours very dark brown , almost completely opaque , with a large tan head . the lacing on this is very nice .
appearance : the body is a clear amber color . the head is a just darker than white color , a ton of sticky lacing , very dense , great retention and medium sized bubbles .
a : deep brown , almost black liquid . light brown creamy head .

a : almost crystal clear just darker than straw yellow body with a highly effervescent body reminiscent of champagne with a fluffy white head of ~1cm that drops to a cap and leaves nice lacing . virtual perfection for a beer .
appearance : pours a dark orange/brown with a short lived slightly tan head.there appears to be ample carbonation as evidenced by the many columns of beads rising to the top .
appearance : black , light tan head dissipates to a cap that sticks . decent lacings hangs out .
a : pours a dark brown , not quite black with a two-finger tan head . light lacing .

appearance : 22 oz bottle dipped in crimson-colored wax , which is ridiculously thick . awesome label and presentation . the beer itself pours a dark but clear reddish-brown with two fingers of off-white head forming from a vigorous pour . the beer is just barely transparent in my tulip glass . head retention is decent for the style .
a : this pours an extremely thick black brew with almost no carbonation . i thought it might be flat until i checked some other reviews . got a brief thin dark tan head by snifting .
a : black as sin , even when held up to the light . a creamy , nutty-brown head with serious retention . heavy lacing .
a : pitch black with a thick creamy brown head . some lacings .
appearance : pours a medium brown like a murky cider with a huge white head . lots of sediment floating in my glass . head stays forever with lacing all the way up my glass .

a : what a gorgeous pour ! in my duvel tulip , this sits a mostly clear light amber with a gorgeous 3-finger thick off-white head . retention is excellent , and the lacing , beautiful . could not possibly want more from a beer 5/5
appearance : no head retention , dark amber colour , not really pale looking at all
a : transparent . head lasts for days , lots and lots of bubbles . lots . and lots .
a : very dark , bit surprising for a wee heavy . bout a half inch of white head with good lacing on the glass .

a : solid black body ( surprise ! ) topped by a majestic light brown head that shows truly noteworthy retention and leaves tons of sticky brown lace - this is exactly what i want an imperial stout to look like : exactly .
appearance : medium gold body , almost no head on the pour . very little carbonation visible .

appearance : an aggressive pour yields a huge 2 inch head that is brown is color with varying sized bubbles . the beer is opaque black , where no light can escape it . the head is pillowy and unrelenting , leaving plenty of lace against the crystal .
appearance : this has almost no head from light carbonation and a bright copper color with transparent edges .
a : what a beautiful pour , copper in color with tons of frothy head that eventually subsides to a thick , creamy layer that leaves tons of lacing around the glass .
appearance : beautiful dark brown liquid , a finger of light tan head which dissipates quickly
a : pours a dark mahogany with sightly less than one finger of head which quickly dissipates .
appearance : think raspberry ice tea out of a drink fountain at mcdonald 's .

appearance : a one finger head that is ivory , creamy , and frothy , with poor retention . the color of the beer is a medium amber color with orange hues . the clarity of the beer is clear with some haziness . the head did leave a little lacing on the glass .
a : a not timid pour resulted in a substantial , very light brown head that sticks around for a good while . lots and lots of lacing . the beer is surprisingly translucent when held up to the light .
appearance : dark amber , head on the smaller side . good head rention and lacing that clings to the glass . lots of bubbles .

a : a medium to dark brown with a thick bubbly tan head that dissapates rather quickly leaving almost no lace . nice color but with the lacking head and no lacing it 's not that impressive . belgians typically look great in the glass , this one does n't .
a : pours a light , gold/straw color with a small fizzy head that is gone rather quickly . no real lacing either .
appearance : golden blonde , with effervescent white head .
appearance : peach-colored
a : looks like a nice brown ale - dark brown , lighter highlights , tan head of a good size .
a : very thin , tan watery head . half a finger width and zero retention rate . deep chocolate dark , moderate lacing . weird little floating bits ?

a : huge white head arrives and remains atop a glowing yellow-orange beer . extremely clouded with yeasts , can not see a thing through it . like the color a little more on the orange side , but this is close enough to perfect .

a : pours a nice rich amber/copper with some ruby highlights and an absolutely massive , mountainous beige head that just simply will not give up . took me at least 5 minutes just to be able to fill my glass 3/4 of the way , and i was being perfectly gentle ( yet undecided if that 's a good or bad thing . ) crazy lacing .
a : thick and hazy , but with not much head at all . both mine & my friend 's glass had no lacing and virtually no head . disappointing for a wheat beer .

appearance : red poppy pours a murky dark ruby color with lighter ruby highlights . about 1.5 fingers of tan head forms . lacing and retention are decent . this is definitely not a beautiful beer , but not bad either .

a : if its filtered i just do n't think it should be a wheat beer . i know technically its the same , but i guess i should be happy they do n't name it a hefe . golden yellow in color , low carbonation , but the head is 4 fingers wide on first pour . dissipates quickly though to allow you to fill the glass .

a : poured according to the directions and wound up with a massive head . toward the end of the pouring , the beer did n't even make it beyond the head- it hit the foam and just created more . beautiful dark golden color , the head dissipates slowly , and leaves lacing all down the glass . beautiful .
appearance : clear blond color. , no head at all
a : golden orange , clear , huge 3 finger foamy white head that looks like pillows of clouds bursting out of the glass . great head retention and lacing .

appearance : first off , this beer is highly over-carbonated . it 's so fizzy that a small 4oz pour creates enough head to fill-up a 20oz glass . the foamy head is very light , meringue-like and takes forever to settle . the beer itself is a cloudy/hazy copper-amber with brown hues . obviously a bottle-conditioned ale , and potentially an off one .

a : pors a very dark orange in color . kinda freakin me out a bit . this looks damn near brown , and glowing orange brown tends to scream barleywine to me . . . not wheatwine . held to the light , a little bit of golden yellow peeks through , but barely . a pretty agressive pour gets me just a minimal amount of white head , but that stuff is gone as quickly as it showed up . no real lace going on here . the only thing good about the appearance is the color , but that is a bit off as well . hmmm .

appearance : 3/4 of the bomber was moderately poured into the tulip , leaving a full 3 fingers of fluffy bubbly white head . this is probably the nicest looking head i 've ever seen in this glass besides the beer it was intended for . body color is dark orange . absolutely fantastic lacing .

appearance : a cloudy , hazy yellow-bodied beer . head is nonexistant to begin with , so retention is necessarily pour , as is the lacing . almost has an oily sheen on top - a little strange . having no real benchmark for the style , i 'm gon na have to give it a 2.5 .
appearance : pours a murky dark brown , low carbonation , very minimal head retention .

appearance : a twist off cap whispers as i crack it . the beer pours a brown color with red highlights . a 1/2 '' light yellow/ivory head surfaces and shows a little bit of retention . not much lace left behind .

appearance : creamy , salmon-froze pink and ultra-sugary : just aseptically-rightfulness hitherto in the like of fashion of how i maintained my beers : some bubbles , cloudy skinning/body-mold , watery alcoholic smells ... but granted to waiting a few 15-20 seconds of elapsed visualization , the froths sets in and it has this straightaway white-laced head , good for the show , and even better for presentation . there were a lot of bubbling going about from bottom to top , giving the old `` yeast metabolic transfer '' ... lovely ... ever-so very shiftily pleasant ... nice ... big ... sings a different song ... and how ! thank the lord and all up above i poured this one determinedly cooled pup into my patriots nfl pint ; it really kicked the moment ; i 've been using my ( much larger ) coka-cola rimmer for most of my overpopulated reviews . this is a fresh of breath air . and how ! -goddamn- .
appearance : it has a unique look . it pours a burnt-orange color that glows like the fluid in a lava lamp . thin head that looks like the foam on a glass of iced tea .
a : deep black , thin head , no head .
appearance : golden in color with a hint of red , not the orangey/amber hue i look for in a good pumpkin . no head to speak of .
a : it poured a dark thick black with a dark rich chocolate head that was massive , sticky and lingering . as the head slowly fell it left a bold lacing around the glass .
a : this thing is beautiful , everything i would imagine from an imperial stout . pitch black , foamy dark brown head turns into a fizzy thin ring . nice lacing going on here . very nice appearance .

appearance : a full 3 finger head evaporates before my eyes with such haste that i check to see where the nearest exit is located . glass is crystal clear faint yellow . flavor : cream soda with a flash of plastic lime juice with a finish that goes completely stale and reminds me of dirty gym socks .
a : bright , clear golden color topped by a perfectly white head of big bubbles . a lot of visible carbonation supporting the head . lacing just sticks to the glass .
a : the beer is very dark brown in color and poured with a finger high light mocha colored head that has excellent retention properties and consistently left a thin head covering the surface .
a : straw-golden yellow with some head ( white ) .

a : an aggressive pour yields a fine , tan head that settles relatively quickly into a collar with a few islands of bubbles remaining . the body is hazy -- i like the yeast -- but pretty clearly a deep , dark red-brown , rather than the expected pitch black . pretty , but more in line with a dubbel or quad .
appearance : almost no head . bright yellow body .

a : maybe the best looking beer i 've ever seen . poured the blackest black . no light had even the slightest chance at this one . the slightest head , maybe 1/4 finger , and went away instantly . head never came back , even with an aggressive swirl . no lacing ( but with no head what can you expect ? ) . huge alcohol legs . just a beautiful beer !
appearance : pale gold in color , nice head retention and lacing .

appearance : its body is black as night and opaque with a typical nitro head on top . the head is a creamy light tan color , very thick and very creamy . it has very good retention and makes cool lacing on the glass as i drink .

appearance : i gave this a hard pour into a nonic pint glass which resulted in a solid one finger tan head that lasted for only a moment or so . the beer poured a very dark brown and maintained the slightest lacing throughout .
appearance : cloudy light orange that resembles a hefeweizen , only without the billowing head . looks completely flat with no lacing . cloudy apple juice maybe ?
a : pours a ruddy orangish gold with a massive frothy head . you 'll want to pour this one slowly so the entire glass is n't foam . carbonation is not an issue with this one .
a : caramel color with large head that disappears quickly .
a : solid black with no head .
a : pours a clear , pale gold color with a fizzy , one-finger white head . the head quickly recedes to a small ring around the glass , which does not lace very well .

a : brilliantly crystal clear brownish maple leave colored beautifully carbonated glass of excitement with a good 1 finger head that decays slowly leaving potmarks that would rival my street in spring . i stared through the clear glass for a minute watching the red sox in an interesting brown tinge . just looking at this gives me the autumn feel with the dark brown maple leaf color , clear cold chill , ceamy head , and windy bubbles ( ok that might be stretching it , but you get the point ) . n : very much like oktoberfest marzen with lots of dark caramel and munich malts , some toastiness , and some lager like crisp aromas with touch of yeast . this nose also brings me back to october , even though its mid september .
appearance : poured from the 12oz bottle into a tall pokal glass . the beer is a bright orangey color with a hint of gold , and no head to speak of .
a : pours a ruby red with a good 2 fingers worth of head . head settles to a nice ring and layer.. great lacing from start to finish .
appearance : coppery amber with an enormous puff of foamy head that lasted until the liquid was gone from the glass . very , very impressive .

appearance : pours a deep black into a shaker pint glass with no light getting through . a hearty one-and-a-half-finger tan head forms on top and does n't really budge and only eventually drops to a splotchy yet full surface covering of foam . honestly , there is n't anything about how this beer looks that is n't perfect .
a : ruby red with a small head that quickly fades to nothing .
appearance : it is an attractive beer . this beer settles into a dark cherry wood brown that retains its head nicely .
appearance : dark roasty brown with a thin head that dissipates fairly quickly . no visible carbonation .

appearance : cloudy , peach-like color ( almost looks fuzzy from the haze ) . i 'll say that this is kinda interesting , but it is this beer 's only good aspect . small head development recedes to a ring .

appearance : tiny to medium sized bubbles pack a one finger high khaki/tan head . carbonation bubbles quickly rise to the surface . it pours a deep , dark amber , almost black . i can not see my hand behind the glass . slight lacing traces its way down the glass as it is consumed .
appearance : light straw color and very clear . head was about a finger high when first poured and very light and foamy . excellent lacing .
a : clear brown body , with no head at all upon serving . minimal to no lacing present .
appearance : solid black with thick lingering head . one of the better looking beers from a pint glass .
appearance : i think this beer has a beautiful bronze amber body with almost a. perfect white head and lace .
a : copper brown color , nice rocky head
a : cloudy orange body with two fingers of frothy white head with poor retention and minimal lacing .
a : pours a beautiful , slightly opaque , medium golden . enormous light yellow head that show fantastic retention .
a : brown opaque . really ugly ass color . but i was expecting this ... anyway , light beige head head with a good level and good retention with good lacing .
a : wow . this has the palest yellow color that is almost clear water . it is ridiculous . the beer has a pretty lame look . had about a finger of head that went away immediately . wow , shitty .

a : the beer is crystal clear golden yellow in color and has a high amount of visible carbonation . it poured with a two finger high white head that slowly died down and has excellent retention properties ; a thin head consistently covered the surface .
appearance : a nice golden amber pour that settles into a foggy amber body . the head reduces to a blotchy film that cover the surface but hugs the edges of the glass .

appearance : slightly hazy . good foamy white head . light golden yellow color . flavor : mostly light hop flavors initially . light hop bitterness balanced in the follow-through with sweet malt . somewhat grainy in the finish . hops and malt are basically equally balanced . mouthfeel & body : moderate light . average carbonation .
appearance : hazy with a light amber/orange body and thick , creamy white head . there 's loads of carbonation and it stacks majestically on top of the beer .

a : served with a 2 finger bright white foamy head . decent retention . the body is yellow-orange - very light in color - mostly clear with just a touch of haze . very little carbonation can be seen on the inside . excellent lacing .
a : pours a very deep brown , nearly black , completely opaque . a strong 2+ finger head forms pretty tight and holds nicely . great lacing .
appearance : pours a very pale straw color with hints of gold in it . has a slim one-finger head that dies down very quickly and actually manages to leave some lacing on the glass .

a : moderate pour down the center of the glass leads to 5 finger head ! wow this head is not going anywhere , sticks around forever . lots of carbonation in this one . beer is a golden color and somewhat hazy . looks like it could be unfiltered . 4.5
a : thin layer of head which dropped relatively quickly , medium copper to light amber in color , active carbonation in the beer - 2.75 ,
a : looks promising . rich copper color with thick head . leaves very nice lacing down the sides .
appearance : pale cloudy orange with a thin head .

appearance : appropriately cloudy appearance . dark straw in color , actually a couple of shades darker than i expected . nice pure white head with staying power . heavy population of tiny carbonation bubbles . i subtracted half a point for the fact that some of the yeast from the bottom of the bottle poured out in heavy chunks . while i understand what the heffe in heffeweisse means , i found this visually unappealing .
a : pours a dark , dark brown . nearly opaque . little to no head on vicious pour . thin mocha film on surface that will grow to 1/2 finger with lively stir . spotted lace on rim .
a : peach/golden hazy color . head is solid , 1/4 inch layer of whipped cream on top of the body
a : a deep orange/amber color with a nice foamy white head and good lace .
appearance : cloudy , honey yellow color with 2 fingers of head that faded slowly with a nice curtain of lace .

a : initially pours a very creamy orange , but that clears up instantly to reveal a sparkling , well carbonated , orange/gold beer with a two finger fully off white head . there 's a little haze , but the head is so beautiful and that balances it out . 4.5

appearance : deep , deep chocolate brown , verging on black . almost completely opaque -- i could not get a ray of light to penetrate this bad boy . bubbly , thick deep brown/expresso swirl head with surprisngly good retention . no legs or lacing .
a : clear dark brown color with a gorgeous creamy off white head . fantastic retention .
appearance : pours a dark clear amber body head : thick frosty light brown head

appearance : very clear copper tone with a slight reddish hue . flavor : very unique . apricot , i guess , if i did n't read the bottle i would have never guest . really sweet up front that follows through the entire swallow . fruity , and finishes with a spicy , peppery hop bitterness that is over powered by the candy like sweetness .
a : deep crimson , a lot of fizz , little retention .

a : one finger head of decent cream . pathetic 30 second retention . i 'm excited to try a new irish brewery beer . amber-copper colour . transparent . sm : fresh caramel and nutty hops . butterscotch hints ? medium strength scent . maybe a bit of vanilla as well . hard to determine with me broken nose .
a : this is a great looking imperial stout : black in color with a nice mocha colored foam .
appearance : clear pale yellow body . head dropped to nothing . low carbonation . this is pretty poor looking .
a : pours an opaque , hazed orange . unattractive murky , and dirty . at first a two finger white head forms , but recedes to nothing in a second . no lace .
a : i loved the appearance of this beer it had a yellow murky tint . very eye pleasing .

a : pours pitch black with a huge head - seriously like 4 '' of light mocha foam that has huge staying power and prevents me from pouring the entire beer at once . while this is the first time i 've had this from a bottle ( had it once on tap before ) so i ca n't say if this level of head is normal , but it is absolutely the most gorgeous head i 've ever seen . needless to say , the lacing on this is out of this world .

appearance : pours a 4 finger , thinner looking , fluffy white head with great retention . color is amber or chrome yellow with medium carbonation . the head turns very thin and bubbly over time , leaving thin splotchy bubbles down the glass . what the hell ? no head remains , and ends looking flat . bleh .
appearance : is n't this what a hef is supposed to look like ? murky , cloudy , ca n't see through the glass , picturesque . three fingers of very soft lingering foam with everlasting lacing .
appearance : dunno . : )

appearance : a solid amber color that proved to be very transparent . a head that would n't quite , awsome retention , absolutly enormous , light tan in color . leaving rings of sticky lace all the way down .

appearance : a hazy amber glass with no head . flavor : this is different . a slightly licorice and whiskey note fades into a light mango finish . there is a gentle metallic edge at the end as well . hops are pretty low for an apa .

a : the beer pours a very nice golden brown from a 12 oz bottle with a 1.5-2 finger head after a slightly vigorous pour . the head disappates fairly quickly , but leaves some lacing along the side of the glass .
a : no head now but thats probably because it gushed all over the place for five minutes before i poured it . amber/red color .

a : has a pitch-black body with a beautiful , dark mocha-colored head . the light has no chance against the body of this beer . the head has excellent retention for 10 % ( seriously , it 's confusing ) and fantastic lacing that just wo n't go away .
appearance : this has a medium brown color with a raspberry tint . slightly transparent edges . no head , this is pretty flat , just a few stray bubbles .
appearance : pours a piss golden yellow color , little head and crystal clear . bright vibrant yellow piss color .

a : witte noire pours with a 1 and a half finger , medium brown creamy head that is fairly fast to diminish . lasting film . the body is a very dark shade of amber-brown with transparency only along the edges . lightly particulate . good lacing initially , but stickiness is lacking , resulting in a glass scantily clad with erratic strings of lace .
a : pours a very light orange color with 1/2 a fingers worth of white head that settles quickly to a very small ring with no lacing .
a : pours a clear yellow with a fizzy white head that leaves little in the way of lacing .
a : clear as a bell and ubiquitous pilsner-amber tint . as average to a fault .
appearance : the color is a dark amber , the head a light tan with sticky lace formed on the glass as you drink .

appearance : poured a pale golden color , with a very slight cloudiness . no sediment in the beer , but plenty of yeast left in the bottle . no head at all ( with a regular pour ) . almost no carbonation . no real lacing at all .
a : as listed , ruby red with thin head that dissipated . lacing was minimal , nothing drastic .

a : moon glow is extremely hazy , with a brown-orange body and white head . lacing and retention are both on the low side , but do n't forget that this brew is nearly 9 % abv . the main points here are lost to the clumps of yeast that sit limply at the bottom of my tulip . i do n't mind suspended yeast , but clumps are a touch off putting .

a : a slightly overly vigorous pour resulted in two inches of rocky white foam on top of a bright golden , slightly clouded liquid . it took a while , but eventually things settled down into a persistent half-inch cap of foam that left thick lacing throughout the session . each top-off from the bottle and each swirl of the tuilp reinvigorated the solid head . gorgeous tripel .
a : murky tan with a large robust off white head with amazing retention . this head of this critter does not subside . lacing rings the glass .
a : bright golden with large foamy white head with great retention and lace grabbing glass the enitre way down .
a : pours a clear honey color with a luxurious , fluffy white head that shows great retention and leaves a wall of lacing all around the glass .
appearance : opaque pitch black with a chocolately head . beautiful .
a : pale yellow with a slightly white haze ; pours with a rediculous amount of fluffy white head ; continous degassing makes a great bubble show ; plenty of retention & leaves a foamy lace .

appearance : poured into a pint glass a dark brown . my pour produces a rather thin 1/4 inch light brown head . as i look at the beer i do a double take . i pick up my glass for a closer examination . what the hell ? there are some tiny whitish floaty things in my beer ! i keep my glassware clean , handwashing them , i know there was nothing in there when i poured my beer . there was something in the beer .
a : pours a cloudy golden yellow with a firm white head , great retention , leave a fair amount of lace .
a : poured into an over-sized wine goblet . opaque , murkey , ruddy brown . not much head ( perhaps too timid on the pour ) , and what head there is settles pretty quickly .
a : black . holy black . with a huge thick head . the head stayed for almost 5 whole minutes .
appearance : deep red body with an active head . looks great .
appearance : opaque ruby red , with a light grey head .
appearance : 3/4 '' foam fills the glass above a hazy , light amber body . very fluffy and long lasting .
a : nice dark amber and red color with a wicked head . just huge and rocky as hell , great lacing .
a : clear golden yellow , great head ; very nice lacing
a : a hearty , ruby-brown color with a 3-finger , tan head that leaves a good amount of lace . 1-finger head stays even after the pour .
a : chocolate and caramel malts . touch of roasted coffee .

a : large 3 finger head that 's creamy and fades quickly , very light pale yellow color with brilliant clarity , its almost like looking through a yellow tinted window n : nose has a somewhat belgian quality with some nice malt a little banana and citrus and touch of light hops ( maybe hallertauer )
a : pours a hazy orange-ish brown color . on finger worth of off white head . retention is correct and lacing is pretty good .
a : deep gold color . very good clarity . effervescent but long-lasting , creamy , white head . fades to the classic belgian lacing .
a : very dark & opaque.aggressive pour leads to a 3 finger head .
appearance : looks alone , this is nice - dark but not as think and luminous as an imperial stout . has a light beige head - just under a finger think that is going no where . very good lacing .
a : stark black . head is a little short , and a kinda pale tan head . retention is mediocre , lacing is minimal , but there is some there . s +
appearance : had a bottle at a company dinner in pr . medium crystal clear gold with an instantly dissapearing head . no retention nor lacing .
a : ugly yellow , off white head that existed briefly .
a : golden yellow with a bubbly head that dissipates quickly and leaves very little lace
a : pours a hazy yellowish , with a brown twinge color . provides a thick white foam head with excellent retention . there is tons of lacing down the side .
a : cloudy with no particulate . thick head that quickly dissipates and leaves sub-par lacing . murky honey color is less than appetizing .
a : i poured a bit into a cup and it poured an interesting light shade of orange .
appearance : poured from the bottle into a tulip . it is brownish red with a very small amount of foam which dies quickly .

a : clear gold , with a thin and foamy head that dissipated quickly . very little carbonation visible . once the head was gone , the beer was essentially golden water . left no lace . the beer 's glaring weak spot .
a : deep clear red with a fantastic reddish-white head . great looking beer . extreme lacing - sticks to the sides long after pouring .

a : pours a huge , frothy off-white head , the cap is persistent and thick , and the lacing is tenacious like a honey badger . do you think that lacing cares about time or gravity ? it does n't give a s**t.
a : moderate pour yields 1.25 beautiful tan head with good retention . scarlet , dark brown and clear liquid . very pretty .
a : black body with beige , almost light violet 1/2 finger of head that fades quickly and leaves very scant lacing .
a : this pours a dark amber/brown color . a thin , almost non existent head forms . no lace . after the head recedes this looks closer to a red wine than a beer .
a : little head , dissipates quickly , clear copper color with little carbonation
appearance : light golden in color with only minimal head and lacing .
a : two second head . if you drink this you probably do n't know what lacing is .
appearance : pours deep gold and crystal clear . has a nice thick head and tiny bubbles .
appearance : pours a clear dark red/amber color with a layer of off white head . some lacing remains after the pour .
a : deep , clear ruby-brown body with two fingers of cream light brown head . good retention and sticky lace . awesome looking brown .
a : pitch black . no head at all .
a : hazy orange with a small eggshell head that does n't stick around save for a thin film . leaves no lace . the weakest part of the beer for me .
appearance : black with mahogany hues . no head , light suds . low viscosity .
appearance : pinkish hue with absolutely no head , kind of looks like cherry 7-up .
appearance : great looking dark lager with gorgeous dark hue , nice lacing , and medium carbonation .

a : pours a clear golden yellow/orange with loads of visible carbonation . head is small , not long lasting , creamy texture , & white color . i know some people say hazy or cloudy , but i did n't pour the last inch of fluid in so i do n't know if that made any difference .
appearance : imagine orange pop with some cranberry juice poured in it . looks very much like a fruit drink .
a : snifter . pours a crystal clear light orange color with a pure white head . very low retention rate and soft light lacing .
a : pours a light red with a full creamy nitro head , nice lace .
a : bright , crystal clear straw body . small , loose head that quickly dissipates leaving no lacing and no cover . the color is right , but everything else is completely out of style .
a : pours with a dark ruby-colored body and a large , dense , creamy white head . almost looks like a nitro pour .
appearance : slighty chill hazed copper coloured brew with thin yet creamy lace which leaves a few rings around the glass .

appearance : straw colored . huge head . large effervescence . floaties in this beer , didnt know it was bottle conditioned . would rate higher without the floaties . they look like gelatanous beer clumps .
a : pours hazy golden orange . not an impressive head , 1/8th finger maybe but does leave a small amount of lacing on the glass . must be a bad pour on my part .
appearance : nice bright golden color with lines of bubbles dancing in the glass . decent finger measure of head .

appearance : pours with an average amount of head which quickly dissipates , leaving virtually nil by the middle of the beer . lots of moist lacing . pale yellow colour , lots of unusually small bubbles .
appearance : dark brown with a lot of floating chunks . the carbonation floats the chunks about in a unappealing look .
a : pours a deep goldenrod with a huge white head , looks very overcarbonated , i do n't like waiting to taste the beer , and this one made me wait .
a : this , light head , dark amber color , head disappears quickly
a : pours a nice looking light orange , with a large fluffy off white head . lacing is good . little visible carbonation .
a : very cloudy with an off brownish red color , not nice looking at all.little to no lacing .

appearance : cooking oil has more color than this beer . it 's crystal clear with only a touch of yellow tinting . on the plus side the beer held on to a sizable white head for a good little while . there is n't much lacing to note but a whispy film remains after the head is gone .
a : pours a reddish copper w/ a good finger and a half of head . really good head retention .
a : straw yellow , about 1/2 of head that disappears very quickly to nothing with no lacing at all . lots of carbonation .

appearance : far on the yellow side for a hefe . very cloudy , but deep inside i can see what looks like when you drop food coloring in water , just slightly darker than the beer itself . very very carbonated . had to wait a few minutes to pour the whole beer in the glass .
a : light murky orange brew with an enormous 4-finger white head after a violent pour . head last forever ( just like i like it pun intended ) and eventually ends in a very persistent lace .
appearance : pale orange-gold transparent liquid . thick , two-finger pale yellow head .

a : pours a dark brown with ruby highlights . you can see right through it when held to a light . it has two fingers worth of light tan head . settles to a solid cap and creamy lacing covers the glass .
appearance : dark cola brown with crimson notes , very minimal amount of lace with not much cling to it .
a : pours a walnut wood color with chunks of sediment , basically no head and not any significant rising carbonation .

appearance : pours with a very small head that goes down to almost nothing . the beer itself is a very dark brown that is only the slightest bit transparent . in general , i do n't want to be able to see through my porters .

a : bright light straw . heavy carbonation . pours into a semi frothy , mostly bubbly head , dissipating completely rather quickly . carbonation stops rising from the bottom of the glass after only a few seconds . no head remains . no lacing .

appearance : ( 3.0 ) - heavy pour into a glass hardly rendered even a finger of head . quick light mocha fizz settled immediately to a light bubbly ring , and some scattered thin skin on top . stout is rather dark , and i ca n't see through it . light ruby at the edges .
appearance : 5 |
a : honey amber hue with thin cap of off-white head and scant lacing .
a : hazy brown beer , can not see anything through it , topped with 3 fingers of white head which sticks around . highly carbonated with lots of fine bubble streaming towards the top .
appearance : pale yellow , great clarity , thinnish layer of white froth that quickly dissipates
appearance : this beer pours a hazy orange and brown with very little white head . there are miniature floating carbonation bubbles atop the surface .
a : pours deep yellow with sticky white head .
a : pours straw-colored with a small white head , that leaves only small lacings .
a : pours a clear straw yellow , nice 3 finger bone white head settles to a small cap , lacing everywhere and sticks to the glass like almost no other beer i have drank , save for duvel .
a : hazy golden-brown , very little head ( or retention or lace ) .

a : hazy ( i swirled and poured the last quarter of liquid ... i love my yeast ! ) straw hue with champagne-like bubbles that are helping to form a massive , active white head . the fluffy marshmallow head rocks . there 's a ton of retention and spider web lacing . i love it .

a : vigorous pour yields a 2 finger semi-coarse deep chocolate head that holds steady at about .5 fingers . beer is opaque black and thick . lacing is frothy , like a painted tidal wave of brown on the side of my glass .
a : had to wait about 20 min for the head to die down as well as all the yeast to settle to the bottom of the glass . 3+ fingers of white head .
a : dark and 'stout'-like , nearly impenetrable . nice creamy head , a yellow-tan sudsiness that builds to over one-finger and fades quickly to a bubbly film and tight curtain of lace .
a : pours a deep thick black , opaque , with very dark head , considerable lacing , good head retention
a : finger sized head head that lasts on top of a dark brew
a : poured a deep dark brown with a thick creamy head , but that was the highlight of this beer .
a : pours a dark brown , nearly perfectly opaque ale . single finger light tan head dissipates quickly . little lacing here .
a : poured a very deep brown , nearly black color . almost a one finger head that quickly faded from the middle out .
appearance : pours a hazy pale golden , with a fizzy white head that thins to a persistent ring .
a : this beer pours a beautiful , clear , copper color with a one finger of offwhite creamy head that holds nicely . minor lacing is left on the glass .
appearance : murky purple body with a pink head , well carbonated . think bavik wit with raspberry juice added .
a : pours a murky orange with a full white head , excellent head retention and lacing .

a : the color of this is quite shocking . i expected a pinkish hue , but instead this looks like hazy chardonay . three fingers of white , fizzy soda-pop head that falls super fast and leaves no lacing . like usual , upland managed to make an ugly brew . 5.0
a : solidly black body with an inch of creamy tan head . good retention and strong lacing . very nice .
appearance : dark amber with a good size , strong head . this was the best part about this brew .
a : slightly better than a macro brew . sub par head and lacing .

appearance : served on tap it had a golden color with orange hues and a fizzy white head on it . the retention was very poor . the head barely lasted from the tap to getting the glass in front of me .
a : pours a light , clear amber body with no head to note and no lacing either . nothing overly impressive .

appearance : a nice pillowed white head formed when poured . the head receded slowly to a nice clumpy layer . lacing was way above average and the color was pale yellow . barely cloudy with lots of carbonation .
a : pale and light-bodied . a considerable white head emerged from the tap .
a : midnight black with a super thick mocha colored head that stands 2 inches tall . it slowly fades but never really disappears . perfect !
a : nice red color , very cloudy , wonderful reddish white head , decent lacing and retention . 1-finger .

appearance : it was only fitting to pour this imperial stout into a `` maudite '' snifter . what came of the bottle was a thick black oily sludge of a beer . i use the term `` oily sludge '' in a good way though . i could have used the term `` oil , '' but that 's not a good enough description of this beer 's color . sitting on top of this oily sludge was a 1/2 to 3/4 of inch head of mocha colored foam . this mocha colored head of foam had decent retention that left behind foamy mocha rings along the edge and a few spots of mocha lace around the snifter . the color of this beer is just as nice as the label itself .

appearance : pours a beautiful orangy hazy yellow sunsetty color with a huge 3 finger foamy , honey comb like head . lots and lots of lacing down the glass , huge head retention . one of the best in this style .

appearance : pours into my hennepin chalice a crystal clear pale gold color with a huge , loose-bubbled , white head . the becomes very rocky as it drops leaving tons of lacing down the side of the glass . this looks perfect .
a : this is a beauty . opaque bottle-conditioned dark orange brownish color . two fingers of thick , off-white creamy/frothy hybrid head . pretty good retention and a lot of lacing . 4.0

appearance : looks like motor oil . it pours a thick , oily , viscous pitch black . as you pour , it looks and even sounds very syrupy . the dark brown head dissipated quickly . was only about a 1/2 finger at the max .
a : poured amber colored with a finger head and a little lacing .
appearance : beautiful brew . hazy orange-tan body with a fluffy white head . very airy head leads to an interesting lacing pattern on the glass .
appearance : head never amounted to much , and was gone surprisingly fast . carbonation is very high in this beer .
appearance : really nice looking porter . black bodied beer with a huge head over 3 fingers high leaving lacing all over the glass . the head medium brown in color .

a : pours a completely opaque black body , with a 3/8 '' light brown head that quickly drops to just a thin ring around the edge of the glass . a thin string or two of lacing is formed at every sip and hang around for a while .

a : a motor oil pour yielded a towering near 3 finger mocha colored head that stood the test of time and patience . smooth , yet firm with the texture of wet sand , it remained unscathed on the surface as it receded at glacier speed . an absolute beautiful presentation in a snifter that words truly fail and fall short in description . spongey patches of lacing leave a nice calling card .
a : poured into a snifter a rich and deep dark brown but a very thin , tan head . nothing spectacular .

a : into a pint glass , massive head immediately develops -- i had to slow down just to keep it in the glass . 1/2 cap has great retention and produces massive lacing . beautiful golden sparkly color is exactly what i look for in a summer beer .
a : pours a light copper amber with good visibility . 1 1/2 finger white head forms and holds nicely ( hops ! ) . nice sticky lacing throughout .
a : pours a hazy reddish/orange color . a tiny bubbly white head forms , and is gone in an instant . not much lace either .
appearance : beautiful yellow sunset over the western skies - 5
a : golden orange hue with no head or lacing ... almost like apple cider in its look , not great .

appearance : a dark golden yellow color with a reddish orange hue . there is a 2 finger head that is ivory and foamy . there is a lot of effervescence in the beer . the clarity of the beer is hazy , duh that is what the label said . there is a lot of lacing on the mug .
a : poured into a pint glass from a 12oz bottle . thick fluffy head that slowly receded into a ring around the glass and left some decent lacing .

appearance : a clear honey colour , like oak aged whiskey . the colour made me suspect they got the label wrong , and put it on a honey lager or some other style . it poured with a one finger of head that settled quickly . lacing was moderate .
a : dark gold .
a : pours a clear , but very dark , reddish brown body . half a finger of light beige head . short retention , with a thin collar and some bubbles on top .
appearance : poured a brown amber , slightly cloudy , with some suspension . one finger bubbly that diminishes immediately . no visible carbonation . no lacing .

appearance : one of the prettiest beers i have ever seen . arrives in a root beer mug with a coffee brown body and a frothy tan head that would outdo anything starbuck 's puts on top of its lattes ; plenty of lacing all the way downt the side of the glass
appearance : unimpressive pale yellow . about as pale as they come . not much foam and no lacing .

appearance : a light and transparent brown pour produces a small , thin , bubbly , crackly tan head that vanishes instantly . flat looking . black body , transparent for the style , and zero carbonation evident . looks flat to the finish . lifeless and thin looking .
appearance : looks like dirty water .
appearance : from the can , it looks like yellow carbonated water .
appearance : exceedingly pale lemony-yellow , hazy body under a generous white head that leaves gorgeous clumpy lacing . a rather pretty presentation .
a : not terribly impressive to look at , at least not compared with many of the other ipas i 've seen/drank of late . pale , golden yellowish in color , very little head , though nice lacing .
a : slightly hazy golden hue like it should be . really nice head with crazy lacing and good retention . it does n't come of my glass even when i wipe it with my finger .

appearance : golden amber color . a strange opaqueness from a light colored but heavy microscopic sediment floating throughout the beer . pours a decent head initially with soapy bubbles that disappear quickly .

a : an attractive , hazy orange . not overly hazy , but not completely clear either . big bubbled head dies way too quickly . literally no retention and it 's not the glass . otherwise bubbles come rocketing to the surface .
appearance : ruddy brown , very scotch ale like . no head at all , even with a vigourous pour .
appearance : amber/copper , hazy . bottles have some sediment on the bottom , but tap is relatively free of this . very little foam .
a : black , 2 finger brown head that dissipates quickly to nothing , no lacing .
a : poured a burgundy with ruby highlights and a pink head that had a little lacing .
a : pours a murky orange that reminds me of watered down apple cider . sticky white head and lacing that seem to hang on for a while .

appearance : pours brown and makes a small , light brown , medium looking head that quickly fades to a wisp and ring . sits a very dark brown in the glass with minimal carbonation evident . relatively clear for the style perhaps . a ring remains until the end but leaves no lacing on the glass .
a : used to ipas that are darker and redder in color , so i was surprised at how orange and golden it was . also , the head was thin with very little sustain , which as also a disappointment
appearance : poured from a 12 oz . bottle into a 12. oz . glass . it looks good , makes me want to drink it . smells : smells pretty good , like the snack bar at a baseball stadium .
appearance : way over carbonated it took several pours to get the beer into the pint , but other wise it pours a hazy golden with a huge amount of head.1.5
appearance : amber copper , not much head , just a tiny bit of ring , and some fish food sediment .
a : pours a light amber with a real mild white head , fair retention , no lace .

appearance : now this is depressing me already , but i will try not to continue with any preconceived notions . the beer pours a somewhat cloudy brown color that was practically lifeless . there were a few islands of tannish foam when i was pouring the daylights out of it ... at least for a dubbel . i poured the whole bomber in about 15-20 seconds . i ca n't really see any bubbles rising , and when held to the light . there is n't any more lace than you get from a coke .
a : cloudy amber color that was much lighter than i was expecting . a fizzy eggshell head formed quickly , but sadly would n't stick around . left no lace .
appearance : beautiful thick rich frothy head atop a crystal clear golden brew
appearance : pours a light orange/yellow color with an off-white , fluffy head which fades quickly .
a : black-brown-redish color with a one finger tan head that fades to almost nothing . light lace is left as the foam recedes
a : pours the clearest yellow i 've ever seen . plenty of carbonation with a large white head , which does not last long .

a : one of the most beautiful beers i have ever seen . it pours a murky creamy brown color . the head is monstrous . it is sooo large and fluffy kind of like whipped cream in appearance . it 's like a large feather pillow as it comes to rest above the rim of my affligem chalice and leaves behind thick lacing . this baby reminds me of a root beer float . the head absolutely refuses to die . magnificent .
a : cloudy orange color ; abundant head , good carbonation ; lacing nice
a : pale color , a little cloudy , white head dissapates far to quickly into almost nothing , not happy about that

a : looks brown to black , but if held to the light is a translucent dark amber . i was surprised that , being a stout , it was so light . has a caramel-colored head that is somewhat thin for a stout and dissipates rather quickly , but a remnant stays throughout drinking .
appearance : best part of the beer . nice amber pour . tiny bubbles linger .
a : pour is a bit darker than usuall for this style , hazy deep golden . the white head is smaller than others in thes style , airy and light . dissipates quickly into faint lacings .
a : state pen porter pours deep , dark brown with a creamy , one-finger , beige head . the cap contains big bubbles interspersed in a thick cream .
a : pours a translucent orange-rust with a 1-finger eggshell head . leaves a fair light lacing on the glass . fairly average in appearance .
a : pours a muddy dark brown . brownish/whitish head is pleasant at first but quickly dies to virtually nothing . no lacing either .
a : mahogany/dark amber in color with a slights haze . thick , two finger white head that sticks and barely settles at all . probably the best pumpkin ale i have ever seen .

appearance : light amber with an off orange ( pumpkin ) hue . nice fluffy head with some decent staying power , falling to about 1/4 inch . bubbles lazily float to the surface through a slightly viscious liquid .
a : black with a big beige head . scattered lacing .
a : yellowish brown ale ; very prominent head and excellent lacing

a : pours a pale gold and is topped my a miniscule head that vanishes , and leaves only a ring around the glass to ever indicate it was there ; no lacing to speak of . the appearance is lackluster , however , it has its redeeming aspects .
a : dark amber , clear , fluffy , foamy 2-inch head . small but thick patches of lacing .

a : nearly clear medium yellow color . like the dfh version , this one gives a hell of a lot of head . fortunately , it looks great with super dense white froth . unfortunately , it takes forever to subside and getting a full glass took a while . still pretty though . 3.5
a : hazy orange body under a thin , frothy cap of tan foam . mediocre retention , spotty lace . decent .
appearance : copper/orange body , foamy white head , fades fast , but a little lingers quite a while .
a : very macro style lager looking with a decent head formed by the active carbonation
a : pours an orange-amber body with a small , white head with pretty poor retention and minimal lacing that was not too impressive for me for the style .
appearance : pale golden yellow with a wispy white top .
a : slightly reddish copper color ; huge head ; great carb action ; good lacing
a : clear , golden with a stiff white head

a : pours a dark , nearly impenetrable black body with a perfect finger 's worth of light tan head . it 's exquisite , in the way that all nitro-tap dark beers are : watching the suds coalesce into a dark body as they cascade up the beer is nothing short of eye-pleasing . tons of thick lacing down the glass as i drink . it 's beautiful , and i ca n't fault anything here .

a : pours a cloudy amber-orange color , with lots of suspended floaties all throughout the beer . at least a full finger of frothy off-white head and decent lacing ; this beer gets marked down due to the floaties since for all i know , it could be a brand new bottle ( dear green flash , please date your bottles ) .
