a : deep reddish-brown with minimal orange-brown head that disipated quickly and left no lacing . this looks more like a brown ale than it does a stout .
a : pours dark brown , with some light passing through . one finger foamy tan head .
a : pours clear copper with a quarter inch of head . fairly carbonated . attractive beer , although somewhat darker for a saison , which is no doubt due to the rye .
a : this was a bright , clear copper color . it pours with a big , craggy white head that leaves lots of lace in it 's wake .

appearance : initially pours a very deep dark garnet color with a small 1/4 '' head of tan bubbles . the head sticks around for only about 20 seconds to end up as a small ring across the top of the beer . the beer is dark , but it appears that there arent many bubbles rising to maintain the head .
appearance : slightly cloudy pale amber with a thin , rocky head dissolving to a rim right away .
appearance : i 'm not impressed at all with this . some ok lacing , but no foam retention at all . looks like watery coffee . definitely not black .
a : dark black body , surprisingly big bubbles around glass . not much head otherwise . minimal lacing . none too pretty .
a : golden color with a good amount of fizzy bubble haze . minimal head , though i 'm guessing i can chalk that up to the waiter 's delicate pour .

appearance : three finger head on a golden glass with considerable protein chunkiness & # 61516 ; flavor : floral hops take the lead , light tripel taste with a little honeydew melon and other light fruits .
a : it poured from the bottle looking like old wine . no head , no carbonation . the color was attractive though , showing a deep rosy red with light brown on the sides .
appearance : pretty much like every other see-through beer that ab makes . water mixed with a slight bit of urine .
appearance : pours a slightly translucent chocolate color with a sturdy tan head that leaves some webs of lace
a : i poured this beer into a standard pint glass . the color could best be described as piss yellow . there is little to no lacing and only a faint trace of head remains .
appearance : nicely black , with a tan head that leaves some nice lacing on the glass
appearance : poured into a great dane pint ... actually a great looking beer - dull amber body , 1/2 '' fluffy white cap that retains itself throughout ... .nice
a : pours a hazy bright yellow , looking like a hay field . provides a nice 2 finger foam head with superb retention . there is a thick layer of lacing as well .
a : pours black with only a half-finger of tan head even with a rough pour . it quickly fades into nothing , leaving no lacing behind .
a : deep murky brown in colour with a short , fizzy light brown head that fades away rather quick leaving you with what looks like a glass of mucky water .

appearance : favorite part ? the prop . 65 warning that states : `` some materials used in the colored decorations on this product contain cadmium a chemcial known to the state of california to cause birth defects '' . that made me laugh , gee if you are a pregnent mother and considering a drinking a bottle of old gaurdian , then i think the kid is gon na have worse things to worry about than the cadmium ( what ever that is ) . ok but seriously ...
appearance : beautiful copper color , not orange ... nice fluffy off white foam and extreme lace left !
a : poured a nice deep yellow with a two finger head that left beautiful lacing down the side as it subsided .
a : pours a very dark brown with a two-finger light brown head with poor retention but sticks around on the edges .
a : it pours a completely opaque black color with two fingers of white nitro froth that laces incredibly well .

a : bright , clear straw yellow . poured a 1 finger foamy white head that dissipated quickly to a skim that disappeared in a minute or two . decanted continually . thin , inconsistent lacing after the first couple drinks , then nothing .
appearance : very pale yellow with thin white head .
appearance : hazy amber with little carbonation and little ( shortlasting ) head .
a : a really beautiful beer with dark brown hue and thick , two finger tan head with lots of lacing .
appearance : clear and extraordinarily pale , just a shade above invisible , with bubbly bone-white foam above , short in duration .

appearance : deep dark brown with mild carbonation . pours a very thin off white head that disappears immediately into an almost non-existent film , which eventually disappears itself . slightly disappointing actually .

a : this pours a murky dark cinnamon brown color and is topped with a massive tan colored head which slowly spiderwebs its way down the glass . this looks amazing . oh and i rarely comment on this but it comes in a pretty bad ass bottle showing a sort of eclipse of the earth .
a : opaque peach/ruby red color . i think a saw a yeastie or two float by . nearly three fingers of white , fizzy soda pop head that falls fairly quickly and leaves no lacing behind . 4.0
a : gorgeous rouge with striking amber and orange tones . slight cloudiness . thick bready head . really great lace like a timeline down the glass .
a : hazy amber with lots of bubbles and a giant off-white , foamy head that lasted a while . great lacing .
a : dark golden to amber color , one finger head with some lacing and lightly carbonated
a : pours a finger thick head . too cloudy for a true pilsener style . a golden brown straw color . good lacing .
a : dull yellow color , ephemeral head and some sediments at the bottom ;

appearance : black with quite a bit of carbonation evident . bubbles racing to the top everywhere . big 2-3 finger tan head is medium thick , fluffy , and retains very well . a relatively thick head remains until the end . thick lacing down the glass . nice .
a : very dark black pour . two finger tan head that is very creamy and has excellent retention and beautiful lacing .
appearance : pours a very nice hazy rust color . the head on this beer is unbelievable . thick and bubbly . it looks like rising bread dough . naturally , it leaves a thick , persistent lacing .

a : pours a dark amber/ruby red with very low carbonation , really no head , good retention for what is there , but not a horrible appearance , i would have expected better from port , but let 's move on .

appearance : when i think winter beer , i usually associate it with a dark , amber colored beer . this beer looked exactly like the amber ale they serve . it was a reddish amber color ... very light but it yielded a decent head that had some nice lacing .
a : dark brown with a slight cherry hue . short head quickly disperses to edges of glass .

appearance : pours a small and very thin white head that quickly fizzes away and vanishes almost totally . colour is an amber or tangerine yellow . no carbonation evident and no lacing left down the glass at all .

a : golden and straw colored mostly opaque with moderate cloudiness and a shimmering of orange when put up to the light . visible carbonation , this is one fizzy looking beer ! pours with a thick creamy and towering white foamy head . heavy and sparkling lacing . wow , perfect example of the style !

appearance : very yellow , golden color . nice clear and bubbly body . i got two plus fingers of pearly head on this beer that left remarkable lacing . looks sticky , yet light enough to be bubbly . it is very beautiful to look at , actually .

a : a lot of reviews called this cloudy . did victory recently start filtering this ? my growler pour was a perfectly clear golden color . it poured with a moderate sized head . i 'm generally not picky about a beers appearance , but hefes are different and this just did n't look right .
a : pale gold color , very clear , decent sized head but dissipated quickly , almost no lacing .

appearance : clear gold glass starts with an active finger white head that dies quickly and fails to lace . flavor : the blueberry is mild and has a jam like quality . base beer is balanced between hop and malt so closely that neither flavor stands out . unfortunately , theres buttery ( diacetyl ) note that makes the whole experience a little less enjoyable .

a : more red in color than anything else has an off white head , not quite an inch worth that recedes to a cap about a quarter of an inch thick . decent clarity on the initial pour . interesting looking beer .
appearance : little or no head or lacing on glass , but a beautiful ruby orange color . a few fines were floating around .
appearance : dark mahogany/cherry with a ruddy head that had great retention
appearance : pours a clear , gold body with a small white head .
a : pale straw body , with a very foamy white head .
a : dark brown , close to black color . pour did n't really yield a head . 4.0
appearance : opaque reddish brown with an inch tall white head .
appearance : honestly , it pretty much looks like miller lite , there 's not much haze , lacing 's alright , and the head fades pretty quickly .
appearance : hazy orange . really nice head with exceptional retention . very nice lacing .
a : `` one-of-a-kind '' . pitch black in color . an extraordinary 2-finger head . i do n't often use this word to describe a beer , but the appearence is just `` perfect '' .

a : pours a hazy yellow . the head is a half finger of light cream , decent thickness , and bad retention . sm : light lemon citrus esters and cream over a light clean barley foundation . a bit simple , but pleasant and refreshing . very well balanced .
a : pours a nice , dark golden-brown colour with a two finger pale yellow head ; it is a very good looking beer .
a : pours a deep amber color with a beautiful two finger off-white puffy cloud-like head that has very good retention and a nice amount of lacing all the way down..
appearance : thin lacing with a troubled head retention , faint haze on the rusty brown brew .

a : black body with dark tan head of two fingers with a good cap and lacing . s/t : simple and straightforward , with little more than some basic chocolate , some sweet toasted malts , and some light smoke to offer .
a : dark black , with no light able to get through , with a decent about of head even with a slow pour . the head is mocha colored and leaves some lace .

appearance : body is a deep reddish amber - shows flashes of crimson and mahogany . as with all of the beers at the sn brewery , the carbonation is constant and active ; however the column of bubbles is not quite as dense . a big , fluffy , white , foamy head sits on top - looks just like a bubble bath . great head retention and tons of clumpy , foamy lace all the way down . i can find no flaws .
a : toasted malts with some minerality . lemon hop aromas , with some floral tones as well . a tad soapy .
a : hazy copper under a small white head . no lace , little retention .
appearance : it 's a tad bit lighter than the normal mad hatter ipa .

appearance : a foamy white three finger white head that has poor retention . the color of the beer is a light straw color with yellow hues . there is a lot of effervescence in the beer . the clarity of the beer is brilliant . the head disappeared after a couple of minutes in the glass , nothing remained .
a : dark as night , with subtle lacing and tiny carbonation presence . similar to the 18 year in these traits .
a : pours with a typical sierra nevada perfectness ... gorgeous deep amber color and has an off white head . the head is rocky with large bubbles and amazing retention/lacing .
appearance : pours a nice deep copper in to a pilsner glass . there is a sizable cream colored head with some decent retention but little lacing .
a : pours a clear red color , 2 finger width head with great lacing down the glass
appearance : two fingers of light brown head that is thick and beautiful . the head stays around for quite some time . the beer is an incredibly dark ruby color . i mean this is wow beautiful .
a : pours dark with copper and caramel colors . it has a nice head .
appearance : clear . hay-straw colored . white head that disappears quickly .
a : pours a very nice golden color with a beautiful one-inch head , and great lacing for a tripel .
a : my head , poured hard to 3+in faded rather quickly , lasting 2-3 minutes . i 'm really not seeing much lacing here , no sip lines or anything . a bit dissapointing ? honey/whiskey color .
appearance : crystal clear , pale yellow .

a : pours a nice dark brown with a light tan head that foams up to an inch and does n't want to fade away any time soon . excellent lacing left behind as it recedes . excellent clarity when held to the light with nice deep red accents .
appearance : huge white fluffy head exceptional retention , crystal clear amber color .
a : pours a cloudy reddish brown , little to no head on pour , no lacing
a : pours a deep amber with a thin head that quickly disappears inot nothing . zero lacing .
a : pours a mostly clear orangish amber . two fingers of creamy head that holds pretty well . good lacing .
appearance : there is little to no head on the beer . when it pours the head is white . the beer is an amber color . it is cloudy .
appearance : dark slightly hazy mahogany in color . little in the way of head , the little it had when poured faded away quickly leaving basically nothing on top .
a : off white head , light brown color , clear and has average lacing .
a : pours a chestnutty mahogany-ie brown . very little head to speak of .
a : a crystal clear beer , dark chardonnay color , with plenty of white head . the bubbles are exploding from the laser etching on the bottom of the glass .
a : opaque dark brown with a finger width tan colored head that dies down quick to a thin line of bubbles . looks very thick .

a : pours a cloudy amber color with copper/orange highlights when held to a lamp . difficult to see any carbonation up the glass , but there is a half-inch head that recedes quickly into a quarter-inch head on the brew , leaving nice sticky lacing down the glass .
a : pours a nice and cloudy amber/red color . a large beige head forms and leaves lots of patch lace down the glass .
a : exactly what a heffe should look like . cloudy tan colour with a cumulus cloud head that pushed above the glass .

appearance : poured with an amazing white frothy foamy head that stood 1inch over the rim of the glass that dissipated very slowly leaving a beautiful lacing all down my glass . the beer is slightly cloudy yellowish gold .
a : the beer pours a orangey hued color with a large off-white head and okay lacing ...
appearance : a slightly hazy , deep reddish-orange body capped by three fingers of off-white head that fades slowly and leaves brilliant lacing .
a : nice , clear amber color , frothy , rocky head
a : a clear , raisin-brown colored liquid . no head to speak of , almost no carbonation to be seen .

appearance : pours extremely dark brown with a finger of rich tan head that fades quickly and retains at a skim . no clarity to this beer , though slight carbonation runs through it visibly in the pour . light lacing clings here and there down the glass .
a : pours apricot ale with a finger of off-white foam which falls quickly to a sheet of the same . cherry tones . near excellent clarity .
a : a very light appearance.golden tint , tan in sort of creamy head but not creamy enough to thrill me .
a : pours straw-colored with a large fluffy soapy uneven white head that sinks quickly . only little lace .
appearance : as with most great divide beers , the head retention and lacing are remarkable . the penny red-copper color of beer is gorgeous as well .
appearance : my pour has an apple juice brown hue to it with golden edges . just a tiny big bubbled head forms with an aggressive pour - it appears to have an issue with the carbonation .
a : guinness just looks great in the glass . good contrast with black color with a creamy white head .

appearance : frothy finger of creamed coffee head settles to a finger of creamy head on an opaque black mug that only shows a few carbonation streams . the head left some clumpy lace that thinned out to a trace before i finished the mug . flavor : thin dark malt starts dry and airy with a bit of purple grape , then floods in with a cloying sweetness before finishing watery with a bit of grassiness and vanilla extract/alcohol .
a : pours a muddy dark brown leaves about a 1/2 inch head of lace , i love how dark it is .

a : hazy orange and cloudy with a terrific meringue head that built its on structure on this bad boy with staying power . a truly great looking beer . a plethera of sediment on the bottom of the glass . n : banana bread and lemon . scents of a moisturizer and liquid soap , oddly in a good way . the hops are there but not as much as the brooklyn version which is unfortunate .
a : poured this beer from a bottle that has been sitting in the basement for a while . possibly because of this , the head retention is poor . none the less the glass is laced nicely .
a : pale golden in color , very clear . head somewhat smallish even right after the pour .
a : pours dark yellow/orange color with a very thick white bubbly head . clear carbonation on the bottom of the glass , slowly-rising bubbles . very nice .

appearance : pours a crisp , translucent golden body , capped by a magnificent foamy , sticky white head , the retention on which was amazing . the lacing is also fantastic for the style , stringy and delicate but sticky nonetheless . the carbonation is also off the hook , fast and fine-bubbled , plentiful and well-dispersed . just a very attractive beer .

appearance : a very clear , bright yellow . carbonation is highly active with mixed sized bubbles that creates a sticky , delicate , foamy pure white brussels lace head . bottled-conditioned , so there will be dregs in the bottle .

appearance : great carbonation this beer does not have . but the pale greenish yellow is kind of cool in my opinion . not sure if it should look like that , but there definitely is a green tint to this . good lacing and foam .
a : insane head on this one . hazy . a lot of lacing on this one . looks great in a duvel glass .
appearance : pours a light mahogany with amber highlights , a massive khaki head forms with thick and foamy lacing
a : black . no light gets through this one , much like all other yeti 's . a nice espresso head formed from the pour followed by a good lacing .
appearance : slightly cloudy dark brown with light tinted amber streaks . good head retention .
appearance : very hazy and cloudy dark copper / almost brown in color . the head consisted of a few surface spots when the pint arrived . just looked pretty sad .
a : has a nice golden red look , almost an amber . pours with a thin head that disappears after a few minutes . lacing is n't very prominent .
a : cloudy yellow color , like a mango , perfect foamy head with two fingers thick , good lacing ;
a : a gorgeous beer . golden . not clear . volumnous craggy white head . visibly effervescent . belgian lace .
a : silent cork , no head , very little carbonation . liquid is an extremely dark raisin brown .
a : about as black as stouts will be , but this one is a little thin in the head / head retention . some strings of lace . reasonable , but not great .
a : deep copper brown with red hues with a 1 inch white head that fades quickly . good .
a : dull/dirty/darker gold color but quite carbonated .
appearance : a fine looking beer . dark orange and perfectly clear . big rocky white head with good retention and pretty excellent lacing .
a : yellow with a slight haze , white head , no retention or lace .
a : 2011 batch poured into a portsmouth snifter . dark brown with translucent cola edges . a finger of beige head diminishes to a glass ring . no lacing evident . 2/5
a : bright golden yellow color with a touch of hazed cloudiness . lively head of white foam had good retention , and left lots of lacing inside the glass .
a : translucent , golden beer with thick creamy head .
a : quarter-finger head of fair cream . hazy dark copper colour . laughable retention . sm : very light clean barley and malt .

appearance : pours a crytsal clear ruddy amber that becomes a light brilliant red when held to light . a three-finger high , rocky , off-white head forms on top and shrinks to a scattered arrangement of bubbles all across the surface of the beer .

appearance : ruby and copper with haze and not a great deal of head . as a result of the substantial quantity of yeast in the bottle , a few random little globs are floating in my glass . perhaps my dinner will be bottle conditioned by it later this evening .

appearance : on tap , it pours a not-too-bad-looking pale straw color with a foamy one and a 2 finger head . honestly , it 's not too bad looking , and the head does n't look so bad seems like fosters , it does n't taste as good as it looks .
a : cloudy amber with a white head . incredible lacing , good retention . full finger head .

a : exceptionally pale and clear . almost resembles a lemon soda , or maybe a blend of beer and water . poured straight into a glass and still only managed to produce about one and a half fingers of head .

appearance : a thin , transparent brown pour produces a 1+ finger , medium looking , light brown head with good retention . dark brown and slightly mahogany in color , transparent body , and very active carbonation for the style . head slowly fades to a good film cap , but only a ring remains and leaves no real lacing down the glass . could be a little darker and the carbonation could be toned back a little .

appearance : slow pour down the side and middle of the glass yields a two inch , silky offwhite head that dissipates slowly , leaving walls of lacing . pours a deep , semi-opaque reddish amber . leaves a solid wall of lacing on one side of the glass , and huge streaks and latticework elsewhere . lacing sticks around indefinitely . great .
appearance : super foamy but not gushing , the froth had no problem at all sticking on every inch of the glass . black with evident brown hues on the edges .
a : looks soft and creamy , with a dark golden color . there was a small head .
a : pours a dark brown with a thick head .
a : pours a nice dark pumpkin orange hue with no sight of a head .
appearance : poured into a snifter . has little carbonation and a small whitish head that dissipates into a milk mustache ... a beautiful auburn color that diffracts the light .
a : cap was rusted from the inside out , cork had leaked and smelled damp . cork made no pop on opening , and pour produced no head almost flat . has a gold orange color .

appearance : pours a pale off white , two fingered head into a pint glass . color is a deep orange almost rustlike flavor with lots or bubbles leading up to the head . when held to light , has a reddish hue . this beer looks great . head retention is good , and there is some great lacing from the hops .
a : transparent , macro-lager color with a small head . this is a wheat beer ? where 's the cloudiness ?

appearance : medium brown in color without the red hues common to porters . the head is thin and dissipates quickly . scent : malty sweet aroma with notes of honey . the sweetness is not rich enough to be called molasses , but perhaps is closer to caramel . no discernable hops aroma .
appearance : widget lends to impressive cascading effect , dark black/brown fades to rich mahogony , with creamy off-white head , great lacing , i think guinness invented lacing .
a : pours a light orange straw color ; small head , no lacing
a : almost no head . very pale gold .
a : very clear and fully carbed . white fizzy head moderate lacing .
appearance : watery , pale , light gold color . decent head that fades fast .
a : opaque body topped off by 2 inches of billowing tan foam . head dissipates quickly to a 1/2 inch .

a : pours a two finger head of slight cream , fair thickness , and above average retention . hazy cloudy dark yellow colour . it 's kind of appealing . sm : wheat , old ( stale ! ? ) orange peel , light lemon esters , and maybe a tinge of honey . a mild strength scent .
appearance : light to dark ruby brown color with foamy 1/2 inch tan head . at the bottom the beer is red it darkens at the top . it reminds me of a good piece of saddle leather . simply beautiful !
appearance : golden amber that looks great beneath the fluffy off-white head that lasts . decent lacing . my favorite appearance for an apa .
a : huge head on this one , takes up half the glass after a normal pour . beer is a darkish golden color with some amber sneaking through . really good
appearance : pours a golden straw with a 1 inch head that fades to spotty lacing sporting medium carbonation
a : very clear beer with frothy , 3-4 fingers white head . lots of carbonation . looks a light golden , almost a light piss yellow color . for what it 's worth , it does n't look quite bad .
appearance : 5 |

a : it looks pretty damn good looking , a healthy dark brown almost clear black if that makes any sense , but you know what i mean , clear and dark . there is an initially creamy two inch tiny bubbled light sandy head that fades into a thin cap in five minutes or so . lacing is very thick and defined all the way around the glass . looks good .

a : pours a one finger head of fair cream , fair thickness , and average retention . colour is a cloudy yellow . sm : lemon esters , cream , assorted citrus esters , and full barley . no malt , thankfully .
appearance : 2.5 ,

a : hmm , not a great head , really . it 's thin and very large bubbles , and it 's fading fast . it 's light tan , and it 's gone . the beer itself is an amber-brown with lots of active carbonation . it 's also got a heck of a haze to it . this is not a very pretty looking beer in my opinion .
a : dark brown , near opaque ; short-lived coffee-colored head ; some lacing , but not much .
a : super dark brown colored beer . even with super aggressive pour , near no head ( mocha colored ) with really bad retention . also , the lacing is pretty bad considering the abv .
appearance : pours a crystal clear light yellow color with a one finger head that breaks apart immediately .
a : pours burnt orange with a mild white head , average head retention , no lace .
a : this beer looked glorious , it came from an illuminating tap handle with a count sitting atop it .

a : murky brown , mahogany body with a fluffy and creamy off-white head . it settled out very quickly into a thin ring around the walls . minor splotchy lacing accompanied , but overall this is rather ugly looking beer . it 's hard to be to harsh considering this is essentially what pureed raspberries look like .
a : split the pour with someone , theirs turned out a slightly hazy orange amber with a rocky white head ; mine turned out a very yeast-laden clouded amber with noticeable sediment . strange .

a : dude ! it 's purple ! extreme beer ? well , extreme color anyway ! this does have the appearance of carbonated blueberry juice , complete with soapy purple head that disappeared within seconds . zero lacing .
appearance : very pale yellow color with a huge white head which stayed around longer than its ice counterpart .
appearance : very hazy brown colored . small head . does not look appetizing .

a : i once heard that the darkest place on earth is not even 100 % black . clearly my source never had his head submerged in a glass of the world wide stout . this is really black . no , this is what really black wants to be when it grows up . ummmm ... kind of small head and , during it 's short life , i could tell it was creamy and light brown . completely opaque body . s &
appearance : pours a dark brown porter color with a very modest head that quickly drops to a ringlet and fails to lace the glass - odd for a wheat beer
appearance : poured just a tad too quickly and the head is massive . effervescent , champagne like quality . the head is very slow to fade . laces nicely . very transparent golden color . awesome .
a : hazy golden ale with a finger of transient white foam . spotty lace .

appearance : chestnut brown body with a slight copper hint . pours with massively high levels of carbonation at first , but the head rescinds almost immediately quite astonishing i have never seen such a large head form & disappear so quickly without leaving any lace traces at all . oh , but wait i have ; its like pouring a lively cold soda into a warm glass it fizzes and pops as it settles to a flat appearance ! it drops marks for that im afraid because now im expecting a cola-beer .
a : deep amber . with not much head or lacing . nice color .
appearance : impressive , corked 750ml bottle with gold ink , poured into a schooner . pours a dark brown , mahogany color with a thick off-white head . good clarity .
appearance : poured a rich , shiny amber color with a very healthy head - a very inviting look .
a : poured a golden amber color with a slight chilled haze and a thin film of carbonation leaving no real lace .
a : dark brown and toasty with one finger light brown head . when held up to light a very small amount of light penetrates .
a : this beer is about as clear as they get . even less color than say a miller lite or bud light .
a : vigorous pour yields a .5 finger coarse light cream colored head that dissipates quickly into a thin film at the top . brew is a clear mahogany that reveals a highly carbonated body .
appearance : pours a deep amber with an airy off-white head that lasts during the entire session , and laces incredibly down the glass .
a : pours a cloudy , murky , dark brown color like tootsie rolls , slight reddish hue as the light hits it ; two finger-width head , medium lacing . this is a pretty ugly beer .

appearance : just like the regular ruination , the double dry hopped version pours a light , yellow straw color . the head was about a quarter-inch thick in a large snifter and there was no lacing at all .

a : pours do n't get much more perfect than this . a fluffy , gummy head of yellowish tan at least two fingers thick sits atop the liquid . it collapses at the slowest of paces , leaving tons of bubbled swiss cheese walls of lace on the sides of the glass as it does . under this puffy crown , a light orange and caramel brown brew waits , nearly opaque and cloudy in some spots and merely hazy in others .
a : coffee with cream dark ( watery ) . in all fairness i think the bar may water down the beer .
a : rich , translucent golden color with 1.5 fingers of bright white head that diminishes quickly . no lacing remains on the glass . this beer is a few shades darker in color that most wheat beers .
a : not as syrupy looking as i 'd expected . as much head as would be anticipated for a 10 % . middle of the road stout looking .
a : a vibrant goldlen ale with a strong haze . towering snow white head ... frothy and creamy . looks like scoops of whipped cream .

a : pours a mostly clear golden with some amber highlights . a vigorous pour produced a head with the approximate thickness of a fingernail . retention is obviously non-existent as a scant ring of bubbles lines the top of the glass .
a : big , bright white 3 finger head with a swirling tempest of carbonation feeding it .
a : golden ale with near excellent clarity and no head formation . a broken sheet of white head . no lace .
a : pours a really vibrant yellow , more reminicient of lemonade than urine though .
a : what 's up with cheap home-computer printed label ? anyway , pours dark , dark brown with virtually no head . not unattractive , not the most attractive
a : the beer is a deep dark brown color with a reddish hue , creates a dense , foamy , tan head that fades slowly and leaves a very thick lace on the glass .
a : pours black , tan head .
a : a hazy light brown color with a thin tan colored head .
appearance : it 's a triple bock , so it should be nice and dark , which it is . it clings to the sides of the glass like a brandy does , which is fine with me because i like brandy .
a : black as black can be with a tan head that was one finger thick and disappated to thick ring after about a minute .
appearance : a thin straw colored beer with a few bubbles floating to a weak head that briskly disappeared .
appearance : pours just like the adverts . looks beautiful . fluffy white head compliments the golden body . lacing down the glass with effervescent wondertude .
a : this beer was a cloudy medium brown color . there was a small head with slight retention .

appearance : little to no head and two shades from black . not sure how this is supposed to be served but it was on the same co2 as the rest of the beers and even after i stirred it up the head dropped like a soda .
a : pours near no head . just a thin white wisp atop a golde , slightly cloudy , yellow beer . no lacing . very lightly carbonated but appropriate for its style .
a : clear , golden yellow , white head , very little retention or lace .

a : that is what a hefeweizen should look like : cloudy and deep golden/wheat-colored , crowned by a billowing dollop of rich white sea-foam . head drops slowly over several minutes to a clumpy cream .
appearance : clear copper color , huge head that volcanoes out of the glass .
appearance : pours a clear yellowish orange color with a 3 '' + head . the head lingered around a while . thick lacing painted the glass .
a : cloudy apricot with minimal carbonation . soapy eggshell cap has poor retention . it quickly dissolves and leaves the beer looking like apricot cider . no lace is left behind .
a : aggressive pour yields 1.5 fingers of dense brown head with good retention . black opaque liquid . perfect .
a : thin , brown pour with no head or lacing . looks like flat coke . the only place where this beer does n't shine
appearance : too-clear light golden color . non-existent head . i want a witbier to be cloudy and foamy !

a : pours a somewhat dark brown , yet slightly amber that is n't opaque at all . head is about half a finger and leaves quickly . not too much lacing going on here . does n't seem to have to porter appearance .
a : cloudy orange , and not just because of the yeast . half inch white head , faded , no lacing .

a : pours a dark brown body . i want to check out the edges and see if it 's translucent , but the head -- 3 fingers of huge , fluffy bubbles -- lasts forever . it collapses in sections and is easily stirred up by a gentle second pour . i was told this is infected , so i was n't surprised to see this .

appearance : painfully bright yellow glass holds a finger head of snowcapped white that gives good lacing to the glass . flavor : over sweet , first blush tasted of turkey for some odd reason . thats a completely new one on me , got it in the second taste as well ; cold cut turkey . taste quickly goes over to a bit of corn , mild flash of leafy hops , then just a faint metallic finish .
appearance : pale yellow and cloudy , like near hefe cloudy with very little carbonation in the body . the pour produced not even half a finger of head , which did sustain but did not lace .
appearance : ultra-clear light golden color . very thin , white head that dissipates quickly .
a : pours a semi-clear reddish dark brown . very small white head . little retention and no lacing .

a : poured moderately aggressively , it formed a brief head that dissipated to a mere ring very quickly , leaving very light lacing on the glass . dark copper , almost light brown in appearance , vaguely murky , moderate carbonation visible .

a : uh oh : i do n't remember this being ridiculously overcarbonated . the opaque reddish-brown body looks rather muddy , and is topped by a solid off-white head that towers a full inch over the top of the tulip - i.e. , it 's ginormous . i wonder whether there might not have been some secondary fermentation going on ; in a fruit beer , that could actually be pretty great .
a : pours a deep ruby amber with lots of hazing . a huge fluffy head forms and wo n't go away , lol . some patching lace from the head .
a : rich , clear pale amber body under an inch of frothy , creamy tan foam . terrific retention , heavy lace . gorgeous lager .
appearance : thick white/tan chunky head with excellent retention and nice lacing . beautifully clear , deep penny copper color . a better looking red ale you 'll be hard pressed to find .
a : pale brownish straw . clear with a great white head and stellar lacing .
a : pours a very light yellow color with medium amount of white head that quickly is gone .
a : pours a dark orange with a finger of off-white head that recedes into a thin layer with little lacing .
a : somewhat of a murky ruby red color with the beginnings of a head around the edge of my caracole tulip , but no real head to speak of .
a : pours a deep red/dark honey type color . soapy light tan one finger head that dissipates into a nice ring . very good carbonation , consistent bubbling

a : it 's a dark amber or bronze color that is brilliantly clear . the head is a foamy eggshell white that stands about a finger and a half . lots of carbonation is visible , refracting sunburst hues of yellow and orange ( i know that 's worded pretty funny but that 's what came to mind when i looked at it ) . a whole lot of lacing !
a : almost clear copper with a 1.5 finger light tan foam head that dissipates into a nice thick lacing and coating .
a : nothing special here . an amber brew , clear as day , with a fizzy white head that recedes and does not lace . may as well be a pale ale ...
a : dark , almost opaque with a small amount of coffee color peeking through the edges small-medium head dissipates quickly and leaves little lacing .

appearance : gorgeous , crystal clear copper color with a very nice , thick head ... part of the 22 oz . bottle poured into a 16 oz . pint glass left a solid finger-full of fluffy head . as the beer sat it became more opaque . lacing was heavier at the top of the glass than further down and the lacing up top clung to the glass throughout the entire 22 ounces .
appearance : brownish amber color with a mercy haze head : light brown with a nice frosty head

a : pours a murky brown body , translucent at the edges but dark in the center . the head is two fingers of light tan foam that recedes quickly into a short-lived cap and then a moderate collar at the edges . some lacing as i sip .
appearance : pours a translucent amber color . has a thin , yet foamy , head that dissipates slowly and leaves spotty lacing . has less of a head than i would 've expected .

a : poured a half finger white copper head that settled to a thin cap . color is a very deep garnet hued amber color . carbonation can be seen streaming to the top from the middle of the glass like an ocean vent . lacing and glass presence is great lasting 45 min into the pour .

a : pours a clear light amber with a finger or so of fizzy white head . the head disappears pretty quickly , leaving a little layer in the middle - not much retention , no lacing . s/t : smells and tastes like a mediocre belgian pale . it 's true to style , not bad , not outstanding .

a : pours a midnight black with 3 fingers of dark mocha head . retention is great ; it takes several minutes before the cap relaxes into a manageable half-finger of even covering on the brew . nice lacing as it recedes , and broken sheets of lacing down the sides during a sip ( with quite a lot of it sticking ) . i ca n't imagine an 11 % ris looking any better .
a : poured a pinkish orange with yellow highlights that had absolutely no head and no lacing at all sticking to the glass . it looks like a colorful barrel aged beer .
a : deep dark color with a milk chocolate mocha colored that never completely fades . very good .
appearance : pours an opaque , brown body with a small , off-white head .

a : pours pure , rocky , belgian-looking foam , which fill glass and then some . eventually the head recedes , leaving spectacular brussels lacing and beer that is clear deep gold . exuberant effervescence .

appearance : this is probably the most gorgeous pale beer i 've seen up to this point . it 's a hazy , bright , pale straw color with a full 3 fingers of egg-shell white head . retention is ridiculous , and lacing is incredible . superb .
a : pours pretty clear , full of carbonation with a small head that quickly fades . basically standard macro fare .

a : pours a clear cherry wood into a dfh signature glass with a finger of off white ( the gf said eggshell , sounds good to me ) . the head dissipates rather quickly and the left behind bubbles cling to the glass and leaves nice little rings .

appearance : black . it 's not overly thick like oil , but more like having the consistancy of grape juice . has a dark brown/light black one-finger head which lasts a good minute or two and leaves nice foamy lacing on the glass .
a : an unpleasant yellow color , with virtually no head .

appearance : pours a deep , dark brown that still shows a little bit of light through it . ruby red highlights shine . the head is tan with a height of one inch.the head is cakey and has deep craters . plenty of lace clings to the glass .
a : clear dark brown with red hues and lots of tiny little bubbles . two-finger , off-white , creamy head that lasted a while . very nice lacing .
a : pours a clear light yellow with less than a finger of white head . not a lot of retention , pretty much no lacing .

appearance : pours out a very thin and light brown and completely transparent . yields a two finger , thinner looking , light beige head with decent retention . clear , transparent brown body with no carbonation evident . a ring remains and leaves some touches of lacing down the glass . this is far too light and transparent to be considered stout looking .
a : golden with some slight orange hues . similar to a duval
a : pours a clear , honey-brown body with a finger of off-white foam . retention is n't great , but it leaves spots of foam on the glass during sips .
a : dark and cloudy with a reddish-orange tint . large head with big bubbles that recedes slowly . moderately enjoyable but a little too murky for my taste .

a : pours a reddish/chestnut brown with mahogany highlights . very thin head that dissipates quickly . thin lacing and low carbonation . n : apple juice , red grapes , maybe blackberries , oak , vanilla and a hint of brett . you can also smell the cabernet sauvignon aromas left over from the barrel aging .
appearance : pours a clear copper color . has an almost non-existent amber-white head that is gone in seconds , and there are no carbonation bubbles visible anywhere- somewhat troublesome .
appearance : very nice looking- almost perfect . pours a honey color with a large white head that stays for a while , leaving a nice lace .
appearance : poured a deep , probably opaque black ( i do n't have a trusty lamp to test the glass ) . a thin , foamy , tan head developed and dissipated to leave a spotted lacing .

a : got to love the creamy cascade of nitro bubbles . pours a clear gold into an american pint and after it settles it has a finger of creamy , thick dirty white head that hangs around for the experience and leaves a beautiful lacing .
appearance : pours a clear amber color with a very nice , frothy head ; leaves plenty of strands of lacing behind
appearance : this is a darker brown ale , almost porter-liked in color . it has a nice tan head .

a : arrives with 1 finger of one of the creamier , frothier heads that i have ever seen . eggshell white and annoyingly long lasting . ten minutes in and the head has n't budged one bit . seriously , can i drink my beer already ? ! ? the body is remarkably clear , bright annealed copper in color . boatload of slow moving bubbles can be seen on the inside . this beer is an absolute stunner in a glass . clearly a 5.0 ...

a : one of the prettiest beers i 've seen tapped . it 's completely unfiltered , as a mix of beautiful red , ripe strawberry hue intertwines with a white peach-honey golden . almost no head - .25 fingers and zero lacing .

a : pours a dark , but not opaque , maroon-mahogany blend in the glass that looks quite inviting at first . a standard pour yields 2 inches of beige-colored foam that retains well and deposits nice lace . not quite as nice as the standard guinness on nitro-tap , but nice just the same .

appearance : pours a big fluffy medium-thick off white head with very good retention . dark brown , almost black , opaque , with some ruby hues . higher levels of carbonation evident in the form of smaller bubbles . head slowly fades to a healthy film cap and leaves some immediate lacing . good film stays with lots of pretty lacing down the glass . looks like a good-looking porter .
appearance : very nice dark crimson color , very little head , does n't look properly carbonated .
appearance : i was expecting something slightly more orange/amber , but instead , this pours more yellow-golden . nice fluffy head on the pour , but it dissipates quickly .
a : cloudy , deep straw body ( apple juice ? ) with a big white head that rapidly dissipates leaving no lacing or cover .
a : hazy amber with very little head . head retention is not that great , and no lace is left in the beer 's wake .
appearance : black as night , no light passes thru the beer head : small bubbles that dissipates quickly other than that no head
a : spicy fruity with allspice and cherry notes .

a : lovely presentation . unfiltered pinkish-red radish in color , with a touch of warm amber at the edges . solid 2.75 finger head on a good pour . the head dies quite quickly , leaving just a bit of lacing .
a : the bottle gushed a bit with head when i popped the cap . huge white head results and laces beautifully . orange yellow in color , the beer pours extremely clear . a very fine looking dipa .
appearance : perfect , very very dark with a large pillowy head that leaves plenty of sticky lace and leaves a thin layer of foam all the way to the last drop of beer .
a : the aggressive pour was not too bad for a lager . the bubbly head lasted all of 25 seconds . bubbles dominated the pour making it look a lot like champagne .
appearance : very dark with just a bit of red around the edges , thin head , very little lacing .
a : pours near black . transient foam production is mocha and disappears before i could type this . pretty much a black mirror surface . no lace .

a : dark golden color with a thin white head little lacing lots of carb bubbles and little floating particles i doubt it 's yeast it might be leftover malt or spice particles . if it is indeed yeast it did n't mix with the beer well when swirled .
a : a beautiful pour with a huge , thick tan head . it glistens like a ruby when held up to the light , and later on shades of brown shine through . plenty of lacing 30 minutes in .
a : forms a short lived , 1 '' white head when poured aggressively into the glass . color is hay golden .
appearance : pours out a slightly hazy deep ruby color with copper highlights . very high carbonation . about 2 '' of tan head forms that has phenomenal retention and lacing .
appearance : hazy deep amber color . little to no head , blotchy lacing .
a : the cork comes out with out a pop and the beer is black , somewhat thick , and flat .
a : orangy-amber in color , typical of an ipa . almost identical to the 90 min .
a : deep copper brown color - incredible , dense , rocky head that lasted 3/4-1 inch the entire glass

appearance : when poured into a mug , the beer was a clear golden yellow color with plenty of carbonation bubbles racing through out the glass . the head of foam was disappointing . all i got was just a little skim of white foam and even that dissipated quickly into oblivion . if i wanted anything , i had swirl it around the glass and even that came as fast as it went .
appearance : phoenix fresh pours a very light yellow-gold colour with a large , white head that does n't last much more than 10 seconds and leaves no lace .
a : pours with a thick mocha head that quickly evaporates ; color like root beer
a : pale yellow in color with a small head that fades quickly .
a : pours dark gold with a small white head , quite fizzy , average retention , very mild lace .
appearance : 12oz single bottle . sickly pale yellow bordering on white . carbonated white grape juice appearance . small head forms and crackles away to almost nothing .

a : bottle gushed into my lucifer goblet . head is huge , retention is amazing and lacing is all over the place . body is the definition of cloudy . spices and yeast everywhere . final pour had sipces and yeast on the head even .
appearance : cloudy amber color with a tint of gold . a nearly nonexistent head clings to the edges of the glass .
a : very clear , mahogany in color , and respectable lacing are present , but where is the pillow of head ? this brew could definitelyuse a bigger head .
appearance : she poured a murky , light brown . maybe an inch or so of smooth white head disappeared quickly .

a : i had the pleasure of sitting across the table . i was in full adrenaline mode , having stayed up most of the night before ; my heart was pounding in the low 100s , and i was staring at everyone with an intense , but haggard , paranoia . when i saw arne apply some pressure on the cork , i went into the zone . time slowed down . i observed his wan , dullard face adopt a soft grin . i saw the cork slip just a millimeter past his fingers . i should have reached out and caught it , but i wanted to see what would happen next . yes . yes . the bottle was about to burst , all over arne 's pretty face . yes . oomph ! the cork shot out , just inches past his eye . arne , still grinning , had no time to react . if he had been standing just a bit closer , he 'd be a pirate right now . anyway , the beer was grossly overcarbonated to the point of injury . it gushed . in our glasses , it poured a faintly glowing light amber / orange body with good head , good retention , good lace .
appearance : looks really great . dark read , almost black with a thin tan head .
a : pours a clear , copper-brown with two fingers of off-white head which quickly recedes into a thin ring with no lacing .

appearance : lighter than most of its peers from aventinus , ramstein , and erdinger . pours a turbid reddish orange and generates a substantial , fine-gauged head , thats a bit darker than off-white . it resolves down pretty quickly , but leaves a nice sticky sheath on the walls of the glass . the body has a remarkable glow to it , really setting it apart from most beers ive seen and evoking a real sunset . tiny particles can be seen bombarded around the hazy liquid by the rills of tiny bubbles . another victory beer that stimulates close inspection .
appearance : an almost crystal clear dark yellow/ light gold beer with nice fluffy white head that has some staying power and great lacing .
a : deep blood/brake fluid body with a small fleeting sandy head
appearance : has good lacing and is dark amber in color .
appearance : pours a semi cloudy golden orange with a towering 5 '' yellowish head . it shows great retention . a spongy webbing of lace clings to the glass .
a : black color . about a quarter finger of frothy light tan head . poor retention and no lacing . 5.0
appearance : pours a very deep amber with about two fingers of off-white head . head retention is amazing , as is lacing . a great looking beer .
a : copper color with a nice 2 finger white head . the lacing on this one is fantastic ...
a : cloudy , pale yellow color ( i mean really cloudy as in you ca n't see anything through it . poured a 1 finger fizzy white head . minimal lacing . loads of yeast in the bottom of the glass .
a : it 's pale yellow with some fine sediment suspended throughout . very little retention and no lacing .
a : pours a somewhat cloudy pale pink with a beautiful pinkish-white head that never goes away and leaves one the nicest , stickiest laces i 've ever seen . gorgeous .
appearance : cloudy with lots of sediment and carbonation , good head but short lived although the lacy hung around throughout the sampling .
a : poured from the bottle into a lindemans lambic glass ( not the ideal way of sampling this one ) . experimental cassis pours a dark maroon topped with a thin wisp of salmon .
a : did not look like a typical doppelbock . much lighter in color . in fact , it looked like a red ale more than a doppelbock . some amber tints , not much lacing or head retention .

appearance : brilliant , crystal clear , deep copper with a fluffy , perfectly white , quarter-inch head . of course , it is all poured out of one of the best looking containers on the market , the nearly solid green can . excellent layered lacing . sort of reminded me of an archeological dig - each layer of perfectly preserved lacing represented a sip .

a : the first two glasses i poured out of the bottle were crystal clear golden colors , the last looked more like a witbier as it was slightly hazy from the bottle conditioning yeast . i had to pour slowly due to massive creamy head formation . the head fades in spots and does n't in others , making it look like melted marshmallows are floating in the beer . this is by far the best lacing beer i 've ever had . my empty glass is filled with tons of bubbling foam and lace , it looks like my glass was once filled with whipped cream . amazing .
a : pours dull black with two fingers of pillowy khaki head , leaving behind incredible lacing . good retention .
appearance : dark brown with a very brown head that abundantly fills the pint glass . it 's also long lasting , this beer looks like a champ .
appearance : the beer has a ruby opaqueness to light . the head of the beer is a light tan coloration with good retention .
a : color was a bit darker than i expected for a witbier . excellent white head , but surprisingly very little lace . was n't very cloudy .

appearance : as poured the beer is a cloudy antique gold color with a 1 `` fluffy white head that recedes slowly . there are rings and legs of lacing clinging to the sides of the glass and sipping creates sheets and legs and small patches of lacing , some of which cling to the side and some of which slide back down to the liquid . even mid-way through the beer there is still a 1/8 '' layer of foam covering the liquid .

a : pale straw ... .ok , these are my notes and maybe i should have had this earlier in the session because i wrote `` hazy clear '' . as god is my witness , i have no more idea what that means than you do . no head to speak of .
a : super murky amber haze . very little head , looks sort of like dirty pond water , i am not too appetized , but more intimidated by its looks .
appearance : pint glass . pours copper-orange with a one finger white head that recedes immediately . minimal lacing .
a : reddish black . pours with a plethora of off-white , fluffy head . some retention , but erdinger glass seems to continually generate head . nice lacing . awesome !
appearance : looks great , nice straw-yellow milky pour with a huge off-white head . smell &
a : poured into a tripel kameliet glass . looks delicious . whats amazing is how dark the head is . not tan , but dark like dark chocolate , especially when you swirl the glass a bit .
a : dark black with little lacing .
a : golden with hints of yellow , brown and orange . excellent head retention and lacing . surly beers always look amazing !
a : generous head atop an ostensibly molasses-black body . in decent lighting , the beer is translucent and a drop-dead gorgeous wine-dark red .

a : it poured a thick , black with a massive dark chocolate three finger sticky head . the head receded slowly and left an even cover of medium and small bubbles over the liquid and thick chunky lacing that lined the entire glass .
a : golden hazy goodness with an off-white head and some sticky lacing
appearance : pours a mostly clear mahogany with a finger of fluffy , off white head . there is good head retention and some nice lacing .

appearance : the head is massive , dark brown , sticky and lasting . looks like meringue . glass is black with thick slightly murky brown edges . flavor : all over the map . chocolate malt , burnt roasted grain , baked apple ( no spice ) , pumpkin meat , slightly metallic sharp hop finish . for all of that , its surprisingly mellow and has some crazy form of balance . alcohol is a bit fusel , but felt much more than tasted . a belgian yeast characteristic comes out once you are a bit used to all thats going on in here .
a : poured a hazy straw into an american shaker pint with a white head that did n't hang around and left no lacing .
a : poured a very clear , golden straw yellow color with a very thin head of fizzy foam which left almost no lacing and retained pretty poorly .
appearance : poured a clear , pale brownish yellow color . half finger fizzy white head that disappears immediately . visible carbonation . no lacing .

appearance : poured into a weizen glass from the 12oz bottle . the beer is a hazy pale golden color , not quite as cloudy as some wits i 've seen . head was about 2 and a half fingers thick and pure white with poor retention . par for the style .

appearance : pours with an eighth-finger or so foam with some surface haze . reminds one of cloud cover on a view of the globe . lacing is spotty in formation but consistent . body is the highlight - a ruby red amber that is just striking - some blond accents . beautiful looking beer , really , if mostly for the body .
a : pours a clouded mahogany with a nice half-inch of white head ; average lacing . beautiful .
a : pours an amber orange with a fizzy light white head , no lace . minor floaties , not the most attractive brew .

a : orange amber ... clear , poured no head ... none ! a little very thin foam ring is all . only a touch of carbonation . by midway through the glass it looked just like a dark apple juice in clolour & carbonation ( very average ) .
a : looks absolutely fantastic . dark opaque brown , and very ruby-red tinted when held up to the light . one of the darkest belgian dubbel 's i 've seen myself .
a : standard pour yields a 2 finger frothy white head that dissipates quickly . beer is a cloudy sunshine yellow . lacing is near non-existent with only a few spots here and there .

a : my initial reaction was that this beer looks pretty think for a pale ale . the head cascades pretty well in a pint glass . carbonation is lively but does n't keep the head alive for a long time . i love the unfiltered murky beers , a nice dark golden color with even lighter accents .
a : the pour is a dark , dark brown color -- bordering on black -- with a creamy tan head resting on top .
a : black as night , with no light passing through . the finger or so peppery brown head departed our dimension ( or did it ? ) with in a minute or so . great retention on this baby .
a : pours black with a fizzy medium tan head , average retention , some lace .
a : cloudy , golden orange ; 1-finger head , frothy , little lacing
a : black , tan head , very little retention or lace .
appearance : brownish gold in color , cloudy , minimal head , medium carbonation
appearance : a nice transparent orangey brown , but the head was stubborn to form and did n't stick around very long .
appearance : pours a clear reddish amber color . head is a thin layer of foam , no real lacing to be seen .
a : translucent dark orange colored beer . no carbonation rising from the bottom of the glass . egg shell white head that leaves a decent lacing on the glass .
a : the saison has a hazy yellow-orange color with big head that does not lace well .
a : clear , darker reddish-amber . decent light tan head that leaves moderate lacing .
a : 1 and quarter creamy , fluffy white head with fantastic , thick lacing clinging to the sides of the glass . brew itself was a cloudy goldenrod color .
appearance : comes out as a caramel colored amber . head is tan that fizzled away like i a coke . it even made noises like coke
appearance : pours a midnight brown that fades to tawny at the edges with a very modest head that manages to hang around as a film and leaves just a few spots of lace

a : clear , medium orange . very active carbonation . even with a very gentle pour , creates a nice billowy head that stays with the beer . nice lacing . this is exactly what a tripel should look like .

appearance : pours a pale yellow with lots of quickly building head . 2.5 '' tall , off-white color . the beer is amazingly clear , unlike a lot of the beer i 've been drinking lately . good retention , lots of pillowy craters . the fun continues as a single stream of bubbles steadies itself to the top of the beer .
appearance : very light amber , clear , weak head , poor carbonation .

a : pours a nearly headless floral colored hue of ruby grapefruit pink . a few bubbles popped up with the pour but after a second this beer looks as flat as a cup of cranberry juice . the first pour was crystal clear but the second was a slightly cloudy .
appearance : murky golden with a thick white head that lasts forever . lots of little bubbles streaming from the bottom .
a : goldenrod with a thick , foamy head and a massive stream of champagne-like bubbles . heavy lacing .
a : solid black ; the carbonation is not pronounced , with the head dissipating relatively quickly
a : mohogany red brown with a fluffy tan head that lingered for a few minutes . very pretty in the snifter looking glass .
a : clear golden yellow color , with a tiny white head receding quickly to nothing - looks almost flat .
a : light amber color with white head .

a : when decanted into my duvel tulip , this one foams up like crazy . there 's a 3-finger dense dark brown head that looks like it is n't going anywhere , which is ridiculous for the abv on this puppy . as the head slips away slowly , it leaves some patchy foam on the side of my glass . as for the beer itself ? not quite black . very dark brown with reddish brown highlights
appearance : honey-gold with a righteous plume of angelic white .
a : the beer pours a light brown color with an off-white head .

a : foamy mess of a beer . i started to pour this one and in a split second it was on the floor . 9/10 of the glass was full of foam . insane retention ( not a good thing ) with nice lace . had i not poured it all over the floor i would have been a bit more forgiving .
appearance : it has a swiftly vanishing head . the beer is unfiltered and orange in color .

appearance : pours a very nice crystal clear golden beer with large carbonation bubbles that give way to a very patchy large bubbled foam head that lasts for quite sometime , then goes near still with some lace .

a : it poured a hazy brownish-orange body with a barely there quarter finger off-white head . the head receded to an inconsistent bit of cover that was fed by a moderate stream of bubbles . there was a veritable not there amount of lacing .

appearance : the beer pours a very clear yellow color with a small cap of small bubbles after a pretty quick pour , and then the head faded into a small ring pretty quickly ... within about 20 seconds . there is a small amount of lace left on the glass after drinking .
a : unfortunately completely headless but the color is a nice rust/brown
a : basically looks like a macro lager , perhaps a slight hint of haze . very little head . where 's the wheat ?

appearance : let 's face it ... few beers look better than a 'draft ' pint of guinness . the creamy tan head , the deep black body , and sharp line between them ... the classic , and perfect , look . a sight to behold ...
appearance : gorgeous frosted lemon body with a luciously frothy 2 finger white crown . tons of retention and lacing . seriously sexy !
a : very deep red amber color , decent head but doesnt retain well . lighter than expected .
appearance : nice golden yellow , slightly cloudy with a good off white head . great first impression
a : pours a very deep amber/copper with about two fingers of light tan head . lots of lacing and good head retention .
a : light yellow ... thanks to the addition of artificial colorants . booh ! ! !
appearance : pours a thick , black color with no head and only a little lacing . low/medium viscosity .
a : straw yellow with a tiny bit of fizzy head . i 've seen it so many times that this is my basis for comparison .
a : has a very clear yellow color with lots of carbonation and quick thinning head .
a : gentle pour ( in case there was sediment - there was n't ) yields 2/3 finger creamy cream colored head with great retention . crystal clear deep orangey-crimson liquid .
a : standard pour yields a single layer of coarse white bubbles atop a cloudy grapefruit beer that dissipates quickly . lacing is spotty and with moderate cling .
appearance : it pours `` oo-long tea '' to strawed colour ; somehow not very clear and has almost no bubbles and no beer head at all !
appearance : pours cola black with a sizable ruby head . however , the head retention stinks . very disappointing .
a : bright , hazy gold with a relatively large white head with turbulent pour ; minimal lacing in spots down the side of the glass .
a : a dark singel but that 's cool . not much of a head with below avg retention but that 's cool too
a : pitch black . an unpromising looking beer considering the complete lack of head .
a : pours an unfiltered pale yellow/gold with bubbles rising . not much of a head with even a heavy pour straight down the middle . no lacing .

a : beer pours a beautiful color that produces deep ruby hues through a hazy mahogany body . thick and fluffy 2-finger head sits majestically atop the pretty liquid . this head produces really nice looking thick rings of lace .
a : nice amber color , initial two finger head with nice lacing .
a : pours a brown with crimson highlights . massive tan head with pretty solid retention that takes about 15 minutes to settle to a thick disk , leaving patchy foam on the glass
a : burnt orange color . cloudy , not translucent . aggressive pour gives a near non existent head , that quickly dissipates to a ring . head is off white . presence of lacing
a : golden colored with a thick , 2 finger head . extremely heavy lacing .
appearance : the color of the beer is black and opaque . the deep mocha colored head is thick , rich , lustrous , and long-lasting .
a : cloudy amber with a 1/8 '' tan head which dissipated quickly .
appearance : pours an awful looking cloudy dark orange brown color with a short 1/8 '' head that falls to a surface bubble or two immediately . no lacing . just does n't look good to me .
a : black as engine oil , little or no head .
a : this beer is n't amber , it 's downright red , fading to orange in bright light . the color is bright and beer is clear , with a nice , foamy light tan head .
a : oqaque black with a two-finger caramel sticky head that stays with a solid lacing .
a : medium copper color with a small white head that quickly fades .
a : extremely fizzy , bubbles stick to the glass . red , cloudy , not much head , no retention or lacing .

a : when i poured this beer into a stella artois goblet , i was sorely disappointed . no head ? obviously no lacing . there was hardly a swirl of it , and that wisp immediately disappeared . decent golden-amber hue .
appearance : pours a dark brown with ruby red highlights . the head rises 3 '' and is khaki in color . retention is great and there is some decent lace .

a : black body with reddish-brown tinges around the edges of the glass , underneath a small , frothy , light-brown head that dissipates quickly . surprisingly decent lacing . decidedly average-looking , as i 've come to expect from bar .
a : hazy and light yellow . this is a beer that looks like lemonade . kinda off-putting . pours to a half-finger head that dissipates over the next few minutes .
a : pours like black , well-used motor oil ; dark tan head , no retention or lace .
a : pours with a 2 finger head that is bright white and does not last long at all . the body is cloudy if not semi-murky and is light yellow in color and ridiculously pale .

a : boddingtons looks great . crack open the attractive yellow can and hold it over a pint glass so you do n't miss any of the cream head that begins to form . the bottom is a pale yellow , but it 's fun to keep your eyes on the pillowy head that forms at the top .
a : pours deep black color with a good 2 fingers head . big retention .
appearance : poured with 1 cm bubbly light tan head that dissipated over a few minutes to a thin layer leaving no lacing . the beer is amber-brown and slightly hazy
a : pours black with two fingers of khaki head that recedes into a creamy cap with good lacing .

a : pours out an awesome pure harvest gold with an enormous 1.5 '' head of solid white merengue . head winds down very , very slowly , never quite lifitng , and the champagne-like bubbles just keep on gurgling . very nice . n : spicy fumes , slight biscuit and saltine , herbal bread dough , alcohol , down . somewhat incomplete , sort of halfway between a weak saison and a passable champagne or sparkling wine . p : an odd one . initial euro-hoppy and light malt tones blend hand in hand with a off-sourness and bread dough/biscuit neutrality that does n't quite gel . this leads to an end palate of green fruits , a touch more sourness ( but in a juicy , almost fruit like way-not at all like a gueze or a lambic ) , water crackers , overcooked green vegetables ( particularly green beans and broccoli ) , and light floral tones . some seaweed , green algae even . the whole brew tastes rather `` green '' and `` underripe '' , as if it were trying to capture the flavors of fruits eaten before , or vegetables consumed after , peak . the grain quality starts to show a bit more as the beer warms .
a : pours a cloudy orangish color , 2 finger width frothy white head , good lacing down the glass
a : i never really know how to rate appearance , drank right from the bottle so yeah ...
appearance : beautiful gold with wonderful tan foam . at least 2 inches of foam with this . an exceptional look by any standards .
a : sweet malts , very pronounced sour cherries , candied sugar , alcohol , and yeast .

a : pours a deep dark black with a moderate-but frothy off-white head that dissipated quickly but clung to the glass well . the head on this beer had that look of `` pancake batter '' that i like so much . 4.5 .
appearance : pours a pale , translucent golden color . the thin fizzy head dissipates almost immediately leaving no discernable lacing .

a : light amber , fairly clear . very little carbonation . this bottle had a ton of sediment in suspension -- not sure what that means , but if i did n't already know what it was i might 've thought it was dirt or something .
a : the beer is a light straw yellow color , with a thin white head that fades very quickly and leaves very little lace on the glass .
a : motor oil pour . quite a bit of head for the style . mocha-tan in color . tons of lacing .
appearance : pours a pale yellow beer with a thin white foam lace that dies quickly .

appearance : harsh pour results in an abundant head over 2 inches high despite the large surface area . deep ruby red that is dark enough to make the beer translucent . light brown head does n't feel like going anywhere . tiny bubbles and large bubbles reside within the miniscus .
a : pours a dark ruby red/brown color . a towering beige head forms , and finally settles . the pillowing foam has excellent retention . sticky lace is left down the glass .
a : dark reddish brown . one finger head which disapears into nothing . no lacing is present . carbonation is above average .
appearance : bottle is pretty cheesy looking..nothing too appealing . relatively clear-orange color with nearly no head to speak of .
appearance : this beer is a dark and murky brown bodied beer with absolutely no trace of a head or carbonation . the beer almost looks like dirty muddy mop-bucket water .

a : bears the sultry warmth that non-filtering/bottle-conditioning bestows . auburn with a suspended cloudy of silty and plenty of rising carbonation . a flocculent head of ivory nearly tops the glass , cresting at about 3-fingers . excellent lace hangs in frothy curtains .
appearance : arrives at the bar with a cloudy golden color and a nice head that leaves gobs of lacing

appearance : produced a finger of head that did not stick around , in either the lacing or head departments despite good carbonation in the body . the beer has a bit of a cloudy look to it , and is quite a bit darker then the standard lager gold .

a : pours a murky maroon body with ruby-orange edges when held up to the light . its light beige foam retains well and leaves generous sudsing down hte sides of the tulip , maintaining a light film on the beer when all is said and done . great appearance .

appearance : nothing too special about the appearance on this one , a warm amber hugh with carbonation bubbles persistent . the only thing off about it is it pours with nearly no head at all , maybe something other than a standard pint glass would fix this .
a : straw yellow clear . nice head and lacing .

appearance : a brilliantly hazy , golden-orange body capped by two fingers of off-white head that quickly fade into minimal lacing . it 's worth noting that the last pour is far hazier than the first pour .
a : a nice amber color with an off-white head . the beer is unfiltered so there are tiny white globs suspended in the beer .
a : a huge , frothy , mocha colored cap that leaves behind huge clumps of lace sits atop a black body .
a : pours a dark black body with a tan head with low retention and some lacing along the sides of the glass .
a : beer poured a golden color with an orange hue , little head .
appearance : pours into a sam adams glass a deep brown to black . a one-finger tan head forms on top and drops to a large collar with an almost full bubbly surface coating .
a : pale cloudy straw . pours into a giant white 3 finger foamy head . settles forming little craters , foamy spiderweb lacing clings to the sides of the glass as it does .
a : amber clored , clear yet kind of opaque . thin head , that disappears quickly .
a : pours a ruddy sepia with small white head , solid retention .

a : a vigorous pour delivers a clear mahogany body with some fine particulates in suspension underneath a billowing head of frothy tan foam that fills the tulip to the perfect stage of near-overflowing . retention is off the charts , and as the head recedes it leaves the thickest covering of lace that i 've ever seen . phenomenal looking beer .

a : poured a hazy golden/straw color with a large , white foamy head ballooning on top ( about 2.5 fingers thick ) . really , this beer looks every bit the part of a sexy german brew . just a bit of lacing clinging to the side of the glass as this beer quickly disappears .

a : dark pink color with reddish hues , quite cloudy . the head is about 2 cm and has a light pink color . it settles fast and leaves small lacings . of course , this looks kind of weird judged as a witbier , but it 's actually quite good looking and since it 's brewed with fruit juice , i assume that the pink color is ok.
a : opaque black liquid ( no light will penetrate it- i tried to with a coleman max led flashlight ! )

a : clear amber-orange with a thin vivid white head that stayed exactly the same for the duration . beautiful sticky lacing all over the inside of the glass . i was really impressed with the overall appearance of this beer .

a : pours a clear mahogany in the glass with ruby highlights when held against a lamp . the pour produces a light tan-colored head of two fingers ' worth , but it slowly recedes into half a finger on the brew , and leaves some flecks of lacing down the glass . really impressive for a 10 % er .
appearance : pours a slightly hazy , deep amber body topped only by a thin ring of white bubbles .
a : clear golden yellow with a very white one finger head that quickly disappeared to nothing . it does not look like a quality brew .

a : moderate pour yields a 1 finger semi-coarse , light chocolate head that fades gradually . beer is a dark , almost opaque amber . lacing is actually pretty epic ... frothy , full , and nearly completely covering the glass .

appearance : 25oz bottle poured into tall weizen glass . pours a very nice golden wheat colour , darkens as everything begins to settle . inch-thick puffy head , fades with nice lacing . visible carbonation , moderate amount .
a : pours a half finger head of decent cream , okay thickness , and and bad retention . colour is a cloudy yellow . sm : light lemon ester hops and clean barley . a mild strength aroma .
a : perfectly translucent amber color . head has nice volume with light beige color . head looks creamy but the retention is surprisingly good . lacing is pretty good too . very nice looking beer .
a : beautiful . orange with pale edges . bubbly .
appearance : deep brown with a large head with good retention .
